reviews.review: Informative & Comprehensive. I am 22 and I went on both the Pest & Buda tours (10am/2pm respectively) and I had Andrea as my tour guide, she made my trip to Budapest worth it! By having each side of Budapest on a separate tour I learned much more than the average free tours offer. I had all of my questions answered and I learned fun facts outside of the typical details usually offered.

See Budapest with a local guide who knows the history and culture of this jewel of the Danube!. Our travel agent booked a private 4 hour tour with Adam for us and another couple. He met us at our hotel in the Castle District. Adam shared his amazing knowledge of his city and country through walking and riding the trams. He even booked a private wine tasting with a friend in the caverns underlying the city. So much fun!Adam grew up in this city rich in history as did his parents. So he was able to share very personal stories that we would have not known but for him.We arrived a few days early for our Viking river cruise up the Danube. Make sure you do that as it was well worth our time to spend the time with Adam!Judy and Dean Fraser

Excellent private tour guide company. Tourist Angel organized a professional private tour for us in October 2016 in Budapest. The tour guide, Andrea, was courteous and very knowledgeable. The tour was truly tailored to our wishes and had enough flexibility in it for on-the-spot changes as well. Over the course of two days we got a nice overall impression of Budapest with truly local, insider information. The tailored guided tour also took us off the beaten path to see not just the main touristic sights but the "real" Budapest as well, just like we wanted. Andreas dedication to her job and especially her personal touch were much appreciated.

The Best. Adam Botta was an excellent tour guide for us. He was well prepared, spoke excellent English ant was extremely well informed on Budapest history. He was able to easily interpret our interest level and packed a wallop of information in a half day tour. One of the best parts of the tour....he asked if we would join him for lunch at a local "cafeteria" on the Pest side. What a thrill to be able to eat genuine Budapest food and eat with the locals.Ann & Bob

Fascinating Tour. Adam Botta was a truly outstanding English speaking guide for us in Budapest. I was especially excited that he told me more about my famous family name, Szilagyi and he directed us to a church and square of that name. He even recited a poem about Erzsebet Szilagyi, the mother of King Matthias in whose church I got to sing with my choir. I am a full-time wheelchair user, so traveling can be difficult, but Adam knew exactly where to take us for the best views – and even knew the best wheelchair friendly rest room location (very important!) I highly recommend him as a tour guide whether you have a disability or not. Susan Szilagyi Borsky October 2016

Weel prepared and interesting tour. We had a private tour. Our guide was on time and was well prepared - she had even made research on Danish history and society to make comparative remarks during the tour. We were all very impressed and felt an urge to further explore 1956 when we got home.

Friendly and accommodating!. We used this tour group on our trip and they were very easy to coordinate with. Our guide was at our hotel as scheduled and took us around the best spots in the city. He was knowledgeable and helped us plan the rest of our trip.

Nina, A Wonderful Guide in Russian. Used Tourist Angel for a private tour of Budapest in the Russian language. Our tour guide Nina was exceptional, filled with facts and information about Budapest. She was a consummate professional, accommodated our needs without question, and created a wonderful walking itinerary that showed us the best highlights of Budapest. The Company Tourist Angel was a pleasure to deal with, always responded to our emails in a prompt fashion, and made us feel we were being taken care of. Will use Tourist Angel and Nina without hesitation when we next return to Budapest.

Andrea Kevei. Andrea is an excellent tour guide. She was extremely knowledgeable about Budapest and shared a wealth of information. She is patient and can handle a group or an individual with ease. Andrea goes above and beyond to ensure you enjoyed your tour.

Excellent guide in Russian. We are a mature couple from Russia, and we had an excellent three-and-a-half hour walking tour in Budapest in Russian language. Our guide Irina was informative, knowledgeable and had a lot of interesting insights about the city. We had the tour on our day two in the city, and it was very useful to get to know it better - and use the knowledge to navigate around and choose attractions during the following days. Thank you Irina and Adam for organizing this event, definitely recommended to anyone interested.

Super Tour. Andrea was very helpful and always attentive to our requests, gave us also tips to save money, helped us to get the week bus ticket and also she is full of important information.
We really recommend Andrea as she is a true guide!!

Tourist Angel - Andrea Kevei. Imagine you are going for the first time and alone to Budapest and you find that one of your very good friends was born there and is willing to go with you and show you the sights, sounds and something of the culture of the place, then that is pretty much the the experience that you will get with Andrea Kevei. Her English is very good, her background knowledge is excellent, she asks what sort of things you think you would like to see/do, and sets up a programme to discuss and agree with you. However, she remains very flexible about arrangements throughout the time she is with you.

Excellent Wlaking Tour Guide. met at hotel Janka. Excellent relaxed and informative guide, gave a great incite into this lovely city. Showed us all the areas we asked for and set us up with enough information for our remaining days to explore on our own ExcellentAndy,Dave,Helen, Elaine
Excellent guide to Budapest. My wife and I really enjoyed the commentary of Noémi who was knowledgeable and communicated very well.

Andrea Kevei's knowledge and charm brought Budapest Alive!!. Our 2 hour walking tour of Budapest was made complete with the historical - political - cultural knowledge of our guide Andrea. Her charm and enthusiasm for this beguiling city on the Danube was conveyed to all on her walking tour. Every street..every corner...every building ...every monument's story of yester year was shared with us by Andrea in a informative and enchanting manner. We highly recommend the tours of this young and passionate tour guide.Oi Oi OiAnne & Paul Rogers

Excellent walking tour highlighting the best of Budapest. The walking tour is an excellent option for groups who would like to experience the main sites of Budapest, ending in the Castle District with breathtaking views of the river and city below. Our guide, Andrea, was extremely knowledgeable and friendly, and engaged with our group of high school students. In addition, she was conscious of our time restrictions and shared information that our students were able to understand and appreciate.

A great 3 day tour. Our tour guide Andrea was excellent: she got to know us and then anticipate our questions and requirements, was knowledgeable and had planned a tour based upon our brief, sap professional at all times, went out of her way to assist me in some additional information I required and was very aware of our safety. It took a few hours for Andrea to understand our diverse group, after that she was warm & engaging - a great 3 day tour of Budapest & Eger.

Andrea is great. Andrea was charming, smart, energetic, warm and knowledgeable. She took us on a great tour of Budapest, combining history and current affairs. While her English is very good, she has a very soft voice, so you have to listen hard. For oldish people like our group it might be nice if she used a low-frequency radio with headsets so everyone can get the full benefit of her excellent tours.

Adam Botta Makes Budapest Come Alive!. Not knowing what to expect with regard to Budapest and Hungary, we were fortunate enough to have Adam Botta as our tour guide. As a native of Budapest, Adam did more than show us the sights and recite the history of Budapest. Using his family history and his own personal experiences growing up in Budapest, we were afforded a look at the last century's history in this historic city through the eyes of a family that was very much involved. Over two days we were immersed in a culture both similar and different than our own and developed a deep appreciation for the Hungarian culture and people. We consider Adam's tour one of the best experiences we have had in our travels abroad.

Andrea - one of our best walking tours :D. We were a big group of students and Andrea showed us the city in around 3 hours and it was a really top class walking tour. She also explained to us not only part of the history of Hungary but also some really funny/interesting facts about the Hungarian traditions and she kept our interest in the highest level all the time during the tour.Thanks again Andrea for this amazing tour!!
Amazing trip. Adam is a great guide - perfect English . He has acsess to all the special attractions ! We highly recommend him to all visitors to Budapest

“Adam & Eva - A Top Class Team for your Walking Tours :-). Included as part of my 3 day Budapest Card was a walking tour of both Pest & Buda. Adam led the Pest tour which was simply brilliant. He is so knowledgeable of his country's history and provides an excellent overview of its communist past. I thoroughly enjoyed the walk about in this stunning city but to arrive on their national holiday was a 10* bonus. It couldn't have been better and the city relished in hosting over a million visitors:-) Thank you Adam for your invaluable insight on a terrific day for your country!!!!Eva hosted the Buda part of the walking tour & she delivered it with pride & passion. The views from Fisherman's Bastion & St Matthias Church were incredible. Eva even showed us where she attended school :-) Both guides were so friendly and professional and I would absolutely recommend them to anyone travelling to Budapest or indeed availing of the Budapest Card.

Briliant. We booked a one day walking tour with Adam earlier this year (in March) and it was excellent. Adam is a very knowledgeable person and a great person also (very entertaining). He made the whole day very easy for us and enjoyable. We covered a lot of ground and saw a lot of the City in just one day. Highly recommended. Visited March 2013

A great day. Adam took us around Budapest to see the main sights but also some fun local places that made the day very enjoyable. He is thoughtful, funny, and very knowledgable and loves chimney cakes so try one. If you have only 1-2 days in Budapest this is your guide. We actually visited Budapest in June 2013.

A+!. We recently used Adam Botta in Budapest from Tourist Angel to tour Buda. He is fantastic. His knowledge of history and politics plus his sense of humor made this one of the best tours we’ve ever done. Don’t miss using this guide!!

The statue park. Adam was guiding a group of tourists to the Statue Park outside of Budapest. His group and I were on the same chartered tourist bus. I eavesdropped on what he was saying on the bus and decided that he added so much value it was worth paying to join his group. I truly was able to try before buying and I was not disappointed. The experience of being guided by someone who lived through the Soviet occupation was priceless.

Thorough and Thoughtful, Excellent Tour Guide. We worked with Adam in early June. Because of his wide range of knowledge, he went to great lengths to understand exactly what we were interested in seeing and doing. And given we'd spent the day before with a different guide, that removed the obvious tour sites. Originally we were seeking a comprehensive tour with focus on Austro-Hungarian history and Art Nouveau. He delivered! We saw interesting and off the path sites. Adam delightfully shared a couple of stories of how his family experienced the transition from Communism to Capitalism, to life today in Budapest. Very, very interesting. We enjoyed his cordial unassuming manner. Highly recommended.

“A Wonderful Guide in Budapest”. Adam is a wonderful guide and a very nice man. We got stuck in traffic and then got lost and ended up in Budapest 3 hours later than planned and Adam waited for us. He then took us on a tour of Budapest so that we were able to see the highlights of the city in the one day. We took public transportation to all of the various areas and Adam made sure that we made the most of a day that started off poorly. I would highly recommend booking Adam for a private tour of Budapest. He is the best!

Great Day in Budapest. Adam was wonderful. He has such passion for his country and we both learned so much on our walking tour of the Pest side. We walked all thru town even though the weather was not good he made the day very enjoyable including a very nice lunch at the end of the day. We will use Adam again when we return to Budapest.Visited September 2013

Brilliant walking tours of Buda and Pest the time flew by and we learnt so much!. They say time flies when you are having fun and this was most certainly true of our walking tours in Buda and Pest with tour guide Viki. We were a large geography group of 36 students and when we heard the pest tour was 2 and half hours of walking it seemed a bit daunting for our first activity of the trip. But Viki was incredibly enthusiastic and told us so many great things that it did not seem long at all before we were back at the Deak Ferenc Ter! She was clearly knowledgable and friendly as well as very eager to answer questions, her manner and skill made us excited for the tour Buda which we went on the next day and it was once again Viki who guided us around. This tour was a little shorter but included the great opportunity to see the changing of the guard at the Palace! Viki once again did an excellent job and her amusing yet informative tone in perfect English was wonderful! The whole group gave positive feedback about the tours, so this is vouching for 36 happy students from England! We would highly recommend! The fact it was free with the Budapest Cards was fantastic also, the cards are worth their money, especially when you get two fantastic tours for free included!

Happy walks. The walking tour in the inner city of Pest on a very cold December day was a good experience. Guide Viki was a very kind young lady who had done her best to entertain the group. She has a great knowledge about the city and the history.

Excellent tour with Viki in Budapest. The tour that Viki gave in Pest was extremely interesting. She talked about many different aspects of the city; history, culture, gastronomy, economics, architecture and much more. She speaks a very clear English, answers all questions, has a lot of knowledge. I learned a lot during those two and a half hours. She also gave recommendations about places to go and how to get to them. I highly recommend.

Great tours, both Pest and Buda. Those tours are probably biggest benefit of Budapest Card. The guide, Vicky, did an amazing job walking whole group around the city. She was very enthusiastic about the city, seemed like she loved what she's doing. I highy recommend joining tours - you gonna see most of the city's highlight, get to know basics of its history. All in a nice, friendly atmosphere, without getting bored with to many dates, but with many actually interesting facts and stories.

Walking tour with history. Today was really a great day beginning with the morning walking tour with Vicki as our guide. She was so glad for us to be there and her live for the city and it's history showed. As we walked thru Pest- Vicki told us about the history -conflicts - changing governments -the how's , why's and when all these things came to be. I would HIGHLY recommend that you do the walking tour thru cityrama tours. When you purchase the BUDAPEST CARD- it is a free tour.The BUDAPEST CARD by the way is the best value on the planet! Enjoy your trip!!!!Ps. Get the card at the airport- free transportation from the airport to the metro -easy easy easy !

Guided visits in Buda. We were guided by Viki in Buda. She did a very well job. She is a very enthusiastic person and knows how to entertain the tourists. It was a very interesting tour. She gave a lot of tips and she was well prepared. She was one of the most pleasant Hungarians whom we met during our stay in Budapest.

Guided visits in Buda and Pest. Vicky was a very competent guide, full of enthusiasm to share what she knows about her city with others. She was both informative and humourous adding titbits of all kinds of information which you wouldn't otherwise know about - a friendly professiona!

Great Pest Tour, of Budapest, with Viki. As this was our first walking tour of this trip in Europe, it was great to have someone like Viki to show us around. She was knowledgeable and enthusiastic and genuinely excited to talk about her city and about Hungary in general. Based on this experience we decided to do the Free walking tours in all the cities we visited and we are very happy that we did.

Budapest walking tour. We were guided by Viki, our tourist angel. She is not only a very enthusiastic person, but also very knowledgable and well prepared. Talk about someone with a passion for the city¡ Our tour went through the city's main attractions, and the ones not everyone notices so easily. Bravo for a great guide.

A nice and sprankling tour in Boeda. With the interressant explication of a young enthousiast hungarian women during the nice tour in boeda, we know much better the history of hungarian and the city Boeda-Pest.Congratulations Viki

Pest Morning Tour with Victoria. Very complete and interesting walking tour with Viki. We did many tours in Central Europe cities over the last three weeks, and Viki's combination of good English and engaging story telling was one of the best. Even when her electronic amplifier wasn't working she spoke loudly and clearly -- thanks Viki!
Walking tour of Pest . Had an amazing tour this morning made by viki. She is a wonderful guide amusing so interesting and knew everything we wanted to know. Such a lovely person too thank you viki.
Budapest walking tour. Excellent...Gabriella did a fine job, very pleasant to be with and very knowledgable. Her English was just fine and she seemed very comfortable...

Just a great tour!. Yesterday we took an afternoon tour with Julia. She is a very pleasant and intelligent girl with plenty of thrilling stories to tell.We spent a great time and learnt a lot of interesting stories about the history of Budapest. Highly recommend for everyone! You will fall in love with Budapest from the first sight!

Angel of Budapest!. I joined two walking tours during my short stay in Budapest at the beginning of this month, both of which happened to be guided by the lovely Kate. Kate was very friendly and well-informed, and gave just the right amount of information without overloading, and I particularly liked the way in which the members of the party were involved, particularly when it came to translating the dates on the various monuments from Roman into Arabic numerals! The Monday morning tour of Pest would have been even better had not parts of the city been cordoned off for the visit of a certain Chancellor Merkel! Both walks were very enjoyable, and a great way of discovering the capital if you're short on time: some friends of mine are due to visit at the beginning of April, and I have already recommended that they take these tours. Még egyszer köszönöm, Kate!!

Great tour. Highly recommended! I had a tour with Julia this afternoon. She is so knowledgable, humorous and sharing. I'm planning to join the morning tour tomorrow. This is a great way to kick off the trip in Budapest!

Wonderful tour in Buda. Just today we took this tour. Kate is perfect guid! She has deep knowledge, excellent and clear English and she just lovely kindly girl that very pleasant to communicate with. I recommend this tour to everybody who planning to be in Budapest.
Great citytrip. Lovely girl who knows a lot about the history and politics of budapest. Shows you the most amazing spots and is prepared to point some points on your map
Excellent tour. It was very interesting tour. Tour guide Kate was very attentive and told us a lot of thrilling stories from Hungarian history. Highly recommended!

Great service: Kate was the perfect tourist guide. During our stay in Budapest we subscribed for the 48H 'Budapest Card' which included guided tours of the vity.While visiting Pest we had a fun and pleasant (and free!) walking tour thanks to Kate. She delivered an accurate portrait of the city's highlights and history.Great job :)Nicole

The best walking tour!. If you want to see the best of Budapest, learn the history and legends of Hungary and its capital, and simply spend some quality time with a positive person, you should definitely attend Buda and Pest walking tours with Kate! Kate (thanks to Budapest card) made our trip to Budapest unforgettable and interesting!

Just GREAT!. The kind of guider that makes u fall in love with the place. I took the afternoon tour to Buda and learned SO MUCH. With humor, sweetness, intelligence and more, she helps u connect with the inner side of the place. Bravo!

Budapest card morning tour . Warm and personable despite the freezing temperature. Helpful and considerate. Recommended a fantastic restaurant for lunch that served one of the best beef goulash we ever tasted. Thanks, Kate!!!
Pest walking tour . Kate was excellent! In just two hours learned a lot about the history of Pest and saw the most significant sites.

Worth every penny with Adam Marot. The thought of visiting Hungary can be pretty intimidating for a US citizen. With a guide you look for someone that can speak English and help us understand the Hungarian history while working with our generally limited working knowledge of the country. Adam went above and beyond what one would expect from a guide. He was knowledgeable about everything, spoke perfect English, and brought a hilarious sense of humor. I highly recommend him and ask anyone to email me with any questions hwinnie80@gmail.com

Amazing Budapest Tour. I took the half day tour with Adam. What a fun time we had. Besides being very entertaining, he is very knowledgeable and passionate about Budapest!! I saw the important sites and the help he gave me with getting around the city and using public transportation was very helpful. I would take this tour again and recommend it everyone.Thanks. Adam, you're the best!!

Erika was excellent!. My wife and I went on the 4 hour walking tour of Budapest with Erika. Saw some great sites and learned alot about the history here. Erika is not only knowledgable but has a keen interest in the Opera and movies as well. Very well rounded young lady who made the tour very enjoyable!

Personable, funny, and extremely informative guides. Adam and Zsofi were our two guides to Budapest. On day 1, Zsofi took us on the tour of outer Budapest on a half-day walking tour. It was a very informative tour, we really saw the sights very well. Not only did we get a great history and culture lesson, but she was a good resource in answering our questions about the city and country and offering suggestions for activities. Very warm and friendly person.On day 2, Adam took us on a tour of the inner part of the city and the colorful Jewish Quarter. Adam has great warmth, a great self-deprecating sense of humor, and a wry wit. The history, particularly from WWII and the Communist period, was fascinating. In addition, his personal and familial connections to many events added unique perspectives to history. He had great suggestions for night life, further touring, etc. Truly an exceptional guide and someone we could be friends with. (No one "suggested" a gratuity but we were happy to give one to each guide for good work!)I highly recommend their services!

Outstanding Budapest tour!. We had an absolutely amazing private tour of the City with Anita a couple of weeks ago. We were on a Viking River Cruise, and 4 of us decided on a private tour vs. the optional one provided by Viking. It was a brilliant decision! It actually cost the same as the group tour for each of us with 4, and if you had more, it would even be cheaper. We saw much more, including more stops at behind the scenes places, and even stopped for a beer at a wonderful ruin bar. Anita was truly outstanding, and I highly recommend her and Behind Budapest Tours

Awesome Tour Guide!. I went on a 4 hour walking tour of Budapest on Saturday, April 30th with my husband, son (14 yrs old), & daughter (21 years old). If you want to learn EVERYTHING (and I mean everything!), there is to know about Budapest by a soft spoken, easy going young man, then Adam is definitely the person to contact (or his company-(behindbudapest@gmail). It was refreshing to see a young person who was so proud of his city and so eager to share his extensive knowledge about the place where he was born and lived his whole life. Adam was like a walking encyclopedia (it seemed like there was virtually nothing he didn't know), and he imparted this knowledge in a friendly, funny & interactive way. He also kept the attention of my children, which sometimes can be hard to do :) Also, Adam shared much personal history with us which made the tour that much more interesting. Even after the 4 hours was over, Adam highlighted for us what to do, where to go, as well as gave us recommendations for places to eat. Our tour with Adam was definitely the highlight of our visit to Budapest!Randi

Super interesting and insightful!. Adam had lots of hidden knowledge that was way more interesting than anything you would find anywhere else. Good mixture of hard facts, urban legends and the story's between.
Amazing tour ever!!. This is one of the best tour I participate. Adam is so friendly. Always he has a smile and he say a good jokes and interesting things. Everybody feel his love to Budapest.
Zsofia, you are awesome 👍😎🇹🇯. She can speak interesting and very understandable. She can tell us some funny things, really interesting trip in Budapest.

Can't imagine how we'd be without Adam. Adam & his tour guides are either trained or naturally awesome people. Clean vans, calm driving and extraordinary quality service. The trip was just so good - we can't wait for our next opportunity. Also special thanks to one his drivers "Daniel Szollosi" who went out of his way to make our trip A one to remember.Thanks a lot !!!

Adam was the best!. This review is overdue but I wanted to write to say how wonderful Adam was as our guide in Budapest this past October. Even though the weather was rainy it turned out to be great. I had a list of every place we wanted to visit and he gladly took us everywhere so we wouldn't miss a thing. Adam is also full of knowledge and we learned more about Budapest than we had ever hoped for. My favorite place he took us was to the Central Market that had delicious goulash. We also stopped at a little bakery and Adam treated us to a delicious Hungarian pastry! Our visit to Budapest was highlighted by this tour with Adam and we will definitely contact him again next time!

Tour with Adam. The tour was with other Erasmus students and it was amazing! Adam knows a lot about Budapest and Hungary and speaks about it with a lot of passion and makes even the boring facts sound nice. I really enjoyed, even though it was raining when our tour took place.

My Custom Tour to Hegyfalu & Sopron with Adam. I was seeking my roots:my grandfather's birthplace (Hegyfalu) & arranged a unique tour including a visit to Sopron (Site of Pan European "picnic") & Hungarian "Versailles" palace. I found family I didn't know about! Adam was a fabulous guide! I learned so much from Adam who presents his country with great pride & enthusiasm in superb English. I highly recommend him - he even researched my family for me (I had my grandfather's passport from 1907). This was the tour of a lifetime!
Our tour with Adam. Our tour was wonderful. Excellent communication skills, a passion for the Budapest, on time, very knowledgeable and very helpful.

Great evening tour. We had Adam as our tour guide on Saturday 15th Aug and he gave us a wonderful evening tour of beautiful Budapest. The tour covered both sides of the river and the Castle area, and included use of public transport which is always good to get the low down on how best to use it. Adam spoke perfect English and his enthusiasm for his home city came through as he described the many interesting landmarks. We were also taken to places not frequently visited and one of many ruin bars. Overall we had a great tour and would heartily recommend.

Like it says; Behind Budapest. Im not that fond of traditional sight seeing tours since they usually only scratch the surface and only tell what you usually already know from any information or guide. Having lived in Budapest for almost 4 years now I found the tour with Adam absolutely fabulous!Why..?Adams tour was very open and easy...casual you might call it. But at the same time it was very professional and he told us things I had never heard of. Not only facts and dates regarding historical monuments and streets but also stories and tales involving how people lived during that time and what actually happened in society. Very interesting and fun tour. Looking forward for the next one!

Women in Budapest. Our 30th birthday privat tour was just amaizing! We felt like being in the series "Sex and the city". Adam was elegant, amuzing and we could have a new aspect of Budapest and pick up a lot of new information about our loved capital.
local right now. My friends and I really enjoyed the tour of Adam. He is a real local and can tell you juicy stories. Afterwards you are a local as well! ;)

Great guide. Adam is a excellent guide that loves to share all of his knowledge about Budapest And Hungary. It always feels short in time and distance even though it is quite the opposite. But that is how it is supposed to be when you discover and learn new places with guides that are skilled in their profession. :)

Best sightseeing tour ever. Everyone knows the boring sightseeing tours where you always walk from one station to the next. But THIS sightseeing tour of Behind Budapest was really amazing! Nice insider stories, local recommendations and a lot more! A really nice guy, called Adam would be the perfect guy to choose for a tour! So go on and wish you the best!

Absolutely special!. I totally recommend the tours organized by Behind Budapest team, especially delivered by Adam Marot! Absolutely creative approach, right amount of data and fun facts intermingled with urban legends that make these tours absolutely unique and catchy. What I loved the most was that by the end of the tour I was not left overloaded with dates and names not remembering any of those, but had a lot of interesting historical facts and info about Budapest that years later I still use to surprise my friends and family with when I guide them around!

A fantastic way to see Budapest! Highly recommended!. We booked Adam (Marot) for two private tours of Budapest and we were really impressed with the service he provided. On the first - a morning from 9.30am until 2.00pm - he came to our hotel with an air conditioned minivan and we covered all the highlights - and in the process we learned so much about Budapest's history and culture. On the second morning (9.30 until well past 2.00pm) we were treated to a walking tour of the Jewish quarter and then finished up at the Houses of Parliament. Again - Adam was a wealth of fascinating information - all delivered with a wonderful sense of humor. We then spent several days on our won but Adam was always available to offer suggestions for eating places. All in all a wonderful service - professionally executed and a real ambassador for his home City. Many thanks Adam - we really enjoyed the experience and we will be back - your City is a fabulous place to visit!
I really recommend. It was amazing. The guide, Adam, is very competent and friendly. Budapest has a beautiful history, just one day is not enough to visit the city.

Corporate group - short tour in Budapest. We had a last minute corporate group in Budapest, so we needed a good guide for our short tour in the evening. They were very helpful and everyone had an amazing experience. Thank you!
Excellent. Very nice and informative city tour. Adam surely knows a lot about his birth town. We were a large group and had a lot of fun. I will definitely visit again Budapest! :)
Budapest- melinda. Ayman Mubarak - Saudi Arabia Really enjoyed the tour with pretty Melinda, she was funny and gives us plenty helpful information about Budapest.

Budapest with Anita & Orsolya.. Took a customised tour with Anita Toth & Orsolya Kelemen last week and it was great fun. Anita & Orsi knows their city so well and are super knowledgeable about Budapest, so we had some very interesting discussions. Plus, they introduced us to some little secrets of Budapest that are off the beaten tourist track. All in all, a great time. I would recommend it highly.
Budapest - Adam. Really enjoyed the tour with Adam! It's strange but he has all the answers to questions, sometimes topic even does not matter.

Storytime in tour form. Took the tour with my friends with Adam as our guide on April 4th, and absolutely loved it! The stories he had up his sleeve were extremely interesting and helped out so much with mapping out the city and getting more into the history. Adam was professional but felt like a friend telling you a story, and the tour covered well the most important sights of the city.Budapest is a city easy to love, but the tour made it even easier. Definitely recommend to everyone visiting the city, even to people who have been there before.

Great tour, great guide. I took a tour with Adam and he was terrific. He obviously enjoyed sharing his insider knowledge of Budapest. He knew tons of little personal details that you'd never find in a guide book, plus all of the major historical stuff as well. All in all, it was a very enjoyable way to spend a morning and learn about this wonderful city.

Budapest, Hungary. Fabulous tour guide and tour! It was my privilege to have a private guided tour with Adam today. I am still talking about it eight hours later! This young man is incredibly knowledgeable about his Budapest and his anecdotal and personal connections to the areas we visited that held me spellbound for four hours. I feel that I know so much about the people of Budapest, their struggle and immense courage! This emotional journey transcended historical and geographical boundaries of learning for me. As a Humanities teacher in the US, I am now inspired to teach the story behind the story of this city!Definitely the best tour and tour guide I have experienced and I have been on many!

Engaged. Brilliant tour guide: very knowledgeable, speaks excellent English, caters to his guests needs. We had a great time in Budapest and this tour made everything come together! We can highly recommend this guy.

The seriously researched fun custom tour. If you are in for a special-interest tour of Budapest, not just the usual mainstream canned stuff, hire Adam and his company. Send him your wishes beforehand, he will prepare a custom-made tour for you and deliver it with loads of wit and humour. Ever heard the term Hungarian chagrine? You will have the mocking-on-it version and learn everything you always wanted to learn about Budapest (and more) laughing your head off. Highly recommended.

When you don't want to miss a Word. When you just do not want to miss a word from the ones said by your Guide you know that you are with Adam Marot ...it is not only his knowledge or how well informed he is ...it is how he gets your attention with his great sense of humour and attention given for details...It is worth mentioning that he organised a special tour dedicated for the theme of training course "Face the Race!" that we were running in Budapest from 4-11/12/2014. We had one day tour as part of the program and he made it suit the topic which was fighing against racism and discrimination. Thank you very much for letting me discover Budapest as if I was seeing it for the first time despite being there 6 times before.check their facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/BehindBudapest/timelineAnnan IbrahimEgypt

Really Great Fun. This tour was really fun and interactive. The guide was absolutly brilliant. He managed to be funny, serious and informative all at the same time. If anyone goes to budapest i highly recomend this. Thankyou so much Adam!
Great experience. This tour has been interesting, educational and funny at the same time! I wish the guides in every city were like this!! Thanks Adam!! (Antonio from Spain)

The Soul of Budapest. We spent an enriching day with this program. It began with a comprehensive lecture on the history of Hungary in a charming coffee shop, continued with a tour by minibus of some of Budapest's sites, a delicious lunch in a family home, a concert by a Gypsy quartet and a walking tour of the city's Jewish quarter. Every aspect was impeccably organised and the lecture, luncheon and music were particularly appreciated. This tour is a clear attempt to move beyond the ordinary and provide a special and intimate experience in a complex and fascinating city. Our guide, Boulacz Levay was charming and gracious and managed the day very well. The food was delicious and the vegetarian option offered was fabulous. It was a privilege to be in a family home and we had a wonderful day. Recommended!

Danube Bend Tour. The Danube Bend Tour with our guide, Andras, was one of the highlights of our trip to Budapest and we definitely recommend it to anyone looking to see a bit of Hungary outside of the city. Andras is funny, personable, knowledgeable and has a passion for what he does. Though there was a bit of driving at the start, he certainly made the trip comfortable. He even took great effort in assisting us purchase tickets for the Parliament building by recruiting the some local store keepers (and their laptops).We started in, Szentendre, a charming little town on the banks of the Danube with lots of crafts and a museum containing more impressive sculptures made of Marzipan then you possibly could imagine. Then we moved on to the River Bend itself from an elevated view near the fort (which we opted to not enter). After a small history lesson, we grabbed lunch on the side of Danube. This restaurant served the most delicious grilled Trout! After some well deserved rest, sipping beer and watching a tributary flow just below us from our lunch table, it was on to our next stop. Off the beaten path, Andras shared a hidden spot with us that took us right to the river's edge. It included a short walk through the woods which was enjoyable as well. Finally we made it to a restored mansion for a strawberry wine and homemade dessert tasting. The mansion's owner was a charismatic, jovial guy who was also a friend of Andras. We quickly felt like part of their crew as we hiked up the back yard to the "tree house", sharing stories and learning about the walnut trees. We concluded with the wine and dessert tasting and a tour of the house, It was 7:30pm by the time we made it back to our hotel, pleasantly exhausted from the great tour!

BEST DAY EVER!!. I booked this private group tour for my multi-generational family vacation (from 87 to 22 years). We arrived in Budapest a day prior to our European River Cruise so I wanted a structured day of sightseeing - and we had an absolute fantastic day. WE had Balázs as our all day tour guide. He arrived on time, with great transportation and brought his knowledge, personality and love of Budapest with him. I cannot say enough kind things - we did and saw so much - all at a nice quiet pace (which we wanted so my parents)- saw so many interesting hidden gems. We shared lunch together and I left the day wishing I could spend more time in Budapest. This was my best day of our 12 day European tour ... to Balázs -- thank you thank you thank you! You are so kind + patient and my family loved spending the day with you!!

Thanks Balázs. For an excellent day trip to lake Balaton. We are so satisfied with the round trip to view different types of villages and local specialities. You were observent what we liked and showed us a great variety.Thanks againGunnel
great. loved every minute. Didnt have a lot of time-but this tour covered mostly everything you would want to see in this lovely city

Amazing way to see Budapest and Lake Balaton!. We didn't have a tour of Budapest... we had an EXPERIENCE! Balázs took us around the city in the famous trabant cars. We attracted a lot of attention from locals and tourists. Come to find out, these communist cars are quite a collectors item in Hungary. Balázs was an amazing guide with a lot of knowledge. We saw some of the major sites, but he also took us to some "hidden gems". Then we went to his parents house for a typical Hungarian meal. Warning: go hungry! His mother is an amazing cook and the food just keeps coming. You don't want to miss a thing! The next day, Balázs to us to Lake Balaton and a winery. It was beautiful! It was great to experience both the city and the countryside. And- enjoy wonderful wines with excellent food.Our experience with My Personal Budapest was excellent. I would highly recommend their "tours" (experience)!

This Is The Reason We Travel........ We travel because we are passionate about life and the people we meet along the way. We travel to learn about how connected we all really are. How history changes us all in different ways but ultimately still connected just in a different path of the same branch, from the very same story... In the end, we travel to find ourselves, it's really the story of our lives unfolding. So do all the touristy things for a day or two, then go find My Personal Budapest Tours and get the real story if you care and are hungry for more than just an impersonal tour.We did the Hungarian Soul Tour with Andras and the half day wine tour with Balazs. They were both incredible and we loved every minute of their passion and love for their country. We were struck by how passionate, and soulful the Hungarian people are. It took our breath away even more than the beauty of Budapest and it's top 5 of the most beautiful cities I've ever had the privilege to visit. The only other country we have really experienced that kind of passion is probably Ireland. The Hungarians really have soul. They are a breath of fresh air. We don't normally say for sure that we will go back to a country in the near future, but Hungary is an exception, it draws you back, it stays with you.What I love about Andras and his team, is that they spell out exactly what to expect in their tours, they are organized and professional but still free spirited. I won't explain the tours we did because you can find everything you need on the website. It was incredible. Indescribable beauty, great company, insightful real in-depth conversations, wonderful new friends, fantastic food and wine. What more can you ask for in life? Thank you Balazs, thank you Andras and please tell your mom and dad that we loved their warmth and hospitality. I shall be attempting to make that dish soon that your mom made us. I'm armed with her paprika... We will be back, God willing and when we do, we'll be connected to My Personal Budapest Tours again...

A Commi/Capitalist drive through Budapest. This is one of the more memorable things we've done. A little background: The Trabant is a one of the communist cars that was poorly designed, poorly engineered and assembled, yet still had a 10-year waiting list due to soviet “efficiency”. It would be hard to overstate what a P.O.S. this car is. My lawn tractor makes more power than the Trabant’s 2-stroke motor and my college kid's handmade club race car is more refined. The body panels, hood and roof are all made from Soviet plastic and I can’t imagine a worse production car. That said, I absolutely LOVED cruising around Budapest in the Trabant!Budapest is an interesting mix of old-world style and modern touches with remnants of Nazi and communist rule. We trundled through the city in the Trabant with almost rock-star status. The Trabants were such a symbol of all that was wrong with communism that when the Soviet Union collapsed in 89 the Trabants were relegated to the scrap heap of history. A few young, enterprising Hungarians have taken to saving the Trabant and really have made them better than when they were new. All of the attention we got was from locals who were amazed to see such fine examples of the cars on the road. We got to see a lot of the highlight of Budapest, some local hangouts and even a home cooked meal. The slow speed and excellent view from the Trabant allowed for great stories and beautiful pictures. The best part of the experience was the love our guide, Balazs had for Hungary, Trabants and visitors. A great experience!

A personal tour at a relaxed pace. Andras is one of the friendliest hungarians I have come across since I landed at the airport. He is professional and points out interesting facts and places that we could visit on our own, beyond the usual tourist spots. The tour started off with a overview of the history of Hungary which provided context and an insight into the Hungarian psyche. This was done in a cafe that was a throwback to the 1960s, in a very relaxed atmosphere. The city tour was fairly quick, we spent time at the Gellert Spa ( for just a quick look), the citadel, the great market hall, freedom square and 3 interesting cafes to check out on another day. Although we took sometime at each place taking photos, Andras was patient with us and with my mom who walked at a slower pace. Then off to Andras' parents house for a delicious home cooked Hungarian lunch. This was really the highlight of the tour for me. His parents' hospitality really made us feel welcomed in their home. Such a lovely couple! We were also treated to a private performance of gypsy / Hungarian music which was enjoyable. My mom and I didn't join the walking tour after that but I heard from my husband and son, who did, that Andras took them to some interesting places that most tourists don't get to see or won't know about.All in, I liked the fact that it was a private tour, done at our own pace. Highly recommended for an informative and friendly introduction to Budapest and Hungary.
Excellent. Excellent experience. Attila was awesome, very knowledgeable and very fun to your with. The pottery was a highlight of the day!

I'm still thinking about the tour!!!. If it is at all possible to get a very good feel for what it means to live in Budapest and what its citizens feel is important to them in just one day then this is the tour for you.Andras was excellent as a guide bringing us to different locales (away from the throng of tourists) and giving us insights you cant google. He loves his city and now we do as well! Thanks, Andras!

Superb gem in Budapest. This was the highlight of my time in Budapest! Takes the time to go through the history of Hungary and learn things that are not common, Excellent venues for all activities. Andras was an excellent host.

Unlike any other tour we have ever taken... Highly recommended.. My wife and I booked the all-day Hungarian Soul Tour with My Personal Budapest, and were extremely happy that we did. András was a great guide and led us through a number of experiences unlike any other tour we've ever been on -- a discussion of Hungarian history in a quirky cafe, a Hungarian lunch with his family, and even a private concert. The more conventional sightseeing portion of the tour was also well-done, with a separate driver dropping us off at a number of sights throughout the city and picking us up to move to the next sight when we were done. The small group size (ours was 4, maximum of 8) was great in keeping a very personal feel to the tour.We just got home from a five-city European vacation, and the Hungarian Soul tour was definitely my favorite tour of the trip. Thanks for a great time.

Time of Our Lives!! Attila and My Personal Budapest are simply THE BEST. This was our 2nd time returning to Budapest and it was our honeymoon, so it had to be a special experience filled with the best people. We had utilized My Personal Budapest for the Trabant tour in October 2015, so when it came time to plan the honeymoon, September 2016 trip, I reached out to the company again, to see if we could hire a driver for our 9 days in Budapest. Attila responded to me very quickly and gave us a very fair price. Each day, he was prompt and showed up a few minutes early to pick us up at our apartment by Parliament. It's a small detail, but I appreciated that his car was always clean and smelled good (I'm a real estate agent, so this is one of those small details that really made it nice!). Since my hubbie and I had already seen a lot of Budapest's historical sights, we turned this more into an eating and shopping tour. Attila was very accommodating and happily took us to any store/mall/outlet mall we wanted to go to. He even set up what we jokingly called the "Rich Man's Pub Crawl" for us one night and drove us to the Merkur, The Ritz Carlton, The Aria SkyTop Bar and The Four Seasons where we enjoyed cocktails and light snacks at each of them.... A lot of fun for a night!!! ...not to mention, getting to experience the amazing Hungarian red wines!!!On the day we visited the House of Terror Museum, there were important dignitaries that caused the museum's opening to be delayed. Attila quickly came up with a 'Plan B" to help us find something else to do, while we waited and then, when we returned, he personally walked us to the door to ensure that we were able to get entrance with no issues. He is just a class act that truly cares...Our last day together, there was a lot of cloudy skies and rain, so we turned that day into a photo shooting day. Attila took us to all the beautiful places and took our photos with our camera and iPhones, in front of the special places. This amazing act of kindness allowed us to have a lot of photos with BOTH of us in them and not just choppy looking selfies. I highly recommend this as an idea for any tourist that is traveling with their loved one(s).... It is so worth the money and you will LOVE having beautiful photos of both of you in front of the amazing architecture that is beautiful Budapest!We are planning our return visit already for May 2017... Attila and My Personal Budapest Tours will definitely be on our radar... Just can't say enough, how truly special he made our honeymoon.... Like a fairy tale... Thank you, Attila!!!! Much Love from Florida,Angie & Kirk

Lake Balaton Daytrip with Balasz. Me and my girlfriend had an incredible daytrip to Lake Balaton (including a ferry ride, walk through beautiful towns in the countryside, a walk to a nice viewpoint on the top of a vulcano, and a great located winery in the middle of beautiful nature with a wine tasting - that's what you see in the picture).Our tour guide Balasz was a great guide and had a well feeling for the things we wanted to see and hear.In all, we had an absolute unique tour where we were able to see the beautiful countryside of Hungary! :-)

Fabulous Day Trip with Boat Tour. We had a great tour of the countryside with Attila! He was personable, funny, knowledgeable and provided a full day of things to see. We also enjoyed a one hour motorboat tour on the Danube which provided a different perspective.Attila serves as a translator as well and we had no issues in communication.We would highly recommend.
Buddapest best tour!!. A must do. You will learn what it is to be hungarian. History, archictecture, food, family and music.

very good tour. Great guide knows his stuff really well as he has lived in Budapest his entire life. Took us to a beautiful hidden cafe in a bookstore and a terrace with wonderful views. We also did a boat tour which enabled us to see the city from a different perspective; highly recommend using My Personal budapest for your guide in Budapest

Great winery trip just outside of Budapest!. My wife and I had a great trip with András up to the Hernyák vineyard. András was great about providing lots of local information on the drive to the vineyard. Once there, we met Laci and Vali Hernyák, the owners, and began the wine tasting. Márti was our hostess for the tasting as well as serving us a really nice cold lunch. The wines were excellent and we had a nice tour of the wine cellar. It's in a really beautiful location and it was nice to be able to get out of the city and see a little more of Hungary.I'd highly recommend the trip.

Szentendre and hidden island tour . We decided to take a tour with Andras to go out of Budapest,to a small town called Szentendre. Andras offered us to visit a few very interesting museums there. He told us the history of the town and other curios facts about Hungary. Later Andras brought us to the hidden island just a few miles away from Szentendre. The island is very charming and it was an awesome experience to walk along its peaceful alleys and enjoy the picturesque scenery. Highly recommend this tour. You will absolutely enjoy a lovely getaway from Budapest especially if you have already spent a few days there and would like to view it's countryside.

Booked for 5 days and experienced awesomeness!. I was researching various tours in Budapest that met my needs (single woman who has zero knowledge and experience with Hungary), and I happened to come across MyPersonalBudapest via a quick Google search. They seemed to offer everything that I was looking for my trip, and so I contacted the company via email a few months beforehand. I received a reply back fairly quickly from Attila Kiss, and we worked together to come up with a plan and prices for my week in Budapest. Attila not only answered my questions that I had about the tours promptly and thoroughly, but he was also a wonderful guide when it came time for my trip in this beautiful city.Attila was always on time and very accommodating. I initially inquired about tours for single individuals, but eventually one of my relatives decided to join in on the trip and Attila worked out the budget to include and accommodate her as well. We had an amazing time with him! He was very knowledgeable about the city and locations, and whatever he didn't know he did his best to find out for us. He showed us 'secret' places that most tourists miss out on while in Hungary, and he was always hilarious! Attila the Pungarian, is a fit name for this funny tour guide! He was also very gracious and helped me to learn some Hungarian while I was there. Pro tip, a little bit of the language goes a long way!It was a little awkward at first as I had booked Attila for 5 whole days...something that apparently most people don't do, but he made it so fun and amazing that it felt like I was with a friend the whole time. Time flew by during the long car rides to the outer cities, and we never ran out of things to talk about from a range of topics including the long history of Budapest and Hungary to A.I. and Pokemon Go. Attila always did his best to keep us entertained and informed during the tours. We ended up splitting 3 days to explore Budapest as I had specific requests to see certain places and to space out the tours so that we wouldn't be too overwhelmed with the schedule. We also booked the Szentendre, Danube Bend, wine tasting, and Lake Balaton tours...Basically almost everything that the company had to offer, but it was so worth it and everything was personalized to what you want to see and do! Honestly if you have the time and money, spend more time in Budapest and Hungary! I thought it was well worth the money and planning. I felt like I got to really learn about the culture and history of Budapest and Hungary with Attila. From my initial contact with the company to actually meeting Attila in person, everything was handled very professionally and smoothly. He really went out of his way to fulfill my requests for the tours, and I am super impressed with how 'personal' MyPersonalBudapest really is! I will never forget my time in Budapest thanks to Attila, and I would definitely recommend others to contact MyPersonalBudapest if they're looking for a guide in Budapest! I hope to come back again sometime in the future! Thanks again for such an unforgettable trip!

Perfect day at Danube Bend tour, with Boat trip.. We are a family of four and went with András on the Danube Bend tour. He picked us up at 9 am and we drove to Szentendre were we stopped for a walk through the charming and quiet streets of the town centre, where we had some morning coffee. We visited the Szentendre micro art museum and the Szamos Marzipan Museum and Workshop. Then we drove to Visegrád and saw a beautiful panoramic view of the Bend. After that we went on a one hour boat trip which was fantastic. It was great to see the view from the Danube river. We all loved the boat tour and highly recommend it. Then we ate trout at a great local and well hidden restaurant. And finally we met András friend, Mischa (hope I spelled it right), in his beautiful old mansion and we drank strawberry wine and ate chestnut desert. Mischa is very nice and fun guy to talk to and the chestnut desert was delicious. I am so glad that we decided to go on this private tour. Hungary is more than just Budapest. We all highly recommend this tour.

A unique and memorable experience. My wife and I were looking for a personal tour of beautiful Budapest that took in a few major areas but also included a locals view of this wonderful city. We were only available on Thursday and wanted an afternoon tour. Andras hooked us up with his colleague Balazs who offered a unique 4 hour opportunity to see the city from a Communist-era auto called a Trabant. Small but spotless and comfortable (only 2-door) the Trabant drew stares and salutes from the natives and we easily negotiated some narrow streets and found parking where little existed. In addition to the standard tourist narration of major sites, Balazs also imparted to us insight into what it felt like to grow up in a city bursting out following the withdrawal of communism. We also loved seeing the beautiful residential areas, vibrant but off the beaten path. You must be open to a non-typical tourist experience to appreciate the tour, as well as be willing to exit the car at several stops. If you're looking for something different from the large group bus tours THIS is the experience you will remember.

Budapest with a Personal Guide. My Personal Budapest Tours offers small group tours on particular days of the week. Our trip happened to be on an off-day, but the company put us in touch with their guide Atilla Kiss who worked directly with us via email to arrange a personal tour during our stay. Atilla is very accommodating, speaks great English (he even makes terrible puns!), and is extremely knowledgeable about his beautiful city -- the history, the architecture, food and places to eat, little known surprise sites. Although there was not enough time in our 6 hour tour to stop long at every site we saw, we got a great overview and went back later in the week to visit several places in more depth. I recommend this company and this guide for anyone visiting Budapest for the first time.

Great escape away from the main city of Budapest. Our favourite parts of the tour were: (1) our lovely and passionate tour guide, Balázs, (2) being driven around in his beautiful vintage car, and (3) the visits to the towns just outside of Budapest. It was a great breather to get away from the city and to see a side of Budapest that we would have otherwise not have gotten a chance to explore without this tour. Balázs was extremely warm and welcoming, and had great knowledge and love for this city. We got to take beautiful pictures of the Danube bend from scenic spot, tried delicious local coffee and cakes, got a brief tour around an artistic town, and even got to step into the grounds of Slovakia. An addition that my family selected to this tour was the strawberry wine tasting. Although the strawberry wines were very unique and were indeed interesting to try, we felt that the inclusion of this was at the expense of the exploration of the small towns. As the tour that I've chosen was a mere one-day tour, it would have sufficed without the supplementary activities (such as: motor boat tours, ceramic workshops, wine tasting, etc.). Although highly interesting, I would personally only recommend these activities to those who are doing a longer tour (spanning a few days), or to those who have a particular interest in them, purely due to the lack of time. Overall, I still highly recommend this tour to anyone and feel that it is suitable for all as they are very flexible and open to tailoring it to your needs and interests.

Trabant tour in Budapest. What an excellent way to experience Budapest in three hours. Attile our guide was so knowledgeable and we learned a lot about the history of Budapest. The show stopper was definitely the open Trabant. We felt like celebrities. For us the highlight of the tour was the Fishermens Bastion and the wonderful views we enjoyed from there. Thank you My personal Budapest for excellent communication before the tour end providing us with the info how to get to our hotel.

This unique tour made for a very memorable day!. I have traveled all over the world and have taken many guided tours over the years. The Hungarian Soul Tour is truly unique and unlike any tour I've done before! This tour gives you a small, but true and memorable, taste of the Budapest/Hungarian history, it's culture, it's music, it's sights and it's food! The tour is a full day of more of a local, insider tour around the city and the the things that make up the 'soul' of the city! You start off the day with an interesting history lesson in a fun little cafe decorated in communist-era decor and memorabilia, then you move on to more of a traditional sightseeing tour which includes a stop at the Great Hall Market and a stop at the top of Gallert Hill, then on to lunch at a local's home (we were lucky enough to have a delicious meal at a lively Gypsy/Roma home), and then end the day with a private concert by some local, fabulous musicians!This tour is more expensive than most tours offered but it is worth the extra money to get a real taste (literally, with homemade traditional food!) of Budapest and to learn more of what makes up the heart and soul of this beautiful city!

Well worth the time and money. . We thoroughly enjoyed this tour, especially after we had walked around the Pest side for two days getting familiar with the neighborhoods. We also toured the National Museum and the Parliament ahead of time, so the Soul tour enriched everything we had learned superficially. It was a perfect culmination to our three days in Budapest.

Best In Budapest. Awesome day of experiencing Budapest and the surrounding areas through our tour curator Andras! How many personal tour guides take you to their parents home for lunch - that would be none - absolutely fantastic! Want to experience the 'real' Budapest, My Personal Budapest is the unanimous choice! Tell Andras the Casey's say "hi".

Memorable day @ Danube Bend Tour (Guide Andras is THE BEST!). If anyone is planning a trip to Budapest, I HIGHLY recommend signing up to this private day tour...I promise you will come away with a more complete, deeper and more meaningful appreciation of the beautiful country of Hungary and its people. If you can, ask that Andras be your guide; he was professional, personable, kind, and patient with us with all our requests, questions, shopping interests ;). A short drive from old Buda, Andras took us through to the enchanting countryside north of the country - the charming, artsy Szentendre (with shopping stops if you wish to do so), Esztergom (first capital with its castle ruins), the Szentendre island, all the towns along the way to the famous Danube Bend. Andras showed us the best viewpoints, local stops, and a "secret spot" ;). We had lunch at this AWESOME local seafood restaurant. Best grilled trout EVER- so fresh!, but I think my ultimate favorite portion of the tour was when we were introduced to his friend (he showed around his mansion), we also met his sweet mom, who embraced us guests like family. We enjoyed the strawberry wine tastings (I probably had 4 glasses haha) and home-made dessert to top it all off! On our return to Pest, we chanced upon a farmer selling raspberries and garlic along the road..even though we are already way over our schedule, Andras stopped, we got to say hello to the locals and try out fresh raspberries- YUM! I fell in love with Hungary not only because I got to visit Budapest but also because of the amazing experience/memories from the Danube Bend day tour. Sign up now and you won't regret it :)

Gastronomy, history and sights combined in one tour!. I can sum up the experience in one sentence; before the tour I didnt know much about Budapest, hungary and its people, after the tour I feel confident to say that I understand how the people and their customs have shaped the beautiful city. Some of my favourite parts of the tour include:- A great meal in the house of a Roma family where we tasted the local cuisine and learned more about their traditions and culture. - An insightful bus tour that took us to the most interesting sights of the city including some hidden gems. - the knowledge and great stories about the city and the country provided by our guide and the historian that taught us about the Hungarian history.- Free ticket for the parliament tour! worth the visit. Ideal for both solo and small group travellers that want to do more than just enjoy the sights of the beautiful city, but also want to learn what is behind them and how the city evolved and shaped. Especially interesting for people with little time that want to make the most of a one or two day visit! The guides also give you great tips of where to go after the tour is over. Thank you to our guide András for a great and insightful visit!

Trabant City Tour. What a great way to see some out of the way attractions, different from the hop on hop off. First, our guide Balázs, what a great guy, knowledgeable, enthusiastic and a very nice chap to boot!Second, the car, a super example of a Trabant, what else for a Budapest tour. This car was clean and fun, lovingly restored and modified by Balázs himself!Don't expect air-con or the hieght of luxury - the whole point of this tour is that it is in a Trabant, so whingers beware!Thirdly, some off the beaten spots with local knowledge thrown in.The only thing we would have changed was the cafe WE chose to stop at, Balázs offered two, a sixties retro place, which was great by the way and if this is your bag, go for it. On reflection we would have chosen the Art Nouveau cafe.Our trip to Budapest was only for three days, not enough in our opinion as there is so much to see and do!That said we are going to go back, before we do we will be contacting Balázs to organise another bespoke tour.Thanks Balázs see you soonSteve and Gaynor

Wonderful day. A wonderful day. From Andras being so responsive to our many questions and changes to Attila as our guide. We did the Danube Bend tour and Attila was both knowledgeable and flexible, We went to Szentendre, a small town with an array of small shops selling local artist pottery and trinkets. Don't miss the miniature museum. We then proceeded to a local "off the beaten path" spot. A local beach spot along the Danube river. Our last stop was Hungary's largest Catholic Church. First we crossed a bridge to Slovakia for a vantage point and then back to Hungary for a visit inside. Attila engaged with us, was entertaining and very knowledgable. He shared information about Budapest as well, which was not part of our tour. High recommend.

Complete view of Budapest. Our guide, Atilla, was excellent. His English was very good and his knowledge of the history and the sights of Budapest was extensive. We toured sights on both sides of the river and ended the tour with an understanding of the city and saw a number of "hidden" sights, including a wonderfully decorative roof on the government building that is only visible from the roof of a hotel nearby, and funky bar and open air market buried in the narrow streets of Pest. The tour lasted most of the day and involved enough walking to recommend comfortable shoes and clothes (Budapest can get quiet warm). And definitely bring a camera. The architecture is unique and well worth photographing, and the guide will insure that get all the photo ops that you might want. The tour was tailored to my request provided in advance when booking the tour and we got everything I wanted to see and photograph. Compared to some other private tours I've booked in Eurpoe, I found My Personal Budapest to be of excellent quality and very reasonably priced.

Day tour. I'm going to start off by saying everyone was really nice. Now I will tell you do not spend this much money to go on this tour. You start off in a cafe to hear about history for over an hour. One drink included. Then we got into a very hot van and rode around to see sights that Hungarian people don't like. We saw one monument that they liked. Then we got into the hot van, windows up with an AC that was terrible drove for over 30 minutes to eat lunch at 2 or 3:00. Needless to say we were starving. Loved the couple who had us in their home and food was great. We just wish it would have been closer. Then we drove over 30 minutes back to listen to a gypsy band. We felt uncomfortable in the small room with just a band playing. I will tell you that the idea & people are 5 star but the actual tour was a 1 star. The reviews they have online was not for this actual tour. I just want to state again we did like the people not the actual tour. Also there was only one hidden treasure a bookstore cafe that we ended our tour in. I do give George & Gizzy who had us in their home 10 stars.

Second time around, better than the 1st!. I am a travel agent and have taken many tours around the world. I can honestly say this was one of the best! Yes, you feel the Soul of Hungary starting with the warm welcome of the guide, the humor and knowledge of the 'historian', the love of the home cooked meal and the passion of the Roma concert. The tour is probably more for someone who has seen the tourist highlights already but wants to get closer to the people. It is a very personal tour and the guide Andreas, was a pleasure to spend the day with. Lots of laughs, a few tears and many hugs. I traveled with my husband, 2 sons, ages 35 and 29 and a daughter-in-law. We all thought the tour was amazing.

Fantastic day in the countryside outside of Budapest. For various reasons on my side, I had to communicate with Andras multiple times by phone and by e-mail and he was always responsive. Andras picked us up at our apartment right on time and as he drove us to Szentendre, he talked about Budapest and its history, the areas we were passing through and the history of Szentendre. We had a great time with Laszlo and Gabriella during our private ceramics lesson. They were so welcoming. We were also able to purchase some of Gabriella's beautiful ceramic items to take home. Next, we went into Szentendre proper, but while Andras showed us the usual tourist shops, we spent minimal time there, instead going off on side streets, eating traditional Hungarian langos, a fried flatbread. After a visit to the Baroque-Rococo Greek-Orthodox Blagovestenska church and the amazing Marzipan museum, we were off to Visegrad for amazing views of the Danube Bend. Andras also took us to visit his 'secret' spot which unfortunately was a little flooded, but still beautiful. One of the highlights of the afternoon was visiting a trout restaurant A Pisztrangos in Visegrad, a restaurant for locals, serving only trout. Delicious! We each ate every last bit of our fish. We went up near an old castle for some more amazing Danube views and then Andras dropped us off to catch the ferry back to Budapest. We were treated to more beautiful views of the countryside from the water as we traveled home after a wonderful day. Thanks you, Andras, too, for recommending the Budapest Bistro. We had a great dinner there.

The Soul of Budapest is a must do Tour. Booking the Soul of Budapest Tour over the Internet, and paying was very easy. Most tour guides will want cash in the local currency. Not so on this tour! I paid using PayPal, it was easy. This tour started understandably at the beginning...by reviewing the City's history and events over coffee/tea at the "Communist Café" a qwerty and unique place with 1950's radios, TVs, and other in the windows, all over the Café was fun memorabilia. After the history we discussed what we wanted to see and by air conditioned mini bus visited the Market, Gellért Spa, and Chain Bridge. We made 4 stops and a highlight was the magnificent architecture of Hotel Gellért and its Spa, and the views from on top of Buda. I should mention that although there is a plan you have a vote.We admired the amazing view of the city from the Citadel and got off for a short walk on Liberty Square and also in the City Park. Photo opportunities were everywhere we went.The next thing we did was a big surprise and the four of us really enjoyed it...we had a lovely Hungarian lunch in the home of a Hungarian family, which means we met with friendly and progressive Hungarians in their own home as well as enjoyed traditional Hungarian cooking in a relaxed atmosphere. The food was amazing and none of us needed dinner that night! On our drive back to downtown Budapest after lunch we enjoyed some heart-warming melodies from Liszt and another Hungarian composers. It was a private concert!We visited some places that have been left out of guidebooks as well.This is a ~8 hour tour, some walking, some bus, we got a tour of the city and afterwards we were prepared to venture out on our own. Don't worry if you are on a cruise to Budapest, this tour will not duplicate your tour.I would call this tour relaxing though. I never felt rushed. That is rare among tours in Budapest. This is the best tour in Budapest, look no further.

Not your usual tour…explores Hungarian Soul. One of the highlights of this tour was a lunch of Hungarian cuisine at the tour guides's parents house. Andras's parents were very gracious, and the food was excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed it, and it gave us an insight into Hungarian daily life. Another highlight was a private concert by five Roma musicians performing Hungarian music. They were accomplished musicians, and we were moved by the soulful sounds of their music. We made a stop at a retro communist cafe and had a interesting slide presentation with commentary by a student of Hungarian history. Other more conventional tour stops included the Gellert Baths, the Citadel, the Opera House, a secluded city park square, among others. Andras was very knowledgeable, and his English is excellent. At no time did we feel rushed during the tour. It was very relaxing and interesting, and utilized both van transportation and some walking. Best tour we had in Budapest!

Fantastic Experience. We had already been on a Viking Walking Tour of Budapest and were concerned that there might be some duplications. All we had to do was let András know what we had already seen and he formulated a tour just for us. It started out having a conversation with an expert on Hungary's history at a unique coffee house. He took us places that we would have never seen as they were not the usual "tourist" attractions. We had a wonderful dinner with his parents in thier home. They really went all out to set a beautiful table and the food was scrumptious. Then we all (parents included) went to a concert just for us by a group of gypsy musicians and it was entertaining and educational. One of the musicians gave us a history of gypsy music and it was so interesting. They were great. I didn't mention that we also received free tickets to the Parliament from András and visited it the day before. Wow, what a building! We had a tour guide who spoke English very well and gave us an amazing amount of information. Don't miss touring the inside of the Parliament building. I would recommend this My Personal Budapest because it didn't feel like 10,000 facts and/or dates spewed out by a guide that had a memorized a script. My mind tends to "turn off" when people talk that way. It was an 8 hour tour I believe and well worth the money.

A fantastic day. We had a great time on our day with Andres. This tour was completely different than any other tour I have ever been on. Andres arranged for several interactions and events with local people -- it was so interesting to understand what it was like to live through various stages of their history.The highlight of our trip was definitely the meal with a local family. Our hosts could not have been more gracious and we understood just as much about Hungary by their grace and hospitality as by their insightful answers to our many questions. I would highly recommend this tour if you are planning to visit Hungary.

Enjoyable Danube River Bend Tour. Our family of four enjoyed a delightful day trip outside Budapest with Balázs. We learned so much and saw so much in just one day it was well worth it. Visiting three villages, seeing such beautiful Hungarian scenery, and enjoying pleasant conversation with Balazs all day made for a great day. We would highly recommend it.

A 6 hours tour of Budapest with a private guide. This is certainly the best way to have a first contact with Budapest. Our guide has been very effective in showing us the best known places as well as more confidential locations. Being very friendly he made this visit very enjoyable for us. The tour was well prepared, with documents giving us useful informations as well as historical views. We strongly recommand this organisation. The prices are quite reasonable.

Hungarian Soul Tour could be improved.. It pains me to write this because I really liked Andras. When I tried to book on his site, he had different offerings at the time and I chose a personal tour but I see he has since changed his website and no longer offers what I originally wanted which was the Trabant tour around the city. He convinced me to take this tour instead and now realize why. We first went to a coffee shop for an hour long history lesson. After 30 minutes, we had enough. His guide was very nervous and the whole thing was way too long to be indoors on such a beautiful day. We rode around the city on a bus and then went to his house for lunch. The food was okay. This was the only highlight. The 2 hour music concert, again indoors, was nice but way too long. If this was outside we could perhaps have tolerated it better. Sadly, we are not fans of classical music. Overall I would recommend this if you don't mind sitting for long periods and have a greater appreciation for classical music.
