The second day we saw off-the-beaten-trail sites in Budapest: good views, hidden ceiling paintings, the Ruin bar (another highlight, we had the bar to ourselves and the whole place is full of hidden works of art and other ingenious things), and more. Later we walked around ourselves and realized how close all these things are together, but without a guide it would take a lot more time to see so much. In fact, most of the highly rated things on Trip Advisor seemed to have been on our tour. The day started at a fascinating local market with a beautiful meat and cheese plate but we didn't expect it so we'd already eaten breakfast. My husband had a coffee he described as the best he'd had in his life. We also had lunch at a restaurant Pesti Diszno, which turns out to be a restaurant written about in the New York Times with excellent Trip Advisor reviews, we tried three soups (my husband and I shared two) and three main dishes, all very tasty and typically Hungarian. We then had delicious warm pastries at First Strudel House. All of these snacks, admissions, and transportation were included in our tour, which I didn't expect.My only hesitation for giving five stars is that Andras, who is pictured, was not our guide. He is the A list and I didn't realize we wouldn't have him. We had Attilla, who was thoughtful and attentive, he just lacked the gift of gab that you would expect a tour guide to have. Several times I felt that he didn't seem to have enough information to impart and that it was more a string of facts rather than story telling. Several times I felt the conversation got too involved in our jobs and finances, subjects I found especially uncomfortable because of our respective countries' financial disparities. We did really like Attila, and we certainly learned a lot about Hungarian life from him, I just think there's some room for improvement.I highly recommend using My Personal Budapest, though I think the company's name and promo photo may be misleading. This was an unforgettable tour.

Fantastic Experience!. We did both the Trabant city tour and the Danube Bend tour during our time in Budapest. Balazs and his Trabants were a lot of fun, and our guide, Attila, showed us many sites around the city that we might have otherwise missed. The authentic Hungarian lunch was excellent.The Danube Bend tour on our second day was spectacular, and we really enjoyed the wine tasting at the Hernyak vineyard. Andras, our guide, was friendly and knowledgeable. His tours are a great way to experience Budapest and Hungary, especially for those who have never visited before.

Dinner with Local Family. Our group of 8 had a delicious dinner at the home of Andras Novak's parents. (Andras picked us up in our hotel lobby as it is about a 30 minute drive.) The menu was traditional Hungarian food and Mr & Mrs Novak were gracious, delightful hosts. Andras was very well informed on every topic that came up for discussion and we all felt as if we had new friends at the end of the evening. I will recommend this dining experience to all my clients who are travelling to Budapest.

MyPersonalBudapest the Best. On our recent trip to Budapest we took two tours with MyPersonalBudapest, the Trabant and Hidden Treasures Tours. These personal tours were the best we have encountered anywhere. The personal service and friendly atmosphere made it very special and our guide Attila showed us some interesting places in Budapest we could not have seen otherwise. The lunch in a Hungarian home was a highlight with the food and hospitality special. I would recommend these tours to anyone visiting Budapest. You simply won't find better.

Great way to see Budapest in one day. With our tourguide Atilla we went through all the public and less public highlights of the city. In the morning in an excellent Trabant and in the afternoon in a car. Even though the weather was not too friendly, our tourguide was and we had a very good day!

Great Culinary + Main sights + Hidden Gems Tour. Small Improvement for Larger Groups. We took this tour during one of the hottest days of the year in Budapest (101F) - and still enjoyed it very much. So, yes, that's how good it is.We combined the main sights + culinary tour since it did not make sense in my opinion to try to squeeze the main sights tour between breakfast and late lunch. I strongly recommend you do that since everything flows better. We had breakfast at a local market and already started talking about Budapest history, recent events, etc. Then we went for the main sights tour. Everything was covered and questions answered without rush, at a very relaxed pace.One small improvement suggestion for larger groups. We were in two Trabants (cars) and used a radio to communicate between stops. But the radios used are not very clear and the group in the second car sometimes would not properly understand the guide's observations. Therefore clearer radios or some other solution would be better for larger groups.All in all highly recommended.

Absolutely the best tour of Budapest.. Our city guide met us at our hotel, which was extremely convenient, with his immaculate Trabant car. My son and I thoroughly enjoyed Balazs, a Trabant fanatic, showing and telling us the history of this great Eastern European car. We then took a fantastic tour through the streets of Budapest and stopped off at many great attractions including Heroes' Square, the Parliament Building, the Great Market, Spa Baths and the Fisherman's Bastion to name a few. Balazs knew so much information and it was extremely interesting to see his collection of photos that he had brought, showing Budapest many years ago. Going around the City in the Trabant was a fantastic experience and had many other city tour groups checking out our tour! Balazs was so informative and an awesome guide - this is definitely the best city tour we have ever taken. If you are visiting Budapest do not miss this wonderful experience.

Great Tours of Budapest. We had a great day with Andras combining 4 tours into one full day of touring around Budapest. We started with the Trabant Tour (Andras met us in our hotel lobby which made it very easy for us), having a driver also meant Andras was able to talk to us about the sights enroute. Next was the Hungarian Lunch at his parents house which was very authentic, great food and such lovely people! The afternoon sightseeing continued with the Hidden Treasures tour before a Cruise on the Danube. We highly recommend these tours. Andras also helped us purchase a 72 hour pass for the metro and was happy to accommodate any requests including stopping at a Currency Exchange so we didn't have to find one later. The personalised tour means you get to ask the questions about what you are interested in and run at your pace. A great day that we will never forget!

Fantastic off-the-beating-path tour. Attila gave our family of three, including a teenager, the "hidden treasures" tour. It was a wonderful way to see what most tourists don't have the opportunity to experience, as the company has made plans in advance to gain access to these places. Attila was very attentive to our comfort, as the day was very hot and he gave attention to walking and standing in the shade when available. He also instructed the tour in a comfortable pace so that we never felt rushed and were able to enjoy everything at a more relaxing pace. Attila's tour especially captivated our teenage daughter's attention. I can highly recommend this tour, especially for those interested in a more leisurely and eclectic tour.

We are so glad we took the tours!. My husband and I were on holiday in July 2013 in Budapest and hired Andras and company for five tours - The Trabant Tour, The Hungarian Lunch in a Hungarian Home, The Hidden Treasures of Budapest, The Danube Bend Tour and The Winery Tour. Each tour was unique, personable and definitely well worth it - our favourite was the Winery Tour. We combined it with the Danube Bend Tour, which we did first, and then finished with a late afternoon tour with a tasting of five wines and a scrumptious cold plate on the stone patio deck overlooking the vineyard - a memory to last forever!THANK YOU

The best way to see Budapest. We took a Trabant tour of Budapest and the Hidden Gems tour of Budapest with Balazs. He was a total delight but most importantly he gave us 2 wonderful tours of Budapest. He was very knowledgeable and as a result I feel like I came to appreciate Budapest on a much more intimate level. I also felt like we were able to see and do so much more than we would have been able to on a big tour.

A really interesting and educational day. We spent a great day with Andras in June. For the morning we did the Trabant tour, and in the afternoon the Hidden Treasures. Andras also kindly arranged a private concert in the home of an excellent concert pianist. Throughout the day Andras answered our many questions in excellent English, with patience and humour. After telling him we were interested in bakeries he re-shaped the day to take in some of his local favourites, translating for us, and guiding us on some of the delicious products for sale. This was entirely above-and-beyond our basic requirements, and showed that he is very willing to go the extra mile for clients. The Trabant was a great attraction, and our driver was a charming man. Despite being rather tall people, we all fitted in easily enough. The personalised piano concert was the highlight for my partner. We could request any classical music we liked and have it played (without notes) before our eyes. Very impressive. Andras's knowledge extended from current affairs to history, politics, architecture and more. We would highly recommend his company for a real insight into this fascinating city.

The best way to explore Budapest and the Danube River towns. My husband and I just returned from a two week trip to Amsterdam, Prague, and Budapest. The two days that we spent with Attila from MyPersonalBudapest were among the best days of our trip. I began by emailing Andras to create itineraries for two days. Initially, I wanted to tour Budapest on Sunday and do the Danube River Bend Tour on Monday. Andras suggested that we switch our tours around as many places such as the Great Market in Budapest are closed on Sunday and we'd miss out. After several emails, our days were set.On the first day, Attila met us at the apartment which we were renting. He was prompt and arrived in his personal car which was clean and well maintained. At first we thought Attila was a bit reserved and quiet, but we were quite wrong (in a good way!) He spoke perfect English and had a great sense of humor, offering us terrific insights into the way of life of Hungarians. Attila taught us a great deal of history filled with anecdotes along the way. Clearly, he has a great love and pride of his native Hungary.We took off to do the Danube River Bend tour and Attila was kind enough to search for an ATM for us on the way, even standing nearby and watching as we used the machine. Our first stop was Szentendre. We arrived early in the morning, just as everything was opening, with few tourists around. Attila asked what kind of art we enjoyed (as this is an artist's town) and took us to the shops that reflected our interests. We enjoyed the winding, narrow roads and Attila's explanation of why they were built that way. (I'll let him explain that to you.) The shops were lovely and Attila was patient as both my husband and I took a multitude of photos and browsed to see if there were items which we wanted to buy. We went into a beautiful old Serbian Orthodox church and Atttila explained the customs and history, while giving us tips on Hungarian pronunciation! We then went into the Szabo Marzipan Museum, which was quite interesting! (All tickets were included in the price that Andras had set.) From there we went on to the town of Visegrad, where we saw a castle and breathtaking views of the Danube and the river valley. Next, we traveled to Esztergom, where we visited a stunning cathedral. Below the castle was a restaurant where we ate a delicious French lunch (as it was Bastille Day). (Lunch was at our own expense, which had been explained previously.) As it was Sunday, there was a mass in the cathedral and Attila told us that we must hear the organ play, but he was not certain when it would begin. As we walked outside, admiring the view, Attila repeatedly checked inside for us to see when the organ playing would begin. He ushered us in right on time and it was indeed splendid. I'll also add that Attila was quite helpful in showing my husband and I spots to take the best photos from. It was an informative, relaxing day that we just loved, and we would recommend this the Danube Bend tour highly. We almost took a bus tour and are so glad that we did not. Oh, and we even drove into Slovakia to see the view of Hungary from there! Very cool!On the next day, Monday, Attila met us again at 9AM and brought us around the corner to where Balazs had his Trabant parked. What a lovely young man and what a fun car! He actually made the top into a convertible by himself. Balazs gave us a great explanation about the history of the car model and my husband had fun looking at the engine with him and comparing it to the Volkswagen Bugs that he had long ago.The morning was spent with Balazs driving and Attila guiding. The banter between them made the ride even more fun. We saw great sights (you can read about them in the previous reviews - I had read all 180 of them before booking this tour, which Attila found hard to believe, but it was true!) and once again, Attila was a wealth of information and so pleasant to be with. We never felt rushed at all.We went back to Attila's car, said goodbye to Balazs, and then hopped back into Attila's car for a drive to the countryside to have lunch with Andras's parents. They were lovely, welcoming us with Palinka and appetizers, and then serving a delicous lunch of vegetable soup, Lecso (stew) and roasted chicken, followed by raspberry cake.We headed back to Budapest, dropped off the car, and took public transportation to see the Hidden Treasures of Budapest, including a ruin bar which I requested that Attila take us to. I'll add that I had mentioned in my email to Andras that I was a bit concerned about too much walking due to a foot injury, and Attila offered to drive us for the afternoon tour to lessen the walking that we'd have to do. Fortunately, that was not necessary, but Attila's kindness and concern were evident. The Hidden Treasures tour was fun (we were a bit tired by then but we did enjoy it) and we saw places that we never would have found on our own. Andras clearly has good connections, even enabling Attila to get us into a famous mansion on a day that it was formally closed!By the time we were dropped off at our apartment at day's end, we felt like we had made a good friend and were sorry to say goodbye after our two days! I'd highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting the delightful city of Budapest. Best regards to Attila, and I do hope you find what you are looking for. ;)

Great Way To Get To Know Budapest. My friend and I spent the morning with Andras on the Hidden Treasures tour and it was one of the highlights of our entire trip! Andras is extremely personable, great English, and being raised in Budapest, a true understanding of the city. Highly recommended!

Com oito e com oitenta - With eight and eighty. My mother turned 83 in Budapest and this trip was the perfect way of celebrating it. Our guide Balazs gave us a personalized city tour made of historical references but also full of fantastic stories and happenings that my 10 years old son enjoyed, such as the fountain that stops when you command our the shinning bolls of a statue horse. He also was attentive, understanding and we feel like visiting with a friend, not like tourists. The impression was completed by our lunch in a Hungarian House. We were most welcomed and the food was delicious. My son is skinny but ate a lot. My mother and our hostess, Giselle, don’t speak English, and even so we had a brilliant and alive conversation.Budapest and MyPersonalBudapest gave us memories to treasure.

Excellent Guide for Hidden Budapest. We had a n excellent tour with Attila walking around Budapest seeing parts that you might not generally see. Probably my favorite part was walking into one of their famous "Ruin" bars which I probably would not have done if not for this tour. My daughter had to change her travel plans at the last minute and this company was nice enough to rearrange our tour and move the day from Saturday to Sunday! The day was exceedingly hot and we wanted to show my daughter the Castle Hill area and Attila was nice enough to drive us up there (not part of the tour). After doing one of the larger free tours we were glad that we made the commitment to take smaller personalized tours such as this one for the remainder of our trip in eastern europe!

Great personal tour. Tour was wonderful, as was our young driver balazs.he loves his car, city and job so nothing is too much trouble. He took us to a wonderful cafe which had not been on the itinerary but we chose to skip the central market hall as we had already been there. He gave us lots of tips on other things to do whilst in budapest. Thank you sooo much will recommend to all our friends

A must do !. I am not even sure where to start this review - if I could rate it above Excellent I would. Balazs was waiting for us at the hotel on our first day in Budapest. After explaining the details of his Trabant, we piled into the car and were off ! There is no finer way to see the city then with a local tour guide who was charming and very attentive. After seeing the sites, we booked the hidden treasures tour for the afternoon. It is amazing what you can see if you are not trying to figure out where you are on a map and what to do next. Balazs lead us around. It was a great day and truly the highlight of our trip. Thanks Balazs for making the day so memorable and special ! If traveling to Budapest - use this service - you will be smiling for weeks with great memories !

Lots of fun! Great tour and great tour guide, Balazs. I was a little worried at first when I read all of the great reviews of andaras and then found out we would have a different guide because he was busy. Fears were unfounded as BalazsI was exceptional. Great knowledge, inquisitive, fun, caring, warm and friendly. I love taking personal tours because you can have great conversations about the region, culture, history and of course, restaurant and other recommendations. These guys are great. The trabant tour was so fun and the sights memorable.

The People Factor. We chose My Personal Budapest to experience life in and around Budapest in a unique manner and we were certainly not disappointed. Only a few moments after meeting Andras in out hotel, we felt comfortable in his company and eager to embark on a custom-designed tour of the Danube bend, complete with a wine-tasting in the afternoon. The people you meet on this tour - including, of course, Andras - are what makes the day so memorable. We will never forget shaping our first clay bowl under the expert guidance and encouragement of Gabrielle. Smiling, vibrant Gabrielle. Every moment spent with Andras - strolling through the cobbled streets of Szetendre, gazing at the flooded Danube from a scenic overlook, or simply driving from place to place - was filled with open, intense, and sometimes even philosophical conversation. In itself, a rarity in these days of superficiality. Yet again, during the wine-tasting, the encounter with Valerie was so genuine. Filled with admiration for what she and her husband had created in less than 20 years following their escape from Serbia, we felt moved by her tale. Another person along our way whom we will always remember. I mustn't omit the mention of the delicious cold plate we were served, the good wines we tasted and the exclusive hilly location of their vineyards. It was a day - and three very special people - to remember!

Best Tour in Budapest!. This is by far the BEST tour I have had so far!!! Honestly, Andras has given me such a fresh view of Budapest...My husband and I were in Budapest for less than 2 days in May. We had arranged 3 tours together with Andras: Trabant tour in the morning, Hungarian lunch in a Hungarian home, and The hidden treasures of Budapest. The total cost was 220 euros. I initially thought it was a little pricy, but trust me, at the end of the day, I felt it was totally worth it!The tour with personal, had a very nice pace, and was tailored to our interest. The Trabant tour was fun and took us to a lot of places that would have taken too long to get to by foot. I particulary loved the lunch because it was intimate and really gave me a sense of how locals live their lives. Not to mention that the lunch was so yummy because it was made by a lovely professional chef! The afternoon walk tour was relaxing. Andras took us to a lot of local places that tourist would have never discovered. Additionally, we were able to ride the subway and the bus, and take a little break here and there in the market or charming cafteria.What more can I say? If you ever consider a tour in Budapest, this is it! You won't find anything better than this. Perphaps I will go back for another tour with my family some day...

The Guiding Light. Sometimes, what’s left out of travel guides is more interesting than what’s put in. That’s what Andras Novak specializes in, and he delivers it faster than Domino’s. A true child of the city, Andras took us to the nooks and crannies we would have otherwise missed: the park and palace of the Karolyis, an old aristocratic family … an art nouveau café that looks like it walked straight out of a Klimt painting … the Central Café coffee shop where the poets and writers and firebrands of a world long vanished frequented, sipping strong coffee and tossing strong opinions … the Alexandra Bookstore which would be what you’d get if the Taj Mahal gave birth to a Barnes & Noble (where we also had a chance to tour a little-seen part of its art gallery) … the Jewish quarter … and Szimpla Kert, a “ruin pub,”whose interior decorator must have been a wrecking ball and a stick of dynamite. There you can drink in a bathtub or an East German Trabant, the car that made a Yugo look like a Rolls Royce. But all of this would have been pictures without meaning if it wasn’t for Andras’ encyclopedic knowledge and his passion for history. Walking with Andras is like being served a pastry in one of the city’s many patisseries–a treat, as full of history as much as flavor.

Trabant-Tour through Budapest. My friend and I booked the Trabant-Tour in advance and we felt in good hands right from the start. András realized we had quite a few things planned and offered getting us tickets for the river cruise so we wouldn't have to worry about that. He planned a great 3h-tour, which perfectly fit in our schedule so we were able to catch the ship right on time. Coming down to the lobby of our hotel, Balázs - a true Trabant enthusiast - already expected us and first held a quick history lesson about Trabant cars. The tour took us to the most important sights of Budapest with Balázs pointing out a few hidden treasures we would need to check out later during our trip. Throughout the tour we were frequently asked if there was anything else we wanted to see but we laid our full trust into Balázs' experience as a guide and we weren't disappointed. The Trabant-Tour was absolutely fantastic and it was definitely a highlight during our stay in Budapest. On a side note: Balázs is an extraordinary driver and very passionate about his Trabant. You will enjoy listening to him and the stunts he's performing with his car! :)One remark: If you know what sights or special locations you want to visit, you might as well tell them in advance. I am sure they will set up an individual trip for you.

Lake Balaton/winery tour. We just got back from Budapest and had an amazing trip. The highlight was definitely our tour of Lake Balaton with the winery visit. The lake is stunning! It is a long drive but definitely worth it. Andras took us to a few small towns on the lake and each was charming and beautiful. The afternoon ended with a visit to a small winery overlooking the lake. Breathtaking! The food at the winery is outstanding, the best meal we had during our entire trip. The wines were wonderful and the view is unbeatable. Overall a picturesque and relaxing afternoon. If you have the time, definitely add this to your itinerary. We also did the hidden treasures tour the day before. We had a nice time and found it interesting, but the lake tour was our favorite. Thanks andras!

Great Tour of Budapest. My wife and I stayed an extra day in Budapest after our river cruise on the Danube, and we arranged a personal tour and lunch with MyPersonalBudapest. Balazs met us right on time in front of the Sofitel with his Trabant, and after an explanation of the car and its history, we had a wonderful private tour of the city. After the tour, we headed out to the suburbs for lunch at the home of Andras' (it's his company) parents. Lunch was fabulous and it was quite interesting to be in a traditional Hungarian home. We would highly recommend this tour.

Hidden Treasures Tour. One thing that I have found to be consistent with the tours we have taken (my partner researches these on Tripadvisor , among other sites) is that each guide-the good ones-bring a little of themselves to the picture. They cannot help it-they are in this business because of their own curiosity, their love of history and their city or country and their desire to share that with others. That being said, we have been very lucky to get the guides we have. Andras is polite, deferential, really, really smart and knowledgeable. He is interested in what you want to know, and guides his tours that way, answering questions thoughtfully and thoroughly. He met us at our hotel mid morning and came back with us when the tour was over. Since this was a tour for two people, there was time to stop for something to eat or to go to the bathroom. It's a city tour, so shoes for walking in the city are good to wear.The tour we took is aptly named "Hidden Treasures." Andras grew up in Budapest, in Pest, and so he is familiar with many places known only to locals. We would never have found many of these places on our own, and in fact, had never even heard of some of them. The Karolyi Gardens and Palace, the first stop on the tour, was a perfect example. A beautiful park, part of the former estate of the Karolyi family, it is easily passed by as its entrance is small and unprepossessing. Once through the small gated entry, it's lovely. Andras took us through the estate and the history of the place and the family beautifully.His love for the city, and for these places in particular was evident. The Central Bookstore and Alexandra bookstore are on the tour as well as the statue of Ronald Reagan - right across from the Soviet monument! And there's a wreck of a building turned into a hopping night spot, kosher bakeries and one of the most hidden highlights on the tour was the Post Office!Had we not taken this tour we would have walked past some of the most beautiful and interesting sights in Budapest, never knowing of their existence! It was well worth the morning. We had a wonderful time.

The best tour!. My mother and I were in Budapest in early May and had a fabulous day with Andras touring the Danube Bend and Hernyak Winery. Booking the tour was very easy and Andras was an exceptional guide. He was extremely knowledgeable and professional, and our day touring with him was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. We would highly recommend My Personal Budapest to anyone visiting the area. One suggestion would be to book your tour on one of the first days of your trip. Andras provided a great introduction to the culture and area and had wonderful recommendations for sites, restaurants, etc to visit. He even assisted us with a last-minute reservation for a Danube Bend cruise!

Personalised Trabant Tour 1 Bus Tours 0. We met Balazs & his 2 stroke Trabant on our last day in Budapest & I have to say it's a fantastic & personalised way to see the city. The trabant is a really quirky car & he's knowledegable & passionate about both the car & Budapest. Unfortunately for Balazs we've been in Budapest for 3 days & today is our last day so we've already seen most of the sights! He takes this in his stride & takes us to the best views of the city, adds his own spin on the history & events that have taken place and also acts as a pretty decent camera man! His english is good & so is his ability to drive a trabant on 2 wheels (this isnt part of the tour so dont worry!) Having seen hundreds of people sat on the hop on hop off bus tours listening to their headphones blankly I think the tour more than worth the money!

Trabant Tour For Fun. My wife and I spent a morning touring Budapest with Balazs in his Trabant auto and he provided a great deal of local info delivered with a great sense of humor. We learned not only about the city and Hungary, but also about the Trabant which was very interesting. This tour is far superior to any bus tour, in that you receive a customised tour with your own personal guide. I highly recommend this tour.
Personal look at someone who is passionate about his town.. Wine tour was our highlight because of its personal , intimate setting; Andras had a good sense of humor along the way after 2 days.

For those that want something a little different.. We have just finished our culinary tour and hidden treasures personal tour and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We were collected at 8.30am from our hotel where we embarked on a local market for some traditional Hungarian styled breakfast. Very cool hanging with the locals, nice brekky and different to what we are used to and superb coffee. We then headed out to some hidden spots that you wouldn't know about nevertheless find. This was off the beaten track and just what we were looking for before stopping for an amazing lunch. After a short car ride, a bus, a walk and the metro we finished the day at a quaint little Strudel bar with a wine.Fantastic value, great food and excellent service. We are young to middle aged and thought it was great. We were well looked after and it was a real buzz having the one on one time with a local.Highly recommended.

A Great Day in Budapest!. We booked Andras Novak for a full day of touring in Budapest and could not have had more fun. He rented a vehicle to accommodate our group of 6 and took us all over the place, answering our many questions and spending time on the things we were interested in. We were delighted to experience a wonderful home-cooked Hungarian meal with his family, and we finished the day with a visit to the lovely Hernyak winery.We will definitely call him again if we are ever back in Budapest! We highly recommend him!

Fabulous Day in Budapest. When we stepped outside our apartment, we noticed a group of men standing around a car and looking under the hood. It turned out to be Balazs, our Trabant driver, showing the car to local workers and explaining how it works. My husband was immediately in heaven, as he has quite a love for old cars. Attila, our guide, arrived and we were off for our adventurous Trabant tour. Both Attila and Balazs were very knowledgeable and entertaining and great to spend the morning with. They showed us various sights throughout the city and explained the history and politics behind it all. So many beautiful things to see-Heroes Square, the baths, Parliament, Chain Bridge, Buda, Fisherman's Bastion,Matthias Church,the Liberation Monument, not to mention the magnificent views from the Buda side. As the homemade hungarian lunch was not available on the day of our tour, after the Trabant tour, Balazs dropped us off at Trofea for a buffet lunch which featured many Hungarian specialties. Attila explained the various dishes to us and we were able to sample many foods. After lunch, we began the The Hidden Treasures tour, beginning in the Jewish Ghetto. We walked, rode on streetcars, and traveled on the subway and saw all forms of architecture, parks, a palace, restaurants with interesting decor, the view from the rooftop of a hotel, went shopping, and had a great overall view of Budapest along with the wonderful companionship of Attila. The entire day was a great adventure and the tours are highly recommended.

Great tour. We had a great day touring the city of Budapest with Attila. First stop was to local market / mall for breakfast and coffee then into town to check out some fabulous architecture, coffee shops, art and history. Lunch was traditional Hungarian and was absolutely fantastic. The day was topped off with some delicious traditional strudel. Attila was pleasant and knowledgable. We were very pleased with the value and overall experience, no way would we have found these interesting places on our own.

The best way to see Budapest. We have just had a weekend break in Budapest and finished off the trip with a Trabant Tour. Our guide for the day picked us up in the Trabant outside the hotel as arranged and introduced us to our vehicle for the day. I'm around 6'3, my friend is 6'2 and other pal not too far off 6'. It was a bit awkward for the three of us getting in and out of the Trabi, but it was relatively roomy (I've been far more squashed up on some airlines!). Our guide (Balázs) was brilliant, even though we had already explored the city on foot, he was able to tell us so much history about the buildings and statues and the country. We visited all the most noteable places, had plenty of stops to walk around, and of course, lots of time bombing around the city in the Trabi.Balázs was able to answer any questions we had, and took us to one or two of the more hidden gems of the city, away from the usual tourist treck. The driving was very safe - from a very skilled driver, if you are lucky enough to have Balázs as your driver, make sure you check out his youtube videos of Trabant driving skills! Is this really the best rated trip in Budapest? It's the only way to see Budapest!!Thank you very much :)

Enjoyable and educational. Andras is very knowledge and loves to share information about his beautiful city. He and his Trabant driver were at our apartment a few minutes ahead of schedule. This tour was an incredible introduction to Budapest. We took the Trabant City Tour, Hungarian lunch and hidden treasures tours. It was a very full day of sight seeing, history, and delightful experiences. Highlights of the day: Trabant, Mathias church, fisherman's bastion, incredible view of Pest, book cafe, experience of the underground, the old Jewish quarter and the tree of life. We especially enjoyed our home made Hungarian lunch and conversation with Andras and Agi (www.budapestcookingclass.com).

The best way to spend a day in Budapest. We are both Americans of Hungarian decent and very excited to be finally visiting the country of our grandparents. All the places we went with Andras we never would have discovered on our own. We love Andras' parents-they made us feel like family and we enjoyed a delicious lunch. Afterwards we attended a private classical piano concert which was simply incredible and I highly recommend that experience to everyone. Booking some time with Andras is a smart vacation decision. Next time I am back in Hungary, I am setting aside a couple of days with him and his associates.

Nice Introduction to Budapest. Balasz, our driver and guide, provided a great introduction to Budapest. He was informative and spoke excellent English. And his Trabant was clean and well maintained. Truly, this is a unique and worthwhile way to see a bit of a beautiful city. Thank goodness we didn't opt for a tour bus.

Don't Feel Like a Tourist. We did the Hidden Treasures tour and the Family Lunch, and had an amazing time. Even our 6 year old daughter never got bored. We didn't feel like tourists, but like locals getting an insiders view and getting to see things most tourists don't, then felt like friends who have been invited over for lunch. The meal was one of the best meals we ate during a 2 week trip that included 7 cities in Europe, and the company was very enjoyable. Exploring the city with András was really fun, and our only regret is that we didn't have more time in Budapest. Would highly recommend My Personal Budapest.

Almost like touring with a member of the family!. Someone else said that this was the best thing they did in Budapest and I have to agree. My mother, sister and I booked the Trabant tour and family lunch with Andras (at short notice) and had the most amazing day out ever. My mother (in her seventies) was a little alarmed when she first saw the two Trabants that were arranged for us (somehow I imagined we would all be travelling in one - silly me!), but after a few explanations from Andras and his colleagues, she felt completely at ease. We packed a great deal of sight-seeing into the morning tour and Andras even amended it slightly to avoid some stair climbing, which my mother didn't feel able to manage. All the while we had a running commentary of all things Hungarian, from history to politics to cuisine. We stopped off at a lovely, Art Nouveau cafe in the center of town and ended up at Andras' parents' house for a delicious Hungarian lunch. Even though his mother didn't speak any English and his father's English was limited, we had a marvellous time and loved the feeling of getting to know some real Hungarian people. We also had a quick shot of traditional plum brandy, which just about shut down my nervous system. An acquired taste for sure!Spurred on by the success of our first tour, we ordered another tour later in the week to Szentendere and Viesgrad and this time our tour guide was Atila. This was another fabulous day out. Atila is a font of knowledge on all manner of things and we enjoyed getting to know him and chatting through the day. He was a joy to be with and nothing was too much trouble for him, as he tried to work out which area would have the best view and where the clouds might be. We even saw some storks on their nest (first time for me). I felt very sorry when the day was over and we had to say goodbye. If you are in any doubt about what to do in Budapest, look no further than Andras and his team. What a bunch of fantastic young professionals. We will certainly use them again on our next trip to Budapest.

Best thing we did in Budapest. The trabant car tour was a truly unique way to see the city and our driver, Balazs was very passionate about his car. His family collects them and he even does stunt driving! Andras showed us the layout of the city so that we were able to go back and revisit certain places such as the Szenchenyi Baths and the Great Market Hall. Lunch at Andras house was so much fun. We met two other ladies on vacation who also spoke English. Andras mother and father did not speak much english but they were very kind and genuine and his mother was kind enough to cook me a whole separate meal simply because I am vegetarian. By doing the lunch we got to see an area just outside the city we would have never gone to by ourselves. Andras was very accommodating with my grandmothers needs and even adjusted the price of our tour when she opted out of some things even though we had booked them in advance. He clearly trusts his customers alot. It was very refreshing to speak to a Hungarian tour guide who knew so much about his country and also a hunger to learn about me and my country. Attila took us to Szentendre and even though it was snowing all day we had a good time with him because he told great stories and made us laugh. He too seemed eager to engage in conversation and not just spit facts at us. We saw a wild boar! We went to Lake Balaton and Istvandy winery, both of which were beautiful even in the snow. Daniel, who greeted us at the winery, was warm and inviting. He was very casual and funny. We had an absolutely amazing meal (again I was specially treated with a wonderful risotto dish because of my vegetarianism) cooked by his girlfriend Czilla. Their guesthouse was in a pretty rural town and was absolutely luxurious. I only wish we could have stayed there a few more days! I will never forget our tour with mypersonalbudapest and I know my grandmother feels the same. It was as if, only after a short while, Andras, Balazs, Atilla and Daniel were old friends that we were visiting. I would highly recommend Mypersonalbudapest as a necessity when visiting Budapest even if you know the city very well.

The best day of our 16 day vacation!. I would highly suggest a Trabant Tour with Andras in the morning and the wine tour to finish the day. In spite of the snow, we had a fantastic tour of Budapest and all of the important sights and ended the day at the Hernyak Vineyard. The wine was fantastic and the hosts were warm and so welcoming on a cold snowy afternoon. My husband, my 20-year old daughter and I all agreed that it was the best day of our travels through Prague, Budapest, Paris and London. Don't miss out!!!

Trabant Tour that you will always remember. Last week my partner and myself took a combination of the Trabant-Tour and the Hidden Treasures Tour organized by Andras and our Trabant driver, Balazs from My Personal Budapest. It was an amazing experience for me because our family had a Trabant very long time ago (so I had some flash backs...) and for my partner, too, because he has not yet seen a Trabant from the inside, not even speaking about riding one. We were picked up by Balazs and Andras at our hotel and were driven to interesting locations in the city, that we knew very little about. Budapest has so many hidden corners and even for someone who speaks Hungarian and lived there for years (many years ago) it is very hard to keep up with all the happenings, new places and old / hidden treasures.We wholeheartedly can recommend this fun tour to anyone - even to locals! - who prefer to get true insider knowledge by excellent local guides, who love what they do. What we appreciated the most was really the mix of the places we visited that were off the beaten path and of course the sweet Trabant, that Balazs (owner of a Trabant collection) has proudly showed to us - the highlight was to have a look at the engine area... very special indeed! :)

A fabulous time. I booked four tours and each one was great. The Trabant tour was so much fun. Balazs was a great guide and we enjoyed touring in his little car. In the afternoon, we went on the Hidden Treasures Tour. We had such a great time seeing different places in Budapest that we normally would not have seen. Balazs was a knowledgeable guide and we enjoyed our conversations with him. I loved the ruined pub and the street market he took us to. The next day I booked the Szentendre tour and the winery. Szentendre was such a lovely town and Andras did a fantastic job showing us around. My husband and daughter had a fun time making pottery and enjoyed talking with owners of the pottery business. Then Andras took us to the winery. We had such a great time. The owners of the winery were such pleasant people and we enjoyed learning more about making wine. They gave us a delicious meal and we sampled their wines. It was excellent. Thank you Andras, Balazs and Balazs for making our trip to Budapest so much fun.

trabant / Budapest. Exelent. Balazs was our guide on this 4 hour trip in Budapest, and we would not like to have any other kind of guided tour in Budapest, than this.
Its the one and only way to enjoy and in the same time learn about the culture. Thank you for 4 very nice hours :o)
Best regard "Bruce" and family

"Loved every minute!". My 18-year-old daughter and I decided to take a side trip to Budapest during a recent stay in Austria, and with only 30 hours in the city, we wanted to really maximize our time. András did a fantastic job customizing our day, which included touring around in a Trabant in the morning, lunching at his parents' house, and spending the afternoon visiting a winery in the countryside outside of the city. He was very professional and prompt in his e-mail communications prior to our arrival, suggesting that we might prefer the winery visit when he learned we are students of wine. We loved riding in the very cool Trabant and found Balázs, the owner/driver, really delightful company. It was a treat to be able to get out and walk around at our various stops in Buda and Pest and not have to worry about parking! We got kind of attached to that little car and were sad to see it drive off when that part of our tour was over. Lunch with András's mom and dad was not only really delicious, but the experience satisfied that part of us that loves to get past being tourists and see how people really live. They were so sweet and welcoming! We left feeling we had made new friends despite the language barrier (András was great at translating for us - it was never awkward). We could tell his parents genuinely enjoy meeting and feeding András's guests. Our trip out to Etyek to visit the Hernyák winery was of particular interest to us, as we got to see the Hungarian countryside and taste Hungarian wines with the winemaker. The meat and cheese plate we were served there was a tasty ending to our day. As András drove us back to Budapest to the train station, we asked him to help with our Hungarian wine pronunciation. Now that's a video! András is a warm, open, flexible, knowledgeable, interested and interesting guide with a fun sense of humor - a super companion for the day. We were very well taken care of, and will definitely tour with him again the next time we are able to get to Budapest!

Personal guide in Budapest. We had two days in Budapest, first day we had planned to spend with Andras. Andras took us to all major sights and hidden sites in Budapest. We had a great lunch at his parents house. His mum prepared a excellent hungarian dishes. It was a personal touch to the tour. We would certainly recommend Andras as a excellent tour guide. We thank him and his family to make the trip a very memorable one.

Worth It!. We just toured with András on Sunday and had a great time. He was very communicative over email when we were arranging the date of our excursion and what we wanted to do. The tour is really as advertised, customized and personalized. We started the day off with the Hidden Treasures tour. Got to see part of the old ghetto wall, an old aristocratic home and even walked around on the buda side. Some of the hidden treasures were unfortunately not available to us because of the weather but András did a great job of improvising.Then we stopped for lunch with his lovely parents! His mom made the BEST hungarian goulash as one of our courses! So glad she made it for us as I would have left Budapest without having tasted the best goulash in town! His dad is super sweet! Overall I have to say having lunch with them was one of my favourite experiences on the tour. We then went to a small winery a few minutes out side of the city and met a really lovely family and tasted many good wines. Again, it was a very small winery but the quality of the wine was really quite good! And because they are so small something you would not have access to outside of Budapest. Really it would have been a missed experienced had we not added the wine package to the tour. Overall the day was well spent getting to know Budapest like a local! Also loved getting a little bit outside of the city and seeing one of the smaller towns where the winery was. Thank you so much to Andras! You honestly made our trip. Thank you for accommodating us on a Sunday as well! We will definitely come to see you again when we are back in your lovely country!

Really personal tourguides!. I would really recommend this company. They are very personal and dynamic. The places were interesting, special and not boring at all. If you would like to have something that is not usual try out this company.

The BEST introduction to Budapest!. We only had a day in Budapest, but Andras planned an ambitious combination of the major sights(in a Trabant, actually in two Trabants) and hidden Budapest, plus a lunch. Everything was flawless. Our main guide was Attila, and our drivers, Balazc(the cars owner) and Josef. We laughed, we learned, we feasted and we want to spend more time in this beautiful city with these wonderful people!

Good quick trip. set this trip up last minute but even with very little planning we had a good trip saw all of the major attractions and had the personal touch that is always nice. I recommend completely!

Hidden Treasures Tour. I opted for the Hidden Treasures tour with Andras. The sun was a welcome surprise during mid February, and we spent a wondrous morning wandering through the smaller courtyards and streets of Budapest. Andras was very accommodating, catering to my interests in literature and the arts by introducing Hungarian authors at a bookstore. It was an invaluable experience to converse with Andras, who was able to add more depth to my understanding of this wonderful city.

My Personal Budapest - Trabant Tour - Absolutely Fantastic. Just got back from an amazing mini-break in Budapest - such a beautiful city. Saw My Personal Budapest recommended on tripadvisor and decided to book the trabant tour for our very first morning. My partner and I spent a good three and a half hours with András (guide) and Balázs (driver) touring around Budapest and seeing the main sights - not to mention getting some stunning photos! It is a superb way to see the city - not only is it different (the trabant cars are really something!) but it also serves as a great introduction; the rest of your trip becomes much easier to plan. You know where everything is, and you know what you want to go back to. I could not recommend this activity highly enough - András and Balázs are lovely (their passion for their city and country knows no bounds, and the sheer extent of their knowledge is just incredible); it's very reasonably priced; and it's definitely something to remember and talk about for years to come. The MyPersonalBudapest website is very user-friendly, András responds to any and all requests quickly and efficiently, and they pick you up from your hotel and drop you in a place of your choosing. If you pick one 'tour' to embark upon in Budapest, make it this one. We will definitely use them when we go again and would recommend them to anybody and everybody. Thank you András and Balázs for showing us your wonderful city - we'll be back! Helen and Dan.

Something different. Informative and unique tour of the city whilst being driven around in a piece of history. Especially good if the weather is bad! (like it was with us). Lots of interesting facts that only a private tour unearths. Thank you

A great guided tour.. Recently returned from a super visit to Budapest. My wife and I spent a whole day with Andras who runs private tours of the city. Despite snow arriving on the day of our planned tour he contacted us at the hotel in good time to suggest some re-arrangements due to the conditions. This did not adversely affect our day, which was very informative, entertaining and done at a good pace with many good stop off points. As part of the tour we did his "hidden Budapest" and he was able to take us to places we would probably not have found on our own. We also took advantage of his somewhat unique experience of lunch at his family home and a chance to meet his parents which was a delight and something we will long remember. You can book tours with Andras with confidence of a professional service from a very knowledgable young man who understands and speaks English very well. Keep up the good work Andras and thank you.Ray and Janet

Best way to see Budapest. We HIGHLY recommend My Personal Budapest.We took two days of tours with Andras.We felt like an old friend was showing us his city.The first day was the Trabant tour. Even natives of Budapest would come and look at this cute interesting car when we stopped. Balázs, our driver and owner of the car was also a pleasure to be with. We were taken to sites on both the Pest and Buda sides of the city. During the drive and at each stop we had interesting explanations of the what we were seeing. The next day we took a combination culinary and Hidden Treasures tour (did I mention how Andras customizes his tours so you get to see what you want). We really felt like we were seeing the true Budapest as we had breakfast and lunch in wonderful local restaurants. We strolled large avenues and then little alleys, seeing parts of Budapest that I bet are not seen by other tourists . Andras took care of everything including the meals, desserts and daylong Metro passes.Both Balázs and Andras love their city, show it off beautifully.Too bad each city doesn't have an Andras!!

My Personal Budapest. We were recommended to use My Personal Budapest and definitely it was the best tour choice we could make.We did the Trabant tour and had lunch in a Hungarian home. I can recommend both to anyone who is interested in a different way to see this beautiful city.Our tour guide was Attila with his driver, both are really nice guys, and had lunch together with Andras. If you are looking for a rare type of tour, book My Personal Budapest.Looking forward for our return do Budapest, so we can book the others tours.

Trabant City Tour - Truly Fantastic!. We had a first trip to Budapest in August 2012 & found the Trabant City Tour through Trip Advisor. Andras our guide meet us at our hotel with the owner & driver of the Trabant, Balazs. Andras & Balazs were both delightful - Andras full of information about Budapest & Balazs full of information about the great love of his life - the Trabant! With the 4 of us squashed into this great little car we toured all the major sites, Gellert Baths, Castle District, Chain Bridge, Houses of Paliament, Liberty Square, Szechenyi Baths, Vajdahunyad Castle, Heroes Square & then finished with a meal at a restaurant recommended by Andras that was a 5min walk back to our hotel. We highly recommend Andras as a tour guide & the Trabant Tour for something really unique & fun.

A definite must for visitors to Budapest!. On our first full day in Budapest, we took a wonderful Trabant tour with Andras. He picked us up from our rented apartment and whisked us away to the Castle. We had never been to Budapest before and this was a fantastic introduction. Andras' tour was full of interesting and personal stories that highlighted the rich history of Budapest. He was extremely knowledgeable about the city and its history. We were able to pick out the attractions we wanted to return to and really planned our entire visit based on what we saw on the tour. Andras went out of his way to ensure that we saw as much as we wanted and really got a feel for the city. Riding in the trabants was an unexpected treasure. It was such a unique experience and I loved the quizzical and excited stares from onlookers. I really felt like we were a part of the city riding around town in the small cars. My favorite part of the tour was the hidden treasures Andras brought us to. Beautiful panoramic views and coffee house gems are just a few of the unknown attractions Andras showed us. We were fortunate enough to be able to have lunch with Andras' parents. I cannot fully describe what a wonderful experience this was. His parents graciously welcomed us into their home and cooked us a huge and delicious traditional Hungarian meal. It was hands down the best meal we had in Budapest. The language barrier was forgotten as we toasted together and told each other about ourselves, with Andras translating of course. This is an absolute must for anyone visiting Budapest! We are frequent travelers to Europe and have never been on such a great tour before. Andras really personalizes the tour and makes this foreign city feel like a home away from home. I highly recommend Andras' tour and would go on it again!

A more personal tour of Budapest. We engaged Andras for 2 tours. The day of our arrival in Budapest, Andras met us at our hotel and took the 2 of us for a tour to a winery. Our host was charming and the experience was delightful. It was fun to have Andras available to answer all our questions.The following day Andras and 4 of us took the Hidden Treasures tour. It was a long, but fascinating look at Budapest-----lots of walking and public transportation. We really felt we had a great feel for this beautiful city. I would highly recommend his services

Great Tour, Great Guide. Just returned from a short stay in Budapest and one of the highlights was the Hidden Treasures tour with Balazas as our guide. We had been to Budapest before but we we didn't really see those small things that only a local could know. It was very clear that Balazas was very passionate about his city and his enthusiasm really came through which made the tour even more enjoyable. I can't recommend the tour and Balazas enough.

Fantastic Tour!. After ending a Viking river cruise in Budapest we stayed two extra days to really explore the city. We booked the Trabant Tour and the Hidden Treasures Tour for Sunday December 9. We realized that most "attractions" would be closed, and were fine with that as we normally do not go into museums etc., and are more interested in architecture and out of the way places. Our guide, Attila, was excellent and ensured that we saw as much of the city as possible. His knowledge of the various areas and places was excellent, and we really enjoyed the day. Viking booked us into the Budapest Hilton near the Castle, and Atilla picked us up at 9am for the morning Trabant tour. After seeing many sights we finished the tour at noon, and had lunch at a "all you can eat/drink" buffet restaurant. It was excellent with great food! Then it was off on the Hidden Treasures tour. There was some driving to various locations followed by short walks. One of the highlights was seeing one of the cities "ruin bars". Very eclectic and interesting, you simply must visit one during your stay!
Great choice for a team building. Andras organized us a team event with Hungarian dance lesson+ dinner.Everything worked perfectly: on time, interesting with a great amount of fun.Highly recommended!

Trabant tour - highly recommended :-) Book with Andras. I had a half day tour with András and Balazas in a Trabant - They were on time and collected and dropped my back at my hotel Its a great way to see the sights and get the lie of the city Firstly this was Balazas own car and he is Engineering Student who collects / restores Trabant and has genuine knowledge and love for these little cars - not just a job, but a hobby! Andras is a very likeable fellow and his English is excellent. He has a excellent knowledge of history of the cityHis approach is personal and he actually adjusted the tour to take in sights i had not already seen. He also then took me a to local market and introduced me to some local snacks a sort of savoury doughnut with sour cream and cheese and it was much tastier than it sounds touring in the Trabant took me back to my 1st visit when it was still behind the Iron Curtain Thanks guys and good luck with your business Martin

Super private tours for a family!. At the end of october, beginning of november we visited Budapest for around one week.We have a 10 year old daughter and she was enjoying it a lot !Andrass showed us a lot of nice places, not only in Budapest but also around the city. For example a nice "winemaker family " and a wonderfull couple that both are ceramic artists.They gave us a introduction in how to make a beautifull ceramic piece, this especially was very pleasant for our daughter, she could try to make something herself. You could not have these opportunity without somebody as Andrass, he knows a lot of interesting people .Thanks to him , we also had the honour to meet a famous piano artist, he gave us a wonderfull private concert in his Budapest appartment.We, as a family, will remember this trip for the rest of our lives, it was beautiful and very special.... this was certainly the work of Andrass.

Never received a response!. These tours looked so great and I was so looking forward to making a booking. I sent a message to the email address given. I received the first response about 30 days later. Emails were exchanged and Andras asked me to narrow down my choices because he said that he would not be able to price all that I requested as it would take too long. It seemed a little odd but I was willing to give him the benefit of the doubt (wouldn't anyone want a lot of business?). Our trip was planned for the end of Oct 2012 and I can't imagine that time would be too busy. I received no further correspondence despite sending a follow-up message. This was very disappointing.None-the-less, we really enjoyed our visit to Budapest and we did and saw as much as we could fit in during our nine day stay.

Trabant tour and perfect day in Budapest. We had the best day in Budapest with Balazas and his friend Paul in the Trabant car. What fun and the car was such an attraction in the city. People were always looking and waving at us the cute colorful little car. It was a real experience. Our guide was outstanding we saw all the top sights and learned alot while there. We then were dropped off at a restaurant of our choosing then walked to the wonderful market and made our way back to our riverboat. What an exceptional day and our guide and the car made it that much more special. A day we will never forget.Thank you so much! Frank &b Michelle Thompson October 2012

ronvinson. We were staying outside of Budapest and used the train. Because of a mechanical problem, we were shifted to a different train and arrived at a different station approx 2 hrs. late. We called Andras and he then adjusted our sightseeing to fit to time we had. He was very accommadating and the meal at his parents home was truley a treat. The sights we were shown were wonderful and I'm sure not available for the larger groups. I would highly recommend MyPersonalBudapest to those travelers wanting a personal, in depth look at what are the "hidden treasures of Budapest".

What a Great Tour and Guide....... Our guide Attila Kiss, made us feel he was a friend showing us around his city. He went beyondwhat most tour guides would show you to make sure you had a good time! You could also tellhe was very proud of this Fantastic City Budapest! I you need a tour guide this young man isan excellent choice ,very knowlegable and ready to answer any questions .Thanks Attila and Thanks MyPersonalBudapest !

Fantastic!. We spent two days with Andras and they were the highlight of our week in Budapest. He was knowledgeable, friendly and fantastic tour guide. The first day we went on a culinary tour of Budapest and saw many hidden treasures - nothing we would have seen on our own and definitely worth the time. The second day we drove to Lake Balaton, saw the hermit houses in the hills and had a late lunch at a vineyard. Amazing!!!! We would without hesitation recommend this to everyone!

one word-AMAZING. we had one of the best tour days ever with andras. He was willing to go on a new adventure and helped us research our heritage in the small village of banhorvati. We dined in the local castle, explored our great grandfather's baptism records at the local church, and overall created great memories. We also had a budapest tour with hidden treasures, must sees, and a winery our second day with atilla which was also great and informative. Highly recommend

The Best Way To See The Real Budapest. On the second day of our trip to Budapest we booked a Trabant tour with Balázs. The tour lasted for 3.5 hours and was absolutely fantastic. We saw all the sights of Budapest and many sights which we would never have seen ourselves. Balázs was very knowledgeable and answered all our questions. The tour was personal and Balázs took us to all the places we asked to see. Driving around in the Trabant was a real fun experience and it was great to see the sights in an iconic car. Both myself and my partner agreed that the tour was the highlight of our trip to Budapest and would recommend it to anyone. Thanks Balázs and MyPersonalBudapest

One-of-a-Kind Personal Tour. Our recent week in Budapest was enhanced by 2 days we spent with Andras, and we know we saw many things we would have missed without his guidance. The first full day, we did the Trabant tour, with Janos driving, and saw many beautiful places we could never have gotten to on our own. Then, we went to Andras' parents' home for a delicious home-cooked meal. I wish I could stay with his mom for a while and learn how to cook the way she does! The day was capped off with a private recital in the apartment of Adam Filegi. My husband and I are both musicians, and really appreciated the opportunity for such an intimate performance. Mr. Filegi is very friendly and an excellent pianist.It is very rare in any city to have the opportunity to visit people in their homes, and we got two visits in one day. On another day, we did the hidden treasures of Budapest, with many places we had never heard of, even with all of the pre-trip reading we did. Especially moving was the little piece of the wall of the Jewish Ghetto. Then, we went into the wine country for a private tasting. It was such a treat to be in the countryside on an autumn day and look out at the vineyards, then head inside the Hernyak Winery for some delicious wine and light snacks. The family who run the winery were friendly, and we learned a lot about how wine is produced. I know a lot of people think they can find everything on the internet, and that private guides are beyond their budget, but I would argue that every forint we spent was worth it. Budapest is a very large city, and it takes a personal guide to figure out the logistics and organize tours to make perfect days like the 2 days we spent with Andras. He is very popular, so if you are interested, you should contact him as soon as you know your dates.

next time, a 2 wheels trabant trip!. my wife and I had a wonderful day in Budapest. Fortunately, we booked a full day tour featuring a trabant tour during the morning (which we truly loved) and during the afternoon we ran after the hidden treasuries in Budapest. The trabant driver was excellent (it was very hard for me to remember his name) since he tried to drive as calmly as possible despite the horrible traffic in Budapest. During the afternoon we had the chance to visit a number of wonderful places which we wouldn't had visited otherwise (the best were the ruin bars). Our guide, Attila, was great as his english was pretty good and he showed a very good knowledge about every place we visited.I hope to have the change to visit Hungary again and take another tour from MyPersonalBudapest.Cheers

Fun and Educational Excursion!. It was my first trip to Europe and I read such great reviews on Tripadvisor about this tour. We had Attila Kiss for our guide and he was a perfect fit. He was very friendly and knowledgeable about Budapest. We started off with the Trabant tour. I felt like more of a tour attraction with all the looks and pictures taken of us. Saw great sites and pictureous views around the city. The ride alone was a great time. Then Attila took us to a great Hungarian buffet, so we could taste numerous Hungarian dishes. Great suggestion Attila! ;-) Then it was off to the "Hidden Treasures of Budapest" portion of the tour. We took the subway, bus and walked all over the wonderful city learning the interesting history. Took us on a private tour of a mansion via a good friend of his with a kind heart. Learned so much of the WWII and Communist history that it opened my eyes to so much more sadness and terror that once bled through the streets of this city. I thank Tripadvisor for such a great recommendation and I thank Attila Kiss for such a great tour. Will look you up again when I come back. Thanks

Awesome Day!!. We spent an awesome day with Attila today. Driving the Trabant was Balazs who owns the car and is a very good driver. He is also very knowledgeable about the history of the Trabant. We learned much from him today. The day began with a driving tour up to the Fishermans Bastion. Spectacular architecture and views of Budapest...pronounced Budapesht...from there we drove across Chain Bridge around the Parliament building. Gorgeous! Many stops along the way to take advantage of the picture opportunities. Attila has a very keen sense of good photographs...he has an artistic flair and helped us capture true Budapest. We met Gisela and George who prepared a fantastic Hungarian lunch for us in their home. They made us feel like we were family. Very warm people! Lots of laughs! We then returned to the city and began our walking tour. There are many hidden treasures within Budapest that we would never had seen without our very knowledgable guide. If you are coming to this beautiful city do yourself a favour and look up My Personal Budapest. You will not be disappointed.

The best way to visit Budapest in two days. Andras provides the perfect way to see Budapest and the Danube Bend in two days. For the first day, we took the Trabant tour of the city. The Trabant is a Soviet era car that was manufactured in East Germany. It is very rare in Budapest today, and wherever we went, we felt like rock stars with people flocking around the little cars and taking photos. Andras rode in one of the two cars and communicated with the other via radio as we toured many of the important sites of this beautiful city, the Paris of the East. The two men who drove the cars were great also. One of them does trick driving shows in his car and will be glad to share the YouTube videos he has made. The day concluded wonderfully at the house of Andras's parents where we enjoyed a delicious traditional Hungarian meal prepared by his parents in their home; like Andras they are very gracious and personable, and we learned so much about life in Hungary today and in the past. In a short time we feel that we made friends for life.On the second day, Andras drove us to three towns on the Danube bend north of Budapest: Esztergom, Visegrad and Szentendre . These towns contain much of the history, culture and beauty of Hungary. We took the one-hour boat ride back to the city from Szentendre.Andras is a wonderful young man and through his eyes and guidance you will learn first hand about his city and its life. His tour is very deserving of its number one rating on Trip Advisor.

Must see Budapest with Andras. We booked Andras on our last day in Budapest, we thought we've seen most sights, and we wanted to go light and perhaps some off the beaten tracks away from tourists. This day became our most memorable day, Andras' tour is not a tour, it is an experience, and a truly unique one. Andras took time to find out where we've visited, so we would not visit the same place. Bringing us to the backlanes of Jewish Quarters, toured a historic bathhouse, enjoyed the best coffee at a grand cafe that was once a casino, rounding off this perfectly paced tour with a home cooked lunch that beat the best of Budapest restaurants. Any friends/readers thinking of Budapest in a day, you won't be disappointed.

True to its name--very personal and we felt right at home.. True to its name--Andras' tour is very personal. You'll feel right at home with him as your tour guide. My family of 5 just got back from a holiday in Budapest. We all had such a wonderful time. Since we were traveling with elderly parents and my 4-yr old son, we especially requested him to make sure we don't do too much walking so he drove us around in a private van and made sure our special requests were met. He was so nice and we appreciate his warm hospitality. I highly recommend his tour!

Our most wonderful travel experience ever!. My husband and I took the day site seeing tour with hidden treasures on September 14 and we are still talking about it to everyone we know! It was the highlight of our 10 day European trip. Atilla was our personal guide. He was wonderful!! Atilla was so knowledgeable and professional. We felt very comfortable with him, therefore, it seemed like we had know him for a long time. I noticed he took care of us. For instance, he always stayed by our side. Budapest is a beautiful place, so the personal tour made it easier for us to see so much. We met Andras at his parents home for lunch. What a great family! The food was amazing but the company was even more rewarding. Loved visiting with them. I would go back to Budapest just to see them and Atilla. We will recommend MyPersonalBudapest to everyone! Thank you so much for the experience of a lifetime.

September 22. September 22 is my mothers bithday and it was the date I met Andras. I will never forget either of them. Andras was our personal guide around one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Our day started with the Trabant tour. While waiting for Andras, Boulash (sic) the driver and loving owner of the Trabant explained the intricacies of the 2 stroke engine from the past. In this communist relic we visited all the normal tourist spots. Andras is passionate about his city and has every right to be so. We were able to discuss some historical facts and this seemed to impress Andras and the more he engaged on each and every subject.The second part of the tour was a Hungarian lunch at the home of his parents. This was a highlight of our tour. A lovely couple and in true Hungarian style made us most welcome.In the afternoon we visited sights that the normal tourist would never see. These I will not explain as it would spoil the surprise for those who subsequently take this tour.We took these tours on our first day in Budapest and during the next three days visited attactions pointed out by Andras. MypersonalBudapest tours are great value for money. We are returning to Budapest, probably next year and will again use Andras.

Extra ordinary experience. 25 years ago 7 friends and me visited Budapest as students - in September ´12 we were back again, and of course we had to make a guided tour in Trabants. It was an Extra ordinary good experience, and especially due to Andras skills as person and guide + the Trabant-loving drivers who really care about their Trabant-jewels.Next time I will definitely go for another trip with Andras !!!!
Visiting present day Budapest with the past.. We had a great day sight-seeing the city in 3 Trabants. Andras has great knowledge about Budapest and the ability to share it in an interesting fashion.

A Great Introduction to Budapest. We booked these guys after reading the great reviews on Tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. The business seems to be run by two friends having a go at setting up their own unique tourist attraction. Our tour guide was Atilla who looked after us for two tours which took up a whole day.We started with a Trabant tour, where you squeeze into a delightful little car and see the all the major sights around Budapest. This would be something to do on your first or second day, as you'll then know where you want to visit again on your own.After lunch we headed off, this time in Atilla's car for a visit to an historic town about an hour out of Budapest. It was great to see a part of Hungary other than just the capital city.The fellows who own this business have an obvious love for their country and love showing it off to tourists. You won't go wrong if you get them to show you around.

Excellent tour with a small child!. This private tour was perfect with my 2 year old. It was comprehensive yet flexible to account for a child's changing needs and moods. Our guide, Atilla was fantastic. He was extremely nice and very knowledgeable. He made our visit to Budapest all the more amazing. I highly recommend the company and Atilla to anyone who is interested in a private tour of Budapest. Thank you, My Personal Budapest!

A great experience!. We booked a full day with Andras via the internet from Australia. He was flexible with our itinerary and prompt with responses. We spent the morning doing the "Trabant Tour." My husband enjoyed everything about the car, even though it was unseasonably hot and no airconditioning! Everytime we were back in the car he was deep in discussion with the very pleasant English speaking driver about "Car things". Andras found a lovely street cafe for lunch and in the afternoon we did the "Places left out of Guidebooks" tour. We really enjoyed this tour which was a combination of walking and riding on the subway. Andras was both knowledgable and passionate about Budapest and its history. His contacts allowed us into places you would never find on your own. I recommend buying a 24 hour subway pass as we used ours sailing the next day on the Danube River. It was a very pleasant way to spend several hours.
Good wine good food beautiful setting. Nice people and the host were the best. A very pleasant way to spend a few hours. We would highly recommend.

Special view of Budapest and Szentendre. Andras has created a fabulous way to see Budapest from a special perspective that draws your attention to sights you might miss. It was nice to have our own personal tour guide who is willing to show us the sites at a comfortable pace. We combined the Places off the beaten path with the trip to Szentendre. Having a guide who speaks such great English and is so pleasant and flexible makes for a great day of sightseeing. Thank you, Andras!Pam and Bob

Great experience, Attila our tour guide was great!. For a 3 day in Budapest trip with my wife, I contacted MyPersonalBudapest and I'm glad I did.My tour guide was Attila, he is really nice and made sure we had a great experience.We did 3 tours, all great and different: Trabant tour, Danube Bend and Hidden Treasures.Attila speaks perfect English and knows Hungarian and European history, life and culture very well, which gives the tours and places a perfect context. Without this tour we would have never made it to Szentendre (must-visit place), Visegrád (beautiful) or EsztergomHe had great suggestions for lunch/dinner and off-tour activities.Do the Trabant Tour, then the Hidden Treasures on the first day, then the Danube Bend on the 2nd day.

Terrific Trabant. Just back from 3 nights in Budapest. The first morning we took a tour in a Trabant with a driver and guide. We spent 3.5 hours being introduced to the main sights, with opportunities to get out and explore. It was an excellent introduction to this beautiful city. Attila was a knowledgeable and enthusiastic local whio provided fascinating insights into life here, both past and present. A big part of the fun came from being driven around in the charming and quirky trabant.

Andres was awesome.. I was 'binging' searches for personalized tours in one of the cities I most wanted to visit before I died ('bucket list') when I came across a number of videos posted by tour guides for Budapest. I viewed them all, and picked Andras (after spousal approval of this expense). We met him when planned, and spent the entire day exploring Buda, and exploring Pest. And spent a wonderful meal with his family. I'd have to say that his Mom's meal could out-duel or at least come to a draw with any other dining experience we had in Hungary.
