One note - they give you a coverall, but if it is muddy (it was) your cuffs and sleeves will get dirty. They didn't have shoes or Wellies, so our shoes were very dirty but cleaned up ok at home. Overall awesome experience, but as I said not for the feint of heart.
Caving. What a great adventure exploring underneath the streets of budapest for about 3 hours. They made the tour fast pace and fun.
Exciting and fun. If you want to be active in Budapest, this is an awsome thing to do. The guide we had was very funny and made the experience extra special. Please go caving!
It is amazing adventure!. I've never had caving before so I couldn't compare with other places, but the guide was nice and the cave is a good adventure to spend one day at Budapest

DO THIS!. Couldn't recommend enough. Absolutely loved this experience, all the staff are very friendly. We contacted them by e-mail while already in Budapest and they got straight back to us. They were so helpful in the cave, always making sure you were able to do as much as you wanted, and made it so much fun. We sat around in a cave for a while and our guide had us all turn out lights out so we could experience absolute darkness. She then asked if anyone could sing, and when no one volunteered, she proceeded to sing the most beautiful song in Hungarian, and the acoustics in the cave were breathtaking. Once out, they offered to ring a taxi for us also. Great experience.

So much fun!. Found out about this on trip advisor and decided to give it a go because of the good reviews and boy was it worth it! It was really easy to book, contacted the people online and got a really quick response. The organisation was also great, we all met at Nyugati train station and then followed the guide from there. Once we got there, they gave us all the equipment and a quick introduction and off we went! It was great fun crawling and squeezing through the dark caves with our headlights on, quite the adventure. Highly recommend if you are looking for a bit of excitement and something a bit different to do.

Great fun for everyone. We had an amazing time in the cave! Our tour guide - Anna - was super nice and we felt safe at any given moment during the tour. Squeezing through impossibly tight spaces and crawling through tiny tunnels - we had a blast.At the beginning of the tour, you are given overalls, which is great, because you can move freely without worrying about your clothes (nonetheless, I wouldn't wear the best clothes, because there is still a chance of them getting slightly dirty). The cave itself is covered in clay, making it safe to crawl and climb everywhere (I have cut my hands pretty badly in other caves...). Also, there are different options for your tour. Depending on the group, the guide can choose a different route tailored perfectly to the individual requirements (done while on the tour), meaning you could repeat the tour several times without taking the same route twice :)Tip: Bring some hand lotion for afterwards, because your hands will need hydration :)

So fun!. This excursion was so much fun! I'm an slightly experienced caver but my husband was a newbie and he is hooked now! The guide was awesome, fun, and knew her stuff! This was not for the out of shape or claustrophobic, needing to bend, shift, climb, crawl a lot of the 2.5 hours! It was a great experience something different and not a "normal" limestone cave as you'd see in the U.S. They provided suits and helmets, the meeting point is at the 26 bus stop near the train station, they will find you just be patient :) also need 4 single bus passes for each caver.

Highlight of Budapest. I really wanted to trying the Caving under Budapest and didn't know what to expect. It was great fun, scary, thrilling, and exciting. Our guide was so great, encouraging and funny! If you are in Budapest, you'll be crazy not to do it.

Came back with a new hobby. This was incredible. I went with a few people from my hostel, we climbed, scrambled and laughed our way through the cave. The guide was funny and encouraging. We sang Disney songs in the pitch black cave. A highlight of my trip. I have started caving in the UK because of this visit.

Worth a visit and not expesnsive. The best bit is the pitch dark maze! My wife and son clung to me as I walked through pitch dark passages trying to find my way out. good fun and the information on Dracula is very interesting.

Caves under the capital!!!. Budapest is the city of wonders. But it surprised me, that not only beautiful buildings you can find here, but there a beauties of nature too! There are natural caves here, with huge chambers, beautiful trip!

Worth A Look. I was short of enough time to do a proper caving experience and so I chose this, which was a guided tour of 45 minutes in a cave. The guide was very friendly and translated everything he was explaining. It is excellent value for money.

A true caving experience. Caving under Budapest was one of the highlights of my time here. There are two options for the caving tours (both with guides). The first one is a walk through a small section of the cave. The second (the one I did) is a true spelunking experience. It's not easy and you shouldn't expect it to be easy. There is more crawling than walking. You do have to squeeze through some tight spaces. You will probably get a bruise or two from bumping into rocks. However, it is definitely worth it! And, anyone who wants to do it can do it! The only limitations are that you have to be able to handle a couple hours of walking/ crawling. It is an amazing experience! I would highly recommend this caving experience to everyone who wants a little adventure in Budapest!

A definite must in Budapest. A fantastic experience, with a very enthusiastic and friendly tour guide. Thrilling crawl through some tight spots - very enjoyable and satisfying plus a good laugh with friends. Don't be put off by the other reviews saying it's very scary and very strenuous - I never felt claustrophobic and the walking/crawling was certainly not too difficult. Some great sights along the way including experiencing complete darkness and silence. Definitely recommended!

Great introduction to caving for beginners. This was so much fun! A friend and I did the 2-3 hour tour and it was the first caving experience for both of us. I'm in decent shape but not particularly athletic, and this was exciting and challenging at times without being too difficult or uncomfortable. It was like a natural playground! I'm pretty small, but I never got stuck or worried about getting stuck. There are some very tight spaces though. Aditte, our guide, was fantastic and very knowledgeable. We had a small group of only 4 so we were able to move through pretty quickly. It was 50 degrees Fahrenheit that day, which is about what it is in the cave, but we got very hot in the suits they give you. A t-shirt and pants are enough to wear underneath--wear clothes you can sweat in and shoes you don't mind getting dirty!

Best caving experience of my life!. Our guide Luxi was awesome. He tailored the route for our group and it was challenging and fun. He mixed in a good amount of humor into his tour and was extremely knowledgeable about the caves and caving in general. Highly recommend!

An exciting crawl through dark caves. A great way to explore underneath the Buda Hills! You get kitted out with a boiler suit and helmet with head torch, then off you go. A short walk across the road and you arrive at the entrance to the caves. You go down quite a long ladder, next you walk along a shaft area and then your adventure begins! There were some quite tight parts to squeeze through and a few climbs too. Our guide was very informative and told us all about the caves, pointing out intersting rock formations and fossils. We were in the caves for nearly 3 hours! Really good value for money!

Fantastic adventure. Lets start with the warning - you need to be at least moderately fit, agile, have no fear of the dark and not claustrophobic. If you can tick all these boxes I fully recommend this attraction.You will find your self crawling through places you did not think was possible. sliding down rocks on your backside, crawling on your belly and generally having a great adventureThe guide is very knowledgeable and works to build a good team spirit so you help one another through the various stagesDue to the rock type in this area the cave is dry with only a little mud in places and the odd damp area so trainers are idealWe only booked this less than 24 hours before. It is possible to pay by credit card through Paypal or just with cash There is a small cafe at the start point and free toiletTo reach the start point just follow the directions of catching the 65 bus and get of at the fifth stop just after the tennis courts

The "cool" tour under Budapest. I just recommend everybody to learn more about the underground world. This is amaizing to go back millions of years and get some info about how the world developed. The climate is really cool (12 -13 Celcius) and the humidity is really high (in some parts of the tour you'll experience the dripping water effects). This effect and the thermal water movement causes a lot of formations which are very beautiful.
Amazing!. Its a fun activity to do especially with kids.Could be little difficult to find the entrance....it goes by the name Labryinth.

Fantastic experience. It was a lot of fun and adrenaline and I felt that I got stuck many times. It is exhausting and I would have never expected a touristic event to be that hardcore, the warnings that you should not do it if you have any health issues are definitely to be taken serious.But the feeling when you crawl out of there and made it is amazing.

Hangout in the Dungeon!. Went in July, was 40+ degrees outside, so to descend into this gothic feeling world, cool and damp, was the perfect escape! It gave a good history of the ancient Budapest world, I do wish there were a few more attractions below but overall I would definitely recommend it to those who want to step back in time to feel how basic life can feel.

Loved it. My review is for the approximately 3 hr. exploration. It was, in a word, amazing. It was actually more strenuous than I anticipated and I'm a very outdoors/fitness type. I could definitely feel it the next day and had a few minor bumps and bruises. It was totally worth it. Some of the passage spaces were quite small, narrow, or tight fitting. Our guide was great and I learned a lot on the tour. So it was educational, endurance testing, unique, and memorable all at the same time....simply spectacular. A few tips: If you are taking public transportation you eventually need to catch the bus at Kolosy Square. In late Sept 2015 there is a road construction project there, so allow a few extra minutes to navigate that area and be aware of the possibilities of some disruptions in the normal flow of traffic. Secondly, they only accept cash. Thirdly, wear shoes with tread. Hiking type boots are best. Finally, you really do need to be in at least decent shape for the 2.5-3 hr. geological tour. There are ample rest periods, but you've got be able to climb, slide, and crawl a fair amount. I don't say that to dissuade anyone, but if you are mostly sedentary the lack of stamina may make the longer tour very challenging for you. With those caveats and suggestions, I'd say do it! You'll be glad you did!

Flowstone follies. After a short but invigorating uphill walk of about 3km from Novotel Danube we reached the hilly suburb in which the caves lie. There are a number of caves and a few options you can choose as to how many and what degree of excitement and difficulty you can choose. We opted for the main tour of about one hour as my 5-year-old son was with us and we all enjoyed it a lot.The year-round temperature in the caves is 11 Celsius so be sure to take a warm jacket with you. The humidity is also very high and all the surfaces, including all the guide rails for the stairs are wet so make sure to hold tight.The cave itself is nice, with some great formations and the tour guide was knowledgeable, friendly and gave us a nice tour.

Simply Incredible. I cannot recommend this enough. We did this as a recommended day trip from our hostel. And for the 7000 forint it cost, it was well worth it. The tour guide had an outstanding personality that made everyone feel welcome, and he was funny, and enjoyed making sure everyone was enjoying it. He really brought a true passion for caving and introduced it to everyone, ultimately making it the highlight of my time in Budapest.And trust me - you will never understand the term "deafening silence" until you are 50 meters underground in pure, unyielding darkness. It was incredibly invigorating.One warning - do not do if claustrophobic. I am personally not, but it is extremely tight in some places so just keep that in mind. An absolute must-see and must-do.

Extremely fun and an adrenaline rush!. What a wonderfully extreme sport, I cannot stress enough to take on board the recommendations on the caving website to “not take part if you’re overweight or claustrophobic”. Although I had read this information and thought I was mentally prepared, some of the small gaps we had to squeeze through were still surprising. If you think you will enjoy it then I 100% recommended it. For me it was a once in a lifetime experience and I am very glad I did it. I would say that I was close to my physical limits by the end of the two and a half hours and the next day I ached all over! It was worth it as the experience was fantastic. We were provided all the equipment we needed but we did take our own walking boots and I would recommend using walking boots not trainers. Our guide was funny, experienced, informative and confident with his job, he gave me confidence to believe I can do it. We used a taxi to get to the caves but unfortunately he dropped us off at a different cave site, we did manage to walk from there but were nearly late so if you choose to use a taxi make sure you are at the correct caves before the taxi leaves. Lockers were provided for free and there was a toilet in the changing rooms. There was also a café to get snacks and well needed drinks. If you are looking for a unique, physically challenging and an adrenaline rush I highly recommend this activity.

Super Fun and Unique. Amazing, challenging, exhausting, and so much fun! Had a great guide who's name sounded like Salad (sorry for not remembering what it actually is!) who pushed us but also helped us along and kept us in good spirits with great humour and a big smile.

Wonderful! exiting! original!!! to be recommended!!. We were two girlfriends of 50 years old visiting Budapest and we went to visit the Pal volgy cave. It was a wonderful experience!!! fun, exiting, interesting, sportive!! we loved it!! we had a very nice and friendly guide calle Lazlo (sorry for the spelling) and he made the 3 hours tour under 50 meters very funny and attractive. We would recommend this activity, this is a very nice experience. Nathalie and Martine (french toursists)

Active tour of caves. Spent a brilliant morning exploring a small section of the caves under Budapest. Our guide was superb as he really knew his stuff, spoke excellent English and was really informative on all things relating to the caves. Not all that easy to find (two buses out from the city centre) but we were lucky in that our guide met us at the bus station. Booking is through email so try and arrange it a few working days in advance. Definitely recommended even if you've never tried caving and also offers a great location for exploring the nearby national park as a break from city life.

Cave walk in Budapest. I would thoroughly recommend a visit to the caves under Budapest. This cool attraction is an ideal place to visit,getting away from the heat of the day. The caves provide a unique insight into the buildings of Budapest as well as explaining some of the myths. The dark walk should not be missed!

Adventurous Fun. Budapest is famous for its thermal spas & after having experienced one at the Szechenyi ,i wanted to find out the source of all these healthy mineral waters of the deep earth.The legacy of the hot bubbling water coursing under city for over millions of years is that it is carved out of a complex network of caves & caverns which i decided to visit on a guided tour.The meeting point of the Buda hills & the great plain at the Danube river creates a great faultline.This is from where the famed thermal mineral waters spring from.This forms more than 200 caves of which some are open to visitors.I took a guided tour to the Pazvolgyi cave which turned out to be a wonderful adventure.The cave was dark & slippery.The guides were good & a great help in explaining the geo-stratic features always giving a helping hand & egging us on.You have a light on your head so while sometimes crawling you have to be careful & also of the mobile & money in your pockets.We came across beautiful stalgmite & stalcite formations.Definitely worth the visit & very much enjoyed it but avoid if you are claustrophobic or fear the dark.

Awesome experience! Highly recommended!. This experience was actually the best I had in Budapest! It was so hot outside, and then you get into that deep cave, made of clay, cristals and rock. The atmosphere is at the beginning weird and then it gets really adventurous but you never feel scared because the guides were actually amazing. Real guides! They explain everything, from the geological history of the cave to the small stories that happened in it! They help you a lot when it gets hard to climb, putting their hand or knee under your feet to help you. They make you feel comfortable, check on you all the time. there is a room that looks like an amphitheater and they take the time to make you feel the space, loosing and reaching your senses. There also is a surprise honoring a tradition that I won't spoil but that gives this experience a definitely real human dimension! AMAZING

Must do. We joined a group of school children on a trip who were having the tour of the caves in Hungarian however the tour guide happily translated and answered any questions we had. If you are travelling and staying in central Budapest and are relying on public transport to get here be prepared to wait around for buses and do quite a walk up the hill and ensure you have a map to the caves. The tour within the caves has walkways (as long as you don't choose adventurous caving option) this makes it an easy walk with some ladders and steps which can be quite slippy due to the water dripping in the caves, dress quite warm as it can get quite chilly.

Caving in the Buda Hills :). Took a little while to get there and then get in the caves. Be aware that you do need 2 Transfer tickets because you use public transport to get there and back. Transfer tickets are for when you need to change transport halfway in your journey. 1 Transfer ticket gets you 2 tickets which go together and will give you 1 journey, so make sure you get 2 transfer tickets, which is cheaper than getting a whole bunch of singles.The caves were beautiful and the guides were definitely the best part: funny, cautious for your safety, and friendly.Thoroughly enjoyed caving with these guys :)
Interesting. A bit hard to find, but worth a look. It is very dark and quite scary at times, but don't take it too seriously. We enjoyed ourselves. It was a bit chilly in there.

Don't miss out on this!. I cant believe the value here. It was a great tour through real caves. Dont be misled, this wasn't like walking around in caves, this was legitimate caving. Climbing, crawling through very narrow holes, pitch black, dead silent. This was a great adventure for those looking for one, and well worth the money. Frodo was our tour guide and turned out to be an amazing host. Highly recommend.

Caving is cool. We went caving the other day and didn't know what to expect. I was very excited to go here. The caving starts from a small entrance and a long descend from a long ladder. From there, the underground world is beautiful. Sometimes a bit challenging to go through the narrow passages. But that's part of the fun.The light on your head adds a extra dimension to the experience. I really enjoyed the underground 'church' . If you suffer from claustrophobia, don't go in. It is sometimes very narrow. If you don't suffer from claustrophobia, GO HERE! :)

best thing i did in budapest. I was a bit anxious at first as tight spaces are a bit daunting, but the instructors were brilliant and I was soon squeezing through holes that I did think were possible. the instructors spoke really good English which was great because my Hungarian is poor to say the least , and there knowledge of the cave history and and how they were made was impressive. at one point they made us turn off our head torches to experience true darkness. I wont tell you what this is like as I think it should be experienced first hand, but it was definitely a strange feeling. all the equipment supplied and worked which was nice and the travel to and from the caving is easy, as the instructor meets you at the main station in the city. all in all I had a really good

Caving under Budapest . Tomash was an excellent tour guide, with a great easy go happy attitude; whilst also being extremely funny. Great fun would highly recommend to anyone if you're in Budapest and looking for activities!

Excellent cave tour and guide!!. This was one of the best experiences I had in Budapest. Our guide was very friendly and funny! He has been caving for over 15 years. It was so much fun watching him slide and jump through holes the rest of us struggled to crawl through! We also turned our lights out and sat in the dark a few minutes. One of the most beautiful moments of the trip. HIGHLY recommend.

Challenging but fun. We did the 2.5-3 hour caving experience. Me children, 12 and 9, absolutely loved it. The tour guide was very nice and funny and provided some interesting information without being boring. There were times I really thought I wouldn't make through some of the tight crawl spaces, but my guide helped me through. It is pretty physically challenging and involves a good amount of time army crawling, but I am glad I did it. The cave is cool, too, so,it was a nice break from the heat.

Cool experience. It was really cool to do this and not what we expected. Our instructor was funny, involved, interested and good in English. We had to climb through very narrow holes and don't expect a nice path through the caves. It is more climbing and crawling than walking but that is why it is awesome.

Great fun for kids. Fantastic place on the Buda side. We have been there three times over the last 10 years and the kids have been thrilled every time. Remember to try the dark cave without lights - uhhh

Excellent first time experience . This was my first time at this but my friends 2nd and 3rd times. I thought it was scary and tricky at times and so rewarding when you realised that you got thru that little hole! Great fun. It was a wet weather day so this was a perfect activity as it was not weather dependant. Great price and we learnt about the history and formation of the caves. Fun!
Caving fun!. this is must try if you love caving and adventurous tasks , takes a bit of time but we enjoyed throughout. Thanks to Thomas our trip guide for suggesting the caving

Great family experience. This is not for people with a fear of narrow Spaces. One really has to challenge oneself when one goes through some of the very narrow pass-throughs. The underground spaces are interesting but grander is caves elsewhere. My son loved the experience and the fact that he could go through so much more easily

Incredible!. So awesome! Was not expecting it to be so far out, faced my fears and squeezed and wiggled through some tiny gaps to navigate the entire cave system! The guide Frodo was hilarious and super helpful to everyone, had some really good fun with really good people and would highly recommend to anyone staying in Budapest, also if you stay in a hostel in Budapest you can probably get the guide to take you there on public buses from central area like we did by booking through the hostel.

The best way to discover the beauty of Budapest. I had a really awesome time on this tour. You go around following a guide in about 1km of tunnel crawling, jumping and climbing around. I have been through some very tight holes on that tour. It is a little expensive, but I would still recommend it.

Scary and Amazing. Unreal experience! One of the coolest things I have ever done. A lot of tight spaces to get through some of the walls, however we were a small group so he was able to take us through the harder parts of the cave. Definitely worth it, if your in the area and have the opportunity do it! Unless your claustrophobic, I suggest going to one of the caves you are able to walk through.

Amazing but terrifying!. I booked this after reading great reviews, and despite them all saying it was scary and intense I didn't really expect it to be that bad. Once we got there we had to do a lot of waiting around for a big group of people who were travelling Europe together (this was really annoying as it meant we overran by about an hour and a half and missed out dinner reservation). We got our overalls and headtorches and headed into the caves. Our guide was crazy but brilliant, although I did find it hard to keep up at times. Some of the gaps you have to squeeze through look impossible but somehow you have to get through as there is pretty much no option to turn back. This will be no good for anyone who doesn't like the dark or tight spaces. Be careful taking a phone or camera as you will be crawling on your front and using your hands a lot. And you will get dirty!Really worth doing but remember it is not easy!

For travelers with an adventurous streak!. Traveling around with friends in Europe and had to get my adventure on so I split from them for the morning and went caving-DO IT! So fun, active, exciting, and different- love me some castles but sometimes the crowds and heat kinda ruin the experience ya know? Pretty easy to get to by 2 buses from the chain bridge area, awesome guide- fun, knew his geology and ghost stories, tailored the trip to us. So worth the 7000 florints (20$usd). Emailed them the night before, they responded in hrs. Happy caving!

Fun and Challenging. It was really fun to climb around and to bond with new people on the tour. I'd say this tour is best for people who consider themselves strong and nimble, because you'll need to squeeze through a lot of tight places. ...I gave this experience a 4/5 only because my attention span felt a bit under-stimulated after being underground for a couple hours. I hoped that there would be more formations to see, like in the cave tours I'd done in other places! -Overall, very fun, though! :)

Amazing yet physically taxing experience. Amazing yet physically taxing experience. One of the best attractions in budapest. I'm very claustrophobic, so it was a little difficult for me. But the guide was very helpful and kept encouraging us to make it.

Great experience! . Visited with friends. The guide was very enthusiastic and gave us lots of great information during the caving tour. The caving itself was amazing. It was tight in places and wide in other. I would definitely do this again.

Totally surprised. I am 65 and have a bad hip. I chose this activity because I thought it would be like Lurray or Carlsbad caverns in the U.S. Only with views of older cities buried under Budapest.  We met a guide near the train station. He boarded a bus with us and we rode to the area of the caves. We were given jumpsuits and helmets to wear and I was told to let them know if mine fit. We crossed the road to the cave entrance, a little graffiti covered door in the rocky side of a hill. In a little chamber we were given instructions on how to crawl and squeeze through small spaces and what order to go in. I was first behind the guide , my husband behind me. Next were a couple in their forties, one with claustrophobia. After them were about 6 caving enthusiasts in their 20's and in very good physical condition.  We followed the guide down a forty foot ladder then proceeded to crawl, slide on our hind ends slither on our bellies and backs and climb up and down very narrow tunnels of rock. In one spot we had to turn our head sideways so the helmet would fit through. There were small room like openings between the tight tunnels where we could rest and the guide told us about the cave. I figured out after a tight 10 foot tunnel that if I hadn't fit in my jumpsuit, (it was their largest size), I wouldn't have been able to go. I'm a woman's US size14.  We squeezed our way through the tunnels for about two hours pulling and pushing with our fingers and feet in places where it was to tight to bend our knees or elbows. My husband pushed me through the tightest and steepest tunnels. We eventually came to a large room where we could walk around. The rest was a 15 min climb up a medium size tunnel back to the 40 ft ladder and out.  I have never been so far off in imagining what an excursion would be like. Caverns and caves are totally different experiences. I was very proud of myself and also shaking from the exercise but not as proud of the claustrophobic man. I wouldn't do it again but I am glad I did it once. My husband loved it.

Not for the faint hearted. After watching to many horror films ,i really didn't what to expect and there were only a few on the tour ,its a great adventure but be prepared for bruises and knocks ,i didn't think it possible under a major city amazing

What an adventure . Who knew you could do caving under Budapest and have so much fun? We did the adventure caving with Lazlo and he is so full of energy even though he's been doing it for such a long time. He'll find the smallest hole for you to crawl and you'll be surprised you could actually fit in without getting stuck! We also got some educational lesson from him regarding the cave so he will give you some time to rest while he does the talking. Some areas are more difficult but if you listen to him he'll give you tips on positions and it's so much better. What a sense of accomplishment for that sandwich crawl!

Amazing adventure. This is definitely an adventure you will not forget for a long time! Or for the week following as your bruises and aches heal. It's an amazing experience to venture into these caves with expertly trained guides who will occasionally dash past you as if they are spider men and women. The cave is nice and cool but I would still suggest wearing light clothing because the caving suit isn't very breathable. This is also an activity for the athletic and fit. Not only is it strenuous but the holes which you will need to fit through are very tiny. I am overweight and got stuck for a moment, as did people smaller than me. Not recommend for those who are obese.

Laughs and a workout 40 metres under Budapest!. Definitely recommend this adventure caving tour- our guide Edith was knowledgeable and had a great sense of humour. We were caving novices but the reviews here helped us prepare- wear shoes with a firm grip, your clothes and shoes will get muddy so use older ones, follow the explicit directions in the email confirmation they send you as this is about 50 minutes outside of downtown Budapest and you need to change buses to get there. All in all, a great workout squirming through tiny gaps, climbing and crawling 40 metres under the city. If you aren't claustrophobic, I'd highly recommend this experience!

Palaces and Castles. Budapest is a lovely city to walk around. There are great shops and restaurants, as well as magnificent palaces and hiking trails (on the Pest side of the river). A bus tour and a boat tour are great ways to become oriented to it. There are also wonderful day trips available outside of the city

Exhilarating Day!!. So glad we did it!! Booked thru Viator, very convenient meeting place, near giant mall,catching local buses with guides easy and nice way to get to meet other cavers. Caving seems to attract a very interesting, well traveled group. Went with teen daughters 14&18. I was a bit worried that I might not be able to handle the claustrophobia part-- It was close, but the guides are well seasoned. Ours, Lottie, was funny, charming and could recognize a little panic in my eyes- he had me follow after him on the difficult= narrow "squeeze throughs", I definitely challenged myself which feels great for a 50+ mom. We had 9 travelers in our group- all fun and interesting (and relatively thin) The guides choose cave trail depending the size of the group's participants. The cave has trails with assorted size opening. Don't worry you won't get stuck! We came prepared with sweat shirts, no need, guide said tee shirts were fine- the exertion warms you up. Sneakers are a must.We stored our belongings (including all jewelry) in lockers and were safe. Carried phone/ camera, glad I did. You are given a hard hat with light and sturdy coveralls, make sure they are not tight as you really need to move in them. Take a little Ibuprofen before you go to bed, we all were a little sore next day-WELL WORTH THE EXPERIENCE!When we left we went to the bus stop on the road, caught bus #65 down the hill to the bus turn around. Across the street you'll find a good pizza, pasta, salad place called VAPIANO, great choice, self service, indoor or patio seating. Right around corner is the street you take back to the Mall.

EXCELLENT. visiting the caves in Budapest and did the underground caving! IT WAS BRILLIANT!!may make you feel a little claustrophobic however once you overcome that it is indeed a laugh.Requires team work but great sport a bundle of laughs!

Great Experience. This wasn't something we came to Budapest thinking we were going to do but it was so much fun! We've never been caving before but the guides made it really enjoyable and we felt very safe with them. Make sure you wear comfortable clothing and shoes (preferably something older that can get a bit dirty). Also I wouldn't recommend this if you are claustrophobic because some parts of the cave that you climb through you wouldn't think it would be possible for a person to fit through! But if you're up for an adventure I would definitely recommend this, it was such a great experience!

Fun experience!. Having never tried caving before, I was initially a little bit afraid to join this activity. However it turned out to be a super fun experience which I would recommend to anyone who is up for a bit of adventure and doesn't mind a little bit of muscle pain and bruises the next day! If you're not someone who is very fit you might find it a little bit difficult, but you'll be pushed out of your comfort zone and the adrenaline rush that you get once you enter the cave keeps you going. Here are some little tips:-the tour starts off with a 10m long ladder down into the cave, which looks pretty scary but you'll be instructed to hold on very tightly.-parts of the cave are very, very slippery. wear shoes with a good grip!-our tour started off quite slow but eventually we were told to speed up at the end, which was quite tiring.-after the tour you'll have the chance to rest in this little cafe close to the changing rooms, so bring some cash to buy some drinks and food!
Great. The guide was really experienced and well-prepared. It was a really good opportunity, if you have time, you shouldn't miss it!

Fantastic. If you are looking for something a little out of the ordinary to do in Budapest this is it. There are a few tight spots and if you are a beginner you will be taken out of your comfort zone. Our guide was really knowledgeable and very funny. Would certainly recommend following this up with a trip to the thermal baths to sooth an aching body.

Highly recommend checking this out!!!. Unreal experience!! Highly recommend checking this out. The tour guide was amazing. Super funny and knowledgeable. Pushes you out of your comfort zone just enough. Even one girl on our trip was very uncomfortable, so the tour guide knew an alternative route to take her back.

Amazing hangover cure. It was my stag do so as you can imagine I was a little rough that morning. Within minutes of being in the cave my hangover disappeared. Maybe fear at first. Taking a look at the small gap we had to fit through. After the first one fear changed to fun. It was an absolutely awesome experience that I would thoroughly recommend. Lottie was a fantastic guide through out. He had an amazing memory for names. With 16 of us all in the same suits he referred to us by name every time. Test him out. He was also full of knowledge and humour and made you feel safe at all times. A must do of in Budapest.

Amazing!. If you are into adventure and do not have any physical ailments, I recommend doing the longer (2-3 hour) tour over the other tour. There is one tour where you walk along a paved path and there are lights illuminating the cave-don't do this one. For the other one there is no paved path and the only light is from your headlamps. So a fun experience and our guide was great!From Budapest, you can get to the caves by public transportation and one of the buses (I forget which one) will take you right to the entrance of the caves, so no need to get a taxi or Uber.

Exhilirating Experience. I decided to go a little outside of my comfort zone and do the Caving Adventure. I was a solo traveler but didn't want that to stop me and I'm glad it didn't. Great experience. Ditto on things below. Few things I would note:The site indicates that it is 10 degrees Celsius which I took to mean dress warm. In fact they encourage you just to wear like a tshirt and pants under your overall b/c you are working hard in there so you have no problem keeping warm.There is a locker room with lockers but they are not individually locked, they just lock the entire room. So I would recommend not bringing anything of too much value.Definitely not for the faint-hearted but you can do this if you are fit, even if you've never caved before, the guides are very good. I would definitely do it again and the fee is reasonable (7000 HUF which is around 25 EUR). Is a bit of a annoyance getting out there, but it is DEFINITELY worth it. One of my favorite experiences from Budapest! Also, if you will be doing any of the Baths, plan that for the day after this to relax afterwards!

Awesome caving adventure. Fantastic spelunking adventure with our guide "frodo." He basically left us speechless doing parkor moves throughout the caves, but ensured we were safe and having fun every step of the way. Highlight was turning off our headlamps and sharing a meaningful conversation in the darkness, sounds weird, but was really cool with 10 strangers from all over the world. Turns out our minds co strict images in the darkness. You've got about 3 hours before you lose your mind!

Amazing experience, one in a lifetime. There are 2 different sections of these caves, one is made for a simple guided walking tour, on a concrete path, but the one I did was a english guided caving tour where each one have his own overall suit, helmet and led light and can explore for 3 hours the complex system of the caves under the city, you will be asked to climb, slide and crawl, according the itinerary that your guide will choose for you according to the size and fitness of the group you're in. The guide was so funny, he speaks a perfect and fluent english, alwasy there to help you and profesionally guiding you through this make of complete darkness, which reveals its treasures and beauties one after another as the guide show you how to see them. Some spots were quite hard also for me as a slim guy, but totally doable. The BEST thing I did in Budapest for sure, don't do as some people wrote some review here who went there without getting informed first and visited only the concrete part, without trying this amazing experience, go to their website and book a caving experience before going! Worth it!!!

brilliant!. i didn't even know there were caves in the area! formed back in time by the thermal waters you need to bathe in while you are in Budapest, this is another must do experience in Budapest.On the Buda side of the city, your guide meets you in Pest and takes you out to the national park, where you kit up, meet your fellow cavers and wonder what exactly you have got yourself in for!Soon enough though, you are crawling, squeezing, ducking and sliding through all size gaps and arches in the cave system.A great benefit of doing the tour for me as a solo traveller was meeting people and having the opportunity to work together so everyone could get through some of the trickier spots.the tour takes a couple of hours depending on the speed of the group through some areas, and with the transport you should plan for either your whole morning or evening taken depending on which time you go.but make sure you go!

What an evening!. With a group of 8 people, we descended into the cave......what an adventure! We did the tour in the evening. All in all it took almost 3 hours, of which we were more than 2 hours in the cave. You have to crawl, salsa, squeeze, shift and squirm your way through the cave! The guide is wonderful and we did not feel unsafe at all. Have you had enough of the sights of Budapest above ground???? Go underground!!!!

Squeezing and Sliding!. Caving Under Budapest was one of the highlights of our visit to Budapest. The start of the caves was easy to find as the bus route was very well explained. We had Frodo and his colleague who were fantastic as guides and very enthusiastic about the caves. They were very safety focused and encouraged us to look out for each other. Overall a great experience, very happy to have done the tour.

Challenging and Spectacular. Imagine climbing, crawling, leaping, squeezing, sliding and covering a path of 700 meters in a little over 2 hours. Its a completely different world inside there. One of the best things to do in Budapest with your group of friends. The guides were fun to be with. I'd say it was a great and a definitely worthwhile experience.

MUST DO. We are a group of 6 friends traveling around Europe for a semester and this was one of the best things we've done! Definitely challenging and tested our strength a little bit, but SO rewarding afterwards. Silard made the tour really fun and included some history and other caving information as well. The 2.5 hours flew by. Thank you Silard/Solid! We had an amazing time.Highly, highly recommend this!

SO glad we did this!. I was apprehensive at first but wow I'm so glad I went for it! Truly a once in a lifetime experience... You get completely suited up (thick overall and hard helmet with torches attached) and after a quick briefing you're good to go! We were underground for just over 2 hours but it flew by as we were either on the move or listening to our fab tour guide (Lot-C? Sorry if that's spelt wrong!). You're able to take your phones/cameras down too - there's a pocket on the overall for them - which I recommend because this is an experience you won't want to forget! Such good value for money, it's a must if you're in this city!

Must try in budapest!!. Our friends recommended caving in Budapest to us and we did not regret them a single bit! It was definitely an experience crawling and climbing in the caves and the instructors are really helpful and experience! Definitely a must try!

Amazing experience. My friend and I booked this tour during our weekend stay at Budapest.The caves are quite something else entirely and an experience not to be missed. Needless to say, if your are uncomfortable in tight spaces this might not be the best attraction.The guide was very good, providing interesting information about the caves during our visit and also squeezing in the occasional joke. The tour lasts for approx. 2,5 hours. When you are at the deepest point you are approx. 55 meters below the ground.You may leave personal belongings in cabinets provided by the tour company, however please note that the cabinets are not locked. I would advise against bringing big / clunky or expensive camera equipment with you on this tour, simply due to the fact that there are quite a few narrow passages where crawling is necessary and you might bump you camera equipment into the rock walls. Smaller cameras and GoPros should be okay.Tip: the overalls you will be wearing are water proof and the fabric doesn't really breathe much. You will be quite warm while walking / crouching / climbing through the caves, hence wearing just a t-shirt and a pair of shorts under your overall is a good recommendation. Also, make sure you book this attraction a few days in advance as the available places quickly fill up.
Cool program in Budapest. It was a very adventurous and awesome experience! The guide was very friendly and helpful! It takes a bit time to reach the cave from the city center but it worth!

Great experience, not for the faint hearted.... This was an out of the ordinary experience, one to look back on with a sense of achievement. This is proper caving, crawling around, pushing yourself through tiny holes, climbing up steep muddy slopes. The guide was excellent, kept everyone feeling safe and gappy, with some good and interesting tour guide info.If you are used to or expecting western style health and safety, forget it. If you fall you'll hurt yourself, so don't fall, and you'll be fine. A sense if adventure and slim hips needed.

I could not recommend this more!! The most fun!. I was a little iffy on going caving, I didn't think it would be much, just walking through some caves and what not. That was not the case! I had such a blast caving and would 110% do it again!!Caving is more of an exhilarating, thrilling activity. You definitely need to be in some shape to do it, it is definitely a work out. While caving, you're in the caves awhile but you're having so much fun you don't even know where the time has gone. While caving you're sliding head first, backwards, you're on your side, contorting your body to fit in all these tight spaces and to slide under these rocks to get deep into the cave.I have not laughed so much in such a long time. Just seeing the little spaces you're about to go through makes you laugh because you're literally thinking "how in the world am I about to fit through there?!" and then seeing people try and fit through them is hysterical!On top of that, it's a great way to meet people! Caving is definitely a team effort and I felt like our group connected so much by the time we had finished. No joke, those were the people I ended up spending the rest of my time in Budapest with. Our guide was great, he was so fun to watch, literally running, jumping and sliding with such ease through all these spaces, it's insane. He was so knowledgable too and gave you great information about the caves.I can't stress enough how much you should do this! You will not regret it one bit.

Must do activity -- complete fun. This was an interesting and awesome experience I can say and I would strongly recommend for all. This should b a "must see" list. The guide and crew is friendly and very thrilling experience and the cost is worth and not over charged. One good tip is, carry ur old shoes.. Old cloths..old hand gloves with good grip and use a light weight mobile camera or G-pro cam in caving.

BEST EXPERIENCE EVER!!. Apprehensive at first, I didn't know what to expect regarding caving. Eventually, my friends and I caved in to the idea of doing something out of the norm, and in no way did we regret this decision. Our guide was Fredo, and he must be one of the most outgoing personalities ever! Best experience trying to wriggle through small holes, and climbing up and down clayey structures.

Great way to spend a half day. We only booked this the night before by emailing and getting a response at midnight that we were in. Cost was 6000 forint (AUD28-30) and totally worth it. You can only pay cash when you are there (no credit card) unless you book via a tour operator (more expensive I think).Takes about 45-60 minutes to get there from central Pest side via bus 9 (change at Kolosy Ter) and bus 65 (or 29 from memory).Our guide Mark was really good and engaging. He involved everyone. Lots of walking, talking after descending a tall metal ladder. Not recommended if you are overweight as plenty of tight spots to navigate. Couple of really tight bits, one on your stomach when you inch under a rock formation where you can't look forward ( my partner bailed on this one and went around) and another fab one the size of a birth canal (she made alas I was too wide in the hips).If you are reasonably fit, enjoy a bit of adventure and are claustrophobic then it's pretty good. My partner was a little apprehensive beforehand but enjoyed it.You are provided with overalls ( dusty) and a helmet. You will sweat a little so a tshirt and comfortable pants and shoes are all that's needed. Plus your shoes will get dirty! Can have a snack or beer afterward.Note that there doesn't appear to be a contact phone number.

Fun and challenging experience!. Me and my boyfriend signed up for this, not really knowing what was coming for us - we assumed some walking in caves, possibly some crawling at some points - basically something "everybody" can do. What actually happened was much cooler; you get a helmet and an overall, and are told that there will be a lot of crawling - still thinking this will be nice 'n easy? As you enter the cave - down a long ladder - you walk a little bit, get some introduction and start crawling, squeezing, pushing - it was awesome! At one point we also tested what it was like if we turn all the headlights off, and how to guide each other - really cool! Even though it was challenging physically, you always feel it will be fine as the guides clearly now VERY well what they are doing (as well as being super entertaining), so there is never an actual safety issue.I would however not recommend this if you are very overweight, or not up for some actual caving - forget about a relaxed walk underground; this is much better in my opinion.PS: for booking: book on their website (just email them and make an appointment), and pay cash when you get there - heard it is cheaper than booking otherwise. PSS: slightly pain in the *** getting there, but well worth it - there are buses that stop nearby.

Insane experience!!. Signed up on a whim and was so nervous beforehand. Was a great experience, not sure if I would ever do it again, but it made for one crazy story! Our guide was so cool and the caves are awesome but make no mistake, this is A VERY PHYSICALLY STRENUOUS ACTIVITY. You will be drenched in sweat, out of breath and so sore and bruised afterwards. But it's a once in a lifetime experience! totally recommend this to adventurous travelers who are in good shape!

Quality afternoon. Chose this as an activity for a stag with 10 mates and absolutely loved it. Our guide (Agi) was brilliant and took us on a tour that lasted about 3 hours although we could have easily spent another 3hrs in the caves. Being a group of guys we obviously chose the hardest route around which was physically challenging but totally worth it if you're up for a challenge. There are some seriously tight spots and some tricky climbs, decent shoes are essential to get yourself round, there were a few guys not fond of tight spaces but everyone made it through. The caves themselves are amazing to look at and Agi pointed out fossils on the way which were great to see. This was easily one of the best experiences we had ever had and for 6000 HUF (about £15) would recommend it to anyone looking for an exciting day out in Budapest.

Great experience. You will go places you never thought possible. Excellent and fun trip crawling through holes that you would not have noticed let alone try and get through. Very professional guides, clearly know their stuff and felt very safe. Great time.

Exciting adventure. An excellent adventure under Budapest. The instructors added just the right amount of information to make this exciting trip an educational one as well. If you want the chance to meet other holiday makers and to enjoy their company in a confined space this trip is for you. Not for the obese or unfit.

Fun Tour but you need to be in at least average shape. It was a lot of fun and challenging. It is not a walk in the park. Prepare to crawl in some tight spaces and climb up some areas that you will not think you can climb. The guides were great and helpful and gave options in which path to take. Take a small camera at most as it can get bumped around. You will be sliding on your butt and crawling on your chest to get to certain spots. If you do not like tight spaces, pick something else. Your fee includes overalls and helmet with light.

amazingly unexpected with lots of climbs, crawls, etc..... made a last minute booking with them the day before my tour and i was glad they replied even late at night.tour starts near the cave so have to make my own way over to buda side. took bus 9 from city centre and changing to bus 65 at kolosy square. journey took about 45min to an hour depending on traffic.the meeting point was on the top floor of the building and staircase was located on the left side. did my payment there and changed to the coveralls given. remember to wear comfortable clothing and proper shoes (expect to dirty them) and expect lots of crawling and climbing. leave any bulky items behind as they will be a hindrance during the caving.had a great time with the male guide (sorry i forgot his name). he was really engaging and funny although he has done this for 20 years. we did not expect to be going through such tight spaces. definitely not for the claustrophobic people. expect to be on all fours lying, crawling, climbing, etc.had great fun for 3hrs in a beautiful natural cave. definitely one of the best caving i've done.
Awesome time with great people. I had such a great time, it was a challenge on some parts but its great if you are the athletic type. It was a great experience.

Great fun with friends. It was a fairly simple tour, for people who do not do any sports it might be a work out... The guide was really nice. The group was also very nice, we helped each other out and such. Bonding time with strangers xD

Bit of a work out, lots of fun. This was great fun. It wasn't as challenging as I would have liked, but it's certainly not for the faint hearted. Got to see lots of pretty crystals and rock formations.

Excellent Caving Tour if you like an Adventure. We decided to do the adventure caving tour largely based on the excellent reviews and are so glad we did. We made a reservation easily online via the company website and the company sent us all the information needed including bus routes. You can also get the H5 train to Szepvolgyi Ut and walk up the hill, which is what we chose to do. The caving tour is great fun and I loved crawling, climbing and exploring the cave branch. Our guide was great fun, knowledgeable and very helpful to my partner, who found it a little tougher. Just make sure to wear appropriate shoes and comfortable clothes for under the overalls. Also, just to provide a disclaimer: the tour is quite physically demanding and if you are not keen on tight spaces or getting a bit dusty, then a walking tour may be more suited to you. If, however, you enjoy a bit of adventure then this is an unmissable experience! I absolutely loved it and my partner admitted she had a great time too despite it not being something she would have chosen herself. Thanks for a great experience!

This made my trip!. Budapest was my 3rd European city break in a year and must admit that it was starting to feel a little bit samey...We booked this trip before we left and am very glad that we did, it wasn't advertised anywhere but hostels in-country.Our tour guide was incredibly funny and made us feel safe for the duration of our trip. There are a few small gaps but they aren't as bad as they look and our guide was so funny and relaxed that it took away any worries you may have had about getting stuck!I don't want to give too much away as i think everyone should do this when visiting Budapest. This trip made the break really stand out and made my 2014!
Great Experience. Caving was incredible. It was slightly more tiring than I expected it to be, but our guides were very entertaining and knowledgeable.

A MUST!. This was a great experience. I didn't know how physical it was going to be and I was definitely surprised. This is no wimpy walking cave -- you're army crawling through tight spaces and definitely off the beaten path here. So much fun!!

Best experience yet!. My husband and I have done quite a bit of adventure-like activities whilst abroad, buy I've got to say, this has got to be one of, if not the best experience we've had. Our guide Lotzie kept us all entertained and laughing for the entire tour. The 2 hours absolutely flew.They provide you with overalls to wear so you can just wear some loose trousers and a T-shirt underneath. Everyone just had phone cameras with them. The tour involves quite a lot of crawling through VERY tight crevasses, so if you're claustrophic, you may want to reconsider. But for those who have more of an adventurous streak you will not want to miss this! Highly recommended :)
deep cavern with stalactites. strange feeling being so far under the earth but enjoyed it none the less. went with other Americans after spending time in Russia and Austria

Must in Budapest!. One of the must do things in Budapest - where else can you do a thing like this in a capital city?!It's really practical that the meeting point is in the city center because if i had to find this place on my own, i wouldn't know where to start (as you take two buses) - and it's easy to get back (you need 4 bus tickets!). It also helps that the guide (Lotzie - i really hope i spelled it right! He learned all out names) knows what he's doing and you can basicly see just how experianced he is (through words and actions) - it calms you down a great deal (being in a tight space, meters underground, without an exit even if you're not claustrophobic doesn't make you fell at ease). A lot of interesting information and 3 hours of interesting experiances that i haven't seen anywhere else yet (it's not just a walk on the designated path in the cave or a ride with a train). I think i will defenetly be doing this again the next time i visit (i've been to Budapest a couple of times already and am planing to visit again as it's an amazing city) - i really had a blast!You can also see that they take safety seriously, as it isn't exactly a walk in the park (you have to climb, crawl, duck walk, drag yourself..,) and it is a work out. It's not hard core adrenaline, but it's a really great adventure for most people - i'm not a sporty person, but it was really enjoyable - and defenetly worth the money i paid (which is saying a lot since a lot of places have really high admission and not really that much to see/so to make it worth it).Tip: Don't expect to come out clean out of this (it is "crawling/climbing" in the dirt) so pick some shoes you wouln't mind getting dirty and long fingernails will chip, belive me. It's also hard climbing/crawling/... when you're laughing really hard

Really fun!. I had already been in several caves around the world, including the Glow worm caves in New Zealand, so I didn't expect to be overwhelmingly impressed. However, the staff put on a good adventure for us as we truly had to weave through tight spaces, climb up, down, and around for a few hours. They provided a lot of interesting information along the way. Nothing was too challenging, but did provide for a bit of a workout. It was really quite beautiful and a really fun time!

Awesome Experience. Caving was an amazing experience, my first time and won't be my last. Our tour guide / instructor in the caves (Frodo) was very humorous & friendly. Still aching after a few days so prepare yourself for a good workout ^.^.
good experience. Not a caving fan, but the tour was interesting and fun with the guide, especially in English. I have been to a few caves before and this was a good experience as well.
What an experience!. Not only was the tour superbly fun, it was a fascinating geology lesson too. Our guide Frodo was humorous and spoke brilliant English. It was a good workout!
A very nice experience. I think it would be fun to visit there with children. But there are parts that might be a little scary for them

A challenge but an incredible experience. You know as soon as Lotzie, the energetic guide, locks the 3-inch thick metal door behind you that this isn't for the feint hearted. Crawling through 10 metre long crevices or sitting back in a massive cavern with fossils on the ceiling- this added a totally unique experience to our city break. It was long and at times pretty uncomfortable but made the beer afterwards taste unreal. Worth doing if you fancy more of an adventure than museum-shuffling.

Great Fun and great value .... Myself and partner really enjoyed this underground experience . Its not often you will get the chance for a well guided caving tour for totally inexperienced for such good value for money . I would say it helps to be reasonable physically fit to take part ..... and be prepared to push yourself at times during the tour . We decided to complete this activity towards the end of a 4 day Budapest visit , which I am glad because the next day , boy did I ache !!

Absolutely amazing!. I was a bit sceptical about caving in Budapest. Really, how challenging can be a tourist attraction in the middle of a city? Oh, how wrong I have been!!!The activity is amazing. It is challenging, fun and fascinating. Our guide (whose name I unfortunately can't recall. Which is embarrassing because he managed to remembered all our names) was great. No, even more than great. He was absolutely amazing. He made the experience absolutely unforgettable. I read reviews telling that the organization was not well, i didn't experience that. We arrived on time and started the tour around half an hour later. So, if you like challenges and you are not claustrophobic, this is definitely a must thing to do while in Budapest.

Amazing!!!!. A brilliant experience not to be confused with the labyrinth under castle hill which we didn't do. We paid for a taxi and glad we did as don't think we'd have found it otherwise. Quite physically demanding but loved every minute, so glad we went.

Great tour but needed better management. I had so much fun on this tour! I surprised myself by how I could contort my body to fit through holes that are almost exactly human size. The activity itself could not have been better but it took an eternity to actually enter the caves. We met our guide at 3:45 at Nyugati Station and then we took 2 buses to the base camp where we waited for OVER AN HOUR before we put on our caving equipment and descended into the earth. About 30 people were on our tour at the beginning, but we broke into groups of ten. I think the tour company should have more frequent tours but cap the number of participants in order to speed up the process. I would be easier to pick up ten people in a van than have 30 people take the bus. Overall, it was a great experience but if you are claustrophobic at all or not physically fit then this activity is not for you.

Awesome activity!. A real must do in the city! The caving tour is a 2 1/2 hour guided tour under the city, its challenging, fun and rewarding! You will have to squeeze through gaps you didnt think were possible, for people that are very claustrophobic it would nt be the best idea but to everyone else i guarantee you will have a blast!

nice experience. Never tried such 'entertainment' before but thankfully to my wife we decidet to do it. What's unusual I liked it. A bit scary for me but as the result now we have very nice pictures in our album.

Thrilling underground adventure! . A great activity for action seekers. We had a very enthusiastic guide who made us feel comfortable with squeezing through some very tiny gaps through the caves. We drove and found the location ok but others in our group found it tricky to find by public transport - recommend allowing a little extra time to get there.

Absolute must do. I think this is a bit of a hidden gem as a lot of locals have to heard of it. If you fancy something different then this is a must. The caves run under Budapest and is amazing crawling climbing and squeezing your way through. Our guide lottie was brilliant knows the caves like the back of his hand and loves to crack a joke. Just do it!!!!!!

A nice way to spend the day. We went down the cave today. The guides were fun and spoke perfect English. We had a group of about 20 people down there. It's suitable for all kinds of people, even men and women who are not very sporty. During the harder parts they often suggest easier routes and always assist everybody. Please be aware that your shoes will get dirty so you shouldn't wear your best pare. :-P

Budapest. It was a really fun and exciting time! Something different! U just need a pair of good shoes, coz mine was a runner one and was extremely slippery! The tour leader guys were very nice and caring! Recommended!!

Good fun!. Me and my friend pre-booked this before going out there and are really glad that we did as our accommodation didn't have any details of the caving trip. When we turned up we traveled with about 30 other travelers, mostly backpackers from hostels so if that's where you're staying then I think you'll be fine booking in-country!The only downside with such a large group is that we were waiting around in the cold for our group to get suited and start the tour. However, once we got going - wow! Our guide was fantastic, a real character and made the whole experience fun and not so scary. He was really supportive of those that felt slightly claustrophobic and for those with a more adventurous flair (like me) he was throwing us in with the more difficult route through the caves.Would highly recommend!

Best tour ever!. Never been caving, but had the best time of our lives. We were surprised when we were told that our almost 3 hour long trip had ended. What was great about this tour,beside our guide Szilard, is that he changes the difficulty level based on the groups ability. What a great experience. We are hooked to caving now.

Great fun.. tight squeeze!. WOW! this was fun and a good workout BUT i am a size 12-14 uk and I got stuck in a few places, one of the best things we did in Budapest, we got a taxi here off the train as the walk up the hill would have been quite a way. Overalls are provided but wear old shoes and take old gloves to stop hands from getting too dirty. The caves dont have too many interesting features really but it is the activity that makes it so good.

Great experience. Be careful! This is no cake walk and not for the faint of heart. There is very little room to move around in the caves. You are going through some extremely tight holes. I do not think an obese person would fit as it was a tight squeeze for me. Basically you're crawling / sliding / climbing through an underground labyrinth for 3 hours. I'm generally not claustrophobic but I got pretty scared a few times. There are multiple places where you could easily slip and fall, and break a limb (or even die), and if something were to happen I don't know how you could make it back up to the surface as there is no easy exit. That said, it was also one of the best experiences I've had. It was terrifying at times but also exhilarating. If you're the adventurous type and like to push to the limits of your comfort zone then you will probably love this. Well worth the money (6000 HUF when I went).

One of the most unique experiences ever. Never before have I tried such an attraction. I was going there expecting something more or less ordinary (having visited caves in Greece). But no, this was completely different and you could tell from the first few meters. It is amazing to see how you can get 100+ meters below earth and see what nature can do. It's definitely off beaten track and has been really enjoyable. If you don't mind getting your hands dirty and searching for something different and exciting, then this is trully something you should do. The guides are excellent and do provide lots of info so that you can understand what is happening there.
Nice and interesting. If you have enough time while in Budapest, devote it to caves and a little cave church too...well worthy visiting...

Best thing I've done in Budapest.. A friend and I ended up doing this trip completely by accident, were stuck in Budapest for a couple of extra days and someone recommended caving to us. Didn't know what to expect but ended up being incredibly impressed and challenged! Loved every minute of it, and tour guides were awesome. It was a bit terrifying at times (I was positive I would get stuck and die) but the guides were so knowledgeable and great at what they do that it made you comfortable and motivated to push forward. Would recommend to everyone!

Amazing fun, brilliant guides. The trip was well worth the £15 - for this you get 2-3 hours of caving. The cave is a dry cave and so there is no getting wet, it is about 10 degrees down there so quite comfortable. Sometimes you are squirming through small holes, sometimes shimmying along ledges or just chilling out in caverns, it is all very surreal! Our guide Kata kept offering us the option of taking the hard or easier route and so I would say that this activity is suitable for people of all fitness levels. On the more technical parts Kata was excellent at giving us guidance on how to progress and didn't rush us at all.The cave is really cool, you get to go down to 35m below ground level and Kata was very good at telling us about the formation of the cave and its history.This was such made surreal fun I can't recommend it enough!

Amazing experience. I wasn't sure what to expect from this tour, especially because I hate small spaces! That being said I absolutely loved every second, the tour guide was fantastic and made me feel comfortable with the small spaces & was incredibly humorous and knowledgeable, a must!

Highlight of my trip, also as per others: pack knee pads. Must do. If TL;DR, just remember - do it for sure and bring knee pads. Our guide Kata was helpful, and informative about the caves and rock/clay formation. We stopped to view fossils from when the area was a sea. Kata asked if we would like to cave completely in the dark. We turned all our lights off and in a safe section with no potholes we grabbed onto the foot of the person in front and trusted their advice, while we advised the person behind us of hazards. We were given options regarding side routes and when we ran into another group, deviated away from them. Kata also had a map of the network which she explained to us afterwards. We had a wonderful group who were really helpful, kind and supportive of each other so I was lucky there.Can I say a massive thank you to the reviewer who said "Bring Knee Pads" further down? Because of your review I bought cheap rollerblading knee pads before I left Australia and they were the only reason I had minor bruising only on my knees. Trade off: you will be slightly less flexible and knee pads chafe skin, but nicer than getting your knees banged up. You do a lot of crawling on hands and knees. Definitely not for anyone with a knee injury or a shoulder problem. The bus stop is quite easy to work out, have a good read of bus instructions in their briefing email and all is very clear. It is actually quite quick, perhaps 30 mins if timing is right, to get here from Vaci Utca on the metro, H5 overground and the bus.

Great experience. It was one of the best things I've done. First time I do this type of things and I thoroughly enjoyed it.Our guide was Frodo and he's really cool and has his own funny ways of navigating in the caves.There's a lot of crawling, both with face forwards and foot forwards (reverse crawling, if you wish), pulling yourself up in tight corners and sliding down.While it is not easy for large people (read tall) since you have to switch from legs backwards to forwards in a tight area, it is very much possible as there was a guy almost 2m tall who could do it.My friends didn't like it as much since it's not something you'd expect: it's very demanding and you need to make some weird moves in order to get into holes and out of them, sometimes even crawl on your sides.Your overalls have two pockets: one inside and one outside. You can take your phone/camera but you have to watch out they won't get cracked when you're hitting the floor for some weird crawling. You are allowed to take photos as well but you risk dirtying your equipment since you don't get gloves and it's pretty damn dirty down there. You absolutely have to bring shoes you don't care about because they will get really dirty and muddy at some point (nothing a little bit of water can't fix, but still..)I really recommend this if you are looking for something different and not afraid to try something new and demanding.

Caving under Budapest. This is my 1st caving experience and I really enjoyed it. The climb was manageable. Guide was very considerate to provide both easy & difficult options when going around since we have personnel of different fitness level. Great acoustic underground and it was enchanting with the local songs the guide sang for us. I will definitely recommend for people who want some adventures in Budapest. Recommend good and comfortable shoes that are ready to get dirty, and knee guard (not provided in my tour) for more protection. It is very warm with all the climbing, hence you can go with light clothing. Went for 10am tour, and it started promptly. Reservation is required. Safe enough to bring a small camera, but I just brought my mobile for some pictures along the way.l

great fun but more of a challenge than advertised. loved the crawling, the dirt, the physical exertion, the silence, the tight spaces of the 2.5-hour tour. though i thought to myself on more than one occasion, "this is MUCH harder work than they mentioned on their website." i'd definitely recommend it to budapest visitors, and would also recommend that the website guys and gals add a little more info about what to expect in terms of physical exertion--a great, but tough-at-times adventure.

The day I fell in love with caving. This was my first time caving and all I can say is IT WAS A BLAST!!! The caves and routes taken were fantastics but most importantly, the tour guide (Loti I believe) was fantastic. He was really entertaining and really informative. He kept the tour really interesting by talking about the cave's and country's long and very extensive history and talked us through the entire route. The two and a half hours spend in the caves flew by really quickly and left me begging for more.Definitely a must try for anyone looking for a tinge of adventure in Budapest! Highly recommended!
Unforgettable experience. Recommend to anyone who wants to do some fun activity and enjoy caves sightseeing. And the guide made it very fun!

Amazing introduction to caving. We had an excellent time on the 3.5 hour caving tour! Our guide (Silard??) was great fun and very attentive and knowledgeable. He learned our names quickly (there were about 11 of us!) and would tell us to be careful going through certain parts and then swing himself through like a monkey!! Some parts were pretty scary - I would look and think 'no way am I going to fit through there' (one of our guys DID get stuck too - but it was hilarious with him shouting 'LEFT, RIGHT, SHIMMY, SHIMMY!' as he pulled himself out!!) and there are parts where you have to army crawl your way through, which I found great fun! The climbing back up was the hardest, where the rocks are slippy and you have nothing to hold onto. I got a little stuck at one point because I couldn't get to the top, and our guide was immediately there pulling me up. That was the only part where I needed help!Do be careful with your footing, one of our party fell down and landed on his ankle but as long as you watch your step, you'll be fine. Like I said, the guide was super attentive and always tells you if somewhere is slippery or there's a gap in the ground etc.A lot of fun and we had many laughs! Totally 100% recommend. :)

lots of caves in Budapest.. its a paradis of cave lover in the capitol of hungary .. there is easy and more diifficult caves , also where nobody can go , cause that is a steril lake under budapest .. so lets go discover .

First time caving and definately not the last. When I realized it was a 3 hour tour I thought it would be boring but noooo. It was our first time caving at it is a great way to challenge yourself. At some point I was sure I was stuck for good. I went through places I didn't believe a human could fit lol. The tour guide (Loti I thing) was great. He memorize all our names and was communicating with each one of us all the time. He explained the best way to go through several passes and talked us through when someone was stuck. He also told interesting stories about Budapest and caving. This is a must do and would recommend it to anyone who doesn't suffer from claustrophobia. The bruises over my body remind me to tell about my experience to anyone I meet :)!
amazing. such a great attraction! i would highly recommend this place. Unfortunately many tourists are there but on off days this is excellent experience.
Really boring. In case you really dont have nothing to do with your life u can try it. Boring and expensive. A big NO. And the prices are expensive
Enjoy the middlealter. You are abble to take a tour and have a look in to the life in middlealter, see the city under the city. Try it!

Caving. Great fun. Great guides. The red suits are warmer than the others so if you get cold easily and are given an older thinner suit I suggest wearing more than one layer underneath...was quite cold for half the tour. Otherwise great experience.

Incredible adventure. Didn't know about this prior to arriving in Budapest, but thank you Trip Advisor Reviewers for bringing this to our attention. It was a great experience, worth the money and worth the time. One of us wore hiking boots and the other sneakers, and both worked with equal amount of slipping in spots. Overall great service from Peter who replied to our late night email to Laci (c is pronounced like a t) who was our terrific guide. There were some tight spots, but Laci was great at guiding us through or over. I'm a 43-yr old well-endowed UK 38 and walk/run half marathons, so not super fit or super skinny. So if I can do this, you probably can too. Getting there was a bit of a challenge (we took M2) because the HEV 5 is under construction from Batthyany Ter (Nov 2014) but there is a temp bus to take you to Margit hid then HEV 5 to next stop then 65 bus at Kolosy Ter for 5 stops. Or, you could take the 9 bus to Kolosy Ter and switch to the 65 bus for 5 stops. Definitely heed the reviews about shorts and tee shirts. We are from Florida and not used to cold and we were fine with shorts and tees. We did get a late start due to waiting for a group to arrive, but went the full 2.5 hours.
