Laci was knowledgeable, helpful, and has a sense of humor. Check out the other reviews and website and if you want an out of the ordinary experience in Budapest, go caving.

Tight. 1. Be fit2. Bring your own knee pads3. Have good shoes that don't slip! Trainers etc are not a good choice.There's not much to see in the cave but you'll work every muscle on your body. It's an activity, not a sightseeing.

The highlight of my stay in Budapest . I visited in July and had an excellent time. We were down there for maybe two and a half hours but it felt much longer. They gave us all the necessary protective gear and gave us the necessary safety talk. It was a very active event - lots of squeezing through small gaps - and you will get a bit bruised but it's well worth it.

Simply amazing. This was one of the coolest adventures I have ever experienced. Our guide was amazing, super funny and at the same time absolute professional. You have to try it to understand. Definitely the best part of my stay in Budapest.

Caving!. If you're pretty active and want to see a bit more of Budapest this is a great trip....it's different to anything you'd normally get the opportunity to do and great fun! Our guide was a great laugh and cured any nerves anyone might have...he also looked after everyone so it was possible for everyone to do it. Combined with the city sites this completes a great weekend!

Unique experience - must do in Budapest. I booked this experience for myself and my partner, both 20, before our trip through a booking site called viator. It cost around £20 each person which was great value for money.We met the guide, Laci, by Nyugati Station in Pest at half 1 and got 2 buses to the location in Buda. You need to make sure you have 4 single tickets with you for this as this is not included in the price. Myself and my partner decided to get 24 travel cards instead for convenience and also used them the next day etc. Also, you need to make your way back on your own so pay attention to the buses etc.You are provided with overalls and helmets - I advise to wear trainers. There is also room to leave your stuff in lockers and you can take your phones/cameras down underground with you, but don;t take anything that could get damaged! You are underground for around 2 hours and there are a number of routes you can go underground depending on the groups abilities, wants and needs. Our group decided to go through a particularly challenging route as to really give us the full experience. This is not for the faint hearted and isn't a walk in the park. It really does involve you to squeeze through tight gaps and challenges you to climb and slide on all different rocks and terrain etc. You get a massive adrenaline rush and feel like you really achieve something. Laci is great, one of the best tour guides I've ever had, and he makes sure everyone is ok and that everyone works together as a team. It was informative aswell as exciting and I could not recommend this trip any more - give it a go you'll be surprised at what you can achieve!

Something different!. Had a brilliant time today down in the caves. Our guide Frodo took us down and spent a good few hours crawling through passage ways, sliding down paths and scrambling up other areas. Frodo was great fun and very informative. Felt really safe and looked after at all times. Definately reccomend especially if you fancy a day away from the normal sightseeing activities which are typical of a city holiday or break. Only thing to be aware of is you will get dirty and dusty (all part of the fun) and we both have visible bruising on our forearms, knees and shins from crawling. Well worth it in our eyes though.From the English couple.

Unexpected adventure!. Caving was a super awesome surprise when we got to Budapest. You go for about 2hrs and the guides are fun and informative. Great way to spend an afternoon. I´m a pretty small girl and I had to have a few encouraging conversations with myself. It was around 4000Hun which is around $20. Worth every penny.

Fantastic experience. So Rowland and I were the oldies in the group, but I'd like to think we kept up with the young 'uns,I really, really enjoyed the caving experience. Loti (I know I haven't spelt it properly) was a good, patient and informative guide. His knowledge was excellent although some of his jokes were less so! The crawling, climbing and sliding were challenging but definitely not too difficult for novices, helped by being part of a great group of people. I was disappointed when we came to the end, but pleasantly tired and ready for the cake that Loti recommended.If I had to have a criticism it would be that the meeting point was a bit vague, and time keeping was very 'flexible'. ( we were told to meet at 9.30 complete with the required bus tickets, one group arrived at 9.50 and we then had to go with them to get tickets and breakfast....) I would have found it useful to have known in advance that there were changing rooms and lockers rather than travel there and back in caving suitable clothing.That aside, our caving experience was one of the highlights of our trip to Budapest, and I now want to do some more! Don't hesitate in giving it a go, it is a unique couple of hours,Thank you. Jenny B

Give it a go!. Challenge yourself and see a different side of Budapest. The tour runs to approx. 2.5-3 hours with a group of 10 to 1 guide. With the overalls and helmet provided, you will definitely be climbing and crawling through a few narrow spaces (nb. got through smallest hole ok @ 191cms, male, medium build). Suitable for first timers. Recommend to wear sneakers/trainers as the surface is slippery - clay on limestone (some walking boots didn't grip very well).
Very challenging, but worth it.. I really loved doing this. It was super challenging, but definitely worth it. One of the best things I have ever done.

Nice Change of Pace, Great Adventure. We took the adventurous climbing-crawling tour as opposed to the walking tour out of Pálvölgyi Caves. They provide you with full body overalls and a helmet with light and then you spend about 3 hours guided through the caves. Climbing involves traveling through brief narrow passages and then regrouping in larger areas of the caves. The temperature is a constant 50 degrees so it is great whether it is hot or cold outside. We traveled in groups of about 10 people and it is great for kids as well (~10+ years). We did not see any stalactites, etc. in our tour, but I believe there are some around, but they are protected so that they are not destroyed by the tourists. This was a nice highlight in our time in Budapest. The caves were easily reached by public bus and the cost was a very reasonable.

Out of the ordinary and great fun.. My wife and I met caving xx years ago and were very keen in our day. We were by far the oldest of our group of 12 at 50+ but what great fun, brought back some way distant memories. Cave is slightly unusual in it's development and hence not full of pretty stalactites and mites but quite sporting with climbs and a few narrow spots and slides. Laci ? our guide had a great if slightly mad sense of humour and got the mixed nationality group working well together. Respect to the big guy who managed amazingly well. Such a change from over-eating and way too much culture in rest of city, if you are at all active give it a go,!

Awesome Trip - best part of our visit!. You will not be disappointed on this exciting tour. My son and I booked this tour and we had time of our lives. It is very exciting and challenging for all ages and skill levels. Be prepared to get a bit dirty, and bring change of clothes (shorts and t-shirt) to wear under coveralls. There are lockers in the changing room but they are a bit limited so do not bring large backpacks suitcases etc. The tram/bus system takes you almost to their doorstep, it is a 30-40 min trip from Budapest Centrum.

Super awesome!!. Waaaay more extreme than you would think. It's not a guided tour of some big caves as I expected, it's a physical mystical adventure through tight shafts and deep holes that's more of an adrenaline fuelled workout than a tour.Get involved!
Must Do in Budapest. Great Experience..kinda unique...reach out to hotel or hostel staff and they do all the arrangements for you..usually at no additional cost !!

Number one attraction in BP. This was an absolute ripper of a time, me and my friends went down with Frodo and he was an legend, dude can cave! Loved the little bit of history and challenging myself, not for the fainthearted!
Nice programme we had. Our friends and I enjoy a lot, was a different thing to do on a rain day....we enjoyed a lot and we recommend

Absolute must do. Full-on caving experience, not to be missed. Such a good few hours crawling, squeezing and climbing through the caves under Buda. Defintiely do this. The guides are great, really knowledgable and freindly so make you feel at ease. Gets very tigth at points so be prepared, but make sure you give it a go. Only a bus ride out of the city too.

Stuck!. Our guide, Aggie, was great. This was definitely adventure caving, not a sedate stroll. I would caution that at age 47, I felt the experience in every muscle of my body the next day (on the flight home). My son, who is 6'4, got stuck in a small passage at one point, but we managed to get him free. Very exciting. However, you should definitely check to make sure your size won't impede you.

Great fun :D. Went being pretty sure I'd be scared but had a really wonderful time. The guides are so friendly and make you feel very safe - the environment is also very well planned and I felt confident I was in safe hands. A fair warning to anyone who is big or broad - I'm quite small, but even I had some trouble fitting through the gaps. There is a lot of crawling, sometimes on your belly, and if you are even a little claustrophobic it's quite spooky moving through tiny gaps (though they are always very brief and you can see the person in front of you). A super adventure and nothing quite like it, definitely for thrill seekers :) I would have given it 5 out of 5 if I wasn't just a little bit scared and relieved to be out at the end!

Most Exhillerating Experience in Budapest. This is an absolute must, going down in to the caves and pushing yourself through spaces you didn't know you could fit through, or for the more claustrophobic there are other routes you can choose from. The guides were brilliant and i would definitely do it again!
CAVING BUDA. THIS IS BRILLIANT. Would recommend to anyone unless you do not enjoy dark, damp and small spaces for 2-3 hours. It's a great challenge. Avoid if hungover!
Fun and weird. If you like exploring and are not claustrophobic you'll have fun. The caves are dark without signs. It's a Labyrinth.

Awesome Adventure. A must for anyone looking for something different and exciting. Our guide, Szilard Regos, was absolutely brilliant, funny and informative. He went out of his way to learn everyone's names and put us all at ease.Some of the spaces are very tight, but nothing to be worried about, often these spaces were very short. The caves are 10 degrees, which you would think would be a little cold, but we just needed t-shirts and trousers under the provided overalls. We took knee pads, but did not need them. The three hours flew by and it was so much fun and we were grinning from ear to ear throughout the trip.Absolutely must do this trip!!

If you're up for something different - do this!. I was recommended by friends to join this cave tour in Budapest. I really had no idea what I was in for and it turned out I was in for a fascinating ride. 2.5hrs of sliding, crawling and exploring fascinating caves. Our guide was also great. He was quirky, fun and enthusiastic whilst still keeping an eye on the progress and confidence of all in our group. Any geology/cave questions you have will be comprehensively answered by the end of the tour too! If you go to Budapest and you're up for a bit of adventure....Just do this tour. One of the highlights of my entire backpacking trip!

disappointed. This is a real adventure with tight places , do not go if you are claustrophobic. We spent 2-3 hours under the ground with our guide Sellard who is a real cave explorer. He was informative with lot of knowledge about the caves and geology of Budapest. My girlfriend booked through an online travel agent Vatior and we were so disappointed because others payd on the spot much less. Ok, the caving itself worth for the money but if you want to pay less try to find a cheaper travel agent. The cave is located 40 min from Pest side, easy to access by bus.

Amazing adventure. Nestled within the Buda hills these beautiful caves offer excitement and mystery for those who choose to venture into the woods and descend the 10 meter ladder to the system's entrance - the chapel. Our guide, Helga, showed us through the complex and winding caves, making sure everyone was safe but giving them the freedom to explore and take their time when climbing, squeezing and admiring. The information Helga provided was engaging, as she managed to answer all questions and explain both geological aspects, as well as the myths and history of the caves. At times it was necessary to crawl, squeeze, and pull your way though crevices and tunnels; which may have made some people uncomfortable, but for me only added to excitement and mystery of the tour. The two and a half hours we spend in the caves were amazing, coming back to the surface felt unnatural and strangely sad. Once above ground I realized the experience had ignited a desire to further explore the world which lay beneath me, and I have since booked to go caving back home in England! I couldn't recommend this tour highly enough, it is very easy to get to by bus from central Budapest, the guides are friendly and knowledgeable, and the caves satisfy the need for adventure which exists within us all. After the caves we returned to Budapest via bus, when departing the 65/65A back to central Buda (where the connection from Pest station is), be sure to visit Istvanffi - a vegan burger bar, with delicious and affordable food (ceasar salad burger with chips - 550 fornits) which is mouthwatering for herbivors and carnivores alike!

Small spaces... Big adventure.. I can't believe such a thrilling adventure sport takes place so close to the city. Just a short bus ride away and you feel as if you have been transported into another world. Prepare to challenge and manipulate your body in ways you didn't think possible as you work your way through small crevices and tunnels. The guides however will totally put your mind at ease and are excellent at communicating the best way to get through small spaces. Great that they give you overalls but prepare to wear shoes you won't mind getting dirty. Plan your visit to the thermal baths the day after as you will definitely leave a bit banged up and bruised. Despite the bruised knees I couldn't stop talking about how awesome caving was for the next week. Must do on your trip to Budapest and a great alternative activity if you touring Eruope for a long time and have seen a few too many pretty churches.

Best thing to do in Budapest. I read the trip advisor reviews last time I came and missed it. This time I was for sure not going to miss out, the positive reviews kept mounting which is why I wanted to give it a crack. Our guide Laci was as good as the reviews say, he met us at the train station and guided us to the caves, it might be a bit of jerking around getting the tickets for the two buses but this is how the price is so good. There was about 26 of us with three guides, we were in the third group which was outside the usual pub crawlers and I thank Laci for that. He gave us a full brief at the meeting point so we knew exactly what to expect. They give you overalls and flash light helmets, I wore jogging shorts and a t- shirt under and I was sweating while caving. The overalls are clean and the helmets and lights are quality. We went at the 3.30 pm time, it makes no matter the time as its in the dark anyway. They have lockers so you can lock away your valuables. I took a small video camera and it fixed in the pocket if the coveralls. I would suggest that you arrive in long pants and a sweater or jacket to wear at the end because your shirt in the cave will get sweaty. Laci was very informative and funny, he knew many things about the caves and points out many areas of interest, I suggest you pay attention and you might learn something. The caves are quite challenging if you have never done it, you go at least 50 meters under the ground and its stomach crawling and climbing, Laci takes you on the road which is suitable to your capability. Inside the caves we were at least 2.5 hrs, it's dark and humid but so exciting and untouched. I recommend you get into this your before the masses. I went with my girlfriend and we both loved it. I can't say enough about our guide Laci he really made the trip excellent for everybody.

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. Wasn't my first caving experience, but definitely was the best one. Cave system is just what it needs to be fun and suitable for almost everyone, and the guide was really fun and informative. A must-do if you've got even a trace of adventurism. :)

Love Caving in Budapest :). This is so fun! Definitely the highlight of my Budapest trip. I didn't expect that I'm capable of doing it. Felt like giving up at the beginning. Some areas especially the very small cave openings are so tight and very challenging but our guide was excellent. With lots of crawling, climbing, wiggling ... we've done it in the end and it's the best feeling ever. We were lucky we were with a great group. I will definitely rate this activity 10/10 and will recommend it to my friends!

Amazing experience, would recommend to everyone. The caves were awesome and the guides were helpful, informative and funny. If you're looking for an experience that can't be properly described by words or pictures, then this is the place for you.
Pics > reality. Saw a brochure thought it was going to be great and ended up very disappointed. Price is pretty high and the experience not very exciting.

I survived... And would return. I went with my college age son and his friend. Being twice as old as the rest of the college age group (any other 50 year olds out there?) I thought I was doomed. Thanks to Lotsi I survived. He makes the experience fun with his jokes and information about spelunking. If you are in relatively good shape you can do this, with a few bruises. They are well organized. The information on the web site is accurate. Hey, this was very interesting and fun! If you like adventure and have and afternoon then go.
To recommend!. I really enjoyed the tour! We had really funny tour guide, who had also a big knowledge about the cave. 3 hours of fun!

caving is awesome. Never did anything like it and never been a very nature's person. At first I thought it was just walking around through some rocks, nothing very major, but it turned out to be unexpectedly fun. If someone had told what we would be doing I probably would say no. I usually don't like getting dirty, but there it was super fun, adventurous, fresh and amazing. At some point I could recall some movie images while passing through little holes that made me feel awesome. There was a place that lazi, our guide, called the sandwich, which was the most scary but also the most thrilling. I thought i was going to be stuck there. I crawled, slided, climbed, got a lot of dirt on me, and would do it again.

This is serious. I thought this was going to be a kinda shuffle the tourist through kind of cave. It is not, be prepared to wiggle through tiny holes in relative darkness. It is an awesome and unique experience, but plan on getting dirty, a little sore, and spending a lot of time here. Most unique tour I have done in a while.
I loved this!. This was great! It was the right challenge level. You do exert yourself but that's the whole point of it. If you are looking for something different this is definitely for you.

Lars was great!. And he deserves a 5-star. As our guide, he could tell who needed the most help! Our group was made up of a very nice Finnish gal, two 45-50+ ladies and 5 twenty yr old. He knew who needed the most attention and lined us up accordingly. Being one of the 45-50+, I appreciate that very much. Yes, we took the more challenging route and his technique definitely got us through safe and sound. I suggest anyone who's going make your reservation early. We made ours 3 days prior but we did not get a confirmation till that morning of the adventure. BTW, the temp in the cave is 50F and while it sounds cold, it is really comfortable to wear shorts and short sleeves under the overalls you are provided with. Yes, be prepared for bruises but it's worth every minute.
Do not miss it!. While you are in Budapest and have the time, do not miss to try this out!Perfect way of spendig your free time, nice people and amazing places.

Really impressed.. After reading reviews on tripadvisor we decided to give caving a go, and I'm so glad we did. It is well worth the money for a 3hour guide which was really interesting. Our guide spoke good English and was very helpful and funny. There were a lot of people booked onto our morning trip so they split us into two groups which I was thankful with so our group only had around 10 people in it. Would definitely recommend it as was one of the best things we did in Budapest!

Wonderful experience. We took the 3 hour tour. The whole thing was amazing. The location is on the edge of the city, and it is very beautiful. We got to the caves and started the descent in the morning. Our group was small and our guide was really good! We passed through many corridors, each named after a specific feature in it. The lowest room was 40 meters below ground. This activity requires you to be fit as you have to crawl through tight holes. Because of the consistency of the rock and the fact that the caves were carved with water, there is a lot of wet clay which at spots can be slippery and may also cause problems to those with breathing difficulties.
The darkside. My daughter and I really enjoyed these atmospheric caves. We also visited the Hospital in the rocks which was well worth a visit.

amazing!! great activity highly recommend. loved every minute. our guide was Szilard whos been caving for years as a hobby and as his job. he is great, tells you heaps of little bits of info about the caves. you always feel really safe even though some parts of it are quite tight and challenging to get through (you are asked as a group whether you would prefer an easier route or a tougher one, i recommend the tough one as we did it and it wasnt even that hard) would definitely do it again and definitely recommend to others too.

Incredible caving experience. We visitied the Pál-völgyi cave system and had an absolutely great time. The guide was funny, the cave was amazing and we learnt a whole lot. I did a somewhat similar caving thing a while ago but compared to this one, the other was just plain boring.Some parts of the route are (naturally) quite physically challenging and some are really narrow. I mean REALLY narrow- we surely got our fair deal of bruised elbows and knees. :)But I would not want to have missed it. A truly unique and great experience. If you visit Budapest, make sure to take the time to visit the cave! And as for the bruises: Budapest has lots of great thermal baths ;)
O-ho!. Really worth visiting - the feeling of a long and big history is everywhere. It's very easy to imagine oneself lost in there or mounted or caged by the ruler :)

Something Different. Maybe a little hokey but was a fun diversion from all the historical monuments & military history. One section involved walking through complete darkness as in complete sensory deprivation - a challenge.

Awesome first caving experience and incredible value!. I had never done caving before but this experience has made me want to try it out again! It was an incredible experience - we were taken down in a group of 8 people with a very friendly guide who was clearly a very experienced caver. Her relaxed and calm attitude throughout the trip made the whole thing all the more enjoyable - some people at the start seemed a bit nervous but after the first few minutes everyone was having a great time. Near the end of our trip we all turned our lights off and she told us a few incredible stories of her passed caving experiences which was great! The darkness down there is profound, it was a truly surreal experience as you never really get to experience total darkness anywhere else!The trip itself was fairly active but everyone coped fine. You need to be able to navigate around rocks and support your body in tight spaces. It's definitely a challenge but this makes the experience all the more rewarding! There are some veryyyy tight crawl spaces that were very daunting at first but everyone made it through and the 'adrenaline high' is great!Since we were stuck down the cave with a group of 6 other travelers we inevitably became great friends with them by the end of the 3 hours! We ended up all going out for drinks afterwards and have since meet up with a couple of them in London! Everyone was friendly and I'd highly recommended this trip for everyone, from solo travelers to couples and larger friend groups.

Really cool (if scary) thing to do in Budapest. So glad I decided to go caving under Budapest - it was quite physically tiring, and some of the spaces we had to fit through were incredibly small..but it was a really great experience! Tour guide was interesting, friendly and had a good sense of humour, which made it all the more enjoyable. Be prepared to get a little dirty and spend a lot of time on your hands and knees!

Caving - a must do if you have not yet tried it.. I went caving in Budapest, the whole experience was amazing. They took us into the caves deep under the ground, we turned off our lights ... it was pitch black! If i was there on my own, it would have been very surreal and lonesome! One individual in the group i was in nearly made a huge rock collapse onto my back, I had to give him a talking to.. complete idiot! but it was awesome :), A little journey from the city centre, but it was well worth it!!

Really nice attraction. . The best attraction in Budapest. It's a must go to. The instructor was really nice and caving itself is more fun then you think. It's a bit challenging physically, but I am out of shape and I made it and really enjoyed it.

Super cool caving adventure. We came here with a large group of all ages. Some of us decided to do the caving adventure, where you have to crawl and slide. It was an amazing experience, very informative, little bit strenuous. But the good thing is that they offer a chill walking tour for those who don't want to do the extreme caving :) Loved it! Go visit!

If adventurous, MUST DO!. Physically demanding. If you are ok with sweating a bit and are not claustrophobic, it's amazing. The coolest thing I have done in Budapest. Bring a gopro and enjoy the awesome tour/guide. So much fun!!

Amazing. Its one of those attractions that talking about it just doesnt do it justice.Getting into the caves with all the gear required at your disposal takes all the think work out of it for you. The guides are wacky and funny as hell, make sure you take in everything that they have to say and show. Take a chance to stop and sing inside the caves too, so much fun.

Amazing!. I love spelunking and had heard amazing things about caving in Budapest. I was definitely not disappointed! The guides were amazing and the caving system was out of this world. For a small fee the staff provides you with any equipment you will need, and lockers are available if you need them. Overall I highly recommend this to any outdoor lover visiting the area!

Could have been a great time. I am an outdoor enthusiast-rock climb, ice climb-do lots of adventures. This adventure was what I was most excited about in my trip to Budapest-but it just didn't work out so well.Here are some FYIs to make your experience better:1. The start time they give you is just a 'guess' at best. We arrived at 10 for our outing and were suppose to start at 10:30 but it was well after 11 before we even got our coveralls on. We had a car service picking us up and it cost a lot to be so late-we didn't get done until almost 2. So know that they run late and times are really just a suggestion.2. When I emailed I asked if I could pay in Euro-they responded "yes". However when I got there the guides said no-lucky for us we went downstairs and a man exchanged for us. I understand if they don't want to take Euro but they need to be upfront and honest-we would have been stuck.3. I had forgotten my knee pads (my fault)and asked for some-they acted like they didn't have them, although I could see a tub. Finally our guide (who was really great) said I could have them. You are crawling a lot-so bring knee pads.4. The description of the event doesn't really tell you what it is like-my friend is not active and has never done this type of thing and based on the description I thought she would be OK but it is actually VERY physical and she really struggled at the end. When they say you need to be fit-they mean it. You also have to be comfortable crawling and going through very tight places.5. Shoes-the floor of the cave is clay and quite slippery-you need traction. the site just says don't wear heals or flip flops-what you really need is shoes with good traction to help minimize the possibility of slipping.6. Bring a case for your camera to protect it and also the clay dust will get in everything. They have lockers for you but no locks. All our stuff was OK but I would not bring any valuables to this location. You are sliding on your butt a lot and crawling so anything (phone) in your pockets will take a pounding.7. You start out the adventure descending down a long ladder-FYI. You also climb up it. This is an unique experience and if you are use to do these type of physical adventures you are OK.

Bloody Brilliant. I learned that there is an easy version and adventurous version. If you are reasonably fit don't shy away from the challenge - it was the best bit of my holiday. Great value for the experience. There are no lockable lockers but it was very safe and the building is locked. Also you will certainly work up an appetite. Make sure you eat first.

Best of Budapest. This was the coolest thing I did on my trip to Budapest! Our guide brought us all around the caves for about 3 hours, making us go through all the smallest nooks and crannies. We felt like real cavers! I would recommend doing this to anyone who is moderately fit and not afraid to get a little dirty. Great experience.

Get your "thrill" fix in Budapest. This adventure was very fulfilling, tons of climbing, crawling, crouching throughout these small places. This is not for the faint of heart, however, I believe the guide will make the trip easier if the group needs it. Our group chose the hardest path, and we did not regret it. Very fun, challenging, and something I'll never forget. The actual caves themselves have no spectacular formations with the exception of certain rocks looking like things... however, this is an adventure and you'll get an adventure. Our tour guide was Annie (I believe) and she was a very good tour guide to the cosmos.

Awesome caving adventure. We went caving for 2 and a half hours and it was amazing! Such a cool, off the beaten path thing to do outside of Budapest. A good way to get out of the city and do something different. All the guides were really cool, energetic, and know tons about caves and the geology of the area. You squeeze through tiny little spaces while wearing full overalls, a helmet, and a headlamp. Definitely need to be athletic and adventurous. DO THIS while in Budapest!
Great place to visit. The trip under city was fantastic! It's really worth to see it.Don't forget to visit the museum, where the hospital was run during the war.

Intense Urban Caving. Everybody that travels to Budapest needs to go Caving! I've never been caving before so did not know what to expect but our entire group all had a good laugh adventuring through the dark caves and squeezing through the tight corners. Easily one of the best outdoor adventures I have done anywhere in the world! What are you waiting for? Book it now!!!

Unforgettable!!!!. Didn't know what to expect but I'm so glad I did it! The tour guide was amazing and so friendly! I had a slight freak out while I was in the cave but our tour guide helped me through it all!! I would 100% do it again! Thank you!!!!!!!
fun tour. great experience walking and climbing in the caves under budapest. did both the short and the adventure tour - highly recommended

Unforgettable experience. My partner took me caving during my visit to Budapest. We booked in advance which is recommended as the tours fill up fast. We arrived on time for the tour but because of the amount of ppl the changing room space and the equipment we started late. I would recommend wearing old and lose clothing long sleeves shirts as the caves receive little heat and it can be nippy. Also if you have grip gloves or hiking shoes bring them along for two reasons you get very dirty climbing around and some of the surfaces are moist, with the wrong shoes you may find it difficult to get a good grip. Zoli our guide was a treasure. He was encouraging, calm, highly knowledgable and witty. We had so much fun and were astonished at how easy it all was. Make sure you bring cash to pay as there are no machines available on site. Happy caving.

Great fun!. Two friends and I went caving during a trip to Budapest in the summer and had the most amazing time, it was definitely a highlight of the trip. It was so much more adventurous and exciting than we had expected and great value for money. I would advise anyone planning to go to wear robust footwear, we had plimsoles and felt very ill prepared. The guide was brilliant and the group size (of about 10) felt perfect. All of the bruises and achey muscles were worth it - I can't praise this experience highly enough and will certainly be returning!

Bruised but happy. Very adventurous and fun definitely go to the spa afterwards as it will ease out the aches and pains, I am 50+ so don't be put off if older you only live once! A very informative and entertaining guide!

Definitely a great experience. We can highly recommend the caving adventure tour to anyone in good physical condition. It's great fun and our guide lazlo was very funny and made us feel comfortable all the time.
So if you don't mind some bruises from the small passages you are crawling through you will for sure have a good 2,5 hours down in the caves.

Hard work but amazing fun. I don't think you would get caving like this in England! The guide made us feel safe and he certainly knew the caves back to front. He definitely made the trip a lot more fun and interested and was clearly very passionate about caving. Maybe less stories about people being trapped in caves though!I had a lot of fun although it was hard work at times, involving crawling and dragging ourselves through spaces not much bigger than our bodies! The equipment provided was good and keeps you fairly warm in the caves, I enjoyed having a little head light (as the only light in the caves!)It is fairly easy to get to although based outside of the city centre and we met them right in the city to get the buses out. The staff are really helpful and really nice and this was a very different and fun start to our stay in Budapest.

Worth it, even for someone with Claustrophobia.. I found out about these caving tours while googling fun stuff to do while in Budapest. I love walking through caves, but was initially put off when I realised it'd involved squeezing through tiny spaces. My boyfriend seemed very up for it however when I mentioned in conversation so I decided to be brave and just go for it, I am really glad I did!We had Laszlo (or Latsi? I wish I could spell his nickname :D) as our guide. He said he'd been exploring these caves for 19 years, guiding in them for 12, and knew them like the back of his hand. It was very reassuring how confident and cheerful he was, and he kept giving us helpful instructions to help us get through the harder parts of the tour. Anyone who is a bit nervous should know the guides make you feel very safe, He suggested we took the harder route (decided by people's size and abilities) and as my group agreed. This made me a little nervous at first as while I am not big I don't work out at all...but we all kept up just fine! Laszlo also made a real effort to learn all our names and chat with us all which was really nice. I should point out that the more difficult parts of the tour are only 2-3 metres long max, so if you aren't fond of small spaces it's nice to know they don't go on for ages!The caves were really fun to explore, me and my boyfriend both had an awesome time despite my apprehensions and are really glad we did it! My joints ached a bit the next day but that's nothing I can't live with. Thanks to Laszlo and Caving under Budapest for a brilliant experience :)

unique experience. very unique experience , just like exploring the underground tunnel network of a busy city , never tried something similiar before , wonder if you can get something like this else where ?

Amazing unique experience. Had an excellent time with Cave Under Budapest! Our guide was great, cracking jokes along the way, but always making sure we felt comfortable. I am quite claustrophobic, and Ill be 100% honest, there were some times where I felt slightly overwhelmed, however whenever we had to crawl through tight spaces, I could see a bigger part of the cave through an opening, so that made me power through it. Our guide also told us he alters the path depending on the group he has (ie people who are bigger). It was definitely one of the coolest ways to conquer a fear of mine, and I would recommend it to friends and family :)
must visi it. very excitic place you have to visi is. Me and my family was visited it it was a very good experience. we will never forget it

AMAZING!. I was a little nervous about this at first and when the guide started talking about taking us on the more difficult route i started to wonder if i had made the right decision in coming along.I did. It was hands down the most amazing experience!Parts of the route are rather tight squeezes and you have to commando crawl through and twist up on your side, but it's just so much fun!I'm a fairly small woman but there were some decent sized guys in my group and they had no trouble fitting through some of the tight spots.The guide will meet you at a big bus stop to help you get out there, theres at least two buses and it could get confusing.If you're nervous about caving I suggest you go along and have a go anyway, it ended up being the highlight of my trip!

Great fun!. This was my first time caving and it exceeded all expectations I had! I felt completely safe the whole time and the guide was fantastic in telling us about the caves and also having fun too! Would highly recommend this, if I go back to Budapest il be sure to go again!

A great afternoon. A great and different way to spend a few hours. Comments on TripAdvisor hit the mark. A good experience; a lot of scrambling over rocks and sliding down slopes, but not hard and would suggest suitable for most ages. Guides are enthusiastic and definitely help make the tour. Good value.

One of my favorite holiday experiences!. I was excited about doing this when my friend and I first signed up, and then really nervous the day of after I'd made the mistake of Googling images from the caves. However, despite my fears, the experience ended up being the highlight of my Central European vacation.Our guide, I wish I could remember his name, was a fantastic little spider-monkey with the way he just leapt, slid, and climbed his way through the caves. I always felt very safe with him and our group. During our 3-hour trek through the caves, we encountered a few other groups, so I know there are several different paths the guides can choose from. I believe they choose their route based on the group they have, so if you have any particular challenges or fears, mention them right away, and the guide can work around them. Our guide said that they've had special tours for children with physical handicaps so if they can do it, anyone in reasonably decent health can too. The guide also said that he once had a 6'2" American footballer on a tour and he made it through, with some course adjustments from the guide.I did not find the experience too physically taxing, and I would say I'm only in average shape. Perhaps it's because we often stopped for breaks during the trek, either so the rest of the group could catch up, or so the guide could explain the history/geology of the caves. But you will leave with bruises and maybe scrapes on your knees and elbows.I know some people really enjoy being scared or spooked, so I hope what I write next doesn't spoil anything for them. However, as someone who absolutely hates being frightened, I always appreciate a heads up. There were a couple of times on the trek when our guide popped out from nowhere to gently scare us. It was easy to tell it was coming though, because you could hear the shrieks from the group members further ahead in line. There was also a point when we sat in the 'theater' cave and turned off all our lights, which might be scary if you don't like the dark. Lastly, you can bring your camera into the caves with you. There is a pocket in the coveralls. But it will get dusty! Everything gets dusty! it's worth a little dirt and grime for this experience though.

Really unique and awesome experience. This tour offered a very different perspective to the city. Really enjoyed it with no complains.Reasonably cheap for a good work out and experience:)Remember to ask for the sandwich. They offer the best in Budapest; )

One of the best experiences of a 16 day European trip!. We were scheduled to cave on the afternoon of our arrival in Budapest-- after a 12 hour flight from the states. We were EXHAUSTED but had so much fun! We had concerns about making it to the cave in time with our flight but the company worked with us to ensure we'd be able to go- having us meet at the cave at a later time than the rest of the group that met up somewhere in the city center. Our tour guide- Frodo as he called himself- was energetic, informative, and altogether a great guide! We had some concerns how physically difficult it would be but it wasn't a problem at all. This is a MUST DO if you're in Budapest--- and it is rather inexpensive for the great experience!

Caving. Incredibly fun experience. You can choose how intense, or "tight" the caving experience is. Provided with overalls, headlamp and helmet. Ask for Laci for a guide! He was energetic, funny, gave lots of good city and cave history, as well as, a good recommendation for food after the tour. One of my favorite things I did in Budapest!
Awesome adventure!. Did the caving tour and had a lot of fun if you look for something really uncommon to do in Budapest.

Definitely worth it. I've already visited some of the Hungarian caves, and though the caves in Aggtelek a lot more beautiful, but it is also very nice and definitely one of the most beautifuls around Budapest. I only can offer that place :) Also nice to go there with children (older than 6), can be very exciting for them.

Great few hours of exploring! . This is fantastic and recommended to all who visit Budapest! Kited up with overalls and taken down into the caves the guides are friendly and bring excitement to the adventure. Different options are given but the group decide where to take easy or not difficult routes. Not recommended for the unfit. Would do this again!

Definitely Worth Doing!. I went with a friend of mine and we really enjoyed it. It was more physical demanding, in regards to crawling and climbing, than we had expected. I ended up with a lot of bruises on my knees, but the bruises are worth the rather unique experience. Our guide was very enthusiastic and fun; he crawled and climbed the caves like a monkey. The jumpsuits they had us wear were a bit comical, but VERY necessary; it's dusty in the caves.

Wow, what an experience!. We went caving with our whole family: parents and children aged 12, 10 and 7. We arrived late because of misunderstanding the place (Tripadvisor map directs to the beginning of the street, there is still about 2,5km walk up the hill!) but were able to join the next groop. The experience was very exiting. We were a little worried how a fat but fysically active mother and children who don't speak english would manage, but our guides were able to accomodate the trip so that we all could enjoy it. If you fit in the overall, you fit in the cave. We felt safe all the time, no claustrofobic experience whatsoever. It was physically challenging but definately something to remember. The kids loved it so do not hesitate to take active kids caving with you. All they need is concentration and ability to do what the guide tells to do.

Loved it!. My sister and I (both in our early twenties) recently went caving under Budapest - we were really looking forward to it and weren't disappointed; it was the best thing we did while we were there and worth every penny. Our guide (unfortunately can't remember his name properly but think it was something along the lines of Lutzi/Lottie) was lovely and hilarious and did a great job of informing us all about the caves, as well as Budapest as a city. He made a real effort to speak to every member of the group and ask them about themselves and was patient and encouraging, particularly with those who found it more challenging. Speaking of which, in my opinion, I didn't find it massively difficult but I'm relatively fit and active (not to mention small which definitely helped!) and absolutely love adventuring and climbing. Even so, I was tired by the end of it and covered in bruises! I can see how others might find it challenging as, obviously, caving involves climbing, crawling and small dark spaces! One member of our group (a middle-aged man) got a bit panicky and wanted to leave not long into the tour as he feared he was going to get stuck but, after lots of encouragement by our patient guide (and all of us having to take a slightly easier route than was initially planned), he carried on and ended up enjoying himself. If you suffer from claustrophobia and/or hate the idea of crawling and climbing about underground then this definitely isn't for you but, otherwise, give it a go!

Amazing: A must do in Budapest. I did this tour yesterday for my last day in Budapest and it was so amazing, difficult though, I am 20 and i'll admit not a very active sort but I managed yo get round so almost anyone can (although it was slightly embarrassing that a ten year old was better at it all than me but then again she was smaller) You WILL get bruises and goodness do I ache today but it is definitely worth it for a real caving experience. Our guide was great, and hilarious including throwing himself down a massive hole and then pretending he was unable to get out and convincing several people to squeeze through a tiny gap before revealing that there was a perfectly good walkable way around, he also had a habit of disappearing and reappearing like a spider-monkey from some point above you. All in all a great morning, even if i did get wedged in a hole and have to be pulled out, and despite the look of horror on my face and the fact i moaned fairly solidly all the way around I had a fantastic time and would recommend it for anybody, although I do advise walking boots or seriously sturdy trainers XD

Neat experience in Budapest. This was was an amazing experience and nothing like we had done before. The caves were very impressive. Our guide Lottie was awesome, he made our trip a lot of fun as he was so energetic and interesting to listen too. The trip was definitely value for money (24 euros per person). It can be a bit cold in the caves so I would suggest taking a light warm layer to put on underneath your overalls. I would definitely recommend this trip to anyone who is up for a challenge and wants to feel slightly out of their comfort zone.

A review from two 40-yr-olds who took two kids:. This was a day to remember! It is very interesting and our guide spoke excellent English; he was funny, helpful and an all-around good guy. This is a great way to spend a day, and an even better way to do something you'll always remember while visiting Budapest. Now, there are a few things to take into consideration: 1)this is a big draw for the 20-something year-old backpackers--we were the only people there over the age of 30, and certainly the only ones who brought children. Everyone was very nice, but we should have gotten a hint on how challenging this might be just by the age of those in our group. 2)You wear proper equipment (a jumpsuit and hard hat with lamp) but there is no padding, so be prepared for you knees and elbows to be scrapped raw and there will be plenty of bruises! If I were going again, I would take knee pads for sure. If you are older, please be sure you're in good shape--THIS IS HARD WORK! You will climb using just your upper body to pull you through, you will belly crawl through tiny openings, and you wedge yourself between slippery rocks where it's difficult to get footing. I'm a 40-year old who runs four miles several times a week, and I found this very challenging. 3)If you are taking children: make sure they are in good shape and do not scare easily! Again: 40-meter ladder climb, tiny crevices, dark, etc., and everything is single-file, so no hand-holding. I took two boys, ages 14 and 10 (the caving age limit is 10-55 years old), and they had a blast, but it was hard work and I could see where those who are not "tough" could easily get scared when they get stuck (and you will get stuck) or just generally have a difficult time of it. So, yes--awesome experience. So glad I did it once. My boys will always remember Budapest for the caving--but please sign up knowing that it is a great deal of work, is very challenging, even for those who are fit, and you will be battered and bruised at the end--but all in good fun!
A different option to interesting people. Caving under Budapest is an interesting option to those who enjoy having new experiences. The site is not very close to the city but it is worth the trip.

Brilliant Experience. Just absolutely amazing. We really didn't know what to expect but it was well worth it. The tour guides are brilliant and clearly love what they do there, and there's just such a great feeling once it's over from a sense of accomplishment. Highly recommended.

Excellent - must do in Budapest!. Having not been caving before, I didn't know what to expect, however, I was completely taken away but how much fun this caving experience was. The guides are fully trained and organised people into groups (it appears they place people of similar build/athletic ability so that each group has a reasonable amount of difficulty so that no one gets bored or to avoid some obstacles to be too tricky for some but not others). Very safe at all times, although a lot of fun to be had. Just do it.

Awesome . Led by Frodo, our hilarious guide, our group worked its way through the cave over the course of about 3 hours. I had never been caving before but this was a fantastic introduction. It definitely had me out of my comfort zone, and I was close to freaking out a couple times, particularly in the small wiggle spaces where it felt like you were stuck, but never felt I was in danger, and in the end a very rewarding and exhilarating experience.

Exciting and well organised. Cheap enough (around 20 euros I think), plus bus tickets. The actual caving is excellent! Great guide who gets you through some holes you never thought you'd make it through and the whole trip was well run and very exciting!
wow!. Great caves, was so unexpected. Only drawback is climbing the ladder to get out. The other cave was easy to walk through and out.

Amazing!. The whole thing was amazing! It was my first time caving and I'm now addicted! There are some really really small crawl throughs however I think the guides assess the size of the people in the group and take you on routes accordingly. I felt completely safe all the way although wouldn't recommend to anyone who is unsure of small spaces. A lot of people were on their own so it's a good way to meet people if your travelling on your own in Budapest. You are however left to find your way back to the meeting point after the caving involving a few buses but it was fairly straight forward. Make sure you wear suitable footwear that you don't mind getting covered in clay :) you get an overall to cover up your clothes. It was really nice and cool in the caves but not too cold. Overall we had a fantastic time and was definitely worth the price of 5000 ft's each :D

A Must Do in Budapest. Let me first start by saying Im rapidly approaching 40 and consider myself to be in great shape.....HOWEVER this was challenging to me. It was sooooo much fun and you will feel a sense of accomplishment once completed but here are a few things to keep in mind:-you crawl, climb and slide for over two hours-you slide and crawl through some of the tightest holes ever-there is ALOT of dust, you will get dirty-Wear comfortable clothes and shoes with good traction-if you are super tall or of a significantly fuller figure, im not sure how you will get through it, but worth a try.With that said we are SOOOOO happy we did it. I was an AWESOME AWESOME experience. -

other buda. Worth a short bus trip into the Buda hills for this unusual experience on a city visit. An excellent guide makes every step interesting. Particularly attractive as an escape for a few hours from the hot city. This is not an arduous pot holing feat just a pleasure.

Excellent Caving Experience. Quick notes: If you have boots, brings them. If not, bring clothes and shoes you don't mind getting dirty.There are lockers you can use to change. They do not lock individually, but the cabin is locked by the guides.The difficult route is NOT for those that consider themselves unfit or may have health concerns. There are two other routes that may be more suitable.My fiance and I decided to give this a try as our last adventure in Budapest. The meeting point was a little confusing as there were no signs and as the meeting time got close we began to get worried. Eventually we bumped in to other confused people and became a group just standing around until someone with a, "Budapest Caving" shirt came up. Other than the initial confusion the trip was great.We had to take a couple of buses to get to the caves so make sure you have a bus pass or tickets handy. Once we were at the site we suited up and walked a short distance to the cave entrance. Our guide spoke broken English and was a bit hard to understand at times but she relayed all important safety information that we needed and at no time did we have any real communication barriers. The cave is NOT for those who are even slightly claustrophobic or afraid of the dark. After a 10m climb down a ladder we walked and crawled a ways before deciding on which trail to take. I suggested the difficult route (from Easy, Medium, and Difficult) and the rest of the group agreed so off we went. And it was difficult. It was not overly physically challenging but it is not for those that are not in shape or may have health problems (the Easy and Medium routes are probably a better bet).Our guide had us climbing up and down, sliding around on our backs, crawling on hands and kness, and the most difficult part: crawling snake like on our bellies with stone cave walls brushing against all sides of us. This intense army-crawling had me able to only squeeze by centimeters at a time in places.Now, I am a physically fit, 25 year old male, 6'6", 230 lbs. There were a couple of times that I got pretty close to not fitting so be warned, if you are any bigger you may have some troubles. You will build up a heavy sweat even though the cave is 50 degrees F the entire year round. The entire cave floor is covered in clay deposits and makes some parts pretty slippery. Overall, this was a great experience. It is a challenege for those who have never gone caving before and well worth the price and time.

So much fun!. Thank you so much TripAdvisor reviewers! This was such an amazing experience. Several of the people we were in the group with mentioned that this was one of the best caving experiences they've been on and they've been through a few. Some things to know - they do provide lockers so you can lock up any items before you go on the trip (we didn't know this and arrived in shorts and a tee even though it was cold out). It does get very warm down there especially with all the wiggling and crawling you do so make sure you dress for that. I had a lot of bruises which was then treated to a nice Turkish bath right after. Our guide was hilarious - at one point he tied my shoe laces together when I was wiggling through a particular small spot. My hips almost got stuck in one of the spots... I'm not sure how bigger people did it. I would definitely recommend this activity to anyone visiting Budapest!

Wow...... This was incredible!The caves are stunning...it was my first experience of an activity like this and I'm home researching caving in other places!Looking at some spaces you think I can't get through there yes you can.The team we went down with were lovely and our guide was great,dead funny too.Highlight for me was lamps off time and one of our group sang!Price wise I can't believe it's so cheap!

Subterranean adventure. Went with my girlfriend on a nice sunny Budapest day... so we go underground into the deep. Caves go down about 30m according to Helga our guide. She was so comfortable and obviously enjoyed the cave so much it put all of us in a great mood, and felt safe the whole time. All told we were a group of 8 in our mid-20's.There were a few parts that were challenging, for the really adventurous. Really tight parts, or a slide.The best part, though, was the "worm hole," a 18m crawl with lamps off. You must absolutely trust the people in front of you to guide you through the path, and pass it to those behind you. After coming out of it, the rest of your fellow cavers turn into great friends!5000HUF per person. Don't pay at the little window inside the cabin, pay the tour guide directly.

WOW. I went caving last week, and although I didn't really know what to expect, it was a fantastic experience! My tour guide was called Lotty (I think) and was great, really loved his work, and definitely made the experience memorable, with his jokes and shenanigans! I would definitely say this is a must do activity in Budapest! - I would just say that it goes on a little longer than the leaflets say, it said we would get back to the centre of Budapest around 7, I think it was closer to 9 when we did, this was fine for me, but could be an issue if you had a flight or something!

AMAZING. This was such a cool experience!! Our tourguide was awesome i don't remember his name but he was from hungary and is doing the caving since 20 years or something and he spoke a bit german with me (i'm from austria) and he made me (us) feel really save down there. I was nervous before but he was so awesome so relaxed and he gave that attitude to the whole group so everybody felt good even the ones who were claustrophobicThank you again!!!

Holy cow. This was one of the best crib ties I have done traveling Europe. This is a MUST in Budapest if you have just have a day spare. I am scared of darkness and right spaces so it was definitely a "fear facing" activity but I loved every minute of it. We did the intense tour which is 2-3 hours long and our your guide was so nice and such an enthusiastic guy. Do yourself a favor and check this place out!

AWESOME. This was awesome! I am incredibly claustrophobic and was super nervous about this but ended up enjoying every second. The tour guide (Sidal) was fantastic. I never once felt like I was in real danger and he kept us calm and relaxed the whole time. It was me and about 8 other girls who went and every single person enjoyed it. Would definitely recommend to travelers looking for a little adventure and maybe facing some fears!

What more could you want from 2 hours under the city?. The guides were crazy, which made it even better! I thought I was claustrophobic but that didn't prove a problem. We were a bit late starting as we missed transfers in buses, but it didn't matter. It's quite tiring work, and make sure you take a pair of shoes that you don't mind getting dirty.I think i could go again and again and again!

WOW!!. the most incredible attraction you can do in budapest !the tour is fun very hard, and sutisfing.price 5000 adult child 4000 forint. take a small camera with you, don't afraid to come there by the bus it is vary easy.the guids are super! and ask for the english speakrs.we are a young couple, it is fit for evetyone who can crawl and walk normaly.very very recomnded!!important: bring some clothes for change because you are getinng weaty and dirty, make a contact with the company in advance. and have fun :)

GO - JUST GO!. This was by far the most fun activity I have ever tryed on a holday. I'm not usually interested in these kinds of things during a holiday, but wanted to try it, because my boyfriend is - and we both loved it. Such a fun and new way for us to spend time together. Must go! And the best part is, it's cheap and we had a great guide!

MUST Do !!. My second visit to Budapest, heard about this during my first trip and what can I say - the guy was right - you´d simply regret not having done this. It´s an awsome, unbelievable experience. My first caving tour, would definitely do it again ( well not today... muscles will need some time to recover :) Tour guide (hi Lazlo) never gave any reason to feel unsafe or uncomfortable, with tips and good hints on request you can rely on! We also had funny moments during the tour :)

Perfect. The guide spoke excellent English, despite humbly claiming otherwise, told great jokes, taught us a number of interesting tidbits about the cave system's history and the types of rocks and minerals that can be found within it, all while ensuring that our trip was physically challenging, SAFE, and most of all: fun.I couldn't have asked for a better experience, and it all came down to the excellent treatment that we received from our guide, Szilard.If you ever find yourself in Budapest for two days, make sure you dedicate at least a couple of hours to caving with Caving Under Budapest.

Challenging!. This is not for the faint hearted. It is challenging. You will be crawling, sliding, climbing and getting very hot and sweaty. It was good value for money and certainly an experience!! I doubt whether you would find something like this in the UK (too much emphasis on health and safety here). All I can say is give it a go if you like a challenge - would I do it again.........not a chance! Lol

Brilliant fun and more challenging than you think. I read about this on TA and understood this to be more of a walking tour but it was much more challenging than that and all the better for it. The guide was excellent, the experience just fantastic and the price was very reasonable as well. All in all well recommended.

A great experience!. After my boyfriend saw that you could go caving in Budapest, I had no other option than to book it! I must say, I was a bit scared because I have mild claustrophobia and a great fear of heights, and neither of us has done this before so had no idea what to expect.We met our guide in the city, and he helped us get to the caves with public transport. We were divided into two groups, and being in the second one we had to wait a while for him to get the first one started. Then we got to the changing rooms, paid him (in cash, which you have to) and he handed over the helmet and overalls. Once changed we walked a little bit to the opening of the cave, and went down a high ladder. I can say that now afterwards, that was the scariest part for me! =P There weren't any really high drops, and even the smallest hole was over quickly, so I had no reason to be scared and felt safe the whole time (I was afraid of long tunnels of crawling on your back, and thankfully there were none of that)The guide joked a lot, and helped us to understand how to get through all of the obstacles. It was really dark down there! When we turned off our headlights, it was truly pitch black! Me and my boyfriend both brought gloves, and afterwards we heard some of the group say that this would probably have been a good call for them as well. We both had some bruises and scratches, but it wasn't as tiring as we thought, both being absolutely out-of-shape ;) It took us about 2-3 hours down there, we met the guide in the city a bit before 3:45, and we got out of the caves around 8.After it was all over, I think this was the thing my boyfriend enjoyed the most on our trip, and I can honestly say that I did enjoy it as well (and I agree with the other reviewer here that said it feels like you are a big kid), although it might not have been my favourite ;)

Great experience a MUST DO!!. If you're into doing something different then this is for you !! Great guides very funny and helpful. My advice would be take a change of tshirt ( this means 10 beers in Hungarian ) if you sweat a lot and wear boots /trainers. My gf and I had a great time loved it!! Worth the money!!

amazing experience!. very funny english-speaking guide, the route was amazing with a bit, but not too much challenging sections, the group was nice to be around and the cave really got me! it was worth every forint!

Absolutely incredible!. Caving was incredible! We had awesome guides and it was so much more intensive than we imagined. They kept us safe and we all had a blast!
Rave Cavers unite!
Exceptional experience... It got moist.

So cool. What a must!!!! We had a blast exploring. You have to do this for sure. We end up in this cool spot where we could hear the normal street above us. It was creepy but a great time. Felt safe but a little risk at times.

Challenging but fun. Great experience. Our tour guide was very funny and made the walk interactive. It is physically challenging but I am not athletic and was able to do it. Expect climbing, crawling, and prepare to be in between rocks. Your shoes are gonna get muddy but it is part of the fun!! It was such a fun experience! I would go back and do it again! Great workout;)

Different but excellent. A different type of caving than you may normally expect, there is no walking, and no escape doors, so if you will get worried, don't go.However the caving itself was excellent, takes it out of you a bit after several hours of crawling through tiny holes and scaling steep clay paths on your hands and knees, but it is definitely worth doing.I was in group three out of four, and whilst we did wait a while it was definitely worth it, all the guides know good English, and even I (easily the biggest guy in my group) made it through without getting stuck once, so anybody who wants to do it would be able to.

An absolute must do. What can I say that hasn't already been said in other reviews? This was a brilliant experience from start to finish, and superb value at only £15 per person. Terrifying in places but never dangerous - the guides know exactly what they are doing. The health and safety is almost non-existent, no harnesses and no safety talk, no emergency processes so if you're of a nervous disposition you may want to give this a miss. I have mild claustrophobia, but pushed myself to do this and never felt truly scared. You will spend up to three hours in the caves, and you will get muddy and sweaty. It can be quite hard work. Take a change of clothes and factor in time to go back to your hotel for a shower once you finish!

A family of four outing. Me and my girlfriend, along with my brother and father, whom both are a bit on the tall and broad side ended up doing the caving. As you need at least four person for a booking, I persuaded them a bit to come. However, even the least fit of us enjoyed the experience and the challenge, despite getting a bit sweaty by the end of it. There were some really narrow bits that I didn't think we could pass through. The theater place was really cool, would be really interesting to come on one of the events that they sometimes do there. I also loved how spontaneous the whole thing was. Our guide, also named Gabor (he was great by the way, really helpful and funny guy) showed us at the end how to get back on the top of the ladder area without using the ladder, and when I attempted after him just for the hell of it, he was really supportive and by the time I realized it, I was up like 5 meters, too late to come down! He showed steps how he'd suggest going further up, but he didn't mind when I tried it in a different way and he was there next to me in case of trouble. Exhilarating! Definitely aiming for the extreme tour next time.

A brilliant and unusual way to spend a day 'under' Budapest. We were looking for something a little different to do on a recent visit to Budapest and came across the caving on trip advisor.We contacted the company via email, the evening before we were due to visit and received an almost immediate response. We were able to book onto a trip the next day.It's slightly complicated to travel there but if you meet the guide at the bus station, as instructed, the whole trip goes quite smoothly.They give you the overalls and helmet to go caving. When they recommend that you only need a t-shirt and thin trousers underneath, they are not lying. When you get into the caves and start moving around, you will get VERY warm. It is also advisable to bring/wear shoes that you don't mind getting muddy.The whole caving experience was brilliant. There is a lot of climbing and crawling so you need to have a certain amount of agility.This is certainly an experience not to be missed. Staff and caves are both brilliant and I would recommend this to anyone else traveling to Budapest in the future.

Any title I choose won't be positive enough.. With a few friends from my study abroad program, I had one of the coolest experiences of my life caving under Budapest. I had never caved before- going into it having few expectations and without having looked at a single picture of the caves (and hearing from equally uniformed people that there were "cities" in these caves), the bopping around neath the ground was easily my favorite thing I did in Budapest during the three days I was there. While it might sound unnerving to descend many meters beneath the surface, squeeze through cracks in limestone, and experience total sense deprivation, the care and optimism with which our guide, Laszlo, led us through the "Big Ring" route extinguished any sense of fear! We worked as a team. Laszlo was really knowledgable about the geology of the region and enthusiastically responded to all of our questions about the caves and his own experiences caving. Thank you so much to Adventure Caving for opening up this opportunity for even athletically challenged people to explore these incredible landscapes!

A Great Adventure. For something a bit different we decided to explore the caves under Budapest. The price was very reasonable and one of the guides met us at a central location in Budapest and took us to the caves in 20mins on the local buses. The tour guides were very knowagable and very funny. The whole experience was really great and a lot of fun. We were exhausted after it but it was definitely worth the trip. Highly recommended!
Do not miss this!!. This was the highlight of our trip and very good value for money! It is a trip for people who are active and like to do something different.
Great fun. As a 6 foot 4 guy weighing 110kg some areas where a bit of a squeeze but nothing unmanageable. Really good experience

Fun and adventurous for beginners. For Budapest I wanted to do something adventurous and cultural. My friend and I decided on underground caving. We made our reservations at http://caving.hu/. The price was 5,000 HUF, which is about $22 US dollars at the time of this post. The price didn’t include the round-trip public bus ticket that we had to take to the place but it did include a guide, overalls, helmet, and headlamp. Without the guide we would never find our way out.My friend and I had a great time here and the guide was terrific but his jokes weren't too funny. haha.. for a full trip report to the underground caving, check out my blog at http://travelwithyj.wordpress.com/2014/02/07/part-2-budapest-thailand-hong-kong-trip-report-2/

The most fun I've had in Budapest. Szilgyi was our guide, he was hillarious, overall he had all the characteristics that a leader should have, this was the best time my girlfriend and I had in Budapest, I highly reccomend this experience to anyone.

Adventure!. Great physical workout, so much fun!Just a little disorganised in terms of pick up etc.. Make sure you buy your ticket through your hostel/hotel and wait where they tell you in the bus terminal - they will be there!

Epic. Title says it all. This was epic. Was a bit hesitant at first as we emailed the guys and directions were vague. But then we got there. Best experience ever. The guide was super friendly. Spoke perfect english on the tour and was really funny to. Some bits were a very tight squeeze but theres always and easyier route if your not up to it. The guide was very knowledgeable to with in depth history of the caves as well as explaining what it takes to be a caver. All in all words really wont do this justice. Just go do it and have fun. Its a must.
Amazing experience and a must do in Budapest.. This was a really great experience. Extremely enjoyable and didn't think I would fit through some of those tiny gaps. Must do in Budapest.

leave the beaten path, hire a private guide. If you are ready a bit of crawlig, climing ( and not claustrofhobic!) allow yourself hiring a private guied and allow 2-3 hours. Will no regret. Guides are not awfully expensive and usually are very knowledgeable so what you get is more real cave experience. There is a little pond at the bottom of one of the cave branch, actually at the water level of the Danube, which worth the descend...and climbing back. Outfits are provided, only bring shoes that can get muddy and ditry. Few citiy offer such attraction with no travels, so why not trying something out of the beaten track. No special physical condition is needed, just some endurance.

somehow I really enjoyed this!. I'm not a very adventures person when it comes to physical things, but I really enjoyed this! it's hard work and testing but feels really rewarding at the end. If you're sore the next day you did it right!

Absolutely terrifying but brilliant!. I loved this caving experience but it scared the life out of me!I went with my 21 year old son and decided we would do this together. Now I am a 48 year old bloke who likes a pint and has a bit of a belly. I weigh 17 stone and the guide assured me that I should have no trouble navigating the caves, but the spaces were TIGHT! I got stuck on one of the very fist holes ( Where you have to assume the "Superman" position for your reference) There is no way this would be allowed back in the UK. By the time Health & Safety have done a risk assessment they would shut the place down. You crawl through a tiny little hole on your belly into a cavern then you crawl through an even smaller hole into the next cavern. This goes on for 2 hours! I am not claustrophobic but boy was I was glad I was out of there in the end. I kept thinking "if I get trapped how will they get me out?" as you are half a mile underground! My son coped well but there again he is only 21 but even he said there was one bit he got stuck and panicked a bit so it was not just me! In the end I was out of breath and dripping in sweat. The caverns themselves are nothing special, just muddy brown rocks and although the guide Lottie pointed out various formations and fossils throughout there is not loads to see, but it was the apprehension of the next gap that I had to squeeze through that spurred me on! So glad I did it but never again! There is a real sense of achievement when I had done it.

Do it!!! You won't regret it! . As long as you are in good health and reasonably fit you should do this!You certainly won't regret it and will feel a sense of achievement afterwards! Expect to laugh a lot and to be amazed by each small hole you get through! We were so glad we did this, it was the highlight of our trip! Tip: You need to organise and but your own bus tickets. (2 buses there and 2 back) so buy 2x connection tickets at the tourist info or the nearby train station.

Wow so cool. Funny instructor. The kind of adventure you see in the movies and cannot believe your allowed to participate in-- in real life. So impressive so intensive so fun, expect some bruises and tricky challenges ;)

Not worth the wait. I read others reviews about this caving experience before visiting and I was really excited to go, but the trip failed to meet my expectations on every level. First, I arrived on time to the meeting point at 3:45, but we did not get on a bus to head to the caves until 4:30 because the guides were dealing with an upset older gentleman who could not participate without a doctors note. Not their fault, but it got worse.When we got to the cave site, after being literally PACKED onto the city bus, they separated us into 5 groups, because not every group could fit in the changing rooms at one time. They said each group would take about 10 minutes to change into the caving jumpsuit. They were wrong. It took 25-30 minutes. I was in group 5. I waited nearly two hours and finally got into the locker room, only to realize all the lockers were already taken, thus having to cram my stuff into a corner, unprotected. So at 6:45, mind you I've waited three hours already, our group finally enters the cave, only to learn that our guide has only spent 6 months learning English. I learned absolutely nothing about the caves, no matter how simple question I asked. Additionally, due to starting late, we were hustled through every room, and left the caves at 7:45. We were promised about a 2-2.5 hour tour. I only spent an hour in there. Liars.Overall, even if my experience was not a complete failure, I would not recommend the caves. They really aren't too exciting, there's no cool rock formations or crystals, its just all brown rocks. Whoopdy Doo. If you DO choose to do it, just make sure you are in group 1 and that your guide knows English.

Best Birthday!. Incredible! The one thing every visitor to Budapest should do! I went a few days after my birthday as they were fully booked on the actual day... and it was worth the wait! Can't wait to go again soon hopefully! Awesome guides - really know their stuff!

Never Again.. Dont be put off by the title of my review.I had an awesome time, on reflection. I took my fiance here for his 30th birthday as I knew he would enjoy it.
