We both thought we would be walking around in a cave looking at stalactites and stalagmites. Boy, were we wrong! Firstly, we were with a group of straight out off college kids. Never a good sign. Putting on the overalls and seeing how grubby they were, told me this was going to be a lot more active that we thought.Upon entering the cave, you have to climb down a ladder. Being 5 foot tall, Im scared of most things, so here, I was absolutely petrified. I realised it was too late to turn back so just bit my tongue and proceeded, especially after seeing the absolute joy in my partner's face.You're in there, your'e crawling, sliding, climbing, you have to listen carefully to the guide otherwise if you dont, you'll get stuck in a hole. No ropes, harnesses or carabiners. No such thing as health and safety. Could not fault any part of it. I'm sorry to my group as I moaned a lot. But as I said, upon reflection, I'm really proud of myself for doing it. I only sort of regret is not bringing my phone/camera with me. I was scared of it getting crushed or broken (and rightly so!)It cost 5000 forints (around £15) per person which includes the helmet with headlight and overalls. You have to pay for your own travel to and from the cave. The lockers provided did not lock, but everything was there when we got back. There's a cafe on site with beer and food.It's not for everyone, certainly not for me, but I loved it.I cant remember the name of our guide, but she was awesome and deserves praise.

Must do!!! SOOOO awesome!!!!!!. There's a review further down that encapsulates everything I thought about this, so I will give a bare bones review. I just want to make sure you've got the right one.This review is for a tour via www.caving.hu at Pál-völgyi cave in Buda. We booked through our hotel, other hostels offer bookings as well. The english guided tours are "late afternoon" Monday, Wednesday, Friday. it was 5000HUF per person. We met at the Nyugati pályaudvar train station in Pest and took two buses there with a chaperone. Most of the other people were young hostellers, early 20's, only a few 30+. Bus tickets are not included, but we recommend getting a travel pass (transport only, available for one, three, five and seven day tickets, includes metro, trams, buses and ferries). Oddly, all the young people had to buy bus tickets, the older folks didn't. Ha ha. Noobs.Upon arrival we were broken into groups of about 9-10, and went in shifts to change into the gear. You are provided with a helmet with light and jumpsuit. Recommend you wear good hiking/walking shoes that you don't mind getting dirty. Glasses are ok for most parts, and you can fit a compact camera or mobile into the pocket of the jumpsuit. You have to sign a waiver "for insurance purposes", but it didn't seem very formal. There is a pub and cafe underneath for afterwards. Remember to pee before you go.The tour is 2.5 - 3 hours, you will return to town around 8-9pm. (We met at the train station at 15:45.) the guides are excellent, speak good English, and are very good At what they do. Ours was hilarious and moved like a spider monkey over rocks. He said he'd been caving for 12 years.The tour is adapted to the skill level of your group. We opted for a slightly more challenging path, but we took it slow with frequent breaks for the less-fit members to recuperate. And your shoes will get dirty.If you like scrambling over rocks and squeezing into tight spaces, you absolutely must do this tour before some stupid tourist sues them and they're forced to put in ropes and stuff. This is not recommended for people who can't climb to the citadel in the city or those who are morbidly obese or ridiculously un-fit. Yes, you can do this if you are over 30, my husband and I managed better than some of the young frat boys in our group. You do this at your own risk, so don't over reach yourself.But OH MY GOD IT WAS SOOOOOO FREAKIN AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Unique and fun way to spent some time. Not for the claustrophobic but a fun way to spent some time in a cooler environment out of the heat.

BEST!!!. Frankly, I signed up for this tour because it was too hot to go to the thermal baths and the 10 degree caves sounded extremely appealing in the summer. I'm so, so glad I went. It was one of the best things in my entire 5 week holiday. It's quite intense, and not for the claustrophobic. Our guide unfortunately didn't talk much and wasn't the most engaging, but the tour was phenomenal in spite of that. I highly, HIGHLY recommend it! It's a little disorganized though, and the tour starts over 1.5 hours after the meeting time (the guy who met us was a little standoffish, and the lady at the store at the venue was quite rude as well-refused to let us fill our water bottles :/). Small inconveniences, the tour was good enough to make me forget all this!

so glad we found this. Great thing to do in Budapest that's not exploring the historical districts of the city. Definitely not for the claustrophobic, as you have to wriggle through holes and angle yourself in a certain way to make it through at times. It's totally worth it, though, and a really fun 2 hours. The deepest part of the cave is 50m - we turned off our headlamps and experienced complete silence (anything closer to ground level still echoes sounds of water running, leaves rustling, etc.) and darkness. They provide you with a full suit and a headlamp and helmet, but bring shoes that have traction and that you don't mind getting dusty and muddy. It's cold down there but you'll heat up really quickly - crawling through caves is more of a physical exertion that I thought it would be.

Best thing I did all holiday. This was sooo much fun. We had been shooting earlier in the week and I didn't think anything would beat that....but this did! Great value for money too.Our guide was great, clearly very enthusiastic about caving and made the tour fit-for-all and a fun and informative experience. He had very good English too. When we were clearly all ok with the initial route, he upped the difficulty....I thought I might panic going through tight gaps but I felt in safe hands....especially because some of the holes we had to climb through were soooo tight, literally didn't think I would make it through some of them!! It was very challenging and I was totally battered and bruised from the experience, would repeat it in a second though!The caves aren't overly beautiful, but it is a great activity and so much fun. You get really warm when you are down there so just a t-shirt and jeans underneath the overalls they provide was fine.They lock up all your valuables when you are down there and you are able to take a camera with you. They provide overalls and a helmet which are needed! Wear practical footwear! And be prepared for them to get dirty, it's very dusty and because it had been raining was quite slippy and slimy when I went so shoes were stinking when I came out!One down side is the time it takes to get going....our guide was waiting for a team of 40 odd people (they split you into smaller groups at the caves)....we were due to meet at 3:45pm and weren't in our overalls until gone 5pm. There are two buses required to get from the meeting point to the caves too, but the guide comes with you and then you just have to repeat this journey on the way back on your own (which is fine as there will probably be a big group of you).Definitely an activity worth doing....2.5hrs flies by too! I wanted to stay down there....although my aching muscles and bruised body was probably glad I didn't. Ideal activity to do before checking out the Budapest spas the next day!There is also a bar at the location where you can buy alcohol and food after the adventure.

great fun!. This was such a good choice! Very good organisation. Easy transfer by buses to the cave, full equipment given, enough time spent underground, very nice, patient, informative, funny and helpful guide. Lots of bruises on my knees afterwards but I would have never otherwise dared to climb down 3-4 meter tall rocks or slide down 5 metres through narrow holes. Fun, fun, fun! Affordable and challenging enough. You don't need much clothing under the overalls as it gets warm with all the physical activity. Can also take changes of clothes and anything you want as you can eave them in lockers for when you go into the cave itself. Their base is also a pub so you can stay for a beer afterwards :)

Very challenging yet fun!. The guide first seemed liked he'd hit his head in the cave a few too many times, but he was actually very nice as we got to know (and rely on) him in the caves. Take appropriate shoes (that you don't mind getting dirty)!

The kids LOVED it. When we were planning our holiday to Budapest and was looking for things to do with my kids (boys 9 and 12) this came up and I knew we had to give it a shot. If you have the opportunity and have never done anything like this before please do it! I called a few weeks before our holiday to schedule a tour. I was happy to learn that since we were a party of 4 we would be able to do a private tour with just the family. We got there early and Lotti ( think that was his name) fitted us for our overalls and headlights. No one else was there that day. We didn't know what to expect at all except what was on the website. 2 1/2 hours of crawling, climbing and sliding....The guide was great with the kids. He saw that they were pretty adventurous let them lead where appropriate. If you are an avid caver then maybe you might find this boring but if you are a family with active kids please don't miss this! You will not be disappointed....
Best experience of my trip. Wow, this was awesome! We decided to go the hard way and it didn't disappoint. "The Sandwich" was intense. You gotta try this for something different.

What an experience!. I am in Budapest for a study abroad program and this has to be one of my highlights of the city. I had heard there were caves but never imagined anything to this scale.Our guide, who called himself Frodo, was experienced, knowledgeable, and fun! I learned a lot while I had an adventure squeezing, crouching, crawling, sliding and climbing through the caves. We went through rocks I didn't think you could fit and saw rooms I couldn't believe were carved out by nature.Overall it was a very unique and satisfying experience that I would whole heartedly recommend to anyone visiting Budapest that has an adventurous side!
escape from heat. felt instant relief...cooling down.admission charge was a little expensive compared to other atractions.

Squeeeeze.... A fun 2/3 hours, the caving guides are helpful, enthusiastic and fun. You'll be squeezing, sliding and crawling through all manner of nooks and crannies. Although the caves are cool, wear just shorts and a t-shirt under the jumpsuit provided or you'll cook! There is a changing room where you can put stuff while you're underground. Some reviews have been critical of the organisation at the beginning of the tour. The transfer from the meeting point at the main station is by taking two buses. It would be really helpful if everybody brought tickets with them (these aren't included in the tour price to keep costs down as many people buy a 1/3/7 day pass) but, as people do, they don't read their confirmation email or they forget... We had to wait 15 mins while everybody else went to buy tickets. OK, this was a bit of a pain, but just had a drink and people watched while we waited. No biggie!Overall I'd definitely recommend this to visitors as something a little different from the usual touristy things to do and very good value for money!

GREAT Guides, lame cave. Sorry, but I've caved a lot and this place requires much crawling for a little dazzle. The guides are a blast and it was a lovely adventure though. I'd not waste 2 hours on this when you can go to a bath house instead or rent a bike and enjoy the city. Just my opinion.
rewarding experiance. rewarding speachless experiance one must do!!!!! you have to sighn uo throw the web / very difficlt but enjoyable/

Unique Experince. I was a tad apprehensive about taking on this activity but after reading the reviews decided to give it a go. I communicated with the organizers via email and they were very responsive and answered all my questions. I followed the instructions for the meeting point and the guide was on time. Once you arrive at the site (45 minute bus ride) you are given the coveralls and some instruction and then you are walked to the cave entrance and away you go. Inside the cave it is pitch dark (you will have a small light on your helmet), initially I felt uncomfortable but after about five minutes I was fine. I am of average sized(height and weight)and in excellent shape so if you are a large person or you are not in some kind of decent shape this will be an extremely challenging experience. You will walk, crawl, climb, and squeeze into a variety of holes and crevasses while following the guide. I loved this excursion, excellent guide who gave good instructions, you are in the caves for about 2hrs, another bucket list checked off.

Absolutely loved it !. I'm glad I did this .... It was super fun and exciting . Our guide was really helpful and funny . We had to catch a train back to Vienna and these guys did everything they could to help us reach the station in time :)

Was apprehensive at first, but so glad I did it. Weeks before I arrived at Budapest I knew I was going to give it a try, but I became quite nervous as the day approached. I'm a little claustrophobic, scared of heights, and not in the greatest shape (5'8" female 140 pounds). I've ALSO been caving before with a group from the university I attended, and needless to say I was NOT prepared for the traumatic experience I had that time.Why do it again? I like the mental challenge (and for me, this was far more a mental challenge than a physical one.) Call me crazy, but in the end I have absolutely no regrets for this Budapest caving experience. So let me run through the important facts:1. Everyone is right- it took hours from the moment we met at the bus stop to actually getting our coveralls on for the cave. While it was incredibly annoying, I forgot all about it once the experience was over.2. As soon as you walk into the cave you climb down a metal ladder. For me, that was the scariest part because that was the official descent into the unknown. There was no turning back...well, one guy did turn back after walking through the first tunnel (which wasn't that small so good thing he did!)3. The holes get smaller and smaller. But it also get's less and less scary...you aren't crawling through them for long periods of time AND you're getting used to the idea that your body can fit into tinier spaces than you ever thought. Plus, it really helped that the guide was cracking jokes and making you feel safe and comfortable throughout the whole journey. The guide definitely made the journey 100x better than it would have been with a crappy guide (like I had during my first experience.)4. The first half of the journey is climbing down into the cave...so naturally you have to climb back up! This was actually scarier for me than the crawling because a) the rocks are slippery and b) I have fear of heights. Nevertheless I managed it, and it really wasn't that bad. Just make sure your shoes have good grip (mine didn't), and if you're truly scared, crawl on your hands and knees....you'll be bruised later but that's no big deal.5. Even if it's 11 degrees down there, it feels HOT from all the climbing and crawling. So wear shorts and a t-shirt that you don't mind sweating profusely in. 6. Make sure you don't have to pee- get it all out while you're waiting to start and really try not to drink any liquids before you go in! Even though you'll be doing a lot of physical activity, you can live without water for a few hours.7. You might be scared, but guess what- most of the people on that tour had no clue what they were getting into either. Everyone was equally as nervous but all came out loving it! If you think you can manage to control your fears and you're looking for a little bit of a thrill...JUST DO IT. I promise you won't regret it! If you have severe claustrophobia though, then obviously skip this!

Slow to start, but a unique experience. Good:Caving is fun and good exerciseUnique way to see the Buda side and then explore natural cavesBadThe tour asked us to meet at a bus stop at 1:45. By 3pm we didn't even have our caving coveralls on. The organization could be much better. Also, make sure that you know how to get back home as after the tour you are left on your own at the site. Also, although the cave is 10o, it is very warm in the coveralls and tight spaces and there is physical work in wiggling through small holes. Dress lightly and with supportive shoes that can get dirty

Wonderful experience in Budapest. We did the adventure caving (3 hours of full-on wiggling through narrow cave entrances) and had a blast. Definitely wear shorts and a t-shirt or tank top underneath the overalls they provide, because you get really sweaty with the effort of getting around. If you have hiking boots, bring those, but if not regular tennis shoes will do just fine. I'm not super fit but do walk 20 minutes 3x a day and I was fine. Our guide was wonderful and shared lots of information about the caves and about Budapest in general with us.

Must do and absolutely worth the money. We chose the adventure caving option and it was the highlight of our trip in Budapest. Unlike what I expected, you actually get to do some amazing caving as you navigate through tight spaces. Although the website says suitable from 14-55 I would most definitely not recommend anyone who was unfit to attend this as many places are very slippery and there were many tight spaces.If you take a camera inside, make sure it's at least waterproof as it will get very dirty (dust is everywhere and humidity is 100%).Our guide was amazing and answered all the question everyone in the group had. We even had the option to take different routes depending on the preferences of everyone in the group.Note that the meeting place for the tour is actually in the city center and you'll need to pre-book with your accommodation in order to attend.

this is full on caving under buda not labyrinths as some seem to have got confused with. this is great,full on caving with overalls and helmut light,certainly not for the faint hearted or someone not physically fit.i`m 44 and near the end of the recommended age bracket, however i walk over 20 miles a night in a physical job and i sweated buckets and the following day i ached in a few places with a few bruises to match so be wary.we went in a group of 20 somethings and one of them really struggled, although a bit hungover.some of the gaps are really tight although some have an alternative route, but a bit of wriggling and you are through albeit after a bit of a scary increased heart rate moment of getting stuck, panic attacks almost..highly recommended though, go for it..

An excellent expreience. This definitely was one of the highlights of our trip to Budapest....the tour itself was exciting and an amazing experience...and our guide was really good, had an amazing sense of humor and also gave a valuable insight about the cave...jus remember to wear full sleeve shirts and pants as although you will be wearing overalls u might still get bruises as you have to crawl in many places...highly recommended!!!!

This experience rocked!. Loved every second of this caving experience (lies... Once or twice hating life because of slippery shoes - easily amended) but all jokes apart, this experience is truly something else. Best part, at each new step, you think your body cannot possible do what it's about to do, wrong. Absolutely wrong. Your body can and it feels great after. Tiresome and hands on experience, dirty I must say but so much fun. With a good tour guide and a great bunch of people, you are set to go for an experience of a lifetime, seriously do it! Do not underestimate the strength of your body. Enjoy the half way point (ish), the lights off and dead silence to enjoy the peace of an underground location so cut off from the rest of the world was beautiful!

Amazing - a must do!. This had been my to do list from a few years ago. So this time I booked it in! It was amazing! You get a good 2.5 hrs below in the caves, climbing, sliding & squeezing through all sorts of places! Was a great work out! Only little annoying bit was all the waiting around before we started. Mine went well over the allocated 4 hrs. But defiantly was the highlight of my stay! It's a must do!

My best budapest memory. I must admit I was really nervous before this trip. I'm afraid of being trapped in small spaces and panic easily in such situations, but I figured this could be a good time to face my fears and also get an adventure on the same time.The tour guide and the group was awesome. The guide instilled confidence, he was joking around and was very relaxed which helped the rest of the group feel more relaxed about the whole situation, he paid attention to every member of the group and made the group look out for each other. I know we took the "hard way" but I don't know how it relates to the other possible paths in the cave, however there was a few very tight spots but mostly it was followed by big areas to relax in.I got very warm, even though I only wore shorts and a t-shirt under the overall, light clothing recommended. And good shoes! Most of the participants wore simple shoes like Converse, one even wore Crocs(!!) and it works, but better shoes would just make it a bit easier to get a grip in some slippery areas.Over all, a great adventure, and for me a slightly life-changing one as well.

Amazing! Totally awesome experience!. This was hands down one of the scariest but most amazing experiences I have ever done. Our tour guide was great, very patient and lots of fun. It can be a bit tight in some spaces, but there are lots of pathways so regardless of your personal specs, there will be a path for you to take. You'll end up sore the next day - but it's worth it! Crawl, duck and slide through the caves - it's an experience you'll never forget!

Original. This was an original idea picked out by my husband. He wanted us to do something different. And this certainly was different. I thought it would be very claustrophobic and it was, but not too unbearable that I was screaming, I want to get out. All was good, it was like an adventure! We felt like big kids exploring, crawling and walking in the dark. We were accompanied with a guide, he was really funny and explained all we had to do. He really was interesting and had great confidence and I think because he had confidence, we found confidence in ourselves. It was a great idea to do this activity. Very hot in the caves, so dont wear a lot of clothes underneath your caving suit! I came out with a big red face. Fantastic experience though and the warm , dark , caves!

Amazing, a MUST if visiting Budapest. At first was a bit nonchalant about this, expecting a walk through a big tunnel and not much else. However this was absolutely amazing and hands on, climbing through tiny tunnels and crawling your way through mud very far underground with nothing more than a helmet and a torch was exhilarating. The guides were good and tailored our trip for us, we were a more athletic/younger group so i think they took us down a more hardcore route which rocked. however i think if doing this as a family etc , they could also tailor it the other direction. Guides were funny and had some fantastic knowledge about caving and the tunnels themselves, All out amazing day , would do again in a heartbeat!

Do It!. I had no idea what Caving was before actually descending into the darkness that is the Budapest caves. I figured I'd be walking through some dark passages of rocks and caverns... it was a bit more extreme than that. Having a bit of claustrophobia, I don't think I'd have participated if I had known the extent of the tight spaces. Dressed in proper spelunking attire, coveralls and a headlamp, you descend into the caves and begin an hour of crawling, climbing and worming your way through crevices that appear impossibly tight.This activity is physically strenuous and is not conducive to those who are not in decent shape. I say that as a caution for anyone who may think this activity has been exaggerated.Definitely would do it again.

Caving under Budapest. Hi. I have been in Budapest already for one month on internship from IAESTE. And one of IAESTE member suggested to go caving. In the end there went almost 20 people and not a single one regrets this choice. When we arrived at caves (You can get there by car or by public transportation) we were divided in two groups ~10 people in each. The tour was around 3 hours and we had to crawl like worms, slide, climb up/down... We turned of lights and sat in darkness and silence. Amazing :) The caves are really amazing - there are really tiny places which are followed by bigger rooms (like Library, Big room, Theater etc.) so You can experience all kinds of situations.Caving was one of the best and most amazing things I have done in Budapest so far. I have to mention that instructor/guide was very knowledgeable and could answer all questions we asked. He very often offered a choice for us - shortest and easiest or longest and hardest way. If You decide to go, the stick with the hardest choices ;) And he was speaking English really good. I was really surprised when he squeezed trough a hole that looked too small for any human being to get trough. In the end even some people of our group did it too. Only problem could be that you have to book this in advance and the tours are not held every day. If You take camera then make sure that You have where to put it and that it isn't too big, because there is a lot crawling trough tight spaces involved. But I suggest everyone who comes to Budapest go on this adventure. You won't regret it.I will definitely return there and go on another trip to the underground lake.Good luck!

Amazing experience, but badly organized. This was one of our highlights in Budapest and I can warmly recommend to people who don't have claustrophobia. Our tour guide was very professional, told stories from her caving experiences and was funny. The caves are fascinating and scary at the same time. In most places you can walk or crawl, but some of the wholes are so tiny that it seems impossible to get through - but somehow you still manage it. I'm quite tall guy and got stuck twice for a short period of time, but you just have to keep your calm and move your body centimeter by centimeter.Remember a few things: 1) don't take your expensive shoes with you, because they will surely get dirty2) even it is only +10'c down the caves, you will be sweating A LOT and feeling warm. Wear something light under the caving suit.3) take some (disposable/washable) gloves with you, because there is quite lot wet clay And then to the downside: This tour deserves five stars, even I gave only four to it. The only reason I couldn't give full points to this tour was how it was organized. We met the tour guide and other "cavers" in the meeting point as expected. Unfortunately it took ridiculously long time get us in the bus: some people didn't have the bus tickets so we had to wait for them and also it took quite long time for the tour guide to check our reservations. The locals probably will hate us, because we used only public buses and basically took 80% of the space in the bus. When we arrived to the caves they separated us to smaller teams (10 people per team) and again there was a long waiting before we got our suits on.

Great time. While this was more activity than first anticipated it was a great experience even though my boyfriend is slightly uncomfortable in enclosed places. By the end of the caving expedition, he was thoroughly enjoying the experience. If you are adventurous, I would recommend this for sure. If you are a little afraid, go for it as you won't regret the experiences.

Great trip, just need better management. The actual tour and climb is amazing. Great guide and awesome fun.Downfall is the management of everything. Wasted nearly an hour waiting for things to be organized on a 41degree day.

One of the coolest experiences of my life. I am someone who loves to climb and explore, and the caves under Budapest was legitimately one of the coolest experiences I've had to date. Our guide made sure everyone was having a good time, was funny and very knowledgeable. It is unlike anything you've ever done (unless you have gone caving before). I would recommend this to anyone who wants to try it! I would certainly go again if I'm ever back in the area. You will probably regret not going, if you don't. Just do it!

A truly awesome experience. The cave system in Budapest is one of the reasons we came here and could not wait to do some spelunking. It was a bit unorganized at first meeting everyone by the bus. We then took two bus rides to get to the caves which are outside Budapest a bit. You will either need a transfer ticket or Budapest card for the buses. We then changed into the coveralls that were provided. The tour itself was about 2.5 hours and it is quite the workout but you do not need to be in amazing shape to do it. Children also do well. My kids are 10 & 11 and they had a great time. Our tour guide, Helga, was amazing. Two of our group were a bit claustrophobic and she helped them through and they ended up having a good time as well. You will be crawling on your hands and kness so be prepared to get a bit dirty.

Pal-Volgyi-Barlang Cave. It was a fascinating journey underground. Amazing rock formations and stalactites-stalagmites. Be aware that to get back to the surface there is a very vertical climb on a narrow ladder.

all the excellent review is no JOKE!!!!. As a cave lover i really want to this because this is not only visiting a cave but you experience on caving. our group at that time is really sporty so we do not take really long to finish the tour. some of the tour activities is sliding down, climbing and crawling and sometime is a really small space. our tour leader is really nice and speak good english. in summer time this place really recommended because it is quite chill down there but you will not feel cold because you will move a lots!! you just need a close shoes to join this tour and some money but it is really worth every penny and based on my experience try to book it directly or through you hostel. DO NOT BOOK from the tourist office they take commission. Not included is the bus ticket to the cave so do not come without bringing your money.

You MUST DO THIS!. This was the most fun I could have ever had while in Budapest and that is saying a lot. It is mind blowing. The tour guides are awesome. You are underground for at least 3 hours. It is not expensive at all. I thought that I would be extremely claustrophobic, but I was not at all. We took awesome pictures. I highly recommend doing this. It is unlike anything else you will ever do!!

Who would have known. Great couple of hours. Walked from Buda through the street seeing lots of statues on the way and then had another fantastic English speaking tour guide to show us around. Great to do with the kids and for the brave you can go caving which looked good if you like being stuck in a hole in the dark with a torch attached to your head! Not my kind of fun but what ever floats your boat! love the cauliflower and pea rock formations!

Loved it!. This presented itself as such an interesting and unique thing to do to me so I went along and loved every minute of it. The guide meets you at the meeting point and escorts you to the caves where you get split into groups of about 8 and taken into the caves.I'm a tall guy so squeezing through some of the gaps was tricky but it was so much fun. At almost 100% humidity you'll lose a bit of sweat but you'll have the time of your life with a great sense of satisfaction at the end of it. The tour is also informative with the guide sitting you down for a rest every so often to explain about the caves, what is above where you currently are and of some of the fossils that you can see.

Awesome experience. It was a hot day in budapest but comfortably cool 100 feet below the city. the guide was knowledgeable, fun and experienced.interestingly enough the website mentioned booking through your hostel, undeterred we inquired with our hotel concierge, twice the first sort of snickered, the second was much more helpful. You meet at a bus stop, take two buses to the site, get your helmet with light and overalls then crawl, slitter, wiggle and climb your way down 149 feet and back. Awesome experience for a first time caver : )

Excellent experience. Wanted to do something unique when in budapest so I remember the trip and I've never done caving before so I picked this, cost 6000huf and the bus to get there and back was an extra 1000huf (tour guide meets you at the start point for the busses, look for people with orange cards as they will be on the trip too!).Spent a good 3 hours in the caves listening to interesting stories and facts about Hungary and he the caving system came to be, also general chit chat along the way about many things Hungarian as the guide was really friendly and interested in his group. Have a team of upto 9 so not to big, some really tight spots but there is other ways if your a bit larger etc.Guide also had some funny stories about fossils etc and 1 part you all turn torches off so its totally black and to show the great sound of the room we were in he sang a Hungarian folk love song, in the dark very soothing.All in all perfect activity to do and in total it's great value for money

Underground epicness!. This caving tour was awesome. You take a couple buses out to the caves, get changed up into cave gear with headlamps and helmets, then descend underground up to 40 or 50 meters for several hours. I don't want to give anything away, but imagine going to a place where light doesn't exist! It's also very cool down there (temperature-wise it's 10-15 degrees C). Truly an amazing experience. Frodo was our guide- simple awesome! Full of knowledge and really gave the group a fantastic tour. Must do!
Great Fun!. I went with a group of 6 friends during a vacation trip, and it was fantastic! The caves are cool, the park is a great area, and the staff are terrific. Shoutout to Frodo!

You will be so proud of yourself for doing this!. We joined this tour after reading about it from their website.. We thought it will be a good change from sight-seeing and eating which is pretty passive if you ask me. This was probably one of our best experiences in Budapest, and in life! We would never have caved our entire lives if we had not chanced upon this.. Our instructor was Lazslo, and he was such a quirky funny guy. There were about 30-40 other youngsters who registered for the session and we were broken down into 4 groups of 8-9. Once we changed into our overalls and helmets we were led into the pitch black cave. The next 3 hours was one big adventure. We squirmed through holes on our backs with our hands outstretched and heads turned sideways, maneuvered through cracks that had only enough space for one arm and one leg.. climbed up steep walls,slided on our butts down uneven terrains and many more! Our instructor was very spontaneous, diving (literally) into holes and introducing us to the caves at every resting stop. It was alittle bit strenuous on the muscles, though we found it to be an excellent workout. The caves were eye opening. This is really a must-do for everyone visiting Budapest! Be prepared to get dirty. You will be mud coated by the time you're out ;) But trust me, with the kind of terrain you will be moving on, dirt will be the last thing on your mind! Recommended for anyone who is up for a memorable adventure!

Daring, exciting and rewarding!. Incredible experience to be had under budapest. 2.5hours underground crawling, sliding, squeezing and climbing. Our guide was Szilard who has been caving for 18years! Didn't know what to expect and was initially a bit apprehensive as concerned about how hard and tricky the caving would be.Our guide took us out of our comfort zone but never put us in situations we wernt capable of. For people who are concerned about small spaces, yes some of them are tight but they are over quickly and you soon find yourself in a large cave! Echoing a past review, if you are nervous but interested this tour is definitely for you, if you are seriously claustrophobic it's not for you!!

Best adventure in Budapest!. I went caving here a couple of weeks ago, and it was an amazing 2 1/2 hour experience. I didn't know what to expect. If you are part of a larger group, they will divide the group into smaller groups of 8, by ability. I never imagined what a great challenge - physically and on the psyche - it would be to crawl through such tiny spaces! Each of the caverns you go through has a name and story behind it... Our guides were fun, informative, and great leaders. It was a wonderful bonding experience for our group. I would definitely recommend going to one of the baths on the Buda side afterwards, such as Rudas or Lukacs.

Worth It.. I had never been caving before and do not consider myself to be particularly adventurous, athletic (especially after a gym-free semester abroad), or risk-taking. But my boyfriend and the woman running our hostel (Penthouse Privates) convinced me to go and I do not regret it! Once I got over the initial fear of being in a cave, the experience was totally unique and really fun. I got a little too good and excited, actually, and fell a little, but the bumps and bruises are just badges of honor. I wouldn't recommend it for anyone who is legitimately claustrophobic or very unfit, as I am hurting from the exercise and there are some VERY small spaces to fit through, but if you're just a little nervous but curious DO IT. Easily the most unique experience you can have in Hungary, and it's inexpensive all things considered. It's also a great bonding experience for friends and strangers.Helmets, headlamps, and a onesie/overalls that protects your clothes from cave dust and mud are included.Try to bring boots or athletic shoes if you're going to do this, though, I would not have fallen had I not been wearing converse with no bottom traction.

Awesome adventure!. Caving in Budapest was really fun! I happened to chance upon the caving brochure in my hostel, watched a YouTube video on someone caving in budapest and I was sold! And it is 5000huf (approx 17 euros) for 3 hours of fun! We made friends with the other ppl in our group and it was really cool! There were 9 of us to one guide and 3 different groups but we didn't bump into the other groups so not to worry about it being too crowded! It is 10 degrees in the cave all year round but I only wore a tshirt and leggings below the overall and halfway through the cave I was perspiring so don't wear too many layers! Would be useful to have shoes with good grip and it might get muddy so dont wear expensive shoes! You get to squeeze through tiny holes, climb up slippery parts and slide down and the different parts of the cave had quirky names like library, chapel and a bar.

An underground adventure. We went on the 3-hour tour, and recommend it for everyone who has got an little explorer inside. We have been in a lot of limestone caves in Ukraine and Austria, but this cave tour was complete different. No really big chambers, stalagmites and stalactites, but lots of narrow passages, small holes, different cave levels and rock formations covered with clay. All tour participants (a maximum of eight per guide) got an overall, helmet and light, and then we were ready for the adventure. The guide we had was both professional and playful at the same time, and really made our exploration the perfect one. It is possible to buy food and refreshments at the caving bar after the tour.

3-hr Caving in Palvolgyi Cave - unforgettable highlight of Budapest. This review is for the 2.5-3hr caving tour where it involves, walking, climbing, crawling. It's not the short 1-hr tour. I also reviewed the 1hr tour at Szemlőhegyi cave (check my reviews page). The Szemlohegyi cave was quite enjoyable, but I enjoyed this tour more as it's a lot more fun and unforgettable. Will recommend this tour if you have time to spare (or do both!).Booked a session for husband and myself. We arrived at the site early - went to level 2 where the guides are, and were told nicely by one of them to wait downstairs for our group to arrive. The meeting point was supposed to be somewhere else where we will take a bus to the cave area but we arranged to meet at the cave directly since we were already in the area in the morning. We sat around the lovely outdoor area and had time for some snacks from the cafe and took in the scenery while waiting for the group to arrive. Once the group arrived, we were split into smaller groups of about 8 people, and were taken up to the locker room to keep our belongings and change into overalls. Then it's a short walk to the entrance of the cave system. The actual caving experience was a lot of fun, and an eye opener for us as it was our first caving experience. There will be a lot of climbing, some sliding, crawling, etc. To be honest, I was a little apprehensive as to whether I can survive the caving tour as I do not exercise regularly. The last 5-10 mins were a little tiring as we did a stretch of almost continuous walking/ climbing, but other than that, there will be frequent stops for you to catch your breath throughout the tour so it's actually pretty manageable. If you are in decent health, I think it shouldn't be a problem. Husband and myself are in our early 30s, normal weight range (a little on the high side!), pretty sedentary lifestyle. We only do proper exercises less than 3 times a year, so we're pretty much in 'vegetating' state for most part of the year, and yes, we survived!!! :DThe guide (Lati? - not sure how to spell) is really nice and patient. Our group had 2 females and 5 males and he made the female go first before the males (he will be in front) so he can assist if needed. If you are claustrophobic or scared of the dark, this tour may not be for you. We heard that a girl from the other group bailed out upon entering the cave. We crawled through a couple of seemingly tight openings you'd never think it was possible and it was quite an adventure for first-timers like myself. I've a short video taken during the caving. It's not a terribly exciting video, I just uploaded to share how the environment was like. You can find it here: http://youtu.be/Dz2RWZQK5JEIn summary, we had a fabulous time and I highly recommend this caving tour if you are in Budapest. It was easily the highlight of our Budapest weekend.Tips:1) You don't need to layer on too much as you will perspire. Just a Tshirt or a long-sleeve top will do.2) Long-hair individuals - bring a hair tie / rubberband.3) Bring a new top to change into after the caving. Can also bring small towel / soap as they have a shower room (no one uses it so please email them to ask if you are allowed to use it, I'm not sure if it's only for the staff or open to visitors as well). 4) You may get the occasional sand/ mud stuck in your nails during the caving. They do not have hand soap in the toilets, so if you are a hygiene freak, bring your own hand soap/ hand sanitizer. 5) Bring a compact camera you don't mind dirtying/ damaging. DSLRs definitely not allowed. You have to be prepared to come out with a dusty camera. You will be moving about most of the time, so won't get to use the camera regularly. Can keep the camera at your overall chest pocket.6) Wear proper shoes with good grip (trekking shoes). Most seem to manage fine with track shoes. They will get a little muddy as some areas are a little wet in the cave, however most areas are dry so not to worry.7) Might be good to keep some wet wipes/ tissue handy in your pocket but do not litter!8) Use the washroom in the locker room before caving. The toilet underneath the cave costs 30 euros to use.... just kidding! There're no toilets in the cave! ;P9) Enjoy a glass of beer at the cafe after the caving. You deserve it!10) If you are going on your own, board the bus 65 from Kolosy Ter (there are multiple bus stops there, so leave enough time to get there/ find bus stop, wait for buses). There is a good free bus app on iPhone where it lists the stops. Search for 'Budapest Transport' on the app store and it's called BpMenetrend devloped by iMind Kft.

Annoying start- great overall experience!. We did the intense 3 hour 'climbing-crawling adventure' tour. Definitely one of the more interesting things I've done on a vacation. From what I can tell it is also infinitely better than the 1 hour walking tour of he cave. They do need to make it more obvious on the website how demanding this tour is though. Lots of climbing, crawling, slithering, jumping, sliding, guessing and FUN!! Our guide "Frodo" and his companion were great.Advice for tourist: bring good shoes with good grip. Buy a one-day public transport ticket in advance. Once in the caves, don't wear more than a t-shirt underneath your overalls because you will be too hot. If you're claustrophobic, are afraid of the dark or are in relatively poor shape: not for you.Advice for organizers: the meeting point was bus stop no. 206 at 3:45pm. If some people show up late or unprepared (i.e. without bus tickets), that's their fault. Don't make the rest of us waste valuable time waiting for them.

super interesting &informative tour. Tour was about 1 hour &the guide was quite knowledgeable about the formations and fluent in English. The guide was really interested in telling us about how the cave formed and discoveries of new areas. It was neat to see this cave &an excellent value for my tourist dollar. Also, easy to get to by transit.

Fun Experience at an Off-the-Beaten Track Gem. We went on a cold, rather dreary winter day, and there was no one else about. The cashier explained that she would lead the tour as her English-speaking guide was unavailable. While she apologized for her English skills, she had no need to do so -- she was very understandable, and shared wonderful insights along the way as the tour was just my family. We enjoyed our conversation as much as we did the lovely sights of the cave. The tour is well-organized with very modern paths and walkways underground, and the lighting is just right. I would imagine on a hot day this would be a very pleasant escape. Very much worth the time to visit!

Great place to visit. Been there in May of this year and enjoyed the visit very much. It's a spectacular cave, really worth seeing. We were there with a group of tourists from Europe and they too had a great experience there. Guided tours are available.
caving under budapest. It was the best tour I've ever experienced!! The Guides were wonderful, and very friendly, the cave was amazing!!
Way cool.... Physically and literally. Well worth it, an amazing sight. Make sure you wear sensible shoes.

A short guided tour well worth the price!. I only had time to see the cave in the guided tour, the guide was very knowledgable and it was a very highly recommended trip!
It can get quite chilly so wrap up warm and watch the slippy stairs!
Excellent Tour. For the price I paid and the quality of the tour this deserves 5 stars. the Guides were very friendly and fun to talk with during the whole tour.

Great personalized English-language spelunking tour!. We wanted to book a spelunking tour because my husband and I had done one before and the idea interested the other couple with whom we were traveling. We thought it would not happen because the planned English tour did not work with our schedule--it would end at the same time we were supposed to board an overnight train back to Dresden!But the staff was so accommodating and created a special separate English-language tour for the four of us! Wow! We had so much fun with Orsa and Gabor. Orsa met us at the train station and took us with her on the bus to the caves, as we were a little confused on how to get there (not too hard, but you do need to change buses). She then geared up and geared all of us up in full-length suits with helmets and headlamps, then we hiked across the street to enter the cave! It was very different from my first caving experience, which was in South Dakota--there were less rules and regulations but the cave was also not as exciting. (We had some folk tell us it is not worth it because the cave is so "boring." There are not a lot of geological oddities like stalagmite or stalactite, but there are fossils and crystals.)But the fact that they took in to consideration our needs and abilities made the tour totally worth it! Some of our group took a more challenging course while others took a less challenging course after getting a little tired out. There are some tight spaces and the suits sometimes make it hard to squeeze through--I did get stuck at one point until I was able to pull my suit up to release me (though the skinnier folk in our group had no issues). I really loved this down and dirty tour. It was was a lot of fun and I would recommend it to adventuresome people.Wear shoes that can be easily cleaned or that you don't mind getting dirty and, for women, it is helpful to have both a hair tie and a bandana to wrap around your head before putting on the helmet. You could also maybe bring a pair of tight-fitting gardening gloves for some extra grip. Our guides had on snug-fitting rubber boots, which were excellent for traction and dirt. My hiking boot treads filled with mud and became a little slippery at times.If you are someone with claustrophobia, I would not recommend this wild caving tour. Or if you are someone who is averse to some minor risk-taking/getting outside of your comfort zone. Or someone who does not like to be dirty!!

Highlight of our Budapest visit -- a must for adventure. I will start by saying that I did not want to go on this cave tour. I had promised my teenage son that we would go see the caves, but once I read the other reviews and saw some of the photos of people who had been caving I had a major anxiety attack. I literally could not sleep with worry, and woke up every morning wondering how I was going to manage this. (I am not making this up) - on the morning of the tour, I woke up, remembered watching the film « 127 hours » and thought to myself - I must remember to pack my swiss army knife in case I get stuck and have to saw a limb off. All to say, that I was quite nervous. However, I also thought to myself – am I never going to do anything adventurous ever again ? So I decided to do it. We met at the bus stop at the train station. We already had bought a travel ticket for the week (Can recommend this) so we didn't need to buy additional bus tickets. I was immediately relieved that there was a large group booked in -- all from youth hostels. Apparently the cave tour is very well advertised at the hostels. I was even more relieved when I saw a group of 6 young Japanese tourists in unsuitable footwear - I thought, if these guys can do it, so can I!The caves were about 30 minutes away. Our geoligist/guide (Salid) was friendly, and we discussed mountains & caves across the world. On arrival we changed to overalls and helmets. For footwear, we had bought our hiking boots, but most people had bought trainers with them which were fine. I had thought to bring my i-phone to take pictures but our guide discouraged this (dusty & dark, he said). So if you have a small, old, camera then I'd advise taking this. By the time we arrived at the entrance of the caves, I had built this whole experience up in my mind so much that the actual entrance and descent seemed easy. We entered via a man-made tunnel, then descended a 10m iron ladder into the caves-proper. We were in a group of 15 with one guide. The rules were that you checked the person in front and behind of you and passed on any tips to the person behind. The caves had a kind of "necklace" structure. i.e. there would be a tightish spot and then almost immediately you would be out in a more open area. I have to say that I didn't feel at all claustrophobic - to my great surprise. More so, I enjoyed each of the physical challenges. We took our time going round and the guide explained the geology of the caves. Every so often we would get to a spot where there was a choice between an easy route, and a tight tunnel. Here, you had the freedom to try something more challenging (my 14 year old son with his zero sense of danger, and 14 year old hips did everything and more of course). So, many of the super-tight spots images that you see online were actually optional (to my great relief). One last tip - we got out of the caves at about 8:30 pm -- I bought along some water and some crackers as my son was quite hungry by then. So, finally, this was the highlight of our trip to Budapest. I thoroughly enjoyed it, and would go again. At 46 years I was by far the oldest in our group (average age 25) and the only « mum » of course. I would recommend it to anyone who is not seriously claustrophobic , who enjoys a physical challenge.

Absolutely Fantastic. We had heard of this caves existence through a series of recommendations and frankly, it was the best part of our entire trip! It was our first caving experience and it was exactly what I had wanted. You have to climb walls, crawl through narrow passages that don't seem big enough, walk a long ledges where one side is a 4 metre drop and the other is just a wall and you get to experience "the true dark".

Great fun, sternuous activity. The underground trip took over 2.5 hours, with a great guide (fluent English, fun, and considerate), great sights, and a nice sense of adventure.The company organizing the tours supplies coveralls, helmets, and headlights; given the cave's high humidity (and the effort crawling up walls and down holes), be ready to sweat a lot!

Great tour, fascinating. I'm not a very outdoorsy person, but I really enjoyed my tour of this cave. The cave is not difficult or treacherous for an in-shape adult or adolescent, as they have put hand rails and steps in where needed. The guide shares both geological info and funny stories about the history and names of each of the sections.

Amazing time!. This tuk tuk tour was a lot of fun!!!!
It's a great way to see the city. The tuk tuk can get into places the busses and big red bus can't. I highly recommend this tour, my girlfriend and I had a wonderful experience. Daniel was a wonderful guide!!!! Loved him!

Awesome city tour. Very friendly guide, awesome driving and great sightseeing. Good selection of beautiful sights especially for people who haven't been to Budapest prior. Combined the Tour with a nice glass of wine and cheese platter afterwards. Keep it up.

Value for money. For 50 euro, this is a great way to see both Buda and Pest. The drivers/guides speak good English and will give you a quick lesson in Hungary's history and insight into each tourist attraction you visit.

Really good tour which great tour guides. These little machines can get through the smallest of gaps and traffic jams didn't cause any sort of delays. We hired 2 Tuk-Tuks for a group of 4 people they picked us up from the hotel and dropped us off at the 21 restraurantOur tour guides were Bertie and Adam, they both spoke great English and answered any questions that we asked. They dropped us off for a quick stop at the one of Budapest's Ruin pubs which we subsequently walked back to at the end of the tour.A big thank you to both of these guys as they could'nt do enough to help you.

Customized Tuk Tuk Tour -- Highly Recommended!. My parents, my husband and I took a 5-hour tuk tuk tour around Budapest on October 16th. The company was very easy to work with; we told them what we wanted to see, and they made it happen! They were happy to pick us up at St. Stephen's Basilica after Sunday mass, and we went from there. Peter and Paul were our drivers, and they were full of interesting history, facts, and stories; they knew Budapest! They were also extremely flexible: if we wanted to stop somewhere, or take a peek at something else, it was no problem. Peter and Paul were quite generous with their time, and both were extremely kind. It was fun riding around in the tuk tuks; we were able to cover a lot of ground quickly, something you could never do on a walking tour. We had just the best time, and we learned a lot, too. Thank you so much Peter, Paul, and Budapest TukTuk!!

Fun way to see the city. This tour was the highlight of our trip. The tuk tuk was able to wiz around with less traffic problems than a usual tour so we were able to visit more in the time. It was good that we were able to customise the tour to a degree, choosing where we spent extra time taking photos or visiting a site. We chose the tour ending in goulash as it left us near the fisherman's bastion with plenty to look at before a gradual walk down the hill to pick up public transport. Unfortunately I didn't enjoy the goulash but that was a personal preference, the restaurant was smart and helpful.

Best way to see the city!. Book a ride! The tuktuk tour is a great way to have a personal tour of so many different places in Budapest, along with learning some historical information along the way! With two children, 9&11, I cannot think of a better introduction to the city, see some great sights, and then it allowed us to pick a few other sights to spend more time visiting. Our tour guide was very entertaining, full of amazing history and stories, and so incredibly nice! I cannot say enough about what a great experience.
Nicest guy ever! Gave my mother 80+ years mother a ride, refused any payment!. This guy was energetic and sincere and knows the city and did a great job and is in a great location.
A lot of fun. This tour was this tourrecommended and it lived up to our expectations.Paul did a great job showing us around and explaining the sites.I would definitely recommend this tour.
short but sweet. We had only short time in the city but loved the Tuktuk service & Adam especially!He was so accommodating & helpful & made getting around a breeze. Would definitely use again!

Great value and stress free tour . I only had two full days in this amazing city. I was able to see all the spots in 2-3 hours. The city is so big and this is a great way to do it. I was able to quickly figure out where I should spend my time. I thought the we show everything package is a great value. The private driver/tour guy for approx. 2+ hours + free boat trip ticket is a nice touch. I did the night cruise next day. It was amazing.

Fabulous way to get an overview of Budapest!. Tuk tucks are so much fun, and this was a great way to get an overview of both Buda and Pest on our first day here. We signed up for the 2.5 hour tour ($135 for 2 people) and it was well worth it. Our guide, Daniel, was very flexible and knowledgeable. This was the perfect amount of time to see everything and figure out where we might want to go back and spend more time. We even helped participate in a tuk tuk engagement--a young man from England proposed to his fiancé at the base of the Liberty Statue in Buda, and we were there afterwards to offer our congratulations! All very fun.

Perfect city tour for foreigners. Our tour guide Bert picked up us on time at Kossuth Lajos metro station on the 1st of October.Bert was so excellent,friendly and informative,that we did see so much of Budapest and really enjoy this amazing city from a different way,.Everything's perfect!
Perfect City Tour. Enjoyed an amazing city tour our tour guide Barrabas have show us the best part of the city and made it so enjoyable with his story talent and flunet English. Suad

Piknik tour . Had a tour on Saturday with Bart it was a perfect way to start our Budapest trip allowing us time to see the city, get our bearings and tips for our later adventures. Bart was fantastic very helpful and extended our tour to give us time to take photos etc cannot recommend enough. The only negative thing I will say is the tour included a plate of meats & cheeses at the end with a bottle of wine. We swapped the wine for beers but the plate was disappointing - a few measly slices of 1 type of cheese and salami a few slices of bread and 5 olives! BUT the restaurant was fantastic, brilliant location and we bought the most amazing hot dog to supplement the plate so after all it worked well and we wouldn't have wanted to miss the place!

Touring in a Tuk Tuk. Thomas our Guide picked us up at our Hotel. We just had to walk out the front door and get into the Tuk Tuk. The weather was beautiful and Thomas asked us if there were any sights we wanted to see. I had a few requests and he also made some great suggestionstuff of sights we didn't know about. Thomas spoke very good English and was quite knowledgeable about the history of the sights we saw. He is a good responsible driver and had good command of the vehicle. I recommend Thomas and this private Tuk Tuk tour.
Great time with Bart.. Delightful way to see the sites. Bart was very interesting and filled us in on present day life in Budapest.

Tuk Tuk - a great way to see Budapest. Adam was a super tour guide - we didn't want the usual tourist tour so Adam took us off the beaten track. We saw so much more of Budapest than we otherwise would. Such a great experience, we would highly recommend it.

Great tour. Well worth doing, you see lots of Budapest and Peter our tour guide was excellent and very informative. I felt the tour provided a good point of reference for the trip so I would suggest doing it on your first day. We really enjoyed it.

Great Way To See The City. I went on this trip with several of my business associates and we had a great time. The trip was a little over 2 hours and we were able to travel through a majority of the city and see most of the key sites. We were provided adequate time to stop and get out at several of the key attractions and the guides were very friendly and knowledgeable. The TukTuk's fit 2 guests and a driver so we arranged for two since we had a party of 3. They are very mobile so they can navigate through the city easily and are open air. I have a much better appreciation for how beautiful Budapest is after this trip. I highly recommend it.

Great street level view of Budapest. So I needed a way to see all the main sites of Budapest, with limited walking involved and without the need to stand up all the time. Tuk Tuk Budapest offered the perfect solution. We decided to get one of their tours and add some extra time, which is nice as you'll get to see more, but you also need to make clear exactly how much you are willing to spend as you may end up enjoying Budapest a lot more than you expected. We had a great driver - Daniel - which took us all over. Gave us great details on all the main sites of Budapest and was more than happy to let us enjoy a bit of extra time at the sites and sounds of Budapest. Definitely a great option for those of you who don't have great mobility and need to limit your walking and still want to be able to be close to everything. Adding the extra time really worked for us. But people on a budget (money or time) should stick to the set schedule.

Brilliant Service!! Perfect organisation from them to help me propose to my girlfriend!!!. I visited Budapest with the intention to propose to my girlfriend. After scouring the internet for ideas I came across Budapest TukTuk. I had the idea to propose to my girlfriend at the top of Gellert HIlls, after surprising her with a TukTuk ride through the city.I was in contact with a lady called Bori - who could not be more supportive and genuinely excited by my idea. She briefed the driver (Mikkey) excellently and he helped keep it all a surprise.We was picked up from a river cruise and taken to Gellert Hills. I requested a bunch of flowers and champagne for after the proposal. Once I had proposed, Mikkey (the driver) came up and gave me the flowers in such a sly way I felt like James Bond. We then returned to the TukTuk where a bottle of champagne was popped and we continued the tour whilst sipping on the bubbly.Bori was a star in all of this. She was excellent with her communication and any query I had was promptly answered. The night went perfectly and a huge part of this must go to Bori for sharing over 30 emails with me really planned everything to the tee.Mikkey the driver was also fantastic and was briefed really well and kept the whole thing a surprise. Thank you to Mikkey, Budapest TukTuk and off course a huge thank you to Bori!Highly recommended and extremely good value for money. Planning on visiting Budapest on our anniversary and will certainty have another tour!

Not quite as exhilarating as in Asia. To me, Tuk Tuk, conjures up memories of fast and exhilarating rides I have done in lots of Asian Countries like Thailand, Philippines, Vietnam, Cambodia etc. Not here in Hungary...Very subdued as they probably have to be. The overall experience for our 100 minute tour was good. We did suggest where we wanted to go (we have been here before), so our Driver, Miki, was accommodating but not knowledgable of questions we had. Suggest the Company needs more drivers who are not only safe when they drive but also know a bit about their cities history and are familiar with tourism facts for those of us who are interested in this sort of thing.

Excellent way to see beautiful Budapest. We have visited many European Capitals as a group, and used many ways to see them,electric bikes, scooters and Segways to name a few, so this was another one to tick off the list, and we were not disappointed.Very knowledgeable and witty drivers Dan, Zol and Gabor Thank you !The end stop on top of the hill near the statue overlooking the Danube was quite a stunning view, of what is a beautiful City,one of the best we have visited.Gabor went out of his way to find us at the metro station as we were late due to unforeseen circumstances.Dont think about it.....do it!

Best tour!. This was our first time in Budapest, and the tuktuk is one of the best ways to see Budapest and learn the history of the city. Our driver Paul, was on time, very friendly, polite and very knowledgeable of the history of the city , willing to stop and take pictures, and showed us the best of the city. After he dropped us off at the hotel we had no problem walking around the city. We ate at the places he recommended, loved the soup bar! One of our best meals in Budapest. If you go to Budapest you must do the tuktuk, it's the best way to see the treasures of the city. Will definitely do it again.

Amazzziiiingggggg. Well what can I say... We went to koh samui in July and saw NO tuk tuks so when I found this company on google I booked straight away. The driver was early and his English was outstanding. We had Adam and he took us to the most relevant places and then to off the beaten track to see some awesome views of Budapest.He then dropped us off at a location specific to us what a fab idea. The only bad point would be they need to advertise more as this is an awesome experience thank you

Amazing experience . We took the "we show you everything" tour earlier this week and loved every second of it. Our driver Paul arrived on time at our hotel and brought us on the most amazing tour of Budapest. Paul was a really great driver and we felt safe and relaxed throughout the trip. His knowledge of the city and its history was fantastic. Our trip included a Danube boat trip and Paul brought us to the boat and sorted us out with the tickets. A truly magical day. Thank you so much Paul.

Sorry, but they didn't show up. Hate to give a bad review, but our experience wasn't great. In fact it was a non-event. We booked many hours in advance for a hotel pickup. We call them when they were late and they said the driver was 5 min away. 30 minutes into it we called again and the dispatch didn't answer. We then we're on our way to plan B.... poorly handled to say the least and ended up costing us precious sightseeing time. If you use this service, go to their meetpoint, not a hotel pickup. Hopefully you'll have better luck.

Perfect way to see Budapest. My wife and I took a 2.5 hour Tuk Tuk tour of Budapest with our driver/guide Peter. This was a great way to see the city and we were able to go to places that the tour buses could not reach. Peter, a university student, was very knowledgeable and obviously proud of his city. We were picked up and dropped off from our hotel which was a bonus for me as I walk with some difficulty. Thank you Peter. You made our visit to your beautiful city even more memorable.

Best of Budapest. Fantastic way to get a personal tour of Budapest especially if you are short on time, Adam and Zoli gave us lots of Historical information with passion, showed us the unexpected and made our tour fun. Thank You for A great Tour.

Awesome eperience. It is great to ride on the TukTuk, though it rides on the same road with all the cars, it is extremely safe to sit in the tuktuk and look around the city. The benefit of riding on it is that you can go through the paths that those big buses by other companies that cannot go through. It is also amazing that the tuktuk driver really know a lot about the city, and they can introduce to you about all the stories behind the roads/architectures, good places to go on your own, recommendations on places for eating, you can even stop and take the pic with the beautiful background while sitting on the tuktuk. Another benefit is that, whenever you have questions, you can ask the tuktuk driver immediately, and I am sure they will be able to answer you, I guess with the interactions with the driver, it more or less made me feel like i have a private tourist guide.

Highlight of our trip to Budapest. We had a great time on our tuktuk tour with the super informative and very helpful Daniel! We saw so many sights on the trip, found out history we would never have known and also as we did our tour on our first day it helped us plan out where we could go to explore for the rest of our time here. Had the best best time and must thank Daniel for his great tour and also for giving us sights to see on our map once the tour was up, just fantastic!!

What a great way of seeing the city!. Daniel took us on a tour of Budapest in his tuktuk. He asked about where we'd already been in order to find new places for us to visit. He was very invested and told us a lot. Once over, we felt that we'd covered most of the city, had a lot of fun and learnt a lot all at once.I very much recommend this tour.

Tour of Budapest City. We booked the night tour of Budapest and also the Everything you can see tour. My mother is older and so this was a great way to see the city and not have to walk too far it also allowed you to get into places that the usual tour bus can't. Our guide Thomas was great and you could see how passionate he was about Budapest. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would highly recommend the company.

Wonderful Experience! "I suggest The tour Guide Adam". This is a fabulous tour particularly if you only visiting Budapest for a short time.The guide Adam was a fantastic guide, who spoke excellent English, had good knowledge of the sights visited and was friendly. The Tuk Tuk were great fun whizzing around the city and I felt really safe with him. I saw a really mixture of areas which I couldn't do on my own.  Take this tour you won't be disappointed and for a very reasonable price.

absolutely amazing . amazing experience we loved it more than the double duck bus tour, I would highly recommend it,, the ride was amazing and informative also you could ask the guid anything comes to your mind, I would love to do it again

Friendly driver and a great way to see the city. I was recommended to try the tour out by one of my clients and I must say a great recommendation. Very easy to book and friendly service. The driver knew a lot of history and I would recommend this over the hop on hop off anytime. We booked the tour which cost €49 Euros and it took us around pretty much everywhere in Budapest. The tour ended with a free boat ride on the river. Tip: exchange your river cruise voucher at the boat office before you board the boat.

Great way to see the city. Took a ride through Budapest and hit all the highlights. TukTuks are uniquely suited for driving in high traffic tourist areas. They move in and out of traffic easily and can park in areas unavailable to cars. Our driver was knowledgeable and pleasant. Highly recommend this tour!

Our Budapest visit . Decided to take this tour after reading the reviews from trip advisor, so thanks to everyone who has taken the time to review previously. Need to add that I think you got it right. What s brill way to see the city, and get a good understanding of its history and culture. If your in town for a limited time I would suggest the 4 hr tour, we did the 2 1/2 hr which covered the parliament, and the Buda part of the city, the free cocktail at the end was pretty good as well. Fantastic guide, really good way to see the city from a one on one based. You really should give this one a go Well done and thank you to our guide today 31 st August 2016

Great ride. Was looking for a unique comfortable way to see the city . Was picked up promptly by my driver Barnabas who tailored my trip to exactly what I wanted, he was friendly and very informative. Great value !

A great way to explore the city. We booked the Romantic Budapest tour through our hotel and we are so happy that we did. Our tour guide Zoltan was so friendly, knowledgeable and has such a passion for the history of his homeland Hungary that you cannot help but be interested to learn more. We would highly recommend touring Budapest city on a TukTuk. It's an experience we will never forget.

yourney. Was so fun, Budapest is one of the best city in eastern Europe. Come and try out tuk tuk. Ádám, driver is so friendly and he does the best. :) You will love riding and sightseeing in centre of Budapest.
Great way to see the city. Fun way to see all the main sites of the city in one day. Beats sitting in a tour bus.... Thanks to Daniel, Gabon and Banni for a great tour.

Fun way to see the city!. The tuk tuk tour was great! A Last minute phone call booking and a tuk tuk was sent in the next half hour with all the available tour options. It was ready all set to cruise! Peter was a great and informative driver. Had a few laughs along the way so it was not boring at all.

Fantastic 21st birthday present.. We did the tour on our first day in Budapest and it was the perfect way to see the city. Our tour guide David was very friendly and informative about all the sights, he also answered all questions we had for him. We would recommened this tour to anyone going to Budapest. Our tour also included tickets for the hour cruise which made it very good value for money. Memorable experience and nice to be picked up and droppped off at the hotel.

An excellent experience. We booked the Tuk Tuk last minute on an evening and it was one of the best things we did. Our lovely and knowledgeable driver knew all the history of Budapest and its buildings. He drove us to all the hotspots and allowed us to take pictures, the highlight was the hilltop with an amazing view of the city. Definitely worth it!

Perfect Trip thru Budapest - a maximum of sightseeing and a little adventure. We´ve already recommended Budapest TukTuk to all our friends and colleagues - we don´t want to miss the opportunity to do so at TripAdvisor, too.Visiting Budapest one really should use this unique chance to get to know a city!We´ll do it again.Best regards, Kristina and Rainer from Vienna
Tuktuk guide tour. Really nice guide. Paid for 1 hour but the trip took 2 hours :) the guide told a lot about the city. Really good tuktuk trip!

Anniversary Special!. Booked the Tuk Tuk through our Concierge, Nina, on our Viking Vili River Cruise. What a fabulous way to see the city! Our drivers, Bart and Paul, were very knowledgable of the city history and were entertaining as well. Forget the bus and take the Tuk Tuk. You won't reget it.

Best way to see Budapest. We booked a tuk tuk tour as we wanted to do something different. Our driver Tomasz was amazing, a young man with great pride in his city and hugely knowledgeable about the history of Budapest. He asked us what we would like to see and then proceeded to take us to the places we'd asked. All the way he was giving us historical information about places we were passing. He stopped at each destination to allow us some time to look around and take photographs. He was also an excellent driver, we felt very safe with him. The tour lasted about 100 minutes and (with a small tip) cost 70 Euros. Well worth it. We thoroughly recommend this alternative way to see Budapest - all the back roads where the usual tour buses can't access!!Terry and Gina

Why to take a taxi if you can go with TukTuk?. We were using TukTuk at Paloznak JazzFestival. It was awsome experience to sit in a cabriolet :) Adam was our driver and he was really polite and funny. He was offering music but we preferred talking to him about the sorrounding landscape.

Top down with the city around you. A must!!!. Gabe picked us up at our hotel and the adventure began. We had the top down and zipped from sight to sight on back road that were not touristy. Very nice. Gabe told us about what we were seeing and with the top down you can here the sounds of the city as well as the smells of each Restraunt. This is not to be missedOpa Opa Opa

Charming!. We wanted to see the sights of Budapest but were not tempted by the crowded tourist buses in the area.We ordered a tuk tuk from its station in the middle of town.Michael (I hope that`s right) a very nice Hungarian student meet us after 20 minutes. He took us to the most famous sights of town and, did in a charming and knowledgeable way. We were really satisfied and would recommend this highly to visitors in Budapest!!

Great view of the city!. An absolute recommendation to view the city in an other perspective. Our guide Atilla was very well-known and good English speaking. You can ask your questions and see the city in an other way than the normal bus tour. You will go to streets where the bus is not going and see also other things. Absolute must do! ( we experienced it as even better as the bustour )
tuk tuk in Paloznak. yesterday eve i had my 1st tuktuk ....it was really great service at 3 am after finishing the party oin paloznak Jazz piknik...,-)....thanks&respect for Adam, the driver !! ;-)
Great site-seeing tour of Budapest. We had an amazing 100 minute tour driven by Péter.He could give us plenty of new infos about the famous places of Budapest.

Wonderful Evening Tour!. We took an evening tour on the Buda side of the city and it was a wonderful way to end our trip to Budapest. We were a caravan of 4 vehicles with adults and children and everyone agreed it was the best! Our drivers - Paul, Miki, Juhos and Beru - were all terrific, both fun and informative. Dealing with the company was a pleasure from the beginning - they even called me at home to confirm an online tour request, suggested the ideal tour and time for our group, and picked us up at the hotel exactly on time.
