They very wisely tailored the tour to make it interesting for the range of ages we had in our group and it was a great experience from start to finish. We explored Gellert Hill, the Buda Castle area and more and felt like we were the envy of all the other tourists who saw us having such fun. Can't say enough about this tour -- a must do in Budapest!

Great site-seeing tour of Budapest. We had a great trip round Budapest on the 2.5 hour tour. The guide was very knowledgeable and it really helped us to get our bearing in the city and plan out the rest of our stay. Would recommend.
Amazing tour, great way to see Budapest's sights! . Could not rate this tour more, great way to see the city, very personal trip and Zoltan our guide was so knowledgeable. Definitely worth it!

Amazing tour - perfect way to see Budapest.. We had an amazing 100 minute tour of Budapest driven by Daniel. He was the best host possible, knowledgable, friendly and welcoming. I would thoroughly recommend his tours .

Live streaming from the Tuk Tuk. What a great time we had with Daniel our driver as we took the 100 minute Tuk Tuk ride round Budapest last night. We live streamed the whole trip on Facebook and had people asking questions live from around the world which Daniel handled with great aplomb! Superb. Thanks!

Great trip!. I am very happy to have a chance to meet Adam. Adam is a young man with kind heart, wisdom and enthusiasm. He knows a lot and he can introduce the beauty of Budapest. He can show a lot of secret places and organize the schedule well. He can make your trip more comfortable, efficient and full of fun. You can trust him as a friend and ask any question you want to know. I highly recommend him as your travel guide.

Great service and a fabulous way to see Budapest. I am not a tourist bus sort of guy, but after climbing all the way up to the Freedom Tower in the heat, we decided we should maybe reconsider walking all of the way to the Fishermen's bastion. We came upon this tuk-tuk service and called the number. Within 20 minutes Miki, our driver and guide was there. He was incredible and took us all around Budapest, even to some "secret" spots with spectacular views and no tourists. He was deeply knowledgable about Hungarian history and appropriately proud of his city. I can't recommend this highly enough. It is a great orientation for a city that can be quite a challenge to navigate. We learned a lot and really liked Miki. It's also an incredible deal at 14 euro per person (plus we added a generous tip).

Unique & Special. We enjoyed every minute of our tour with our guide Daniel. The Tuk Tuk vehicle makes the experience unique & special. We loved the individualized aspect of the tour and were having such a great time that we even extended our tour with an added excursion to Margaret Island. Daniel offered us a wealth of information and answered all our questions. We would highly recommend this tour company based on our experience.

You MUST Do This!!!!. Our (good looking) driver, Gabor, picked us up outside our hotel and spent the next two hours showing us all the wonderful sights of the city. He stopped at various points for photo opportunities and was very knowledgeable.A lovely touch at the end of the tour - dropped off at Restaurant 21 for a bowl of fabulous Goulash Soup.Without doubt, THE best and most fun way to see beautiful Budapest.
The perfect tour!. Best way to discover Budapest. Very friendly and good looking driver, with good driver skills. Our group (2 tuktuk's) enjoyed every second of the tour.

Great way to see the city! . Yesterday we had a fantastic trip through the city in these tuk tuks. A great way to see a lot of the city in a small amount of time. The drivers are friendly and funny! They can stop wherever you like and know a lot about the city and it's background. They really enjoy showing you around. We definately had a great time, driving like crazy, racing and seeing the most wonderful places!
Hallo . We had nice tour with driver Adam.Our Grandson is happyThank you Today more tuktuk.Budapest sunshine tuktuk. Just perfekt day

An awesome tuk-tuk ride in Budapest. There were just too many nice things to say about this Budapest TukTuk tour, such as:1) it was so easy to book for this tour. We just booked via their website in the morning, for the ride in the evening; and they confirmed it immediately2) the ride came in-time (earlier than scheduled), no hassle3) you basically choose your own destination, and free to go anywhere within 60-minutes ride tour inclusive4) using Budapest card, you'll get 20% discount5) last but not least, we wouldn't have such great time without our driver-cum-tourguide: Bertalan. He's such a fun, polite & knowledgeable guy, it was just awesome!This tour is totally recommended!

A really funny way to discover Budapest!. Definitely the best way to discover the main points of interest in a big city like Budapest, in a very (yet very!!) funny way. We were driven around the cityby Thomas, a young local guy, on a typical TukTuk (a sort of motorbike with enough place to accomodate two people in the rear side). He told us about the history of the monument he took us to and we were amazed to get to know so many details in so short time with him. The tour lasted an hour but we were able to visit the Parliament, the main railway station, the Heros Square, the Opera House and some other attractions on this amazing means of transport. I would definitely recommend to choose Budapest TukTuk to discover the city, since the tour is custom-made and you can choose where to go and what to visit. The driver is at your disposal and you will end up in a bar enjoying a refreshing lemonade (incl. in the price) at the end of the tour. Definitely worth the price (19.00€). Thank you Thomas!

Great way to tour Budapest. We rented three tuktuks for the six in our party. This was a highlight of our trip. The drivers/guides, Adam, Thomas and Gabor, were excellent in every respect - friendly, knowledgeable and more than willing to go out of their way to accommodate us. They also worked together extremely well to keep the six of us in close contact. I give my highest recommendation and encourage others to take advantage of this great way to tour Budapest.

Tuk Tuk and away. We booked a Tuk Tuk tour of Budapest before our visit and contacted them to arrange a hotel pickup when we arrived .In my opinion this is the best way to see the city as you can travel to areas such as Margaret's Island where bus tours cannot .The biggest advantage of the tour is you get to choose where you go and finish and you can talk to a local about the city asking questions as you go .The tour is flexible and you can stop off where you want for a quick look round or a drink.The other bonus for me was the history lesson as we went round the city.I would recommend it to anyone visiting Budapest to do first thing so you can get your bearings and decide what to visit later on.
AS Conference. Great trip - what an unique way to see an astonishing historic city in Europe, staff was very friendly and informative - definetely will recommend ...

Interesting way to see Budapest . Our Hungarian friend recommended this unique guided tour of the major Budapest city sights of both banks of the Danube. From the backseat of this bike like taxi with the top down we watched our driver take us to key places and listen to him explaining the background history. He was courteous and friendly with good local knowledge. We were able to cover the castle area on the hill, the parliament building, the downtown squares, the monuments and many points of interest in a couple of hours. It would have been even better if they could provide earphones to allow us to hear the guide clear full above the traffic noise.

Great for children as well. We saw the tuk-tuks in front of St. Stephens church and decided to take a ride with the kids (2 & 6 yrs). We asked for a short 15 mins trip. Since it is a motor vehicle it cannot enter the pedestrian areas but we went towards the Parliament and then down to the Danube. Our driver Miki offered to cross the chain bridge which was an excellent idea. We all enyoed this weird mode of transportation and enjoyed being a tourist in our own city for a few minutes.

A unique and unforgettable evening with TukTuk. We were born and live in Budapest, but we really enjoyed to see the city as tourists.We started our trip after working on a weekday afternoon. It was enjoyable and comfortable for 3 of us just sit in the car and look around while our driver, Berci answered all the questions precisely. He was nice and patient when we stopped to take photos and he helped us a lot. We finished our 'exploration' at 360 Bar drinking cocktails in the sunset...Many thanks for the TukTuk team for the precious time and for all the great memories!:)

Fascinating tour!. Excellent tour of Budapest with our well informed drivers Barney and Bertie. More immediate than the open bus but much easier on the feet. This is the best way to see a lot in a little time. We know Budapest quite well and were shown new places we had not been to before. Our tour was in the early evening. Not so hot and less traffic. Ended up on Gellert hill at sunset with impressive views of the city as it came to life at night. Thoroughly recommended.

Budapest Tuk Tuk- Just do it!!!. I was in Budapest with my wife for three days and we want to see all the major attractions, monuments, and popular sights but with a more personalized approach. We didn't want to do the hop on hop off buses because they can get hot with so many people and they are often too slow. I found Budapest Tuk Tuk on tripadvisor and noticed how personal and accommodating they were, read all the wonderful reviews, and immediately made up my mind to book a tour with them. They responded promptly and picked us up at 9am, the exact time they told us they would be at our apartment. They come directly to your address and pick you up, so convenient! Our tour guide/driver, Bertalan, was so gracious and welcoming. He told us tons of facts and historical information about the city and its landmarks and monuments. Bert was extremely funny and a great tour guide. The Tuk Tuk rickshaw had an open back which allowed us to drive through the city with amazing unobstructed views. Due to its small size we were also able to navigate and maneuver through smaller streets and other great locations that were off limits to the big tour busses. In just about 2 and a half hours my wife and I had seen all the big highlights of Budapest, in comfort and style I might add, and we still had the rest of the afternoon to decide which of the places we had visited we wanted to return to in order to spend more time there. I highly recommend this company and want to personally thank Bertalan for making my wife and I feel like rock stars in Budapest. You get way more than your money's worth with this tour and company and I hope to return one day with friends and relatives and take them on a Budapest Tuk Tuk tour. If you are still reading this, book your tour with Budapest Tuk Tuk now, you won't regret it.

Budapest Tuk Tul. Our driver and guide Adam was a safe and very knowledgable person who was personable and helpful. He eagerly provided history on the many locations we passed and offered many options to consider. I would have no hesitation in recommending him and a Tuk Tuk is just the most fun to see the sights.

Budapest Tuk Tuk - the best way to see Budapest!. I have been living in Budapest for a few years and didn't know about Budapest Tuk Tuk until my mother came to visit. She is not able to walk around well or climb in and out of buses, so when I learned about Budapest Tuk Tuk I thought it would be perfect and indeed it was!! Adam, our driver/guide, was so wonderful to us. He even helped my mom in and out of the tuk tuk and offered his hand when she had to walk on unstable ground. He was a gentleman! Not only that, he was a great guide. He was able to tell us a lot about the history and important events and people of Hungary. We were very pleased and I will be recommending this to everyone!

1 day in Budapest / Solo American Girl. Single American girl wanted to see city of Budapest - I traveled 20 hrs arriving by overnight train & needed a tour that could show me everything in a day without waiting with large tour bus groups! As I'm continuing on the next day by train ... Tuk Tuk was perfect! My driver, Thomas, knew the city & sites incredibly well! I wasn't sure everything I wanted to see - so left most of it up to him. Great day & fun to go around town by Tuk Tuk. Yes, it was getting hot out, but the covered top & breeze while driving was really ok. Very personalized tour! I did tour 11-2pm, then he dropped me off at Market Hall for some tourist shopping then nice stroll along Danube. Plenty of time to even take a river cruise & stop at the 'ruins' pub street later on to cool off :-). Thanks Thomas!

Amazing way to sightsee!. My friends and I recently took the 'we'll show you everything tour including free Danube boat trip. As there were 7 of us, I emailed ahead to ask if this would be a problem because it appeared that the tuk tuks only accommodated two people. They responded promptly and advised that although they do accomodate 2, that we could have 3 in one of them. We found this to be ok and didnt feel squashed at all. The trip was brilliant, such fun as we were in convoy. The drivers explained and pointed out different sights and were knowledgeable about their city. We asked if we could stop off for a drink in a bar and they waited patiently for us whilst we did this. This obviously knocked some time off our tour so we didnt see the castle area but that was our choice and we still felt we had seen loads. At the end of the tour, the driver gives you a voucher to validate for a free boat trip on the Danube. This trip was just amazing. We all agreed that this tour was great value for money, especially when taking into account the hour long boat trip, again which is narrated on audio with a free drink too! I would highly recommend the Tuk Tuk trip as part of your experience in Budapest!

Great Way to Cover Lots of Ground while enjoying the breeze. Our Hotel was recommending the Hop On bus, which is probably good. But the TukTuk trip was exactly what we wanted. They send a driver/guide to your hotel in the TukTuk, a small 3-wheel golf cart-like vehicle but with more power and speed. For about $55 US you get a 2-1/2 hour spin to some major sites while visiting nice neighborhoods in the Buda side and at the City Park. It's private, just you and the guide, no crowds or jostling on and off buses. Our guide was Gabor, who not only spoke good English but gave us the benefit of local history and geographic insights that made Budapest all the more interesting. He dropped us at the Marina since the price included a one hour boat tour which was also excellent and provided great views of both shorelines while being well narrated by a tape. This is a great overview which we followed up by going back later in the day and next day to visit a few sites we wanted to see more of (using a cool scooter we rented from Scooter Budapest, but that's another review).

Three hours of sheer delight touring Budapest. The Concierge on our Viking River boat said the best way for us as having some mobility issues was to see Budapest via the Tuk Tuk. The Viking representative in our hotel also told us the same thing so she made a reservation for us. Paul arrived promptly at the set time and off we went with the top down. It was not long until the weather threatened so he put the top up. There were blankets in the "buggy" but unfortunately they were wet from the rain we experienced. He offered to put the sides on to keep the rain out but we said we were OK (my wife used her umbrella at her side to keep the rain off). I was just fine. Paul drove us all around the city on both sides of the Danube and took us places no other hired transportation would be able to take us.Paul would turn and face us and give us all the information we could (and could not) handle about Budapest. He spoke perfect English and was so knowledgeable. Our tour was priced at 46E each but he took US dollars which was great. Paul is the best!!!

What a great way to explore Budapest. This is a fantastic tour. I was able to explore most of Budapest in a matter of hours. The compact size of the Tuktuk makes it very versatile and allows it to avoid traffic. I was impressed that the driver is very knowledgable and friendly. At every destination where most tours drops you at the parking lot, the Tuktuk are able to drop you right at the door step. A must for visitors to Budapest.

Taken For a Ride!!!! A Five-Star Ride!!!! Tuk Tuk FOREVER!!!!!!!!. Hot off the presses - - Our tour was TODAY, June 23, 2016!!! Just can't wait to report!!! Oh, people!!! Tuk Tuk is not just for Bangkok anymore!!!!! Adam, you darling young man!!! I pause to sing your praises!!!! This is THE WAY TO GO!!!!!! Adam picked us up promptly at 11:00 a.m. Annnnnnd We werrrrrre OFF!!!!! TukTuking round Pest, and later, over the river, into Buda! Every beautiful thing, every interesting thing, Adam introduced us to them all! With more time in the city, we could go back and extend time at any of these places, but we won't have time!!! Even with such a short time, we are delighted to say we have truly SEEN Budapest!. The people of Hungary have engaged in vigorous restoration of beautiful buildings and places that were destroyed during World War II, and neglected under the Soviet control. Never have we seen buildings so beautiful in design - - from various eras of architecture -- and so lovingly maintained. Bright clean, scrubbed or freshly painted - - not sure - - but everything with pride and determination, kept in excellent condition and order. A true gem of a city!! And Tuk Tuk Tours takes that pride and determination on up another notch or two, showing you the entire city - - parks, buildings,monuments, lovely tree-lined streets, all with Adam's gentle, intelligent, knowledgeable comments on history and happenings. What a perfect way to invest our time here!!! This little electric pony cart edges in and out of places where any larger vehicle could not beGIN to go!! As we zipped along, we observed bus-loads of people following guides in groups a block long, to see various and whatever. Lots of staring at us, with clear looks on their faces, wondering how we got THAT!!! I tried really HARD to smile without smug!!!! Such a happy trip!!! We're LOVIN' it!!! Our driver/guide Adam was ALL ABOUT what would be interesting and pleasing to us, helping us love Budapest and Hungary. Well, Adam, THAT'S THE WAY I LIKE IT!!!!! Thank you for our wonderful, wonderful trip, in your wonderful Tuk Tuk!!!! Thank you for all your caring, considerate, sweet help with my stiff knees and ankles!!! Your thoughtful kindness will forever be a bright star in our European tour!!!!! TripAdvisor People!!!! If you are planning a trip to Budapest, we urge you to include Tuk Tuk Tours as a part of your plan. If you are NOT planning a trip to Budapest, we urge you to do so!! immediately!!! :~)

Tuk Tuk Margaret Island Tour. My wife and I had a wonderful morning with Adam driving and guiding us on our Tuk Tuk tour of Margaret Island in Budapest. Adam arrived exactly on time at our central Budapest hotel. After brief introductions and presenting him with our pre-arranged voucher we were on our way.Adam gave us a choice of two possible routes to Margaret Island and after suggesting we would like to enjoy his expertise and allowed him to choose the route. Travelling towards the riverfront route Adam asked if we were at all interested in learning more of the history of the area. We were happy we indicated we were as he was full of little kid-bits of information as to the naming of particular features and structures as well as the sometime good fortune / sometime misfortune of the area being in a desirable location and having desired agricultural and economic features that resulted in many armies battling over the region from the time of the Romans onward.Our tour through Margaret Island was delightful under the shade of many large trees. Adam was extremely receptive to our questions and readily able and willing to quickly search out the english name for a number of tree varieties we had questioned him about. He also gave us time to wander slowly through the region surrounding the musical fountain and were able to obtain a number of beautiful pictures of the impressive trees and gardens surrounding the fascinating fountain. On our way back from the island we travelled the river route on the Buda side of the river and took a side trip through some of the castle district and up to Fisherman's Bastion where we had another opportunity to wander and have a look at the spectacular views of the city from there. Having completed that excursion, Adam asked us for our desired drop-off location and as we had other plans for the afternoon he returned us expeditiously to our hotel where we were picked up.All-in-all, this is probably the best experience we have had in our two separate trips to Budapest; due mainly to the pleasant, polite, and knowledgeable nature and attitude of our Guide. Currently I am unable to walk great distances was I am currently awaiting joint replacement. This tour provided a wonderful opportunity to experience a number of features even with my condition - greatly appreciated!Thank you Adam!

Good fun, Good Value Nice Guys.. On our last day in Budapest, very hungover and 2 hours until we needed to be at the airport. Tuk Tuk tour and take us to the airport please! In hindsight we wish we had taken the tour on the first day because it was great. If you like being pointed at, stared at and giving people a giggle this is the way to arrive at the airport. Zlatan is funny and knowledgeable. Overall 5 stars
best ride. one of the biggest experience in budapest. good driver and nice city from the perspective of a tuktuk. Gabor was kind well prepared
Amazing!!!!!. Loved getting to ride around and tour the city!!! It was an awesome experience and the tour guide was incredibly helpful!!! Barnabas!!!!
Budapest. Budapest tuk tuk sight seeing tour was amazing! We had fun with my friend ~ :) we went to St Gellert's Square ~! :) Thanks Bertalan for it! :) :D
Awesome experience. Thank you Budapest tuktuk for teaching us more about Budapest.We had luck to have Bertalan as our driver who was really careful and polite.
Tuk tuk ride. Osum ride...!! Had a gr8 tym with barnabas n bertalanits a must try as dey r very helpful n courteous so guys do try it

Brilliant!. We visited Budapest for 2 days before our Viking River Cruise and with the help of Petra worked out a route with the TukTuks which didn't clash with our included bus tour. I can't remember the last time I had so much fun!! We hired two TukTuks with our son and daughter-in-law in the other one. The drivers, Zoltan and Mike, were a great source of information as we zoomed around the city, visiting small streets away from the main traffic as well as Margaret Island which was really beautiful. I think it was well worth the fare it was so enjoyable. I would highly recommend this way of travel to anyone wanting something a bit different.

Tour with Adam. Having only one day to explore Budapest I decided to use the Tuktuk "all you can see" service to get a general feeling of the city. The concierge at The Corinthia Hotel called the night before in a rush. The next day, at the agreed time, the Tuktuk was there driven by Adam. He greeted me and explained where we were going. He did a great tour of all the landmarks with very insightful information. A very clean and comfortable way of seeing the city. At the end of the tour Adam dropped me by the ferry ride on the Danube which is included in the price. The best way of finishing a trip around town. It was raining but the boat was comfortable.

Chillest way to see the city. I simply loooved this tour. The tuktuk is super cute, you can use it even if it is raining as it is a convertible. We had a sunny day, and we had a blast with Alex, the driver, who showed us around, took us to the main attractions and told us stories of Budapest. Highly recommended!

Excellent!. I pre-booked a 3 hour tour before arriving in Budapest, and altered my pickup time to fit in with other activities. This was not a problem and my driver, Paul, arrived on time at my hotel. We then proceeded to visit all main areas of both Pest and Buda. Paul was a very well informed and articulate young man, and I was able to learn so much about the early and more recent history of Hungary. I appreciated his politeness and care, and he willing to answer all my questions, often adding an extra insight. It was certainly a great way to travel around the very busy tourist spots, especially in Buda where there were dozens of big buses with hundreds of people, and we were able to move at a pace that suited us both. I can certainly recommend Budapest Tuk Tuk to any visitor who is wishing to have a more personalised service and who wishes to avoid the usual large group tours. Thank you for a most memorable day Paul.

Best way to see the sights. We were looking for some cool way to go around the city. My friend recommended the little Tuktuk's, so we tried it. It's great fun! Balint, our driver knew all the little details about the city, even the party places. Make sure you ask for him when you go!

The best advanture to explore the city, to enjoy it with your friends. It was the best idea to celebrate a bachelorette party with Budapest Tuktuk. It was the biggest surprise and present to the hen and to the whole team! We could surf through the city in the best mood, music, having the greatest fun! The drivers were very generous and nice guys! The main point of the whole event! Thank you Bp Tuktuk for this lifetime memory!

Three Tuk Tuks in convoy was a great trip around Budapest.. This was an excellent way to see the city on our first visit. Three adults and 6 year old triplets had lots of fun travelling together alongside the Danube. The children loved Margaret Island and looking back at the Chain bridge from the Citadel. Tamas, Peter and Gabor proved knowledgeable and very helpful guides as well as capable drivers.This is an excellent and fun way for an introduction to Budapest. Oh, and the goulash at 21 was ace!

Charming way to see magical city. Budapest Tuk Tuk provides an intimate and comprehensive overview of this beautiful city!! We were picked up at our hotel at a time convenient for us. So much better than a big bus on a set schedule with lots of people! Our guide was excellent- friendly and informative. We felt like he personalized our tour of Budapest just for us. He stopped at points of interest so we could take pictures at our leisure-Never felt rushed-and he ended the tour by dropping us at the restaurant of our choice!

Colorful tuktuk ride around the city. The most interesting way to discover Budapest!The staff is very friendly and well-trained about the hidden secrets of the city. You can choose a small, romantic private tour or a round in the noisy corner of Budapest, even if you want to go at night! The tuktuk ride gives you a unique, happy, energised feeling, you will have fun! In the end of the tour you can choose a restaurant to try the hungarian goulash, have a glass of excellent hungarian wine, go to a rooftop bar to have a crazy coctail, continue your trip with a boat tour!⛴The city is amazing and this is the best way to feel the pulse of it! Love at first sight with the cute, little motors! You will see, that everybody gives a smile for them! ☺️ So the service is more than perfect, don't miss one of the tours! Highly recommended!
Cool programs arraund Budapest.. Friendly Stuff. Competent service. Unfoegatable experience. Cool programs. Highly recomended!!!:) The best in Budapest for turist!!!
Charming city tour.. Cruising with the Tuktuk is probably the best way to explore Budapest in 60 minutes and capture the flair of the city in a summer feeling. Also very friendly and informative.
Feel Free. Best trip in Budapest downtown. We loved the Cabrio feeling. Highly recommend a TukTuk tour to anyone. ImadTuk-Tuk. ❤️

4 Tuk Tuks in a Row. Our group of 8 went in 4 Tuk Tuk on the city tour. The drivers Pal, Daniel, Gabor and Tamas were very friendly, knowledgeable and understanding with our groups needs.All 8 of us had a very memorable time and enjoyed the Tuk Tuk experience.Highly recommend a Tuk Tuk tour to anyone wanting a fabulous time!

Tuk Tuk Budapest by night. While in Budapest recently, we took at tuk tuk tour by night to see the city lights and do something that we couldn't do back at home! We had a wonderful time! Our driver, Thomas, was a personable young man who is a proud ambassador for his city! As soon as we entered, he gave us a blanket as it was a cooler spring night, in fact, the first night of tuk tuk season! We gave us a tablet that was connected to a GPS, and we could visually watch where we were headed on a map of Budapest. At interesting sights where the Thomas stopped there was an audio narrative to correspond with the sight. Thomas gave us additional insight into the city through conversation, took us yo the highest point of the city yo overlook the lighted buildings and bridges and fulfilled a request to get a close up of Parliament! He even took our picture in front of it! For a fun, reasonably inexpensive private tour of Budapest, take the tuk tuk city your at night and ask for Thomas.

Epic city tour!. My sister and I chose the we will show everything tour, it was a fantastic experience. The weather was great so we could enjoy the cabrio-style ride, the city is so marvellous. Our driver Alex was so kind and funny, we enjoyed his company, and he had great stories to tell about the city. Excellent way to discover Budapest!

Visited Budapest with Parents. Had an absolutely wonderful day tour in the TukTuk, driven by Gabor. Had no idea he was new to the team- was a great and courteous driver and answered our questions about life and culture and drove us around in the sunshine. I booked the tour for myself and my parents, both of whom are in their late 60s, and I'm in my early 30s. While I could explore Budapest from dawn to sunset, they don't always have the energy to walk all day and explore big cities by foot, even though they have the interest. The tuktuk seemed like a great way to see it all and it absolutely was. You don't feel stuck and above/separated from everything like in a tour bus and you cover SO much terrain and see so many sights. It's a very personal experience where you can ask questions and engage, stop and wander and experience the city. It really is the ideal way to travel and I know I will be booking this kind of transportation in any city I travel where it is available. The transportation itself is fantastic and Gabor really made the trip that much more enjoyable :) I am so glad we booked this tour!

Above our expectations!!. We got tuk tuk voucher as part of hotel package and I was doubting how it will look like, especially that we have one son 13 and another one 2.5 years old. But the ride was amazing!! We all enjoyed the tour so much! Guys were so kind and great, stopping on interesting places, telling stories about those places... My little son fell asleep, we covered him with blanket and it was so nice riding in tuk tuk with him asleep on my lap Thanx for a great day in Budapest! Hope you will have a lot of work in the seasons that come!
It's a muss!. It is so much fun driving with tuktuk through budapest! You can see all great buildings and the City. The divers are really nice. Thank you so much for the tour.
Friendly and welcoming. Great service everyone should try it at least once while you're in Budapest! I really recommend for everybody!

Budapest from head to toe. The most excellent way to visit Budapest from head to toe, from the citadella of Buda to the smallest streets of the center of Pest. Our guide was competent, friendly and very patient when he had to wait for us at the different sights. Overall a beautiful experience!!!

Amazing City Tour in Budapest. Amazing experience for foreigners and locals! You can see Budapest from a different way. Just sit down in your TzukTuk and enjoy the beautiful city! Our driver, Tamas was so kind and helpful!We are really enjoyed our trip! :)

Best experience ever!! . The tuktuk experience was fabulous! My boyfriend and I saw most of the city, and had the opportunity to hop off and look around and get pictures.We had music and the driver (Dan) was very friendly.We would recommend this to anyone and everyone!

Fantastic way to see beautiful Budapest . So pleased we decided to see Budapest using the tuk tuk tour, we did the see the the whole of Budapest tour and was well worth it, was around 2 and a half hours but it flew by, the guide was really good and told us about the history of the city, much more personal than just going round on an open top bus. If your only in Budapest for a few days it's highly recommended as you get to see all the stunning locations in a few hours.

Amazing experience! . My tour guide was prompt outside at 10:00. He was lovely as I was traveling on my own. I did the 360 tour as there were a few things I specifically wanted to see. It's such a great way to see the city, and they offer a wide variety of tours to suit everyone's needs! Plus the vehicle itself is so cute! Highly highly recommend. The customer service before and after was brilliant too!
Best way to see the City . Brilliant guide, such a friendly, informative and flexible chap. We couldn't stop smiling the whole trip. Cannot recommended highly enough. Thank you!!!

A mi esküvöi autónk, our wedding car. I surprised my fiancé ... well, by that time she was already my wife ... with a tuktuk trip from the church in Máriabesnyö to Veresegyház. It was fantastic, I strongly, strongly, strongly recommend this!There are two reasons for that: One: My wife loved me for it. It was a wonderful trip. Second: The Budapest Tuktuk Team was great! They gave us an absolutely decent offer, communications with Vivien were fantastic and they actually drove out to Gödöllö, which is a bit of a ride and which must have been fun for the driver.Some more details: The tuktuk was there on time, which I didn't know, but my best man took care of the preparation. Because right after church we were greeted by a tuktuk with many red balloons and a smug driver. We hopped on and he had a playlist of french chansons prepared, which was great for the occasion. We took a wonderful tour and had a great time, enjoying the first minutes of being married.We then reached the étterem and while my wife and I had our first champagne, the driver stayed another hour or so, so that the children amongst our guests (yes, there were some very old children) could have a chance to take a little tour in the tuktuk.So thanks again, the tuktuk was an important part of our wedding!!!

The best way to visit Budapest. Atilla was our driver on this glorious morning of Sept 3rd 2015. We loved this tuktuk ride so much: definitely the best way to see Budapest. We stopped at all major attractions on both the Pest and Buda sides of the river. He wasn't shy with the details from history to culture to politics. The best thing was also that we could overtake all coach buses, park almost anywhere for a few snaps and beat the crowds at all attractions. Highly recommended!

Best way to see the sights. Absolutely brilliant time. Paul my driver was ace. Electric blanket was provided as it was a bit cool. I would recommend Budapest TukTuk to everyone who is looking at coming out. So many sights to see and ooooh the cafe life style= I love it. The trip was well worth the money. Thanks guys
Great! in 1 word -great service! tuktuk budapest. great service very nice driver we went with robert and saw all the bridge parlamant and get expalation about all view

Best way to get a flavour of Budapest. We booked 3 tuck tuks with theses guys and Attila, and his mates turned up at the hotel, with great tuk tuks, and a wealth of knowledge of Budapest. They were great and gave each of us a different flavor of Budapest. Well worth the money and each of us got something different out the experience.bthese guys are great!

Tuk Tuk Tour. We took the 2 1/2 hour city tour. This was a great way to see the city! Tour guide (Atilla) was wonderful. He was very knowledgable and friendly and gave us a great understanding of the history of Budapest and Hungary in General.

The Best Way To See Budapest. I have to say I was hesitant about taking a tuk tuk tour. Not sure why but I am so glad I did. The only thing I can say was a mistake was leaving this for my last day instead of it being my first day activity. Our driver Robert was just amazing..I truly can't say enough about him. He met us at our hotel and was even early. We took the We'll Show You Everything tour- about 2.5-3hrs. Robert asked us what we had already seen and he modified the tour as to not take us to places we had already seen. Robert was a wealth of knowledge and an obvious historian and was always willing and able to answer any questions we had. He took us to a special park and explained the history of Buda and Pest. A very special and personal touch. This is such a more personal tour than the hop on hop off bus tours- and very much worth the money spent. I couldn't recommend this enough to anyone visiting the beautiful city of Budapest. We covered in hours what it would have taken days to do on our own- and was shown lesser known areas of the city that many tourists don't see. From start to finish, Robert treated us with respect and kindness and was really engaging in conversation- He LOVES what he does and it shows. Thank you Robert and TukTuk for making our trip to Budapest so very wonderful and exciting. At this time they have 7 Tuk Tuks and many packages available to suit most needs. (tour was in English)
Sightseeing. Bästa sightseeing ever !! Attila var riktigt bra guide. Best tour and guide we ever had intresting and fun. We took 150 min city tour.

Terminal Restaurant and Budapest TukTuk package. We took four TukTuk's at night after our dinner at The terminal (8 people - 2 in each TukTuk). It was the highlight of my entire trip. We raced through the streets of Budapest and up to the Statue of Liberty with the olive branch. The city lights at night were wonderful. The drivers of the TukTuk's were so so fun. Dinner at the Terminal was very good too.If you like a little excitement this is for you.

Favorite experience in Budapest!. We took this tour as part of a suggested promotion of Viking and it was the highlight of the trip. We had dinner at Terminal Restaurant and then the TukTuk picked us up for a city tour. We had a group of 8, so split up into 4 tuktuks, and had a great time sightseeing together. Our guide, Attila, was personable and knowledgeable showing us many city highlights. I only wish we could have taken a second trip during the day to see more sights! (This was much better than the hop-on, hop-off bus.)

The tuk tuk tour was fantastic. We had Attila "the Fun" as our driver and he was brilliant. We started at 7:30pm so it was a night time trip and it was great fun. Crossing the Danube in a tuk tuk when the bridges are lit up is serious goose bump stuff. We were pretty well oiled but Attila was unfazed and the perfect guide. He filled us in on the local history and tips for the local ladies, all pretty tongue in cheek and with a big smile. The perfect way to cram some culture into a boozy Budapest visit. Very highly recommended.

Tuktuk power!. A great, offbeat way to see the city. Our driver and guide was Attila... don't worry: not that one ;-)The driver's enthusiasm, charm and know-how (combined with the hilarious mode of transportation) really made our day: highly recommended!

Tuk Tuk tour of the city - Excellent!. Our Viking River Cruise Concierge recommended the Tuk Tuk as a way to get back to our hotel after walking to our restaurant in Budapest. We were NOT disappointed! Attillo, our driver, took us on a one hour tour of the city. He was accommodating, professional, offered great history facts and as a native Hungarian, was very knowlegable about the city.

Go on tour that will take your breath away, and leaves you with a smile. I found out about it coincidentally, when a Tuktuk stopped in front of my hotel, and a very happy tourist stepped out of it. I instantly thought this it is a brilliant idea to do a tour this way, so I booked one for the following day. Balazs, the driver, picked me up and off we went. 5pm was the perfect time, the light of the sun coloured the horizon and sights looked even more fabulous. The tour ("Budapest pro") was set to 150 minutes, just enough to get to see the best spots. Balazs was very helpful and entertaining, and you could feel he enjoyed his job. I would recommend this tour to any Budapest 1st timer, and do it on the 1st day right away. It will help to get a feeling for the city and help you find the best spot to return to on your own.

Do it!. I absolutely recommend this on your first visit to Budapest. It's the best way to get the lay of the land, and figure out where you may want to come back and spend more time. It's definitely the best way to get to the top of Gellert Hill, which has the best views of Budapest.The Tuk Tuk will pick you up at your hotel, and the driver will show you the major sights, and wait for you while you explore. Riding in the Tuk Tuk is fun in itself, and the guide will customize the tour to your needs as well if there are things you want/don't want to see. FYI - the Tuk Tuk only fits two, so this works best for couples.

Brilliant tour, excellent staff, must try!. Although I'm living in Budapest for 3 years, these guys made our tour with my date one of the highlights of my stay in the city. Truly pliant and helpful staff, amazing amount of territory covered with a stand up routine by a very cool guide, Budapest from the eyes of a local you want to get to know! You get to see the hidden beauties of the city as well, you'll love it!

Best way to see Budapest....Tuk Tuk. Thank you for a wonderful experience. The best way to see Budapest, by far. I’m so glad I decided to take the tour, I’ve recommended you to all my friends. We had a fantastic guide “Robert”. He made it all very special and Robert you have a great way of making tourists feel welcome to this glorious city.Thank you again.Ruby

A perfect way to view the city. This was one of the highlights of our visit to Budapest, we chose the Castle tour as it was the perfect way to view the Castle hill area especially as it was followed by a picnic and bottle of wine included in the price.Alex our guide met us very close to the hotel we were staying at, he spoke great english and was full of information about the area and happily answered any questions we had. We really enjoyed the experience of being driven through the city amongst the traffic as it made us feel apart of it, it also helped us to get an awareness of our location and where other places were that we wanted to visit.Once we drove over the bridge into the Castle Hill area we were able to stop at the Citadel for 15 minutes to get out and look around before Alex took us to Fisherman's Bastion etc, Alex told us loads of interesting facts about the beautiful architecture and we finished at the Piknik Pavillion where our wine and lunch awaited us. It was the perfect tour 90 minutes long which then gave us plenty of time after lunch to visit the Royal Palace and to look round the whole area before catching the Funicular train back down to the bridge.Can not recommend this trip enough we loved it !!

Tuk Tuk city tour. It was a terrific way to see the city. We only had a day and a half in Budepest. We took the 2 1/2 hour tour and our guide, Atille, was great. We felt we received a genuine flavor of the city in a short period time. Highly recommend it.
The best tour ever. It was the best tour ever and Bob was the best driver, guide and such a nice, kind person. I absolutely recommend Bob and tuktuk! Enjoy!

The best way to get around. Fantastic time!!!!We really had fun... Donny and David know so much, we used them over two days to see all the sites and bar hop. Felt like VIPs a true 5 star service thanks guys I would say to anyone who hours to Budapest if you don't do the Tuk Tuks you are missing out !!Clare, Shaun,Dean and Sarah
Greatest way to see Budapest!. Excellent way to see the city, cute, romantic, pleasant, and with great guide and driver Bob! Highly recommended !

Lovely way to see the city. It was absolutely great to have different kind of sightseeing. Only took it in Bangkok before, but here is much more fun!My guide Tamas took me to Gellert Hill to see the lights of Budapest, was a great end of my journey!Hughly recommended program for everyone!

Best way to see the city. We had a limited amount of time to tour the city and the London type bus tours are generally more frustrating than fun to me. This private Tuk Tuk tour was exactly what we hoped it would be. Friendly, courteous, knowledgeable driver took us on a safe 2.5 hour journey around the city. Worth every bit of the time and money spent. Highly recommend!

great city sightseeing. Just had a tour with Budapest Tuk Tuk. It was gorgeous. Met our driver Robert at Deak ter, and went up to the Citadell. Already saw the city, except the Gellert hegy, and was the last night of the stay, and the birthday of my friend. So was a surprise for him. was great to customize our trip. went to see the lights of the city then took us straight to the restaurant where we booked in advance. He put birthday music on, was amazing experience! If you want a great jurney, definitely need to try this service!

City tour. My wife and I took this tour. The best value tour I have ever taken. Our driver and guide Tommy was very informative and went where no bus has access. The Tuk Tuk is fitted with Wi Fi and we showed family in Australia the sites while we toured. We were given miniature bottles of Hungarian Vodka. I am yet to try them. We paid 78 euros for a 150 minute tour. Forget the crowds, this is the best way to find the layout of the city. Tommy spoke perfect English. Leon from Melbourne, Australia
Tuk tuk budapest. I loved the tour on the tuk tuk's! Our driver Alex, was full of information and spoke very good English. Very well priced! Thanks Alex :)

40th birthday. We had a couple of hours to kill in Budapest so glad we did this tour, Attila was our guide he picked us up from the hotel within 30mins of booking. He took us everywhere and taught us a lot of history and told us lots of stories. Our only regret is that we didn't do the tour at the start of our weekend, we saw lots of places that we just didn't have time to revisit as we had to rush off to catch a plane home immediately after the tour.

Fabulous way to experience Budapest!. We recently spent a few days in Budapest before embarking on a river cruise. Our local, incredibly knowledgable guide introduced us to Budapest TukTuk as a unique and interesting way to travel around the city. We had a fabulous experience and want to share it with TripAdvisor. We were fortunate to have Attila as our driver and he was just excellent. The small TukTuk car was able to navigate the narrow streets and take us to places we otherwise would not have seen. We engaged Budapest TukTuk get around the city in the daytime, and then we engaged them again to give us a guided tour of the city at night, which was just spectacular. Having a personal, knowledgeable guide, an open air ride, and access to places a bus can't get to is a winning formula, and for a price that's affordable. If you are visiting Budapest, TukTuk is the way to go. And ask for Attila. He's a rock star when it comes to giving a guided tour. Five stars!

BOB!!!. The best of the best Tuk-tuk drivers, for sure! He was very kind and polite, showed us around. It is good that the driver is also a guide, who can tell about history, politics and economics. We were happy to be Bob's customers :)

Have to try!. The trip was a birthday surprise by my "better half" as I have never tried tuktuk before. Being a citizen here didn't make our guide, Robert task easy but he managed to show some parts of Budapest I haven't seen before ;) Love our city and this is a great way to explore, not even mentioning all the smiling faces looking at us.

Go places where no bus has gone before. Spent the morning of our last day seeing all the bits of the city that we missed on the hop on hop off or by walking, our driver was a great guide and took us to locations only accessible on a tuk tuk or bike, we never felt as though we would fall over despite the 3 wheels, a very enjoyable time that went really quickly

Fun, fun, fun!. It was an amazing experience. We had a Budapest TukTuk trip with two of my friends to celebrate my friend's birthday. Budapest was beautiful of course and the trip was very exciting. Our guide, a very funny and kind guy gave us a tablet when we sat down, so we could set the music, what we wanted to listen to duting the trip. Singing crazy happy songs in a TukTuk on a warm spring night with your friends...priceless!

Recommended for any occasion. As I saw it in the city I knew I will love it. First time I used it with friends for transport, to try it. Later we ordered a trip for a hen party, 6 of us were travelling with 3 TUKTUK, everyone really enjoyed it, especially the bride, so it was a part of her wedding gift:)Definitely will use it again!Don't miss it!

Endless fun with friends. We had an amazing time during our TukTuk ride around the city! These guys are the perfect entertainers, they know everything about the city. Their tours are well organised and they are also very flexible to your needs. I think everyone should try this!

TukTuk Tour with Gregory!. Great job! We take rickshaw's in every city we visit (if available) and this TukTuk motorized 2-hour tour was one of our best! Gregory was polite, interesting and informative - plus, he knew Budapest and all of its "secret sites" adding just the right amount of historic detail to make it interesting without info overload. We took the tour on our 2nd day in Budapest and thought we had seen nearly all of the highlights, but Gregory helped us discover even more. A splendid trip with an exceptional guide and his English was beautiful. Thank you Gregory Pastor for a great Budapest experience.Ed and Pat - Palatine, IL USA
Fun,fun,fun!. Driver knowledgeable and pleasant. picked up at hotel right on time, dropped where we wanted. Blankets ready if chilly too.

Tuk Tuk Forever. We used Budapest Tuk Tuk to go to bars during my hen party and it was simply amazing! The Tuk Tuks are really funny, the drivers are super cool, the city shows you its best face from a Tuk Tuk. So we all loved it and it was one of the best surprises I have ever had in my life. Thx my dear sister and friends and of course thx Tuk Tuk!!!

Don't miss this experience!. We had a great time! It was both fun and romantic for us. The only issue was that the tablet's audio tour kept cutting off because of weak internet service...that was a bit annoying. Otherwise, it was great!

Tuk tuk tour. Had an amazing time in the tuk tuk pity it was November and cold but blankets supplied to keep you warm. Great 40 minute tour of river area. Good fun for anyone especially vespa/ lambretta nuts

Best ever Birthday suprise. Unbeliavable........... My friend had her birthday and she claimed a suprise birthday party and day for her. I was in charge of arranging her the program, and the first point of this unforgettable night was the Budapest Tuk Tuk. 8 of us booked the cars and undeniably we rocked the Budapest nightlife. The drivers were really cool and flexible, they were for 100% at our disposal during all the way. If I could attach some of our photos, which were taken during the night I would gladly do it, to proove the success and experience we gained :) The people on the streets were waiving to us all night and really it was a Legen... wait for it... dary night!! Thank you guys ;) We will return for sure!

Amazing trip & gift.... Smart, lively, cute and very friendly services. It was birthday gift to my mom for 73th anniversary. She and the whole family loved it so much. Eternal memories :)Thank you guys!

the most unique tourist guide in Budapest. it was a pleasure to ride on these cute and funny TukTuk's :) The well designed tours, the helpful drivers and the creative staff will make the most out of your Budapest trip. Highly recommended for people who want to explore the amazing capital of Hungary. Cheers guys ;)
Amusing, youthful, everlasting love! :). Budapest TukTuk is the perfect choice for a familiar or a romantic sightseeing in Budapest! Love it! ;)

A new way of being Tuk'en around a city!. Myself & 3 others were enjoying a beer opposite the Central Market Hall in Budapest when a couple of tuk-tuks turned up. I went over & spoke one of the guys who explained it was a new venture that they had started only 2 weeks earlier. Don't worry these aren't your tuk-tuks with hundreds of personalized lights you see in other counties. They have seat belts, side doors & a cover if necessary.Rather than using the hop-on hop-off bus this seemed a much more personal way of seeing the city & really wasn't expensive (47 euros per tuk-tuk for 1½ hours + a free cocktail in the 360 Bar & they even picked us up from our hotel) The beauty of this attraction is that because the tuk-tuks are classified as motorbikes they can get closer to places the buses can't. If you wanted them to stop you can at any time which you certainly couldn't do on a bus. The two drivers were very friendly, knowledgeable with great grasp of our language, (& many others) which helps.If you want to see the city in a more friendly, personal & fun way use these guys.

Nice way to visit the city the first time. We spend with some friends of ours and our 3 years old daughter very pleasent time with our guide Fanny. She was very informative, nice and knew how to adopt the itinerary of the tour (Bites and Sights) to our wishes which was not so easy as we were all vegetarians and it is not so obvious to have something good without meat in Hungary! The best place for us to visit was a ruin bar where we ate Hungarian speciality - langosz and were we came back again on our own another day.

Two tours: Buda Castle Explorer, and Bites and Sights. These were two very enjoyable and informative half-day tours. Tour guides Agnes and Emese were well informed and very pleasant company. I went back to do these tours a second year running as I enjoyed them so much the first time. The second time I again learned a lot and enjoyed exploring Budapest with each of the guides.
tThe food tour was somewhat disappointing. We have been on a few food tours and this one was not one that stands out. The guides were good but the tastings were the bare minimum that were advertised.

Food Budapest Tour Bites and Sights Excellent. the Guide Emese should be indulged with strudel at end of the tour, I think she prefers sour cherry and poppy seeds- I wont give her story away but strudel is not a Germanic creation.....what a food tour should be...history of the food from a cultural perspective. also those shops we visited - my group went back to one of the places we stopped at and the owners where very happy..I think guests should mention where they found their place, because they where surprised we where on the food tour.. and back again for dinner.

Forget those herd-like tours -- THIS is how to experience and learn about Budapest. Our four hours-plus with educator Agnes Zoka were enlightening and exhilarating.We felt immersed in Budapest history, culture, pride and flavors and our four-member group strolled -- briskly -- through the Central Market and several neighborhoods.We tasted, questioned and gained insights into the Hungarian character and nationalism, with frank comments about the tumultuous changes of the past eight decades. Our guide provided a candid, personal perspective of life during and after Communism -- value-added bonuses for a culinary tour!Agnes Zoka is delightful company whose passion includes an offer to share recipes. What a splendid ambassador for her city, country and for the Urban Adventures network.

Budapest is tasty and interesting. . The Urban Adventures tour was more about Budapest, Hungarian history and cultural discussions than that the food. Agnes was a delight! She loves her city and country - warts and all. Her personal perspective and history gives tour participants a true understanding of the complexity of Hungary and being Hungarian, in the past and in the present. Don't get my message wrong, the food was excellent. Consider it to be the seasonings of a great tour!

Great introduction to Budapest food and history. We did the Bites and Sights tour with Zsuzsi as our guide. She was well informed about Budapest history and gave us insights into lives of the residences of this city both now and in the past. We experienced a wide variety of Hungarian food with many tastings during the tour. We got a real flavour of this city and its food on this tour and I would recommend it.

A real highlight of our trip!. One of our fondest memories of Budapest will no doubt be our wine tour with Fanni. The wine tour was not formally available the day we wanted to book but Urban was fantastic and worked quickly behind the scenes to get a tour organised. We visited several ruins bars, an outdoor wine garden, and a several other venues. We were delighted to be surrounded largely by locals . . . not tourists! Fanni was amazing! Not only does she know wine . . . she has a degree in museology (who knew there was such a thing?!) and is not only a history buff but has a rich family history dating back to war times. We loved the introduction to the Budapest bar scene but also loved meeting such a warm and informed local. I actually felt sad to say goodbye to Fanni at the end of the evening . . . she is adorable!

Perfect! Well done. We did the food tour with Livia. Excellent tour full of interesting stops and tastings. I have to say that the is much more than a food tour. Livia combine very well local living, history of the city with food stops. Recommend to all!
Happy Hour Tour. Our guide Livia was super friendly and helpful and showed us bars/cafes that lots of tourists don't know about. We also sampled local food and drinks.

Food tour. This food tour was by far the best food tour I've ever been on. We started off at the central market and the tour was just for our small group of 4 people we came with. I loved how special I felt as the sign with all of our names were held up and how personalized/intimate it was. Agnes is an extraordinary woman who was extremely knowledgeable on the history of Hungary which tied in perfectly with the food we tried as well as the food she talked to us about at the market. We tried a wide array of delicious food which I think was a total of 8 different food items. The first item was a fresh biscuit that was homemade and fantastic. She was really helpful to our needs by asking if we had any dietary restrictions and allowing us to choose from types of chocolates, spritzers, & pastries. She also, called us a cab for our spa appointment as well as recommended some great places & music to check out. Finally, she had sent us a follow up email with her goulash recipe that I am looking forward to trying. She also, made us feel like we made a lifelong friend that we are more than welcome to come back and visit. We are planning a return visit sometime in the future and will most definitely be contacting Agnes when that happens.

Food tour. Superb tour of Budapest with both food samples and a lot of historical and cultural info about Hungary and its capital. Agnes was such a friendly and informative guide and made us feel very happy and cared for!

Bites and sights. Great tour seeing the city and enjoying great food along the wayRecommend this tourThis is the second urban adventure tour we have done on this holiday and I recommend them to anyoneIanni was a great guide

Agnes for the win!! . This food tour was incredible and having Agnes as a guide was even more incredible! Not only did we get to try many wonderful dishes the tour took us all around Budapest and really displayed the splendor of the city! The best part was having Agnes though because she lived through the majority of the city's rich history and was able to give us a first hand account. She brought so many wonderful extras for us too, in the form of maps, photographs, and recipes. I felt as though I made a life long friend in Agnes and really look forward to meeting her again when I return to the beautiful Budapest one day!

Bites and Sights Tour -- Big bites!. We were not advised by the concierge making our booking not to eat in advance so we had a very light meal for lunch before our tour. We should have waited! Agnes Zoka was our guide, very friendly, extremely knowledgable, and she greeted us with a traditional and very filling pastry! And the eating went from there. We saw various aspects of Budapest by foot, including the Great Market (stopping for cured meats and pickled veggies), the university area (chocolate and wine stops), the Jewish area for matzo ball soup and a final stop for goulash and strudel! It was all delicious and informative and thoroughly enjoyable. Even on a hot day, but be sure to bring an empty stomach and good walking shoes! The only thing that could have made it slightly better was to have something like to quiet boxes they use for walking tours on cruise ships as sometimes we were all strung along the sidewalk and it was hard to hear if you were near the back and she was talking, though usually we were all together when she did speak.

Livia Was Best Guide. The wine tour was fun and informative. Livia was very passionate about Hungarian wine, history and Budapest. She was an exceptionally nice person and extremely helpful. She created an interest in finding Hungarian wine now that we have returned to the US. I don't typically like white wine, but she took us to venues where very good white wine was served. The Hungarian white wine is not stored in oak and allows the fruit to be tasted rather than the oak.

A taste of Hungary and History. We highly recommend the Budapest Food Walking Tour through Urban Adventures. Our tour guide Livia was knowledgeable as well as fun and made my husband and my experience very special. Our tour took us through the large market sampling all sorts of Hungarian staples and delicacies, to the Jewish Quarter for traditional Matzo Ball Soup and finished with a delicious apple strudel. It wasn't just the food that was great, Livia also gave us a taste of Hungarian history in an interesting way leaving us wanting to learn more. We really feel we got our moneys worth as our tour lasted four hours, we saw interesting sights and definitely didn't need dinner afterwards. We highly recommend. Ask for Livia! Rose&Paul

Budapest Food Walking Tour, Urban Adventures. Excellent tour with Livia as our guide. The tour started in Market Hall where we had a Hungarian sweet treat and salamis. We then walked around the city and had small bites of 4 different types of fish, matzah ball soup, chocolate, goulash and strudels. All the food was excellent quality and Livia gave historical information about the areas and places we visited. She was excellent!! The tour was about 4 hours long and I had so much food that I didn't need dinner afterwards but a light, early lunch is a good idea.

Amazing experience . The walking food tour was one of the best activities I've ever experienced on a trip . The food was wonderful with a great variety . The best part was our lovely guide Agnes , she couldn't have been friendlier and her knowledge about the city and food made it a fascinating time :) I would highly recommend it to everyone .

Great Way To Experience Budapest. My favorite way to learn about the culture of a place is through the food. We did the "Bites and Sites" tour with Livia. It was a great way to learn about the history of Budapest while sampling the local cuisine. There is a lot of ground covered, food included, and stories shared about the country and culture. Livia also took us to places we never would have found on our own and she gave us some great recommendations for the rest of our stay in Budapest. This tour is definitely worth it. Make sure you go hungry!

Budapest Central Market and Walking Food Tour. Livia was a fantastic tour guide and very knowledgeable regarding Budapest history and cuisine. What a wonderful way to start our Budapest adventure! Kudos to Urban Adventures for such a great tour and guide. If you love local when you travel you don't want to miss this tour!

Fantastic Tour with Agnes!. Had the most fantastic experience with Urban Adventures when I booked a food walking tour in Feb. Agnes was a fabulous tour guide, who knew so much about the Hungarian culture and history, and really made the experience enjoyable. There was so much food included, and I felt like it really gives you a sense of the cuisine in Hungary. Thanks Agnes for the amazing tour - and I will definitely be returning to Budapest!!

Amazing tour with Ágnes Zóka. Our tour around Budapest was a wonderful experience. Ágnes was very friendly and knowledgable, she created a very personal and relaxed atmosphere. Everything ran smoothly, it was a pleasure to visit various places and taste Hungarian specialities on such a well-run tour. Not only did we learn about the general culture and history, but we also to got to know some of the hidden treasures a true local would know about. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone interested in getting to know Budapest in depth. :)

Great tour with Livia . This was a good foodtour with good food sampling and historic background. Livia our tourguide was enthousiastic and knowledgeable. Just awesome and a recommendation when visiting budapest!

Food tour Budapest. A few weeks ago I did a food tour in Budapest. I've been to Budapest very often but never done this tour, and I'm glad I did. Our guide was Livia (!), she showed us a lot of different places and hidden treasures, places I did not even know they excisted. We tasted different local specialities, drank the local wine, ate goulash, et, etc. Besides that we were given very interesting info on the background of the specialities as some history while walking through the most beautiful parts of town.What a great way to explore this beautiful city! Thanks Livia!

Authentic, informative and very enjoyable tour!. Our tour guide was Agnes, excellent in her job, very informative and professional. As a local I've started with a limitless interest to all details and with my kind high expectations as well :). So far from the first moment the tour was exciting, went smoothly, we tasted delicious hungarian food, visited real treasures and hidden places, had interesting topics, a bit of history, a bit of hungarians, a bit of everything. Agnes made the athmosphere very friendly, personal, and even if the tour was a bit too long, it was enjoyable until the very last moment. Thank you for this wonderful experience! I've studied a lot and will definitely recommend it! :)
Great tour and thanks Palma. A great tour with a combination of food and info about the city! Loves the chocolates and the goulash! Thanks Palma for an amazing time! :)

Great way to see Budapest. Our group of 4 had our guide Agnes all to ourselves on the Bites and Sights tour. We started in the Central Market and my only criticism was that we spent too long in the Market. Once we got out on the streets the tour became far more interesting! The mixture of food, history and sightseeing was perfect. A warning- the food is substantial, so have a good breakfast and do not eat until you get on the tour. We started right away with delicious salami and sausage in the Market, then on the other stops we had fish, chocolate, matzo ball soup in the Jewish Quarter, wine, and by the time we got to the goulash and strudel we were stuffed, since we had had a light lunch before starting. Agnes was knowledgable about all things Hungarian and gave us a good deal of recent history as well as insights into the lives of the people. Such an improvement on the usual walking tour filled with ancient history which you can only absorb a small part of. Highly recommend!

Happy Hour Budapest. Went on this tour on my first night in Budapest and was very glad I did! My tour guide (Livia) was very personable and knowledgeable, and the tour itself was excellent. We sampled a number of different wines in different bars (from classy wine bars full of locals, to an iconic ruin pub full of backpackers, and back again), as well as some sweet and savoury local bar snacks. The tour winds through an historic and lively part of the city, and between locations Livia gave a history of the area, and spoke engagingly about Hungary in general, and Budapest in particular. I have often wasted hours trudging round cities looking for the right bar/restaurant, and I only had four nights in Budapest. Going on this tour on my first night gave me an instant short-list of bars to return to, and I was able to familiarise myself with the area for a few hours with a local. This is my second UA trip this year after Istanbul, and my second 5-star review.

Excellent Guide!. Agnes was a fantastic guide on our 4 hour food tour of Budapest! High energy and very knowledgeable not to mention great humor! We saw some of the key attractions of the city while learning the deep history of the country. Highly recommended.

Delicious Budapest!. The Sights and Bites tour with Fanni in Budapest was excellent! We started in the Great Market Hall tasting salami and Paprika before heading to some hidden Budapest gems to taste various types of fish, drinks, soup in the Jewish Quarter, award winning chocolate bon bons and ending off in a traditional restaurant for Hungarian goulash and home made strudel. A delicious introduction to the History and Culture of Hungary with a very good guide full of extra stories, photos and surprises!

Passionate Tour guide. We recently took the Sight and Bites Tour of Budapest with Urban Adventures Guide Agnes Zoka. Although her choices of "sights and bites" were amazing, her vast knowledge and pride in her city made the tour a must experience when visiting this city. Her enthusiasm for all the city offered was contagious. She connected each food sampling to the city's unique history and charm. As we walked from sight to sight (do wear comfortable walking shoes) she pointed out architecture, unique shops, quaint hidden courtyards, the history of different neighborhoods, and told local legends based on the culture represented by both the food we sampled and the highlighted sights we visited. We felt comfortable asking questions and found her perspective and insight when answering them well worth the tour. Food sampling included a variety of salami meats, goulash soups, best chocolates ever, strudel, fish delicacies, and Hungarian wine. No need for lunch prior to tour! She ended by giving us a helpful map with our day's route marked so returning to any restaurants would be easy. Two thumbs up for this tour - especially with Agnes.

Great way to get to know the city. We were lucky enough to have Agnes Zoka. She was knowledgeable, thorough and enthusiastic about her city. She managed to keep us interested and informed for nearly 3 hours. We saw the major attractions in the city which included walking, busing and tramming. Highly recommended.

Excellent way to wander round the city and try Hungarian food. We went on the "bites & sites" tour with our guide Fanni, who was both knowledgable and enthusiastic about the food And Hungarian history. It starts in the central market with tasting of some sausage and paprika, then moves out into the city stopping at various eateries to sample different foods. The restaurants varied from the relatively basic to the final restaurant which felt like a very high class strudel house where you could see strudel being made. The food sampling was interspersed with talks about Hungarian history set in the context of the various parts of the city the the tour visited. There were 7 people on the tour, which we understood was fairly typical, so plenty of time to ask questions. Possibly not the cheapest thing to do in Budapest but an excellent way to orientate yourself with the city, its food and history.

Best food tour ever! Does NOT dissappoint!. Bites and Sites Tour!!! Let me first start off with our tour guide, Agi. She was splendid in both her knowledge of the city & culture, as well as in Hungarian culinary arts. Although the tour was strictly walking, the distance was not intensive at all as you stop every few minutes for some facts and tastes of Budapest. If you want a tour that takes you off the beaten path and gives you a well rounded culinary experience, this is a must! Being a Hungarian living abroad, I found it extremely refreshing and accurate. You definitely get your time and money's worth. Thanks for the recommendation Livia!

Fantastic food tour and Insight into Budapest's history. I attended the Budapest Bites and Sights tour. As an American Hungarian, I thought I was familiar with Budapest's history and culture, but as I quickly learned there was so much more to know. Our guide Agi knew a tremendous amount about the city and had many interesting stories that kept us engaged the entire tour. The stops were spread out perfectly and provided key cultural insights into both the cuisine and culture. Highly, highly recommend for anyone passing through the city or even living in it.

Best Food Tour - and History Too!. I've done food tours in a number of cities, and this one truly is the best! We toured the market hall in Budapest and sampled some sausages and biscuits, in addition to learning about the history of the market. Ice cream shops are everywhere in this part of the world, but the flavours at the one we visited were unique. I had rose ice-cream. We continued to walk around downtown Budapest and the Jewish district, learning about the history of the city and tasting great food. And these were not tiny samples! My friends and I did not eat lunch before the tour or dinner after because we got so much food. Sandor and Agnes were great enthusiastic guides. If you are looking for something unique to do in Budapest, I highly recommend this tour!!

Fantastic guide, amazing food. On 2015-08-17 I attended my first Urban Adventure tour - the Budapest Bites and Sights tour. Our guide, Sandor Nagy, was amazing. He is a history teacher during the school year and does the Bites and Sights tour over summer. His knowledge and passion for the history of Budapest is astonishing and inspirational. The food that we got to experience on the tour was phenomenal as well. We started with a walk through Market Hall and sampled a variety of Hungarian salamis. Then we moved on to walk around the area, learning about the history and sampling food from other restaurants. Everything was fantastic, but a real highlight for me was having the motsa soup at a Kosher restaurant. That was a completely new experience for me. Huge thanks to Sandor, and his assistant, Agnes, for an unforgettable afternoon.

Excellent private guided walk with Livia. I can not recommend Livia enough. We spent 2 days with Livia seeing all the sites and listening to the many interesting stories Livia had to offer. Livia was extremely Knowledgeable, super personable and gave us great restaurant recommendations.A great guide in a great city.

Bite and sights. My two children ( 11 and 13 ) and I went on this tour July 13, 2015. It was our favorite tour of the many we took ( though my son was a toss up with the Segway tour) . We started in the market and were told about the produce and pig rituals . We ate sausage regular , paprika , aged and several others all yummy. We moved on from there to a traditional pastry with cheese before we left the market for the streets on Budapest. We went to a fish place with the coolest atmosphere and great fish catfish spreads, fried scrape? And smoked scape?? . We then continued to a chocolate shop oh la la how delicious. And then off to get wine spritz in one of the coolest retro places I have seen. Then we head into the Jewish section for soup before heading to the goulash and strudel place. This was a wonderful trip and plenty of food and history

Mix of wine bars, history, culture. I took the Happy Hour Budapest tour. As I was the only person that evening, it turned out to be a private tour with guide Livia who is sophisticated, enthusiastic and eager to show travellers around in the Jewish quarter.We visited several wine bars together while discussing the history of the neighbourhood, and the current state of the area. Got good pointers on Hungarian wine and shared a Langos together. :)The best time to do the tour - as with most tours - is at the beginning of your stay, since everything still feels new, and the tour can add value on top of that.

Happy Hour Budapest. Joined Livia on the Happy Hour Budapest last night. Fun & informative. Livia is passionate about her city & its history...and definitely knows the best bars to hang out in. The Hungarian wines were very good & the little local bites were delicious & there was enough to soak up the wine!The Ruin Bars are nothing short of brilliant in concept & design. What a terrific story of renewal & rebirth.

Amazing Foodie Tour!. Palma was a very professional, super fun guide to learn so much from. As a food lover and traveller, the Bites & Sites tour in Budapest will definitely make your day. Delicious food, a great walk with lectures about the city's culture & history.It made my trip! Thanks so much Palma and Livia :)

Budapest Happy Hour Tour. We spent an enchanting evening with Livia as she led us through Jewish Quarter passageways. We learned so much about Magyar history in such a short time. The tour was very professionally delivered in Livia’s passionate style.In and out of hip, but rustic bars, including ruin pubs. A fun environment withlive bands or American music. We discussed politics over Rose fröccs-Hungarian name for spritzer and finished with burning palinka (fruit brandy). We would never have seen or learned as much on our own. It was like meeting a friend who knew all the right places to go.

Bites and sites. We had an excellent afternoon with Livia. We learnt all about the history of Hungary and Hungarian cooking. We tasted some amazing food and went to parts of Budapest we would of not found on our own. Some lovely cafes and bars. Thank you for a fantastic afternoon we highly recommend this tour We did her bites and sights tour.

Bites and Sights - great eating and great information. I really enjoyed my afternoon with Palma, a most interesting and engaging host. I learned a lot about the history and culture of Budapest while eating delicious food in a mix of quiet and busy locations. Palma also gave me advice about public transport and about a visit I was anticipating to a family with little English. I was the only person on the tour, so I was very spoilt. I would strongly recommend this tour.
