Authentic & very exciting!. We made the Happy Hour tour with Lívia who was very enthusiastic, funny and impressive. Even though it was a very cold night, we enjoyed walking around the city and getting to know the most cool gastro and wine bars of Budapest very much! As we live here it was even more interesting to get new information and tips about our city. We are planning to try other tours of Budapest Urban Adventures too!

Fantastic food tour in Budapest :). It was so much fun to get to know Budapest through tasting different Hungarian dishes. Loved the food and the places that we went to off the beaten track, Really nice way to spend time in Budapest. Thanks !Highly recommended:)

Lots of Bites and great sights!!!!. Livia was the perfect person to share the foods and sights of Budapest, her homeland. She was informative yet charismatic. The hours with her flew by. We walked, talked and ate and drank at establishments we would have never ventured in to. When you visit Budapest, look up "Bites & Sites" tour via Urban Adventures and have a great afternoon with Livia.

Passionate guide brings this tour to life.. The food was good, but I have to credit Livia with giving a great tour. Hearing about her family struggles and her life made this a more interesting tour than we are use to. I would have liked to spend a little more time in the market, but then it was closing time, so not much to be done about it. Be sure to quiz her on places to see and eat as she gives some good recommendations.

informative and fun. Enjoyed the tour very much. Tour guide was friendly, had lots of exciting information to share, took us to great hidden gem places of the city. Food was yummy, we had a chance to experience every day food and restaurant food, as well. We took a card of a restaurant to go back for private dinner later, great decision. Thank you for the great tour!

GREAT AFTERNOON FOODIE TRIP. We booked this trip at short notice and were not disappointed. Livia took us on a very interesting tours with a good insight into the city and its history and food culture. Lots of short stops along the way to sample the delights of Hungarian food and drink.We would definitely recommend this trip for people with an interest in seeing the city from a food perspective - much more enjoyable than other boring tours and the four hours passed quickly!We were not aware of the 'Ruin Bars' in the Jewish quarter and went back to one later in the evening for a unique and any experience.Thanks Livia and all the best for the future success of your business.

Bites & Sights Tour NOT to be missed!. Wow! Where to start?! Our guide was great! (sorry I don't remember her name!!) She was so knowledgable! BEST FOODIE TOUR!!!We met at the public market and even though we had walked through the market before, it was fun to hear the history and get to sample the food in a few of the stalls! All together we visited about 8-9 places with a comfortable walking distance between each appointed stop. We tasted in the market-meats & cheese, etc., other shops: chocolate, fish, matzo soup, struddle and other things....She took us into places that if you were NOT a local you wouldn't have even FOUND! She gave us lots of history, background and a great time! And a bottle of water :). (which was nice.)I would recommend this tour to any and all but please be prepared to walk.

Food + History = Goodtimes. Livia was a great guide. Enjoyed learning the history of where were were eating and walking while getting to sample local foods. A great experience with a small group of other people. I would definitely recommend the tour!

Ken Kleins' Review of "Bites and Sights" Budapest. This was one of the best tours we ever had, and this was the consensus of our six person group. Visiting the great market, learning about the Hungarian foods, spices, etc was extremely interesting and tasteful. Livia was very knowledgeable, friendly, patient, and above all she has a great sense of humor. We trudged through the rain and had some really great food from several quality restaurants throughout the city. Not only did we have our fill of food but had a excellent history lesson as we walked along. The food was included in the price of tour. Don't miss this tour, even in the pouring rain. We really had fun. Thanks again Livia, you are an inspiration to your country and we wish you well and may you proper.

"Bites & Sights" Tour of Budapest with Livia. Food tours are such a great way to learn about a culture & see a city..."Bites & Sights" was no exception...we LOVED it! Livia met us at the most popular food hall in Budapest to walk us through the stands & explain the basics of the Hungarian cuisine. After a few samples of sausages, cheese puffs, & candies, Livia walked us to a great retro spot for us to try some Hungarian staples & provide some history along the way. We ended the tour by seeing a Ruin Bar, the St. Stephan's Christmas market, & getting some goulash & strudel. This tour was so thorough that we actually cancelled our walking tour the next day. Definitely worth it!

Bites & Sights. This tour was fantastic, from start to finish. Our guide, Livia, was fun & engaging. She knew a lot about the area and kept pointing out information about the city, the history, local bars & restaurants, and even some "modern art." The food was great, and even on a frosty December day, I found every moment enjoyable. Highly recommend!

Happy Hour tour with Livia. As a local I wanted to see how they showing the city to foreigners, so in December we took part in the Happy Hour tour with Livia and it was a fantastic Friday evening. Despite the cold weather Livia was enthusiastically taking us around the Jewish district, sharing a lot of interesting facts and secrets about the neighborhood. We heard personal stories, visited unknown places that are not in the tourist books. Apart from getting a cultural experience, we stopped at several bars tasting typical drinks and snacks. Being Friday night, the bars were full but we had reservation everywhere, so we could enjoy our wines/palinka and delicious snacks. It was a great insight into Budapest’s Friday night!

Bites and Sights with Livia. The bites and sights tour with Livia was quite exceptional. Despite the rain and cold we had a wonderful time with Livia. She first took us all around the main food market for a tasting of local meets, baked goods, cheeses and then took us on a walking tour for tastings all around the city. It was a really good time with a really great host. Highly recommend.

Bites & Sights, Happy Hour Budapest, Merry Markets & Mullet wine. I chose the Urban Adventures for 3 tours and I was enjoying all of them tremendously. The guides (Livia and Agnes) were fantastic. After each tour I had learned a lot, had had a really good time and felt a little bit more at home in Budapest, as you get to see places you might not find on your own. Would highly recommend this organization to anybody.

Bites and sights. I took the Bites&Sights tour with Livia and I highly recommend it to everyone!
She took me to a lot of different places to eat and I could learn a lot about Hungary's history.
I enjoyed it very much.

Budapest Urban Adventure 2014. We took a family trip to Budapest in October 2014. We had booked an urban adventure food tour to experience Hungarian food and an insight into their culture. Our guide was Livia who spent the next four hours taking us all around Budapest. This was an unforgettable experience made all the more special by Livia's accounts of Hungarian life and cuisine. Our children, aged 12 and 15 enjoyed this experience as well and listened intently to Livia's stories of life in Budapest. At the end of this tour we all felt like we had a better understanding of the rich life that Budapest has for its people. We also had better knowledge of the history of Hungary and Budapest over the last fifty years. This was a great way to experience a country and city that made the visit all the more special.

Like visiting a city with your cool, hip local cousin who knew all of the best spots in town. My husband and I took the Bites & Sights tour with Livia in October 2013 and we could not recommend it more highly! We did not book a private tour, but it turned out that we were the only ones who had booked. Not only did Livia not cancel, she ended up giving us a private tour with all of the enthusiasm one would think would be reserved for a VIP group. We met at the Central Market and wandered, sipped and nibbled through its various stalls. We then noshed through the Jewish quarter and through some of the rehabilitated districts of the city, stopping at a bunch of cool shops (including a sophisticated chocolate shop) and several fun restaurants along the way (loved this awesome joint called Fish Rooster that had its own backstory). Livia explained how Budapest was still clawing its way back to greatness after the end of the Soviet occupation, as evidenced by the shiny brand new buildings surrounding crumbling, but still stunning, baroque ones. Our favourite stops were the Ruin Bars she took us. I guess it started with an ingenious response by a group of students to the government's call for entrepreneurs to purchase and renovate the city's many derelict grand old buildings. Livia explained that this group of students bought a building, but instead of renovating it, they decided to use the building as a sort of underground student bar and left it as-is in its ruinous state - hence, "Ruin Bar". Livia showed us a bunch of these and we loved all of them. It was really fun to roam the city with Livia. I was like visiting a city with your cool, hip local cousin who knew all of the best spots in town. She was energetic and enthusiastic; knowledgeable and informative. Best of all, she was passionate about her city and keen to make sure we appreciated it, which we did. We highly recommend this tour.

Happy Hour. If you want to get acquainted with the Jewish quarter of the city, with Hungarian wines and night life at the same time, it's a great choice. Our guide Livia took us hidden, small places and showed us some very popular trendy pubs. We heard about the Jewish history, and she told interesting and entertaining stories also, while we tasted excellent wines and some of us strong Hungarian spirit called palinka also. She was enthusiastic and very helpful. It was great.

Bites and Sights. This is a great way to eat your way through Budapest and also get your bearings in the city at the same time. Fanne, my guide was fantastic and I had a great time learning about the food and culture of her city. She was very enthusiastic and was quick to recommend good local wines to try. I was very happy that I did this trip which started at the Central Market Hall. Great place to start. Armed with everything that she showed me, I was able to take some people that I met in my tour group that I had just met back to some of those places and they were very happy indeed. I would recommend doing these little trips in any city that it is offered. Well worth the time.

Professional, fun, informative way to get to know the city and culture!. We arrived at Central Market Hall and was met promptly by our guide who took us through the market as well as introduced us to childhood favorites and local traditional meats. We went to various types of restaurants and shops for local flavor along with history. It was fun and informative along with much casual conversation. It was relaxed yet we covered many neighborhoods and there was a good pace to the tour. We were able to take many pictures and enjoy the day. I would highly recommend this tour to get to know the city and culture!

Morning City Walking Tour. Just returned from a fab trip to Budapest. We did a morning walking tour with Palma from Urban Adventures. What a joy. It turned into a private tour which we were able to do at our own pace. We visited some fantastic historical sights and also visited some great off the beaten track spots. Would definitely recommend this tour and make sure you get Palma who was very informative.

Great way to see back streets of Budapest!. A group of 5 of us took Palma's tour and couldn't say enough great things about it. Hitting the back streets for a history and food lesson was much different and more enjoyable than your usual type of tour. Some of the food was adventurous for us and really took us out of our comfort zone but that's what travel is all about!

Soooo good!. Getting a local view of Budapest is what we wanted to get out of budapest other than your a typical tourist food traps. Alexandra was so knowledgable and enthusiastic, we couldn't help but to want to know a little more about Hungarian culture and food. Going around to each of the districts included the Serbian district, the Jewish district and a few hole in the wall cafes, you would never be able to figure it out unless you were with her and for that we were really grateful and so very round and full! definitely worth it. And - I am currently trying to impress my croatian friend with my ghoulash recipe that you gave us, no shortage of Paprika here?! wish me luck!!!

This Food Walking tour was excellent.. This is a great tour in Budapest, Alexandra our guide was excellent , the starting in the Central Market was perfect , she has a great knowledge of the history and food of Budapest. We had 6 restaurant stop which were all really good ,places we would have never found on are own. We would say this is a must if your going to Budapest.

Learned and tasted so much!. Thanks to Palma for an excellent tour today. My flight arrived late so I missed the meet up point but she kindly came to find me and took me to the next stop. I enjoyed all the stops, but especially the chocolate, ruin bar and goulash. She gave such an informative history as we walked and ate, along with many great pictures. With only two of us on the tour, it was very personalized and helpful! Highly recommend if you're in Budapest. My only regret is not having any local currency with which to tip her, felt awful!

Bites and Sights. Wonderful way to see a fraction of Budapest in some depth. Choice of "food stops" showcased Hungarian cuisine and walking through the city with a "local" brought the history of some significant sights to life. Congratulations Urban Adventures on another fantastic tour.

This Should Rank Higher!. 100% the best thing we did in 5 days of Budapest. We booked this tour for Saturday 9th and ended up with a private tour by Andrea. The food was fantastic, the tour was fantastic, Andrea was fantastic. Very informative, entirely worthwhile, could not recommend it more! Tour meets at the Central Market which is easy to find and cost 59 euros per person which is wonderful value for the amount of food and information we obtained. Thank you Andrea, perfect afternoon!

Lots of surprises—all of them good—on Sights & Bites Tour. Expecting this tour to be more bites than sights, we were pleasantly surprised to find that this was a 3-hour walking tour of Budapest guided by Palma, who was both charming and informative. Palma seamlessly shifted among discussions of history, culture, architecture, and food while visiting five or six uniquely Hungarian shops and restaurants to give us a good and varied taste of the local cuisine.

Sights and Bites-excellent tour for a taste of Hungary (literally)!. We had a wonderful tour with our guide Olivia. We started at the Grand Market and continued on to several restaurants, a bar and a candy shop where we got to taste all kinds of delicious, traditional Hungarian foods. Along the way, we got our fill of history and sightseeing, as well. The group was small, only 5 of us, which was perfect. If you're lucky enough to be in Budapest, I wouldn't miss this tour!

Urban Adventures -- sights and bites!!. Our guide Alexandra was excellent, this being her first " run ", showing us the tastes and smells of her city , from fish to chocolate to matzo ball soup, goulash, to " schnapps ", everything was wonderful. My husband and I highly recommend her and her expertise, and helpfulness.It was a very warm day and she even had water bottles with her. We walked around the neighbourhoods and experienced that " extra mile " of telling us and showing us her city !!I will definitely recommend " Urban adventures " to whoever is travelling!!

Very informative. Did a walking tour with my two aunties and my grandmother. Livia (our guide) was very thoughtful of my grandma and made sure she was ok and able to keep up. We also used public transport when it all became too much for my grandma. Livia was very friendly and knew everything about Budapest. The tour was very informative and we saw lots of sights we would never have seen otherwise. Livia also took us to places the locals go to eat. A great day out!

Sights & Bites - heaps of both!. Had a fantastic tour with Andrea at the end of May - she was so full of information and great stories - I highly recommend doing this tour on your first day in Budapest as we went back to so many of the places that we visited on the tour and Andrea gave us some fantastic suggestions about things to do and excellent places to eat - she shaped our whole Budapest experience and it was amazing - thanks heaps Andrea! It was boiling hot and the first thing Andrea did was to hand out lovely cool bottles of water! We then stuffed ourselves silly with all sorts of delightful local food over the next 3 to 4 hours, she took us to places we'd never be able to find including the original Ruin Bar which was a delight. The pace was perfect - my 78 year old mum kept up with no problems but we still managed to cover a lot of ground. Thanks Andrea - you were fabulous!

Fabulous tour. Would highly recommend this tour as Livia was informative, charming and truly excited about her home city, which came across in all aspects of the tour. We found the history and anecdotes shared as we walked around some lesser known parts of Budapest totally enthralling, add in the food sampling, which overall became a substantial meal, and it is the perfect way to truly explore Budapest. We sampled, soups, fish, salami and strudel to name but a few, all supplied as part of the package. Although circa 3 hours, the time flew by and the walking speed was comfortable. Budapest is not huge and there are no hills on this tour, so do not be concerned if you are not athletic, my wife and I are both in our sixties and found the whole thing delightful. Special thanks to Livia as her passion and knowledge of her city made our holiday really memorable.

Sights and Bites Tour - more than a tour. Yesterday I was lucky enough to go on this tour. My tour guide Eniko was very professional and her knowledge on the history of Hungary, but in particular Budapest, and of food was evident. She was a lovely person too. We went up little back streets that I probably would not venture by myself - there is a lot of history lurking behind some of the doors. Enjoyed the little bites of food. I particularly enjoyed seeing the Ruins Bar - the first one established in Budapest. The Market Hall where the tour commenced was amazing too. I would definitely recommend it as a way of seeing some of the city.

Eniko's Walking and Eating Tour of Budapest. I live in Budapest and frequently have guests visiting. Although I know the city well, I recently had an excellent experience with Urban Adventures in Kuala Lumpur and in Kathmandu and wanted to see what they had on offer here as some old friends were coming for Easter... I myself learned a tremendous amount about the city and discovered some new places I didn't even know existed - and I consider myself a local at this point! Our guide, Eniko, was warm and enthusiastic from our initial call until the very end of the trip. The tour itself was well planned and it was lovely to eat a little, walk a little, nosh a little, walk a little, etc. The types of foods were extremely varied and it is clear that she really knows a lot about the history of Budapest and enjoyed sharing her knowledge with us. After the tour, Eniko took her own time to chat with us and recommend some activities off the beaten path for the rest of our trip. It was an excellent experience and really enhanced our trip. We were left with a fantastic impression of the city and Eniko truly is an excellent ambassador. I sincerely recommend this tour, it was a wonderful way to spend an afternoon and an excellent introduction to the city and its cuisine.

More than just a tour. My wife and I have been to Budapest 4 times and wanted to see something different. This tour was just the thing. Although we basically walk everywhere in the city, we saw areas and small venues that we would never have hit without Livia showing us. She knows, and is passionate about, Hungarian history and culture while delivering it for hours with unbridled enthusiasm. She stayed an extra hour and a half to talk with us about so many different Hungarian things. Yes, you get to try different foods and they are all great, but really Livia makes the tour. You won't be disappointed.

One of my best UA walking tours, a must in Budapest. Livia has so much energy and a lovely personality and she seems genuinely interested and passionate about everything she wants to tell you about - and she has a lot to tell you! Definitely recommended as a great way to see the city, get a feel for it and enjoy some great tastes along the way! :)

The most enjoyable sight&gastro tour. It was very spectacular and I also enjoyed the Hungarian food tasting. The tour guide was fantastic and well prepared as well. I got lot of interesting information about the local gastronomy and culture. We had a nice city walk and we had a very great time!

Fantastic tour with a very very good giude. This was my first Urban Adventures Tour and I'm totally amazed! The tour vas brilliant! We had a Budapest Gastronomy Tour and not only we had such a lot and good food but the tour has also a kind of sightseeing tour as well. The tour guide was fantastic, we laugh a lot, she was very vibrant. I had a fantastic time and also fantastic food!!! I definitely recommend for everyone! Thanks a lot for this experience!!! I really love Budapest, the food and the tour as well! Highly recommended! Marta

Best tour guide&food. We took the bites and sights tour of budapest with urbanadventures with my boyfriend. It was amazing!especially our tour guide, Livia wasamazing. She couldn't stop telling us crazy stories aboutthe communist times and her family and all!!! The food was great we really got to places where would never get alone!! Nice walk in the city, interesting quirky facts and tasty bites in like 5-6 places!! And on top of this she gave us very useful tips where to eat, where to go out etc!!the best experience in budapest!! Reccommended!!

Amazing concept of food and sights to truly discover a city!. I was there to get a "taste" of the city with my friends, as i always associate food with true local culture and i was very happy to discover Budapest with Livia. She was fun and knowledgable and the variety of the foods and the little secrets she made us unveil were very helpful for our continuation of the city stay. Well done !

Fantastic food tour of Budapest. This tour included everything. Great food, fantastic wine, knowledgable guide, history, culture, bars, restaurants and an extensive tour of the city.We learnt about, and sampled many traditional Hungarian foods, including paprika sausage, goulash soup, fish, chocolates and strudel.Our guide was so friendly and knew so much about the city, she showed us the real Budapest. Completely worth the money and a fantastic introduction to the city and it's cuisine.We would highly recommend this tour. Our

Great way to experience Budapest. My friend and I went on the 'Bites and Sights' tour with Livia. We loved trying all the different foods and drinks, we were very full at the end of the walk! We felt that we got a proper insight into the city, its culture and people. Livia is a lovely guide, sharing stories from her childhood and secret tips. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone wanting to get away from the tourist crowds and get to know the more 'local' side of Budapest.

Fabulous Way to Learn about Budapest. As other reviewers have indicated, Livia was fun, well-informed and interesting. The tour was more than just a walk around the city, but a combination of a history lesson with some cultural insights and some great local food. Livia was very skilled in intertwining all three elements and it made for one of the most interesting tours that we've ever had. This is a wonderful way to really learn about the city, and see it from a very local perspective.We would highly recommend this tour and this guide for anyone visiting Budapest. Great experience!!

Adventure and Eat in Budapest!!. This is an absolutely fabulous tour! Livia is knowledgeable and engaging. Her grandparents had rural backgrounds and her parents kept ties to this lifestyle while pursuing professional city lives, so Livia can relate to the food traditions and cultures as she weaves history and personal accounts into a fascinating and delicious adventure. We covered traditional Hungarian food (sausages, goulash, strudel, fish that is eaten by Hungarians at Easter), emerging trends (artisanal chocolate from a local foodie, “ruin pubs”) and the ethnic and historical threads in the evolution of each. The tour was infinitely more interesting and fun than my description can convey. This is a over the top tour not to be missed! I got more of a sense of the fabric of Hungary in this one day tour than I have for many countries in a week-long visit. And it was delicious!

THOROUGHLY RECOMMENDED!. I'm somewhat hesitant to endorse these two walking tours so wholeheartedly in case it helps spread the word too much and results in the tours losing their very personal qualities - at the heart of their success. For me, anyway...I did both "Bites and Sights" (with Andrea) and "Budapest Explorer" (with Livia): the former along with one other guest, the second on my own. On both trips, it was like exploring the city with a local friend rather than a guide. Both guides gave so much information with such clear enthusiasm that I definitely gained far more than I would have done from one of the (I suspect) huge "free walking tours" on offer in the city - or the "Hop-on Hop-Off Bus tour.On "Bites and Sights" it was a great opportunity not only to sample some of Hungary's specialities - from goulash soup, a Jewish soup, Spreitzer & different salamis to fish dishes, chocolates & freshly based strudels etc. - but also to visit some of Budapest's quirky cafes and restaurants (not to mention a 'ruin pub' and chocolate shop) and see some sights including the Central Market, the synagogue and a Serbian church.On "Budapest Explorer" I visited a local's home in one of the flats surrounding a hidden courtyard, an historical bookshop café as well as better known sights such as St. Stephen's Basilica, Chain Bridge and Heroes Square (via the second oldest metro line in the world). When visiting one of the old four markets of the late 19th century, I had the chance to sample another Hungarian speciality: Langos (a rather big snack!). As with Andrea on my first tour, Livia gave lots of personal anecdotes en route which made for another amazing experience.Cannot recommend both trips highly enough!!

Must DO IT. We were wondering around with a friend and then we found this tour on the Urban Adventure web site! It's a great chance to learn from the locals about their culture! Livia is great and we miss her already!!!

A great, unique experience with a very fun and knowledgeable guide!. Our guide, Livia, gave me a food tour of Budapest by foot. She took us to the main food market and explained the typical foods sold at this market. She then walked us to various locations around Budapest that are frequented mostly by locals and unknown to tourists, such as a very popular fish restaurant, some unusual bars housed in very old buildings, a restaurant known for its goulash and strudel, and a specialty chocolate shop. The entire time, Livia was very enthusiastic and explained things in great detail. She kept me very, very interested. I'm really, really glad I did this tour with Livia and I would definitely recommend it to everyone who wants a local's perspective of Budapest.

Must do when in Budapest!. The day before I had a horrible tour in budapest. While I saw many things I really didn't feel like I got to enjoy and appreciate it. Then comes my saving grace... the Bites and Sights tour by Livia! You learn about the city through the food and with a very knowledgeable guide, Livia. You can tell that she is passionate about food and her city. She knew the history of Budapest and provided the locals perspective. We went to places off the beaten path but that's exactly what I wanted. The food was delicious and was so full by the end of the trip that I skipped dinner! Well worth the money! Everyone has to do this while in budapest!

bites and sights so good. this guided tour was fantastic and much more than i expected, our guide was lovely and so knowledgeable, the amount of food we were given to taste/eat was unbelievable, i counted 10 different items/meals which was incredible. our guide livi was so nice and made the tour really interesting with her knowledge and stories. i loved the market and the ruin bars, i would recommend this to anyone who has an afternoon to spare in budapest, the best thing i did there.

Great Excursion in Budapest!!!. I took a large group of people to Budapest and we did the Bites and Sights Tour with Urban Adventures. It was definitely one of the best highlights of our time in Budapest. Not only did we get to try some great food but we learned so much more about the history of Budapest while we were on the tour. I highly recommend the tour and Livia was a wonderful guide!!!

Bites and Sites with a local. I really enjoyed this great tour through Budapest, trying the food and learning about the history of the city and it's people. We tried a wide range of food at a range of restaurants, bars and shops. I felt I gained a view of Budapest that I would never have experienced otherwise. Well worth doing, a great way to get to know the beautiful city of Budapest.

Budapest Explorer - money not well spent. 3 hour walking tour for 34 euros. Not worth the cost. You're better off joining a free walking tour. Or better yet, spend your hard-earned euros on a hop-on-hop off bus. Not recommended.

The best tour I did in Europe!. A fantastic walking tour of Budapest incorporating regular tasting of the local cuisines with a lesson in the history of how they came to be. The tour guide Livia was fun, energetic, and exceptionally knowledgeable. She absolutely went out of her way to not only let us sample the local foods, but to understand why they were a part of Hungarian culture. Her English is remarkably good too, making the information very easy to absorb. She led us away from the major tourist spots and allowed us to sample a bit of 'real' Budapest. Do this tour while you're in Budapest, I cannot speak highly enough of it!

Best tour ever!!. Without doubt the best tour I've ever been on! Lyvia is full of enthusiasm and passion for her home town and it really comes across in this amazing tour!! If you're going to Budapest you MUST do this tour and explore like the locals do!

Truly the best city tour I've ever taken. The owner, Livia, took us for what was intended to be a three and a half hour tour. It turned out to be closer to five and every moment was a pleasure. We made frequent stops at interesting sights, restaurants, and bars. We ate small bits all along the way. Livia was lovely and very knowledgeable. She spoke of the complex history of this city that has seen so much change over it's lifetime. She made it more real with experiences and stories passed to her by her grandparents. The time flew by. I've been fortunate to have taken city tours in other European countries - this was, by far, the best ever. I give Livia and her well planned and executed tour an unqualified endorsement.

Enjoyable tour. As first time visitors to Budapest, this was a great introduction to the city and the local food. Nice cross section of food sampled as well. Eniko was an excellent guide for our Tour, very passionate about her city and its food, culture and history. We thoroughly enjoyed our "bites" experience and would recommend it to friends. Nice touch was the bottled water which Eniko supplied at the beginning of the tour. Very much appreciated.

Gastronomical Delights in Budapest. Do not miss this tour, it is the best I have been on in my many visits to Europe. It gives you a peep behind the tourist scene, and a glimpse of how history affected the lives of ordinary people. And then there is the food! Scrumptious tastes in amazing locations, from goulash to hand made chocolates. Not to mention the most melt in the mouth strudel in the Cosmos. This tour was the highlight of my trip.

If you are going to Budapest - DO THIS TOUR!!!. What a great way to get your bearings in the beautiful city of Budapest and get a full belly of beautiful food at the same time!! Livia is a fantastic guide and shows you around much of the Pest side of the city on this food-based walking tour. As many other reviewers have mentioned, it takes in different food specialities from the matzos soup in the Jewish quarter to Froccs (Spritzer to you and me but don't mention it to a Hungarian!) on the rooftop bar, to the almost compulsory Goulash and Strudel. What really makes the tour great though is Livia's knowledge and personaliuty; within half an hour of starting the tour we felt like we were simply wandering around a new city with an old friend who was showing us around. Can't recommend highly enough, and if you do this trip early in your stay in Budapest it'll give you a great sense of place and allow you to get your bearings to navigate your own way around once Livia has gone!!

Budapest bites and sites tour. Absolutely fantastic tour. Livia was great, she had lots of stories and insights into life in Budapest, history, whats on, where to go that you will never get from the commercial bus tours. A bit quirky but really nice . If you want to fall in love with Budapest - this is the way.

Budapest Explorer &Bites and sights/sites. Livia was an amazing guide. What beats a local, with an interesting family history, to share details about a beautiful city? Walking took in Jewish Quarter and special foods:duck soup,ghoulash, sweet/sour struedel, a special chocolate lolly, froos wine and more. The Explorer tour took us to places we would not have seen as ordinary tourists....eg. places where SS took over for their own purposes, several different 'ruin' bars, the oldest coffee shop in Budapest! Plus heaps more. As a student of architecture, Livia shared many anecdotes of Budapest and Hungary's history. A tour well worth doing.

An excellent introduction to Budapest. The tour was well managed and paced just right so that there was a good balance of walking, history and yummy Hungarian food. I would highly recommend this tour as our guide was very knowledgeable and personable. Through sharing both historical and current insights into life in Hungary I feel that this tour gave a good introduction to the country, especially as I was a first time visitor to Hungary.

Truly epic and local adventure. I had a great time on the tour. The guide who was able to answer all my silly touristy questions with a smile. I went into places that I would never have found. The guide showed us how the locals (i.e. her and her friends) live in the city. She was helpful to give me tips on what to do after the tour and gave me great tips on where to have dinner at genuine local delicacies. Highly recommended, especially if you only have a short stay in Budapest!

Eat and love. Eventhough I am Hungarian I really enjoyed this tour! My and my friends from Germany attended a tasting tour with Livia, it was such a fun! We discovered many hidden places and ate sooo many delicious food, yummmieeh :-)

A pleasant and interesting stroll through the less well trodden tourist areas.. First off our tour guide Maria was lovely and really knew her city well, and spoke with knowledge and passion about the history of her beautiful city. The trip was entitled 'sights and bites' and just as our legs were getting slightly weary, we had another stop for a bite to eat or drink. What a great idea! We wholly recommend that you consider a tour like this. A fan way of getting a great feel for a beautiful city. Top work to Budapest Urban Adventures!

Best tour I took in Budapest. Went on the bites and sights tour. Of the four tours I took this was the best. A great introduction to the central market and its history with samples as we walked through the market. Then a local neighborhood fish place outside of the tourist quarter. I found the ruin bars fascinating and enjoyed a roof top bar and a great view. Loved the introduction to popular Hungarian summer time drink "Maci Froccs" Then we went to the Jewish quarter for matza soup. We stopped at the temple graveyard and saw the graves with so many dated1945 the effect of the harsh treatment of the Jewish quarter during World War 2. Then we stopped at a chocolate store to taste hand made chocolate. The last stop was a traditional restaurant for goulash and strudel. Olivia my tour guide was knowledgeable, personable and enthusiastic. If you want and opportunity to sample the culture of Budapest, I highly recommend this tour group.

Fabulous tour!. Went on the bites and sights tour which was awesome. We met at the central market where we got to sample different foods, and then wiggled our way through the city stopping at many small restaurants where we tasted a variety of interesting and delicious foods. Livia, our tour guide, was extremely personable, interesting, and fun to be with. This was one of the best tours I did during a three week trip through Europe. The pace was great and everyone had a fantastic time. I highly recommend it!

Food tour. First of all Palma was outstanding! She is passionate about her city and customs and if course the food. We started at the market and tasted salamis and spicy sausage. Then ate a local fish eatery that was delicious! We continued on to a local handmade chocolate store with all kinds of weird chocolate combinations (lavender, cardamom, mushroom, etc). Then on for some yummy sparkling wine, a typical matzoh ball soup at the Jewish quarter and finally authentic (and delicious) Hungarian goulash. Great day and delicious food.... Highly recommend!

Informative and enjoyable. I did all of the Explorer and most of the Bites and Sights (had to catch my flight). Both tours were excellent, they gave a good insight into the history of Budapest and the Hungarian people. The tour guide Livia is very passionate about her culture and history accompanied by a great sense of humor.

Interesting, personal and enjoyable. Did both tours today. The first gave me a great insight into the history and stories behind Budapest. Taken to some hidden gems. The second was about food and I was in heaven. Tried salami, local fish, a refreshing light wine, a local soup, chocolate and my favorite "cherry and ricotta strudel". I still have more yummy things to try. Great tour. Many thanks

Really Informative and Fun Tours!. I did 2 tours with Urban Adventures in Budapest and they were both fantastic. The guide Livia was full of knowledge and extremely friendly. The Bites and Sites tour was fantastic, got to eat heaps of different types of Hungarian food and also hear a bit about the history of it all.
Great tour. The guide was great saw a lot of buda pest learned a lot about the local buildings and history, different building styles etc etc. Well worthwile tour and the guide was excellent!!!!!

Fun,facts & food. had a gret tour with Livia today. Very personalised as only 3 of us. We walked all arond the 'Pest' side, having a history and archietecture lesson as we went. Livia also took us to some great cake/coffee shops, (new & old) all off the tourist trail. We rode the sub way, caught the tram, strolled the strrets all with non stop commentary. A lovely morning, did not feel like 3.5 hours, this tour is a must do!

The Oldest Underground. Some say Budapest has got the oldest tube in the World. Even not so, the ride with this underground tramway is a unique experience. Everything is as it was 150 years ago: the tiny cars, small and short platforms, authentic wooden cupboards' doors. You feel like traveling back to Nineteenth Century. Don't omit!!!

Find the hidden gems of Budapest. Eniko was great, we went to lots of out of the way spots that we would never have found on our own and she was very knowledgeable - she helped us with all sorts of queries we had about resturants, public transport etc too. There were just my husband and I so effectively we had a private tour. It was overcast so we couldn't see as much as we wanted and also cold out so we stopped for coffee in a great coffee shop and she shared with us lots of information on Budapest - she knows a lot!!! We would definitely recommend this tour if you can afford it (even better if you end up with a private tour like us!). We got a deal buy one get one free which I think was good value but not sure that I could justify the price if I had to pay full price for both of us.

A great adventure and special way to.... A great adventure and special way to discover the beautiful city of Budapest. During the Budapest Explorer tour we learned about history, art and life and had a fantastic time while visiting a small, real local market with our wonderful guide.
Danube river cruise Budapest. comfortable, scenic cruise, with audio guide in 30 different languages. Best to book ahead in advance to ensure you get the timing you want.

A fine evening.. Five of us really enjoyed the evening cruise and were particularly impressed by the quality of the food: we chose from the a la carte menu and the standard of service was excellent throughout. We paid approx. £50 per head for the cruise, meal and wine (very good also) and all agreed that we would recommend Legenda.

A dark and stormy night. The folks at Legenda were very accommodating. We had to change our reservation twice, and they did it with as smile. It is a short but fantastic way to view Budapest. I highly recommend it for people of all ages.

Pretty Good. We enjoyed our cruise and loved seeing the lit up buildings from the water. The video and commentary that accompanied the tour were good but not necessarily easy to follow if you were trying to identify the buildings on shore.The drinks were OK. We had wine and it was not the best but probably good value considering the price of the ticket. We did show our Rick Steve's book and received a discount bringing our tickets down to 4,400 huft.
Excellent trip with low price!. We enjoyed the trip very much and we recommend it for sure. Low prices and a drink offered by the staff. Thank you very much!
Amazing Trip :). # Boat trip was great :)# Nice people around# Audio guide was good with more information# Welcome drink was good

Beautiful Night Cruise. Took a one hour Legenda boat cruise after sunset recently. The main buildings along the Danube were nicely illuminated, and the scenery was beautiful. The boat was very clear and comfortable, all of the seats had good views, and each seat has a headset for listening to a recorded commentary in numerous languages (including English). A free drink is included with each ticket, and if you show your RS guidebook when you purchase your ticket, you'll get a 20% discount. I highly recommend Legenda.

Staff let it down. Went on the evening boat cruise which overall we enjoyed. The only downside was the staff. We had booked the cruise with drinks and took the advise to get there early to get good seats at the front of the boat. We were sat down from 6.15 for the 6.30 cruise which actually didn't set off until about 6.45pm. All started well when the staff started at the front of the boat taking orders for drinks. We gave our order and waited for the drinks to be served. To our disappointment the girl brought a big tray of drinks out and started at the front giving out drinks. We were missed out but waited on thinking ours would be on the next tray. The waitress then served another tray of drinks again we were missed out. By this time most people around us had finished their drinks. Therefore I decided to go and ask about our drinks (consequently missing out on the audio tour for that section) when I enquiries about the drinks the member of staff who was filling another tray of drinks snapped at me that we never ordered any drinks. I replied that we did and instead of an apology she told me that she had to serve the other customers and I would have to wait. I was shocked at the abruptness and rudeness in which she spoke to me. In utter shock I walked back to my seat. Another staff member then came and again asked us for our order. The whole situation left us with huge disappointment particularly as we had got there so early and invested our time on the trip. I can also add that this trip is about 18€ each and there are other boats that charge €9 each. We thought we were paying he extra for the best but obviously not.

No vegetarian options. It is a good tour if you want to go on a dinner date and if you eat non veg(especially sea food). We were 6 people and we were vegetarian so the dinner cruise was pointless. They didn't have any vegetarian option except a mushroom dish and the boat was closed so it was very suffocating. On the positive side the staff was very friendly and polite.

Perfect start to our city break. What a way to find out about the history of Budapest. The boat was comfortable, clean and warm - just what was needed on a cold October day! The service was excellent and on the way to Margaret Island we were offered wine, beer or soft drink included in the price. Lots of interesting facts about the city which gave us ideas as to where to visit during our short break. You could stop off at the island if you wanted (we didn't) to spend some time exploring. A lovely glass of lemonade was served on our return to the dock. Definitely recommend Legenda to any new visitors to beautiful Budapest.

Wonderful Introduction to Budapest. The day was chilly, but the heated boat, complimentary drinks, and multilingual (prerecorded) tour commentary made for the perfect introduction to this beautiful city.
great. had a lot of fun, not the most interesting thing (im 24) but the view was great, the stuff was pro! got a beer and a juice. great presenting,
Very good tour. Very good tour, nice boat, interesting narration of history, and drinks. Very romantic for couples. Would just recommend hot drinks when on top of boat due to cold.

Dinning on the Danube. A great experience with great food, quality wine selection and wonderful personal service. I was celebrating my birthday with my wife and we had a great evening enjoying the sites of Budapest at night and the excellent band. Premium value
pretty good. there is nice commentary, lots of languages to choose from , the boat looks nice, everything is clean.

Great way to get bearing in Budapest. This was an excellent tour, which allowed us to get some contextual history of the two sides of Budapest, the important buildings, and how things have changed over time. The audio guide was very helpful and enjoyable. Additionally, there were a lot of great photo ops with a great view from the river. Would totally recommend this for anyone, especially just arriving to Budapest.

Sightseeing Boat. The overall experience was good. A nice movie, describing what we saw, was being played during the sail. Wine/beer/soft drinks were served.It's possible to stand outside and "on top" of the boat, so you can take pictures and cool a bit from the heat inside.Tips:1. It's possible to reserve tickets on their website. 2.If you want to sit by the window, arrive approx. half an hour before the scheduled department.

fantastic. what ever you do save some money for this trip from on board welcome to departure every thing is first class ,the table host was really chatty and enquired why we had a toy dog on the cruise and we explained she was keen to see our real dog we left at home ,the 2.5 hour long cruise gets you to view all the lit views by night along with excellent food drink and entertainment its is something you cannot miss

Our romantic night cruise on the Danube. Pay for the best get the best!Night cruise with dinner and music along the Danube, it was an excellent experience With very good food and night view of Budapest from the boat

Nice, relaxing trip.. Nice, relaxing tour. Good to sit inside in cold weather, but missed the opportunity to take pictures from outside. The guides was friendly and i appreciated the glass of refreshment they served. They were in such a hurry when they gave information, so a little bit hard to understand.

Amazing views at night! . We took the evening cruise with our 4 and 2 year old and had a great time. The views were fantastic and the staff were great, the service was very good. It was lovely to be able to see the sights with a glass of champagne. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Budapest!
An essential in Budapest. A great way to get a summary of the best sights in Budapest in an hour. Suggest one of the evening tours to benefit from seeing the buildings lit up.
An evening on Daniub. It was very nice and well coordinated program. All the staff was cordial and at our services all the time. The audio guide was informative. Over all it was a nice trip

Nice experience. We did the night tour at the last everning of our journey.
It was a nice summary of seeing the places we had visited the days before.
I can recommend this tour.
Nice journey. It was a great travel and the audio guide was very good and in many different languages. I recomend!
Excellent value. Fantastic quality food, very friendly and efficient service with breathtaking views, a most enjoyable evening
Romantic!!!. The dinner course was excellent! I think it was reasonble.....and especially, all the scenaries from the boat was very beautiful and romantic!!!

Danube by night. We visited at 6:30 PM CRUISE WITH DRINK.
it was a very pleasant experience to see Parliament House, Gillet Hill, Castle , Mattias church & Fisherman bastion all shining like a Jewell. Both sides of Danube looks awo some
At night. A must do activity when in Budapest
Weekend in Budapest. Nice crew. Clean boat. Guiding on most languages. You can choose to stay 1,5 hours on Margitsziget Island which is a really nice place for walkin around.

Look for Legenda. This river cruise was excellent, from customer service until the end of the boat trip. It has the glass mirrors to better appreciate the view of Buda and Pest. There are other boat cruises but they have the plastic covers. And with welcome drink included. Too bad we decided too late for the dinner cruise. It easily gets full. Book in advance! Must do when in Budapest.

Legends sightseeing. The sites were beautiful at night magnificent to view. However, the tape on the video was not in sync with the sites. You were required to look back. The tape itself was informative.

Perfect timing.... We decided to stop by and check out the schedule just in time to take a tour. This company is recommended by Rick Steve's and you get a discount if you mention him.There were a couple of times that we weren't sure what the audio was referring to but for the most part the audio guide was great.We sat downstairs in the front of the boat and the heat got to be unbearably hot. When I asked staff if they could do anything about it they sort of shrugged and nothing changed. So I did the only thing I could and that was to go outside to cool off where the audio doesn't work!
Nice view of Budapest. The "champain" was good, the visit agreable and the view wonderful , not too many people what can we ask more?

Lovely Cruise. I chose the evening Legenda cruise after a suggestion from friends who had visited Budapest, and I wasn't disappointed. The overall presentation was great, and I learned a lot. Plus, the views at night of the major buildings along the Danube can't be beat. The boat I was in had 1 level of seating with 4-5 seats across on each side. Thankfully, it wasn't too crowded, but had it been, I think this would have impacted the ambiance and viewing from the boat. There was another boat with 2 levels and only 2 seats on either side. I would have preferred this, but again, all in all my Legenda experience was lovely. I'm glad I went at night as the views were a bit more dramatic than the daytime. However, I would suggest to put the headphones on right away as once the boat gets moving the presentation starts without any warning from the hosts. I would definitely suggest taking a cruise on Legenda!
Pleasant cruise. Enjoyed the evening , the excellent and friendly service,and the the food too was well presented and very enjoyable.
Must do. Very good, comfortable seats, very clean glasses. The only thing I would change is the video that is not neccesary and it affects taking pictures.

Danube river cruise. So glad we took this cruise. We opted for the hour & half sightseeing cruise which cruised along Danube, around Margaret island and back again. Along the way we say all the sights along the bank of the river. Buda castle, parliament building etc. The boat itself was comfortable, super cozy, and providedo headsets with interesting facts along the way. The complimentary champagne & non alcoholic beverage makes for a nice touch also. Highly recommended this trip to anyone visiting budapest.
Beautiful. Beautiful & unique experience that we really enjoyed. Punctual & organized people. We hope to repeat it again. As for the guide, a very friendly lady.Thank you again.
Great way to see the city . We took a mid-day boat tour along the Danube. It was a great way to see the city and learn more about its history. It was a perfect activity for a rainy afternoon!

Best Cruise of Budapest. The River Cruise on the River Danube is very interesting and the old historical buildings and structures makes it even more better, the history narrated is also very interesting, the cruise becomes more interesting when it becomes dark as the whole riverside is lit up the view of some of the building and castles in the night after they are lit up is fabulous. Would like to visit again if I get the chance.
Great experience. Must do while in Budapest. I had a great time. Highly recommended to everyone. Great service and experience

Nice, warm and wonderful. I booked an evening tour without dinner prior to my trip. It included a complimentary beverage - with a choice among beer, wine, champagne, soft drinks and water. The trip was scheduled at 19:30 hours and it started on time. We were seated inside a covered boat (transparent), so it was warm and comfortable inside. We were provide with multi-language audio guide headsets which talked to us about history and stories of all the wonderful sights of Budapest on either side of the Danube river. This was in tandem with a video on screen (there are multiple of these screens and is visible from all seats on the boat). Budapest looks really magnificent in the evening with all the lights and reflections on Danube, and the little history and stories that the tour offers is just the perfect icing on the cake. It is one of the most amazing ways to spend an evening in the "Pearl of Danube" with your loved one.

very good experience. I'm wondering how did you know my e-mail address. haha...It's really good experience on your board, but a little cold, especially at night. If you have some rugs on board would be much better, just like airplanes.You have different kinds of drinks, but all cold drinks. To our chinese people, if there were some hot drink, the trip would be perfect.After all, thank you for the unfotgetable trip experience.
Great even on a Cold Night. We loved the cruise. It was perfect for everyone in our group - ages 32-70. Even the cold and wind couldn't keep us from enjoying the top of the boat outside!

Lightning hour. A very nice way to spend an hour (I booked) for my first evening in the city..and the explanations about the history were new to me and the sights for the first time are stunning and not boring..Take the sunset hour cruise..the lights turning in are great ..
Friendly staff and on time. We booked the sightseeing via Travelbird and everything was good. Glad there were enough blankets on the boat as it was very cold when sitting outside.

Blissful evening under the city lights. My mum and I enjoyed a relaxing 1 hour cruise with a glass of bubbly. Staff were very friendly & efficient. It's a perfect way to see the many sights of the city, nestled on the banks of the Danube. Our tip is to go after sunset when all of the lights from the various buildings and sights are twinkling.

Nice night on the river Danube. We took a night cruise on the Danube which wasn't a dinner cruise, but was enjoyable. It provided a video about the various sites, which was helpful with the history of the area. My only complaint was that the reflections from the screen made it difficult to take pictures of the lights reflecting in the river. The trip was about an hour, and I thought it worth the cost.

the stuff is helpful and kind. I was maybe 10th times whit them, and always was a good trip. They are good professionals. Have a comfortable seat, and listen the Strauss music, while admire the riverside building. Have a good Hungarian vine and relax.
Best meal in Budapest.. Views on a night dinner cruise were magnificent. So glad we were able to see the city this way. Great food and service
Interesting experience. You do not board any of this boats expecting fine foods , instead have a couple of drinks nice conversations and enjoy the ride.

Legenda evening dinner cruise. Fabulous evening with friends along the Danube. Staff were very attentive and looked after us throughout the journey. Food was excellent, the free drink was of a good standard and the entertainment - pianist and singer - were not intrusive. Would recommend this trip to anyone visiting Budapest.We booked from the UK through Legenda web page and paid before we boarded.

Great boat trip at night along the Danube. We booked this last minute online the evening before; most were sold out but the last one at 9pm wasn't, so we went for it. All the better to see the lights of the city at night! [This was a viewing-only tour, you could book for dinner as well but that is earlier in the evening.]We arrived about 15 minutes before the departure time, meaning we were in the front part of the boarding queue to get good seats. The seats on the back of the boat in the open air seem to be the best - no glare on the windows interrupting the view (or the camera lens). The company is thoughtful and provides blankets to borrow to keep you warm if you sit outside. The inside is toasty, so either way you should be comfortable. The staff were nice, accepting our mobile tickets with no problems, and were attentive. The ticket price includes one free drink (alcoholic or soft) including champagne, which added a classy touch.Seeing the city at night was amazing, couldn't fault the views - stunning! You go down the river a ways, come back up and further along, then back down to the mooring point. All in all it took about an hour.There were only a couple of things that dropped a star off the rating for this trip:1) Be prepared for other passengers getting in the way of the view. This is worse if you're sitting on the aisle seat. But if it's the view on the other side that they're obscuring, remember it will be there on the way back and your view at that point should be unobstructed.2) The television on board is very annoying. Like most tour ships they have headphones with information describing, in very flowery language, what you're seeing as you're going along (we found this annoying too but it was at least expected) but this ship also had a large television, partly obscuring the view, showing you pictures...of what is going by past your eyes. Seems daft!Ultimately, would definitely recommend going on this trip to see more of the city, just a couple points knocking it down a star, otherwise it would be 5.

Bad Weather made bearable by a caring friendly and professional hostess. Bad Weather couldn't be helped however this was made made bearable by a caring friendly and professional hostess, young Lady with short blond hair. Even offered to take our photos, boat trip was very good value for money.

Thoroughly interesting ride on the Danube. From online booking to checking in at the pier to the service and hospitality on board, I have only positive things to say about Legenda. Everything was easy and friendly with two courtesy drinks and multi-language narrating as the coup de grace. Recommended.

OMG. Good plastic view, awful plastic 'window' surrounded, fuel smelling, and cold food... Requested medium beef, but overcooked....totally like eating airline meal...good services though...which makes it a two star rating instead of one.... Four days in Prague and Four days in Budapest as my honeymoon, randomly picked over 10 restaurants from tripadvisor.. This is the worst... All the other restaurants I tired in my trip were nice though(lucky) Trust me, try something else if you would like to have better food; for the view...nice... But please, for god sake , remove that plastic window....

Very dissapointed. We had great expectations for this ride and got totally dissapointed.We were seated in row#3 and it was impossible to take pictures because of the reflections in the side windows coming from the 2 TV screens up front.The explanation given to all passengers on the boat wasn't following the route the boat took.Not worth the amount of money we paid!Just look at the pictures I added and you will understand what I mean

perfect way to wind down from a 2-week trip. We selected the last daytime tour which was at 18:30, and as a result we were able to watch the sun set during the cruise, as well as see all the lights turned on the buildings after sunset. The evening tours are about $5-$6 more and take a slightly different route. But if you take an earlier daytime cruise, you can get dropped off at Margaret Island and spend 1 1/2 hours in the park setting, and if you have your bathing suit, use the thermal baths. We chose not to take the dinner cruise since we are particular about what we eat, and did not want limited selections. Our hotel recommended this cruise operator, and we were very satisfied. You get one drink, either alcoholic or not, shortly after the boat leaves the dock, and about a half hour later, you get a lemonade, all included in the price. Blankets are available if you feel chilly, but you will have to ask for them. After a 2-week trip covering 3 countries, we chose this cruise as a wonderfully relaxing activity before leaving for home.

Wedding dinner for two. We really recommend a Candlelit Dinner Cruise with Legenda Sightseeing Boats in Budapest. We got a table for two on the second floor of the boat. The service was outstanding with our own waiter and exquisite 4 course dinner. The atmosphere was great and the cityview was amazing. We will gladly return.

Great Tour on the Danube. Very good tour with excellent food and service. Highlight recommended. We paid € 300 for the trip and an a la carte dinner for 4 persons including the most expensive bottle of red wine.

Great sightseeing by night great boat!. We booked this through the hotel. Which was the same price, they get a taxi for us and when we arrived they greeted us well and after some minutes we could go on board. Everywhere is glass so no matter where you sit you can make great pictures. Also the free drink you get is a nice welcome, offcourse we got champagne!
Legenda night cruise on the Danube. Would highly recommend this one hour cruise on the Danube River where we were able to see all of the beautiful buildings in Budapest lit up at night.
Budapest at night!. Took a cruise at night in Budapest. The lights of the city were amazing. The info on the boat was right on. The audio guide worked perfectly. Definitely a must do!

Budapest boat trip. The boat trip over the Danube was lovely. Excellent descriptive explanations og the histories behind the various landmarks of the city that lie along both sides of the city..... in a large number of language options through headphones available individually to ever customer. Will do this again. ...

We had a lovely evening. The visit was really interesting with an audio guide and one can choose his preferred language. Only thing I would have appreciates if a blanket was offered to anyone who sat outside the boat cause I was freezing and had to go inside but on the way I was seeing people with blankets. But overall I recommend this tour . You can see the parliament at its best
Beautiful Budapest. Very nice ride with headsets that provide information about the sites. Would recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest.

Perfect Evening. The cruise was amazing. To cruise the Danube at night with all the attractions lit was wonderful. The food was perfect as was the entertainment. Highly recommended if you visit Budapest.

Nice sights, poor viewing & food. We purchased the dinner cruise, we were sat upstairs on the boat, it was quite tight up there and not very easy to see through the plastic. It was a 2.5 hour trip which just goes up and down the same bit of the Danube. The sights were beautiful, but could have done a bit more in the time frame! I personally did not enjoy my food, the mushroom risotto was bland an the chocolate brownie was dry. Also my boyfriend had asked for his meat to be rare and it was not. The boat in general smelled of fuel, and their was live music, but as we were upstairs we did not see this, it was just played through a speaker. While I had a nice time seeing the Danube at night, I unfortunately would not recommend the dinner cruise...

Boat Trip on the Danube. Really enjoyed this. clear audio sound. Drinks served. Pleasant staff. Very reasonably priced. Got off at Margret Island and the boat collected us 1.5hrs later. Very efficient.
Fantastic Experience. I had a fantastic experience. Food was great and the atmosphere was unforgettable. The cruise on the rives is absolutely amazing. Staff were nice and very friendly. I loved it!

it would be great, I think this is the best boat.. Legenda Sightseeing Boats Legenda Sightseeing Boats
Jane Haining rakpart
Budapest 1052............
.

Good experience. I took the last boat to Margaret island at 5.30 and there was no boat to get back to the dock so I had to find my own way out. Besides that, I had a great time, services were excellent

Great evening cruise. Budapest is as I said before much prettier in the dark. The Legenda evening cruise consistent of a nice welcome drink (sparkling wine, wine, beer, soda) with table service. The cruise was an hour and during the cruise they had a movie with information playing on the tv screen in multiple languages (even Dutch, Thai and South Korean available). The cruise lasted for an hour and costed around € 15,-- including the welcome drink.Tip: we stayed on the top deck which was great. They did have blankets since it was cold. So dress up warmly and go outside on the top deck to enjoy the view from the Danube in the evening.

Perfect evening. I booked the evening dinner cruise for me and my partner as part of her 30th birthday present. The cruise was a very special occasion from beginning to end. The atmosphere upstairs was very romantic and gave great views of the cities sites. The food was beautiful and the service from the very friendly, efficient staff made the evening stress free. I would highly recommend the evening dinner cruise as a must do for your trip to Budapest. Overall it was a very romantic, perfect evening.

Pleasure and intersting mixture. A real pleasure, mixed with interesting explanations and kind service. the different languages eased the listening and understanding of every detail which was really comfortable.
Great boattrip on the Dunube/Donau!. Warm welcome, plesant service, smooth ride on the Danube/Donau, fantastic views at the featured buildings of Budapest and great dinner. Absolute must

Legenda dinner cruise - Budapest. as we cruised along the picturesque Danube through Budapest we were treated to an excellent four course meal and wonderful live music. The service was second to none and we were made to feel very welcome.

Budapest at dusk. Start of the trip was very nice and also the buildings looked quite amazing during dusk. Going around Margit island after dark was slightly boring. But for sure much better during daytime.
Brilliant!. My fiancé took me for my birthday and I had the absolute best time! The food was lovely as well as the atmostphere & the views were stunning!
Budapest night cruise. Impressive staff, excellent view of the city at night!!! Learned a few new facts even after a guided morning tour!!

Quality and affordable fun. We took both, day & night cruise, highly recommended.
The boat is very convenient, very courteous staff.

Great trip. This was a wonderful evening unfortunately with the change in weather the windows steamed up making viewing difficult. We had the fixed price dinner. The food was good and the servings were generous. The staff were very attentive and pleasant.

The perfect host.. We booked a tour on the Internet and were waiting on the wrong dock at the river Danube. When we finally discovered our mistake, the boat had already took off. Our tickets were replaced whitout any problems and we were invited to wait on the next boat in a luxurious restaurant ship where we could enjoy some nice drinks while it was raining outside. After one hour we enjoyed the boottrip after all and it was very nice. We where also offered two drinks on board instead of the one which was included. It all turned out wonderfull!

Excellent trip. We had a lovely trip on the boat down the river. The boat was very clean and comfortable and the staff very helpful. It was for about an hour and was just long enough to see the sights and take some more pictures. It was nice to relax after walking all day.

Nice but something has to be changed. Trip has been nice, but more sourveillance would be glade cause of some visitors that, in order to take photograph of EVERYTHING, made lot of noise till being disappointing. Then, there was a man seated behind me, which after having drunk his champagne, dis a sonore burp: so inpolite.

Good overview. Clever to use two narrators, one for each side of the river, both in good, easily understood English. Well timed and well described sites. Nice hostesses, good welcome drink. Boat seemed safe and steady. Well paced trip. Totally satisfied. CT-USA

Good sights, good food. The tour was quite nice with a lot of great views of sights including the royal palace, the cathedral and bastion and the parliament building (along with several others). The food was also good - I had the duck which was excellent. However the prices for the food was a bit high (roughly 2400 for 3 shrimp appetizer). Additionally, 2.5 hours was a long time. I understand to do 4 courses of food for the whole boat they need the time, but it did begin to drag on after about 1.5 hours as you take the same loop twice (see each sight 4 times essentially). Overall, glad to have done it and a great way to see budapest!

Worthwhile activity. We recently took a Legenda river cruise in Budapest that included dinner. The route of the boat is interesting and the city is very pretty at night, especially when seen from the Danube. The big surprise was how lovely the supper was too. We chose a la carte, and everything we had was very delicious - quite amazing since we were expecting microwaved yucky stuff! I liked that every step was organized well - you enter the boat when invited and someone shows you to your table so there is no free-for-all, and all the tables are in a good position to see the shoreline. The staff tries very hard to be friendly and accommodating. All in all a very pleasant evening and well worth the price.

Wonderful dinner river cruise. Booked the alacarte river cruise on the recommendation of the trip advisor reports and wasn't disappointed. This was a special occasion and everything from the welcome on board to leaving the vessel was excellent. Great food, best so far in Budapest, excellent service and lovely live music to accompany the cruise, couldn't fault anything. Not the cheapest way to view the lovely vista's of Budapest at night but certainly the best. If you want to top off a visit to Budapest then this takes some beating, would highly recommend this cruise.

Very mediocre. Went on the legenda dinner cruise last night. Chose the ala carte option. Was put up stairs in claustrophobic hot room with murky plastic windows that didnt open. I spent entire cruise on its bitsy outside deck on a garbage can as there is no where to sit or walk outside. Was probably a 12 x 6 foot space. Had to hang with the smokers, which also sucked. What kind of cruise doesnt have a place to sit or walk on deck outside!?! The crusiee was up the pretty part of danube....they went up and down same section two or three times. It is very beautiful, but i was envious of the other open boats where you could walk around....cannot recommend this at all....pick another line that has a normal boat. And it was 2.5 hours. Too long.
Good clean boat with excellent viewing. The Legenda boats are comfortable, clean, reasonably priced and on time. A very good deal for a high quality service.

Legenda Night Crise. The cruise was one of the highlights of our trip to Budapest and would definitely recommend it. The only downside was that while one drink is included you cannot purchase any further drinks and you are not made aware of this when purchasing the tickets

Best of the best. I visited Budapest twice and did the Danube River cruise twice via Legenda Sightseeing Boat at night, it's the most famous cruise agent, I liked also they time dedication as well the welcome drink, i used to booked online from my city Lebanon via there web page, I strongly recommend every tourist to try it.

Great views. Good way to spend a nice afternoon on the Danube though i wish id taken a night trip as the views would have been even better. Good multilanguage commentary with interesting information. Clean and safe

The best way to enjoy the night view in Budapest. I booked the boat from 9:30pm through the online in the middle if the September. And it was stunning. Ive been every famous place for taking good pictures of night view but Legenda was the best. The price was reasonable and the staffs are kind and professional. Im surprised that they also have Korean Audio guide.

Film Cruise. Ship was good and it was enclosed on a cool night which was also good. What I didn't like was the TV film of Budapest going on while you really should be looking outside you are constantly watching the TV for information. I would suggest running the film while people are getting on board and waiting and maybe just some occasional live commentary during the cruise.

To see the best of Pest (and Buda). This trip would be worth 5 points for the view alone.With Mrs MadMac being a vampire, we booked the trip after dark. We would have partaken of the dinner cruise but she was worried about garlic in the food.Anyway, this really is the best way to view the city and appreciate another aspect to the iconic buildings that stand the test during daylight but at night really highlight the romantic nature of Budapest.We started the tour on the narrow top deck for the best view. There are headphones that describe the sights in many languages but we didn't bother, the view was enough for us and we just marvelled at it, particularly the Parliament building.As the Queen of Summer had recently slipped South, it was a bit chilly up top for Mrs MMMM and so we ventured downstairs once the complimentary drink was served. Though enclosed, you still get an excellent view with the bonus of it being nice and toasty if you tend to be nesh.The crew are friendly and you don't get any sense of them going through the motions with the tourists, they must do the tour several times a day and so it is nice that they were still smiling.The crew member serving our drinks remembered everyone's drink without writing it down. I wish I had a memory like that.This trip really is a must do. It was also gratifying to actually see a river in use, not just the tour boats but river barges too.We will probably do this trip again but in the heart of Winter.

Relaxing Way to End our Trip. While we were waiting to board, we sat on comfortable sofas on the boarding launch, sipping wine. There was interesting commentary during the cruise and it was a nice way to end our tour through eastern Europe.

very good. very nice way to see the lights of the city at night with a 'romantic' dinner - they have an upstairs floor for tables for 2 and the main floor for groups.the stuff was super nice and the food very good.
Pleasant sightseeing trip. Very pleasant trip, audioguides in many languages and drink on board. Totally recommended for people who want an affordable river cruise and do not fancy dinner on board.
Brilliant views of the city. I would recommend this river cruise, as you get to see the beautiful city from a different perspective.

One of my best nights ever, evening dinner cruise.. We (my wife & I) booked this from our Viking River cruise. Many of our group did, we were given the choice of a la carte or set menu. We, unlike everyone else, went a la carte. I think that's what made the difference. While they were seated on the fairly crowded lower deck, we were shown up a little spiral staircase to an observation deck with four tables for four couples. A wonderfully romantic setting.We cast off, ordered our food and wine, it all arrived in good time and was beautifully presented. We were captive diners for the three hour cruise so there was no rush. The slowly passing lights of Budapest were all that you would expect. There was a live blues band on board, just two guys, put they were good with a great Brit/American repertoire. They were playing our sorta music and playing it well.I asked the waitress if they did requests, whether they had a selection of songs that they knew that we could look at. She went to find out and, next thing, the singer was stood by our table shaking my hand. I was a pleasantly surprised and asked "Do you know Black Magic Woman ..... for my wife?" - "Of course, of course" Wow, this was brilliant. I pushed my luck. "...and Redhouse?" - "Yes, certainly."The sweet arrived, another bottle of wine please. Good to his word the band played both of my requests during the second half and absolutely nailed them both. The food and service were great, the setting perfect and the band the icing on the cake. Arguably our most romantic meal after over forty years married. Remember to go a la carte. And when we got home and checked our credit card it had all cost us about £30!! Could it get any better?
