Flexible and friendly staffs,. The staff who answered the phone was flexible and helpful. She let us change our trip to 1-hour later because we got lost when looking for our hostel.I feel the hospitality and enthusiasm of the staffs on boat at well.Reasonable pirce- definitely recommended.
Loved every minute of the evening. Had an amazing night. The dinner and service was good, but it was the scenery that was amazing. A total beautiful night
Wonderful Views. This was a wonderful to see the lights of Budapest at night from the river. Food was well prepared and tasty and service was top notch. Very happy with the entire experience.

Fantastic views - go for the 8.15pm cruise!. We really enjoyed the Legenda 1-hour evening cruise. The price included a free drink, and the boat has audio narration. We took the 8.15pm cruise, which was absolutely perfect for watching the sunset over the Danube (at the end of July) and seeing the sights both in daylight and at night. I would definitely recommend the 8.15pm one also because there was enough space for everyone to get good seats and no one had to queue up. The later cruises seemed to be absolutely packed with at least 50 people waiting in line to get decent seats.Gave 4 stars instead of 5 as it was at times difficult to figure out which building the audio narration was about - the TV screens could have been better utilised for this.

Great Experience. A cruise in a beautiful landscape. It seems to enter the world of Sissi. The explanations during the cruise are precise and exhaustive and is very addictive listen to the story of a wonderful city, with its monuments, its intellectual excellence, of its universities. An experience not to be missed to complete the visit of a truly magnificent European capital

Decent but Disappointing in One Respect. You really cannot go wrong with an evening boat ride on the Danube. The weather was perfect and the sights are beautiful. The boat offers a narration of the sights along with a video in an impressive number of languages. My big complaint is that the video narration and the boat location are not timed well. It was hard to know what building they were talking about and sometimes things had already passed by. One particularly impressive detail was that the hostesses who served drinks did so totally by memory.

Pearl in the Danube. It was an excellent experience that I had during my trips. I had the 20:15 trip which is the sunset time. I got the chance to see the day and the evening Budapest sightseeing. The tour audio guide translation provided was excellent and it was in all languages. The staff were friendly even the snack bar was good. I highly recommend it to any tourist decide to visit Budapest. For me if I will ever go again Legenda will be number one in my things to do there.
Sights. Served very nice food I would definatly recommend this place had good entertainment and gold sights to see
Great tour!. We took the evening tour on Legenda. The city is beautiful at night and the tour is most recomended.

Great Cruise!. The audio information was very informative and the cruise went at a great pace. Not too long, not too short. The seats were basic and not super comfortable, but certainly not uncomfortable. For the price, you really can't beat this cruise if you're looking for a good informational cruise along the Danube River.

Great way to see Budapest. This was a well done boat cruise of the central part of Budapest via the Danube river. It was well worth the money, which was minimal compared to similar cruises in other cities.

Perfect evening cruise. Easy to order and pay online, only need my phone at checkin. Took the 2015 with my wife and 4 children aged 12-1. All had a ball watching sunset and lit up buildings..free drink on the Danube was a great touch. Boat is uniquely built to ensure open clear views from all seats and angles. Only an hour so great for small attention spans. Wil recommend to friends!

Beautiful Evening Cruise. This was a beautiful evening cruise, the weather was great so we had a clear view over the Danube and therefore we saw Budapest night with all the city landmarks floodlit. There was a live band singing songs and the excursion took about 2.5 hours.The meal served was delicious, 4 courses and the pace was very leisurely so no need to hurry. It is a lovely experience and well worth the price, The upper deck was mainly couples (probably because of the width of the boat being narrower here than downstairs. It is suitable for families too, (not sure if children might get bored) but on the whole it is a lovely evening and we thoroughly enjoyed it.

Excellent boat trip. The Legenda Sightseeing boat tour offers a better experience than other boat tour companies. They have good boats and the service on board is very good. The complimentary bevearges and the audio guides are excellent.
great way to see Parliament House at night. Did a night cruise on the Danube and got to experience the city all lit up, Parliament is particularly impressive.

A night tour on the river. We booked the night cruise which included one free drink. The weather was great and the atmosphere on the boat was, because it was a night cruise, romantic. You were able to open the windows and a small area to sit outside completely. It would've been nicer to have a bigger space so that more people could sit outside. What I didn't like was that all the information about the city came from an audio tape and you had to listen to it with earphones. I did the tour with my boyfriend and it would've been nice to talk about the things you see which was a little hard to do while having to listen to the information via earphones. (It kind of killed the romantic atmosphere.) They also played a film about the sights of the city during the tour which was rather distracting and (in my opinion) not needed. All in all the tour offers a nice nighttime tour of the city, but there might be better once as well.

Outstanding Cruise. We took the candle cruise and it was really worth it. The Danube and Budapest are beautiful at night. Being on the top floor with a candle dinner was truly memorable. This is really romantic. The food was excellent, the service was professional. I recommend this cruise to anyone visiting Budapest.

Excellent boat tour to go on!. Originally we were booked to go on the amphibious bus tour but cancelled when the air con wasn't working. We were so pleased this happened as it meant we found Legenda! We had an amazing time the free drinks were a great touch and the audio tour was brilliantly done to ensure you were clear on what you were looking at. Great value for money and a great way to see both sides of the city and the Danube too!

Love seeing Budapest @ night!. We had a great trip on the Legenda @ night. We were sent to the wrong dock so had to do a little bit of running to make the boat on time. However it was so worth it, the buildings lit up @ night are stunning especially Hungary's Parliament building & Castle hill. The staff were very pleasant & we had a nice glass of champagne during the hour cruise. Do this trip, don't miss out!
Perfect. Kind stuff, which help us with baby carriage.Drink for free and story about Budapest in many languages, includes Czech language.

Sight-seeing At Its Best! . I booked the one-hour night boat cruise through Legenda and was not disappointed! The staff and crew were friendly and helpful, and the boat itself was clean and comfortable. The free drink-of-choice was also a nice touch. Seeing the sights on Budapest is something that you cannot miss while there! The audio guide was very informative with the passing buildings. I was happy I chose Legenda!

Not a relaxing boat ride . Booked this based on reviews. Online it said the 9pm was sold out but when we called on the phone we were able to get a reservation. We arrived 40 min early and the best spots were taken and our group separated. The boat left a few min late and every seat was filled. There was a recorded tour and it came with a drink....this was silly because the ride was barely an hour and it took 40 min for the girls to repeat the choices to everyone and bring us a small whatever. The good part was the beautiful parliament building at night and the Danube and the lights ...the rushed and cramped style of the boat felt like such a money grab. I'm not sure there is something better but you should look around...

Fantastic dinner cruise!. Legenda Sightseeing Boats provided my friends and I with a relaxing dinner cruise in which we were able to fully enjoy the lights of Budapest whilst eating a 4 course meal! The service was perfect! Thank you!

Great choice to know Budapest at night!. Legenda has a great boat. It has a 360 view through all river's road (Best view, up in front although is cold). Service and beverages are great, highly recommended.

Great sightseeing trip. The boat was exceptional and the buildings are beautiful at night. Each seat is fitted with headphones to which you can tune your language, which give information about the buildings as you see them. The only issues were that getting on the boat was a bit unorganized, and the headset didn't always work. At one point, mine just randomly switched to Arabic and I was unable to switch it back to English. Other people had a few issues as well. However, in all it was great and a memorable experience. If you go on the night cruise (which we did and I highly recommend), it'll get chilly even in summer so wear a coat!

Very nice sightseeing boat tour. We booked this tour (departure 21:30) 2 days in advance since many time slots were allready booked. It was a very nice trip with good views on both sides of the river. we also liked the information which was given (in our own language) .

Excellent Meal. We booked the dinner cruise on the Danube as a treat night for our weekend away and it didn't disappoint. The food was excellent, service good and ambiance really lovely. The views from the river are second to none and I'd recommend it to anyone going.
Excellent. Staff were niceFood was tastyEverything were excellent!I would come if I visit to Budapest again!
great nighttime boat ride. took the sunset boat ride. They provide one complimentary cocktail during the ride. Very well done and worth the experience.
Relaxing river cruise. Great way to finish off a busy walking day and see this beautiful city from the Danube.Free drink and a lovely lemonade at the end.

Awful. The environment is gloomy and sad, for everyone is watching the TV. There's not the usual "life" like you get at sightseeing boats. I will risk it and say it's the worst boat I've ever gotten on.
Gorgeus. I loved this place.I loved visiting Dune on a boat.Incredible sunset in there.I wish that one day return the city and use the sightseeing boats again.

Beautiful city at night. Boarded legenda at 9 pm, the beautifully lit bridges and buildings and the cool breeze made the experience very pleasant . The audio guide gave us a clear description of the sights before us. Enjoyed the scenery with a cool glass of champagne .

Evening cruise with dinner.. Don't order food.
Better just the cruise without food.
Quality poor for the price you pay.
21/2hrs a bit too long.
Legenda Sightseeing Boat-Danube River in Budapest. As advertised. Pleasant staff. Provided more refreshments than advertised. On schedule. Boat in good condition.

A nice evening. Food was good, wine too, after it was clear that the Merlot only choice isfor the included one glass only, and you can have a real choice if you ho for bottles. Were unlucky with the weather, but it is a matter of luck

Legenda. Courteous staff; beautiful views of Budapest from the river. Tip: I noticed everyone booked the 9pm departure (summer) but the 8:15 allows you to identify major sights and buildings in the daylight and photograph them in the dark on the return loop.
Relaxing ride. Nice alternative to tour the city and a chance to get a closer view of the beautiful Parliament House.
To be visited. Very satisfied with the trip, recommended. Beautiful views, great service! We had an evening cruise, when the lights are on, it's shorter than day trips but more beautiful

Amazing night cruise. The boat was designed perfectly for great views of both sides no matter where you were sitting. The staff were very nice and the whole process was very easy to get on and off. Did a similar cruise in Paris And this was much nicer in all aspects.

Lovely Experience. The hour long night cruise was exceptional. The staff were very professional and we liked that you could choose to listen to the commentary on headphones or just sit and enjoy the sounds of the river. A drink to start out was a nice touch. The views at night were stunning!

Danube by night !. We chose the package which included the fare ,drinks but not the meal . However when on board we chose the Alacarte Menu and the food was excellent . We sat on the top deck which is quieter and ideal for couples . The lower deck had more of a party atmosphere . Staff were very helpful and service excellent . Very nice passengers on board . Fabulous views of buildings in Budapest . Half way through , tremendous storm with lightening which added drama . We will bk the same trip again if we return to Budapest .

Loved this.. We chose the night cruise at 9.00pm, I think the views are buildings look far better lit up at night. The boat was very comfortable and just a pleasant experience overall. Amazing and would do it again if we ever return to Budapest.
Great way to see the city. We had a lovely ride and enjoyed learning more about the history and culture of the city. Definitely recommended!

Nice boatride, with superfluous and annoying televised content. The riverside is stunning (especially at night), and enjoying it with a glass of champagne on a boat is a fun addition to walking among the buildings of Budapest. Unfortunately the experience is marred by the presence of some giant television sets that run some pre-recorded guide/presentation with crummy dialogue. We ended up discarding the headsets and walking upstairs, outside, where an otherwise perfect 360 view of the city around is was interrupted by another one of these television sets mounted directly in the front of the boat - blocking the view ahead and up the river. The trip didn't suffer much from this (you're going to look to the sides most of the time anyway), but how I wish those flat screens were just scrapped so that we could see the city uninterrupted.
Everything was perfect 😀. We loved all stuff from the begining til end , the boat, the captain, the girls, and the good. It was the greatest night in our life

Evening cruise. I did an evening cruise with Legenda and it was perfect. They have amazing sits, protected from the wind (it was a cold night), with nice champagne (you can choose) and even better sights. The tour includes history commentaries, which help to have an overview of the monuments that we passed. After that I've done a cheaper day cruise with another company and I was pretty disappointed. I highly recommended it, specially at night.

Dinner cruise. Had a lovely evening good food and not rushed with courses,the only thing I would say is you are so busy photographing the sites your meal gets a little cold.Staff very friendly ,we were on the upper deck and the music sound was just right,we requested a table on the upper deck.A wonderful evening and would recommend it ,would love to do it all again .

Amazing. Amazing boat Sightseeing, specially after a whole hot day of walking around the streets of Budapest, this boat trip was like an oasis since we were able just to relax, enjoy the river breeze and look at the monuments from a different perspective. The fact that we took the trip at around 9:30 pm made it even better. Staff is friendly too :)

Fantastic experience. Everything to the booking to the end of the cruise was brilliant! The staff were smartly dressed, attentative, friendly and polite. The A la Carte menu was really good and was cooked to perfection!
Great trip - Great Price. Enjoyed the trip. Audio was very good, timing was good, service good. Very Relaxing evening on the boat. Our trip was at 6:30, so was good to go before dinner.

Fantastic, relaxing, lovely staff.. This sightseeing trip is well worth the rating on Trip Advisor. It was such a relaxing, chilled and informative trip. Audio commentary along with a large TV complimented the trip. We chose the night time cruise which was very special. The boat was just the right size. The staff were absolutely delightful. To top it all, a free drink! Sit upstairs, outside, grab a seat near the front.

Great views of the buildings at night. I highly recommend doing this tour at night. The lit buildings and bridges along the river are gorgeous at night. We sat on top, where there were only 2 seats per row, with an aisle running down the middle. It was great for taking photos.
It was a lovely evening. It was a great experience to see illuminated all the Royal palace and other lovely sites of Budapest.

A perfect hour!. We flew into Budapest with only 2 days to learn the city. It was hot, we got caught in a thunderstorm and we stumbled around the city but at 9:30 pm we boarded the Legenda. What a cruise. Sit upstairs for the breeze and the views then sit back and let the Danube itself take you through the history of this remarkable town(s)!Have a delicious dinner first, suggest Danacorso, across from the dock!

A Perfect Way to See The Danube & Budapest. My wife and I did two trips with Legenda whist in Budapest last week, one during the day, and that being very good we decided to do another one with the same company at 21:30 when the buildings along the Danube are magnificently illuminated. Having looked along the river at all the companies offering sightseeing boat trips we decided to go with Legenda and we made a great choice. The trips are very well organised, you can pay on the day at the ticket booth next to the boats, they offer complimentary drinks, including a choice of champagne, wine, beer, soft drinks or water. The commentary is provided by recording in various languages, you just choose which you want. The staff on these boats are very courteous and helpful. All in all you'd not be disappointed if you choose to see the river with Legenda. And if you do want to do a trip along the Danube and do it during the day, do it after dark too, the sights are stunning! A really memorable time. N&G L

RECOMMENDED BY HOTEL AND NOW US. We asked our concierge at the Intercontinental Hotel about 1 hour sightseeing boats and he recommended this boat line. Tours depart from dock 7 near the Marriott Hotel and run for 1 hour and 10 minutes. Guides are very professional, efficient, and courteous. Audio tour is given in 30 languages and is quite comprehensive. After leaving the dock, boats travel down just beyond the Liberty Bridge then turn around. Sites along the way include Castle Hill, Matthias Church, Fishermen's Bastion, Parliament, and the Chain Bridge. Boat circles Margaret Island and actually allows those guests who want to get off and visit the island to do so. During the tour you are given 1 glass of wine/champagne/beer/soft drink or mineral water and then later on a glass of lemonade. The drinks were actually served in glasses (vice paper/plastic cups and were very good. Highly recommend this tour to everyone.

Best event for pleasent and quick tourist trip in Budapest. Very relaxing journey with tourist guide in all languages. Super.I really recomend this if you dont have any specific wish to see in Budapest.

Lovely!. Wi-Fi didn't work outside at all, but other than that the trip was good.Audio guide in Finnish amazed me, worked well and was interesting ang gave a lot.Wonderful idea of female being the voice of Buda and male Pest.
top guide. 30 languages available, very nice story, beautiful city, take the trip "by night" free drink during the trip

Relaxing and informative cruise. We loved this cruise so much, we did it twice, the second time getting off at Margaret Island for a few hours. It is comfortable, informative, and the champagne is an extra treat!
Good. I like the service and the waitresses are so kind. The weather was rainy but the view and the atmosphere were perfect

Good service. We enjoyed our boat trip. It did feel a bit like a rotating escalator though, really they just wanted to sell seats. Our guides didn't play in English and one of us didnt even have earphones, I'm not sure whether we missed much? Budapest is beautiful though and we are pleased that we had this experience.

Highlight of Budapest. I spent 4 full days (and evenings) in Budapest. This unquestionably was the highlight for me. I signed up for an evening cruise (not dinner, just the cruise) on the Danube - about $20. I waited until late in the afternoon to commit, so as to be sure the weather would cooperate. Whether or not you are a photography nut, choose a seat on either side of the boat, but definitely the end (water) seat. And if you are a photography nut, be sure your camera has at least 5 times as many photo shots available as you think you will need. I have seen many beautiful cities, but Budapest in the evening wins hands down. I was there in May, and so the cruise for me started while it was still daylight. It was interesting and a pleasant ride. There's an audio guide (included) that identifies and gives background info for many of the buildings and other structures we passed. And then dusk fell. And Budapest turned on its lights. It is indescribable how beautiful are the bridges, the Parliament, the Castle and myriad other buildings along the waterfront. Each time you think you've seen the most beautiful, the next one comes along to top that. And for the $20 you also get a glass of very drinkable wine or beer. Don't miss this!

Wonderful!. I took the 2pm cruise on the Duna Bella. This was on Friday, July 1st. It is described as a 1hr and 10 minute sightseeing cruise. A drink on the outbound journey is offered, along with a lemonade offering on the return journey. An english language audio guide, with headphones, is available and suggested to make the journey that much nicer. When you get to dock 7 you are greeted and if you are early for boarding, you can wait in the adjacent lounge. The hostesses for our boat were wonderful. I chose the optional 90 minute stopover on Margaret Island. This worked out very well and I am glad I was able to walk around a bit and explore the island. There is a kiosk right near the dock where you can buy food and drinks. Then in 90 minutes you board the boat for the return trip to your starting point. I had a great time and would not hesitate to take this boat trip again. Cost for this trip was 3,900 HUF.
Nice!. The food was good!Staff very friendlyBut overall the sightseeing was amazing, we realy enjoyed iT !

Fantastically romantic. Rocked up 10 minutes before boat departed and managed to get cancellation on this fabulous dinner boat sightseeing evening. The staff were fantastically attentive without being invasive and even took a few great pictures of us as a couple, s very romantic evening. The boat was small and the dinner was great. We had a lovely couple singing as we passed down the Danube and saw the city lights come on ... So beautiful. A night cruise is worth every penny and this tour felt small and personal with fantastic views all around given by the almost 100% glass sides and ceiling. Much better than most other boats.

Lovely evening. Budapest can be best appreciated at night with all it's bridges, castle, parliament and prominent buildings beautifully lit up. Boarded the boat at 9:00 pm, as it was dusk and the temperature had come down, we enjoyed the cool breeze and the lovely Danube promenade sipping our complimentary drinks. Staff was courteous and made sure that everyone was comfortable.

Budapest. Very poor boarding process. We were the first ones to check in and among the last to board due to chaotic boarding. There were 4 in our group. Headsets did not work for one in our group.and not enough staff to help resolve the problem.

Great start to our holiday. We decided to go on a cruise as a spur of the moment thing as we walked into the city from our hotel. At around £30 for the family it wasn't cheap but looked good. We only had 10 mins to wait for our boat and as the first of the morning it was quiet. We waited in the sitting area and then boarded our clean comfy boat. We went upstairs for the air and views but more sheltered seats were available too. You pick your language on the headset which plays music from each country while you wait (some hilarity trying to ID countries blindfold while waiting). The commentary was excellent and really helped us identify places to visit and get our bearings. Their public transport map in the holders at the start is excellent!

Highlight of our trip (candle lit dinner cruise). We had pre-booked the candle lit dinner cruise based on trip advisor reviews and were not disappointed. This was the absolute highlight of the trip for me.We set sail at dusk around 19:45 and an hour later it was dark and we got to enjoy seeing all the buildings lit up - which is a truly stunning sight! We had paid a bit more for the exclusive package, which probably works out about the same as the a la carte option once you work the prices out. The staff were extremely friendly and very efficient, even when they accidentally forgot our welcome drink (we arrived late just as the boat left the dock so it was a bit hectic for them), it was quickly brought over when we asked and they were extremely apologetic about it - which was quite unnecessary as it hadn't caused us any problems. The food was really good. I was expecting it to be 'ok' given that you're on a small boat, but actually it really was very tasty. The chocolate brownie dessert is absolutely delicious! And don't worry if the starter seems a bit small because the main course is huge (or it was for me!). If you can and there is space, ask to be seated upstairs. I don't know if we were put here because we had booked the exclusive package? There were fewer tables so we had a clear view on both sides and the roof was completely open, so you can look up at the sky. There is a live band on the lower deck but you can still hear the music and they even thoughtfully put blankets on the backs of the chairs in case it gets chilly - no chance on that in July but the thought was nice.

Budapest River Cruise. The boarding process is a nightmare. Our group of 4 arrived 45 minutes early and we sat on the couches provided. As the time neared to board the ship, we where pushed back by people that had just arrived. It was a slow boarding process, and when the person in charge left to go check on something, the passengers that had pushed in front of us made a mad rush to get on. There has to be a better way to board this ship.
Wonderful evening. The cruise is really worthwhile doing. The food was amazing and Budapest at night is spectacular! The staff were friendly and the service was very good.

A great introduction to the city. This was our first time in Budapest and to help us get acclimatised we took the 70 minute trip to see the main sights of the city. We happened to book for the hottest day of the year so far and so the inclusion of iced drinks within the ticket was most welcome. The design of the boat meant that there was shade from the sun available during the cruise.The staff were very friendly and spoke at least 5 languages to welcome guests on board. The trip is a great way to get your bearings of where things are in the city, with an audio commentary in many languages to provide some historical context. Recommended for all - seeing the sights from the river is a great experience.

Danube River in Budapest. My mother and I really enjoyed this. It was especially helpful when the voices switched from male to female so that we knew which side of the river was being discussed on the audio tour. Budapest is beautiful. We highly recommend taking time to do this.

Perfect end to our trip!. We had a trip on the Legenda Sightseeing Boat at 9.30pm. This was the best time for us to see the river Dabune lit up at night - it was amazing! The trip cost 5500 HUF each which included an hours journey and a free drink (champagne included!!). I loved the journey and after seeing the majority of Budapests sights it was a perfect way to round up the trip to gain a more in depth history of the attractions. It caters for everyone where you can watch a TV whilst listening to an audio tape which spoke in every language.The only downside was trying to take pictures of the views. There are 3 TVs at the front of the boat and the boat isn't open, it's covered with windows. The glare is annoying! And the windows were pretty mucky too! I suppose it'll be helpful in case it's a rainy night.Overall a good trip but I would suggest trying this at the beginning of your trip so you have a good insight into the history of Budapest!!

A great way to soak up the city beauty!. This tour was money well spent and it was a highlight of our trip in Budapest. Good way to see the sights and there're audioguides in different languages to introduce them. I'd definitely recommend this!

A pleasant view of Budapest. We decided a river view of Budapest would be a nice way to cool down after a lot of walking on a hot summer day. Legenda was a great choice. Very comfortable. The narration of sights during the tour was complete and easy to understand. And a beer and lemonade included in the price was a nice bonus.
Budapest is beautiful. Along with the Duna river, introduction was good and service was good. We did like the tour! It's highly recommended~
Well spend evening. I went with the Legenda cruise on an evening at 21:00. Nice experience and would do it again. Minus for low aircondition on a verh hot day.
extraordinary. it was the first time that I've been Budapest. And the highlight of the stay in Budapest was definitely the Legenda. P.S. champaigne was good enough to enjoy

Dinner Cruise. So glad that we booked the Legenda's dinner cruise prior to arriving in Budapest. The entry was a breeze with the printed out reservation. We were seated upstairs - view from there was amazing! We could take pictures of the Parliament and Castle Hill before and after dawn. Food was better than expected. Service was fast and smooth. We had to listen to a group of Japanese singing a few songs, but other than that, a lady singer entertained us with easy listening songs. Highlight of my stay in Budapest. Thank you Legenda!

It was nice boat trip. I liked the boat trip. It was relaxing and the sight was beautiful at night. The information was valuable. The only thing I didn't like was that the information did not always match with what you were seeing and it therefore it was a bit distracting, but overall I was happy with the experience. I also wanted to stay on the boat longer. It was a bit shor.t
Everything was excellent, was well done!!!. I am to go again to legenda sightseeing with familiy members and foreign guests.The food is verí good not to speak about the wines.
Company Team Tour. Very much enjoyed indeed. However, the boat was very warm, no air condition. Also, the video and the audio was great, but the footage of the video must be very old.

Beautiful views!! . We had a lovely night on the dinner cruise recently; live music, delicious food and absolutely beautiful views of this gorgeous city! Staff were attentive and friendly and the food was traditional and tasty. A really nice way to see this beautiful city at night!

Great, relaxing time off. We had a relaxing, lovely time. The staff were excellent, they serve refreshments during the trip. You have the option to listen to historical facts, learn about Budapest, or just enjoy the view froma comfy seat, or have a wonder around. Would definitely recommend it.

Perfect Budapest evening sightseeing. The best way to see Budapest is from a boat. It's possible to see all the bridges, Parliament building and other building on the river. In the evening it's even better as it creates a really nice atmosphere. The boat is comfortable and I felt no pitching

Fun way to travel the Danube. The taxi service is included if you have a transit pass, but not on weekends. Then you will need a ticket. They were right on time, and a good experience. Wifi was hit and miss, but there boats were fast and great for picture taking.

Excellent cruise.. We visit legenda twice, first day we watched all the sightseeings as in the same time we where geting informed about the meaning of them. During our visit they offerred us a welcome drink (champange, beer or soft drinks, you could choose) also when we were returning they offered us lemonade. At the second day we got the night cruise and the view was just amazing...just loved it. If you cannot afford both tours i defenitly suggest you the dinner tour!!!!

Romantic Danube. While visiting Budapest, we took the late night cruise on the Danube. What a beautiful city! Purchased tickets early in the day and all cruises were sold out. So had to take the last one at 10:45. It was worth the wait. A drink was included on the trip. Narration and large screen video were very nice. Don't miss this when you are in Budapest.

Loved it!!. We bought our tickets on line. We bought the cruise with the a la carte dinner. We wanted the 4 course dinner, and they very easily let us upgrade to that, which actually saved us money. The food was great , the service was excellent and the views spectacular. I think it was my favorite thing in Budapest.

Elegant, delicious and beautiful. Went on a twilight dinner cruise. The service was excellent, the food terrific (what a surprise since we were not expecting fine food), even the wine list was good. And, of course, the views were spectacular. Going at twilight gave us the opportunity to see Budapest in the light as well as at night. With the night lights it was like a fairytale land. Definitely a highlight.

Wedding anniversary . Terrible experience. I booked my tickets online in advance. That was planned as a special dinner for my wife and me as we had 6 year wedding anniversary in that day. We came 20 mins before departure, and got seated in the middle row in the direct sunlight in 30+ C heat. I asked to give us a seat by water, to no avail.The service was slow, bubbly warm and over sweet. The food tasted OK, but I got a terrible case of heartburn the next morning. Normally I don't get heartburn, maybe once a year, so that must have been really bad food.Never again!

The best sightseeing tour boat in budapest. All in all it was amazing.The crew was super nice to everyone. The crew did speak many languages, so it's underdtandable for everyone in the world ( i think ). The tour guide is something like a walkman. You select a language on the device, and there you go. You put on the headphones and you can enjoy a very good structured and good understandable tour in your language. You will get one drink, and one small lamonade too. Like i said, it was a good tour and I would recommend you to do your tour on this boat. ( The tour I did was the normal tour. There are dinner boat tours, too. The boat for the dinner tour looked like the normal one, but i heard that the food is amazing on the dinner tour boat. )

Great night cruising!. We had a fabulous time cruising the Danube in Budapest with Legenda. Our food was extremely tasty, the staff very friendly and the sailing was smooth as silk. I would highly recommend the dinner cruise to anyone looking for a wonderful, relaxing evening in Budapest - even locals!

Fabulous trip. This boat trip was one of the highlights of our stay in Budapest. The welcome was friendly, the food delicious and the views at night along the Danube simply breathtaking.Would happily do this all over again.

5 days in Budapest. The boat ride wrapped up our wonderful wandering throughout this most interesting city. The Danube which goes from the Black Forest to the Black Sea was best "felt" from the deck of this cruise...

A Relaxing way to see Budapest. We visited Budapest on a very hot, sunny day. This was a lovely way to see the city scape and to stay cool. It was relaxing and you were given complimentary drinks along the way. The crew were very friendly.

Great ride!. We had an awesome time during the evening boat tour! We wanted to wait until it was dark so we could see the buildings lit up. The boat was nice, clean, and even had some blankets for the night time. We were served a complimentary drink, and were able to listen to really good audio while on tour. It came in many languages! We learned so much about the city and buildings this way, before when we were walking about the city, we had no idea what some of them were. I would suggest doing this tour at the beginning of your visit for that reason!
Boat Tour. It was excellent. Everybody should be realized during their visit. I highly recommended this boat trip.

Great Experience ! Superb and friendly Crew !!. We had a great time on our dinner cruise on theDanube ! It was interesting to watch beautiful Budapest at night from the river !! Staff at the Legenda was very very friendly and efficient also the food was great too !! Would recommend this , for sure !!

Shame about the Guests. An enjoyable and well presented tour that takes in all the appropriate sights on the river Danube. The tour takes an hour and is well supported by an audio visual program that is informative and allows you to appreciate the sights. A glass of champagne, wine, beer or soft drink is included as part of the sightseeing tour, which we took from 10:15pm. Unfortunately, they aren't too organised in the boarding process, with guests jumping the queue and annoying those that are already in line.Once on board there is no discipline with guests being allowed to hang over the side taking photos, while obscuring your view, or being allowed to stand and take photos, with the same effect. I would not recommend the tour if this would lead to agitation.

Beautiful night cruise. The sights were beautiful but a few things could have been better if there was some clarification. First we got all confused on which headsets were the ones we were to use- ones in front or on chair. Evidently it is the ones in front but then the cords are not long enough so you have to lean forward. The headsets also kept changing languages on me. That was annoying. Also you get a drink as part of the trip. They don't tell you that. They take your order at the beginning and pick up your cup at the end. Recommend the night tour to see the buildings lit up! Up top is nice but windy and chilly.

A very nice Boat trip - Budapest by night. It was a really beautiful trip - Budapest at night. Amazing experience and a must do for all visiters to Budapest. The Boat was nice, staff friendly. The free drinks were just that free small portion of drink. The wine was below average, the beer OK. So do not expect too muchOverall a great experience

Quite Nice. Just returned from the Legenda boat tour on the Danube. About 90 minutes in length, with the opportunity to step off at Margaret Island, and catch the next boat. Explored up river and down river to Margaret Island. Very nice boat, efficient staff even a complementary beer or soda. Well worth the time and money.
Great night cruise. Beautiful views, great atmosphere, vine & multilanguage guide. Everyone should see Budapest at night from Danube :)
Excellent!!!. It was amazing.. we even got soft drinks for free.. we enjoy it!!!! Very recomended..☺Very good and very nice service.

Disgusting staff and tour. I booked this tour because of all the good reviews and because I wanted a great night to end our trip to Hungary. Unfortunately this was completely ruined by Legenda and their staff. Getting onto the boat was easy. We arrived early to get good seats at the front and we did. Everything was smooth until the tour started and we found out that our audio guide did not work. This is not uncommon in a tour and easily fixed so we asked the staff to replace the audio guide. The female staff serving our section, told us she would look into it. 10 minutes on nothing. We ask her again, what is happening, we are missing the audio tour, the main point of taking this tour. She tells us that she does not know anything about these audio guides. Hello? You work in a tour boat and you don't know anything about this? You don't have to know them, just replace them with another. She says she can't. So I ask her who on the boat knows about the guides or is in change and she says the captain knows. So I ask her to tell the captain that the units are not working. She goes away inside. 20 minutes without audio, still nothing. I waive to her again and she is now clearly agitated and trying to avoid me all together. I ask her what's happening and if she told the captain. She says and I quote "Sorry, there is nothing we can do". What?? Your are a tour company and you cannot do anything when part of the tour equipment is not working? I would assume, this is a regular common issue and you would just replace a faulty one with a working one and everyone is happy. I demand to speak to the captain now and she says the captain is busy and cannot be disturbed! By this time 30 minutes has already passed and we have missed half of the tour. I could tell by then that the staff of my section was not the only INCOMPETENT Legenda staff but the captain was incompetent as well. Out of the 30 missed already passed, we were sailing completely parallel to another boat for the last 20 minutes. So basically another boat was blocking all our views when we were passing the landmarks. I would assume any normal sane person in charge would speed up or slow down a bit so that they were not parallel to another boat on a sightseeing river cruise, but not this crew, not Legenda Sightseeing Boats. God forbid, if they somehow actually give a good tour. Seriously, you cannot make this up. See attached photo as proof!! I asked the name of the female staff and she told me her name is Babet or Rabet. Did not seem like a real name. Seriously avoid this company. Just to put this in context, this is my FIRST negative review in tripadvisor out of the 20 I have written.

Nice tour of the Danube at night . We took a one hour night time tour departing at 9:00 pm. Budapest is beautiful after dark with so many buildings, bridges and monuments lit up. You get a great view of them from the river boat. Seeing the Parliament Building at night was especially spectacular. The boat was comfortable and afforded good views. Very enjoyable tour!

Excellent experience. This was a great cruise. The servers were friendly, the food was excellent, the music was fantastic (the singer was so good!), and Budapest is beautiful from the river. Would highly recommend.

Last night in Budapest. We saved the best for last! Our concierge from the Klempinski hotel recommended this evening cruise as it was just a short walk from the hotel so we booked it for our last evening in Budapest. We enjoyed the magical lights all along the river all while enjoying a nice dinner. The service was pleasant and prompt. I enjoyed listening to all the announcements in the various languages. We were seated at a table for two but were free to move around as we wanted to take pictures occasionally as we passed the sights. Parliament was spectacular as viewed in the evening with all its lights aglow. It was one of our favorite pictures and memories of our trip. The live music provided was especially enjoyable to provide ambiance to the tour. I enjoyed the venison dish for the first time and found it quite nice and tasty. With the lights dim and candlelight on the tabletops it provided just the right touch to be a wonderfully romantic evening to end our trip.
Danube legend. İt was pretty good and especially the crew were great. İ suggest it to everyone to have a wonderfull experience
Nice introduction to Budapest. After the night train from Krakow our rooms at the hotel were not available. So this was a relaxing way to while away the time and learn a little about the city.

nice warm night. We did a 1-hour tour (no dinner) on the Legenda boat Blue Danube. The audio portion wasn't very interesting, but the view was beautiful. Given the quality of the wine served, I would definitely skip any dinner cruise.

Unmissable. The only thing that would have made this cruise better was if it had been a bit longer. Very well conducted tour. Friendly staff. The audio guide to the city was great and its perspective was lovely. :)
a great view of Budapest and an excellent diner. The exclusive diner package was really fantastic, we enjoyed this tour very much. The music and the service were also veeg pleasant.
Great time!. Spectacular views, good service, interesting audio guide. We noted our trip immensely and would recommend it to anyone who wants to see the site of Budapest.

Amazing experience. We had the dinner cruise and it was a great experience. Had a gorgeous meal with welcome drink and got to see the beautiful sights of Budapest. All the staff were very friendly and added to the lovely experience. Would recommend
Great experience. Best way to see the sights from the river. Nice boat and a free drink too! extra characters extra characters extra characters extra characters

Danube views. We enjoyed this comfortable and informative hour-plus trip around the Budapest sights. The ear-phone guides (in many languages) were informative. We did not get off on Margit Island, though we could have. We liked the double refreshments (something cool to drink, twice) and the panoramic views. Only issue -- 97 year old family member had to crawl through two boats before getting to ours.

A Danube view from Budapest. Unforgettable view of the city, enjoying the breeze of the river and an excellent service on board. Sitting upstairs on the front of the nave, looking at the castle, the parliament, the bridges, feeling a powerful atmosphere of peace and relax.
River Boat Dinner. The dinner boat ride is a beautiful way to see all the buildings in daylight and then at night - on both sides of the Danube and have a very relaxing and somewhat romantic dinner.

How to get the best view of Budapest. This boat cruise is a MUST, when you are in Budapest. Me and my husband went for our 2nd year wedding anniversary. we did the set dinner, and it was worth every penny the staff were superb. we were put on the top deck of the boat and you could see everything clearly, it was beautiful. The view from the boat was amazing and when it got dark the whole city lit up and it became even better. I was super happy with the staff, they made sure that everything was OK, the food was fantastic and we even got a complimentary glass of champagne. I must say this is a MUST when you go to Budapest.
Budapest Boat Cruise. This was a great way to get an overview of the city. We had just arrived and took this to get our bearings.
Premium class boat trip. It's a really high-quality restaurant a la carte on board of a modern boat with very nice live music.
YMS. Excellent night candle light tour. I suggest to reserve it with time, I did it online, it was easy. Excellent music, excellent service and food!
Great cruise. Everything was fine. On time, nice people, good drinks, good circuit. I recommend it to everyone who wants to enjoy Budapest by boat.

Delightful Danube Cruise. It was wonderful to be out on the Danube river with a waterside view of the various lighted buildings. The video provided helpful information though the screen sometimes showed up in my photographs. I appreciated not having a dinner cruise and just having the 10:15 cruise.

Relaxing and mesmerizing dinner cruise. A must-do while in Budapest! Views from the water can't be beat. Food was delish. Even more special if you're traveling with your special loved one (I missed mine as I was in Budapest on business). The only thing I wished was that the band played local Hungarian music or a mix of modern and traditional. But this didn't hamper mine and my colleagues' experience nonetheless. Had a fabulous time.

Legenda Sightseeing Boatride on the Danube. The boat ride was very nice. We went at 9:30 so the buildings and bridges were lit up. There was a running commentary (video) in many languages including English and drinks were served (wine). I'd recommend this excursion.
Business dinner. Nice time was spent here. High level of service. Delicious food......nothing can be better when around is such beauty city as Budapest :)
AWESOME!!!. Great trip! Perfect views! Very good food, very good attention. Ideal for couples. Great Experience. Be punctual the ship leaves right on time!
Nice tour. Weather was lovely, relaxing boat tour, drinks were included, nice service. Good price, would come back

VERY EXCELLENT. Everything was amazing... the music, the environment and the staff. i really enjoyed the feeling of magic that you could feel in the air.
very good

Budapest close out. After a full day at the bath houses, we throughly enjoyed the Legenda's evening cruise. Perfectly timed with a late summer sunset and with the kids sleep in mind, the 2100 cruise finished off a family of four weekend perfectly. Great price at 33€ for two adult and kids 10 and under free, which includes one drink each and headphones to listen to the history of Buda and Peat. Nice additions to a otherwise noisy PA system type of boat tour. This keep adults and kids tuned in and made the trip surprisingly quiet. We'd recommend to anyone going with a family. The team cruised by at a leisurely pace which gave folks time for plenty of pictures of all the historical sites lit up at night along the Danube.
RATING OF LEGENDA SIGHTSEEING. The ferry ride was awesome particularly going through Danube river in Budapest.The drinks offered to us were also appropriate.

My husband hates boats!. What a delightful experience! Food was great & could accommodate my daughter's gluten free diet. The evening views of Budapest were magnificent. The boat travels very smoothly. All & all a lovely evening.
Perfect. I really liked the tour. Wi-fi was perfect ahhaah that was important for me!! Also Budapest was an amazing city☺️
Nameday sighseeing boat trip. It was a pleasent one-hour trip, in the sunset, will always remember it :)Staff is really kind and smile a lot.Guide is also perfect.

Enjoyed the trip very much. Enjoyed the trip. Unfortunately it was raining a bit which put a damper on things but it wasn't the fault of the company obviously. We started the trip on the mainland (can't remember which side) and we got off at Margaret Island to explore. The boat was pretty much on time when we waited for it on Margaret Island. They served drinks on board (included in the ticket price). The wait staff were friendly (and nice to look at :) ).

Beautiful Boat Ride. The audio tour provided was not particularly interesting, but the boat ride was spectacular. I suggest you choose the boat ride time right at sunset because our sunset views were beautiful, and it was the perfect time to get photos both before and after the sunset. Keep in mind that the buildings and bridges all light up at night, which is definitely worth seeing.
It was nice evening sightseeing of Budapest!. Nice sightseeing in Budapest! City in night lights is amazing! Highly recommended for visit! You will enjoy!

Amazing experience. Everything was perfect. By the time you get inside, the tables was very nicely done. The joices of the plates, the beautiful apresentation and the tastes was remarkable. The music was very good, and the sightseeing was stunning.

Make sure you go of and evening/night!. I searched various boat tours before going to Budapest and legenda seemed to be the one that came out on top compared to the others. Myself and my partner are students and they gave student discount which was a big plus! And they also give a free drink to enjoy during your tour on the river. We wanted to make sure we went when it was dark so we booked the 9pm tour and boy it didn't disappoint! The buildings and bridges all looked fantastic and the boat even includes a guided commentary on headphones if you want to know about the history. Lucky we had a clear dry night and it was fairly warm, although the downstairs of the boat is under cover anyway. The one side is that the Windows were not very clean in order to take clear photos and I had to keep getting up from my seat to find an opening further down the boat. The boat does have indoor and outdoor seating but the outdoor (top of the boat) was too busy by the time we arrived. All in all, a brilliant cruise which we very much enjoyed and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Very memorable. I booked an 8:15 pm tour which was perfectly timed to catch the sunset, but also see the buildings lit up from the river towards the end of our journey. A magical experience and highly recommended.
Beautiful setting, excellent service. Quality boat. Brilliant service, fish was slightly over cooked but forgivable with the outstanding views

Great candlelight dinner. We booked the exclusive dinner for one of our evenings in Budapest. We were not disappointed. The weather was nice so the boat's windows were open. We really enjoyed the sightseeing during the dinner. Starters and soups were ok while the main courses and desert were great. Very nice and friendly waiters. We were served by Anna and she was very helpful. Overall a wonderful experience.

Dinner by boat. We had a nice dinner a sunny evening. We got a chance to see a lot of Budapest during a three hour boattrip. Good food and service and we appreciated that we could choose from the nenu and not got a preselected menu

Dinner cruise on the Legenda is a must if visiting Budapest!. My girlfriend and I went for the 4 course a la carte dinner cruise aboard the Legenda - at around £50 each, it seemed a little expensive but we were keen to see the city at night from the river and had seen some positive reviews of this.We were greeted onto the boat by a really welcoming team and were shown up to the higher deck of the boat which is where they placed most of the couples as it is not big enough for larger tables. We were given a glass of champagne on arrival as promised and we also ordered some extra drinks. The staff were superb all night - so polite and courteous, and nothing was too much trouble for them.Once we had ordered some drinks and took in some of the views from the river, we ordered our food - there is a really good selection of food on the menu - I ordered the selection of Hungarian appetizers to start, followed by a beef and bone marrow broth, duck breast with a cherry sauce, and a chocolate tart to finish. All the food was delicious, and benefited from having a proper kitchen on board - all 4 courses were great restaurant quality. We had a few drinks on board which you have to pay extra for, but they are reasonably priced. The views of Buda Castle and the Parliament building from the river at night are beautiful, and what made this even better was the live music on board. There was only a guitarist and singer but they played some great songs and was just really nice background music to have throughout the trip. Overall, would have to recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest - it was the highlight of our trip and well worth the money we paid.

Must-do while in Budapest. We've heard of the river dinner cruises in Budapest from word-of-mouth and saw multiple ads when we arrived in the city. Legenda Sightseeing Boats was recommended to us by our hotel (Hotel Moments; highly recommended!). They fill up quickly so we couldn't make a same-day reservation. You could either select an a la carte ticket or a 4-course a la carte ticket (better deal in our opinion). We tried making reservations online but it said the Budapest tourism card (forgot the actual name) was required. We simply went to the front desk of our hotel and they fixed things for us! None needed after all. The dock was pretty simple to find. Someone walked us to our table and we were able to put in our orders shortly after. There were a few men playing live music. I had the scallops appetizer (delicious), consommé soup (not nasty but boring), duck breast entree (pretty good), and brownie dessert (ehh). My boyfriend had the same appetizer, same soup, beef steak entree (he seemed to enjoy it but I don't think it was cooked to his preference), and panna cotta dessert (yum). You receive 1 free beverage and you pay for the rest. The boat ride was 2.5 hours long and pretty smooth.

Fabulous evening. Four of us took the evening meal tour. The trip was pre-paid apart from drinks (reasonably priced). It was such a memorable evening with food and service very good, but the gently moving background was exquisite. Taking 2hr 30mins approximately, we began in the light and finished in the dark, therefore seeing the Danube and background from both perspectives. On board comfort was excellent and although the boat looked small it felt very roomy. Good value for money in my book - a trip not to be missed!

Wonderful. Best night ever. If you decide to take a boat trip and see the City I recommend it highly. Fantastic view. The crew is great. Service is excellent. You won't regret paying for this boat trip
Highly recommended. This trip was recommended by someone we met at out hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed the food and being able to see the sights in both daylight and as night fell.
Cruise ship was excellent. The explanations on the cruise ship were excellent. Recommend to take a sunset cruise. You should sit up front on the front of the boat

Fantastic, relaxing, good value tour.. We had the bonus of a lovely day for our boat trip to see the sights of Budapest. The ticket buying process was straightforward, the staff were lovely and glasses of water were made available. After the sights were passed we were taken to Margaret Island and walked around this pretty place for an hour or two before getting the boat back. Make sure you get a plan of the Island when you leave the boat at the Island stop. It is all included in the ticket price. The commentary is by audio so make sure it is synchronised with your actual location. Several languages are available. The inclusive price was 7800 Forints for 2 people which is cheap and what we also liked was the fact that no attempt was made to push unnecessary purchases onto you.
Good boat trip. Budapest is beautiful and a great sight from the water. Recommending everyone to take a tour with one of the many companies.
Legenda Sightseeing Boat. a excellent trip to have a nice experience Budapest night and to take unforgettable pictures.Is one experience you don't loose

Truly exceptional!. I was wanting a special Budapest dinner cruise on the Danube for my daughters birthday, so after checking out the available options and reading reviews, I chose the Legenda a la carte dinner cruise. I was still slightly sceptical because of previous experiences in other cities with dinner cruises which usually has meant quite ordinary food & service. However, this night was absolutely amazing from beginning to end. The staff (thanks Bettina) were exceptional and couldn't do enough to make our night special. The food was truly excellent (and I'm fussy) and all in all this was a very memorable night for a very reasonable cost. You cannot go wrong booking the a la carte dinner cruise with this company!
t was one of my favorite parts of Budapest!. I can't think of any improvements I would make to it. Audio tour was great, service was wonderful, and complementary drinks were refreshing!

Pricey, but what we were looking for!. While in Budapest, the number one thing my wife wanted to see/do was have a boat ride on the Danube at night to see the lights of the city. Originally, we were going to do the meal and tour, but it was a tad too expensive to do it that way, so we had a meal somewhere else and then did the tour portion separately. It was exactly what we hoped.
Extremely nice tour. We enjoyed the food, the wine, the service and the view 😀. Especially the food deliciouse. Hope to do the same again with my husband
Excellent!. I really liked this boat ride. It has 30 different languages + 2 drinks in price. Everybody were very friendly. Loved it.

Unexpectedly great food!!. Went on this boat trip at night on the recommendation of our hotels receptionist who, knowing we were all skeptical of the quality of the food, showed us pics on her Facebook of the night before with her boyfriend! So we figured if a local girl enjoyed it then we would go... Us 3 were so glad we did . And so glad we went with Legenda. Firstly the boat is relatively small and we actually got to joke and chat with customers at tables around us ( although there is ample space between tables). There are a lot of wait staff on board and even though they forgot our champagnes ( which then arrived in wine glasses as they had run out of flutes) they delivered 2 extra complimentary champagnes to our table as soon as they realised their tardiness... And complimentary to the other table which were served up in wine goblets! Well the food was superb.. All 4 courses.. And i think Im a bit of a foodie so was pleasantly surprised. Firstly it is the only boat to have its own kitchen on board ( the others have food delivered to the boat by caterers). Scallops in chilli, beef broth, lamb with red currant sauce ( from memory ..?) and panna cotta. You just pay for your drinks .. So we thought $90 was very reasonableThe cruise itself lasts about 2 hrs and is relaxing and filled with photo opportunities. I dont normally do any group tours of any sort and my friends and I were quite impressed. It is very good considering the food is done in a small kitchen. And most people had taken the time to dress up which was nice. Mixed ages ranging from young couples and a group of young men to middle age couples. Im rating this 5 for what it is.. Food on a boat.. At a decent price. Dont expect Heston Blumenthal style food for the price and you wont be disappointed

Excellent service!. I use Legenda every time I'm in Budapest! Ask my guests love it! This time many of them got off at Margaret island and came back with the later boat, they have great memories from Budapest!
Culmination of the trip around Budapest. Wonderful trip, friendly personnel, amazing sightseens of the night Budapest, very pleasant drinks))
Evening cruise. Beautiful city by night, good champaign and kind staff. It was a very good moment for us to close our trip in Budapest.

Great Saturday dinner cruise with surprisingly good food. We went on the dinner cruise on a Saturday night and found the whole experience to be excellent. We were shown to a table on the top deck which I was pleased about. This appears to be pre-ordained so if you are a couple and want to be in a more private intimate environment then maybe ask for this at bookin, I was glad we were there.The meals arrived in good time and were an excellent standard, some elements of my confit beef were not quite hot enough but overall it was cooked to a high standard. My wife's baked tuna was also very good. The deserts were also of a high standard, I had the chocolate brownie with a zingy orange ice creme. The cruise lasted 2.5 hours and took in all the city sights, the view from the top,deck was fantastic. Service throughout the trip was friendly, helpful and efficient.Overall I thoroughly recommend this trip, a highlight of our trip to Budapest.

Amazing night time cruise on the Danube. We opted to take the 9.00pm hour cruise (without dinner option) as in June it gets dark around 8.45pm. Our tickets (for my wife and I) were purchased through our Hotel (K&K Opera) at 11000 HUF for both of us (approx. £30) which included a complementary drink on board (champagne, beer, wine, soft drink). There is a audio headset in different languages which keeps you informed as you go and a TV video to watch. The cruise on the Danube at night is truly fantastic and the Parliamentary building absolutely stunning lit up at night, as well as the bridges, monuments and other buildings. It all looked amazing at night and well worth the experience. The cruise lasted around an hour and you embark at dock 7 which is nearer to the Elizabeth bridge on the Pest side. There is a covered lower deck and an upper deck.

Perfect Way to End a Vacation . We took to the cruise on the last night of our vacation. We were three families and they were able to accommodate us at one table. We did the candlelight dinner cruise. It was a beautiful night out and we got to see the buildings on the riverbank both in the daylight and at night lit up. The food was created and presented well, and they were able to accommodate even our vegetarian needs. The staff was friendly and attentive. All 8 family members (18 yrs old to 60 yr old) thought it was the best part of our 10 day trip. We would all highly recommend it to everyone.

Dining on the Danube . Stunning way to spend a hot summers night cruising along the Danube, seeing amazing architecture and experiencing the city at it's finest. Value for money as we purchased the 4 course option with amazing food from appetisers to deserts, the service was great although I feel more staff could've been useful in serving drinks. A definite if you have the spare time in this exciting city.

Nice Views, Average Food. I did enjoy the boat tour and the beautiful views of Budapest at night. Unfortunately, the food quality did not match the views. Next time I will do just the boat tour without meal.

A great way to see the city in the evening...!. We decided to take the evening cruise (without dinner option) based on some recommendations and we are so glad we did! The 9.30pm cruise allowed us to see the city some alive in lights with some fantastic sights. This has to be a must for any trip to Budapest. The boat is really clean, stable and the staff are excellent. Included in the price is a complementary glass of champagne, beer, wine or soft drink. A really nice way to spend an hour in the evening.

Sightseeing Cruise - PERFECT. The evening sightseeing cruise over the Danube River is a highly recommended one as it has an upper and lower deck for open to air and closed sight seeing respectively, it has a choice of multiple languages, it started in the pre dusk time and ends in 1 hour with a fantastic view of the Buda and Pest side of the city under lights, which was beautiful.

Comfy cruise boat - terrible meal!. This boat is quite popular and not uncomfortable at all. The vibe on board was friendly and the crowd very exuberant. The staff are young and helpful. The night sights of Budapest are definitely worth seeing and this cruise gives you sufficient opportunity to see them and record them in pictures. The food however, was very disappointing and not worth the money which then makes this an expensive outing. Perhaps that is something they can work on. The guests on board were mostly adults although I'm sure that for children this would also be a suitable outing.

great experience. this was my third time with Legenda cruise - every time I have visitors from abroad I use this service for sightseeing. the whole group was really satisfied with the tour (we took both, the daytime and the evening cruise), the service, the boat, the staff, everything. thank you for a great experience - again :)
Good. The experience was really amazing . I do recommend to do this travel because we were able to know Budapest much better .

Legend Dinner Cruise at end of the day.... Relatively inexpensive 'up and down' the Danube tour. You have several opportunities to take pictures during the dinner of the Parliament Building, Castle Hill and Fisherman's Bastion as well as The Chain Bridge - go on a 'relatively warm day' otherwise the class 'windows' may be closed making it difficult to get good pictures but you can go 'outside' on the stern with out the windows interferring with your photography. Get there early and you can sit "upstairs" on the top with panoramic views but cool when the sun goes down.

River boat trip with Legenda. We booked online and got some discount using our Budapest card. The boat was very spacious, there were headsets to listen to the commentary. Hosts on board provided a free drink of your choice and a free glass of lemonade on the return trip back to the docking area. We had some free time on Margaret Island but unfortunately it was quite late - 6pm so most of the bars were shut, so we just walked and explored the island. Lots of runners doing their thing there, almost made me wish I'd come in my own running gear.Very enjoyable trip and would recommend it.
Beautiful. The cruise was great! We loved every minute of it . The music and the food were wonderful! We highly recommend this cruise!
River Danube afternoon. Lovely trip. Shame it rained so we had to relocate to inside but we started off up topsides. The commentary was very good and we all enjoyed the trip
Legenda sightseeing cruise on the River Danube Budapest. Lovely River cruise Champaign offered on the way Lemonade on the way back very good recorded story of the River ......Lovely.

Lovely Trip. We chose the Duna Bella cruise to Margaret Island during the day. The trip was very nice, it was not to crowded (rainy day unfortunately), but inside the cruise was nice and we had audio-guides with many languages where we heard the stories about the buildings around. I was a bit nervous because I usually get sea-sick pretty fast, but I was ok during this trip, it was pretty smooth. I would take an evening cruise as well when I go back in Budapest.
Amazing. Amazing view from Buda and from PestGood service from the girls good selection of drinksRight duration timeGood seatsStable boat

Stunning views along the Danube. Our dinner cruise along the Danube was a highlight of our time in Budapest. We had walked for hours across the day sightseeing and our cruise was a superb ending for the day. The four course meal was of high quality with a very good menu choice. We enjoyed the shrimps, scallops, mushroom risotto and delicious panacotta. There was a good selection of wines too. The pianist and singer performed many pieces that we knew and enjoyed very much. Not too loud - just right for dinner music. Going on this cruise in summer season was perfect timing with a 19.45 start. We began with sunset time and then moved into darkness with the fabulous lit up sights of Parliament House, Fiaherman's Bastion and Buda Palace to mention the most stunning. Because the boat does a few circuits, you are given the opportunity to enjoy these sights from light into darkness. I totally recommend this experience!"

Legenda Danube cruise. Nice cruise down Budapest Danube filled with interesting facts and info filled tour to Margaret Island where we got off to explore and then got return boat back to dockOn board refreshments and warm friendly atmosphere Highly recommend
Wonderful experience. I find the waitress very helpful and smily and the food selection very nice .A wonderful overall experince ...1000 thanks specially for Vicky the waitress

Tremendous evening but prices and billing were extremely complex. We paid for extras, drinks and other food. Atmosphere, crew, and food exceeded our expectations. Quality was very high. Options for four course meal vs. A la carte was very confusing. Itemized supplemental bill print out was about 4 feet long. One drink was included for each guest. Coffee, soft drinks, beer and wine were all extra. Still we would do this again without any hesitation.
Perfect. Fantastic, would do again. Food was delicious, wait staff terrific, views amazing. We had a lovely night so could open windows which was perfect
Excellent experience. Great audio guide, lovely comfortable boat, friendly staff and we was provided with champagne and lemonade included in the ticket price which made it extra special.
Very good sight seeing trip. Excellent would recommend. Done many boat trips and this has been one of the best so far,Real good value for money.
Loving dinner on the Danube. Excellent food, marvelous view, music of the first quality and the company, well, that's up to you. What more could you want?

Great sight-seeing tour!. We took the 8:15 PM sight seeing boat tour and it was AMAZING! The tour started right around sunset and the views were just beautiful; it was great being able to see the city both at sunset and then once the sun went down with all the buildings lit up. The tour was well priced and included one complimentary drink. Definitely 100% recommend adding this to your itinerary when you visit Budapest!

Dinner Cruise. We took the Dinner Cruise with the a la carte menu last week. The boat sailed at 7.45pm & did two return trips up the river in 2.5 hours. We were lucky enough to be upstairs – only 7 two-seater tables in total. Once past the Parliament building a crew member closed the perspex cover to keep out the cold but it did not obscure our viewing. The young waitress spoke good English & our a la carte (3 course) meal was delivered faultlessly. Highly recommended.

Great views of Budapest. The boat was very professional and made for a very relaxing afternoon. The sights were amazing and it was lovely to have the audio to learn more about the amazing city. A glass of fizz also added to the cruise. Thank you.

Beautiful trip. We enjoyed the trip at sunset down the river. The boat was smooth. The interpreters did a good job of speaking in multiple languages. The recording itself was not helpful as it did not correspond with the buildings you were seeing on the shore. We would definitely do this cruise again if we returned to Budapest.

Excellent evening programme. We booked Legenda Sightseeing trip with dinner and it was excellent. Food, drinks and ambiente were worth it. I can recommend this trip in any case! You can see the beautiful illuminated buildings along the Danube.

Great inspiring night tour. First we planed to take boat tour at 11 pm, but then changed it to 9 pm and didn't regret. At this time you can enjoy the perfect sunset and the night Budapest - 2 in 1. Don't miss this chance to enjoy the city from river view!
Legenda night tour on Danube in Budapest.. Excellent service and tour. Sights were fantastic at night. Departed on schedule and plenty of time taken.

Good Experience. It was a nice cruise was nice guidelines and information in 27 different language .They offered refreshment drink. and it was really romantic experience on my honeymoon. Pleasant comfortable and good experience!!

Beautiful at night. Went on the 9pm cruise - views of parliament and the castle were absolutely stunning as they are lite up at night. Much of the boat is inside with glass windows. We sat outside as we wanted to take photos. It was raining but 3 rows of seats outside were covered so we didn't get wet. Would suggest getting there early if you want those seats though!
A beautiful cruise. A beautiful cruise, great lighting in early June, took the night 9pm cruise right after sunset. Nice complementary guide translated to different languages.

enjoyed the trip. It was really great , the film is built up well, helped a lot to put all the things we have visited in the previous days into system. My only problem was that the film was late in comparison with the ship, often had to look back, as we have already passed the sight it started to talk about. The seats are very comfortable, the crew was kind. Thanks for the nice evening!
Night view of Budapest. Everything was fabulous! But when you accept large groups, you should make sure the other passengers are not disturbed.

Very relaxing informative with bonus bubbly. The boat was perfect - you had the option of inside or outside (on the roof) and we tried both as it rained half way round. Welcomed with a glass of bubbly. Headphones were used for the information which was in many different languages. Just before we got off we were offered a lemonade.
Absolutely Phenomenal. It was both beautiful, elegant and relaxing. One of my favourite things done in Budapest! Thank you so much for the experience. I will not forget it!

Evening Cruise with al a carte meal. Defiantly recommend this, delicious meal, very attentive staff, (we didn't have the 4 course option and we're happy with this decision). We were fortunate to have a table on the top of the boat which for the 2 of us was very romantic, much quieter than downstairs. Beautiful to see Budapest lit up at night from the river. Gets a bit chilly, but wraps are on the chairs to keep you warm. Would do it again.

Wonderful experience! Thoroughly recommended!. We booked the candlelit dinner cruise and were given a table upstairs with fantastic views across the Danube to the City of Budapest. There is a glass sliding roof which was closed for the last hour as it was getting chilly. Prior to this, we enjoyed the last of the day's sun with uninterrupted views! Blankets are provided - useful for the ladies certainly. Presentation of the table, menu, staff and most importantly the food was excellent and exceeded our expectations. Although the experience is on the pricey side especially as prices in Budapest are so reasonable; the experience makes it thoroughly worthwhile!A must do in our opinion! Excellent communication throughout the booking process...
Scenic boat ride of the Budapest riverside. The boat ride is well paced with the headphones(audio stream has many languages) providing an overview of the tourist attractions in Buda and Pest.
I love Budapest. It's was a great experience on the cruise and best view in Danube River, Budapest! Will visit again.

Beautiful At Night!. The evening cruise is a very pleasant excursion well worth the ticket cost. The one-hour ride is supported by a well scripted video of the various sites in Budapest with also a bit of the history. The lighting of the bridges, churches and other buildings, especially Parliament is stunning at night. The headsets and language devices are easy to use. You are also served a glass of water, soda, wine or champagne which is included with your ticket.

Nice view. The riverside looks amazing when the city lights are lit in the evening. You can listen to interesting stories about the buildings (available in different languages). You might want to bring a jacket.
Good your. Started on time , good viewing deck, curtious crew, easily found, was comfortable with good explanation, 2 drinks

Fabulous!. We took a night cruise (21:00) and it was absolutely amazing! Staff was very friendly, seats comfortable and we really enjoyed the story we could listen to during the trip (there is a great choice of languages as well). If you visit Budapest, cruise on Danube is a must!

Soothing Experience. We did this boat cruise in May 2016 end. The atmosphere was very good. It is highly recommended to do this cruise during Budapest sightseing tour. It is around one hour tour with audio guide in various languages about the history of old buidlings of Budapest on the river of Danube.
Danube River Cruise. Really informative tour. Discount with a Budapass. Served free alcohol on the boat. Winning. Drops youboff on Magaret island and will pick you up an hoir or so later
Lovely sunset cruise. We enjoyed the stunning views. Take the cruise at sunset if you can...great commentary. We enjoyed the cocktail that accompanied the cruise.
