We bought the nicer tickets (which include better seats, a 4-course meal, and a glass of champagne), and those were totally worth it. We got seated right next to the window and in front of the 3-piece band (which happened to be playing really cool bluegrass versions of Rolling Stones, Guns N Roses, etc.). The food was fantastic: with the nicer tickets, you get to choose one of the appetizers, a soup, an entree, and a dessert. The beef tartar and goose liver appetizers were both fantastic, as was the bone broth soup, the duck breast entree, and the brownie dessert. We ordered a bottle of wine, and were very impressed with how good that was too (wine is about 3900-12000 for a bottle). Our server Viki was very friendly and attentive, so we chose to tip on both the pre-purchased food tickets and the wine (and then the band separately) — but that's up to you.

A great way of seeing the sights along the Danube. This was one of the best things we did in Budapest and I'd definitely recommend it. We paid 18 euros each for the 1 hour cruise which included a glass of champagne/wine/beer. This which was much needed after our printed ticket flew out of my husband's hand, into the wind and into the Danube literally 5 minutes before the boat was meant to leave just as we were about to board. Luckily the staff were really helpful and it was all sorted as I managed to get the confirmation email up on my phone.All of the staff were really helpful and friendly and the boat was really nice and clean and warm as well. The views out of the windows were great (unlike a boat trip we went on in Amsterdam when the windows were all steamed/misted up). Overall, a most enjoyable informative sightseeing cruise at a good price.

Excellent evening. Went for the dining package which comprised of a 4 course a la carte meal complete with a very generous glass of champagne. Reasonable selection of wines which were well priced. The food and service were excellent and the live music made for a great evening. Unfortunately, it was very foggy, so the views could not really be appreciated but I would thoroughly recommend the evening cruise with meal to anyone.

Perfect way to end a short break. On a Saturday evening when attractions are closed, a night cruise on the Danube is a good idea. Even in December it was very busy and it became rather uncomfortable in the waiting room. However, the cruise was very rewarding, I did find the commentary a bit confusing and the headphones didn't fit, but I just ignored all that. This is all about the views. Every building, every statue, every bridge is illuminated at night and it feels like something out of this world. And I loved the glass of champagne too.

Lovely meal on evening cruise. We booked this in England on the internet and it was a very easy process. We went with friends and booked the evening dinner cruise. The food was absolutely lovely. The views from the boat were beautiful and the wine and drinks were very reasonably priced. the staff were really good -they were all young girls but worked hard and were lovely. A special mention must go to the young waitress who ordered us a taxi at the end of the evening. Not only did to she use her personal mobile phone to call us a cab she escorted us to the cab to make sure it had arrived. - that was fantastic service.

Fantastic. We did the evening boat cruise and it was fantastic. I would recommend this one over the daytime cruise because the Danube at night is simply stunning. There is audio on board to explain different buildings along the river and in the city. This was one of the highlights of my trip.

Really odd commentary . Nice boat ride, it's a little slow and the English commentary is ruined by the terrible writing and horrific voice overs. That said, Budapest is a beautiful city and this boat ride showed that off well

Dinner cruise is a must!. Me and my partner enjoyed a Legenda dinner cruise on the 6th December and it was the highlight of our holiday!Seeing the Parliament building and the sites of Buda lit up from a candlelit boat was beyond beautiful. The food was delicious and the live music added a lot to the romantic atmosphere (in fact if we hadn't already gotten engaged I think I would have been on the edge of my seat expecting a proposal!)The waitresses really made the night. They were welcoming, attentive without being overbearing, very friendly and the range of languages they spoke was so impressive! I think we paid about £50 for the cruise and a 4 course meal with wine. Honestly this was such a bargain. The food alone was worth more than the price of the evening and additional drinks were very reasonable. I would HIGHLY recommend anyone visiting Budapest take the dinner cruise.

Fantastic way to see the city. We took an evening cruise- just walked up to the jetty (number 7), paid and hopped on (though I'm sure in high summer booking would be a necessity). We sat outside with blankets provided and listened to the fascinating commentary as we took in the beauty of the city at night time. The cruise goes up as far as Margarit Island and back down to the university area, lasting over an hour and every moment of it was excellent. Staff were friendly, bringing round a drink which is included in price. An absolute 'must' when visiting Budapest.

Very interesting. The boat trip lasts about 1 hour 10 mins with 2 drinks included in the price, so very good value for money. The commentary we heard through headsets was very informative and interesting. Very enjoyable

The sights make this tour. We took the 18:30 cruise around the Danu and we were left with our jaws wide open on how beautiful this city really is. There is no better way to explore the city than by boat. Best views of the Parliament building. Make sure you do not sit next to a noisy neighbor.
A must . Been on the night tour. Amazing to say the least! Great food and drinks. Friendly staff and one of the best cruises in Budapest.Go for the 4 course meal

I haven't been in the day but the night is a MUST. It got VERY cold on the night tour but it was amazingIt was a pre-recorded tour which felt a little monotone but you went up the Danube, turned around and came back saw some spectacular sights and Budabest is just full of lights at nighttimeYou could be on the open roof or down below whch a lot of elderly or those with children opted for

Well worth doing. This trip gives you a great deal of history of Budapest and geographically will help you get your bearings.the ladies on board speak an impressive array of languages but you have a headset for the tour.They serve a lovely warm drink to begin and then you have a choice of beverage on return.The trip I took was 70minutes and well worth doing.

Absolutely fantastic . Our friend booked this dinner cruise before we arrived in budapest for our Christmas market. I wasn't expecting much as we have done many river cruise dinner experiences such as Paris, Prague, Nile. This cruise went above and beyond the food was wonderful the staff were amazing and the sights beautiful. This was fabulous a wonderful night to remember I cannot thank the staff enough they were so intentive when we got on board we enquired about a taxi when we left and they said they would arrange it....We didn't have to ask again as soon as the boat docked we were told that our taxi was waiting and was escorted to the taxi by one of our waitresses....what fabulous service. The whole evening was fantastic and is 5* if we ever go back to Budapest the dinner cruise would be on my list....Thank you legenda and your wonderful staff

Very Enjoyable. Very enjoyable trip down the Danube. Highly recommend it as there are some beautiful views of the city followed by some very informative historic information.Great to also have the option of a hot drink, soft drink or alcoholic drink.

Lovely way to spend the evening!. We booked in advance for the evening cruise with four course meal and drink. The restaurant had a great atmosphere and service was brilliant. A very enjoyable way to see the sights of Budapest at night. It was so much better than I was expecting and I would recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest.

Great For A Fasttrack View Of The Sights Of Buapest. Enjoyable trip where you can get a great insight of a number of historical monuments & buildings of the city where are localted on the banks of the river, you get a recorded commentary in your language of choice which pretty much covers all the landmarks along the river on this 70 minute trip, they also throw in a complementary drink, well worth the £10 cost of the trip

A romantic cruise for two. My wife and I went on on the a la carte dinner cruise our wedding anniversary. The whole experience greatly exceeded our expectations. Food and service were both excellent and the views of the Chain Link bridge and the Parliament buildings stunning.

An hour well-spent. We did the hour-long Danube Legend cruise with one drink included. It was a pleasant, scenic trip. The audio guide and accompanying video weren't stellar, but they did a fair job introducing the buildings and history of Budapest--and it's impressive that they were able to write a tour in 30 languages. We hadn't yet done a walking tour of the city, so this help us get oriented. Would have loved an outdoor option, but on a chilly night I guess it makes sense to be fully indoors. Overall, a beautiful place to drink a glass of champagne and get off your feet for a bit!

Cruise down the Danube. Definitely a must, amazing views commentary on the history about Buda and Pest.The cruise was pleasant and relaxing, we were offered a glass of champagne which was lovely.We decided to get off at Margaret island and explore for 1½ hours before getting the boat back.On our return journey we were offered fresh lemonade, again another nice touch. All included in the price which I might add is very reasonable.

Superb atmosphere and views, but poor food. We booked the four course dinner cruise. The staff is great and the atmosphere is truely romantic. There was a pianist and a lady singing throughout the cruise. Guy sitting in the table next to us actually proposed to his girlfriend during the cruise.For a food enthusiastic the dinner was unfortunately a huge dissapointment. None of the four courses were great.Hard to choose between 3 and 4 stars, but I'll give it 4 stars because of the great atmosphere.

Romantic dinner on Danube with a breathtaking view. I took the cruise with dinner option. I expected a decent sightseeing but they topped it up. The food variety and its quality was beyond my expectations. The service is nice.., The ambiance is friendly on the lower and very romantic on the upper deck. You can never see the city the same way from anywhere else.
nice way to spend an hour . Go early if you want a seat outside. Inside (at night) Other tourists are (stupidly) taking pictures with their flash on. also don't drink the free wine. Not good.

Candlelit Dinner ... STUNNING views ... AWFUL Food!. This is a must do trip at night for the views alone. People were friendly, the trip was fun, it was a good amount of time to spend on the boat and get some great shots. 111% I recommend this attraction - and I also recommend you make reservations for dinner before or after somewhere else as the food is a big let down. Food aside, this was the highlight of my trip so far.

Fantastic food and great sights. Five of us booked a dinner cruise one evening recently and had a wonderful night. The food was outstanding, almost Michelin standard. Along with the passing sights it was one of the best things we did in Budapest

Excellent Evening Dinner Cruise on the Danube. We went on the Legenda evening dinner cruise on 29 October 2015 and would highly recommend it to everybody.The ambience on the boat was excellent and the service was very slick and professional. In addition, the food was of a very high quality.On top of this, if you visit Budapest you must see the Danube in the evening with all the surrounding buildings lit up. I would say that the best way to see this is whilst having an excellent meal whilst listening to a quality musician on the Legenda.It is very good value for money.

Lovely evening cruise. We did the sightseeing cruise and enjoyed it. The boats are in very good condition and clean including the toilets. The staff were polite and bilingual, speaking over 10 languages. The drink included in the ticket price was very good, particularly the red wine. It was a lovely trip.

Wonderful evening on the Danube. Our party of four booked the Danube Dinner Cruise online prior to our arrival in Budapest. We selected the deluxe menu which was very reasonably priced! This is really a wonderful way to spend an evening in Budapest. The cruise is approximately 2 and a half hours long, but the time goes quite quickly. Budapest is as beautiful if not more so, at night, and so the trip up and down the river is very relaxing. Dinner was very good especially the scallops, veal cheeks, red tuna, pork tenderloin, panna cotta and brownie. The wine selection was also very good. Music was also appropriate for the occasion.Highly recommend this cruise for a beautiful evening!

Beautiful way to see the City lit up at night. We choose to do the sightseeing only option and we were not disappointed. The City looks spectacular. The cruise lasted an hour and you got a free drink. Turn up around 10 mins early as there was a queue. The best place to sit is on the top deck, you get better views.

Very nice experience and is worth it.. To be honest at the beginning I felt like it was going to be another completely touristic thing to do but I was wrong. We had dinner at night and it was totally worth it. You get the chance to see Budapest at night on a nice and pleasant danube-tour. Having a meal on board made everything much better and nicer. Food was Ok, above average and service was very good as well. It takes place in the Must To-Do list in Budapest.

Dinner Cruise. We booked a candlelit dinner cruise on the Legenda as it was our 30th Wedding Anniversary during our trip to Budapest , we were lucky to be seated at one of the tables on the upper deck and the views were fantastic !With the A La Carte exclusive package you get a drink when you arrive and a four course meal , the standard of the food was superb , everything was hot and the staff were very attentive , there was also live music , i loved every minute of the evening and i would strongly reccomend it :)

Excellent tour and food. We visited as a party of six and went for the 2.5 hour evening cruise and four course meal. Per head the trip was £40 each and on the whole we all felt it was well worth it. The sightseeing down the Danube was excellent, with all the main sites lit up and looking very impressive. Food was served promptly and portion size of the main meal in particular was very good.All satisfied customers and would definitely recommend!

Dinner and tour well worth it. Very good food and nice 2.5 hour tour at night. Only problem was not ability to take great pictures because of closed off boat vessel, however if raining this is a good one. No guide and they have live music on board. Nice for a romantic evening (one family with a baby, but contained in a corner).

Cold but Good. I chose the Danube by Night tour. A nice waiting area before boarding the boat, headphones are provided and the recorded talk is delivered in 30 different languages so most people should be OK! This tour takes about an hour and does a kind of figure of eight loop, this means that whichever side you sit there are plenty of photo opportunities. An added bonus is that there is a drink included in the price and is served during the tour. There is an option of sitting upstairs outside! But you do get better photos, downstairs it is a heated cabin.
Wonderful night out. We did the candle lit dinner cruise, the meal was lovely, the staff very attentive and the scenery spectacular. Have not got a bad thing to say about this tour. First rate.

Fascinating and not expensive. Our sightseeing trip along the River Danube was spectacular. I would highly recommend this as a way to get a full understanding of the history and beauty of Budapest. Headsets were supplied along with commentary on the historic sights passed on the tour. Drinks were available free of charge on the cruise and we even got to get off on an island and order bikes and see the spectacular scenery before heading back from the island on a later boat. This is a must see and will cost less than 10 euro.

Dinner cruise on the Danube - Very good food. We had the 4-course menu on the Legenda dinner cruise. The food was very good and the service staff attentive. The cruise itself was nice, as Budapest is stunning beautiful at night. The cruise lasted approx. 2 hours.

Great way to see the city by night!. Had a great evening boat tour of the city by night. The city needs to be seen by night & this this is a great way to see the highlights. Bundle up warm- it's cold but it's worth it!

Evening Dinner Cruise. Two and a half hour evening dinner cruise on a fine evening mid-October. As a couple we were on the upper deck of the boat (7 or 8 couples at well spaced tables) and on the lower deck there was another 30 or 40 guests and live music.As for the food, there were 4 or 5 choices at each of the 4 courses and the food was very good - I opted for steak as a main course, cooked to perfection!! The service was very good, not rushed and well spread out over the 2.5 hours of the cruise. We had a bottle of Hungarian sparkling wine and the cost was about £10, so we did not feel as though we were being ripped of.As for the boat, it was clean, warm and with adequate space. The staff were efficient and friendly.The views from the river were wonderful. We completed two circuits of the main city length of the river and were able to clearly view all of the wonderfully illuminated buildings. Overall, good value for the money and a great way to spend a pleasant evening - I'm not so sure what the views may be like on a wet evening with all of the glass misted - try and pick good weather.

Very enjoyable . A really enjoyable way to see the city. We took the day tour and stopped of on Margaret Island for a visit and were picked up by the next boat. The commentary is fascinating and gives you a great insight into the monuments and history of Budapest. You also get a free drink as part of the tour. All in all very enjoyable.

Do the night cruise for the Parliament!. Lovely cruise on the danube, very chilled. We did the 21:00 cruise and the bridges and parliament were lit up, stunning ! Great service, great staff. Free drink after you board also.

Great view of the city. This boat tour provided a great tour of the city at night. My wife and I chose this one because if you mention Rick Steve's travel book the. You get 20% off. The city palaces and parliament are all lit up and look amazing at night. You also get a free drink during the ride. I'd recommend arriving early to ensure a spot on the top deck if you want good pictures. The curved glass on the lower deck make it difficult to take good pictures.

Amazing first night!!. We booked an evening river cruise online on our first night and we were so glad we did.The river is beautiful at night and the cruise really captured this. You get headphones and the tour is guided via your headphones where they tell you all about the buildings and the history- it was very interesting!To top it all you also got a free alcoholic drink as part of the price.. champagne or beer! WE loved it :-)

legenda dinner cruise - wonderful romantic experience. during our stay in budapest i wanted to surprise my girlfriend with something romantic, so i booked the legenda dinner cruise. we had a wonderful romantic dinner. it is breathtaking, as the facade of the main buildings look like they were made out of gold and so does the reflecting water. i think the prices are totally reasonable. so there is nothing negative i could say about this experience. we were lucky though, as we had a table on the upper deck, where it was more private and romantic in my opinion. if you want to surprise your girl for whatever reason, this is a recommendable option!

The Legenda Tour Was Er...Legendary. Very enjoyable way to spend an hour!We took the 9pm trip. It was a wee bit busier than | thought it would be as it turned out a couple of hundred tour buses decided to join us, making it a full house!We stayed inside while the boat did it's thing, as it was chucking it down outside. But the included - in- the- trip free booze meant you didn't care about the weather.The sights all lit up were worth it on their own. I gave up on the commentary supplied via headphones. It was cheesy, out of sync and pointless. Scrap that and just enjoyed the view

Sunset cruise was beautiful. Lovely boat, very comfortable. Left at sunset and the lights on the buildings as it got dark were just stunning. The hour long cruise was just long enough. Sat outside at the front, blankets provided if you're cold!

Legenda Dinner Cruise on the Danube. Our dinner cruise on the Danube with Legenda was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Budapest. The view from the Danube is stunning at night and the 2 and a half hours of cruising up and down the Danube just flew by! The 4 course dinner was lovely from start to finish and there was live entertainment on board as well.

Budapest is Beautiful in the Evening Sailing Along the Danube. In general, I find city river/harbour cruises relaxing, but somewhat underwhelming. I expected it to be no different when I took the 9:00 Danube Legend tour with Legenda. However, introducing the night time aspect, with how Budapest is lit up at night, and you get something special Did not pre-book a trip, so wandered along the Danube Promenade looking for a kiosk or something. Near a restaurant called Peppers, I found a set of stairs down to the river where both Legenda and another company (they had a sign, Legenda just had a guy) were selling tickets. Found out it would be a mostly full boat, but they could fit a single.The audio guide comes in quite a few languages and while it has a goofy aspect, it maps out what you are seeing and provides some history about how everything came about. Really enjoyed it. Nice and relaxing. Mostly people stayed in place, instead of hopping all over taking pictures, and it was a beautiful evening weather wise. Enjoyed it enough, that while in Krakow, Wroclaw and Prague I decided to forego river cruises, not expecting them to provide the same level of enjoyment as Budapest.

Great way of seeing Budapest from the water. Very good service - commentary via headphones very well done. We chose a lovely sunny day which made it perfect! Together with the glass of champers and lemonade! A good way to see Budapest, and slow enough to enable photo-taking en route. You can book in advance or on the day but in peak season I guess they get full quickly. Get there early to get a good seat at the front.

Beautiful and relaxing end to a day's sightseeing. This review is for the one-hour evening cruise, without dinner. We bought our tickets one day in advance, waiting to make sure that the weather forecast looked promising. If you don't want to buy online, you can stop by the dock and purchase your tickets in person; there are also reps in sailor gear beside the #2 tram stop at Vorosmarty ter.Arrive early for best choice of seats; the open upper deck fills quickly. There's a sheltered place to wait near the dock with comfortable couches. Since the boat makes a circle, it doesn't matter which side you choose. The audio guide offers an informative overview of Hungarian history (Michael Caine is one of the English-language narrators), and you'll get a nice complementary drink, too.

Night cruise wins. Breathtaking!! I think everyone needs to do the night cruise. Budapest at night is a must see. The audio guide was very informative. The free drink just added to the night. It was a lovely experience. Dont forget to dress warm. It rained when i was on it, but it added to the experience, lol.Don't leave home without your fully charged phone or camera; you might miss out on the best pictures you ever took. If you are going to sit at the open top deck, avoid where the lcd is it blocks your front view when taking pictures.
Learn a bit more about Budapset on the move.. Great way to spend an hour and a half. Two free drinks on board, one of which can be alcoholic. Comfortable seating.

Must-do in Budapest. Budapest at night is simply breath-taking and you have to take the night cruise (we took the 815PM cruise) to experience it. Sit in the outdoor section of the boat if you can take the cold breeze - dressed warmly.. it's worth it!

Enjoyable hour on the river. This modern boat was comfortable and had big windows for easy viewing. Audio-phones have over 15 languages telling the story of the city. TIP: we boarded before sundown so we got views during the day AND night with glittering lights. Night viewing was better than day views. We had 2 drinks included, not dinner.

Relaxing night cruise with beautiful views of Budapest. We booked the 9:30 PM cruise same day on my cell phone. Showed up at the dock, showed them the confirmation number and were issued our tickets. No problems.We were towards the end of the line, but were still able to get seating upstairs, in the enclosed area. It's nice, because the windows will slide to allow you to get photos without the glass being in front of you. I recommend sitting on the right side of the boat, as the views passing Parliament are stunning.The waitress who served the complimentary beverages was efficient. Took our order about 20 minutes into the cruise and we had our drinks in hand a few minutes later.Video commentary was a bit dry.The cruise lasted one hour. The best way to see the main sites of Budapest lit up at night.

Daytime cruise. We booked this before visiting and it was money well spent. The staff were all really friendly and polite. Boat is very comfortable and spacious and I loved the audio guide and how informative it was. You are able to depart and spend some time on Margaret Island and then catch a returning boat at no additional cost which is a really nice touch. Would recommend and also book prior to going

An Amazing Experience, Even for Frequent Visitors. The historic buildings of Budapest, lit up at night, are a beautiful sight and very impressive. The photo opportunities are awesome and the boat is designed to provide a good view to everyone. The audio guide provides interesting background and anecdotes to the various sights along the way. The tour of approximately an hour is just the right length and a drink is served on board which is included in the fare. Highly recommended.One small annoyance is the cumbersome boarding process. The waiting area is small and tickets are not checked/taken until embarkation resulting in some crowding to be first on board.

A good cruise with limited upper deck (outdoor) seating.. Informative cruise facilitated by multilingual headset devices. The reason that I've given this operator a 3 is that the seating upstairs on the upper deck is limited. We were aware of this having read other reviews so arrived early in order to be at the front of the queue. In spite of that a large tour group were given priority for boarding which meant that the upper deck seating was completely taken. Not a big deal for those happy to sit downstairs in the glass enclosed section, but worth being aware of.

Really relaxing. We thought this was good value. The boat was large and comfortable and very well designed for maximum viewing potential. The icing on the cake were the friendly staff and a drink, which included champagne and quite a well done audio guide in many languages.

Lovely river cruise. So many boat tours available, we asked our hotel staff which they would choose and this was the one.Well looked after, good audio and waitress service with complementary drinks (wine, beer, soft drinks etc) on the way out and lemonade on the way back in.Also could alight at Margaret Island if you wish and grab the next boat back.Well worth the money.

Great scenic boat ride. I highly recommend them for their clean boat at a great price with drinks. You can't go wrong choosing them they run an efficient operation and to get good photos you have to go to the upper deck which is open air.

Surprisingly good!. I've been on a few river boats in my life as a tourist but this Legenda boat tops them all. We were welcomed on-board with a glass of champagne and pleasant smiling faces of a young crew. The boat was in excellent condition, we sat on top in the open, the audio guides were well done. The ticket offered us some free time on Elizabeth Island which we took advantage of and re-joined a sister ship on it's return journey to the quay. We were given drinks on the return journey as well - all included in the price.

Horribly designed boat for photos. Danube and Budapest get 5* for views but the boat we viewed it in was horribly designed for photography. There is only a small strip of outdoor seating. The rest sit indoors behind glass walls which reflect and distort pictures. So most people cram up to the top, standing room only, falling over the sides. In addition there is a huge flatscreen blocking the front of the boat. I have to imagine there are better tour boat companies.
The best boatrip on the Danube . Great moment. Multiple languages. A free drink Is served. Tourists really feel welcome. A must-do when visiting Budapest.
Nice night. Bravo! We enjoy a wonderful night on the boat with dinner. The sightseeing along the river is fantastic. You must come here for your Hungarian night.

Perhaps the best activity in Budapest . The women/girls who help passengers on and off, answer questions and serve drinks are quite pleasant. And the video and audio are interesting.The Stars are the evening lit cities of Buda and Pest. Wow and Wow and Wow

Nice views from the river. The tour provides great views of both Buda and Pest from the Danube and includes 2 free drinks along with a recorded audio tour available in various languages. Headphones are provided. We chose to start our tour just before sunset which allowed us to see the city in both daylight and at night time, which we would thoroughly recommend. Overall a great alternative way to see the city in good weather.
Romantic Dinner Cruise on the Danube. Food, service and views are wonderful! I'm so glad that our hotel concierge recommended this dinner cruise, instead of one of the cheaper ones.

Must-Do in Budapest . Take the last Daytime Cruise; it leaves at 6:30p (April through September). You get the best of both worlds with this option: a less expensive version of a Danube tour, which allows you to eat traditional Hungarian food at a local restaurant when you're done versus a non-Hungarian and very limited menu of the full dinner cruise, and the gift of seeing the iconic buildings as the sun is setting, when they're all lit up. It's a wonderfully relaxing way to unwind after a full day of sightseeing, and you learn about the city, too. MOST HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

The River at Night is Beautiful, This Boat is a Challenge. Highly recommended evening river cruise, and I would go again but probably not on this boat nor for dinner. The boat itself is nice, with enclosed first and second levels for more pleasant dining. The river at night is beautiful. Dinner, while nice, was served very slowly, so slowly in fact that we cruised back and forth over the same territory all evening. At one point, we went back to the dock to pick up a couple who were late, and at another point we returned to the dock to allow another couple to leave early. The live music was again pleasant enough, but I would have preferred selections other than American "oldies". At one point, I went to the women's restroom. Always a line, no matter where, so I joined two other women in waiting. One stood up against the wall opposite the door, and was unexpectedly and painfully slammed into another wall and the waiting bench when the 3" thick door to the kitchen slammed into her. There was no slow opening, no warning, just a fast slam as this automated door opened. There was also no safety notice posted saying "don't lean on this wall", a real lack of understanding by management that there would actually be people in that position on the boat. When we returned to the dock from the cruise, there were no taxis except for those that were "off the meter" and wanted outrageous fares, so one of the hostesses had to call for one. Next time, we'll eat at one of the many restaurants in the area, then go for the one hour river cruise without dinner.

Very Nice. We did the cruise this evening. The boat is very nice with two decks. The upper has some seats which are uncovered and the others are covered. The covered seats have very nice cushioned seats with headphones attached for listening to the program. There is also a large tv screen to watch to follow along with the program.One drink of choice is included with the ticket price. Duration is 45 minutes. Highly recommend for a beautiful Danube experience while in Budapest.

Take the One Hour Night Cruise. Great way to see the sights illuminated. Tour began at 9.30 pm and lasted for one hour.Choice of one free drink - champagne, beer, wine, soft drink - very efficiently served.Commentary is via headphones, although some people just sit and chat.Boat departs from dock 7 - suss this out in advance or leave plenty of time to find it!

A Danube delight. A very pleasant day spent with the Legenda team on one of their trips along the Danube to Margaret Island. Excellent staff and all very welcoming. Boats ran to time and a good helping of sunshine made it a great day out.

Fine views of city from river.. Had about 70 mins tour which was fine. Could have done with a bit more detail on some of the buildings we passed, but was generally a fine experience. (Far end of Margaret's Island a bit boring/unnecessary, but I guess needed to moor boat.
Nice to have drinks included.

Best way to see Budapest---do the Night Tour!. Budapest is amazingly beautiful. I would recommend seeing all the attractions individually by day. Use this tour to see the city by night. You will not be disappointed. Absolutely breathtaking views of the city lit up. Complimentary beverage is provided. Located at Dock 7

Dinner Cruise. We took a dinner cruise on the Legenda and it was absolutely wonderful. Excellent service and lovely food. The views from the boat were truly beautiful. I would recommend this trip to anyone.

Wow!. We booked the candlelit dinner cruise in advance for our first night in Budapest. We were completely blown away by the service and quality of this trip! We were welcomed on board with a glass of champagne each, and seated on the lovely boat, with the sides fully retracted so we could look straight out to the sights (on a less gorgeous evening the windows would still have been lovely). The menu was wide-ranging and had something for everyone, and we were amazed by the quality of the delicious food that was served to us. The service was absolutely excellent, and the guitar player and singer provided the perfect backdrop to the stunning sights we passed as Budapest lit up for us as we floated down the river. This was a real highlight of our holiday, and the perfect introduction to beautiful Budapest.

Incredible tour but the staff isnt so friendly. This is an incredible way to see Budapest by night, from the river you can see almost all the attractions in the city. An advice that I give you is to go to the top back part of the ship, it's the only place in the ship that is open. So you can see everything very good and really enjoy the panorama.Also I think the best time to do this cruise is by night, all buildings and bridges are perfectly lit and look amazing !The staff wasn't so friendly, especially the girl selling the tickets. With the florins its always a problem to know the prize and she was very rude not trying to help us at all.Enjoy your trip !

Nice way to see the city from another perspective. Although there are numerous river tour companies, this is one of the better ones. Good equipment, comfortable seats and good commentary. We enjoyed this ride and in our view the one hour trip is sufficient6 to get a view on the city from the river. This tour gives you the option to stay on the Margit-Sigzet island but as far as we could learn from people that did, there is not much interesting to see there. Overall a good experience.

Excellent night ride. We took the night cruise last night and had a fantastic time. The audio was great and explained a ton about the buildings and general history. We opted to not due the dinner and instead just did the night right which we were both happy about. I would highly recommend this professional company.

Romance is alive and well in Budapest. We pre booked Saturday evening dinner cruise prior to travelling to avoid disappointment if fully booked. The boat was certainly the most stylish we saw for a dinner cruise, a duo provided just the right type of background music for the evening. A welcome on board drink of your choice was presented, menu options for 4 courses were delicious , spoilt for choice, but they were certainly of five star quality, the service was excellent. The city by night is breathtaking and in my opinion a candle light dinner cruise on the Legenda is the ONLY way to see it all. So romantic.

Budapest night cruise. Very good night cruise on the Danube. Comfortable seating, dot on time, Champagne to sip - just make sure you board early to get the good seats. The commentary (i heard in english) was of good quality. Budapest is stunning in the night.
Night time cruise. Enjoyable cruise seeing the beautiful sites along the Danube. Helpful that they had head sets for the tour on each chair. Ok value

Legenda Dinner cruise.. First of all two of the staff were extremely rude on entering the boat.An American lady was shouted at and was within her rights to let the waitress know instantly you do not address people in that way.My partner and I were then seated on a small worthless table where everyone goes outside to smoke.And not in the area where you could see the sights going by.We complained and asked to get a refund and leave.Then there was another small table offered on the upper deck.Half heartedly we mistakenly took this offer up but soon came to regret it.Our waitress was pleasant and courteous enough but once again we were sat where neither of us could actually view the sights going by.But by this time we were already stuck on the boat for 2/12 hours...So the wine and beer were both fine.The food however was awful and we didn't finish either of the courses we ordered.The worst food of our trip.At the end of this god forsaken trip we decided not to pay for the food and just the drinks.Our waitress then changed from being courteous to annoyed as she would have to forfeit the cost from her wages.Which I thought was extremely unfair for her to lose out due to the chef.Nevertheless I refuse to pay for something that is awful.Our advice would be if you want to see the sights by night then go on a shorter cheaper tour and dine in one of the many superior restaurants on land.This is just a tourist trap basically.Avoid!!!

1 hour evening cruise. Nice but almost double priced than others.. The boat is clean and modern. I paid 18 euros for 1 hour cruise which included 1 drink. I don't know why it costs double. I booked online, and when I reached the place, there were other operators who offered same for 9 euros. There are few limited seats to upper open deck. So you need to wait in queue in advance if you want to sit up. Rest of the people have to sit down, which is partially open sideways. The commentary was nice and you have to use headphones if you want to hear it. It runs simultaneously in many languages and there is a button to select yours. You get to see all the beautiful views on Danube banks, the parliament etc.

Nice River Cruise. While in Budapest we decided that a late afternoon river cruise would be fun and our tour host recommended Legenda cruises which are located near the Marriott hotel on the Danube just up from the Parliament building. We arrived a ½ hour early to purchase our tickets and relaxed in the shady waiting area which had a very welcoming water cooler that helped out with the 95 F temperature . The two Adult tickets cost $28.84 US and were priced just as all of the other cruise ships that we looked at.Each seat had a headset that had a number of different languages available to listen to the tour. A complimentary drink was offered to include adult beverages and fresh lemonade was served at the end as well.The staff was very professional and the cruise was just what we were looking for.All in all a very pleasant cruise seeing the sights and listening to the detailed tour information while sipping a cold beer.

AWFUL EXPERIENCE. TO AVOID!! CUSTOMER SERVICES OF THIS BOAT IS RUBBISH! I bought three tickets for the value of more than 200 euros and as I could not go i canceled them and they said they will give me the money back without problem. Now more than a month later, i still did not receive the money, even i tried to contact them more than 20 times through my hotel. No answer or when they answer they always said they will give it back but they do not care. TRY OTHER COMPANIES

The best sightseeing boats in Budapest, even more expensive. It was recommended to us as the best boats to see the Dunabe river. It was worth the money, as the Legenda boats offer panoramic view, and they serve you a drink at the beginning and a lemonade at the end of the simple cruise (no dinner).Take care to book a few days in advance and be there at least 20 minutes before the cruise, since these boats are famous among tourists

Sail Away on the Blue Danube (Cheap!). Boat tour was excellent and only cost $15 USD. Go past all the major sites along the Danube and listen to a rather informative audio guide (in many languages) that isn't super-corny and instead, really instructional. They allow you to get off at Margaret Island for 1.5 hours during the earlier tours. Do this, and rent a bike for the hour (only around $5 USD). It's a nice escape from throngs of tourists and has beautiful parks and gardens. Boat ride back took about 20 minutes and they serve you their own sparkling lemonade (which tasted remarkably like ginger ale...) Overall, an easy and enjoyable experience on the Danube!

Great Food, Great ambiance, Great Staff and fantastic sights.. We were looking for something to do on the last evening of our Danube cruise in Budapest. sought advice from hotel concierge who suggested Legenda dinner cruise phoned to make a booking managed to get the last table 19:45 sail four course al a carte menu. Cost £38 each. We arrived shown on to boat by very friendly staff sat at our table in the boat that has glass dome over it so unobstructed views of Budapest at night. Given a welcome drink although the blurb states champagne you can have alternative i had a beer as did wife friends had red wine and shandy. Food was fantastic, Music on trip organist and singer very good mostly 70's and 80's music i like this. You travel on a large oval around Margaret island then past Budapest East and then another shorter route missing island on the water for over 2 and a half hours. Friends that we were with told staff that it was my wife's birthday as i was under threat of death. Out came the sweets the staff put a candle in her sweet the musicians played and sang happy birthday with the rest of the boat joining in and to top it all our party were given a glass of bubbly look at the pics of the sights at night as it was unobstructed as we were on the water difficult to explain but FANTASTIC if in Budapest give it a go. Book in advance places limited for dinner can do on internet prior to going on hols.
Fantastic view of Budapest!. A really nice boat trip. Good guided tour with refreshments avaliable an amazing view of the city. It gives you an ideas of where to go.

Great views. Took a daytime cruise. Fantastic views of the city highlights.Departed on time and boat was well presented and professionally run. The recorded tourist info / commentary was useful.Also appreciated the complimentary wine.You get a longer cruise during the day as it includes Margaret island which was very interesting to see. Save the evening for a nice restaurant.

Great fun. If you're planning a boat tour Id highly recommend this one. £9 for an hour long tour with a drink (red/white wine, champagne, beer or various soft drinks). The guide came in the form of an audio guide with tv screens throughout the boat. Normally I find these fairly dull, but this one was fairly quirky with all the commentary told from the viewpoint of various monuments and the Danube itself!

fantastic. We booked before leaving home and best to do so as this cruise is very popular.Operated by Legenda the cruise left the wharf located right in front of the Marriott Hotel at 7.45 pm and we were treated with a two and half hours of some of the best views of Budapest as the sun began to sink behind the buildings and the hills of Buda.We opted for the four course dinner and cruise package which cost 56 Euro per head and well worth it . The food was of high quality and large servings by any standard.As we dined and cruised as the sun set we had live music by a trio which added to the scene.during the cruise on the Danbue we past the Buda Castle .. Parliament .. Gresham Palace .. St Stephens Basilica and when they turned on the lights on all these buildings and others it provided sights of grandeur setting for a charming , romantic evening leaving you with lasting memories

Recommended . Had dinner cruise. Excellent value for money. Really nice evening with friends. Views spectacular and photo opportunities galore. Book it now and you will not be disappointed. Food and booze were sensibly priced. Slight mishap when champagne was spilt on my wife but they could not have been more apologetic.

Very romantic. This was one of the highlights of our long weekend in Budapest.Very well organised from start to finnish.Good food, plenty of choice on the menue, with excellent service from our waitress.We had a free welcome glass of champagne on arrival.The bottle of wine of we had was reasonably priced. We finished the evening with a glass of palInka. The views were stunning.

Romantic evening cruise with dinner. We booked an a la cate dinner, which made us to sit on the top of the boat. the cruise, the the view was stunning, the dinner pleasant. All together we had a very romantic dinner. and fish was great!

A magical cruise!!. We took a dinner sightseeing cruise "Candlelit Dinner Cruise on the Danube". You can pay to have a 4 course dinner included or pay a la carte. We chose to pay for the package as when we looked at the menu online it works out to be the better deal. The also include a Welcome drink in the price, so we each had our first glass of wine included.I had expected this to be a sightseeing cruise where we got fed. Instead, we were presently surprised that the food was really good!! Beautifully presented, tasty and well balanced portion sizes. The wait staff were very professional and efficient, as you need to be on a timed event such as this. (it's 2/1/2 hours)The boat is very comfortable, linen tablecloths, nice lighting and a singer and guitar player provided pleasant dinner music. There is no "guided tour" on this cruise. As it was a nice evening, The sides of the boat were open to let the breeze in.The scenery is beautiful! The tour starts before dark, so your first pass of some of the sites is in daylight, but then when the sun goes down, many of the buildings are lit up. The Parliament building is spectacular!I truly enjoyed this outing and would recommend it to anyone.

Great Views of the city from the water. Excellent and cool way to view the city from the danube . They even serve you beer, wine or hot tea on board. It is a great outing up and down the river and you see how busy it really is. Cruise ships, supply boats and pleasure boats abound and passing under the bridges is very exciting. This is a great trip and with loads of competition keeps the price down.

Five for the trip, zero for the pick pockets. If we hadn't experienced the pickpocket duo while waiting to get on, we would say the dusk trip was five stars. I have amazing photos from this trip.I can't accuse the staff of being in cahoots, but it was suspicious. I told three staff members a duo was working the crowd. This is what happened. As we all start boarding, there's a rush of people and it's very crowded. As we start moving, I catch a man with his hand in my purse. I caught it on time, but then we noticed the two working the crowd. I was going to scream, but was afraid because the dock is in an isolated place, it was going to be dark when we got back and didn't want them waiting for us. I told three staff members who did absolutely nothing about it. They didn't warn anyone, nothing. That made us suspicious that maybe they would get a cut. That's ugly to say, but I don't know why my call out was ignored. SO BE CAREFUL here when waiting to board and boarding!

Wonderful evening trip. This was an absolute must do and worth the extra money (cost 16 Euros but can use other cruise companies for 9 Euros). Beautiful seats with plenty of room, a glass of wine or beer and an audio guide of the trip along the Danube. Go at night rather than during the day as the buildings are illuminated and absolutely beautiful.

Good tour . This was a pleasant tour along the Danube at night, the price was extremely reasonable as it included two drinks and live music. Seeing the bridges and parliament building lit up is a must. Priceless.

The best way to see the sights what you visited before. Our Guide Tamas took us to this boat trip. It was his suggestion, we belived him, but not this was the cheapest offer. BUT the best one, really enjoyed it. they spoke 5 different languages, information on headphones are great, got a champage on the way up, and a glass of lemonade on the way back. Could stop at margaret island, took 1,5 hours there, got dicont coupons. So this is the boat trip what I highly recommend to everyone!

Enjoyable boat tour of the Danube around Margaret Island. We had a most enjoyable boat mid-day boat tour of the Danube around Margaret Island on a rainy mid-May day. The crew was very gracious. We just wished the weather permitted us to debark to walk the island.  We plan to take this tour on our next visit to Budapest.

Very pleasant relaxing trip. Not having much spare time in Budapest, this was an excellent way to to have the sights pointed out. The boat wasn't too big and we headed upstairs for the open deck, although the seats downstairs were also by open windows. The commentary was a bit naff, probably geared more towards children but did explain the main sights. It was very pleasant and relaxing watching the world go by sipping a glass of free Hungarian champagne, we were also surprised to be offered another free drink of lemonade. I really liked the size of this boat, no overcrowding, we saw some other boats which had so many people on them. Would definitely recommend this company.

Don't miss Danube night cruise. We took a 9.30 p.m. cruise. Boarding was a bit chaotic but just go with the flow and once on board we went up on the top deck. Dress warmly as there is a breeze on the river.Once the cruise started we were completely entranced! Views up to the castle,bastion etc. were stunning. Piece de resistance is of course the Hungarian Parliament building at night - a wonderful hour of beauty and exhilaration. Sparkling wine was plentiful but quite sweet but that was not the purpose of the cruise.Make sure you do this
Great food and amazing view!. Booked through our hotel - perfect romantic night! Get there 1/2 hour early and ask for upper deck table if you can.

Beautiful experience - dinner cruise on the Danube river at night- A must experience :) . We paid a decent price for a dinner cruise on the Danube which lasted around 3 hours. Around 8000HUF each person for your ticket, a free drink of your choice, there was live music, and you pay extra for food. You can choose a 4 course set menu option which costs more, but I'm a fussy eater so preferred to have more option. Food was cooked to perfection, I'm fussy with meat but I was really happy with the steak I ordered-tasted great, dressed nicely, couldn't fault it. We were seated on the top of the boat which gave us an amazing view across the Danube whilst we were eating, and it was very romantic. Took a while for them to come round and order everyone's food, and also to cook it took a while, but we were quite happy to wait as there were a lot of people on board, we were always asked if we needed drinks topping up, and we had the beautiful view of the Danube and all the amazing buildings/sights to see. The parliament building at night all lit up was especially amazing and great to experience . 2 live singers were on the boat which was a nice accompaniment to our meal. A great thing to experience and amazing way to see budapest! The boat leaves at around 8pm so the sun is just setting which is the perfect time, as all the buildings start to be lit up which is beautiful. Please do book yourself onto this! :)

Totally worth it. We took an evening cruise (Danube Legend) and we simply loved it. We took 9 pm cruise because the lights on buildings come on up only by 8:45 pm or so. The cruise started on time and the commentary was nice. The views were breathtaking and the glass of wine promised was also fine. Overall a must do!

Great night time cruise. Four of us booked the 2130 evening cruise through our hotel. Got there a half hour before it was to leave and were sure glad we did. You line up inside a small waiting area and it continues back up the dock. Once the boat is docked, passengers from a previous cruise get off and you board. Our boat had a complete open top with a middle aisle and one set on each side, about 40 people max up top. We were there early enough to get up top and secure excellent seats with optimum views. The downstairs had and aisle and like 4 seats on each side which would make it tough for easy viewing and photos. Don't think it would have been nearly as good from down there. Our seats up top were perfect. We had outstanding, clear views of everything and it was easy to get great photos from either side of the boat. The audio headsets worked great and they provide perfect narration of the river and what you are seeing. Overall, this was a real nice cruse for the $'s and we'd recommend it. As said, go early to secure the type of view you want and you won't be disappointed.

Must-do Sunset Cruise. The hour-long cruise was recommended and arranged by our hotel. We chose the one that left about 20 min. before sunset, and are so glad we did. We sat in the back and were able to take great pictures. This is a must-do in my book!

Great Tour to See the Sights. We did the 2 pm cruise on the Duna Bella. It was a beautiful day so all the windows were up on the boat and we had an great view. The cruise lasts about 1 hour 10 minutes and they provide you with a choice of drinks on the way out and a small lemonade on the way back. There is at-seat commentary in many languages giving you information on historic buildings/bridges throughout the trip. There is the option to jump off at Margaret Island but we stayed on as I had not eaten lunch and I was hungry. There is no food served on the boat. The views are awesome especially the parliament buildings and the various bridges. The city is just beautiful. I would highly recommend this tour as a easy way to see the sights of Budapest.

Lovely sightseeing opportunity, shame about the other tourists!. My friend and I had wanted to do a boat trip in our 3 day visit of Budapest but hadn't booked anything in advance. Our hotel gave us a sheet with recommended boat trips and this was one of them. On the Thursday we were walking along the river and spotted a guy selling tickets for this boat trip. The whole weekend was advertised as 'Red Bull Air Race weekend' but this didn't actually start til the Saturday. We paid there and then and booked onto the 20:15 sunset trip for the following day.On the Friday we turned up at the time stated on our ticket to find people queuing down the gateway and congregating in a large group on the pontoon. We were let onto the boat not long before the stated leaving time, but were dismayed to experience the pushing and shoving of the other tourists in a precarious area - but perhaps that's because we are British and we know how to queue! After a large group were let on to the boat, there was some shoving to try and get through, so in true British style I held my own and didn't let anyone push through.Once on the boat (on which there was obviously plenty of seats and no need for all the bloody shoving) we set ogre down the Danube. The views from.the boat were amazing, especially when we got up to near Margaret Island to turn back round and all the buildings and bridges lit up. Parliament especially is spectacular!The price of the trip comes with a free drink, which did take a while to arrive but was pleasant enough. The commentary provided through the headphones was a bit cringey at times, when voices spoke as though they were a statue etc and some commentary didn't actually relate to anything we were going past.Once we arrived back there was again a rush to get off the boat, and when we did eventually get off, we were greeted by the next group of people all congregated and blocking up the gangway 2 wide, only allow us to disembark in single file.A worthwhile trip, just crowd control could be much better and make for an even better experience - the opportunity to do what you liked whilst waiting to get on the boat was taken advantage of by other tourists!

An enchanting evening. This hour long cruise which includes your individual headset , is interesting and informative . Through the use of a large screen , you get to view the inside of buildings as the boat passes. A very enjoyable experience.

Wonderful night-time cruise. We opted for the night cruise, which was approx. 1 hour and 30 mins in total. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout, and served us with our choice of drink (soft drink, beer, wine, champagne). We were especially impressed as during the day of our cruise the weather was stormy with torrential rain all day, yet the cruise still ran and we were still allowed up the top to see the amazing views from the deck. Very good value for money, and a great way to view the beautiful parliament building too!

A lovely evening on the Danube seeing Budapest at night.. An evening cruise on the Danube with dinner and drinks was enjoyed by all. The dinner and cruise was a special night out on our last evening during a recent visit to Budapest. This tour starts at 7:45pm and goes for 2.5 hours which allows ample time to see the city light up as the evening progresses. A beautiful way to experience Budapest at night and there is loads of potential for this being a romantic evening. Kisses while passing under each bridge can keep you busy! There is a welcome drink included in the price of the evening. The menu offers 5 starter options, 2 soup options and about 8 options for the main course. The duck had good flavour but was a bit dry. The beef steak was ordered medium and was well on it's way to well done which was a bit disappointing. The service was attentive with staff trained well with the plan in place to make it a successful dinner cruise.

beautiful cruise. Very nice cruise, one hour is perfect amount of time. Unfortunately my audio guide didn't work so I wasn't able to hear the information but it was a very pleasant ride. I would recommend. Book before to guarantee the exact time you want during high summer- it doesn't get truly dark till at least 9 or 9:30

Beautiful Enjoyable Boat Ride - A must at night. It lasts an hour, and for your fee, a beverage is included. The evening weather was perfect, and riding on the Danube seeing the many buildings lit in gold, it was very memorable. Very reasonably priced. It's a lovely way to see the city from a different angle, resting after walking, and walking, and walking.

Great dinner out on the Danube river. I celebrated my girlfriend's birthday with a dinner on the Legenda Sightseeing boats. It was a four-course dinner. The whole trip lasted for 2.5 hours. The service was outstanding and the food was great. We had a great time there.

Fun way to see the sights and get great photos. The boat tour is a fun way to see many of the sights of this beautiful city, and get some great photos! You can also learn a lot as they have an audio guide in 30 languages. We took the 5 pm cruise which doesn't include dinner and lasts about 1 hr 15 mins. Ticket prices were very reasonable (about $35 for 3) and include a free drink (beer, wine, champagne, or soft drink) and a free lemonade. Our boat wasn't crowded, but I would still recommend buying tickets at your hotel so you can avoid the ticket line at the dock. The dock is conveniently located in the middle of town on the Pest side. You have the option of spending 1.5 hours on Margaret Island, but we stayed on the boat. We got some amazing photos of the parliament building, Buda Castle, Chain Bridge and many others.

simply amazing. i took a day tour with a stop over at the park island. it was really nice . worth the every penny spent. one evening before we had 9 euro just cruise also in the night but the arrangement at that boat were awful. so it it better to spend some money & have a nice spacious boat . the seating arrangement is very good . the staff was very friendly.it was real nice experience.

Night river cruise with dinner. This cruise was outstanding cost around 40 pound per person which includes a 2 hour 30 minute cruise a 4 course meal (starter, soup, main and desert) and a welcome drink with a band playing. The service on board was faultless it was truly a beautiful experience and the food was top quality. It is worth every penny and the sights look stunning lit up on the night. The drinks are cheap as well a bottle of rose wine 3400 huf which is around 8 english pounds which is highly reasonable. Its a perfect evening to dress up and see the sights. I recommend the scallaps for starter and the steak for main it was delicious. Do not hesitate and book this cruise or you will regret it.

Don't hesitate to book the 19.45 Dinner package . Legenda runs several boats. We did the inclusive a dinner package, with a table for 2 departing at 19.45. There is a later drinks boat and a 2230 party boat so don't get the trip adviser reviews mixed up!A four course dinner was included and a welcome drink (champagne!) with us buying other drinks.It was fantastic - spacious, private but with great views. The food was good quality and plentiful. A really good singer and musical backing group complemented the ambience.Couldn't have been better.

Nighttime Cruise is the Best. I went on a 9 pm cruise without dinner and would recommend it to everyone. Budapest's sites on the Danube are a perfect setting at night. The boat was not busy so I was able to move around to take pictures. Seeing the Chain Bridge, castle, other monuments, and particularly the Parliament building lit up was breathtaking. Budapest is a beautiful city and its nighttime splendor is certainly worth seeing.

Great way to see Budapest's riverside attractions. We went during the day on a Monday in June (11am cruise) so the tour boat wasn't busy at all and we were guaranteed a seat on the open deck. The boat we were on had mostly indoor seating so if it had been busy the experience may not have been quite as good. There is a small (standing only) open deck at the stern of the boat (where I stood most of the trip) where you can get the best photos. There is at-seat commentary in many languages giving you information on historic buildings/bridges throughout the trip. There's the option to jump off at Margaret Island but we stayed on as the guidebook was light on things to do/see there. The cruise lasts approx 1 hr 30 mins and included two complimentary drinks (alcoholic or soft).

Wonderful Dinner Cruise. We went on this cruise a couple of nights ago and had a great time. We got a table for 2 on the top deck and had fantastic views of a full moon over Budapest. Food was great as well. I had scallops, duck, chocolate cake. My wife had the pork tenderloin, which was also nice.Good service as well and very reasonable wines. I would recommend this tour to anyone.
Very romantic ride . This was a very romantic night ride down the Danube. The night view of Budapest is simply breathtaking. And the food on the boat is very good.

Worth doing but nothing that I would call fantastic. The boat tours are good and definitely worth doing just to see the views from the river. However the boats do get crowded we were there 40 minutes before the tour and if we were 5 minutes later we would have been almost last onto the boat. If you are taking the tour in summer check the sunset times and take one that spans the sunset as the atmosphere is really nice.The audio guide comes in many languages but is a little confused as the audio goes on about sights that are actually not visibly from the boat and this just confuses you sometimes as they don't really explain what you are passing. I actually took off the headset and just enjoyed the view after a while.The boat tour includes a drink (Soft, Wine or Champagne) and the staff are very friendly. The inside cabins are not so good for photography as the lights inside reflect off the glass windows. If it is warm try and go to the second floor and outside by the back of the boat.

What a way to spend our first night in Budapest!! WOW. The other half booked for us to go on the night cruise with a meal. We sat upstairs in a glassed walkway/conservatory that gave us excellent views of the city. It was beautiful. I'm glad we went up and down the Danube a couple of times as we missed seeing bits whilst we were eating. The food was fabulous and the whole bill was very reasonable for what we had. I would definitely recommend this cruise to anyone going over to Budapest. We will be doing it again this year when we go at Christmas.

Breathtaking Danube night cruise. My husband and I booked a night cruise on the Danube for our last night in Budapest (a Monday). What a great experience! My husband was able to make the reservation and pay on the Legenda website, then he printed the reservation from our hotel's printer and brought it along that night - no problem! Our boat left at 9:00 pm, so we got to the dock at 8:25 and saw people starting to enter the waiting area at the bottom of the ramp. Once the staff worker started taking tickets, everyone in the waiting room was very impatient to push forward and get on the boat first. I guess they were all trying to get the best seats on the boat... We got on the boat and headed to the top deck. There, the seats on both sides of the boat are in groups of 2, so we had no trouble finding two seats together. There was an informational narrative video that played for the entire ride, and you could choose from a variety of different languages. The boat went south down the river past the Liberty Bridge, then turned around and went north to the Margaret Bridge before turning around and returning to the dock. The buildings were it up beautifully and I got a lot of great pictures during the smooth and entertaining ride. A complimentary drink was also part of the package, and the staff workers bring the drinks to you so there's no need to leave your seat. I can't compare this to the dinner cruise or day cruise, since I didn't take those, but I would recommend the night cruise as a great way to see the city, and worth every penny!

Disappointing. We looked forward to a nice, quiet, romantic, leisure boat sail after a long day of walking. We took the 22:15 pm tour on purpose. The scenic views of Budapest were amazing of course, but they were distracted by a crowd of drunk youngsters sitting in the back who were very noisy and kids who were running around and chatting non stop with a very loud voice. We could not even hear the commentary with the headphones on! If they charge so much, at least they should have crowd control, or limit the tour to people who are willing to be considerate of others. They can have a quiet cabin, or a special tour that does not offer commentary for people who just want to hang out and talk.

Best river cruise. We took the river cruise to Margaret Island with Legenda and these boats are top notch.They have an open upper deck and the lower deck is completely glass enclosed with sliding panes to allow open air and can be slid in for cover if it rains. It rained midway through our trip and the crew quickly closed up.The narrated tour is wonderful and informative and headsets are provided. I would suggest they make the headset cord a little longer as I had to lean forward as they were too short to comfortably sit back. (Switched to my own ear buds to solve the problem)The lower deck seats are very comfortable and not at all packed in. There is plenty of legroom.There is an option to spend an hour and a half on Margaret Island which we did, and then catch the next boat back.Gerat service ad they even offer a complimentary beverage (I had champagne), and a lemonade on the return.

Awesome. Lovely 1h 10 minute trip on Danube river with 30 language options available. Rather interesting facts were shared and just loved the complimentary champagne and lemonade. Not too crowded due to higher price than competitors (about 5-6 eur more) but very attentive serviceand good value in my mind.

Go to the 8:15 sailing in June. This was a nice way to introduce ourselves to the city. We arrived at our hotel and decided ito do an evening cruise to take pictures from the Danube. We tried to time it for sunset lighting and weren't disappointed. They serve a beverage (beer, wine, champagne, soda) and have a video you can listen to to learn about the area. We very much enjoyed the experience until it was time to get off the boat. The next sailing was lined up and crowding the entire walkway. We had to fight to get upstream of the people trying to fight to be first on the boat. Horrible set up for disembarking. Don't people realize you can't get on until the other people get off. ARG!!!

Dinner Cruise. We took the Legenda dinner cruise in early May. All aspects were excellent.This is an ideal way to see the city. The food was as good as any land based restaurant and in addition to the obvious attractions of the city at night the live music (guitarist + singer) really added to the atmosphere.

Must do activity! . The best way to savour the beauty of Budapest is through a boat cruise. I had booked a cruise for 2 in advance but we had 3 other friends join us. Fortunately, they had space for all of us. We took a seat on the top deck. One drink is included in the fare. Since we were the last to be served, we got an extra glass of wine and champagne that was left after serving everyone. It was a sunny day and we loved clicking photos with some of Budapest's well known landmarks like the Parliament, Chain Bridge, Matthias Church and the Royal Palace. The tour was slightly over 1 hour with an option to visit Margaret Island which we skipped. The boat cruise is a must do activity when you are in Budapest.

Need a new script. A nice hour boat ride in the Danube in a completely enclosed boat. The program audio had a number of dead spots that I thought could have been filled with more interesting narrative.

Evening cruise was an excellent end to our time in Budapest. We booked tickets for the 9pm evening cruise in the afternoon. When we walked back up in the evening we watched a lovely sunset before boarding. (Tip would definitely be to get there about 20-25 mins before departure, we arrived 15 mins before and the best seats were already filling up). The cruise was very romantic with some beautiful sights from both sides of the Danube. The waitresses were very helpful and served our drinks quickly. Although the tickets are a little pricey, I think it is a very worthwhile thing to do.

Commentary is awful! . We took this trip last week. Boat trip with drink included. The commentary had us in stitches. It's so awful it's funny! We decide to skip it and went upstairs to take some pics instead. Won't be doing it again.

Never expected the food to be so good!. As a group of 3, we tried to book the top level, but were told it was only for couples. Turns out this didn't matter. We got luck and had great weather so the glass walls were down and photographs were easy of all the sites. Being summer, the sun didn't set until halfway through so the lighting was just perfect. The staff were friendly and the food was surprisingly very good. We had low expectations and were mostly there for the views, but the food was just as much a sensation.

Night Cruise a Must. We made our reservation online the night before. When you get to the dock there is a special check in area for online bookings. We were some of the first people to get on board. Trip makes a figure 8 on the river, so either side has a good view. Trip includes a beer or glass of wine. Blankets were available for chilly nights when sitting outside. The city is beautiful lit up at night. See by day from castle hill, etc.

Would not recommend a night cruise. We did the night cruise, not dinner cruise. We showed up 15 minutes before departure, all top floor was full, but really only about 20 seats were actually outside. Everyone else was inside also and had the same problem we did. The glare from the windows! Made it hard to really see outside, very annoying. It was not totally dark inside the boat, so it is like being inside your house at night, not the easiest to see outside. The video going at the same time was not well done. I finally went and stood at the back of the boat, and once I did many others joined me. I would recommend doing the tour during the day. I think you would see more.

Perfect activity for day. It's a really nice visit with so beautiful views of Buda & Pest, from the Danube. The audio guide is great. Welcome drinks are welcome. Ability to stay on the island is a must. Enjoy then a dinner at the casino and take the next boat. Evening tour is real nice too but, for higher price, less time and drinks. But view is really amazing.

A la-carte Dinner Cruise. We booked this cruise on-line and opted to include the 4 course A la-carte dinner at the special price quoted,it was well worth the money.The food was delicious,1st class, and the service very attentive.What a lovely way to spend 2.5 hours sailing along the Danube with Budapest at night as the backdrop.I highly recommend this particular dinner cruise!

Romantic, delightful evening on the Danube. We did the dinner cruise. Food was very delicious. The service was very attentive. We were seated on the top deck which was all couples so it was romantic. Enjoyed seeing the sunset and then the buildings lit up after dark. We could hear the live music from downstairs. The singer was not very good which actually became entertaining on how bad she was. Overall I highly recommend this dinner river cruise.

Really worth it. Went on the evening dinner cruise and was not disappointed. Seeing Budapest a night is wonderful and from the Danube it is even better. Not only that, but the food was really good. Would definitely recommend taking a boat tour on the river and if you can go there for the dinner cruise.

Nice way to see some of Budapest!. I did not purchase a ticket ahead of time, I just showed up by the boats and bought a ticket. I sat in the seats outside because the weather was so nice. A little bit into the trip I was served a beverage of my choice. Decent commentary on the sights during the ride. I did not get off at Margaret Island, and the trip back to the dock from there goes much faster than the trip out. There is no additional commentary, but I was served a nice lemonade. I wish the ride back was just as leisurely as the ride out, but overall I was very pleased with the experience.
very good. A very good way to see both sides of Budapest, interesting commentary, free drink and the chance to get off at Margaret Island and spend time there before the return journey.

Annoying waste of time. I am on the 9pm tour. Notwithstanding the rain which makes it hard to see the sights this trip is irking me. The boat is speeding along and much of the pre-recorded commentary relates little to what I can see out to. But if you like history I guess you will appreciate it.What is annoying me most is the drink service. It would have been nice to have been served our inclusive drink as we boarded so we could have enjoyed it. Instead one extremely slow steward is serving 2 or 3 rows at a time making me wonder if I am going to get served at all during our one hour trip. Why not have a trolley service or a button to press in front of you indicating what you would like. Or more stewards?

Budapest by boat. The boat provided a beautiful view of the buildings lighting up as dusk fell on the river Danube. The headphone comentary and accompanying video was interesting providing information on the buildings, bridges and some background on the history of the Danube & Budapest as we passed them by.

a la carte is AMAZING. Went on the 2.5 hour a la carte cruise, booked in advance and were taken straight upstairs which has the best views and an open part perfect for pictures, also less intrusive to other diners than downstairs. Greeted with welcome drink, all other drinks extra but are completely reasonable. There is a food selection of food on the menu and you are served at your leisure, not rushed and served by lovely and thoughtful staff who go above and beyond what is expected. Blankets provided for if you get cold and it was a perfect opportunity to enjoy beautiful Budapest by night. Really loved every second of this cruise, and although a little pricy, id pay it again! It was perfect, thanks everyone!!

Lovely way to spend an hour and see the city. Ok, so we had a lovely sunny day and got to sit outside (I would not want to be inside). This was a lovely trip up and down the river with a very good commentary (not too much but informative). It included a drink and was the perfect way to pass an hour whilst seeing Budapest from the river.

Relaxing Evening Cruise. For what the cruise was it was very good. The staff was very attentive. The cruise was 1 hr 15 mins. Gave an excellent overview of the sites on the Buda and Pest sides of the Danube. Also afforded us a great opportunity to take some very nice night pictures. Cruise included a drink. Attendants also provided blankets for anyone asking for one. Would do again!

Basic tour with attentive service. From the river you'll have magnificent views to both Buda and Pest. This sightseeing tour lasts 75 minutes and offers an option to disembark on the Margit's island and come back on the next boat (or some other way for example walk).There are audio guides with 30 languages and two drinks included and even served to your seat. The staff were multilingual.
