To be noted: there is no possibility to buy drinks or snacks but you can take your own if needed (to the sightseeing tour, not the dinner cruise which is also available).

Great views, nice options but average tour.. Sailing on the Danube is lovely and the option of stopping off on Margaret Island is a nice feature. Staff are friendly and surprise, you don't have to pay for the toilet. However, the tour is pretty basic so if you have already seen a few sights,you won't really learn anything new. Another time, we would take a cheaper boat or just go to the island with public transport.

Must-do: one hour sunset cruise on the Danube. Even though I was leaving Budapest on a river cruise ship, I was not leaving town without making sure that I got a proper view of the river at night. I was hoping for a sunset cruise but unfortunately the sun and the cruise schedule were not in sync. The weather wasn't cooperating much either and it was cold out on the deck where I was standing to take pictures. It just didn't matter. I was cruising through a UNESCO World Heritage site and I was seeing if from the only place that it could be fully appreciated.BUT, we had a great time. An hour is plenty of time to see it all-the Chain Bridge, the Castle District, the Parliament Building all lit up and the view from Margaret Island up the river (that's the money shot!). Hubby sat inside and listened to the narration (well done, he said); my head-set wasn't working but that didn't matter because I was in and out taking pictures of the view and hoping that at least a couple of them would be clear and crisp enough to catch what I was seeing.Thank you, Legends. We had a wonderful evening!

Nice evening ride on the Danube. My wife and I included this boat ride as part of an afternoon/evening tour of some of the Budapest attractions. The tickets were pre-booked before arriving and allowed us to save some time when boarding the boat.The boat appeared to accommodate about 60-75 people on the enclosed lower deck, with space for another similar amount on the exposed upper deck. However, the weather was a bit cool with a few random showers so most of our cruise passengers were inside. The boat is equipped with individual headphones (in 30+ languages) so you can listen to the narrative while cruising. Our only main complaint was that about 25% of the headsets did not work and you had to move to a seat with a working set if you wanted to listen to the program.The cruise lasted about 1 hr or so and allowed us to see a number of Budapest landmarks and structures (most were well lit for nighttime viewing) and several bridges over the Danube. Night photos are difficult at best and impossible from inside the enclosed deck (too much glare from the interior lights on the glass), so I had to go outside and shoot pictures from the rear of the boat. That worked pretty well but it sure was windy and damp.Overall, it was a nice end to our city tour and most folks should enjoy the cruise.

Dinner Cruise on the Danube. We decided on a dinner cruise for my husbands birthday on our last day in Budapest. The dock is easy to find but when you arrive it is a little chaotic and not very organised, however it wasn't long before we were seated. We were seated upstairs which has about 10 tables so wasn't really any atmosphere but when the lights came on and it got darker it was probably the best place to be as you got a good view of all the lit up buildings on the Danube. The waitresses took a while to take the drinks order so was sat for quite a while with just the welcome drink. The food came quite quickly and was hot. The starter and soup was ok I had the beef for the main course and it was very tough. The boat went up and down the Danube quite a few times as we were on board for about 2.5 hours and after the first few times you don't even notice. The music wasn't very good the singer was a little out of tune and we were sat right by the speakers upstairs so had to put one of the blankets they supplied over it to turn it down. All in all it was a relatively good night and I would recommend but just don't expect too much

Danube cruise by night. We decided to have a cruise on the Danube to enjoy it by night (if you have the Budapest Card or if you are a student there is a discounted price): the cruise is nice and explains every palace/structure that faces on the river with videos and an audio guide (you can select your language). During the trip there is an offered drink (Champagne, wine, soft drinks..). Watch out if you decide to get on the upper level there are no protections, so you can take beautiful pictures, but it can get very cold when it's windy!

Candelit Dinner Cruise on the Danube. This is a must do special experience on the Danube Legend at Budapest. You can take the A La Carte menu ( 8400 HUF ) or the Exclusive Dinner Package ( 16900 HUF ) Drinks extra on both. So not cheap for the 2.5 hour sail but a nice way to have a special dinner. Our 4 course dinner was excellent.

Re: great. We took the hour cruise at 7:30 which was a good time bec we were able to see the views during daytime and when the buildings were already lighted. We opted not to have the dinner and we had fun. Lots of photo ops. The audio guide was informative.

A romantic dinner cruise. Our dinner cruise on the Danube exceeded expectations. We booked the exclusive 4 course dinner and received excellent service and better than expected food.The arrival, however, was chaotic with people waiting for the sightseeing cruise, the buffet supper and the dinner all crammed together in the small reception area waiting to be let on board. This really could have been much better organised.Once on board we were shown onto the top deck with about 10 tables for two. The whole experience felt very special and romantic.This cruise may sound expensive compared to the buffet supper but it was well worth it.

Excellent VFM. We took the dinner cruise with a 4 course meal included. It was far better than I had expected as I had been on another one before and it was not that great food wise. This was extremely well organized with table service. The food was really good, with a good menu - not too many things, but for all tastes I would say. The only thing I would suggest to anyone is that you also take a cruise where there is a guided tour as this particular one was basically food and enjoying the view, not learning the history. There was no information given, which did not bother me in the least as the views were spectacular and I had done the basic tour. Super and well done to the staff. Very polite, efficient, well turned out and quick. Very good VFM.

beautiful trip, reasonably interesting commentary - worth doing!. I wanted to do an evening boat trip whist in Budapest and, I confess, I booked this because it was easy and I could book online! (If you walk along the riverfront there are plenty of other companies doing cheaper trips, lesson learnt.)We arrived early and therefore got near the front of the queue to board, this meant we could get a choice of seats upstairs.The audio-comentary is OK - adds a bit of context to what you're seeing and answered a few etsions that had arisen as we were walking around the city. There is also a TV screen which shows an accompanying programme, allowing you to see inside some of the building facades. I didn't watch it at all, so it was easy to ignore! My partner did watch it, said it was good, so horses for courses.The highlight, of course, is the spectacle of the lit-up banks of the Danube sliding past. Its beautiful and seeing it from the boat is a wonderful way to appreciate it. Boat is under cover, with open air sections for those that want them - another plus point.All in all the boat trip was well worth doing, and the complimentary glass of champagne was a nice touch.But a word of warning - whilst the upstairs of the boat was great, I think I would have been a bit disappointed to be sitting downstairs,with the noise of the bar and more people wedged in.So our trip was very good - but if you're going, get there early or go on a quiet day to make sure of getting a decent seat!

Candlelit dinner, excellent trip/. We opted for a la carte dinner, the food was perfect, all four courses were great, surely exceeded our expectations. We were sitting on the top floor, which offered some privacy and had a perfect view for the incredible buildings of Budapest. Staff was friendly , the live music was very pleasant.So far, its a great value for the money i would highly recommend Legenda : )

Greatest attraction ever!. Loved the service and the night cruise. The boat trip at night shows you all the beauty of the city and you realise the city changes its "dress" as it becomes more vibrant, you can see the sights beautifully lighted up. The price is a bit more expensive than in the other boat trips 5500HUF per adult but it includes the drink, and operates on a modern yacht, you are able to see the 30min movie about the just passing by sightseeings in 30 languages (also Polish, Hebrew, Arabic). I was dreaming about such a trip, honestly and I have spent there my 30th birthday so I am very excited about the trip and absolutely loved it! The tour is 1 hour long at 21:00, and 1,5 hour during the day as it goes around the Margaret's Island.

A typical tourist boat. To go on the Danube is a must for any visitor to Budapest. However this boat was a little tired but the staff were friendly- handing out free drinks ( included in the price). The waiting area could be improved- rather chaotic.

Good value trip!. We went during the day on the boat trip and had a really good time. Stopped off at Margaret Island for an hour or so and this was well worth visiting. The commentary is not very thorough but was more than enough for us! The staff were all very helpful with the push chair etc.

Worth it, but could be better. One hour boat ride along the Danube at night with Budapest lit up was enjoyable. Friendly staff provides a complimentary drink (including wine or beer) with your ticket. Glass covered boat so weather doesn't affect the ride. But the audio tour could be better. Several of the audio transistors or headphones were broken and we had to move seats after the tour began to find working unit. Could have been a problem if the boat was full. Would do it if it's your first time to Budapest. Beautiful city, especially at night. Dock 7 right outside of the Budapest Marriott.

Candlelit dinner on the Danube, yes please!. My family and I booked Legenda online - an easy process. We arrived around 30 minutes early. There was a queue to get on the boat but there's no rush as the tables are reserved. The boat is fairly small and is covered in a glass dome, great for seeing the sights. A musician played a variety of well known tunes. Whilst we ate, the boat did a couple of laps up and down the Danube. The views are spectacular, the best being when the boat turns at Margaret Island. The food was really good. The red wine by the glass was pretty average, perhaps we should have got a bottle!There were a couple of younger children on a nearby table. They behaved pretty poorly at times; crawling on the floor, sitting under the table etc. This was a bit annoying, especially for the waiting staff.Highly recommended.

Excellent view of Budapest at night. We did the night cruise on our last day in Budapest. It was a beautiful way to see the city lit up at night. The boat is very roomy, a drink was included with our ticket (21 Euro), and there is a balcony on the top where you can take pictures. The tour lasted about an hour and went past all the buildings we wanted to see. A friend recommended a boat tour as the best way to see Budapest and I'm really glad we did this...it was a great way to end our trip in this beautiful city.

Candlelit dinner cruise - fantastic start to our trip. Knowing we were arriving Easter Sunday we wanted to book somewhere for dinner in advance, so chose this cruise. Very helpful that we could pay online in advance. We chose the candlelit dinner cruise with four course meal, for 50 Euros each it actually turned out to be very good value. We had a welcome drink of our choice, then spent 3 hours enjoying the sights of Budapest at night while enjoying the very talented musical duo. Every course was beautifully presented and tasted amazing. The staff were very helpful and friendly and all spoke very good English. I'd recommend this to anyone as a lovely way to see the sights.

Fantastic cruise with outstanding food and wine. Firstly, the food was 5 star. Really fresh with top quality ingredients, all four courses were great.We were lucky enough to be on the top floor which almost seems like a submarine as it is all glass - perfect for viewing the incredible buildings around Budapest. Service was friendly and the food came out at a good rate. We had a couple bottles of their pinot noir was was very reasonably priced and a tasty drop it was.I would recommend this, one of the highlights of our European honeymoon.

Lovely cruise down the Danube. We booked an a la carte dinner cruise down the Danube on the Legenda for 8.400 forint (meal not included.) The welcome drink was a bonus, the staff were lovely and the boat was nicely laid out. The food was pretty good, exceeded our expectations of what we could be getting to be honest. The entertainment was a little cheesy although not offensive. All in all, a very nice way to finish off a trip with a loved one.

1 hour cruise is the best!. I took Legenda many times with my clients, we never took the dinner cruise, though. It's a very relaxing experience, especially when the weather is good enough to sit on the upper deck. The recording in English is really good.

Needs an age minimum because of kids. The boat was nice and provided great views. Food was good, but slow service. There were some young children at the table next to us whose parents let them run wild during the entire cruise taking all the candles from everyone's tables, running up and down the aisles and generally ruining the experience.After complaining to management, I was told there was nothing they could do about it and weren't even apologetic. I suggested that they institute a minimum age to keep an adult atmosphere.The acoustics made it very loud on the boat, so it wouldn't be a romantic experience.Overall an average experience but could have been a lot better.

Evening dinner cruise. Lovely - better than average food( some cold / warm) of the main meal but very tastyExcellent service - attentive and obligingRiver cruise could be extended further instead of going around twice!! Lovely evening with nice. Easy listening live music

Ok cruise. We booked an evening a la carte meal the food was very good but the boat only went so far then turned around and off we went again and yes the city is beautiful but after seeing the same thing over and over it got boring. The staff were friendly.Big disappointment was the group where were they, 2 people one singing other playing guitar I was told it was a lovely Hungarian gypsy group. Definitely not the case.

Great cruise!. We went on the two and a half hour evening cruise, and would definitely recommend. Food was great, and the drinks were cheap. A glass of champagne was 1000 forint, which is approx £3. Good atmosphere and great service. Budapest looks beautiful at night time, the Parliament Building looks so special.

Boat trip on the Blue Danube. This was a great way to see the beautiful buildings that line the Blue Danube in Budapest. Good value for an hour and 10 min trip. Free glass of champagne, beer or a soft drink on the way out and lemonade on the way back. Glass dome boat so nice a warm and good views all around. There are head sets with language choice which informed us about what we were seeing and some historic facts.

Loved it . We took the evening cruise without dinner and enjoyed every bit of it. I specially enjoyed that it is not the typical audio commentary "now look to the left, now look to the right ". It is like the Danube would tell you the history of Budapest. We were lucky as it was a beautiful evening and you also have a drink included in the price. The staff is terrific and very helpful.

A must see by night!. We went with the evening tour at 7 pm. Due to the lights on the various buildings and monuments we found it very nice. Also, the accompanied movie and explanation was good to understand. Would recommended to do by night!

Day trip was enjoyable. We chose to do the day tour and I think it was the right choice. We had a delicious winter (?) tea whose recipie I wish I had obtained! And also had the option of an additional beverage. We chose champagne which was of average quality - not that I'm overly familiar with the stuff but one of my more imformed companions felt that it was not of a high quality so I defer to them on this.The audio guide was interesting but I think that the person driving the boat should be listening to it at the same time; our boat turned before the audio guide did so for the rest of the cruise it lagged behind our location by about a minute. Other than this I enjoyed the cruise and the snippets of info about Buda & Pest.

Excellent meal while taking in the sights of Budapest from the Danube. This tour was suggested by my hotel and, while a candlelight river cruise dinner while traveling solo, seemed like it might be a bit uncomfortable, it was a really nice way to end my time in Budapest. From the start of the night until the end, the staff did everything possible to meet your needs and ensure that you had everything you might want. I went with the 4-course dinner option and was very satisfied. Each course was great and the timing of the meal was perfect. Desert was served with just enough time to finish it and a bit of wine before we returned to the deck. The folks playing music struck an perfect balance between entertaining and remaining in the background. Had I had company, it would not have been problematic to chat and enjoy that company.
poor. The dinner cruise is over priced, defiantly just tourest ripoff. The food was the worst that I had while in Budapest. The staff were very helpful. To be avoided.

A nice way to see the city highlights by night!. This is best done, in my opinion, at night. Budapest knows how to light up their best featured structures , including bridges, castles, churches and fortress walls. It is simply magical, and a great way to relax if you have been sightseeing all day. They serve drinks along the way, and the earphone storyline is in at least 20 languages. It's a great intro to the history of many buildings too.I'll take friends when they come to town.

Nighttime tour is not worth the time or money. We took an evening cruise on the Danube and found it to be a complete waste of time (we didn't include dinner in our purchase). The boat is enclosed in large plexiglass windows, which keeps you warm. However during the whole cruise they show a travelogue on large screen TVs which reflect on the inside of the windows, making it difficult to see outside. Our headphones didn't work and so we had to use the headphones from the empty seats behind us, craning our necks (we didn't move to that seat because we wanted to stay close to the windows). I didn't see them make any note about the bad headphones, so I presume this goes on cruise-after-cruise. Although there are some beautifully lit buildings along the Danube, much of it is not lit - so there is nothing to see from the boat. You can see the lit buildings from the shore. Our cruise also had a noisy bunch of students in the back half of the boat, making it difficult to hear the narration.The boat itself was nice and the staff were pleasant, so maybe it would be worthwhile for a daytime trip - but not at night.

Pleasant . I went on the 2pm boat tour today. The tour was interesting however, there are many other things to do in Budapest that I think are much more worthwhile. The staff on board are very friendly and speak great English. At the beginning of the tour we were given a warm glass of orange tea, this was horrid and I'm not really sure who likes this stuff? However, you are offered another drink after this that is included in with the price of your ticket. The boat tour is a good trip to take if you have an hour and 15 minutes to spare and want to go past some of the beautiful buildings such as Parliament. The audio isn't great. The information given isn't interesting in the slightest and most of the time all you will hear is music.

Nice evening. Nice way to spend the evening. Very good food and very large portion for main course. Drinks were a reasonable price. Lovely surroundings although the boat was very very warm so had to keep cooling down outside.

Worst boat trip ever. We went on the Legenda day cruise after getting 25% off at our hotel. Whilst it wasn't a complete waste of money (it was cheap enough and ticked the boat cruise off the sightseeing list) it was a very poor cruise in terms of information.It was 70 minutes long yet pretty sure the audio only lasted about 25 if you pushed it all together. Every 5 minutes there was a long gap with music - during the last 20 minutes I don't think there was any audio at all. It was a shame as there was so much that wasn't said that we'd already learnt from the guide book - the 'tour' basically just pointed out the ten main sights. Aside from being completely uneducational there were two presenters called Pest and Buda which made the whole thing feel like it was for kids.On the plus side a local tea (not great) was provided along with a free drink including champagne (better than the tea!). Overall very disappointed but pleased we got 25% off - if I'd have paid full price I'd have been tempted to ask for my money back based on the lack of information or 'tour' aspect.

A pleasant dinner cruise. Booked the 2 hour evening buffet dinner cruise for myself and my fiancé for Valentines Day.Slightly odd arrangement of having to go to a venue next to a hotel 5-10 mins walk away to exchange our email confirmation for a ticket and then be shepherded en masse down to the dock where we were directed to our particular boat.However, once we arrived at the boat we were greeted warmly, received a complimentary glass of pink fizz and were invited to pick our own table - all the tables were next to the windows and can seat 4 people, but were only set for 2, so we weren't expected to share. I think we may have been on an extra boat as they were running 5 ships that evening! The one we were on was quite small and therefore felt more intimate, just right for Valentines!Also included in the price was a small bottle of water each and another glass of fizz or red/white wine. There is the option to buy additional drinks should you wish to. We had a bottle of Hungarian sparkling wine, which came in at HUF6750 incl. tip (approx. £17).The buffet was plentiful and of traditional Hungarian type foods. We weren't particularly hungry but enjoyed the selection we had. Not gourmet but very good and tasty. There was a trio of string musicians playing a mixture of gypsy and classical music, very pleasant and not overbearing.The service was ok, our used plates were taken quickly. However, we did have to ask twice for our extra included glass of wine and towards the end they took our water glasses before we had finished.Excellent hostess who resolved any issues quickly, was happy to answer questions re the view (there is no commentary - which you don't really want on a romantic cruise) and came round to ask if anyone needed a taxi booking at the end of the trip. All in all we felt it was good value at EUR77 for the 2 of us.

First Class. Took the candlelit dinner cruise on Valentines, fantastic evening. The staff were excellent, the entertainment was very good and well suited to the ambience of the evening. The meal however was first class.A great way to see the cities lights and money well spent, great value.All in a very good night out, thanks to everyone on the Legenda

Great way to see Budapest by night. We went on this evening river cruise not really expecting it to be a great culinary experience. We were very pleasantly surprised, the food is remarkably good and well presented. The staff are very attentive and the wine (not included in the package price) was very good and reasonably priced. Add to this a 3 man band playing their versions of popular music with a backdrop of the wonderful Budapest skyline and this trip is a real winner.

A Must Do experience in Budapest. A four course dinner for two and a two and a half hours cruise for £81 is fantastic value for Brits where you would pay twice that in London and where the food would be rubbish. The boat has a fully glazed canopy and although it was cold outside it was actually too warm inside. There were two live musicians who played most of the time with some poor canned music as they rested. The food was MUCH better than I had anticipated and very well cooked and presented. You make an allowance for the food because you think they can't cook as well as in in a restaurant but this was good quality even for a restaurant. The service was done very enthusiastically by a group of young girls who are very cheerful and speak most languages well. The cruise starts at 7pm and after a few minutes they lower the lights and the scene is breath taking! It's true that the boat turns every 20 minutes or so but it does give you many chances to take some great photos. I can't recommend this boat trip enough. 10/10

Get a good background prior to exploring buda and pest. This boat cruise we took a few days after being there but we found that if we had taken it first it would have helped us organize how we explored the city. It gives a good background on the two cities, the bridges that Budapest is famous for, and gives you a view of many of the famous bathhouses, memorials and churches. You get a complimentary warm drink which goes good during the cold winter and we also had some local wine which we were not charged for. The prices were reasonable for a family of four I believe around 25 euro or so. Try this first before venturing around the city.

A truly wonderful experience!. This was a wonderful way to round off our visit to Budapest with dining and cruising along the Danube. The 3 course dining experience with wine was delicious and the service impeccable. You just could not fault it. The waitresses were kind welcoming and calm- no rushing about which only added to our enjoyment. In fact I have to say that Royal Caribbean - "Independence of The Seas" with its distinct brand of lack of fineness which we had recently been subjected to really do need to take a closer look at how one should treat customers! This Legenda experience with a wonderful singer magically accompanies the spectacular views all along the Danube. Absolutely fabulous! Lit up at night it is easy to see why this is a heritage site and probably one of the most romantic places to be!

Comfortable boat interesting to see the Danube at night. We took a Boxing Day cruise for dinner. The sight of the Danube at night was lovely although you do go up and down the same piece of river several times. Food was fine and wines were palatable. Service was good and the price reasonable. We were in the upstairs section whilst the band, that played modern standards, was beneath us but we probably saw more of the city. A pleasant way to see the city at night from the river and enjoy some reasonable food and wine.

Lovely river cruise. We went on the 20/01/2015 for a river cruise on the boat called the Duna Bella.The staff were kind and friendly from the start to finish and spoke fluent English. We chose where we could sit either on the upper or lower decks which we sat on good seats on the upper deck. We were given a free drink of complimentary tea towards the start of the journey, (which we thought was our free drink) halfway through the journey we were offered a free drink of our own choice.The scenery on the boat cruise was lovely with an entertaining audio guide system which told you about the city, its buildings statues and historical facts. You could also go outside onto the back of the boat to take better picture if you wanted to. The interior of the boat was also good looking with comfy seats for the duration of the boats journey. I learned much from this river cruise and the audio guide which helped me to know and understand Budapest a lot better.A river cruise on the river Danube is a must do whilst visiting Budapest and I would definitely recommend Legenda river cruises to anyone too. I would also go on a river cruise with Legenda next time I am in Hungary as well. :)

Relaxing. We did the evening dinner cruise. Food was really good, good choice of drinks, decent service and good live music. The best bits however were the fantastic leisurely views of beautiful Budapest. Although the cruise doesn't go too far means you gets lots of opportunities to take in the view, enjoy your food and drinks, the music and the company of your dinner guests.

Danube Dinner Cruise at Christmas. Our family experienced the Danube Dinner Cruise the night after Christmas. From start to finish it was an exceptional trip. We liked that it was not a very big boat so that service was very good. We had the four course dinner and each course was displayed beautifully on the plate and the taste and flavors were very good as well. Our drinks were always replenished quickly.The view from the river was fantastic. The buildings along the Danube are lit up magnificently and our pictures were brilliant. The cruise lasted about 2.5 hours and it was truly an enjoyable evening.

Needs some improvement. Did the dinner cruise. The experience overall was good, however, a few things could be improved. 1. The ticket says to arrive half an hour before, so why leave everyone sat there waiting to be boarded until ten minutes before the cruise starts?2. The boarding process takes too long, more staff are needed to speed it up. 3. The cruise doesn't really go very far, it would be better if it went further, just driving around in circles isn't very interesting. 4. The heating upstairs didn't work on our cruise and the electrics kept failing. We did get some compensation for that, but it was freezing. That really should have been checked before departing. 5. It is sold as a romanatic dinner cruise - why then were there families on board with children running all over the boat behaving badly?Overall the experience was good, the food was nice and the drinks were pricey, but not terrible. The sights we did see were interesting. This is the second time we have done the cruise and will probably look to see if there is anyone else offering something similar next time.

interesting, but overrated. We booked the afternoon cruise as dinner ones were sold out. It was interesting to start, but very quickly became quite boring. Pre-recorded information was good and in correct pace, but was lacking something. The staff seemed to be very unhappy to work as none of them smiled and all what they said was lacking engagement or enthusiasm. I noticed 3 people who fell asleep during the trip !!! It was relatively good value for money (12 euro per person), but possibly other companies could offer a bit more...

Wonderful view, but not a good value for the money. I'm a local in Budapest and once my company booked a dinner on a Legenda's boat with dinner. The staff was very nice and kind and we all were very excited about the dinner. It was quite disappointing though all dishes looked nice but the portion was small and the taste is average compared to the price. For much less you can get better food in the city...And the drinks... They did not have tonic water, and the champagne was the cheapest brand.You cannot miss a boat trip on the Danube, the view is wonderful, especially by night. But I would not recommend for any tourists taking a boat trip with Legenda because it is very expensive. (unless is winter time and you don't have any other choice) From Spring to the end of Autumn take the boat service of the general public transportation company (BKK) for the price of a single ticket (2 EUR) and you get 45 minutes boat trip. It's not that fancy like Legenda but for the money you save take a 5* dinner at an excellent restaurant.

Great tour with spectacular view. I enjoyed the evening tour that gives you great views of the city seen from the Danube river. Everything is really wel organized from the drinks on board to the perfect audio system. Definitely recommended.

A very enjoyable dinner cruise. We were certainly not disappointed by our candle lit dinner cruise on the Danube which we pre booked and were greeted by friendly staff. The meal was not 5 star but very acceptable and the bar prices were reasonable. However the two hour cruise which offered fantastic views of the historic floodlit buildings including the parliament and castle was the highlight of our Hungarian experience which we will never forget.

Beautiful!. I took the dinner cruise with my family on 18 December at 7pm. We were immediately seated on board the boat, which came with huge floor-ceiling windows. The waitresses were very pleasant and took our orders promptly, which were served soon after departure. The food was delicious and portion sizes just right. It was great taking in the scenery and listening to the talented duo playing live music! We will gladly take this cruise again the next time we visit Budapest.

Breathtakingly beautiful!. My husband and I chose the dinner river cruise for our stay in Budapest and we highly recommend this to anyone who wants a romantic evening. The service and food was excellent with a wide variety to choose from. Everything we ordered was delicious and exceeded our expectations. The views of the city at night are breathtaking and the cruise is at a nice pace. A total of 2 1/2 hrs. A welcome glass of champagne was offered in the beginning which started the evening off right. Highly recommend this cruise.

A great way to see Budapest from the Danube!. My husband and I were able to take an evening cruise on the Danube on the Legenda tour boat in Budapest. We showed up on a weekday evening without advance-purchase tickets, and were able to get right on. We didn’t purchase advance tickets, as the trip can be a waste of money if the weather is bad! We just showed up on a clear, rain-free night. Be sure to arrive early! Because it was a clear night, we opted to sit on the top deck, and had cozy blankets to keep us warm. The top deck is a much better experience, as you have an un-obstructed view of all of the major landmarks in the city.Although the cruise was expensive compared to other Budapest attraction, it still was really nice. I had taken this cruise before, so I knew what to expect. We knew to ask for blankets on the top deck, and we knew that the headphones for the commentary don’t work at every seat. We realized that a glass of champagne, wine, beer, or soda was a free part of the cruise. There are several options for cruises… daytime cruises, evening cruises, and evening dinner cruises. We certainly enjoyed our regular evening cruise.

Expensive and also rip off. Went with dinner included, and they keep offered drinks like "coffee or tea?" That are also chargeable... that is not acceptable for an already very expensive dinner cruise.

Legenda dinner cruise **very disappointing**. Did this cruise last night- was looking forward to this on first night in Budapest. Arrived early to ensure a good table as advised. Was boarded on top deck which was dotted with electric heaters on floor but little to no heat from them. Blankets on each chair for the cold. Windows full of condensation , little to no view. Thought deck would heat up but did not. Half way through dinner, went to lower deck to discover a few free tables & simply told staff we were moving to lower deck. Impossible to enjoy when frozen to the core & no ambiance. Other guests also had hats & coats on for dinner which is not satisfactory. Food was disappointing. Would not recommend this trip based on our experience and how all the guests who were put upstairs in the cold, away from the live entertainment last night.

Poor Commentary. Its good value for money mainly because you get a free glass of champagne. However as nice as it was to see the city from the Danube the commentary over the headsets was poor and I didnt really feel like I learned anything new about the city. It would be much better with live commentary, maybe they do this in the summer months.

Evening Cruise with a drink. I made a list of Pros&Cons. It looks like I have more Cons than Pros but it wasn't so bad.Pros:Gorgeous view of illuminated city from different angle.A welcome drink is included.Lots of language choice.20% off with Budapest Card.Cons:In November, I believe that there was no upper deck open unfortunately. I understand because it is freezing but I had to take photos through the window/ceiling glass. It is almost impossible to take perfect photos from inside because there is reflection of dim light of boat and flashlight of other's camera. Staff starts taking orders of drink only when boat starts moving. If sitting rather rear area, you will get your drink most likely in the latter half of the cruise. I got 20% off thanks to Budapest Bard, but it still costs 4,400 HUR. Rather pricey ?Ticket office is almost invisible !!! I went there to buy a ticket in advance but I left without buying because I didn't see what seemed like ticket office but everybody ! Step further. The small ticket office is kinda in the boat, not on the street. I was back there at 1800 again but I was just told that all tickets were sold out for the day. They had an extra cruise starting at 2000 but it was also full. I had to buy a ticket for the next day, which was the only option. There were 2 of night cruise on the next day as well but both cruises were also fully booked. Lucky me, I at least bought the ticket on previous day. It was the beginning of November. Everybody ! Get your tickets beforehand to avoid disappointment.I arrived around 18:05. Half of the boat was already occupied. I still could take a window seat but if you definitely want to take window seats, get there 30 minutes before. There is another cruising company right next to LEGENDA, it seems like they have more frequent cruises (hourly in the evening) only for 1,900HUR. Of course the language selection is not as large as LEGENDA and drink doesn't come with but it costs 2 euro. If LEGENDA is fully booked, you may want to try that one ? It is right next to LEGENDA.

Fantastic day cruise followed by evening dinner cruise - great experience!. Went on morning river trip, stopping off at St Margaret island. Trip explained through audio the history of buildings on Buda side and Pest side with male and female voices - clever idea !! This trip was most informative and formed a good start for our further sightseeing.Followed up with an evening cruise where we paid for our meal on board. The views of the illuminated buildings and bridges were amazing and the meal was excellent !!These two trips were excellent value for money and gave a very good comparison of the river views in the day compared with the evening. By the way, you also get a free drink on each trip !!

Duna bella. The cruise is roughly £20 for two people and lasts about an hour and half or longer if you decide to walk around Margaret Island.. Although the boat is comfy and has an audio guide it isn't overly informative and by using the trams and public boat service on the danube you would see the same things for a cheaper price!

Enjoyed this trip. We felt the trip was really good value, the drinks we were given were of good quality. The young girl who introduced the tour was really impressive - she could speak so many different languages! The hearing guide for the tour was good but the music was a little irritating in between points of interests. The only downside of the trip for us was when we got off at Margaret Island, it may just be the time of the year we went but there was nothing to do and the staff in the small food/drink kiosk near the front were quite rude.

wonderful dinner cruise. We pre-booked the candlelit dinner cruise online opting to go a la carte for the food as neither of us fancied the appetizer choices with the 4 course meal option. We booked this particular dinner cruise based on Rick Steve's book -loved it!I was a bit concerned when I saw all the people that we would be sharing a larger table with others but no, happily we did get the table for two we wanted. The price includes a drink as the trip begins. The staff were very helpful and personable with all the guests. The music was mediocre but truly didn't care-it was all about the company ad the view. The meal was much better than I expected-thoroughly enjoyed the duck and the chocolate brownie dessert

well worth the money. Pre-booked the candlelit dinner cruise and really enjoyed it. On arrival you are offered a complimentary drink . Once set sail you are served with an excellent 4 course meal which was so much better than I expected, and with the evening views as you sail down the Danube what a lovely way to dine. 10 out of 10

Romantic, good tasting food and impressive views. We started our stay in Budapest by taking Legenda's 'candlelit dinner cruise' with a four course al a carte menu included. And it was just perfect! We got a 2 1/2 hour boat trip during which we could admire the impressive architecture of Budapest - the parliament, the castle etc. - beautifully lit up in the dark. The food was great. The menu offered five different starters, two soups, seven main courses and three desserts to choose from. (It was not a buffet dinner - we were served at the table). Only one drink was included in the price though.During the trip there was a man playing soft clarinet music which added to the calm and romantic atmosphere on board.

Lovely evening on the Danube. We pre-booked the 9pm night cruise and were so happy we did! We found the dock, handed over our booking form and were let straight onto the boat. It was very quiet as we went off-peak, and had our pick of the seats. Left on time, got a free glass of wine which was a great touch, and sat back and enjoyed the illuminated Budapest sights. It's the most beautiful way to see the city. A must-do!

Romantic and beautiful. It was a great beginning to our time in Budapest. We opted for the 4 course candlelight dinner cruise and enjoyed the 2.5 hours with beautiful night scenery, nice food and live music. We sat on the upper deck which offered privacy with only 5-6 tables. The ambience was very romantic. My tip is to try the candlelight dinner cruise, instead of just a normal cruise without food which I feel would seem quite boring in comparison.It's really worth it, especially for couples.

Must See Evening Danube Cruise. As most of Budapests' sights can be seen during the day on foot we decided to do this boat cruise in the evening when everything is illuminated. It was a great little trip lasting about an hour. A free drink was included as well as commentary on headsets in umpteen languages. The commentary matched the particular sight you were passing. The area covered was from the Margrit Bridge down to the Petofi Bridge. Evening cruise was 5500 HUF and was good value and a must see.

pleasant boat trip. After checking out the many, many boat tour operators, we picked this one The Legenda, on the boat Duna Bella. It was not quite the cheapest one but they were not in your face like some of the others and the boat stopped at Margaret Island ( the others didn't) where you could get off if you wanted to stroll around the island and catch the next boat back. They gave us a guide book for the island which included a few vouchers for discount at some coffee houses or cycle hire (which we did and was great fun). Free Champagne or beer on the way out and free lemonade coming back. Lovely.Nice, easy, pleasant trip up the Danube. Highly recommend them.

Night Trip. Read reviews that the night time trip was the best. I agree. We did the 6.30pm hour cruise and which was just on sunset. Budapest is spectacular at night and Legenda offered a good rate, very informative auditory guide of the landmarks on the River and the history of Budapest. My advice if you want to sit on the top of the boat get there early!

Evening Danube cruise. Highly recommend the evening Danube river cruise by Legenda (we were able to get a discount through Rick Steve's book-20%). Staff has blankets available for chillier fall days, and the evening Budapest is beautiful from the water.

Night cruise. We planned doing the dinner cruise, but ended up with the night one. The prices listed on the site are misleading - the price listed for cruise plus a la carte dinner is 8500 HUF, but as we discovered upon arrival - it doesn't actually include the dinner! You need to pay for everything you buy or pay 16900 HUF in advance and have the dinner included. So we just took the night tour and were retrospectively grateful we didn't book the one with the dinner. The cruise didn't take us any further than we reached walking around the city, so it didn't contribute any additional information or sights. Maybe it's better doing it on your first day in Budapest, so you have a general idea about the city and decide where you want to go. So... The city is gorgeous and if you are lucky to have a good weather as we did, the sights are very beautiful and impressive. And you can see all the most important monuments and sites in one hour. The audio guide is quite good and informative, but not always synchronized with the cruise and we weren't sure which building they were talking about. The free drink (we took red wine) was poor. There was no safety or emergency information provided, I suppose you just swim for your life in case of emergency. The headphone sets weren't cleaned or changed between cruises. In our opinion - this is absolutely NOT A MUST SEE, but if you do decide to take this tour, arrive early (we were there half an hour before start) and try to sit upstairs in the open part. It is colder there as the boat goes, but the views are worth it. You can get not a very clean blanket to cover up. And one last thing - it could be a romantic cruise, but once upstairs, you have only one row of chairs on each side so you cannot sit close enough to cuddle or talk.

Why Spend $25 When $5 Would Do?. This was nothing short of what could be be described as a misguided tour. We were the first ones on the boat for an evening tour. We were not told that we could sit on an upper deck. Instead we had to deal with televisions with short blurbs about Budapest that had absolutely no relationship to what we were passing along the river. We used English voice units that were close to being inoperable. And what we did hear was totally distracting. In fact I fell asleep. I think we would have done better to find a boat that offers a river crossing (or so I understand) for about $5. It would probably be more enjoyable and more cost effective.

Night cruise is a must!!. We prebooked at night cruise ( without dinner) at 9.30pm. It was not a full boat so did not take to long to get on and off!! The audio information is very interesting and fully of good facts ;) we also got a free drink onboard for the price :). All I can say it's amazingly beautiful seeing this wonderful city lit up at night, magical and romantic ;) worth every penny!!

Romantic Dinner Cruise. This was both an enchanting cruise and delightful culinary dinner experience. After reading other TripAdvisor reviews about Legenda Cruise, my wife and I decided to try a dinner cruise with the company to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Booking online was convenient, and you must print your confirmation and present it to the hostess upon arrival. I would recommend that you asked for an UPPER DECK dinner table in that it is more intimate; there are only about five tables; and you get an outstanding view of the lighted buildings that remind me of Disneyland at night. The food was exceptionally tasty, well seasoned, and fresh. Try the pork loin cubes or duck breast. Even the desserts were made with care and a cut above other restaurants. Plus, there was live music provided by a singing duo. Our romantic dinner cruise will always be one of those experiences that include the word "wow!" to describe our time in Budapest. By the way, for the best photo shots of the lighted historical buildings and bridges, pick the early dinner cruise (starts at about 7pm).Thank you fellow TripAdvisor reviewers for this wonderful recommendation! :)

Perfect ending to a beautiful trip. This boat tour was fantastic. We did it at 19:30 at night and it was well worth it to see all the bridges and the Parliament building lit up. You also got a great overview of some buildings to see and the commentary was actually pretty funny but informative. It is told from the perspective of the Danube. I would almost do the tour the first night so you would have time to go see some of the attractions they mention. We saw a majority of them anyway. Highly recommended.

Very nice experience!. We had a dinner and cruise package thing and it was beautiful. Recommended to anyone. Four course dinner and a two and a half hours cruise on the Danube so plenty of time to see everything and it is a beautiful city illuminated! The package is not cheap but the food is nice - nothing extra special(!) but more than acceptable and wonderful views!

Excellent evening cruise down the Danube . My mother and I booked onto the legenda book cruise for an hour cruise down the Danube. There was lots of cruises to choose from but we went with this one because of the reviews and it did not disappoint, from start to finish it was simply stunning. Excellent price. The staff were all very friendly. Some boats seemed to be going very fast down the river but the legenda was very smooth and slow which is what you need to take in the stunning views. This really is a must do boat cruise when in budapest. Which we had time to have done the dinner cruise as that looked like a real treat. We booked the tickets on their website which was very quick and easy.

A night time illumination tour of Budapest is fabulous. If you visit Budapest you must take a Danube cruise in the evening when all the buildings and bridges are lit. It gives a very different perspective of the city.We took ours as part of a river boat cruise that started in Budapest but any cruise boat would be ideal.
Great evening boat cruise. Do not miss an evening boat ride. Legenda does a fantastic job. Budapest is magic at night. This boat ride is a grand way to soak it all in!

Nice. We took the Legenda cruize on the Danube which took 2,5 hours. The weather was rainy unfortunately, but we had 2 bottles of champaign and so had fun :) The trip itself was boring as we swam three times along the same route and never swam around the island (though it was promised on their site).

Legenda Dinner Cruise. I booked this dinner cruise for myself and 3 friends on the recommendation of our hotel. We chose to book the cruise with inclusive welcome drink and then selected our meal from the a la carte menu. We thoroughly enjoyed the entire evening. The food was excellent and beautifully presented, service was friendly and attentive and the ever changing views of the bridges and buildings along the Danube were truly impressive. A most enjoyable evening and reasonably priced.

Dinner cruise on Danube with Legenda. We took group dinner cruise. No guiding information was available, but great night river view compensated it. Food was very good - we took shrimps (it was quite little portion) and duck breast (that was quite abundant), yammy! Local wine Bock was very nice. The only minus is that the both decks were covered and it was a bit lack of fresh air, so to take good picture (especially of Parliament building) and to get fresh air one shoule have gone to tiny open place at the back of the boat. I still think that it was right to have less expensive ticket as we would not manage 4 course dinner which costed more than 53 Euro per person, drinks not included.

Beautiful evening. The cruise itself was great in that it covered the entire span of the Danube and the audio guide explained all of the sights (though the audio was pretty corny). Staff brought a complementary drink, but it was still a pricy one hour excursion at ~$70 for a couple.

Relaxing boat cruise - go in the evening!. My family and I took the 9pm boat cruise Legenda along the Danube. We had bought tickets the day before the cruise to make sure we got the time we wanted. The cruise was great. It included one beverage. There were headphones at every seat with audio of the places that we would be passing along the way. Very relaxing and scenic. In the evenings, all the buildings are lit up which enhanced the experience!! I am handicapped and use an electric scooter (similar to an electric wheelchair). The staff at the boat pier so extremely helpful. They helped lift the scooter onto the boat and let us board first to avoid the crowds. I would definitely recommend this one hour excursion!

Legenda dinner-cruise. Top-quality dinner-cruise: great service, excellent gratious food and delicious wines, while enjoying the magnicifant views of illuminated Budapest. Very good price/quality ratio. Highly recommended.Big Wheel alumni group - The Netherlands

Do you still believe in legends?. Do you still believe in legends?Well, I hear you: but only if they are not just stories but real too.Here is my legendary experience.Once upon... a month ago, it happened in gorgeous Budapest, Hungary's beautiful capital.The Danubian legend will not fade out of your musical memory, and now here you are.We simply thought that during the heatwave it would be nice just to spend an evening on "The Blue Danube" to the accompaniment of some classical tunes. Also, we wanted to take some pictures of the city's impressive architecture. We usually take a taxi crisscrossing the city, but what is better than a boat?Oh yes, the magic lies in the stunning view of both sides! Sometimes we even forgot to click the shutter button as the view in front of us was not a staged theater scene but an eclectic mixture of beautiful architecture and all the reasons visitors love to come to Budapest.No problem, the boat's captain understood that we forgot ourselves in the view, and the boat slowly glided in a zigzag along a long stretch of the Danube, when Buda and Pest's illuminated wonders appeared in the late sunset. This panoramic view engraved itself upon our memories.No talk, no fuss. The silence enhances the magic; the pleasant evening breeze cools you. The dinner is just delicious. No goulash, thank you. Instead, a sophisticated four-course menu to choose from. We of course, wanted the most out of it, and ordered different dishes at each course, and we can confidently state that the dinner matched the enjoyment.While at dinner you will enjoy live music. When we went, the audience were charmed and entertained by a singer who accompanied himself on the clarinet to complete the wonderful atmosphere.Time went by, and we woke up from this relaxing, wonderful dream, wondering whether our busy schedule would allow us a second time. As it didn't, the impression was completely and utterly unique.
evening cruise. Lovely evening boat trip with a free drink. fantastic view of the danube and budapest. looks fantastic all lit up at night. definitely book though as busy in the evening.

Check time of sun set. We really enjoyed our 1 hour evening cruise with Legenda. If you can find out what time the sun sets then time your cruise so that you can see the sun set over Budapest then pass by all the main sights and beautiful lit up parliament building. Also a very drinkable glass of fizz was served.

Lovely evening. We were undecided about doing a dinner cruise but pleased we did we were lucky enough to be on the upper level where there is only about 7 tables for 2, it was a beautiful evening and they had the side windows open , the views were stunning and the food was good, we went for the four course dinner it cost us about £100 and that included a bottle of wine and 2 bottles of water would highly recommend especially if you can get on the top level, they also had live music which was lovely.

Relaxing Dinner. We took a candle light dinner and cruise on the Danube from 7:15 to10:15pm. Awesome!!! The cruise is a great way to see the sights and lights of Budapest from the Danube in the evening. During the cruise the sun set. Cost was about $140 for two, including the cruise, a la carte dinner and a descent bottle of local wine, Villany Portugieser, 2013. The boat was not fully booked, which was a surprise. It rained on and off during the day, perhaps this put off some people. But the evening turned out perfect for us. It was a good thing since it was our last night in Budapest. The dinner was relaxing and delicious.

Very, very good!. Usually the 1 hour cruises are a big disappointment to me as they are a superficial view in 20+ languages. So I was pleasantly surprised when we took the Legenda cruise. The material is very detailed and they have monitors to show you the interior of the buildings and some buildings that are relevant to Budapest but are not close to the shore. If you mention the Rick Steves name you get a 20% discount (you also get that if you have the Budapest card); bonus: you get a free drink.It is one hour worth of your time as you get to see the Buda castle, the Parliament and St Matias church and the fisherman's bastion among other sights.

An elegant way to see Budapest. This boat cruise was a delight. The food was imaginative, delicious and served efficiently and in a friendly manner. The four course set menu was excellent with plenty of choice to suit all tastes. The cold citrus soup was very unusual and delicious.We were on the narrow upper deck - highly recommended for the views and the service. The live music was good and not too intrusive and the views of Budapest, in both daylight and then illuminated, were impressive.Great value for money and a great way to spend our last evening in Budapest.

Almost Perfect. Granted we took the tour on a particularly beautiful day and the glass roof was rolled back, but I have to say that this was a really good experience all 'round. The staff are well trained and although the food would only score a 3/5 the experience taken as a whole was top notch. One thing I would advise against is the "Citrus cream soup" it is basically a bowl of ice cream that a toddler has played with until it has completely melted. "Not worth wasting the calories on" was both mine and my wife's honest opinion. Choose your evening by the weather and you won't be disappointed. Just gib the soup course. ;)

A trip to relax and enjoy Budapest. Me and my partner went on the latest night cruise to see Budapest at night as we heard it was such a beautiful city and that was exactly what we saw. Seeing the Caste, the Parliament building and other major buildings all lit up brought a different feel to Budapest. Peaceful and relaxing, the trip was easy riding and a great way to see what Budapest has to offer.

Great attraction, poor cruise. Took a late evening cruise that included a glass of champagne (not the dinner cruise). Purchasing the tickets and boarding the vessel was a nightmare,Very poor organisation on the wharf itself. It seemed that all of the staff (apart from the lady selling tickets) were actually on the boat, so the wharf was a free for all. We had tour parties believing that they had "priority" boarding, who were busy pushing everyone else back. We just waited patiently and ended up getting a good seat anyways. The commentary from the headphones was OK, and the boat did what was required-took us up one side and back the other. What is definetly the highlight is seeing all the buildings and bridges lite up-it would just take you so long to see them all at night, and on foot. This is the redeeming feature of the cruise. The price, at about A$23 dollars, was also expensive, considering how cheap most things are in Budapest. I think the river cruise operators have the market by the throat-if you want to see it all, then you have to pay. Problem is, we wanted to see it, as well as many others by the fact the cruise was full, Add it all up and it is an average excursion.

Relaxed dining with pleasant surroundings and great views. Booked a dinner cruise through the hotel and we ended up with Legenda. No problem. The staff were kind and courteous. The food was tasty. I had a lovely piece of steak, my wife enjoyed the duck. We went a la carte as we didn't think we wanted four courses. We cruised up the river in daylight hoping that it would be dark on the return. I hoped that the beautiful architecture would be all lit up, but it wasn't. No problem. They gave us the full two and a half hours and we passed the parliament building four times during the cruise, and it was glowing in golden light on the last two passes. Got some spectacular shots.There were three guys in the band, and they kept us entertained all night with some ambient music. Two of the waitresses showed their mastery of 6 languages between them introducing the cruise and then later winding up the night. The waitresses did really well and were really helpful, especially Henni, who politely listened to my attempts to order my food in Hungarian, and complimented me for trying. Never spoke a word of Hungarian in my life before.My wife and I left the boat happy and content after a wonderful evening.

Good way to start your visit. Good way to start your visit to Budapest. We did a one hour night tour and it was gorgeous and very romantic. Our hotel helped us in purchasing the tickets. There were head phones available, but I didn't use them because they didn't seem that they were cleaned between cruises. We got on right as another cruise was getting off and no one cleaned them or switched them out. I didn't feel it was very hygienic. The TV screens were available to go along with the audio.

Nice experience, very good audio-guide. We did the daytime one hour cruise and thoroughly enjoyed it. The price was good and included, one alcoholic drink and one glass of lemonade. The audio guide was very well done and gave much info on the history of Buda and Pest which was interesting, but much of which we might have otherwise not come across during our stay. Budapest is really centered on the Danube and you get great views of the city and the many bridges from the river.

Pricey but worth the pretty penny. Food and service was excellent. This 2.5 hour dinner cruise is everything you want and more. It offered the perfect vista from which to see all the great sights along the river. Very romantic.

5 star cruise, 3 star embarkation process!. This would have been 5 stars because as a trip it is spectacular. The scenery is breathtaking and the Danube should be viewed at night to fully appreciate it.The only reason I am giving 4 stars (which is for Legenda and not the sightseeing) is because you board and disembark at the same point which is chaotic and quite frightening. For night time cruises, arrive early and move towards embarkation point as soon as possible because as the scheduled trip time approaches, pushing and shoving ensues as people try to board first to get the seats offering the best views and some don't care who they offend by trying to push to the front! You do however get a free drink and it is worth the initial struggle!

Delicious food and great view. I took the 2.5 hour Candlelit Dinner Cruise that started 19:45 on 1 June 2014. The seating is pre-assigned, so no need to rush in. I sat on the middle isle on the first deck and had a great view to both sides, so don’t worry if you don’t get a window seat. There are no commentary on this cruise, so you can concentrate on eating and enjoying the view. There is a small outside deck on the back of the boat from where you can get better photos than through the windows. You can either prepay for a four course dinner, or pay only the cruise beforehand, in both cases you pick your menu on board. The prepaid menu includes one drink. You can find the menu on the company’s website. I had the following dishes:1. Hungarian cold appetizers2. Cold citrus cream soup with a touch of mint raspberry cream3. Duck breast with rosemary in red wine sauce with sour cherry served with roasted potatoes and carrot4. Brownie topped with chestnut cream on the side with spicy plum ragoutYou would not necessarily expect to find high quality food on a this type of cruise, but this was one of the best dinners that I have had. The portions were large and the waiting staff was efficient and friendly. Budapest is a beautiful city on daylight too, but when the bridges and riverbank buildings are illuminated at night, the view is really breathtaking and a night cruise is the best way to experience it. With this quality of food, I highly recommend this tour!

Excellent way to see some of the sights. This is a great way to see some of the major sights of Budapest. The commentary is excellent as you have your own headphones where you choose your own language and volume. It's not like some boat cruises in Prague that have occasional commentary over a speaker. Included in this is a drink, beer, champagne etc. you're paying slightly more but it's worth it. The boat also stops off on Margaret island where you can disembark if you like and get a later boat back. Staff are also very friendly. Overall. Highly recommended

Budapest by Night cruise. We obtained our tickets from the hotel, simple.I wanted to do Budapest by night, and this lived up to our expectations.We booked the 21.30 and arrived early, but was informed we could sit inside and wait, a bonus.The boat we were on had all round vision, large glass panels and viewing was excellent, all but people darting from onside to the other taking photographs, not realising they went up and down the Danube.A brief talk was given by the staff and then they came round and asked what we would like to drink.We had red wine and was very impressed by the quality.I must agree that the presentation on the tv screen could be a little better, but the headset info was very good.It was all about timing and seeing all the monuments lit up was a moment never to be forgotten.As river trips go this was very good and value for money.

On the Duna. I don't know about the dinner cruise, but that short one (about one hour) is good enough to see and hear about the main sites of Buda and Pest. The view of the Parliament from the water is, of course, unbeatable.

Night Cruise with TV!. We booked the 1 hour cruise at 1015 pm but as we were in the area earlier we were allowed on the earlier cruise without any problem. A pleasant hour seeing the lights and having a beer.Spoilt by having large TV screens showing the area with a commentary to match which did not sync to often with what you were seeing. In the darkened boat eyes were drawn to the large screens which gave a feeling that you could have stopped at home and watched the video instead of viewing in real time.

elegant adventure!. As titled, elegant. We really enjoyed the dinner cruise. I have to say that the Danube was even more scenic at night when lights were up. I particularly liked the parliament building (try to snap a pic of it with the water reflection!) The Buda side was also very pretty. We highly recommend the cruise. Very good food as well (even though a little bit pricy. But worth the view!)

Night Sightseeing Cruise. I believe it is a must to go on a short sight seeing cruise of the Danube River when in Budapest. Most of the major sights are along the river. It was timing and particularly wanting to see the lights of the monuments at night we have decided to go on this cruise. It was well advertised on the tourist maps. I am sure there are others to choose from that may be better. I took the quick 1 hour night cruise. Depending on the month and when the sunset time, the start of the 1st night cruise will differ. There are usually 4 cruise at night. Do book ahead online if you want to take the first night cruise of the evening. It does get full. There is a audio guide included in every seat. However, some of the English ones are not working and with any of these cruises, sometimes it will be difficult to catch the monuments that they are mentioning on the guide because of the cruise position. It is a good introduction to all the monuments along the Danube in Budapest and what lovely scenes at night. It can get cold and windy in the upper deck.For the perfect photo shot (day or night) of the Parliament other than on the Fisherman's Bastion is to take the tram 41-19 on the Buda side to the last station before Metro Batthyany ter. This is directly across from the Parliament. :-)

Legenda Dinner Cruise was Awesome!. I reluctantly booked a dinner cruise on the Danube because my travel companion wanted to do this. Although I wanted to see the Danube at night, I thought that a dinner cruise would be way too long and with the usually mediocre rubber chicken food. I could not have been more wrong! We booked the all inclusive dinner booking, and we loved every minute of it! We were seated on the top level of the boat, offering amazing views. As an added bonus, the free Wi-Fi worked better than any other that we had in Budapest. The service, ambiance, food and views were wonderful, and I highly recommend it! The boat also has a back deck, affording great shots of all the sites. We also enjoyed the live music on board. In fact, my travel companion attempted to book again the following week, but was disappointed when they were sold out. Don't wait, order online. Just be sure to collect your tickets early the day of the cruise as instructed, or you will lose your reservation. You will not get a better view of the Danube at night than a Legenda dinner cruise. It was one of the highlights of our trip.

Budapest exclusive dinner river cruise with Legenda. On the 10th of May 2014, we did a dinner cruise with Legenda in Budapest with a group of 32 Belgian wine lovers. Of course, for such a large group, the reservation was made a few months in advance. We had a four course dinner with free choice for every person from the card. All plates were of high quality and they also have high quality wines on the wine list. The service by the waitresses was really outstanding: they were all very kind and respected a perfect timing. This is really a recommendable event in Budapest !

Decide what you want. We went for the pay upfront option rather than the al a carte. This gives you the choice of four courses. The cruise lasts 2 1/2 hours.So, you need to decide if you want to cruise the Danube at night, whether you're hungry enough to eat 4 courses or would rather choose fewer, whether you want to be out there for over 2 hours.Seeing the Danube at night is enchanting and I would recommend it. (The regular sightseeing cruises run at night and are about 45 minute long).Of the 4 courses we had, 3 were very good while the main course was a bit messy and not very good. You get a welcome glass of your choice (it's not Champagne btw, unless it's very poor Champagne, so pick a beer if you want it!). All other drinks are extra.I felt the dinner cruise was half an hour too long; going around for the third time was a bit much and there was a massive gap between the soup and the main course, so time could be saved here. See if you can get a table on the upper deck (if there are just two of you) because you won't have to share it with other couples. Also, the live entertainment won't be "in your face".Saying all that, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.
Cruising.... The Danube at night is a is a sight to behold. No better way to see it then with a delicious 4course meal. Lounge music a little corny but service very good.

A must do. We booked the candlelit dinner cruise and it was wonderful. From the friendly greeting to when we got off, it was a pure delight. We had champagne to sip while we set off and food was served. I have to admit, I wasn't too keen on my starter, Hungarian plate, but the rest was delicious: Pumpkin Soup, Pork and Barley with Panna Cotta dessert. Every mouthful was a delight. There was pleasant live music in the background and the views were stunning - all for around £45. Worth every penny. We were going to call for a cocktail on the way back to our hotel but we were still full from our delicious meal, we called it a night
Definitely has to be done ! . We booked the 8.15pm cruise and were very happy with it. Lovely staff, given a choice of champagne, beer or wine and all for €18 each. The best way to see both cities!

Candlelit dinner cruise. The Danube and the cityscapes of Budapest are beautiful by night and what a wonderful way to experience them. We booked the inclusive package which included a glass of champagne when we boarded and a four course meal. I wasn't sure what the food would be like but it was really very good, and the live music was pleasantly subtle and not too cabaret-like at all.The 'candle' on the table is of course a battery-operated LED but for obvious reasons I think we can let that pass :) Very romantic, a lovely idea for couples or friends alike.

Really worth doing in Budapest. I booked the dinner cruise in advance back home, so I did not knew what to expect. What a pleasant surprise however. The boat leaves at Dock 7 (very easy to find and not far away from the Elisabeth Bridge). The boat leaves at 7.45 pm and takes you on a 2,5 hr trip. As I booked all included (circa 50 € pp) we had the choice of every hors d'oeuvre, soup, main course and dessert of the menu. First of all the boat is really nice. It is a real floating restaurant. The service was very friendly. You should not expect it, but this was the best dinner we had in Budapest. (Quality and presentation were absolutely top) While you are eating the scenery outside is marvellous. All main Budapest building are illuminated and you should even say that Budapest is more beautiful at night as in the day. We were really very very satisfied about Leganda cruises.
Absolutely wonderfull. Booked this trip based on TripAdvisor reviews. One word: EXCELLENT. Highly recommend for couples....P.S. If you do not like noisy neighbors, book the table on the second floor.

Great Views of Budapest at Night. Went on the night sightseeing cruise on the first night we were in Budapest. It was stunning! The video was very informational and we got a drink included. Unfortunately the glass surrounding the boat did not allow for the best pictures- but the eyes are the best cameras right?

Stunning views of Budapest by night. Would recommend an evening cruise on the Danube - a lovely way to see this beautiful city lit up in all its night-time glory. We liked the look of the Legenda boats because they are mostly glass and so we thought would offer great views wherever you sit. We took the one hour evening tour (ticket includes a drink) which lasted abut one hour. There's multi-lingual commentary available through headphones, which is reasonable quality. Budapest takes on a special atmosphere in the evenings and this was a lovely and relaxing way to enjoy the view of the stunningly lit buildings and bridges.

Nice experience, disappointing food. Enjoyed the time on the cruise, the views are great and the atmosphere was nice. The only downside was the food, we opted for the A La Carte dinner package and it wasn't all that !

A must when in Budapest!. We booked this for the last night of our five day stay in Budapest, and were so glad we did.The boat was a little sterile, but in order to give diners the best views it has to be. There were no candles although it was advertised a a candle lit dinner cruise.We chose to take the A La Carte menu package and so chose our menu on board. The food was absolutely devine, and far too much of it! It beat all of us.Prices were very reasonable with three courses, bottle of wine and coffee working out about £30 per head.The boat cruises backwards and forwards between the main sites so you do get to see the same things a few times.Definitely a must when in Budapest.

A wonderful experience we will never forget.. We went on the cruise in the evening of valentine day...with our three children (to our great amusement but hey were do all the young couples think that love is going to lead and don't panic they are old enough to sit and enjoy the views and did not spoil it for others)Anyway, it was AMAZING the views are stunning and will stay with us for life. The audio is excellent and very informative. The drinks are lovely and the staff are friendly and efficient...What more could you ask for. If you have the opportunity it is a must. I was a little worried about walking to the pier but it is a well lit journey and not far at all from Elizabeth tier.

Excellent candlelit dinner cruise. We were lucky to book this on our first night in Budapest as it was a fantastic way to see the Danube and the amazing riverside attractions - Buda Castle and Gellert Hill, Parliament and all the other bridges and sights. To do all this with a candlelit table on the totally enclosed top-deck and choice from an a la carte menu all for just 16300HUF (< £50) each just topped it all. Excellent way to see and enjoy the Danube and Budapest.

Legenda Candlelit Dinner Cruise. We chose this cruise based upon our itinerary and we were not disappointed. Leaving from Pier 7 this was a short walk from our hotel. The Glass boat affords all aboard an excellent view of each bank of the Danube. Which is stunning backdrop to enjoy the cruise. The Food was good, offering us a good choice. It was presented well and the crew were very and attentive.I would recommend those visiting Budapest to take advantage of an evening cruise on the Danube taking in all of the sites lit up.Budapest is a great place to visit..

Beautiful, romantic and relaxing with a bit of live music thrown in. Went here for Valentine's night and we were not disappointed. Easy to book online. Remember to swap your printed voucher for a ticket at the ticket office (just at the side of the main entrance). Tables nicely spaced out, nice welcome drink, good food and wine, soothing music while you sail past the beautifully lit scenery. Parliament building is stunning! All in all, well worth it.

Excellent meal and ambiance. Just back from the Legenda dinner cruise and both my partner and I were blown away by the experience. We opted for the four course package, and the food was stupendous. He had the duck breast main and I had the veal, we both had the pumpkin soup course and my brownie pudding was apparently a bit nicer than his panna cotta pud. Two and half hours with a man and woman singing and playing a keyboard, nice and in the background. Staff warm and well trained, drinks above the inclusive welcome drink were well priced (£11 for a bottle of sparkling wine). I recommend booking early as we understood the earlier bookings, such as our own, got the window tables, although you were never more than two tables from the window, and there is a small outside viewing deck for after dinner. The buildings were gorgeous all lit up, of course. This is a lovely way to see this fabulous city without the usual super-tourist commentary. Highly recommended!
