Delicious Food. The lack of organisation was annoying when embarking. The eticket was not in fact the ticket to board, so after getting to the top of the queue we were told we had to go back to the ticket office to exchange our eticket for another ticket. Most confusing as the eticket stated we had to show this to get on board.Anyway, once we got seated and had our glass of bubbly all this seemed a distant memory.The food and wine was fantastic and very reasonably priced. The restaurant was probably a bit too brightly lit and though marketed as a 'candlelight' cruise - there were no candles! The boat itself was nice but fairly basic - nothing like the same cruise in NYC and (especially) Paris, but not as basic as the Prague version.Budapest stunning at night from the river, but we went back and forwards a few times rather than carry on further down the river. Perhaps it was not so scenic, but it would have been good to see it anyway.The entertainment was basic but very good. A quartet singing and playing classic folk-type pop music, like Dylan etc. Not in national costume or cheesy at all, as I had expected.All in all a good well-priced evening with fantastic food, good service (once on board), and beautiful floodlit landmarks along the way. We stayed at the Marriott (see review) and the embarkation point was directly in front of the hotel.
Fun way to get acquainted with the city. We enjoyed the boat ride...there was an informative video as we cruised around. Lovely to see at night with the lights. A complimentary drink included.

Good cruise. Took the river tour with dinner. Lovely to see all the buildings lit up. Would have liked some commentary to point out the attractions but pleasant evening. Food as in all of Hungary not wonderful but edible. One tip - beware taxis that meet this tour. We were ripped off for the first time in Hungary.

Magical. A wonderful winter cruise on the beautiful Danube highlighted by twinkling lights, stunning panorama of myriad beautiful buildings and a great a la carte dinner too. The whole experience was fabulous and utterly romantic. So glad we booked in advance...

Great Overview of Budapest. We took the river cruise without dinner. Although the dinner boat may be worth doing, our crew thought the 1 hour (approximately) trip was quite enough time to spend on the boat and experience the river up close. Plenty of picture-taking opportunities and we got some great shots. Also, a video plays (with headphones) during the trip which provides some great information about the city and some of the major buildings and attractions. The pricing isn't a great value, but is worth the experience. The staff seemed organized and friendly.

Wonderful Candlelit dinner. The river has got to be one of the best ways of sampling Budapest and more so at night with most of the famous buildings illuminated. The boat slowed right down as you passed all of the beautifully lit buildings for those keen on photography or just to enjoy the view. My wife and I chose the a la carte 4 course dinner and were certainly not disappointed with a high class and beautifully presented 4 course meal. (The veal was to die for!) Welcome drink and then pay for your drinks with a very reasonably priced wine selection. Staff were excellent, attentive and polite and this was two and a half hours along the Danube that we will remember fondly. The evening that we went there was a splendid boy / girl duo playing (guitar) and singing which added that final touch- and certainly not obtrusive. Would certainly recommend this trip and will definitely do it again.

A wonderful way to spend an evening in Budapest!. My husband and I chose to go on the A la carte candlelit dinner cruise last night, and both of us agree it was one of the best things we've done on this wonderful trip to Budapest. As we had eaten a large meal the previous evening, we did not feel like booking for the four course menu, and were perfectly happy to choose from the menu provided. We decided to share one of the starters, which the chef kindly agreed to put onto two plates for us (not just a spare fork like some others would give you), and a main course each, plus a bottle of wine. We like to eat out, and have to say that the food we had on board was excellent and beautifully presented.The waitresses/hostesses were very pleasant and helpful, and the lone musician who played a saxophone as well as singing made the evening even more enjoyable. But I have to say, the best bit of all was to see Budapest sparkling on the river banks...very spectacular. Our two and a half hours on board just disappeared!Thanks to all at Legenda...we won't forget our cruise on the Danube!

Ambivalent. The sights are great. Worth doing two laps, although it could have been interesting to see more of the Danube. Food good, but there are many so many excellent restaurants in Budapest. I believe both the musicians and the waiters were well trained, but neither got to shine. The musicians insisted on swallowing consonants and rythm on Dixie classics while the waiters were very delayed and distracted dispite few guests. So overall, I dunno, might prefer to separate sightseeing and dinner, but then again there was potential for a great combo.

Lovely evening. Decided to book the day before as we wanted to do something different on my birthday. We booked the trip only + went 'a la carte, pay as you order' It was a great evening, a lovely cruise, fabulous sights and the food was excellent! Recommended!

Wonderful food and spectacular views!. I'm normally not a big fan of the dinner cruises but should I return to one it would be the one of Legenda. The dinner was surprisingly good and the view is spectacular when sailing around the river of Donau, the lights of the eluminated buildings and bridges passing by.I was simply amazed and is good for private functions or for a romantic dinner.

The best time to cruise.... This was a very pleasant way to see the lights and hi-lights of Budapest. The boat was enclosed, but offered outdoor seating on the roof.....for even better views. As the temperature was tolerable, I chose the outdoor venue and really enjoyed my one hour tour. The head-set gave excellent descriptions of the sites and the wine, which was included, had a warming affect.A very nice way to spend an evening...

Great views of the city. We chose to go on the Duna Bella daytime cruise, which was 1 hour 10 mins tour! They narrate the tour via headset in 30 launguages, and I found it to be really interesting! They make it easy to know which side of the river to look during narration, as a man talks about Buda and a woman about Pest. You get a free alcoholic drink (I had champagne yum) and also a second drink of lemonade. All in all a great trip!

Night cruise on the Danube. We did an evening cruise 7:00 from dock 7 (close to the Intercontinental Hotel) and was easy to find. We chose this time to see the lights in the dark. This was not a dinner trip. The enclosed boat was warm and comfortable. Each seat had a head set with multi-lingual commentary to match the video that played paralleling the trip. The lights were excellent and this was a very successful evening. The glass of bubbly was a nice touch. The boat was not full but some people did not get on the trip they wanted so, I suggest that you pre-buy tickets. We were able to get our tickets at our hotel.

Danube legend cruise-very pleasant in October. Booked on the Danube legend 1 hr night cruise. Booked at last minute online with credit card approx 20 euro/ head including 1 drink. The view was lovely at night. In October it was not very busy so we spent some time inside and some time outside. The boat provided blankets for use outside. The 1830 cruise was very good as it allowed us to go to a restaurant afterwards. I booked with this company primarily because it was easy to do online.. I cannot comment on the other companies. But given my experience at this time of year I would recommend them.

A good introduction to the city. We took our tour on our third day in Budapest but wish we'd done it on arrival. It's a great way to orient yourself in the city and and pick things as you pass by that you want to explore further on your trip. I really enjoyed that the audio tour was broadcast over headphones, and so optional, rather than on the PA system in rotating languages. The tour took about an hour and a half and came with a complimentary glass of fizzy. Recommended.

Your experience may depend on how crowded the boat is.. We chose the 19.30 Danube cruise without food. The boat was completely full by the time it left (late) and included at least one party of schoolchildren and several families with very young babies. Sitting there listening to one of the crew members attempting to make an announcement, while babies screamed and the general chatter drowned out her voice, felt more like sitting in a hospital waiting room than going on a cruise down the Danube.I do realise that babies cannot help crying and that it is unfair to hold Legend responsible for the noise, but there were other issues.Worst of all, in my opinion, is the commentary. It is cheesy and stale and entirely unrelated to what you're looking at through the window, so if you intend to give it your full attention you will be spending the entire cruise looking up at a tv screen. You might as well be anywhere, instead of on a boat on the Danube. Why not employ live guides, with personality, offering shorter but more relevant commentaries on things you are actually sailing past? I gave up listening to the commentary, and after a while I gave up attempting to look out of the window too, because if you are seated in an inner seat it's a bit like being on a bus, looking past other people's heads through slightly fogged windows. The entire boat is enclosed, so no chance of any fresh air, and if it's crowded you are confined to your seat for the whole trip.The boat doesn't take you very far either - I didn't see anything that I hadn't already seen just walking along the banks of the Danube.No doubt it is an entirely different experience if everything falls into place but I wanted to let people know that sometimes it's going to be crowded, noisy and touristy-stale.

Must do but not enthralling. Our trip to Budapest included this trip on the Danube. The weather was fine and we sat on the top deck had had some good views of Budapest and the commentary was interesting. We stopped and walked round Margaret Island which was a nice interlude and waited for the next boat to take us back I think they run just over the hour so the walk times well. Great for a sunny day not sure it would be that good if its dull and raining.

Budapest by night. My husband and I had just arrived in Budapest with a tour group, and we all decided to get tickets for the 7:30 cruise on the Legenda. The ticket purchasing and boarding were efficient, and we had our choice of seating inside (glass enclosed with great views-2 levels) or out on the deck. The seats were comfortable, and we were given earphones to listen to a video we watched, showing us the sights and a history of the area, as we were actually seeing it outside. The lights had come on on the bridges and buildings, which made for a magnificent sight. I definitely recommend taking this cruise at night! We elected not to take the dinner cruise, but we were served our choice of a glass of wine, champagne, or beer during the cruise.

Most beautiful way to see Budapest. If you have a short stay in Budapest, this is the most beautiful and best way to see it. If you are there for a couple of days, this is an absolute must. Most beautiful evening cruise ever.j

This is why I went to Budapest. Aah! The night view of Budapest from the River Danube! The Parliament Building. The Chain Bridge. The castle up on the hill. All the beautiful buildings and structures - all lit up for us to see. What a marvelous sight! The best way to see them all is on a cruise ride. Legenda does a nice job - with a video about Budapest and its famous people and sights. The champagne is not bad, either. Well worth it!

Outstanding!. We went mid July 2013 and weren't sure what to expect but wanted to do an evening dinner cruise on the Danube. The dinner and evening cruise exceeded our expectations. The food was very good and the night time scenery was absolutely magnificent! It was the highlight of our stay in Budapest! We definitely would recommend this cruise company which is located on the River behind the Marriott.

Night boat ride is a must!. We took the night boat ride to see the illumination of Budapest! Well the view alone is worth it what a city at night! This boat is more expensive then the others, but I think it worth it. The other boats looked packed you couldn't even move. The tour is an hour which is plenty to see the city and have your complimentary drink. This boat ride was superior to ones I've taken in other city's.

Amazing!. We booked evening cruise so it was dark when we left from the dock. Nigtly Budapest is just so different. It's amazing. Price was very cheap if you compare to sights. When you see Budapest in night lights your eyes opens, it's beatifull.
An interesting boat trip. Possibly more expensive than some trips but we enjoyed the experience, especially on such a hot day, and the boat looked newer and safer than some I saw.

Spectacular!. Our evening cruise at 21:00 was spectacular with all the buildings and bridges lit up! The commentary was OK. But the view was magnificent! This evening cruise is a must if you're visiting Budapest. Arrive at least minutes early for beat seat selection.

A must. We booked the evening cruise at 8:15, what a magnificent way to see the beauty of Budapest on the Danube.The commentary along the cruise explaining the various buildings and the history is very good, watching the sunset and the lighting up of the buildings along the the way is beautiful and the glass of bubbly an added bonus. For us it was the best way to end our holiday.

Spectacular. To be short: don't miss this if visiting Budapest. Not because of the drinks: of course they are not using the most expensive wines or beers. Not because of the text: it's interesting but honestly, could anyone remember couple of hours later who was the first king of Hungary? But the view! Just go and book it. For sure after 8pm. Brilliant!

memorable cruise. We had an hour-long cruise at 21.00.Budapest has to be experienced on a cruise the Danube, specifically at night illuminated bridges and buildings at the time. This is despite the Legend on a cruise. The ship was guided in several languages. The only minus was the offered drink, they did`nt taste good. But the most important thing was the view and I would recommend this cruise for all ages.

Relaxing and interesting. We took the basic afternoon cruise on our last day in Budapest which lasted just over an hour. You can get a cruise with time on Margaret Island included but we had already walked to/around the island so didn't bother with this.The Legenda is a bit more expensive than some but for the price (3500 HUF pp) you get a drink (i had 'champagne') on the way down river and a glass of lemonade on the way back.The audio is also very good and informative with a wide range of languages.We also got a free coffee which we could have had before the cruise or after.

Great way to see Budapest. We took the basic tour during the day, and found it very interesting. The audio guide is done quite cleverly, with a female voice when talking about Pest and a male voice for Buda. We also received a beverage and a lemonade as part of the tour. Very good for approx €22 for 2 people.

Take the evening cruise to see the lights go on in Budapest. We took the 9PM cruise in July - from dusk to dark. (We did not take the dinner cruise.) It was a magnificent experience seeing all of the monuments and bridges light up as we were on the water. We sat upstairs; the seating was comfortable and the English commentary was good. There was a video screen also giving close up views of the areas that were discussed on the audio. Very relaxing and pleasant - an excellent introduction to Budapest. Take the cruise on the night that you arrive if you can!

Very nice dinner cruise at sunset in Budapest. Best cruise in Budapest? We went in the evening and had a lovely sunset over Buda. Lovely when the captain opened up for a while and we got to enjoy the river breeze. The wait staff was great and the food was very well cooked. Nice music entertainment. Two and a half hours of the best experience on the Danube and the city lights of Budapest`s waterfront and Chain Bridge.Full tours every night must mean that the cruise is popular. Expensive, yes, but well worth the price, it is my opinion.

Short but sweet - a great way to see the Danube. I really enjoyed the Legenda tour. The guided audio was truly interesting and went at a great pace. The 2 drink options (wine/beer/champagne followed by lemonade) was a really nice touch. It was a bit on the warm side, but they did try to help out with fans on the boat. They have student discounts available too. I highly suggest it!

Excellent dinner cruise. The dinner cruise offered by "LEGENDA" is just perfect, they are very accurate with the time it is really 2 and half hours of trip and it started o´clock.I liked that they have individual tables for couples, so you don´t have to share or disturbing someone for stand up and take a picture. they have candles or flowers on the tables making it a romantic trip. It is elegant and beautiful. they have an adjustable roof, so you don´t have to worry about the weather. the live band music sing in different languages including Spanish and English in a really native way, i was actually surprise.The food is just wonderful, me and my girlfriend take and recommend the dinner package, it include the started, the soup, the main course and the dessert. believe me when i said that i pay the same for a boring restaurant and half of the quality and quantity of food. so i consider even cheap for the food, plus the boat trip, the music and something priceless... the enviroment

Great river cruise. Our hotel(Hilton) booked us day cruise. Pier 7 is on Pest side of town, little walk from centre.They have several ships, both day and night time. Service was good and guides spoke good English. On a boat you can choose about 30 different languages and they serve complimentary wine/beer/beverage as well. It was great that they stop in Margaret Island, so you can hop off and hop on over there. Budapest is best seen from the river, so don't forget that

Nicely done river sightseeing. Clean comfortable boat. Excellent narration compared with river cruises in most places. You pick your language and professionally recorded narration takes over. Complementary glass of champagne or wine included. Took the cruise that leaves just before sunset so we got a great view of Budapest's art nouveau architecture outbound and a beautiful view of the sites lit up for nighttime on the return.

excellent city cruise. Took the daytime cruise Duna Bella Plus which was an hour and ten minute cruise.There was an audio guide on board and we were offered a complementary drink of a choice of champagne,wine,beer,soft drinks or mineral water,there was also free WiFi on board.A pleasant cruise with a great explanation of the surrounding Buda and Pest as we went down the river Danube.We had a chance to stop at Margaret island for an hour and half which i am glad we did this is a beautiful island with a lot to see even though it is only small you can hire a bike for four or electric cars to go round the island.On the return on the cruise from Margaret island you are offered a glass of Duna Bella lemonade.Prices are 4500 HUF for an adult and 2250 HUF for children.Overall well worth a trip.

If you want to kill some time without walking. Based on Rick Steves book and other high recommendations, my wife and I took this boat for a night cruise. You are paying top dollar for Legenda versus the other boats down by the river. First the translation equipment did not work on the top deck .... after about 10 minutes they said they could not fix it and go below deck and find a seat and it should work down there..... it did. The other issue is that you can smell the boats exhaust/fuel while downstairs. So I guess if you want to kill some time without walking the boat ride may work, but I can't see how this can be so much better than the others.

great way to see Budapest at night. Comfortable and fun, with a cold beer to drink on the way. The lights on the buildings are absolutely beautiful... worth the money... and you get 20% off if you buy the Budapest card.

Memorable Dinner Cruise, even for Hungarians!!!. Last night my boyfriend and I had a wonderfull 'Candlelit Dinner Cruise' on boat Legenda. The service was excellent - at the entrance we were greated friendly, drinks and meals were served professionally. Special thanks to Saci and Patrícia, they both went out of their way to make our evening memorable. Meals were delicious, huge portion of main dish, tasty wines. In spite of living in Budapest since years, the nice ambience, life music during the evening and of course the beautiful view made us feel like tourists in our own city. The cruise showed us our home from a new point of view. Many thanks again to the Legenda team!Köszönjük a felejthetetlen estét, Ibolya és Péter

wow!. This is the nicest fleet of boats in Hungary, and I like to take the cruise at dusk. That way you get the sun going down and the total darkness when the lights come up. The Parliament building is the masterpiece, so bring your camera. They include a flat screen video presentation, hand held speakers in different languages, a glass of champagne, and an all glass surround bottom section. For the best trip, get there early and make your way to the back of the boat to climb up to the top level.

Fantastic value for money. We took the daytime cruise on the Duna Bella on our first day and it was a great introduction to this beautiful city. The cruise lasts approx. 1hr and 10 minutes and cost roughly £20.00 for two tickets. You also have the option to stop at Margaret Island and enjoy 1hr 30 mins free time, this is at a cost of 4500huf (roughly £13.00 each). The commentary supplied through the headphones is in a choice of 30 languages and gives you a quick history lesson about the various points of interest along the river. You receive a free drink before reaching Margaret Island, and you can choose from wine, beer, soft drinks or water. On the way back from Margaret Island you receive a lovely and refreshing glass of "Duna Bella lemonade". The staff are really pleasant and efficient. Excellent value for money and on my next visit would definitely use them again and select the evening cruise.

Nice way to see everything at night!. We had only a few days in Budapest, and this one hour night cruise was highly recommended by friends. I think it was well worth the time and money, after spending all day walking around we enjoyed the chance to sit and see the spectacular views as we cruised along with a nice seat and a cold beer. The narration was a bit cheesy, but we did learn a few things from it. The biggest thrill was just to see the magnificent views from the river Danube, lit up with the night sky behind. We took the 7:30 boat in April and were able to see the sun set and then get the night views as well. Highly recommended.

Lovely evening despite bad drinks. The trip makes for a lovely evening, but I don't know how they managed to make the Coke, Sprite and wine so bad. We enjoyed the breeze on the Danube and the scenery is beautiful.

One hour to spare in Budapest? Here is the perfect trip.... I only had one evening to spare, so I booked the one hour evening cruise on the Danube. Commentary is in many languages and was okay, but the trip itself with the ability to walk around the boat and take pictures of the wonderful architecture was perfect.

Danube Legend River Boat Cruise in Budapest. My aunt, three cousins, and I took a Legenda night cruise in Budapest on the Danube Legend, and we enjoyed the trip very much. We cruised on a Tuesday evening at the beginning of March, and the boat was practically deserted! Although it was quite brisk outside, the boat was warm and cozy inside, as it is an enclosed boat. The staff spoke English very well, and they were friendly and quite pleasant. The trip lasted for approximately one hour.It was fantastic to see the fantastic landmarks of Budapest at night. In addition, headphones were provided so we could listen to a wonderful commentary and watch a video on a TV screen about the sights we were passing. We were also offered a complimentary glass of champagne, wine, beer, soft drink, or mineral water during the cruise. The champagne was special treat! The cruise cost 5500 forints for each person, which came to about $24.00 US/Canadian. I thought this was a bit pricey compared to the deals we were used to finding in Budapest, but it was well worth the money. You can use Master Card and Visa to pay for your ticket at the booth.I would highly recommend this night cruise. Afterwards, I would suggest strolling along the Danube to see all of the sights again from the shoreline.

Lovely evening!. This was one of the highlights of our Budapest visit. We took the one hour evening cruise on Legenda which included a free drink. The night we cruised there was a firework display which was a surprise and quite entertaining. It was very relaxing and it was a wonderful way to get beautiful photos of the Castle, Parliament, Fisherman's Bastion, Gellert Hill, etc. at night. Just spectacular and all in an hour!

Candlelite Dinner Cruise.. On the last night of our holiday we booked a candlelit dinner cruise on the Danube. We chose the exclusive package about £46 per person to include a welcome drink, four course a la carte meal, this was better value than the cruise and a la carte meal (pay as you go ) about £23 per person.For our main course we choise fillet of beef and duck breast both cooked to perfection. A cruise on the Danube is a must for any tourist, i would recommend the night cruise as the water front and buildings are illuminated.A really wonderful way to finish our holiday.

Dinner cruise on the Danube. My wife and I had only one night in Budapest so we decided to make the most of it and splurge for the Legenda Dinner Cruise. It was definitely not cheap (around 31000 HUF, or nearly $150 USD), but was worth it for what is most likely a once-in-a-lifetime trip for us.We arrived early after wandering the streets of Budapest, hoping the boat would be open for seating. Luckily for us it was. We were told when making our reservation that sitting by the window was not possible, but there was a large group of people sitting directly across from us, so their seating arrangements made it so we had a table for two right next to the window. The one drink included in the price is a choice of two house wines, juice, Pepsi, etc. if you want another type of wine or refills, you have to pay extra. There is a selection of food that is suitable for nearly every palate. I had a scallop as the first course, followed by pumpkin cream soup, roasted pork tenderloin and panna cotta for dessert. My wife had a shrimp starter, pumpkin soup, duck breast and sponge pudding. Everything we ordered was outstanding, and the servers are simply amazing and work very hard to keep up with the demands of such a large group.After having several drinks, several older couples got up and danced to the live music to everyone's entertainment. Also, the views of Budapest from the river at night are breathtaking. The only drawbacks are the staff has no way of controlling unruly children who ran amok between tables while their parents watched, seemingly amused by their children's bad dinner behavior. Also, the boat is not heated very well, if at all. After a while, the body heat of the approximately 50 people on board fogs up the windows and obscures the otherwise romantic views.

Candlelit Dinner Cruise. I choose this dinner cruise based on the good impression that I got from the positive reviews here. I was surely not disappointed and my opinion is that Legenda deserves the money they are asking for it.I have experienced the same kind of program in Paris and my opinion is that this one is much better!The boat is very comfortable and replicates a modern and stylish dinning room, with a bar counter in the rear end.Glass roof and windows allow you to have ravishing views of Budapest.Of course the food is not “gourmet style” but, considering the circumstances, I must say that it was fine! Everything is cooked aboard, you are nicely served at your place (no buffet stuff…) and the wine list is varied enough and not too much overpriced.A free welcome drink was offered at our table.I know that some reviews point that the music is not typically Hungarian, which is true, but it was a very smooth and nice ambience music.Overall I definitely recommend this experience if you are for the first time in Budapest!

Dinner cruise on the Danube. This was a good take for tired feet at the end of a day of touring.The dinner was elegant, delicious with a flare of presentation. The music was tasteful and calming. The sites along the Danube are romantically lite like Paris and there are open windows and outdoor patios to catch the breeze plus even the ceiling of the dining room is glass to catch the views.

Perfect for Groups. We had a group of about 30 people and had the candlelit dinner cruise. First, its perfect for a group because we could easily organize the payment, there was a nice variety of menu items, and the tables were for 8 people each. Second, the food was much better than I expected from a dinner cruise. The all inclusive price includes a starter, soup, entree and desert. My starter, the cold goose liver, was excellent. The pumpkin soup was even better. Then, to my pleasant surprise, the duck breast was delicious - perfectly cooked with none of the fattiness you get sometimes with duck. The red wine & sour cherry sauce was a delight. The meal comes with a glass of house wine, which was very good for a house wine. The music was nothing special, but it also wasn't too loud so it was easy to have dinner conversation. We didn't listen to the cruise audio and the constant circling did start to get tedious. But, it was really nice to see the city and the major attractions all lit up and the boat was cozy warm despite frigid temperatures that night. I highly recommend this if you have groups that want to have a special dinner together.

Not bad. It really isn't bad, but it isn't 'personal' as the boat is big, full (a testament to the popularity of the trip) and what I see as the drawback is that the audio is pre-recorded so what I refer to a impersonal is the fact that you cannot ask a guide a question. All that said, the 1 hour evening tour is good value, the boat was warm and the service was good with a cold beer, included within the cost, served at your seat. Not bad by any standards, just cold be better IMHO.
Legenda: Rick Steve's discount. If you show Rick Steve's book when purchasing the tickets to the boat, you will be provided with additional discount.

Great way to see Budapest on a cold winter evening. We did this on the Friday evening, the cruise was packed and great fun. In the winter it leaves at 6.30pm and it's magical to see Budapest lit up of an evening. You can listen to the description in over 30 languages, so literally any nationality can enjoy the cruise.I have to say that I found the voice over and description pretty boring, I feel they could have done a little more with the content. That said the view is spectacular, there is a free drink offered onboard from a glass of champagne, beer, wine or soft drink which enhances this pleasant trip.This trip works out to about £15 each, it's a great way to start an evening and then head off for a nice meal after.

Great experience at sunset. We took the boat trip at the sunset and it was an amazing experience. The buildings at the riverside are so well illuminated, the view is great. You will have a 360 degrees view and there are some videos playing telling the history of the buildings or monuments you are seeing.They offer a glass of wine or champagne.This is definitely a must do in Budapest.

Saw nothing wrong with it and everything beautiful on it!. My fiance and I did this last night- on a cold but clear Oct evening- and loved every second of it. Boats were great- enclosed but with an option for a chilly moment or two on the top deck- as was the staff. The music was cheesy and the wine list sparse but the food was plentiful. All in all just what you would hope for/expect from a touristy experience. Some tips- seating is already allocated so don't both being pushy- even if you get a seat in the middle (they split us up into 2 boats so no one did) the view is still great. No need to arrive too early. No need for the 4 course option unless you are planning on being very hungry. If you get a waitress named Melinda, tip her well. She is heaps of fun. It was a highlight for us.

Look for an alternative - mediocre and overrated. My husband and I just returned from an amazing 7-day visit to Budapest. As one of the most recommended things to do, we took a 2-hour afternoon cruise on the Danube.The Legenda appears to be the most touted cruise line for such excursions so we didn't bother to investigate alternatives. Perhaps the employees take for granted their name recognition and do not care about the quality of service? Not once did we hear from the ship's captain - no 'welcome aboard' or 'thank you for joining us'. Moreover, while the taped commentary is clever (the male voice represents Buda; the female is Pest) it is not synchronized with what passengers are actually seeing. Much of the time we saw landmarks that were belatedly addressed in the commentary after we'd passed those sites. By choosing the 2-hour tour, after an hour on the river, we were taken to Margaret Island by Anna, the Legenda guide who traveled with us on the boat. It is telling to note that she never introduced herself - I had to ask her name at tour's end. Unfortunately, this was a frustrating portion of the tour. Immediately upon arriving on the island, Anna met up with a girlfriend (presumably another Legenda employee because she was dressed in the company uniform) and appeared far more interested in socializing than leading an informative tour.She asked what the participants wanted to see (only 4 of us chose to explore the island with her) and I suggested the Alfréd Hajós Swimming Pool mentioned during in the commentary. Mr. Hajós, Hungary's first Olympic medalist, designed the complex that opened in 1930 and in 2006 it was the site of the European Swimming Championship.Anna quickly replied that it was 'too far' but that my husband and I were more than welcome to walk to it. Clearly, she did not want to accompany us but would have been more than happy to see us wonder off on our own - which we did not.We chose to stay with her - frustrating because she and her friend walked ahead of us chatting and apparently 'forgetting' there were tour participants who were depending upon her for an enjoyable hour walking tour. When we walked past several concrete busts of presumably famous Hungarians, I asked who they were. She curtly replied 'they are writers' and kept on walking, again clearly disinterested and in a hurry. She may have sensed my disdain because shortly thereafter, she stopped and provided us with a short, perfunctory synopsis.Thirty minutes later, Anna told us we were on our own for the duration and to be back at the dock 15 minutes later to catch the return boat for the short ride back to the dock. Again, indicative of a disinterested guide. And once we arrived back at the dock, there were no words from the captain.In short, this was a mediocre tour done is an uncaring manner so if you can find an alternative, I strongly recommend that you do so. While cruising down the Danube is a must, doing so with this company is a must-not if you can find an option.

Loved the evening sightseeing tour!. The 1-hour evening sightseeing tour was a great way to end our trip to Budapest. The city is just beautiful at night, and it was a perfect way to get a big picture view of the sites we had visited earlier in the day. Seeing Parliament at night was worthwhile on its own. The audio guide was surprisingly great too as it provided just enough information to make the most of the trip without inundating you with details. I would definitely recommend the evening cruise!

OK boat excursion on the Danube. Legenda offers several boat excursions on the Danube. We did a mid-afternoon ride, which displayed both sides of the river for a mile downstream and a few miles upstream. It was an OK experience, but certainly not a must-do.
Fantastic rivertrip. We took an evening trip and it was just beautiful to see the city from a different point of view. Besides, it was very informative, too.

nice way to get to know more about Budapest. They offer several types of tours, but I took one with drinks included (which was ok for the daytime) and with guided walking tour in Margaret Island.I really enjoyed my time, information was interesting, views unforgetable and staff very friendly. I loved the walking tour, I had very nice, friendly guide (unfortunately, I forget her name) with whom time passed very fast talking about history and present.

Nice program not just for tourists!. We have taken the evening tour which started at 8:15 pm. My advice is to get there at least 20 minutes before the departure time, as it is quite popular evening entertainment. You will get many useful informations about Hungary and Budapest via headphones on 30 languages. Free WiFi on board and friendly staff will welcome you.My only negative experience was regarding their problem solving regarding my reservation - but wasn't disapponted at the end. Plus the drinks arrived pretty late, after we were over the first half of the tour.

I know a lot more about Budapest because of this tour!. We got the boat tour up and down the Danube in July 2012. Very informative and exciting. Free wifi is always a bonus on these types of tour. The tour guide knew everything and was always open for questioning. Never had a better boat cruise, top notch! Not the most expensive either which is always good for someone budgeting their travels.

Very good evening cruise. Legenda offers several types of cruises some with dinners and others with just a drink. Being vegetarians and not finding any suitable evening meal for us, we chose the free drink cruise. Their pier is at #17 and from Hotel Regnum it takes a couple of short tram trips. We got there early and waited for about 45 minutes. Be warned that the temperature does drop quite a bit often (in May) and it is a good idea to have a jacket. The cruise cost us around $25 per person and takes better than two hours.Our cruise left around 8 p.m. The drinks were nothing to brag about. Our seats were comfortable and the translation headphones worked just fine. Just as the tour starts two young ladies welcome you in several languages. They alternated with the languages and it was funny to see them forget their lines many times! But the tour was wonderful. The boat first travelled along the Buda side and then along the Pest side. With gentle nightfall and all buildings nicely lit it was an evening well spent. It also gave us an opportunity to note the places we would like to come back during the daytime and see in greater detail. Overall it was a very good cruise we would recommend it highly.

Great Dinner Cruise. This is THE way to see the City. Great unique boat allowing you to get a panoramic view of the city. The dinner (we did the a la cart) was great, reasonably priced wine selection, and very pleasant service.Yes, it costs more than the others, but is in a class on it's own. Our visiting friends just loved it.

How to spoil a nice evening. Following our guide recommendation we embarked for the Budapest evening cruise on one of their boat. The welcome was good, but rapidly we discovered that the translation equipment was not working at all on our 5 seats!!. We asked to get it fixed but this was impossible. We were asked to go on the bottom deck In the middle of the boat where the view was limited and the air pretty warmed: We decided to stay at our seat and just look at the beautiful views with no comments. We were given CD's to watch and listen the comments at home?. Their equipment are pretty old and they do not have anything to fix quickly. Our advice is that: Better you look for a better organized tour!

Excellent!. We did the one hour sightseeing tour on the Danube. It was a hot day and this was a relaxing way to spend an hour. We were able to get out of the sun and enjoy the breeze on the river. The boats are nice with good seats and plenty of space so you are not crammed in. The headphones are comfortable and you can actually hear and understand the commentary. The commentary provided good information on sights on both sides of the river. They provided one beverage on the way to Margaret island (water, soft drinks, beer or wine) and then on the way back they provided their "lemonade", which was basically sprite with lemon, but very refreshing. Both drinks hit the spot on a hot day. We were able to see more Budapest sights than we had just walking around. Would highly recommend their sightseeing cruise!

Great Danube River Trip. Selected the dinner trip, 2.5 hours with good quality food (best we had in Budapest) and no commentary (live music, but no dancing instead). Good company to book with, they helped us through the booking procedure and wer accommodating to a guest who was late arriving (they wnet back for him!).The view of the buildings overlooking the Danube is fabulous. Lit up at night it is easy to see why this is a heritage site. It beats my experience of a Seine Dinner Cruise hands down. If you have the money (£40/head with wine, 3 course dinner and cruise) do this.

a pleasant and educational little trip. We took a one-hour cruise mid-day on our next to last day in Budapest. It was so nice relaxing on the upper deck, sipping mimosas and lemonades, while listening to the story of Buda and Pest. A thoroughly relaxing and enjoyable respite from our days spent walking all over the cobblestones! The staff were very pleasant and polite. I recommend this trip to all!!

Generally, a good trip. We enjoyed our night cruise with legenda, one hour. It was more expensive then other cruises but a nice boat, good commentary and staff spoke several languages. However, getting on the boat was chaotic - I wished the girls running it would have offered priority for those who had waited the longest - and afterwards, we waited over 20 minutes until we could get an attendant to ring for a cab, as she was so busy - surely they could have two people selling tickets! Overall a good product though, would recommend.

You must see Budapest from the Danube. Arriving in Budapest jetlagged, my son and I decided that the best thing we could do that wouldn't take too much effort was a sightseeing cruise on the Danube. The Legenda line was recommended so we got down to Dock 7 and went on the cruise. This is a wonderful way to see Budapest as it is truly beautiful from the water. The crew on the boat were very helpful coming around to serve drinks and making sure our headset was set on the right language. We didn't get off at Margaret Island but took the cruise that went around the island.We actually enjoyed the cruise so much that we went back at night to see Budapest lit up. Both cruises offered wonderful photo ops and very good commentary with a lot of information. We were surprised that the commentary was different for each cruise we took. I would recommend taking this cruise for terrific views of both Buda and Pest.

Great way to spend a night with the one you love.. Took the Candlenight Dinner Cruise on the Danube River. Went for the Exclusive meal option which got you 4 course meal and a drink while circling around the river for 2 1/2 hours. Walked around the the top deck and got some great photos of the bridges and historical buildings. food was great. cold citrus soup, incredible, steak done to your liking, dessert ( brownie thing was TDF! ). The waitress and I had a slight misunderstanding but she quickly resolved the issue with great tact and we left as extremely satisfied customers. Rember to tip your servers because it is not included in the price of your ticket. (And it appeared everybody got top service like we did). Last words, definitely worth it!

Great way to spend the day!. Took the 11am trip and the 2 hour option with Margaret Island tour. Impressed that staff knew many languages and took turns to advise passengers of trip before setting off. Individual headsets with many commentary languages was easy to use. Complimentary drinks were prompt and as promoted. Top tip for Margaret Island is to hire a golf cart type car as you can cover the whole island or for those who want the guided tour the guide will show you the key sights. Well worth the visit!

A lot pricier than the other boats near there, but it was professional, not a rip-off. Cost for 2 adults was 4300 HUF each because I wanted to tour Margaret Island for an hour. Kids under 10 are free. It was April 10, a warm sunny day, and we took the 11:00 boat. Initially, I was a bit disappointed that the seating was all inside, under glass, and the only outdoor seats were in the back (none on the top). So we sat in the front with the other 20 or so customers (not busy). Commentary on the headphones was informative and not boring, so we just enjoyed the ride to Margaret Island. From there, you can walk the island with one of the boat's guides, but I opted to do it alone (see my Margaret Island review). As we boarded the boat at 13:00, I couldn't help but think I just paid an extra 1000 HUF for a tour I didn't take. On the return trip, the boat was different, and this one you could ride on top (perfect). Sat up there and got the best pics of the Parliament building. On the ride to Margaret Island we got 3 .3L glasses of apple juice and I got a .3L glass of beer. On the ride back we got 4 smaller glasses of lemonadish stuff (tasty). Boats are an awesome way to get an overview of Budapest, but the price was a bit on the high side. 8600 HUF = 29 euro. Nice boats though, very clean, crew professional.
Really nice way to spend an hour or two.. The other reviews say it all. Two basic drinks and audio in 30 languages. Bring your own headphones if you don't want to use theirs.
Worth it. Two drinks included. 30 languages guide on board, incleding Russian

Nice cruise along the Danube. We took the 2 hour ride along the Danube to get a river view of Budapest. We didn’t need reservations and there were plenty of seats on the boat. The guided walk around Margaret Island was fairly enjoyable as well (a bit cold in March). The tour guides were pleasant and spoke English fluently. The price is reasonable and the boat was well maintained.

Legenda Cruise on the Danube worth every penny!. Rick Steves highly recommended the Legenda Cruise line for a cruise on the Danube in Budapest, so we gave it a try. The food was excellent and the views at night of Budapest were amazing. We even got a discount for mentioning that we heard about the cruise in the Rick Steves guide to central Europe. It was one of the highlights of our trip.

Huge dissapointment, horrible customer service and chaos on arrival. We called a few days ahaid (in Hungarian so there wouldn't be any misunderstanding) because we planned our boat trip on Januari 1st 2012 and wanted to be sure of the scedule. They told us that we didn't need a reservation and that there would be 2 boats that day: one at 2:30 p.m. and one at 6:30 p.m. We simply had to show up 10 minutes before departure to buy our tickets. We told the lady it was for 9 people and she said it wasn't a problem at all. So, we show up around 6:05 and there's a HUGE waiting line. No one to talk to exept the lady who sells tickets. There's chaos and lots of people in front us us are angry. Later we found out why. One of the Duna Legenda employees passes by and we ask him if we can still buy tickets without a reservation and he says of course, when one boat is full there is a second one. Finally it's our turn, we ask for tickets and the lady says no tickets only reserved tickets for the 6:30 tour. Needless to say that all 9 of us left pretty dissapointed and frustrated as everyone is leaving in the morning and there is no more opportunity to take the tour. Once we got home we checked the website and there the information was faulty as well.

Well Done - worth the time and money.. A boat ride is a must when you are in Budapest - at least once. We took the evening ride down the Danube as Budapest is beautifully lit at night - buildings, castles, bridges - all are gorgeous. Legenda does and excellent job with video screens at easily viewed points throughout the boat, showing the interiors of the buildings you are passing without obstructing the views. Headsets provide the audio describing the architecture and history in a multitude of languages - just select your language, adjust the volume, and you are ready to enjoy. Two drinks are included with the evening cruise - the first being champagne, the second is your choice. I read some complaints about the champagne in earlier reviews and although it is not high end, it's completely drinkable and smooth. It was lovely evening.

Lovely!. We booked a dinner cruise which we thoroughly enjoyed. The staff were really friendly and helpful. Food and a glass of champagne were included. Other drinks were extra but of a good standard, So often on these tourist attractions you are served sub-standard food and wine but both were very good. Great little live band, not traditional hungarian but very good. Lovely to see the city all lit up and night. Highly recommended!

Good value for money. We opted for the daytime cruise at 14:30 at a cost of 14 euros 2900 HUF each. Boat was very clean although very hot waiting for all the passengers, but should not complain about the good weather in November. Plenty of seats, pleasant and effecient staff, who brough two drinks to us during the trip.Good comenatary with information on both Buda and Pest over the supplied headsets as we passed the various landmarks.Trip lasted just over an hour, well recommended and good value for money.

Nice cruise up the river seeing the palace all lit up with a glass of wine!. I looked at several river cruises before going to Budapest and had been warned against going on the ones where you have dinner (as it's generally not supposed to be very good). We therefore chose this cruise for one hour in the evening (7.30pm) where you get a couple of (nice) drinks included.I found it all very professional, staff were smart and friendly, the sparlking wine was nice, and the cruise does it's job very well! It's worth doing a river cruise - especially at night as Budapest looks spectacular at night.

Nice River Trip. While it seems touristy, a trip through the City on the Danube is a fabulous experience. We took the evening cruise and thoroughly enjoyed it. OUr only complaint was that this is not a cruise for toddlers and those who were on our boat almost ruined it for us. Picture...lovely river, beautiful buildings, moonlit evening, champaign, cuddling with your honey...SCREAMING TWO YEAR OLDS RUNNING DOWN THE AISLES. Honestly Legenda, can't you have an "adults only" cruise especially after 7:00?

A Great Way To See The City. I have done river cruises in a few cities and this one is right up there for interest and originality.We didn't bother with the one hour Margaret Island excursion. All I can say is that my wife and I spent a good deal more than one hour wandering around the island on another day. A great way to get away from the bustle of the city

Good value trip and pleasant experience. We went on a daytime cruise which was one hour 15 mins, but didn't include the island. Cost 2900Ft which is about £9 in UK money. Tour included 2 drinks brought to your seat by the staff, and included a commentary in chosen language which was a little different from the norm, telling a story rather than a monotone "Look at this - look at that" style. No problem with headsets, boat was clean and very quiet.

A great finish to our holiday, though more down to the Danube than Legenda. BOAT - Danube LegendDeparture - 2015Package - Drinks only, no foodTime - 1 1/2 hrsWhat a way to finish our Honeymoon!! A boat trip on the Danube...I have to say that this was a fantastic trip out and I would recommend it to anyone coming to Budapest. We departed at 2015 and this seems like the perfect time in July. For the first half of the trip the sun was going down, and at about 2100 the city is transformed as the lights come on.I have truely never seen such a transformation, The lighting on the bridges and buildings has been designed to best show off the city, and WOW!! We took nearly a quarter of all the photos from our 4 day holiday in just 3/4 of an hour! We had not been this far out at this time of night on our trip, choosing to stay closer to our hotel for meals, drinks etc. I could not be more happy we choose to do this, as it was truelyy a brilliant end to our holiday.HOWEVER....If we did it again I'm not sure we would choose to go with Legenda. I have nothing to compare it against, so I don't know if this is representative of the standard in Budapest.From the very start of the trip we did not feel welcome. We turned up, and there was obviously a big tour who were going out on the same trip. Most of them were sat down, so we joined the queue to board the boat. When we got to the front we were very abruptdly told to wait to one side. The tour group were all then allowed to board in front of us. I am assuming we all paid the same price, so I don't understand why this happened.We then boarded the boat which smelt very strongly of diesel and were dissapointed to find it was completely enclosed by plastic, making decent photos a real problem. It was also very hot on a humid night and it would not have been a good experience to sit in here for the entire time. There were also no toilets on board, so could be a problem for some people.It was only when a couple of people across the boat from us started asking questions of the staff did we then realise there was an upstairs, which was uncovered. It was very small, only allowing two seat side by side with a walkway down the middle for the length of about 30 chairs. It would've by no means fitted everyone on. Initially only a small amount of us headed up here, and it was wonderful. No diesel smell, nice open air and perfect photos. I just don't know why we had to push to be allowed up here.The drinks came and were absolutely fine, a glass of sweet sparkling wine followed by choice of beer etc. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. And the commentary, while a little dramatic ("I am the king of such and such and it is 1874 etc") it was much better than sitting there silently.I am just very glad we were not in a full to capacity trip as I think the entire experience would've been very uncomfortable. If we also hadn't been able to get upstairs we would've been very upset as we would never have got the great photos I mentioned before, and would've been sat in the stuffy compartment the whole way.The trip was definately worth doing, I'm just not sure if Legenda were the company to do it with.....5* for the experience, but for the company which I am writing I can only give 3*

Huge rip off, pick another company. This trip was not bad, but also nothing special for the price considering the boat only makes a simple up and back figure 8 on the river, all of which you can see by foot without too much effort. A trip such as Legenda should cost max 10 Euros, which is in line with the boats in Amsterdam, but in Amsterdam you cover some real distance on the trip. Don't let the new looking Legenda boat fool you into paying twice as much, unless it is the drinks that attract you. I personally can go 1 hour w/out needing 2 things to drink. We wish we had taken the boat for which we had a buy one get one ticket from the travel info rack at th airport.

Beautiful at night. We purchased the Legenda family pass which included our cruise, our subway tickets, and discounts to various sights in Budapest. For our family of 4, this was the best deal going. Plus, Rick Steves readers get a discount on the pass or on the cruise alone, so take along your RS book for a savings.We used our legenda pass for the included evening cruise. We enjoyed the sights and buildings of Budapest lit up at night reflecting off the water of the Danube. We also enjoyed complimentary glasses of champagne, then the included second drink of choice. Great way to see Budapest at night. Would recommend it.

WORST TOURIST ATTRACTION EVER!!. Each new paragraph is a different issue:It was the worst thing about Budapest. I booked my ticket online, and i booked for the Margaret Island trip included in the boat trip, it wasn't until i got on the boat and read a pamphlet/map of danube (which i had to go searching the boat for because no one was going to give me one) that i saw the Margaret Island trip was going that day, i had paid extra for it and the staff told me it was my fault because on a page somewhere on the internet it stated that, yet when i went to pay they gave me the option to book it (scam)! Then we sat on the boat, which was glass roofed, it had been snowing and they hadnt cleaned the snow off the glass window so we could see a thing! Included in the ticket price was a cocktail when you go on the boat and then a choice of beer, wine or soft drink to follow. When they came round with the "cocktail" the boat had just started pulling out into the river, the drink wasnt a cocktail but a glass of hot tea, not alcoholic in the slightest, so complete false advertising there. As the vile tea was being given out (which was actually pretty cold) the commentary started. The Legenda pride themselves on the fact that their recorded tour guide speaks in 30 different languages. So we picked up our headphones attached to the little devices hooked on the back of seats, and felt ill, the headphones were FILTHY! They were the type you receive on planes but they had been used a million times over rather than being presented to you in a sealed polythene bag as they usually would be. Luckily i had my own headphones with me from my ipod but my partner had to use the mucky ones which we cleaned as best we could with anti-bacterial wet wipes. We plugged our headphones in and selected English but all we got was Hungarian, we tried every channel and still only heard the same Hungarian voices. A few Italian people opposite and in front of us were also looking around very confused, when we tried to ask the male and female members of staff they told us "IN A MINUTE!" and ignored us, about 15 minutes went by without us being able to hear anything in English, i was losing my patience and asked her again, she just told us to move to different seats, we did as we were told and then found that the ones we moved to had no sound coming out AT ALL! We moved again and finally got some English, but its not like we could see what we were looking at anyway as the windows were all snowy and steamy. Then came the drinks, my partner had a beer and I, a red wine, it was so bad it was completely undrinkable. One of the recorders then fell off the seat it was attached to and straight into the glass of beer, so in all we had had NO drinks whatsoever!!The glass roof was leaking in many places, and one was right next to me, all over my coat and the next chair!The toilet taps had no running water and the staff weren't exactly helpful!All good reviews should be completely ignored, this is the WORST TRIP EVER!!!

Great evening cruise in a smaller, modern boat. The Trip Advisor feedback on cruises was mixed to say the least and you can see why - there are loads of possible options - some that look like tourist hell, some that moved so fast you'd think they were racing. We got this as a recco from our hotel, and went for an evening cruise - no meal, just a couple of glasses of wine in the price.The boat is modern, has excellent viewing, and a good (if occassionally cheesey) commentary in 30 languages that you can choose to listen to or not through headphones. The key point is that to see Budapest at night from the river is a must.

The night cruise on the Danube is spectacular. I highly recommend taking the Legenda company evening cruise on the Danube. The one hour cruise travels in a figure 8 along the best of the illuminated attractions that Budapest's riverfront has to offer. There are fantastic views of the Parliament, Buda Castle, Chain Bridge and Vizivaros to name a few, and the cruise plods along at a great slow pace for photo oportunities or relaxing with a loved one. Ask for the special Rick Steves discounted price, make a reservation (not required) and enjoy one of Europe's most beautiful riverfront views.

Nice cruise, unprofessional crew. We took a one-hour afternoon cruise on one of the glass topped boats operated by Legenda. The boat was quite nice and modern and very clean. Two drinks, including wine were included in the price. There was audio commentary in many languages available on headphones, The commentary provides some information on the buildings you are seeing along the waterfront. The downside of this trip was the crew, all four of whom spent most of the cruise inside the captain's glassed-in compartment at the front of the boat, laughing and talking loudly. Sometimes the noise was so loud we couldn't hear the audio commentary. Much of the time the captain's back was turned away from the front of the boat while he was chatting and at other times he propped his feet up on the control panel. Very unprofessional in my book! I would pick another company next time.

Sunset River Cruise, The Best of Budapest. I have to say of all the things we did, this was the highlight. We also took of those glass front ones - Company Name: Legenda off Pier 7 and Boat Name is Duna Bella (off Pier 7). It was very expensive (4900 HUF) but definitely worth it. There is a cruise at 10pm that has a discount - I think it is 30% so maybe that is an option if you are on a budget, also i think the day ones are cheaper. It was very informative (maybe a little corny) but interesting. There are multiple languages and you get 2 free drinks. The city is lit up and the beauty was overwhelming! The only downfall was that the day trips go around the island, which I think would have been nice.

Amazing adventure . Yes i call it adventure it was really nice specially the part when it transforms into a boat it's really amazing i hardly recommend it you will be able to see all Budapest in a bus boat

Great experience, kids love it. Very nice trip , bought tickets morning time and noon time went to trip.Great experience for kids and adults. It lasts for 1 hour and bring you back to the same point.Tip: Take seats at the front of bus for netter view and don't forget your camera )Also some discount for Budapest card

Great experience in a cold or rainy day. The ride in the bus offers a lot of excitement to young children and they had a great time. In addition to experience of the bus is sailing in the river the tour was very informative and interesting. Very recommended!

A lot of fun, comfortable and affordable tour. This was a lot of fun and won't break the bank. The transition from land to water was accompanied by dramatic musical score and was a delight. Commentary for any and all language speakers. A good time!

Not worth the money. I purchased the tickets from their office location by the bus stop and the staff was rude and unhelpful. If people have a problem with tourists, I don't think they should work in the tourist industry. Also, the bus does not stop at all, so you can't get good photos. I was sitting on the right side and most of the sites ended up being on the left. During the water portion, the bus turned around right at the parliament building also making it difficult to get good photos since the building is huge.The tour was over priced. Budapest is really walkable. I would suggest taking advantage of a free walking tour and doing a separate cruise on the Danube for a third of the price.

Not for hot summer day , otherwise attraction. We took this attraction in the afternoon of an hot summer day , that was a mistake , although they say the bus has air condition we just could not feel it,we were sweating inside the full tour.I hope they fixed something there since it is a very nice attraction and give you a good tour in the river but it was just too hot to enjoy.You have 30 minutes tour at land and around 45 minutes in the water.

Best way to explore the city. Wow! What a fun ride! My children loved this "bus" ride. Actually it was a much longer trip than what I was expected. Helpful service with a huge smile. Interesting informations about Budapest. I would recommend it to anyone!
Fun , nice but no aircondition. The ride is fun , kids loved it.Gave it 3 stars cause of no air condition on a very hot summer day 28 celsius , no windows too

A comprehensive overview of Budapest sights - from the road and from the river. This was an interesting trip, half of it on the road and the other half on the river. The "boat" part will give you a very different perspective. Not to mention the slightly queasy feeling when the green-brownish waters of the Danube surround you from all sides.The attendant speaks English and German live, the other languages are pre-recorded.I am not sure if this attraction is suitable for smaller kids. Probably not. The trip is long (almost two hours), and kids might get quite bored by all the talking.The trip is not exactly cheap - about 30 USD per person.

Awful experience !! Do not go !! . Booked online to go on this river ride and to start we found it impossible to find we asked a handful of local people including people working cleaning the road and local security men and no one knew where it was until we stopped at the four seasons and asked and he pointed out a man dressed in a costume standing at the taxi rank. No sign anywhere to say where it was, we walked around for 45 mins looking for this. We then waited and waited and waited to be finally told that the trip would not be going a head. No apology we were just told to go back to the office. There were 4 people in the office and only one person dealing with the situation which meant a long queue. When we got to the top we were asked can we come back tomorrow to which we replied no we have other plans tomorrow. We were not asked to come back any other day or when did it suit us. The river ride employee dealing with us told us that we would be refunded with the company we booked it with which was fine but when I asked for some sort of receipt to prove I didn't go because it had been cancelled and I would be guaranteed a full refund I was looked at by that employee and her colleague as if I had ten heads !! I had been let down by this company,no explanation to what actually happened and no apology then when I ask for something to prove I would get my money back because I simply did not trust these people I was looked at like a freak and I did not appreciate the huffing and puffing out of the employee !! I would not recommend anyone to go to this because you are not guaranteed it will go ahead and if it is not safe to proceed with the trip that is perfectly fine, health and safety must always come first with these types of trips. But a customer is paying the money, they should receive an apology at the least of the trip they paid for has been cancelled. the customer service of this company is awful !!

An experience you would love. Imagine going on a city attractions tour bus and a boat ride at the same time. this one of a kind City tour bus will take you through the city attractions and once you get to the Danube river it will drive right in and sail like a boat showing you the River bank city attractions from the river side. So much FUN.
Fun but.... The total experience is good but there some things that they need to change. They need air conditioner that work.

RiverRide. The good: novelty of going from a road vehicle to a sea-faring (river) vehicle. The bad: extremely boring commentary. No personality at all. The taped version in various languages was more interesting than the live commentary. The ugly: the heat in the enclosed vehicle was so oppressive I almost passed out.

Boring, hot not worth the time. I made a tripadvisor account just to warn others. We had been on an amphibian tour in Lisbon and loved it. Unfortunately this one was in an enclosed bus with poor air conditioning (it was hot really hot even after multiple people appealed to the driver). The audio descriptions and tour were quite poor too. Each person had to wear headphones to hear the English+German guide who was quite boring. Truly a waste of time for the family and I. We had amuck better time just hanging out on Margaret Island.

Awful experience. Do not recommend. Had an awful experience. We turned up for the tour and it was cancelled. This happened again the next day. Basically wasted half a day stuck in traffic in a poorly air conditioned bus. Bus was late and it was an over all uncomfortable experience.

Novelty 100% tediousness 75%. The tour covers the most important city marks of Budapest, which is good, and that part of the tour has good earphone narrative as well. Splashing into the river is of course the coolest part of the ride and totally unforgettable. The ride downstream is also very entertaining, passing under the famous bridges and passing the parliament. The tediousness starts after turning upstream towards the landing again. Sometimes it feels that the (Bus/Boat?) is barely making walking pace and so most of the time of the tour is taken up going upstream passing sights which you have already seen on the trip downstream. It would be a great improvement if they just created another ramp downstream so that you just had to pass the sights one way (or get a bigger engine to go faster, but that is probably not possible).

Great novelty value. This experience I will not forget in a hurry.How often do you drive down a ramp into the Danube in a coach?.The view of the sights on offer in this gorgeous city is superb. Great fun

Novel but probably see more on separate bus and boat trips. Loved the bus itself, truly weird driving into the river with a sailor taking over the wheel from the driver at this stage. What really lets it down is having to retrace the same route on the river to get on the road again, an exit point down the river would make this a much better experience.

Rather for kids. The route is pretty similar to other bus tours in Budapest, you will visit the Synagoge, Heroe's Square and then a bit long ride which is not the best part of the city, to reach the Danube. The highlight is to splash into the water, then the bus flows pretty slow front of the castle and the parliament. That part is long, some tourists fell asleep..:) If you have seen the Parliament, Castle already, better to go by yourself to see the other side of the city. The information provided during the trip is interesting, gives the full picture of history, culture and the city.

A beautiful way to see Budpaest. We visited as a family of 4. We had a 1.5 yr old toddler with us with a pram and a 5 yr old. The pram was kept in hold by the staff at boarding and was available as soon as we got back. You get some amazing views of the parliament on the river Danube. You also get to orient yourself to the history and sites of budapest. The commentary in english is part american / partly british accented. I would recommend this as an attraction with young kids as everyone enjoyed this. The bus and staff were child friendly. We got to see parts of budapest we would never visit on foot / with a buggy. The pick up was next to 4 seasons hotel (we stayed at the Sofitel - a stone throw away)- Well recommended for the young and old. Although you do get to see a lot of Pest, you dont really explore a lot of Buda - but Buda perhaps is best explored on foot anyways.

Average ride. The two hours ride fosters only a few interesting moments while getting in and out of water, the rest of the program is very similar to a boat ride without the fresh air feeling.The photos looked much nicer from the boat

Really enjoyable. It's a very odd experience sitting on a bus whilst it splashes into the Danube but this amphibious craft is really novel.It had good narration on the headphones too - I used the recorded version and my husband listened to the live narrator who had a good sense of humour.There were some great views from the river.

Fun couple of hours. We wanted to a bus tour of Budapest as there is so much to see in this beautiful city, and we decided on RiverRide because we could go on the Danube also.We enjoyed the tour that was about 2 hours long. It was perfect for us as it was a rainy afternoon. We were given radios that we could listen to in different languages and the tour guide also spoke as we went throughout the city. The tour guide was good but was a little quiet and difficult to hear and a little "stiff". They told some jokes which seemed a little rehearsed. It would have been better to just go with the history of the city and leave out the jokes we felt. But overall we enjoyed it!

River tour. Had a couple of hours to spare and had seen the normal bus tours, this looked different. The tour guide was excellent and made it very interesting pointing out everything along the way. Would recommend this for a return visit.

Best of the best view. After been to Prague river cruise, Budapest river is grand & cruise view the best. The Parliment &.buda castle stands magnificent & are both impressive. Bridges are if not nicer, longer & grander. We vote Budapest river cruise number 1!

Best introduction to Budapest. Take this trip on your first day. It gives you a good understanding of the layout of the city and where you will want to go. We had a fantastic guide who provided more than just sightseeing information. Really worth it.

Is it a boat? Is it a coach? No! It's a BOACH! . We really wanted to find a good tour of Budapest and this offered a good sightseeing route with a history and culture lesson, all with a unique twist! It was fun being the envy of people on the riverside who were pointing and taking pictures of our amphibious bus! We had headphones to give the audio tour and it had most of the common used languages. My gf and I are Italian and English respectively and we were able to each listen to our own languages. Although, it seemed the Italian audio might have missed some bits of info out that the English didn't, we found out after. All in all an unforgettable experience which we were very happy with. Don't miss out!

Fun and interesting . Something a little bit different. It's a bus. It's a boat. It's aquabus! Live commentary in English. Punctual and friendly staff. Float down the danube in a coach. Very reasonably priced too.

Australian child discovers a yellow bus in the Danube. Our 7 year old grandson, Joseph, showed us and his parents around Budapest. First he personally "discovered" a silly yellow bus ploughing cheerfully up the Danube. He immediately took his grandparents on this astonishing form of transport. He grabbed Grandma's hand and pulled her along, running all the way to find it parked in the little square near the river not far from our apartment. We were just in time and the staff were lovely and accommodating for Joseph's old rellies who he explained had been a bit slow and wobbly on the cobbled footpaths. He was delighted that his Grandpa was entertained by the interesting technologies involved (especially on climbing back onto land). He was very proud of both us for answering some of the questions asked by the guide and winning some presents to show his parents. Joseph was thrilled to make the first ever sighting of the big river house for the kings and queens of Budapest, so he carefully ignored his oldies silly babble about boring government buildings. Joseph was a little embarrassed by his grandparents getting excited about the splash into the river. Afterwards, he carefully demonstrated to us the correct (cool) way to behave on guided tours. Definitely no squeals of excitement. Apparently you look away and think about missing your ipad games. Actually, this was a hilarious send up from observation of his friends and teenaged step-brother and step-sister. Generally, Joseph was pleased at finding this way to keep his grandparents thoroughly amused for a whole morning. He just wishes there was a special segment on tripadvisor for things to do with grandparents and parents as he would put this and the Big Red Bus top of the list for things to do in Budapest.

The best way to explore Budapest - great fun!!!. We tried it after a suggestion and after I read some very negative reviews, and even among the 5 of us we had different feelings after it, but I think that generally I do recommend it for everyone, it's something unbelievable when the sight seeing bus goes inside the Duna, Danube, and it continues the sight seeing tour from there. So it's basically a sight seeing bus that makes a tour in Budapest with a guide who speaks English, German and Hungarian, but you can choose other languages on the earphone, which has advantages and disadvantages as well, because it's a pity that we can't listen to all of them (or more than one) for the same time, because they all have a different style, the tape has music, but can't react on the actuality, so this is a problem, but I think it was only my problem. It takes one and a half-two hours all together, and it worth to bring cameras, because it's a lots of fun to take pictures from the river, although we can't really see from pictures that we are in the bus in the river.I think that that was the best part of the whole tour, of course, when we entered to the river, but it was also very interesting when we went out of it... I think it definitely worth it, even if it's your first time in Budapest, and even if you want a new kind of sight seeing, or just having fun with kids. Actually it's even very fun to see from outside that a bus is floating on the river - and it's free to see it from outside! :)

Nice concept, implementation would need more attention. The concept and the vehicle is excellent, and the first half of the trip is good. Floating on the river with a bus is fun, though since the vehicle is closed, it is mainly a good idea in bad or cold weather. Otherwise the open boats are clearly a better choice for the Budapest Danube sightseeing.What unfortunately lessens the otherwise great experience:- staff treat passengers with minimum attention;- the guide makes little effort above what is required: e.g. when we had to go on a detour, or during the second half of the trip, she was unable to keep talking;- the guidance told is only about half correct (but that's an unfortunate average figure in Budapest);- The routing is flawed, probably due to a lack of suitable exit ramp down the river.
