The bus should float down the river, exit there, and take a different route back to base. Instead, it forces its way up the river (only being able to do half speed), then just returns to base without further things to see. Thus basically the second half of the trip is a bit useless and boring, in a confined space.- Frankly, the price is rather high.If the routing were improved (worst case: construct a ramp somewhere further down) and the staff a little more trained and attentive, this could easily be a must-do attraction.Till then, while an interesting experience, but if you can do it, you probably profit more overall from a boat trip and a bus trip separately, especially if the weather is good.

Lots of fun!. We saw the bus coming down the river from our hotel room, and we both immediately said that we had to do it!Booking online was easy and fast. My only complaint was the there was no voucher or anything to tell you that you had a reservation. That being said, a quick phone call confirmed our reservation and then we got an email with the details. The tour was about like a hop-on, hop-off bus tour. Pretty much the same sights as all of them, though this is a bit less in that department as they save the time for the boat ride, which is the real reason you are there, after all. The water entry was delightfully corny with the music and commentary. Ignore the bad reviews about this part. Again, this is the reason you got on the bus/boats, so stop being a killjoy and enjoy it!. Water entry was a hoot! So bizarre driving a bus into a river. The views from the water were great. Very pleasant and relaxing. (A suggestion: Perhaps some wine, beer, and soft drinks available for the river part of the ride. Would be a nice touch). Views, photos, and water entry and exit make for this to be an unforgetable experience.

Incredible in one word. I have lived in Budapest for ten years and my family came to visit and thought the RiverRide would be a nice time.. and it was much more than that; simply put a wonderful memory that my family and I now share.

A lot of fun. This was my first time in Budapest and we were only there a short amount of time. This tour gave us the opportunity to see a lot of the city in a short amount of time and they tell you a lot of great information. You than go into the river and see the view from the river. It was a very great tour and I would recommend the tour to anyone going that has the time.

Splendid views from the roads and river. This was an absolutely great experience we and our friend had in Budapest. The cruise is funny, especially when you splash into the Danube. Highly reccomended, give it a try!

Good Experience. Really Amazing. First time experience on a Bus that goes into the water. It was good and it was a wonderful experience. I personally wished that the road tour was a bit shorter and that the water trip was much more. But overall a wonderful experience. Yes I will do it again. Loved it simply.
Great bus/boat tour. Lots of things to see didn't have to change from bus to boat. Very comfortable and lovely friendly staff. Would certainly recommended and will not break the bank.

Loved it! Cheesy, informative, and fun! Great views too!. We have never done a bus tour before and always just done the sights on our own. When we saw this hilarious amphibious bus in Budapest, we thought why not? on our last day. So glad we did it. We took the 10 am tour. It was mostly couples with only one child (who was quiet and well behaved- thank God!) we got coffee and snacks at the costa which is right where the bus takes off. We listened to the tour in English ,outlying, and sometimes to the live guide. We learned a lot about Budapest in a really fun way. The bus was cool and comfortable. The fact that it was raining meant we wouldn't have been out walking as much Nd this seemed to be a perfect activity to do in the rain. I will admit, the splash was a little scary. Once we were floating though, the novelty added to the sightseeing experience. Sit on the left if you can!! We took lots of pics, both on land and in the water. People took lots of pics of us too :)We went far past the parliament so not sure what happened on that other reviewers tour?It wasn't cheap, but we found the experience to be well worth it.
Great trip. Very good trip and audio explanation, preferred to a bit of chaos on the hop on-off bus. On the water on a bus something kids will love.

We enjoyed the splash!. The amphibious boat with the splash into the river was pretty much the highlight of this tour. Our guide was quite soft and didn't explain much but the pre recorded guide was adequate and had interesting facts.Pretty pricey but I suppose it's worth it if you have children and can't walk around too much but want to see land and river sights!

Fun and interesting. Super rainy day activity! The coach was warm and provided free wifi. You are given good quality headphones and can pick from various channels. The tour takes you around the main sights on the Pest before going into the Danube. There is even a short quiz on the way back and you can win prizes. Overall lots of fun!

A different sighseeing experience. I tried this excursion on Easter Sunday with my family. At first I was slightly sceptical about it due to some average reviews however I must say that it was a unique experience and it would have been a pity if we didn't try it. I highly suggest this very informative excursion..it wasn't boring at all.

Amazing experience to ride this Bus/Boat. Riverride sightseeing is an unique experience. I love travelling and I've visited many cities in the world but I've never tried similar before. It's really exciting and fun when the bus plash into the Danube. The tour was very well organised, guide was very professional. Good English and good German was spoken. It's truly an amazing experience to ride this Bus/Boat. I think it's a great way to see the city. I can recommend Riverride for everyone!

Stick to walking tours!. Terrible value. The tour guide we got sounded more monotonous and less interested than the pre-recorded voice-over on the headphones you get. She reminded me of listening to a flight attendant go through the safety procedures before a flight. Stick to walking tours where tour guides rely on tips, you can always rely on them to be people who are genuinely passionate and enthusiastic about their cities. The fact that you're inside a bus that's always moving also makes all the landmarks or 'sightseeing' seem less real.Redeeming factors: you do get a great view of the houses of parliament from the river. Some of the tour-guides jokes are so poor and delivered so badly that you get a laugh out of it.

Very boring tour. Their stelling point is the water splash and that's sadly the only "fun" thing during the tour. Everybody got a headphone to follow a prerecorded disk which had no intonation at all. You could follow a live guide in german through the same headphone with very bad connection. Even though that part was live, there wasn't a lot of enthousiasme. They didn't point out the buildings, just at your right or at your left, so that it was sometimes hard to know which building it concerned. The trip took actually 1 hour and then an other half hout of traveling back. Half of the people on the bus fell asleep during the tour because it was that boring... Beter taken another tour with a more enthousiastic guide...

Incredible experience. My partner booked a surprise long weekend in Budapest for my 40th, which included a river cruise. He had no idea that the travel agent had booked this for us, we were both were very surprised and excited when we arrived at the meeting point. We were taken on a tour of Pest to begin with before splashing (literally) into the Danube. It was funny to see everyone staring in disbelief at us from the river banks. The guide was lovely and engaging and knew lots of great facts about the city and its history. We live on a sailing boat and this was a sailing experience neither of us will ever forget. Thank you RiverRide we will definitely recommend you to anyone we know visiting Budapest.
Great way to see the city by land and sea. Had a great experience. Lots of info about the city and its culture. It was really really good. Need I say more?

Nice Experience. It was a new experience compared to all the city tours. First the bus takes us around the main attractions inside the city and then SPLASH!. But after the splash, the trip becomes relatively slower. The guide was good, she explained about the history and major attractions in Budapest.
Very nice!. It was great! Very interesting and unexpected, lots to learn while enjoying both river and in-city tour ! ;)

wonderful. wonderful experiencestarts near to the famus 4 season hotel, then 30 min guided bus tripand 45 min bout trip- (!!the bus splashes into the river )an exellent experience witha very good guide with a lot of knowlage and a big smile

Good tour of Budapest. i thought this was a unique and interesting way to see the main sights in a short space of time (tour takes 2 hours) the guide was good and the river splash was fun. Going back up river is a bit slow but i guess there is nothing that can be done about that. I would recommend to go on the tour if you have a short time in the city.

Unique City Tour. My boyfriend booked this during a surprise city break in November. The tour was a great way to see the city in a short amount of time, and the pre-recorded tour guide was informative and interesting.The splash into the water was dramatic, but like others have said, the boat ride became a bit slow and boring on the way back.
River ride. Very informative and comprehensive tour. Good tour guide. Definitely worth experiencing, even just for the splash from land to water!

Unique. Unique kind of experience. Good overview of the city. The first splash in the river was exciting but it got boring after that. While returning on the river felt very slow and not at all exciting. I would prefer a bus tour and a boat ride separately.And it is expensive !!

Worth it for András Török. The actual ride is overrated and I would give it two stars. It is expensive and the tour guide was mumbling and uninteresting throughout. However, if you switch your headphones to Channel 1 you can hear some slightly confused sounding people reading a script written by the genius travel writer András Török, author of the brilliant "Budapest: A Critical Guide". I laughed when he told me how Freddie Mercury offered to buy the Hungarian Parliament, and cried at his moving description of Queen Elizabeth of Habsburg's love for the Hungarian people. I think the tour guide noticed I was not listening to her but that's okay. Török's script is read with rather poor editing and pronunciation but it's still marvelous and worth the price.

Sit on the left side for the best view. This tour provides a good overview of the city. You can see the major sites and layout of the city on Andrassy Avenue to Heroes' Square and then into the Danube to see the Castle and Parliament building. I sat on the left side and it is better because when you go around Heroes' Square, it is on that side with a clear view. For the other sites, the bus goes up and down Andrassy and turns around in the river so you will eventually get a clear view of all the other sites. The windows are slightly tinted so it is not the best for photography.

Must do, unique. You are driving around in a normal tourist bus, with wifi please on board, and the bus dives into the Danube and it becomes a boat. Terrific tour, great driver and tour guide, worth every penny. The main station is next to the four seasons hotel in Budapest.

Only have 2 hours in Budapest?. The RiverRide Floating Bus Sightseeing is not to be missed. The best of both worlds. The bus takes you through City Centre in Budapest, and when you reach the banks of the Danube, it slides right in...wow, now you are floating. Take in the magnificent sights of the city such as the Parliament Buildings and Chain Bridge to name just a few. Not to be missed so much crammed into 2 hours. Excellent way to see a lot in such a short time. Guides speak English and German.
Fun. A nice trip around town and into the water, but it took forever to get back up the river. Good english and german speaking guide.

The funniest way to see the city. The ride was an amazing adventure and by far the funniest way to see the city. I must admit I was a bit scared with landing on the Danube by bus but it was certainly something to remember.I highly recommend this experience if you want to do more than "just a city tour" and especially when organizing a surprise!

Nice adventure. A very interesting experience and new. The tour bus a little banal, but nice. Into the water with the bus was refreshing . The children loved this part. Overall tour not too long nor short. Bit expensive to a family.
worth every cent. Great experience, you must do it.We all know the city bus and cruis but when they combine together its one life time thing.go for it.
Great experience. Very unique experience to have city and river excursion, especially in Budapest that have great views from the river.

Expensive but very funny with children. Our daughter was super happy ! Certainly the focus of the English / German spoken by the guide is a bit difficult to understand, but this person is very nice and knows well his subject. The city tour is poor. A more extended tour beyond the square of Heroes would be better. A little expansive: 150 € for the whole family (6 adults and a child). But a trip out of the box.

Good way to see Budapest by land and sea.. First, I thought the cost was a bit high, but my husband and daughter really wanted to go, so we did. They both like it, I thought it was ok. If RiverRide is your first city tour it's good, however if you've already done one, this tour can be a bit redundant.Our guide and driver were very good, but the "sailor" they had on board slept over half of the tour. I thought for sure he'd walk up when we entered the water, but he slept right through it. When he finally woke up, he texted and talked on this phone until the tour was done.

Good combination of brief city tour & travel experience. Despite the fact that i live in Budapest i visited this tour.Interesting information was told along the route and i felt that this is a very good value for my money.On the top of that the vehicle (bus&ship) is a big buzz for everybody. If you can take a seat in the front part of the vehicle - in the first line if feasible!

Great fun!. If you visit Budapest then you MUST go on this rather cool bus! Costs about €25 and the whole tour lasts about an hour. You get about 25 minutes or so on the water. It's a great way to see some of the fantastic buildings in Budapest and it's a thrill entering the water!Our guide was lovely and knowledgeable and the tour went off with no problems at all. Definitely recommended!

An awesome experience. Budapest is one of the 10 must visit city. The place is absolutely wonderful and a photographer delight. take a walk along Danube river and try some austrian food in the main square, you will love it. The cruise in night was breath taking.
perfect. One of the best programs is Budapest. I can recommend it to everyone, who want a little bit different sightseeing, than in any other cities.

RiverRide what a lovely experience. I looked in amazement when I saw a bus sailing down the Danube and knew I had to have a trip on it. For only £20 this 1 3/4 hour trip was inexpensive, considering it is the first in Europe.Board the bus opposite the Danube, 100metres down from the Four Seasons Hotel (we had afternoon tea here for only 6500 forints with live incredible piano music) which was a great way to end our trip.The tour of the city covered all the top sights and was excellent, light-hearted, with our commentator adding her own touch of humour along the way. She did a little quiz at the end to see if we had been paying attention...I managed to get a question right and got a special wee fridge magnet. They build up the splash into the water using the theme from Star Wars and once the bus goes in it is surprisingly stable... there are, unused, life jackets under each seat.An unusual and great fun experience....don't miss this!!!! You'll love it.

A wonderful experience. The RiverRide amphibus tour was great fun. The narrative was given both in English and in German by a guide with no irritating accent and what she told us was really interesting. The duration of a little less than an hour was perfect. I took the tour in December, when everything was gray, so I'm going to take it again when I visit Budapest the next time.

Highlight Tour of (Buda)pest. While in Budapest earlier this month I had the pleasure of touring Pest (the vibrant, lowland district on the Danube's left bank, opposite Buda) with RiverRide, a combination bus-boat vehicle that motors down the avenues and plies the waters of the Danube. The tour, lasting somewhat less than two hours, provides an ideal introduction to the city and offers splendid vantage points too numerous to count. Starting near Chain Bridge, the vehicle drove past Pest's major sights, including the Parliament Building, St. Stephen's Basilica, Dohany Street Synagogue, the Opera House and the attractive buildings of Andrassy Avenue (a lovely, tree-lined boulevard styled after Champs Elysees), which leads to the Heroes' Square, with its grand monuments and museums. Along the way we passed 'Book Cafe,' an art nouveauextravaganza which is located above a bookstore (the former Paris Department Store) and which offers a gorgeous backdrop for afternoon coffee or tea. (I went the next day.) When it reached the river north of the city center, our coach plunged into the Danube and headed downstream. Views of the Parliament Building on the Pest side and the Castle and Royal Palace on the Buda side were nothing less than spectacular. Our knowledgeable guide, who spoke both English and German, made the trip back upstream (against the Danube's strong current) go by quickly, dispensing useful information and even quizzing passengers at the end! Just when we felt we were on overload the guide let us enjoy the city for a few minutes in silence. Because the tour ended a bit early (due to light traffic, I believe), we were treatedto a crossing of Chain Bridge before returning to our starting point. All in all, I recommend RiverRide as a convenient, efficient, and highly enjoyable orientation to a fascinating city. Do this first, and you will know what you want to revisit at your leisure.

Bus boat tour of Budapest. The is one of the best tours I've ever done, normally it's either or but this tour is a bus that floats!!!So cool, you get a good tour guide who's English is exceptional and you get to see Budapest from road and river.The way they take you from road to river is such good fun and the same can be said for going back (river to road). The tour is about 1 hour 45 mins, and takes in Pest and some food sights of Buda.

The Best Start for a Stay in Budapest 最適なオリエンテーション. We enjoyed RIver RIde on our first full day in Budapest. The unique combination of bus riding and river cruising was a very interesting experience and very fun. The tour was a very good introduction to Budapest. The starting point is very convenient -- right next to Hotel Four Seasons. Thanks to the tour, we could learn about the city from the perspective of the streets and the water. In just two hours, we could see most of the main points to visit in Budapest. Then, we decided which places we wished to return to the next day. If people are thinking of taking either a bus tour or a boat cruise, they should definitely try River Ride.　ブダペスト滞在の初日にリバーライドに乗りました。ドナウに着水する瞬間と、陸上にあがるユニークな体験はもちろんのこと、地上とドナウ川からの両面から街の見所のほとんどを見ることができ、翌日からの観光でどこをもう一度ゆっくり訪れるかを決める最高のオリエンテーションになりました。バス観光とドナウクルーズを効率よく一度に体験できます。

Almost nodded off!. The novelty of the bus driving into the water and 'transforming' into a boat was good fun (cheesy music and all), however the guide was so boring and monotonous that I found myself almost falling asleep a few times! Also the ride is advertised as 1hr 45min, but it's more like 1hr 30 with the last 15min spent driving very slowly next to the Danube parallel to the route taken in the water.
Great tour, a chance to rest your feet while learning about the city. Great tour. The guide was funny and interesting. The tour is great and takes you through most of the city.
Quick and educative. An unforgettable experience. In 2 hours you get the general information you should know about Budapest
Interesting. Nothing to not like about this trip although I could have stayed on longer as the guide was interesting and funny. The experience of going from road into water is amazing!Not to missed.

A great way to see the city. Usually my wife and I prefer to walk around to see the city, but today we had a nasty weather and didn't feel like getting wet, so we decided to take this tour.The vehicle is a weird combination of a bus and a boat. It rides on wheels on the road like a normal bus, allowing you see the city like any other tour-bus, but then, after 45 minutes or so, it arrives to the Danube, goes into the water and turns into a boat, allowing you to view the city like any other tour-boat. The guide was very nice, and the tour was a real success!
'Ride The Duck' Big Brother. This is well worth the experience. You get the opportunity to sightsee in Budapest then float down the river Danube. This was San Francisco's 'Ride The Duck' grown up.
Well worth it!. A good combination of history and current day knowledge. Covered a lot of territory in a relatively short amount of time. Definitely unique and fun in a silly kind of way!

RiverRide in Budapest. The experience of RiverRide is very nice. The tour around the city accompanied by explanations of the guide which was very pleasant and her explanations were interesting.For those who have already made ​​a guided tour around the city this part a little unnecessary. The entrance to the Danube with the bus was very very fun for the children and so did exit from the river. The bus is spacious with large windows which makes the tour very enjoyable. Take into consideration that there is no toilet at place of boardding and the cafe next door does not allow using the toilet unless you buy something.

Excellent way to view the city. This tour was a great way to see the city of Budapest, especially if you are limited on time during a business trip. The guide was funny, and it was really awesome to see see the city by land and water. I would highly recommend taking the River Ride bus tour :).

Great to see Pest but prepare to be disappointed if you want to see Buda too. Attitude of the driver ruined the trip too.. Overall the trip was fun with a knowledgable and funny tour guide. It's a great way to see the sights of Pest but we were disappointed that the coach did not go to cross the Danube to the Buda side. If you want a complete tour I would recommend another organised event.It was enjoyable when the bus ventured into the river and the sense of occasion was made more enjoyable with the music when entering the Danube. There was some mention of not standing whilst the bus was in the water due to balance issues which is understandable but the co-driver displayed a very aggressive attitude when I slipped to an opposite seat to take a picture of Parliament on the other side. The bus/boat experience exists as a sightseeing enterprise so I was taken aback by the attitude of the member of staff who could have asked me to remain in my seat in a more polite manner. This incident spoiled the event and if I realised you could not swop sides for a better view and to take pictures I would have booked a cruise tour instead, at a much lower price.

Great ride with a splash!. A fun way to see Budapest, a unique amphicoach you shouldn't miss. It takes about 2 hours and you will see the most important sights in Budapest. The water trip takes a while and the speed is slow, but the splash is awesome.

Awesome!. The reviews were all good, and the actual trip was fantastic! Me and my 16 year old daughter had a wonderful time on land and in the water with the RiverRide. The tour guide was a beautiful young woman who sounded just like Za Za Gabor, that did an excellent job of showing us the city of Budapest. We did not have a great deal of time to see the city, so the RiverRide let us see a lot in a short period of time. It was well worth it!
Not bad for something different. It was a bit too long, no refreshments on board but quite a cool thing to do. Also, not cheap! Around 35 euros a person

A bit pricy but worth every penny. We took RiverRide tour last week in December, and didn't tell our kids what we're going to do! They were stunned, and so were we. The guide was very friendly, knowledgeable and amazingly easy switched between English and German, all the time of a tour. It lasts almost 2 hours, I just don’t know how it works in Summer months, I hope they have some king of air-condition! Anyhow, information we got were just in right quantity and shape to get a nice picture of Budapest, its past but also present life.

Plenty of fun and a great experience. My wife and I thought a "city tour" and trip on the Danube all in one go was a great moneysaver.Following a tour of the major attractions in the city with a very competent tour guide the bus drove down a ramp into the water and hey presto! we were cruising on the river.We thoroughly enjoyed it particularly the music that came on just before entering the water.
Excellent. Tried this last week & must say it really was excellent. Combines the best of a bus trip & a boat trip.

A BREAK IN BUDAPEST. I visited Budapest just for a couple of days ,and decided to try the River Ride bus {SPLASH} .I have to say in my mind before going on the ride I thought I would not enjoy it ,and it would be quite boring .How surprised I was .This attraction is certainly unique it was fun , exciting and scary at that moment you enter the water ,Once you are in the water it was totally enjoyable and would recommend to visitors of all ages .On board there was an interpreter who spoke many languages her description and commentary were fabulous she described all the things you could see from the river with great detail .I would certainly take a trip on the River Ride {SPLASH}again .

New experience. Never been to this kind of experience before and I enjoyed very much. It is nice to see so many things in two complete different perspective, land and water.It's not cheap but it's worth, try to get the late one at 17:00 so you can see the change of lights!Recommended!

Loved guides accent. If you do one bus tour you may as well kill 2 birds with one stone and have a sail down the danube as well. Great idea. The tour starts out with conventional bus tour with commentary done by lady who had a great accent and we couldn't help mimicking her for the rest of the holiday. She knew her stuff and was great to get your bearings in the city. It only stayed on the Pest side of the Danube though. Surreal going in to the water, but you only go as far downstream as the Parliament, but all in all good value for money.

A splashing good way to see Budapest. RiverRide really does offer a tour with a difference, and is well worth the money. Our coach was clean and comfortable, and our guide spoke excellent English and German, giving a detailed and interesting commentary throughout the tour. There was even a quiz (with small prizes) making it doubly worth paying attention. And it was quite some experience to drive off the ramp into the Danube (and reverse the process coming back) and something I shall remember as one of the highlights of our Budapest holiday.

Great city tour. Great city tour! We really got to see a lot more of the Pest city history vs what you would only see on a Danube cruise. The bus was very clean and comfortable. Going into the Danube was really neat and we cruised around for about 40 minutes. We did not visit the Buda side at all but a few places were pointed out from the Danube.

Surprising attraction. This trip is absolutely fantastic. The bus (which is a cool combination between a normal bus and a boat) was really clean and the crew was excellent. The guide spoke excellent English and she presented the highlights of Budapest in a funny, interesting and exciting way. I really enjoyed her presentation and actually took notes on what she said for future references. Also, she pointed out excellent places in the city I could visit which I would easily pass by and miss. I also enjoyed the small quizz she prepared at the end of the tour, even if the prizes were totally symbolical :) The splash in the river was really fun (I do admit that the music was a little cheesy, but still entertaining) and it allowed us to see the city from a totally different perspective. I would totally recommend this tour, even if it is the most complete city tour you could take. It was totally worth the money and it guarantees a good time.

Fun city tour. The River ride in Budapest was a fun and cool experience. It may not be the best city tour, it's for sure unique and interesting. And the splashing point is spectacular!Seeing the city from both the road and the river gives you the opportunity to admire it from different perspectives in a short time and the guide explains all the attractions in details, including also funny facts or jokes to keep everyone interested.

Give it a miss. We arrived in Budapest and chose this to have a look round. Big disappointment - great if you spoke German as that made up two thirds of the commentary.The bus was full of flies and mites and we spent the entire time trying to bat them away. At a cost of £70 I'd spend my money elsewhere.

Don't miss it!!!!!. In my last day in Budapest (1st of September) I did the river ride at 17:00 aery nd it was a choice I won't regret ever: the guide was great: spoken with a calm voice and very easy to understand, told us all historic facts and also some jokes:)) The splash point was fantastic and it was really fun...For me the best way to see the Danube: don't miss it in your nextv trip to Budapest!!!!
Like a Bond movie!. Take the bus and ser all the attractions on land and then splash down into the Donaue! Much fun and money well spent! :)
Fun and different ride . Really fun and you get good advice on what to see. The aircondition in the bus could have been better, and the quiz they had.

The worst bus trip I've ever took. Last year I've seen the amphibious bus on the Danube in Budapest and said to myself that I have to take it next year. It was the worst decision that I ever made in Budapest, and I'm there almost every year due to my family ties... The language that the guide spoke today could hardly be described as English. I barely understood a thing due to the Russo-Hungarian accent that she used and the fake tv-anchor-like voice. It is important to mention that I studied English for 5 years and use it almost everyday. Apart from that the "fun facts" that she was mentioning on the ride were not very interesting. I would not recommend it to anyone for the price we paid, because the "thrill" of getting into the water (which lasted for approx. 2 minutes) with lame 2001: Space Odyssey's score by Strauss was simply unworthy the 30euro per person...

Unique trip. This is rare opportunity to travel through the city and Donau at the same time. This isn't city tour and isn't a boat trip. This is something between the first one and the second,but ,by the way , intresting.Live audioguide only in Deutsche and English.

Novelty river ride rather than city tour. This is a novel and fun way to see some of Budapest’s sites from both road and river. The main focus is on the Pest side of the river and we found it a good introduction to sites we’d like to go and explore later. This is a basic tour with basic info in English and German. I’m not fluent in German by any stretch but I understand enough to know that on the tour we went on a lot more info was being given out in German than it was in English. This may not be the case for all tour guides but I was a little disappointed as I felt like we were missing out on the full experience. I would recommend this tour as a quick intro to Budapest, especially if you have young children. They whole ‘bus floating on a river’ is a unique experience and makes for an interesting alternative however once was enough. You are mainly paying for the novelty factor and not a tour of the city.

Good show but not even more.. Shot tour through the city with main places, shot boat trip till Parlament and back. Not a sightseeing tour and not the boat trip.But! It's a bus on the river! With guide's jokes about danger, changing driver to the captain and other special things.Strongly recommended!

Wonderful RiverRide. As we arrived to Budapest we saw a bus sailing on Donau and could not believe our eyes, it really looked fun and unbelievable! The next day our friends had arranged us a city sightseeing and we did not that they had planned it on the RiverRide Floating Bus. This trip was 1 hrs 45 minutes long and we enjoyed every second of it. First we took a bus ride in the city and saw the most important sights in the city centre. As we arrived to the river bank by bus, it started approaching a ramp by the river. Our bus drove into the river and turned into a Floating Bus. Music by Strauss was played at the same time when there was a big splash when the bus hit the water, it was hilarious. As our bus was sailing on the river we saw all the main attractions from the riverview, which was a wonderful exprience.We have participated in many guide tours and can really say that our tourguide was excellent, she spoke fluent English and German and had a nice sense of humour when she was telling her stories about Budapest and Hungary. We definitely recommend this tour to everybody, it is an experience which we will always remember!

Is it a bus, is it a boat??. Our friend had organised this trip and we thought we were going on an ordinary city tour and, as the day was really warm, were a bit disappointed he hadn't gone for an open top bus. This proved to be far more interesting and novel! The guide was excellent and clearly fluent and articulate in a number of languages as the commentary is adapted to suit the tourists on each trip. The journey on land took in the key sites of Budapest but the river part of the journey probably gives you a better feel for the city with its two distinct and very different parts. This is not the cheapest way to see Budapest but perfect if you want a good overview at the start of a holiday or city break, plus the novelty of a bus that suddenly goes off road and into the river! I agree with another review that suggests that this might not hold the interest of younger children (the boy in front of us was about 9 and was clearly very bored apart from when we splashed into the Danube and when we emerged back onto land again). Would certainly recommend, if only for the fun of seeing the expressions on people's faces when you go in and out of the water!
different feel. nice ride. trip by land does not cover all the sights . trip by river very nice.a bit expensiive.better to take apart tour bus and cruise

RiverRide - must do in Budapest - good value. RiverRide was recommended by a local friend. The video on their site had me intrigued but the cost (~ 34 USD, Euro 30) made me wonder if we should opt for the Hop on/off type. I am extremely glad we chose RiverRide. This was the second best experience in Budapest, following the Castle District experience – (which you will find to be unimaginable. )We have not experienced anything so unique. It is fun, educational, informative and a good value. Don’t let the price make you hesitate – while it may feel pricey it’s an excellent value for the experience.They were very responsive to my email enquiries. Adrienn, the tour guide, is a lovely individual and made the tour very enjoyable. I loved the information she shared. The bus driver was very polite – I appreciated that he was so courteous to the pedestrians. It’s these little things that make me proud to have engaged their service. The “captain” (he drives the bus in the water) was a fun individual as well. Our little toddler loved the “splash” in the water and was thrilled to be in the water. The staff were very friendly and attentive towards him, which made it more memorable for us as new parents.You can purchase tickets online or right next to the Four Seasons Hotel, near the Danube River.I highly recommend this tour. Quazi and Habib family – Bay Area, California

A good way to see the city and Danube. Some of you may be familiar with the 'Duck' tours that take place in many cities and this is not so different but is more informative than fun. The Boat/ Coach which I have named the Boach is a fun way to see your surroundings and learn some history into the bargain. You start off on dry land and then enter the Danube after about 45 mins. The guide knows her stuff and the tour is conducted in both English and German which is you have both nationalities on board can make it a little hard to follow but no drama. We did not book in advance but it was February, I would expect you may need to in the busier months. This is a unique experience that is well worth it, certainly makes a change from an open top bus,

Novel experience on the Danube. We took the RiverRide amphibious bus tour of Budapest yesterday ( Feb 2013) and found it an interesting experience. The tour itself is informative and for our group conducted in English as our small group all understood English but the guide is fluent in other languages. It's not for kids, it's a tour of historic Budapest with interesting facts but nothing to engage children, yes the bus floats but that's not enough to keep a kid happy. The moment the bus drives into the Danube is novel, but then it's simply like any other boat on the river, except that it's a bus, passers by wave and look a little puzzled but that's about it. We wanted something that would give us a quick (1hr 45 min) over view of Pest which this did admirably, showing us where things are and what's available, so we thought it was good, and my husband particularly liked the idea it was an amphibious vehicle. It wasn't the cheapest way to acheive a tour but it was fun.

Wonderful Experience. Wow, great experience. A combination of a Coach and a Ship and all that in one vehicle is amazing. The moment of dyving into the Danube River is unreal, almost scary. What a relief to see that it seems to be just as capable in the water AS IT IS ON LAND: Budapest is a beautiful City with so much to offer, one can not get a better package of seeing the City than by using this fantastic Bus. Thumbs up, the price is fair if you consider a Busticket and a Tourboat ticket add up more costly. Thank you Riverride

Amazing (River) Ride. Took the RiverRide Tour in January and was very excited about this unique attraction.Very positive was that the tour left precise on time - no additional waiting for moreguests.The Tour took us to the must see´s of Budapest both on land and water without changing vehicles.Very friendly and well skilled tour guide (in our case in 3 languages English, German,Hungarian - whatever was requested by the majority of passengers) provided lot´s of information.The tour on land took approx. 50 min. and passed all mayor sights. After half way the bus enteredthe Danube with quite some speed via a steep ramp - very spectacular and thrilling.Beautiful sight at the Parliament and bridges from the river.Price more expensive than regular tours but in any case worth it´s money.

Danube river floating bus in Budapest. I had experiences riding a float plane and amphibious truck but this is my first time to ride a bus on to the river. The first splash upon reaching the water was the highlight of the tour and the changing of the driver for land and switch to a boat captain is "interesting" to note and good to know too that this bus is equipped with jet engine to propel cruise speed of about 20 kph downstream and 8 kph upstream. The only issue with this floating bus was the heater as most of the passengers felt uncomfortable after half-hour riding although it's winter but the hot air coming from vents were really hot as you're having hair blow-drier.

Not the cheapest but worth it. I booked the trip ahead via web, but there was no need as there was no more than 10 of us on the bus. But this might have to do something with the fact it was January. Anyway all "ride" took about 1 hour and 45 minutes. 1 hour in the city and 45 minutes on the river. You will see all the most important parts and monuments in Pest part of town. The "splash" is awesome and only disapointement was, that the bus turns around just before it would reach a parliament bulding. Staff was friendly, all in all very nice experience. Also I did win a small little something in the quiz at the end...

stuffy greenhouse effect from closed in windowaa. We had a lousy guide who didn't want to be there. She looked out the window talked into a microphone reading a script and never engaged anyone. The other "guide" or employee fell asleep at one point and hung in the back doing nothing when he was awake. I couldn't take photos because the windows created a glare and the bus got hot once it became a boat in the water. I have been on these amphibian tours in many other cities...this was the worse. It's fairly expenseive and ususally the guides are well trained and make the whole experience extra fun...not here! DON"T WASTE YOU TIME OR MONEY! one positive... the Jaws theme as we entered the water was clever .

Much more fun than a normal city tour. The Riverride Budapest tour costs maybe more than other sightseeing tours, but you get a unique experience that leaves other sightseeing tours far behind. The personnel is friendly and multilingual.

Aquabus. What an experience, definitely worth doing. Our tour guide was very informative about the town, the Danube and all the buildings that we saw. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest. Cost is £20 pp which we felt was very worthwhile.
Budapest-Danube. Ecellent program for forigners with a funny veichle, on our beautiful river, the Danube. You can have the wonderfull sight of the two sides of Budapest: Buda &Pest.

So cool bus/boat. We were there in november, and took a guided tour by bus/boat, and it was great!. We were sitting in the front of the bus and saw everything. The woman/guide spoke in english/german/hungarian and first the busdriver took us on a tour in the Pest side of the town, than we made a "splash" into the water and it was funny :) Than we were going on a tour on river Danube and back. The tour took us ap.1,45 hours and it was worth to go. Recommend it strongly for both people who are coming for a weekend like we did and people who are for longer vaccations too.

Unique to Budapest. Good guide, knowledgable and friendly. We thought it was expensive for what it was (about £20 per person although children under 6 are free). It's different driving on the road to then enter the Danube.

Great adventure, but only in case bus/boat actually works!!. I took the ride yesterday with my husband and 9 years old son. We were really looking forward to it as it seemed so cool as idea. The part of bus city tour was ok, showing interesting sights and telling stories about them. Our guide was a fine young lady that tried to scare us a little (in a funny way) before we went into the river. They even played some theme from Odysey I think :)The bus came into the Danube and started sailing but after only few minutes could smell something strange. The bus stopped and they opened bottom to check the engine and it turned out that water in engine is overheated and that we need to leave the bus. Fortunatelly we were still close to river bank so we slid to nearby ship that allowed us to get onboard and go to land.The company Riverride kindly got us taxis that drove us back downtown and offered us another ride next week, but as much as I could see noone excepted. Unfortunately no money refund was offered as the tour was only half delivered.Please don't get discouraged as the expirience is unique, but they should get a message to make better maintenance and not to jepardize tourists that come in good trust.

Amazing! A must to do if you are in Budapest. Unique experience of a lifetime.. I was recommended this waterbus tour by friends and it is really something to do at least once in your lifetime. The waterbus takes you through the Danube where you can admire the House of Parliament, the Castle Hill, the famous Chain and Erszebet bridges, Margaret Island, etc..and on the road where you will see Heroes Square, Andrassy Ut, The Bazilika, etc.Excellent value for money considering you actually get two tours in one! Highly recommended.

Must see in Budapest. It is one of the best ways of seeing monumental and historical buildings erected on both Buda and Pest side. The tour starts on land and continues in Danube. The moment you dive in the river is thrilling. And if you are careful enough while the guide speaks you can get your small prizes that will remind you Budapest...

The river ride. This is so exciting so unbelievable and so worthwhile a floating bus WOW! watch James Bond I am experiencing something I only ever dreamed of a bus that goes along the road and then down a ramp and sails along the Danube as a boat sk[ppered by a captain the cruise is so well done so informative the people running this operation so careful so helpful so happy.Budapest is a beautiful city and to see it from the peaceful environment of the river just enhances the whole experience. Then afterwards back up the ramp and the driver takes over they dry down the outside and off we go along the roads.Its just a great experience and one everyone would enjoy.

Totally different experience. You get a good tour around Budapest with the added experience of the splash into the Danube.We have been to Budapest 5 times before and wanted a different experience and this was exactly that. It is good although a bit expensive. Would recommend it for a good view of the city

A Must In Budapest!. After reading the reviews online, we finally got the chance to take this ride. I must say, it is worth the time and money for a first time visitor in Budapest.You enjoy the best of what to see on land and along the Danube. My wife and kids truly enjoyed the tour. The guide was very good in telling us the sights, and the driver/captain gave us a smooth and enjoyable cruise all the way.What we also enjoyed was the people on the streets and those riding cruise boats who couldn't help but take pictures and be amazed with this one-of-a-kind tour vessel. It's truly an amazing experience to ride this Bus/Boat.A Budapest Must!!!
Floating bus!. Great! Interesting! It is worth at least for that moment of splashing and then people watching from the Danube's shores like crazy thinking they are drunk))
Dived in!. Awesome Ride! you can't leave Budapest without trying it :) It is probably your only chance to dive into the river on a bus and get out alive ..

okay at best. Not really my thing.... We went on it at the end of June 2012 and the air conditioner was not pumping out very cool air by any means and it was 90+ outside. I thought it was pricey for what you get. There are a couple good seats in the front to watch the splash into the river otherwise nothing to special in my opinion. We did a boat cruise later in the week which I and the children (8 & 11) enjoyed much more and cost less.

...and now for something completely different.... Booked this online during our stay - a little expensive for Budapest prices. Turned up for our 17.00 trip to find there were only 4 people booked. Nevertheless, the tour went ahead with a split Hungarian/English commentary.Have to say that it is well worth the extra little expense over ordinary tours. A well informed and very friendly guide....but the highlight is the experience of being in a bus that drives into the river - quite like no other!

Amazing and interesting!. Just back from trip! Was very interesting to combine land ride with water ride! Although I lost our voucher they let us on board (I have asked hotel to confirm our reservation)! Thank you and all of the best!

Great combination of bus and cruise, but not with high tide. We wanted to do a river cruise as well as see sightseeing spots away from the Danube, so the idea of combining the two in one tour was a great one! The tour guide was great, good English and good, sometimes very entertaining German was spoken. The driving was very comfortable, and we got to see many of the relevant spots. Unfortunately the Danube had a lot of water that day, therefore the part of the river cruise was extremely short (10 minutes) and not done for sightseeing but only for the sake of going into the river. In my opinion, this should have been mentioned upon purchasing of the tickets or latest when boarding, this way it felt a little like a tourist trap... Anyway, it's a fun tour and you get to see a lot of the city, so it's recommendable!

What a waste of money and time!. I went on the first day for the novely of being in a boat bus and seeing a bit more of the city. The novelty wasn't worth the cost and one can get to know the city in cheaper and more enjoyable ways. My view is maybe more negative because I had already gone on a free walking tour, which was interesting, informative and fun. This wasn't any of the three.It was so boring as the guide droned on and my partner had a hard time keeping awake. She did not present a comprehensive story of the history that anyone was likely to remember when going through the city on water or land. Maybe others will get lucky with a better guide/crew. The presentation of the "oh so exciting moment" of going into the water was done in an exceptionally cheesy and half-hearted way. Plus, of course for safety reasons, everything is sealed and air conditioning, which may not be fun in the summer, so no 'fresh' air. It's also rather expensive (approx €30 per person) and besides the short thrill of going into the water it was no better than a lame bus tour or boat tour.Yes, it's nice to see the sights, but another time I would just take a cruise on a regular boat and enjoy the breeze, do a walking tour or take a tram.
great fun. This was a great way to see the city both on and off the water. The guide was very interesting and the kids thought driving into the water was amazing.
Simple way to see Budapest from the land and river.. Guide was very professional and for adults trip was excellent. Kids (11 and 6) were a bit bored as boating on river took quite long time.

Very good fun!. I would strongly suggest to pick the RiverRide on your first day in Budapest, because the bus also goes first through the city, and the guide will tell you about what you're seeing, so it's an excellent starting point to see where the bigger attractions are located, and then you can return later to visit them.The whole idea is very cool, we had a great time and enjoyed it!
Unique with bus and ship. Really unique experience travelling by boat and by car and splashing into the water

Unique experience!. I have never seen an ambibus like this. The idea is great, I enjoyed the tour very much. The guide gave very useful at the same time interesting pieces of information. I will highly recommend RiverRide to my friends.
Amazing. amazing experience in Budapest. I will tell this to my friends.

Best tour of Budapest. This was my third tour of Budapest, and was by far the best. We were lucky only to have the tour conducted in English, and as such learned a lot more history of Budapest. The tour guide was great and never stopped providing anecdotes, history, and answering questions. The photo ops from the river portion were amazing. The only thing somewhat difficult was figuring out where to buy the ticket. The kiosk could have used a map of where to go. Also, in the future, I'd love to see them add different routes that went into Buda as well.

An excellent, exciting, imaginative way to explore Budapest on land and water. I have just returned to England from Budapest and would like to recommend Riverride, the amphibious tourist bus as an excellent sightseeing tour on land and water. The tour starts from the Pest end of Chain Bridge (the one designed by Scotsman Adam Clark). It starts by giving you a good introduction to sights on the Pest side of the city and then continues on the river Danube, giving a wonderful view of the city. This is the first amphibious tourist bus on the Continent and I recommend strongly that you give ti a go at the start of your visit to this beautiful city. - The tourist guide on the bus was very knowledgeable and witty at times. - You find details on www.riverride.hu and you might like to look on YouTube as well, such as http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KQIadebptgU&feature=iv&annotation_id=annotation_328107 .

Can this bus swim???. I was in Budapest beginning of August. I visited the house of Parliament, and walked through the city center. On the way I came across with the strange-faced, yellow bus standing on the Szechenyi square. We decided to try it next morning, we were lucky, we got place and the weather was fantastic. So we took the almost two hours trip, and it was worth the money and time!We drove through among the nice buildings of Pest side, the guide explained the history of the city in a very clear, friendly way. Then the main attraction: the splash! It was a strange but great feeling: swimming on the river Danube with the same bus we were riding through the streets! And seeing the many tourists taking photos of our bus and waving to us!It is really a great idea and I can recommend it, the bus really can swim!!!

Special ride.. we heard for this special bus, which goes also into a river and we knew that we have to try. We bought tickets and went on board - all the people around the town are starring into this strange bus, which is floating down the river. It was nice experience, just the ride back on the river is sooooo long. For sure I would recommend it to anyone, who is prepared to pay that money for a special experience.

nice but very pricey. we were one adult and 3 kids (5,7,12). they were very exited about the whole idea. After all this is a tourist bus, so it goes in the city to the main sights and then go into the water. Entering the water was exiting, but then the kids got bored. it floats quite a long time in the water till it gets out.Overall it is a nice experience, but very pricey in my point of view (7500 HUF for adult and 5000 HUF for kids above 6). the whole trip takes around 2 hours.

Must have seen city trip. If you are visiting Budapest, you have to take a ride with the "River-Ride".First you enter a normal bus, but after 45 Minutes, the bus drives into the river Donauand continues the trip as a boat on water !Extraordinary experience and the Tourist-Guide speaks several languages fluently.In our case, we were asked for the preferred language, and so the Guide talked tous in German, English and Hungarian accent-free.The information given to us was very good with a lot of interesting background information too.Thumbs up.
Unique well organised trip.. The trip was easy to find with helpful and knowledgeable staff. Would recommend to anyone for fun interesting tour.

Perfect adventure. A trip I never did before - on a boat that can swim. Viewing interesting points at the city before, the bus gets into the river and swims downtown Budapest on the Danube. Great experience!

Fun way to see Budapest. We did this tour on the first morning of our 3 days in Budapest. It's a great way to see the city and to get an idea of the layout - particularly from the river. This tour has the added attraction of being a tourist attraction in itself with many people taking photos of this bus driving down a river. And the drive along the banks with Strauss' "Blue Danube" blasting was surreal.
amazing experience. it was vey nice to hear the music while going. everything perfect. thanks maybe would be nice to provide the use of a toilet before or during the ride.

Tour of budapest with River ride. The tour bus was very well organized. Guide tour was so informatics and understandable. Passing by Saint Stephan Basilica, the greatest church of Budapest and hearing about story of Budapest flood in 1838. Being in Andrassy Avenue and looking to Hungarian State opera and finally, Hero Square which summarized whole Hungarian history in column and 2 semi columns, still there are so many places to explore and to be more familiar with Hungarian culture. I forgot to mention, some words about Blue Danube, by splashing into Danube, we were amazed. Especially when your boat is special kind of bus ,and equipped with all kinds of safety measures. Believe me, the view point from Danube ,is Fantastic ,you could see two river banks and Parliament in a close proximity and other important landmarks. Really, I recommend this tour to everyone.Saeid

Riverride - a different kind of splash. I took a ride - or how should it be called - on RiverRide and didn't know what to expect. And don't you think that I would spoil the fun of the others by telling anything more but it was fun!!!! Take a ride! Special thanks for the crew for the music.....

A really unique experience. Though I live near Budapest, I've got a riverride with this bus as a birthday present. It was a really unique experience!The journey begins with a "land" part and shows the main attractions of the Pest side of the city. And than comes the splash into the water :) The water part is more exciting though it shows not so much of the city as it's a much slower ride. Unfortunately there were the water level a bit high and so we couldn't do the whole journey in the water that is listed on the website. But the shorter route was also a very good experience. A bus that can swim - it was a very interesting feeling to sit inside :)I would definitely recommend to everybody, who wants to make a city-tour in Budapest, to choose this one.

Unique experience. I found information about this attraction when reading an ad in a magazine.Since this seemed to be a rather unique experience we decided to take this bus ride.You get a great tour of the city, both on land and water.The guide spoke english and was very nice and service minded.I will recommend everyone who visits Budapest this ride. For everything you need to know about this attraction visit the website.

in the danube with a bus... quite unusual. hi all - we paid for a family close to a 100 euro but it was worth it, we spent an hour and a half cruising and we had a great time; the feeling in the water is kind of different, but it feels safe and was kind of fun. maybe the price is a bit steep for young folks and locals, but quite a thing this riverride.

Good fun, good views, good guide. Couldn't find any reviews before my wife and I went to Budapest but we loved the trip and think this is well worth doing - if a little more money than other excursions. The bus/boat leaves from Roosevelt Square on the Pest side of the river and goes around the main sites in the city. It's one of those journeys that is good to help you get a feel for where you want to go back to. Then you go to a slipway into the river and SPLASH! We were lucky in several ways - firstly it was a calm day at end of January and we only crossed one other boat on the river so no wash. Secondly within 2 days of doing it the river was covered in ice and the trips stopped for safety reasons I imagine.The boat part of the trip takes you down past most of the main buildings on either side and you turn just after going under the link bridge and go back to the slipway to get back on dry land. In all the excursion lasted just under 2 hours.Comments:1) our guide was good but could have had slightly better English (but then she was doing German as well)2) the vehicle sways a little on land but felt fine in the water - probably not the best if you suffer from motion sickness3) try to get the front seats to watch yourself going into the water4) it's a pity the boat part stops short of seeing Gellert hill closer, as implied by the website intro5) you don't go to the Buda side so no views from Castle hill but we knew to go there anyway

Best introduction to a new city. Having done a Segway tour in Barcelona we were really keen to do one in Budapest as we found it such a great way to get a feel for a new city especially on your first day. This one didn't disappoint. Guide was friendly and knew enough about the sights for us. The tour was a good length and covered quite a large area all the way from their base all the way along to Parlament. One word of advice would be to wrap up extra warm if you are here in the colder months as you really feel it once you're travelling at speed. Thoroughly recommended to everyone.
Best way Segway . Bravo! very nice team! Nandy and Andrew were greatWe made the parliament tour everything was topAlso their English was very good

Amazing Time with a great team of tour guides. A group of 4 of us signed up for a Segway tour with Best Way Segway in Budapest,our tour guides were great and very informative. We are still laughing and talking about the tour now. A big thank you to our tour guides Bela and Balint for making our day out so memorable.

OVERALL AMAZING EXPERIENCE. This was a wonderful experience. My children enjoyed it so much. The gentlemen working at Best Way Segway were so professional, caring and wanting to provide my children the best and safest experience. I was very impressed with how they were always concerned for my children's well being. They sent two tour guides with us so that they can keep an eye on both boys. Great job you guys! You have done a terrific job and we wish you all the blessing! Terrific job!!!

The perfect way to see the Buda side sights!. My husband loves Segway tours. We've done close to 20 all over the world. Given the distance between the sights, and the steep hills a Segway is the perfect way to see the Buda side sights. Not sure we would have been able to see everything without the convenience of the Segway. Our guide, David, was wonderful. Rather than rattling off a memorized spiel, our tour felt like having a friend showing us the town. David was very patient, funny and personable. He was very safety conscious, always watching to make sure we were okay. The machines were well maintained. St Matthias church was an unexpected delight; my favorite church in Eatern Europe! We highly recommend doing a Segway tour, particularly with this operator!

Brilliant! . We experienced our first time on segways it was a really great experience for our family Including two teenagers and a ten year old Jonathan was very professional and made sure that we were safe at all times A very knowledgeable and friendly young man Not to forget Marcel who also looked after usWe would highly recommend Best way !

Best way to Segway!!!!. We went on a Segway tour with Jonathan, who was the nicest, most patient guide ever! He helped us get the hang of it and showed us a great time in Buda!And in the end of the tour we got to fool around in The park.Highly recommend!

Great experience. I went with my wife to book same day tour, the guy we met was very helpful, we booked the Margaret island 3 hrs tour and it was only the 2 of us in the tour, the guide with us, Abdallah was very decent & helpful, the tour was well organized & we enjoyed it so much & spent great time.

Best activity in Budapest so far.. We were a group of 9 persons and it was the first time riding Segway for all of us. The guys really took good care of us and we did see Buda and Pest with the best possible view. Everyone in the group could run in their own pace and everybody enjoyed it 100%.
It was great!. I was there by chance, but I do not regret. Staff very helpful and friendly. They care about the safety and comfort of tourists. I recommend it!
Great experience!. That was my first experience with segways and I really enjoyed it! Staff was really friendly and helpful. Safe, interesting and unusual way of exploring the city!

Highly recommend. Easily the best way to get to know the city. We took a tour of the castle area at night and very glad we did! Our guide Aron was amazing. He took his time helping us to handle the segway, and once we were comfortable, took us on an amazing journey. I highly recommend this company.

BESTWAY segway - name says it all!. Arrived into Budapest with nothing planned and saw a brochure on a info stand for best way segway. Well the name says it all. Me and my friend turned up at their office wanting to do a 1.5hr city tour in the afternoon and this great guy called Nandi took us right there and then. He took us to all the places of interest but best part was we had such fun on the segway. We asked heaps of local questions and he gave us his recommendation = thanks! Would recommend anyone to that wants to see the sights in a fun way (rather than a bus etc)Cheers best way!

Best Segway tour ever. The place is barely noticeable, but when you arrive, you know! Friendly and professional tour guides. Our guide was David who was great! Highly recommended :) thanks for a great time, we'll most definitely come back!
I would reccommend them to everyone! . We wanted to try Segway for a long time and are glad we chose Best Way. They are kind, professional, and fun to see the city with.

Fantastic Segway experience. First time on Segway for all four of our family. A little apprehensive at first but quickly got familiar with it thanks to our guides. We were accompanied by Tom who we found very helpful & knowledgeable and a fantastic tour guide. We enjoyed ourselves thoroughly so decided to go on a longer tour the next day where we were accompanied by David as our guide. Once again, very knowledgeable & friendly. We crossed the Chain bridge and toured the Castle district, Citadel and then back to Parliament Square to name a few.We would highly recommend this company as they are friendly, caring and highly professional. If you want to tour Budapest and have great fun at the same time, make sure you experience the Segway tour through Best Way !!!

Best way to explore Budapest. My friends and I did a Segway tour with Best Way Segway in Budapest. All of us were new to this and a little sceptical at first. Soon we all enjoyed the decision to do a Segway tour. The route was great as well as our tour guides who were extremely friendly and seemed to enjoy it as much as we did. I can only recommend this company if you're looking for a positive and fun experience.

Great trip - do it you'll love it. Our first time on a Segway and my husband wasn't keen, but he is now totally converted and loved our trip as did I. We went up to the Citadel and saw the most amazing views. Our guide was great and the Segway was easy to master (felt odd at first but 2 minutes in it was simple). We did some off roading which was a laugh. I would highly recommend these guys the whole thing was a great experience. Thanks!! :)

David's tour. My girlfriend and i traveled with David after encounting with him on the street . since the first moment he was the nicest, smiling a lot and bring a truly great energy.We followed him for 2 hours, he explained every detail through the path.David is very caring and makes us safe and lead us saftly.I trully recommend everyone who wants to save time from walking and enjoy hungary through the best way- It's fun, you have with you a lovely local person. And you keep your trip later with a great mood plus a lot of experience.

Very fun . David, and jonathan were our guides and they were awesome i highly recommend them, super friendly and very safe they took very good care of us. I recommend the buda castle tour its a little more money but they spent more time with us then they were scheduled. Thanks david, jonathan

Mersi & Jonny. Best Segway Tour is actually is the BEST Segway tour .. They take you to to all important places in Budapest and they explain everything to you clearly Also they answered all my questions regarding the history of the city.Many regards robMersids and Jonathan for the amazing hours we spent them together Thanks!Mohamed & Zainab

Brilliant guys would highly highly recommend . To be honest me and my girlfriend were sceptical at the start about a segway tour being worth the money and the only reason we went for it was because we had a discount voucher but having done it now I firmly believe it is well well worth the money. The guide we had was really friendly, had great English, made us feel completely at ease both on the segways and in the city and was really happy to take photos of us on the segways. There's a few different companies offering tours but I would recommend these guys as the best!!

A great way to see the city . We booked the Margaret Island tour through our hotel and we are so happy that we did. Our tour guide was so friendly and knowledgeable. He was not only an excellent instructor on operating the Segway but also an excellent tour guide on the history of Budapest. We had a few laughs along the way too. It was an unforgettable experience and we would recommend it to anyone looking to explore the beautiful sights that Budapest has to offer.

The best way to see Budapest. Office is centrally located in the City Centre just behind the main shopping street and Hard Rock Cafe. Budapest is well laid out and nice and level for Segway adventurers. Staff members David and Reika were very knowledgeable and well informed about the local history and culture. I would recommend this experience for anyone, male or female between 5 years old and 75 years old. It really is the best way to see Budapest!
Go for it. It's the most comfortable way to have a memorable sightseeing, the castle district is highly recommended to discover.
Awesome ride!!. What a way to experience Budapest!So much fun and the history part was well presented - thank you guys!! And oh, finnish & magyar really do sound the same from the right perspective

Outstanding experience. This tour was one of the best experiences we had during our trip to Europe. David was encouraging and the tour was both interesting and super fun! David took our pictures, shared many interesting facts, and made us super comfortable on a great Segway model with large wheels, much better than other companies we saw around. The price was the best in the city and the service was outstanding. We booked the same day and had Davis waiting for us when we arrived and providing a super welcoming and enjoyable experience. Highly recommended for everyone!

An absolute must for sightseeing! Wonderful experience!. I highly recommend this company and the guides! The segways are surprisingly easy to ride, the guides are knowledgeable, patient and kind. Our guide, David, was fantastic. This is a really fun way to see this beautiful city. You can cover lots of ground in 2-2.5 hrs. Much easier than walking and super unique. I cannot wait to go back! Anyone with steady feet can ride the segways. Cash only.
Best tour ever. Had a blast with my 10 friends. Highly recommend it to everyone. Will definitely do it again next time I come back. You absolutely must go with these guys the rest are pansies

Loved it!!. Mercedes is a great Segway tourguide. She accommodated the level of skill for each member of our small group and soon we've all got the hang of it. She shared her knowledge about the many sights we stopped at, ask for our interests, commanded the traffic to a halt when we crossed the road and has an overall sunny personality in going about leading this tour. Our 'tail-end Charlie' was of equal calibre. I really recommend you doing this, it looks a little daunting but is a piece-of-cake becoming confident and enjoying the ride.
Fun!. We went for 40minutes, was short :( We love david and ahmad! Nice and fun peopleGreat place, good price and the best stuff! Go visit them!

Great way to visit the Castle district. Ahmad was our guide for today doing a great job in checking our competence before taking us through some pretty densely pedestrian areas. You will need to be competent on the Castle tour as there is some fine manoeuvring to be undertaken. The crew that met us this morning was extremely friendly and all spoke excellent English. The machines appeared well maintained and safe especially as we were running over cobbled streets. Great experience all round!

Segway tour. Riding a segway is just awesome! you defenly should try it. People at the store were nice and the tour was chill. In just 2 ours have have seen way more of Budapest then we would if we went by foot.

Great way to see the city. We had never tried segway before, and had never seen Budapest before either, so seeing it from a segway was really both pleasant and funny! It was much easier than I thought though we are not entirely young anymore. Our daughter of course got in control very fast. And all three of us found it really funny. Our guide was competent and very nice. Hereby my warmest recommendations. Nina, Copenhagen

Great introduction to Budapest. First thing we did upon arrival to Budapest. The castle tour was our introduction to this great city. Baela (sp?) was our guide. Very knowledgeable - the tour was a real history lesson as he is a lifelong resident. His assistant Achmed was very helpful as well. Kept us safe and moving at a good pace. This was our third Segway tour in Europe and easily the best.

Kept waiting for an hour. We had a time of 11am, they didn't turn up until just after 12. One person said that their had been an accident on the previous tour but another employee said that they had forgotten. Not a good start. However our son enjoyed the segway experience and the kit all looked well maintained. The tour took them all round the city.

Castle tour. Well, this was definitely the best way to get around Budapest and up to see the castle district! Great fun for the whole family, especially the teens! David our tour guide was informative and made us all feel comfortable and safe on our X2 Segways. Tour lasted 2.5 hours and had nice breaks for photo taking and refreshments. Highly recommend Best Way Segway Tours!!

Highlight of Budapest for the kids, so far.... We have two teenagers and an 11-year old who all wanted to try traveling around on a Segway. It was a great decision; we all really enjoyed it. Since we were beginners, we just took the 30-40 minute tour downtown. They asked if we wanted to do sightseeing or mainly just ride on Segways and we chose to just ride around - with a guide. The young guides (two of them went with us) were friendly, knowledgeable and spoke excellent English.This tour exceeded our expectations. We'd definitely do it again on a longer, perhaps more informational tour.

An excellent experience. This was our second segway tour but it did not disappoint! Our guide Ester was absolutely amazing and we were able to have a lot of fun. It was a private tour so there was only two of us plus the guide. It as a great way to see the city and Ester was able to tell us a lot about Budapest's history and recommended some sights that we should see whilst there.

Great tour. We were two families. 8 people. Only us. Really friendly guide, top equipment that was easy to handle (i.e. original Segways). Great way to climb the hill to the castle. You really get around fast. Can you ski, then this is easy.
AMAZING!. Absolutely unforgettable tour! Never used a Segway before however our very helpful guides David & Nandi were great in training us up! Great tour to the Citadel! Thanks again guys!
Real Fun!. It was really good! The guide was very friendly and informative! We just recognized in the begining that its gonna be a private tour!

Fun family activity in Budapest!. We are a family of 5 and did a private 2 hour segway tour to the citadel and the castle. These locations are both up hills and with children this is a great way to get there without complaints. Prior to departing, our guide David showed us how to use the segways. He also ensured our safety the entire time we were out and provided us with information on the places we visited. Everyone enjoyed the trip as we explored the city and learned a bit about each of the locations we visited. I would recommend this activity for families or for anyone looking for a fun way of exploring the city of Budapest.

Great tour friendly guude. Had a great couple of hours having private guided Segway tour up to the citadel. Fantastic views of the city and Danube. Our tour guide was Béla and he was friendly and informative. We had a great time and recommend this way to spend a few hours in Budapest. We also got 20% discount with Budapest card.

Manchester. We had a great time in Budapest in June with my daughter. I have booked a Citadella tour with Kitty. She is very helpful, kind a patient as I am not very clever with the Segway. If anyone want to book a tour I strongly recomend the Best way Segway tours. Thanks for having usZsolt from Manchester

What a tour!. The best sightseeing tour by far! Having never used a Segway before, we were somewhat anxious about whizzing through the streets of Budapest on two wheels. Our anxiety was quickly defused by the friendly staff at Best Way Segway. We had a chance to practice in a small courtyard, and given a safety brief by David and Bela, before heading to the beautiful streets of Budapest. Our guides showed us all the must see sights around the Buda Castle plus all Bela's and David's personal favourites of where to eat, drink, party and much more! The tour went for as long as we felt comfortable, and we didn't feel rushed at all, like we would on other tourist tours. Our guides accommodated all our whims and queries with ease, we would HIGHLY recommend discovering Budapest in such and exciting and unique tour!

2 hours tour. We were 5 persons from 2 families age 10 to 43. None of us had any experience with segways. But very friendly staff and guides gave us basic training and off we went.A fantastic way to get to the Citadelle and the castle. Must be the best viewpoint.

Fantasic service and tour guiding. First time trying segway.Tok a 2 hour trip to the cittadele. Super guide and teacher 30 min to learn and fantastic fun. Abseluttly recomend this place. Service was super. I'l be back

great fun day out. I did a 2 hour tour with a few friends of the Buda side...It was so much fun. Our guides were patient in training us as we had never done it before and also they were very friendly and that made it very enjoyable. I would have like a little bit more about the history as we were going around. Having said that, I had a great 2 hours and good way of seeing everything

Fantastic tour. We were first welcomed by an young man, who explained us everything, learned us the seaway. The guide took us to many places and up to the castle, as well he told us a little about the city. The man was really nice to talk with, and we had a really good time on the segway. Thanks for a fantastic day ;)

Segway is FUN to ride!.
