Great experience with very friendly tour guides: Nagy Eszter and Emese Potonyi!Our guides was very patient in training us on the Segway (first timers) and gave us plenty of time to take pictures at all sites.They were very friendly and helpful!This tour was really worth while got to see a lot of the city and we got a lot of information about the history of Budapest.The equipment was easy to use. This is a fun activity,We would recommend this company!
Segway tour around downtown. It was a great tour with a great tour Guide! I saw the Heroses Square, and another nice places. I will go back in the next year!Many Thanks!Barna

Segway is the BEST way to visit all of Budapest with a family of 4 (15 and 8 year old children).. Andrew and his team were AWESOME!!! Andrew was an awesome guide, knowledgable, very patient and caring. The only way to get around Budapest...We loved it!!! Thanks - The Jolly's

Very nice trip up to the castle. I booked for my first segway experience a private trip up to the castle. After a good introduction we went throught the city up the castle hill.Great views, not to difficult, not to easy.Time for pictures and as an personal wish, a coffee, were given and after that we went down again and back on another bridge.All in all: best trip this year so far, so strongly recommended!

Castle Segway tour. So I'm going to start off with the main reason I gave them a two. Our tour guide did not speak English. She spoke Italian. We speak English. I will say they were very nice and tried but we did not learn anything about what we saw besides the name of 3 places. We did Segway in Prague and loved it so thought we would do it here. Waste of money if we wanted to know anything. I did tell them at beginning of tour we could come back later for a guide who spoke English but they said no it's ok. It was not ok.

Segway Trip to Hero’s Square. My family took the Best Way Segway tour to Hero’s square. We had wonderful guides and enjoyed both seeing points of interest along the tour and the informative conversation with our guides. We ended up in the park and found an open area where we could take the Segways out in the open area for a while (very fun). We (me, my wife and two teenage children) all really had a great time! As a result, we would definitely recommend this activity and Best Way Segway Budapest!

Highly Recommend!. Had a nice and friendly guide. She was very sweet. Segway was a great way to see the city for a couple of hours. As it was our first time on a segway, my husband & I were slightly anxious prior to the tour but with our encouraging, friendly and hilarious guide , we were taught all the manoeuvres very quickly and gained confidence by conquering our fears! And the day after, we rented Scooter, So much fun! highly recommend it!

THE BEST WAY IS SEGWAY. This incredibly imaginative way to tour the city is great and it's easy to get the hang of it this was our fist time on a segway and with the coaches help we felt as if it we were experts, all of the hosts are very talkative and have a vast knowledge of Budapest so all there is to say is that the best way is segway. It is the best way to tour the city. I completely recommend anyone to go on this fun filled tour of the city.

Great segway tour!. We just did a great segway tour in downtown Budapest. Absolutely the best way to do sightseeing This was our first time on a segway, but our friendly and fun tour guides quickly showed us how to drive it. This was so fun! We will definitely do this again
Downtown tour . Great guides and good fun! The way and people to do sightseeing with in Budapest! Recomended!
Great downtown tour :). Went on the Downtown tour and it was great. The guides were really good and took good care of us new beginners Was a great way to do some city sightseeing.

Segway tour of Budapest. Seven of us went on a Segway tour to the citadel, segways were top notch and well up to the job of the long climb, guides were attentive and informative, excellent way to see the city and excellent service throughout.Highly recommended service :)

Best way to see Budapest!!. 6 of us took the 'Best Segway' Tour around Budapest today, it was absolutely beautiful! Our tour guide was super friendly and very informative!! We took to Castle tour which was 2.5hrs long, we actually ended up being out for around 3.5 for no extra charge. Plenty of opportunities to stop and see the sights aswell as a stop at the castle for a drink. Highly recommended!! Thank you David!!!Good luck with your wedding next week!! xxx

What a great tour!!!. We had an excellent time on the Segway tour. Our guides were so much fun and had great information to share with us on our tour. For some of us it was our first time on a Segway and our guides were very patient and kind as we learned. I highly recommend a tour with Best Way! You will have such a great time!
Segway tour. It was a great pleasure high quality segway tour! We enjoyed it very much and recommend it to everyone visiting Budapest!)))
Great team! Really fun. Professional team with good safety instructions. We were with 6 children (7-17) and 3 instructors. Great! Good price: reduction from €60>€50/Segway (6 Segways).

Great tour to the citadel with friendly guide. We were a party of four and Baila was our guide. He was friendly and knowledgeable and we had a great time. We were particularly glad to have done the citadel this way as it saved us a long trek up the hill and there was nothing that we needed to go inside to see, so segue was a great way to see this part of Budapest. We felt safe throughout and it was great fun for all ages (we were aged 40-65).
Best way to see Budapest!. We had a great time exploring Budapest. Trying Segway for the first time, made it an unforgettable experience. Thanks to our wonderful guides!!

Best segway equipment we have used!. We try to take a segway tour in every country we visit. Bestway Segway had the latest X2 models that ran really well. The fatter tires were great for cobblestone paths and made for a much more comfortable tour without losing any of the speed of the slightly smaller I2 models. They had a nice selection of tour durations as well and a variety of tour itineraries so that you could really customize and get the most for your money. Conveniently located around the corner from the Marriott hotel. The tour buses point out the sights through the windows but you can get "up close and personal" on the segway!

Super ride and fantastic guides. We had a fantastic ride arround Budapest. Totally enjoyable! Special thanks to our guides Andreas and Mercedes, they did a brillant Job. We had so much fun and could also go offroad. Best choice for everyone! Best greetings:-*

Amazing Tour. My boyfriend really wanted to do it but I was a bit nervous to try it. David was so helpful and really patient. It takes no time at all to pick it up and before we knew I was really comfortable. David and the other guys had amazing English, the tour was really fun and we stopped off for some bits of history but not too much standing around which was great. We did the downtown tour and will most definitely be going back to do the Castle or Citadel before we leave!Without doubt DO IT! Throughly recommended from someone who hates tours but loved this!

The best part of our fabulous trip to Budapest. Had a 2 hour round trip to the Castle area of Buda. Baila was our guide and he was great. We had time to look around when we wanted and gave us loads of information about Budapest along the way. Beautiful sights and a fantastic experience. Definitely recommend this company whole heartedly!

Best way to get around budapest!. Our hotel directed us to this company. Such a great way to get around all the sights, excellent knowledge from our friendly guide who spoke fantastic english. The segways were easy to use and manuevre. Safety and guest comfort was high on the agenda in terms of helmets and gloves (which were helpful agist the spring wind). Thanks David, really enjoyed our time today.

Fantastic!. Was approached by a man on a segway on the river side. Told us lots about the tours and let us have a little go on the segway, we were hooked instantly! Did the longest 3 hour tour, had plenty of stops to learn more about the area and a few rest stops to stretch our legs. Overall fantastic time and would definitely do it again!

Superb Segway experience. My wife and 2 sons selected Best Way Segway for a tour of the city. Andrew (the tour guide) was superb. We all had a great time and saw parts of this beautiful city that we might otherwise not have seen. Andrew's knowledge, manner and courteousness were excellent and definitely added to our great experience

Amazing Experience. We were all a little unsure of the segway, but we were instantly put at ease when our guide gave us a simple but thorough training at the start. We were off! A great way to see the city and the guide (whose name we sadly did not get) was friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful when I stopped paying attention and fell off the thing. Completely my fault but they handled it brilliantly. Great fun and will DEFINITELY do this again. Five stars for the staff - just great!

Awesome experience!. This really was great. The guide and the staff in general is extremly nice and helpful. We did the castle tour and it was a great way to see the fantastic sights. We had a bit of bad luck with the weather as it was cold and windy but despite of that we had an awesome time. Don't miss it!

Superb experience. 6 of us spoke to the manager and he was very helpful! Managed to arrange an hour long tour of Budapest, the two tour guides gave us an introduction and practice on the segways with lots of helpful tips.We set off on our tour along the river and up to the Parliament House. This was thoroughly enjoyable and I would recommend to anyone wanting to see the city! My only regret is we didn't book the 2 hour tour! Would go again great time

Great experience of Budapest. Last week we did a tour through Budapest, since this was the only day we were there we would like to do a city tour and we found Best Segway Tour! It was amazing, the guide was very relaxed and since we are youngsters this suited us very good. They weren't very strict in riding the segway if it was safe. Thanks again!

Absolutely amazing Segwaying. This was even more fun than I thought it would be (and I thought it would be great). So much fun driving the segway. Great tour route and loads to see. Really friendly staff. David was great. Answered all our odd questions. Thank you so much. Recommend this to anyone. Dont be scared its so much fun and really easy to get the hang of.
Best Way Segway . This Was so amazing, the whole city has amazing atmosphere. Lot of statues, bars. Guides were very kind. I Could recommend for everyone.
Budapest . Amazing tour, with amazing guide! I will come back. Exelent service, with original Segway X2! Panorama from Castle is beautiful.

Not to miss!!!. My partner and I had the pleasure of doing this tour and least to say we were not disappointed! We went and saw some other Segway companies but none were as friendly and welcoming as best way! Our tour guide David was exceptionally friendly, reassuring (I'm nervous with everything) and knowledgeable. We were put at ease straight away and had such a giggle. David knew the best photo spots and some lovely hidden gems you would never discover on your own. It was exceptional value compared to the rest too. I sincerely couldn't rate this experience and tour guide high enough! Simply perfect and a must do for all ages and abilities!!!!

Best Segway Budapest. One of these best things we did in Budapest was this tour. Andrew and his team that run it were great guides and very helpful throughout. You can have a choice of routes and lengths of time depending on what you want to do. We took the trip to the citadel which is one of the highest points. Highly recommend it and by doing it on Segway , its fun ad you get to see more and photograph more. It is also really good value for money. it is also an easy thing to master and good for all ages. A must for anyone visiting the city.

Very Friendly, Safe, Fun, Great Time for All. I booked the Segway tour in advance after a number of email exchanges with the owner. He was very friendly and answered all of my questions before-hand (specifically, whether or not the youngest kids would be able to participate).On the day of the tour, our group of one adult and three kids (13, 11, 6) arrived and were greeted warmly by Bela and Esther. Though we had all ridden Segways before, they took the time to give a refresher course to us. The two older kids had their own Segway while the 6 year old rode with me.The tour was customized to meet our needs as we wanted to see the castle and a particular memorial. It was about 30 degrees fahrenheit so we had several stops during the tour for coffee and warming-up. All along, Bela and Esther were great hosts and kept the kids entertained. There was a perfect balance between history lesson and just having fun.I would highly recommend using this outfit for Segway tours in Budapest. It's a fun way to see the city.
Bp 1152 Régi posta utca 7-9. It was amazing ! They were very kind with us and friendly ! I really loved that!!!!!!! I was on a Castel tour at night !!!!!!!!!

Company Treasure Hunt. We had our American colleagues in Budapest for a visit and we wanted to show them the city in an entertaining way (plus we, as locals who already know the basic touristy spots, wanted to have some fun ourselves). This is how the idea of a treasure hunt came up. We found Underguide and they indeed did a wonderful job! We were divided into three groups and explored downtown Pest in search of treasures. The tasks were surprising and we were challenged in many different ways. Eventually all of us got immersed in the game. On the way from one spot to the next we were taking photos of the sunset and simply enjoyed each others company and the buzz of the city. It is a great memory and it was a good way to get to know my city and my co-workers better. I definitely recommend it as a team building programme.

Kids concur the castles tour. Our tour with underguide was fantastic! Or tour guide Joe was extremely knowledgeable and great with the kids. We all got something out of the trip. The adults gained great insight into the castle area of Budapest and the kids were thoroughly captivated in their "hunt". I would strongly recommend this type of trip for people traveling to the area with smaller children.

Wonderful guide!. I was looking for something very specific in a guide: a qualified tour guide who is also a photography instructor (I want to improve my camera skills). Zsuzsa was both of these. She's very knowledgable about Budapest, as you'd expect, and is a professional photographer. I really appreciated her flexibility is designing the tour. She sat down with me before starting and asked lots of questions about what my interests were, what kinds of places I had in mind, etc. After we began to walk, she modified our itinerary in response to my reactions. I couldn't ask for a better guide. Not only did she show me around and explain what we were seeing, but she also gave me the confidence to explore Budapest on my own for the next three days. And we had wonderful conversations. A wonderful guide and a splendid companion.

Budapest Go Local Tour . Our tour guide Jozsef was exceptional and extra ordinary guide. He's knowledge concerning Budapest was intreaging and profound. Time flied while walking around the beautiful city and we had so much fun!

GoLocal walking food tour. My boyfriend and I had an excellent time on a private food tour of Budapest with our lovely guide, Anetta. The staff at Underguide was really kind when we misunderstood where to meet our guide and she came to find us! She asked questions about what we do, why we were in the city, and what we wanted out of the tour and then we set off, on a perfectly personalized tour! Anetta pointed out historical landmarks and gave us some history of Budapest as we walked from a market to a restaurant to a cafe and finally, to a bar. Everything we ate was delicious and they were all locations we never would have found on our own. Anetta was wonderful to talk with all night, as well. Thanks so much, Anetta!

GoLocal! Tipsy Budapest Private Tour. What a fantastic evening, our guide Orsi was brilliant, she was really easy company and planned the perfect night for us. We visited four very different Ruin bars and enjoyed each one. We were only in Budapest for 2 nights and this tour was a great way to see parts of the city we would have never been able to find ourselves in an evening. Can't recommend the tour and Orsi enough, will definitely be returning.

Highly recommended walking tour of Budapest.. We took a private walking tour of Budapest in order to help us orientate ourselves in a city we had never visited before. Our guide, Joszef, took us around Budapest on what could only be described as a highly informative and very interesting tour of the city. Joszef is very knowledgeable and this made for an incredibly enjoyable tour. As we were on the tour, he would divert us to places that we had mentioned or that he thought would be interesting to see. His information about the city made it really easy for us to get around on our own in the days after that. Not only did he make this a really good day out, but both of the suggestions he made for places to eat were exactly as he said they would be. Joszef was very astute in his recommendations to us and this can only come from someone who knows how to read people correctly and suggest things that they would find enjoyable.We would highly recommend to anyone visiting Budapest for the first time to book a private tour with Underguide in order to really get to grips to the city.

Great local guide. Booked this quite last minute on Viator. Our guide was a lady named Borcsa. She wanted to give us more a historical tour of Budapest from the old city, Jewish quarter and ending up on the Parliament House. I initially wanted to to tour the Castle District and the Heroes square area. I found this walking tour was very well conducted and we really know a lot of the history of Budapest and the significant of the area. We covered the Castle district and Hero's Square by ourselves in which we really needed such a guide. This type of walking tour allows you to know the heart beat of the city a lot better then just visiting the normal tourist sites of Budapest.

Great day in Budapest. My wife and I visited Budapest this October for 3 nights.Our hotel The Balatzar recommended Underguide for ourtour of the city.We booked a 6 hour tour complete with a guide vehicle and driver.Our guides name was Fanni and she was simply outstanding.Fanni made the day informative enjoyable and truly interesting.Our drive was very professional and polite.It was one of our best days on our 5 week European adventure.Bob & CoraCanada

Go Local Budapest: Great Private Tasting Tour. Antónia was a great and knowledgeable guide. The tasting tour is highly recommendable if you want to taste different local food at places which you would not visit by your own. Don't eat anything before...you'll get enough! Thanks for the great tour.

Great Historical Tour. We scheduled our tour on our first day in Budapest and our guide, Levente, provided us with a wealth of information! The history he shared about Budapest allowed us to understand and appreciate the city on an entirely new level.

Perfect way to experience the city . Levente was a great guide with lots of information. We were really good we had the opportunity to get a tour with him and go to places we'd never be able to go on our own. Levente will feel like your friend from the instant you meet him. We did the tipsy tour and saw some very cool bars that seemed very hip and local. His navigation of the city is impeccable. We were particularly impressed with his timing of the trains. The second we'd get to the station it would arrive. This way we maximized our tour and got to try some delicious brewed and wines, local drinks that we were very happy to have the experience of trying. Levente and this tour is impressive and you will love doing this tour.

Poor in all areas. As a large group of friends (13) travelling to the city, we were excited by the prospect of this tour. In the lead up to our trip, Budapest Underguide were excellent with regards to replying to queries and tailoring a tour to our requirements. However, at the point of service, this excellence was not translated. Although clearly an interesting character, Levente's English was not at the level I would expect for a tour guide and he was not proficient in leading a group. He often began talking about sites whilst people were yet to arrive at the point in question and it was often very difficult to hear what he was saying. Added to this, the company had sent him a different itinerary to the one that I had been sent - I had been promised that a drink and a 'surprise' were included in the package, neither of which were provided. As well as this, I had expressed an interest in more contemporary features of the city - of which none were visited. To be fair to Levente, when it was realised that this mistake had been made, he was very regretful and he worked overtime to help us in doing some shopping at a supermarket. However, the itinerary mix up is such a basic mistake especially considering the price, and although this price was reduced, there is no way that €20 per head was justified. Having visited Budapest in the past, I would strongly recommend the free walking tour over this service as it offers a more organised and clearer experience of the attractions in the city.

PERFECT. For me the tour was perfect. Levente spoke great Spanish and English. He has great knowledge of history and culture. I had specified what I wanted to see and in 4 hours had the exact overview I requested.I strongly recomend this.

Deli Tour. Good choice to get a good cultural impression of the city and a great culinary taste of the country. Our guide Anetta was very friendly, experienced and open-minded. We felt like a friend showed us around her city! We never had an akward silence during the night (and it was a long night) and she knew everything about the important facts of hungarian history (in a perfect english and sometimes even in german). We can highly recommend it!

Budapest Christmas Market -- directly outside the InterContinental Hotel. Very nice market! There was live jazz music, lots of local handicrafts (music boxes, Christmas decorations) and lots of food stalls selling sausages, goulash, bratwurst, and on and on. One food item I have never seen anywhere before: chimney cakes. The cake batter/dough is applied to conical cylinders and then cooked over a charcoal fire. Before serving, they are rolled in what looked like a sugar/cinnamon mix and then dropped off the cylinders into a bag. Becuase they batter is scored before baking, the customer can easily pull off strips to nibble on.

Excellent private tour. Underguide is very different from your average tour. It is tailored to your interests and costs Euro79 for up to 4 people for 4 hours. I answered the questionnaire and marked art and architecture as my main interests and was appropriately assigned Virag as my guide. As I understood, most of the guides at Underguide have other jobs. Virag, for example, works on art and cultural projects and is much in the know with the contemporary art scene. It was interesting to speak to her on normal every day life in Hungary. Who knew, unless you are up-to-date with world news, that there is so much discontent with the present government. Perhaps she didn't know every fact and date for the buildings and historical sights but who really cares when you can read that yourself in a guide book?

Amazing. Visited Budapest with friends two weeks just can't do it justice,the tour bus very good and must, river cruise also transport links with two week ticket for about £16 never waited more than 5mins for tram endless squares,bars and eating places, history more than you could ever take in. Spa's loads of them and very cheap it is a must visit place that we can't wait to go back to so enjoy

Tailored to your interests and great guides!. Although you can also use this very clever, client oriented company to organize corporate events we only used them for a walking tour for the two of us. Before we left home we told them what our interests were and they ensured that we daw those things - several of which wouldn't have been on a traditional tour. We were picked up (on foot) at our hotel and walked through the residential area where our guide grew up and even saw her high school which was interesting. For long distances we hoped on trams or the subway. She took us to the Shoe Memorial along the Danube which was very moving. It's where the Nazis made Jews line up, remove their shoes and then they were shot in the back and fell into the Danube which carried their bodies away. We also went up the hill on the Buda side of the river and saw magnificent views from the Fisherman's Bastion and walked through some charming streets. I could go on and on but the basic thing is that this is a personalized, fun and informative experience that I highly recommend. Just be sure to wear comfortable walking shoes that can cushion your feet on cobblestones.

Budapest harbour. We were fortunate to be on a Danube river cruise & were able to see Budapest from the river at night. It was a wonderful experience with all the buildings on both sides of the river fully illuminated - The beautiful architecture of the Parliament, Royal Palace, Castle, etc. as well as other buildings& bridges, including the famous Chain Bridge., all reflected in the water. The whole effect was magical & unforgettable. Next morning the views of both Buda &Pest were lovely by daylight in the early misty air. Our coach tour of the city & an opportunity to explore on foot, as well as a visit to the fabulous Matthias church were well worth while.

Nice to see an other side of Budapest. If you don't like the default tourists tours, this might be worthwhile for you to do. You get questions that you often need to ask locals and teaches you something of the rich history of this great city.

Walking tour of Budapest. The best part of our trip was a 4 hour walking tour with Reka. It's really worth the money to be taken around town by an articulate and friendly local and have the city opened up for you. A great way to start a long weekend in town. You can tailor your trip, they ask you lots of questions before so that the tour suits you and the things you would like to do. We opted for art galleries, cafes and markets and had a great time - definitely we wouldn't have found these places without her.

Get to know the city with locals. We went to Budapest and were ready to explore some of it's fascinating points. I do not think a hop on bus is the most exciting way to discover the city. We hired Budapest Underguid to help us discover the city, and they really know the secrets of Budapest living to get a perfect stay. We did a bike trip and had several meals with a guide from Underguide. I have to give my love to the knowledgeable, fun and charming guides. We learned a lot of stories during our tour around the city and they did bring us to many really nice restaurants. Very good food and everything preordered to avoid queuees and to save time. We also got lot of tips on bars and pubs and where to shop. It is also interesting to be with locals just to get to know what hungarians are like. And again, the guides are really great :-)

Tipsy tour with Verus. Verus made our trip to Budapest! She was so knowledgable, friendly and intuitive to our needs for this tour. She took us to places we wouldn't have been able to find for ourselves, and explained the history and origin of the spots and the drinks. We had open and honest conversations about culture, city and our perspectives. She personalized the tour to what we were looking for, it's not your typical pub crawl! Very unique places that were significant to the Budapest experience. She added a personal touch that allowed us to connect to the people and the city in a way we wouldn't have otherwise. This tour is HIGHLY recommended. Do it!! Palinka, fröccs, and pickle shots!

The real Budapest. There is no better way to get to know a city than to walk around it with a local. Our guide, Bogata, met us at the hotel and we walked and chatted to her for 4 hours. There were six of us and I had already been asked by email what our interests are and if there were any sights in particular we wanted to see. Budapest is a great city to explore and we got a real overview of Buda and Pest. We also had the best coffee and cake in a tiny cafe that we would not have ventured into without Bogata. I would highly recommend Underguide.

A great tour of Budapest with Eszter. With only a day to learn as much of the city as possible, we decided to take a walking tour with a professional guide rather than doing it ourselves. Turned out to be a great decision. Our tour guide Eszter Talabér was wonderful. She met the group at a local hotel and asked where we were from and made an effort to remember. Throughout the tour she referred to us as Pittsburgh, or Italy etc, which is a neat trick that makes one feel special. From the hotel we walked the chain bridge to the Buda side and saw many exciting sites on that end. We then boarded the metro train back to the Pest side where the tour continued. Mid way through the tour we stopped at a local bar and had a beer (or wine depending on preference). The cost was reasonable and included the drink and train tickets. Eszter is energetic and engaging and has a wealth of information on Budapest. More interactive than the big bus tour. I would highly recommend Eszter. I also recommend to wear comfortable shoes.

Easter in Budapest. This year according with my husband,we elected to spend the Easter in Budapest.Not far from my city (Timisoara),about 300km,Budapest looks the best choice for a 2-3 days trip.We both knew very well the famous touristic attractions of Hungary's capital.The St.Stephan Basilica,the Parliament House,the Royal Palace,the "Chain bridge",the Millenary monument,Zoo,Hunyadi Palace,the Fisher's Bastion,Mathias church and many sapid restaurants with excellent spiced Hungarian dishes.Of course,for a newcomer is few 2-3 days,but we are constantly visitors of Budapest.Admire please what we saw!

Underguide is THE best guide to Budapest. Forget about Lonely Planet and all the other books. The guides from underguide give a concentrated, knowledgeable and unique introduction to Budapest, Hungary and her people. Suzy and Elza were my amazing guides, and I could not have been happier. They are both fabulous, fun and very smart women, who have a vast knowledge about art history, architecture, Jewish history, Hungarys history and food. My trip to Budapest was hightened with these two brilliant women. Whenever I am going to Budpast again, I will turn to Underguide again.

The Jewish Budapest Now and Then Tour Was Excellent!. Our tour guide, Palma was wonderful. She was knowledgeable and clearly put a lot of energy and effort into making our tour exactly what we hoped it would be. She was also a lot of fun, and it was wonderful to experience this part of Budapest with a local. I highly recommend Budapest Underguide and Palma in particular!

Specialized event for a small group. Underguide had organized informal part of our regional meeting in Budapest. Everybody was 100% satisfied with all of the program. Thank you Pálma, thank you Zsófia for the great event!

Peter. Peter, thanx for THE Nice tour in Buda and in Pest, i enjoy it very good,
Hè knows a lot of THE history, and hè is just living 5 years in this beautiful country,
Good Luck Peter
Renards Henry from THE Netherlands

Must do!. A delayed review (we traveled a year ago) but always thought that we had to write about this brilliant company. Our guide (sorry forgot her name!) tailor made our walk, took us to some hidden treasures and was very knowledgeable about the area and history. She was warm and friendly and we even went for a few drinks after our tour had finished. To some it might sound a little expensive, but I guarantee that it's well worth it!

Delicatessen walking tour. My husband, myself and our 3 college kids did this tour 2 days ago in budapest. There was a bit of miscommunication as to meeting place. We were sent an email to meet in our hotel lobby but the guide was waiting for us outside our hotel. After 6 minutes he came inside. The guide was very young and friendly , we asked him to take us to a pharmacy to get sunscreen so our middle son didn't burn. We started out at a small deli type store that was so hot we had to wait outside. We then moved to a place where we tried sausage, very tasty, but I was shocked that it was 93 degrees out and eggs are left out on the counter, not refrigerated. Huge health issue there!! Our guide was surprised when we said the US health department would shut you down for that. Then we went to a really cool building that we thought was a train station, but it was a massive food market. We had delicious langos and a Hungarian cabbage dish. From there we went to a nice sit down restaurant for dessert. It was a lot of fun and a great way to explore a city

Get your Bearings!. We just came back from a multi-city hop through Europe starting with Budapest. We took the "walking city discovery tour" as soon as we hit the city and it turned out to be one of the smartest things we did. In reality it was a four hour crash course in "Budapest" we us getting the lay of the city, learning the Metro, etc enabling us to to really settle into a routine quickly and to smartly plan the remainder of the trip. In addition we saw "local" sites we wouldn't have otherwise seen. Our guide Agnes was on time, energized and a pleasure to be with. She was really great. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Budapest!!

Great introduction to Budapest. Our guide Veronika was very knowledgeable, gave us lots of historical perspective and pointed out many interesting features which we would certainly not have found without a guide. For anyone on a short break this sort of introduction is invaluable. HIghly recommended!

Wonderful Budapest City Tour. We had an excellent experience touring Budapest with our fabulous guide Scilla. The city is gorgeous and Scilla was extraordinary - knowledgeable of the history of the city, super friendly and attentive to details, went way beyond the call of duty, and also speaks perfect English. We highly recommend Budapest Underguide and Scilla.

Budapest in Xmas was lovely!. We had an excellent tour w/ Orsolya, who took us around the Jewish Quarter as many of the main attractions were closed due to the holiday. She was incredibly friendly and was happy to adjust the tour to our desires as we went along, which was great. She has a great working knowledge of the city and its history and we picked her brain on the local mentality, which is something you can only get from a local (duh!). Anyways, I would happily go on the tour again if we ever venture back to Budapest and highly recommend it to any new comers!

Christmas in Budapest. Underguide tour in Budapest was really nice way to get to know the city. Even we had bad luck with the weather we really enjoyed walking around with our guide. She showed us many intresting places and always stopped to tell some history of those. Sundays christmas market, in one of the ruin pubs, was unique thing to see and it was one of many things we wouldnt find our own. So I highly recommend Underguide tour to everyone who want to feel the spirit of Budapest:) Budapest was awesome! Definetly going back some day!

Deli Tour. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour and would recommend to anyone who wants to get off the beaten path and enjoy local cuisine. Our guide Veronika was very knowledgeable about the city`s history and architecture as well, making the experience educational both in terms of Budapest`s history and cuisine.

Art nouveau. This was an excellent and enjoyable tour with a friendly and knowledgeable guide. Mostly walking which is the best way to enjoy Budapest, with some tram rides. Our guide Orsolya took us to hidden art nouveau and Lechner gems, as well as to buildings that are well-known. Highly recommended!

A spectacular evening in Budapest. I took the Budapest GoLocal tour and I fully recommend it. My Guide Csilla made a fantastic job in showing me the nicest places in the city, telling me the amazing stories behind every corner and setting a truly friendly environment. Moreover, she was always available to kindly solve all sort of practical problems I had as a newcomer. Csilla handled it to make a fully-proficient Budapestian out of me in just a few hours, which really improved my experience the rest of my stay in the city. Touring with someone that enjoys her job and her city so much really made a difference.You guys say to offer an experience of traveling just like visiting a friend, and I’d say like visiting a very close one. Thanks Underguide for a wonderful evening in the beautiful city of Budapest!Felix M

Budapest- from the eyes of a local!. When I travel I think it is very important to get a taste of the local culture and flair of my destination. I found the Budapest Underguide online and I figured it was worth a shot. I booked online and opted for the GoLocal tour option. On the form I provided the various aspects of Budapest that I was interested in- art, quirky shopping, Jewish historical sites, etc. I am a solo, female traveler so I figured this one-on-one tour would be a great introduction to the city. My tour guide, Cilla, met me in the lobby of my hotel at our arranged meet-up time. This is great because I had yet to venture out on the public transport. Cilla even brought me some typical Hungarian sweets as a little treat. :) Off we went to the bus to head into the city. We spent over five hours wandering around the city on foot and on all forms of public transit. I got very acquainted with the ins-and-outs of the subway system so I was able to get around easily during the rest of my time in Budapest. Cilla was very knowledgeable and the tour really did seem like I was walking around with a friend! It was so much fun and really opened my eyes to what Budapest has to offer. I also made sure to try many local foods and drinks during our tour. I loved having a "native" bring me around and introduce me to so many wonderful foods I never would have known about on my own! I also got a little lesson in Hungarian language- very fun. Budapest Underguide is honestly one of the best aspects of my trip to Europe this summer.When I inevitably return to Hungary with my Mom, I want to do another Underguide tour that offers a different "theme."Thank you Cilla!

Personal Art Tour. I was really looking forward to this tour since both my traveling partner and I enjoy looking at art, especially local artists. We were looking at activities one week prior and after contacting Underguide, they had sent us a questionnaire asking us about what periods of art we were into, what medias, and other things that we were interested in seeing. We were especially interested a private tour since we were curious to explore more of the "underground" art, and learn how Hungarians suffered from artistic expression for the latter half of the 20th, and the exodus of creative minds. I think we had high expectations just from the questionnaire itself. Zsuzsa was supposed to be our guide for the tour and we were pleased to hear that she was into photography. However, she was ill the day of our tour and Orsi was our last minute replacement. I wonder if our schedule was the same or not, but of the galleries that we visited, most of them were closed, or not really worthy to be included on a tour since they had no exhibitions, or they were just pointless. Orsi tried her best and I think that she was very helpful and knowledgeable about Budapest and history in general, but not for the type of tour that we had asked for. It would have been appropriate to have a guide that had more of an art history background, and who made sure that all the galleries that we wanted to attend were actually open. The main reasons I am not rating this tour poor is because we were to a local gallery that was artist owned and operated, with very friendly curators, who were willing to let us browse through books and rooms in the back. They had an amazing collection and I got to see some beautiful pieces that I would not have seen in the local museum. The gallery was called "Prestige Gallery" and I strongly urge everyone to check it out if they have the time. Second reason is that were had some delicious expresso as a pick me up at Printa. While we were there, we read about a shoe shop with vintage Hungarian sneakers from the communist era and wanted to buy some shoes, so we made a pit stop over there for a while. It took longer than we thought, but we were still able to get through the tour on time (but only because everything else was closed). I think that this tour in particular could be improved. There were some excellent sites along the way it was very relaxing, and I did learn a few new Hungarian artists. Prestige Gallery was the highlight of the tour for us.

Worthwhile tour. My husband Jay and I spent 2 and a half days in Budapest in April 2012 and used Budapest Underguide not once but twice . Our guide Zsuzsa Bakonyi took us on a 2-3 hour walking tour of the sites pointing out many architectural details and historical buildings that we never would have found on our own. She was very knowledgeable, spoke several languages and was fun to be with. The next evening we went on underground tour of the nightlife and found that to be very enjoyable as well. She recommended we visit other cities in Hungary, PECS and Balaton. We fit them into our schedule and we are glad we did. Underground guides provides a efficient, interesting and fun way of seeing the sites. We have a greater appreciation and understanding of Hungary and that part of the Eastern Europe

Excellent tour, great way to see Budapest. I highly recommend Budapest Underguide. This was my first time in Budapest. Booking the tour was easy via the website. My tour guide, Esther, was great. I was particularly interested in world war 2 history and the history of communism in Hungary--so she focused on this. But I was also able to learn about many different aspects of Budapest. My only suggestion would be for the company to add a link on their website to allow customers to pay directly via PayPal. Overall a great experience.

Great tour!. Our guide, Ferenc Tarr, took my parents and me on a six-hour tour of Budapest. All of us enjoyed the tour--he was very informative and patient in answering all of our questions and provided us with a really interesting perspective of Hungary's history and place in the world. He spoke great English. I would recommend this tour to people looking for alternatives to the multitude of hop-on/hop-off tours that are available in Budapest. I will definitely do another underguide tour if I return to Budapest.

Road, Rail And Sea Approved!. We were visiting Budapest to gather content for our new website http://www.roadrailandsea.co.ukand we were put in touch with Underguides by the Hungarian Tourist Office. Our guide was brilliant. She showed us key areas of the city quickly and intelligently. She also was happy to bring her personal viewpoint to the tour which meant that is was the opposite of a soulless, corporate tour. By then end we felt like it was a friend showing us round. If you're only in the city for a short amount of time then booking a tour with Underguides is money very well spent. After the tour you'll have the knowledge and confidence to really visit the city on your own.Simon -Managing director Road, Rail And Sea

A very personal tour of Budapest. Zsusa was our guide for this 4 hour walking tour of Budapest concentrating solely on the Pest side. We walked along narrow cobbled streets and explored a side of Budapest not normally discovered. Our tour took in English and American history and Zsusa pointed out places of interest and statues that we would have overlooked. Zsusa also went to great lengths at the end of our tour to make sure our spa tickets were ready for us which we greatly appreciated. We can highly recommend Zsusa and her colleagues to provide anyone with a different insight to this wonderful city.

A wondefull private tour dedicated to contemporary art with Zita. The tour was a gift from a Hungarian friend and it was a great idea. The tour was specially elaborated for us around contemporary art in order to discover alternative places in Budapest. People met were all friendly and welcomed and places discovered were various and all intersteting.Zita our guide was nice and competent. Just try...

Truly enriching!. My brother and I went to Budapest for what was supposed to be a weekend of oblivion and instead of feeling isolated and foreign we ended up blending with the true essence of the city and we owe that to our very dedicated guide Vera S. with whom we discussed a variety of subjects from music to history to architecture while walking the streets of budapest as if we naturally belonged there. Allthat was derilict became beautiful and all that was nameless gained a meaning. Truly recomend. A heart-warming experience for those who loather guides with distorted microphones on top of a double-decker.

A photographer's dream. As a professional travel writer, I have been on a number of tours by this company, even though I live in the city. Last summer, I have the opportunity to complete four special Underguide tours sponsored by the EU celebrating architecture.Having lived here for 10 years, I thought that I would only be going through the motions, because there wouldn't be a thing they could show me that I have not already seen. I was blown away by all of the things they uncovered that I had no clue about. In addition, their knowledge base is incredible. They are a fabulous group and I make sure they are in all of my books.

Best idea ever. I took my wife to budapest for spring, just to get away for a couple of days. As a spur of the moment kind of thing, I called Underguide and asked for a guide to show us the real budapest, rather than just the touristic scenes.Zsuzsa our toorguide, a young dynamic very fun and entertaining guide showed us where to shop, where to do some sightseeing, and told us a lot of folktales and interesting stories.and by nightfall, we went partying budapest style.YOu get you're money's worth for an unforgettable holliday.

A fantastic tour. What a pleasure!Dieu merci:)My Underguide tour was so nice, my guide was perfect and she was speaking fluently german...!She gave me very interesting facts about Budapest, which made it not just Budapest for "hop on hop off tourists". It was her very own private Budapest. I recommend this tour to everybody, who is interested to see another view than the normal touristic one and hear the many secret stories of the city.Best regards from Vienna,Susanna

Fantastic and Unusual tailor made tour of City by knowledgable local guide". I had a tour of the city by an Underguide on 2nd March and thoroughly enjoyed it. The tour is made to your individual requirements so I said that I wanted to see parts of the city where locals would visit, see some unusal sights and sample local food and places to drink. The tour started with a trip of a market then followed some of the religious and university buildings with information on the changing political situation in Hungary and information of how joining Europe had affected the country, we stopped off for food in a quirk cafe and then visited some amazing little bars that I would never have found on my own in the arty bohemian part of the city. We visited the Opera house and chatted about life in the city. It was a real eye opener and something different to do. I don't like people reading from scripts or loads of historical facts so this trip was perfect for me, I'm sure my guide would have been able to provide me a lot more facts but I wanted to hear more fun stories and about the quirky side of the city. For the price it is very good value bearing in mind that the tour takes 4 hours, is carefully planned out and the guide is very experienced and highly trained. The office staff are very quick to respond to queries and requests.

Budget or luxury the city has both. Discover Budapest is worth doing, you learn a lot, you get to see places that would be difficult to get to otherwise, it can make your trip a lot more interesting, you get to see a lot more of the city.If you are on a budget you can chose a guide book and make use of the river ferry passenger boat service, a good option in Budapest. The scheduled service on the Danube is between Újpest and Millenniumi Városközpont with 8 stops North to South: Újpest - Meder utca - Árpád híd - Jászai Mari tér - Batthyány tér - Petőfi tér - Boráros tér - Millenniumi Városközpont, my last use of the boat cost me less than £2, so that's what you call a saving and you get to meet ordinary local people which for me is a big plus side of doing as the locals do. Transport links are pretty good here.

Hungaro Gastro - filling for the mind and body!. We had a great tour with Anniko(?) on Tuesday, August 2nd 2016. We were a fairly small group (3 plus one other and Anniko) which was very nice. Anniko took us through the Grand Market where we ate and drank a wide variety of Hungarian dishes (including Unicum, Langos and Hungarian sausages). We then took a walking tour through town where we stopped in a restaurant for lunch and then a coffee shop for dessert. We wrapped things up at a small wine bar for some tastings of some local wines. All along the way Anniko illustrated the landmarks with great descriptions. She was very personable and fun. I would recommend that if you take this tour you don't eat beforehand (like i did :-)). You will sample a lot of delicious food!
Nice tour but pricey. Our tour guide was very friendly. We were in Budapest for just a few days and wanted a tour. The prices are double of what is mentioned in the Rick Steves book.

Beautiful. The sites are absolutely stunning! The parliament and river are gorgeous and the history behind them are even more incredible. The shoe monument where Jews where killed is emotional and a real journeyAbsolutely recommend

Great evening walking tour with Balint (Balintine? Name Day 14th Feb?). I am assuming Balint is the name of the guide (we thought it was Balintin as his Name Day is 14th Feb). Fabulous tour. Nice walking from Opera House, church, parliament, along Danube to our boat ride. Balint was very informative, always smiling (even though we were the only two people on the tour) and gave us good tips on where to eat / drink etc. I hope the short Yoga lesson given by my wife to him will be equally beneficial to him. Thanks a lot.

Fabulous. We went on the 3.5 hour walking tour of the city and our tour guide George was a brilliant! The tour was interesting, informative and varied and we both thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. It is refreshing to see a tour guide with such knowledge and passion and we were both very impressed with the tour overall. Thank you George :)

Castle district/Mathis church tour . Frank was an excellent tour guide who was extremely knowledgeable on the history of Budapest. He was patient with us because we were 15 minutes late and had no way of contacting him since we didn't have a working phone. He was helpful by coming to pick us up, recommending us to good places to go during our visit, and by catering to our needs to ensure to get us to our other appointment on time. He still got us a ticket to see the Mathis church on our own time because otherwise we wouldn't have had time to go. I loved how the tour was so personable and was just me and my other friend with Frank as our guide. It was lovely having a break with cake and espresso as well. I definitely recommend this tour as well as Frank.

Castle District Tour with Frank . Best tour guide in Budapest!! Thoroughly enjoyed walking around town and talking to Frank! He was great at going at our pace, and every building, monument, or statue we pointed out he knew the history on. I like to ask a lot of questions, and being born and raised here Frank had all the answers! He even gave us contact information so we could get help and more recommendations after our tour ended! Overall an amazing experience, and I would highly recommend requesting Frank!

remarkable city. visited on a river cruise,and did a bus tour(provided by the cuise company) .we moored very near the chain bridge on the pest`side.the actual bus tour was over 2 hours.and took us to both sides of the danube, buda and pest.somebody described budapest as one of the worlds most beautiful citys,and i must agree.the magnificent buildings and structures are truly breathtaking and must be seen.an added joy was they were all lit up at night.wonderful.no talk of turning street lighting off here.

Walking tour with Balint. Just what I needed to orientate myself around the city as a first time visitor. Balint was an excellent guide. Always smiling and cordial and full of information. He wasn't rushing through anything and took time to show us around and highlight interesting point. Our patience was tested by some difficult visitors in our group but Balint was sooooo professional and he managed then most amicably without hurting anyone's feeling. On this alone I give Balint full points. I would recommend this tour for all visitors and ask for Balint!

A Great Way to Begin. The "Discover Budapest" walking tour was a perfect way to explore the city for the first time. Our guide was knowledgeable and pleasant- though she would have been better if she'd been equipped with a mic system. We hopped on the historic M1 line and took it from the Opera to Freedom Square. A walk through the City Park was delightful then back on the Metro to St. Stephen's Square and a strudel stop (included) nearby. A walk over the Chain Bridge and then up the stairs to the Castle was beautiful if a bit strenuous. We walked from the Castle complex to Matyas Church & the Fisherman's Bastion to end the tour (about 4 hours total), never entering a building but talking about them and history all the way. We spent our next three days in town feeling far more comfortable using public transport (a single ticket is good for unlimited rides on buses, trams and the metro for one or more days). We also were better oriented and earmarked places to which we subsequently returned.

Segway Tour of the Castle district in Buda. We took a short Segway tour of about an hour of the castle district. As my wife and I were with our 13 and 15 year olds this was long enough. We had a wonderful time despite the fact that it rained on us for the entire tour (a plastic rain poncho was provided). Our guide Balint was excellent!! His English was fantastic and he was able to address both the adults and the teens with items that interested each group. In addition to his guiding, Balint was interesting to speak with as we Segwayed along describing for us life in Budapest and Hungary today.The logistics and administrative aspects all ran smoothly. I would certainly work with them again.
Worth to cross on foot. I love the food there with attractive price. I've been there twice and still wish to visit Budapest again to discover any interesting thing. May be a concert next time?

Walking Tour With George Simply Superb!. I have done a fair few walking tours in many cities around the globe but I can honestly say that this is actually the best city tour I have ever been on! We chose Discover Budapest based on the excellent reviews and we were certainly not disappointed. Our tour guide George was absolutely brilliant! He had a great personality and explained everything so well in plenty of detail but also in a way that didn't bore your socks off! Even the part of the tour that he claimed to be the "boring part" (as a joke) when we went over to Hero's Square wasn't boring at all it was actually really interesting! He was very knowledgeable also when we enquired about restaurants and Hungarian wines to try. He took his time with everything he showed us, we didn't feel rushed at all and you definitely get the sense that he thoroughly enjoys the work he does, as he showed plenty of enthusiasm. Definitely go on a walking tour with Discover Budapest (especially if it's with George) well worth the money and it's great value for money also. The strudel place they take you to during the tour is so so good!!! YUM!!! Thank you George you were awesome!!!

Fantastic Budapest Segway Tour !!!!. Had our reservation yesterday with Discover Budapest, and from the moment we walked in the shop, which just happened to be located right next to the magnificent Grand Opera House, we were treated superbly. My wife and I hired a private guide named Balint. Can't say enough wonderful comments about this young man. Ran us through a short training and safety session to refresh our other Segway experience, very precise and helpful. He quizzed us as to where we had already been in Budapest and tailored our tour to new exciting sites ! Travels down busy Andrassy Ave. , stopping to talk history and architecture, culture and more . On to Heroes Square with detailed and fascinating review of each of 14 Kings and Rulers from Hungarian history. Ask Balint a question , he gave answers and more ! he was attentive, engaging, polite and often quite humerous ! On to the famous Szechenyi Baths, back down other side of Avenue, stopping at House of Terror for review of the terrible /Soviet occupation, wow !! On to Freedom Square, the Bascilica and surrounding sites . This was just a very fun and exciting 3 hours with Balint, if you go, try to have him guide. Most importantly, he was ever conscientious of safety while on roads, bike paths and sidewalks, and courteous to citizens and other travelers on tour !!!!!! We plan another Discover tour by Segway when we get to Prague,you cannot beat this mode of tour for fun, information getting the feel of a city, our favorite !!!!!

Enchanting Yet Modern. Cruised through 4 countries on the Danube and ended in Budapest. The City is a combination of old and new, restaurants and service were excellent. We did our own walking tours, walked for miles, good exercise and ranks with Vienna and Prague, although Prague is my favorite. We traveled last summer just before the immigration challenge, so can't comment if that has changed the ambiance.

Walking tour with Balint. Balint was an excellent guide: really friendly, full of interesting facts and made the history accessible. He was extremely patient and answered non stop questions. We had a longer and saw far more than expected. Excellent strudel too! Highly recommended.

Budapest Night Walking Tour and River Cruise. My boyfriend and I showed up for the Budapest Night Walking Tour and River Cruise to find out that no one else had registered. We were worried that the tour would be cancelled but were instead surprised to learn that we would be getting the guide to ourselves for a "private tour"! We were blown away by how informative and knowledgeable our guide Brigit was. Brigit answered all of our questions about the history of Budapest and Hungary (and provided great restaurant and nightlife recommendations!). My boyfriend and I agreed that this tour was instrumental in contextualizing the history and architecture of the city for our subsequent explorations. It was the highlight of our Budapest trip and we would definitely recommend it to any visitors! Just as a note- the river cruise was hosted by a separate company and while the views were beautiful, it was a bit difficult to follow along with their audio guide. That being said, the walking part of the tour was so great that we really didn't care!

An informative and personal guide to budapests history. The second day of our trip to Budapest we went on the hammer and sickle tour. Our guide Zsolt (250lt) was really informative and showed us a lot of interresting things around the city. We were told a lot of interresting stories about life in Budapest under communism that we wouldn't have heard if we had just set out to see the sights by ourselves. We learned a lot about the city and what we should take time to see more of, and this was a great starting point for the rest of our trip. We were in budapest in february and since there aren't as many tourists travelling to Budapest in the winter there were no other people than us on the tour, which was really nice. We were lucky to get a private tour, especially from Zsolt who also works as a history teacher, and the tour was relaxed and personal. If you are travelling to budapest in wintertime and plan on walking outside for a couple of hours make sure to bring a warm jacket!

Great Tour. Good tour, fun and informative. Easy booking process / good email communication.Helpful staff (even said to go back to office if we needed any help with any general information / advice).Thoughtful company - provided motorbike type mittens when the weather was very cold.Many thanks to our guide George.

See a lot in short time!. Budapest is a perfect city to be explored by a segway! We enjoyed a professional guide (Petra), introducing us into the secrets on how to drive a segway ... it took us only about 30 seconds the we knew how to ride it! Once we were out of turtle mode, the speed was amazing. And so is Budapest! Go and check it out yourselves!

Jayway Travel Arranged Our Walking Tour of Budapest with Discover Budapest. Josef Zombori was our fantastic guide. He is a language teacher of both English and French in a nearby secondary school and leads tours of Budapest during the summer and weekends. Jayway Travel, which arranged our spectacular tour of Central Europe, provided Josef as our guide through Discover Budapest. He is intelligent, energetic, creative, and adapted to our interests and needs. During our walking tour with Josef, we fell in love with this extraordinarily beautiful city.

Really, its that good.. So we had never ridden a Segway before this tour. Well we have now. The whole process was a blast. Training just outside the Absolute Tour offices. Our small group of 5 were all trained by our guide Balint, which was as described about 20-30 minutes. Afterwards we slowly made our way to the first stop, crossing streets and stopping. Balint expertly explained the history and uniqueness of the Opera house, as well as some of the detail of attending the peoples opera. Afterwards we did the same in each location along the tour. Balint would take photos if requested, and guided us cautiously through some of the more crowded areas (we had a morning tour which I imagine would be a little less crowded than afternoon tours). My wife says this was perhaps her favorite tour ever, and I agree. Where else can you learn about a city, and have fun moving through it, no tired feet. There are a few restrictions - which we didn't need to worry about, but make sure you read up before you book. Segways are Gyro balanced, so it's all about balance and trust, but just about anyone can ride one. Book a tour - you'll have fun, and learn some cool things. Book the extended tour - we wish we would have now that were done.

FANTASTIC experience. What a wonderful challenge and experience!! I loved it! I am admittedly a bit claustrophobic but after making through the first two tight fits (which are VERY tight), I felt confident and super excited to be doing this. Our guide was fantastic, patient and helpful. It was a small group and we bonded so well that we went out to eat after and toured the city together.

Great walking tour with Ferenc. We booked a half day walking tour in Budapest and had Ferenc as our guide. It was a wonderful tour and Ferenc was obviously very knowledgable on the city's history, as well as very proud of his country. It was hard not to fall in love with Budapest after learning so much about the country and Ferenc's passion was infectious. It was also great to talk to Ferenc about our own background (Ukrainian) as he had an interest in the language and country as he was studying it himself. A very excellent guide and I cannot recommend the tour (and Ferenc) enough!
Nice. By using touristic bus, you can discover most of the remarkable places in the city, you can use also boats to discover Margarett Island.

Discovering Budapest by Bike. My sister and I recently spent a day in Budapest before embarking on a river cruise on the Danube. We booked a bike tour with Yellow Zebra. Our guide Adam and his tour guide in training, Anna, pedaled with us all over Budapest, stopping to share a wealth of information and history of this beautiful and exciting city. We felt exceptionally fortunate as we were the only two tourists on this particular Sunday morning tour. We couldn't have been happier with our guides and overall experience, - and, by the way, the stop at the Strudel House is a don't miss!Margaret in Indianapolis

Informative and fun!. My mom and I booked a Discover Budapest tour last minuet, and were so happy we did. Our tour guide, Petra, was great. She gave us an excellent historical information, while remaining upbeat and fun. Despite getting rained on, the tour went smoothly and was well organized. It was the perfect introduction to exploring the rich history of this wonderful city!

Budapest - Awesome city with beautiful people. Budapest with its two city heritage is one of the most interesting and beautiful cities in Europe. It has the most stunning architectural buildings every where you turn. The people are the most friendly and helpful people of all the places we visited in September 2015. I want to return as I feel very much at home in Budapest... Thank you

Good company. I booked a caving tour with this company. Everything went smoothly and the tour was excellent. The guide, Laslo (sorry if spelled wrong), was interesting and funny throughout the tour. The tour is a great introduction to caving.

Great Insight into Budapest. This is the best and the shortest way to discover a beautiful city called Budapest. Helpful people, good detailing and focus on all major attractions of the city. Nothing can be better suited for a quick discovery of this large and quite diverse city

Best way to start Budapest. This was an excellent overview of the city of Budapest--English speaking guide gave great detail about what to see/do later on our visit. Bogata was full of information, and quite a joy to listen to! She gave us a history and geography lesson to go with the information about the city. I felt that I really knew Budapest when we finished the tour, and was confident to go explore it on our own!

Memento Park, Buda castle walking tour. I took two private tours through Discover Budapest. Both my guides, Brigit and Lazlo were knowledgeable and attentive. My experience of Budapest was enhanced beyond what I read in guidebooks and recommend this agency to all who come to Budapest. Great value for the money.

Love Budapest. Stayed in an apartment on the Danube river. Woke up to stunning views every day. Just enjoyed walking around both Buda and Pest side. Wish we had more time to visit the zoo, it looked amazing from the outside. Budapest was clean and we felt safe.

Great walking tour!. They made sure there were only 10 people on this tour so the guide was able to connect with everyone. She not only explained where we were, but the history or explanation of what we were looking at or doing. She also provided us insights into current conditions in Hungary and Budapest in particular. A great way to get introduced to the city!

Budapest blossoms!. the three hours spent with our guide Lazlo discovering, enjoying and learning Budapest certainly enriched and expanded our trip! His background and delightful stories for each of the areas explored allowed us into Budapest and gave us a cohesive plan for further fun...the strudel, the baths! A definite first on the list of to do's!
Excellent tour!. Excellent tour! The segway tour let you cover a greater distance then by walking and the tour guide was very helpfull and had a very good knowledge of the city.
Nice. Nice views with affordable pricesA sea ride is a must, the trip didn't complete without it, & a trip to the island is necessary.
Soeone should write a song!. Love Budapest it is a beautiful and interesting city and I can't wait to come back to see the things we ran out of time for

Amazing Segway Tour in Budapest. On September 11, 2015 four of us took a 3hr segway tour with Yellow Zebra booked through Absolute Tours. Budapest is a beautiful and surprising city and seeing in while riding a segway helped us see a lot more of it than we would have walking.Our guide was Balint. He was enthusiastic, funny, attentive and full of historical information. He was able to provide great commentary on what we were seeing and he had great answers to all of our questions.We were provided with safety instructions on how to operate the machines and then we were off scooting around the city. In the end out 3hr tour turned out to be 4.5hrs and every second of that was entertaining, mostly because of Balint, but partly because riding a segway is a lot of fun. I gotta get me one of these machines.

Great way to get an overview of the city. Joined the Budapest walking tour with a friend on the first day in Budapest. Our guide Tamas was absolutely fantastic - delivering information about the place in an interactive and entertaining way, and encouraged the group to ask questions and participate (rather than just a one-man show - as these tours tend to be). We had a big group on the day, but he paid attention to everyone (not an easy task while navigating the busy streets of Budapest with a sore throat!). He also gave us tips on other places to see in Budapest. Thanks Tamas for being a great introduction to Budapest!

Wonderful way to discover Budapest. As we only had two days in Budapest, we decided to book a tour to try and get see all the key landmarks before we explored on our own. I'm really glad we did as this 3.5 hour walking tour was excellent. Our guide Brigit greeted us warmly and was fun and witty throughout. In the tour we covered many of the main sights, including the Opera House, Hero Square and The Chain Bridge as well as much more. Also included is a quick stop for a snack at a lovely restaurant for two strudel slices and a drink (included in the price). We liked the restaurant so much that we went back again for a another meal later on. Be warned that there is a short uphill walk to Buda Castle which looks imposing at first, but I'm very unfit and I managed it without any problems. Overall I would recommend this to others, especially if you only have a short time in the city. The tour flew by as it was so interesting, and it's definitely worth seeing as much as you can of this beautiful city.

Absolute walking tour and Communist tour. We went on the two tours, first with Brigit and then Georg. Both were good value, and we learned a great deal from both. Brigit was thoroughly professional, considerate to all members of the group throughout the tour, and always sought to see if anyone had further questions. She was pleasant, informative and mixed useful information with the occasional joke to lighten the experience. While her tour was relatively conventional, that by Georg was very much more personalised, with only my partner and myself as the tourists. For the first hour he shared with us the details of the 1956 revolution, using photographs of the time and mementos from his own collection, and then the second and third hours were spent walking to the appropriate sites. His commitment to the tour, and to Hungary as a free nation was impressive and added to our experience. Both tours are thoroughly recommended.

City Trips. Best thing about BP, the people. With their recent escape from Nazi then communist suppression they are grateful for the freedom they have. I found then to be extremly honest, reliable and hard working, very similar in nature to the people in Prague
budapest. great city the citadell was great, you can see budapest from above... great panaramic, the city streets are full of turists budapest people are party people
Great bike tour of the city. We had a brilliant time exploring the city by bike and managed to learn a fair bit while having a lot of fun.

Interesting architecture. Look carefully at the architecture or else you'll miss a lot of detail like the one building near the Sztehlo statue/ where the metro comes out , which has statuesque figurines on the second floor and roman columns over next 3 floors and even more eclectic era designed apex flanked by towers and top of communist era design

discover budapest absolutely all in one tour. This was a great tour. Tamas kajtar , our guide, has a great sense of humor, and even ran a contest where I won a candy bar. He is knowledgeable, and covered a lot of ground and history on the two tours that we took with him. I highly recommend the company and Tamas as your guide to Budapest.

Cool Segway tour. We chose the evening Segway tour of Budapest due to the extreme heat and it was a great choice. Our tour guide and trainer, Balint, was knowledgeable and entertaining, and we barely felt the heat as we buzzed around on our Segways. We learned some interesting facts and got an idea of the layout of the central part of the city. There's no way we would have been able to walk or bike that route in the August heat wave!

Great tour! (even in the rain). Balint is the best! He led our diverse group of seven (ages 17 to 80) on a great tour all over the city in the rain. He was keenly aware of our interests and physical abilities. His sense of humor and knowledge of Budapest were top notch. He also gave us great tips on food and other activities. Highly recommend!
Buiapest in a day. For the first time visitor a must ! Gives you a very good idea what Budapest is about .Money well spent
Danube River at Night. An absolutely beautiful city ... the river cruise is well worth the cost. Wait until the evening to enjoy the lights!

Excellent Segway trip!. My husband and I take Segway tours wherever we travel, including Chicago, Houston, Nashville, Tel Aviv, Jerusalem, Prague, etc. Our trip with Lanzlo of Yellow Zebra Segways/Absolute Tours was fantastic! He is fun, witty, informative, and very accommodating. There was a small glitch regarding the timing of the tour, but it was resolved immediately, professionally, and in a very friendly matter. We highly recommend this Segway tour when you are visiting Budapest!

Exquisite beauty. For me, this has got to be the most beautiful city. There is not one road you will walk along that you will not stand in awe of the beautiful architecture. Walking along the Danube (Duna) while the sun is setting transcends anything you can imagine. Be sure to have a bottle of wine and glasses with you to sit and enjoy the beauty.

Evening Boat Trip on the Danube. We chose the dinner cruise at 9.30pm so we could enjoy seeing all the monuments and landmarks lit up.The buffet dinner was a good selection of Hungarian dishes and we enjoyed the complimentary drinks. we ate downstairs then went up on deck to take in the views.Great Value for money

Good tour, great river cruise. George was a lovely guide on our tour of Budapest. He was friendly and knowledgeable. The tour itself I felt a little rushed in order to get to the cruise on time. This may have been due to a few people who were late arriving.I would recommend this tour at the beginning of your time in Budapest - it's good for orientation and the cruise is breathtaking at night.

Adam did a great job! Interesting tour and we got to race around one of the park statues.. Adam told us all about the history we needed to know without making it a history class. The company did a great job splitting our larger group into an adult tour and a kid family with small children tour so we could move faster. Great times will do a Segway tour again!
Favorite bridge. Beautiful bridge, with a fantastic view on both sides of the city. Cloes to the castle, and a 10 minute walk from the city center.

A fantastic way to experience Budapest. My three friends and I were on the Yellow Zebra bike tour when we arrived in Budapest. We had never been there before, and the tour helped us to form a generel view of the city. Later we could go back to the places we had visited and take a closer look if we wanted to. Our guide, Kati, was very nice and was good at sensing how much information we wanted about the things, we saw. She could answer all of our questions and made the tour very exciting. We ended up on a restaurant with a very nice traditional cake - which name I can not remember - and had a good talk with the other persons on the tour. I highly recommend everyone to go on the bike tour as the first thing, when you arrive in Budapest. The price is very cheap compared to what you get out of it.

Great way to see Budapest!!. Just come back from a long weekend in Budapest with my daughter, and had a fantastic time in this beautiful city.The first day i booked a superior tour on segways and i have to say that it's one of the most enjoyable ways to see a city. George was our guide for the tour and he was great, very informative, witty and took great care of us.I recommend to anyone that you try the segways, they are great fun.Thank you!!!!

Family trip to Budapest and Tokaj region. Recently returned from a family trip to Budapest, Tokaj and other sites in between. We had a tremendous 7 night vacation which was made special by our private tour guide, Jozsef Zombori. The sites we visited were fantastic. But what made the trip special was the personal attention to the trip that we received. Besides hitting all the historic sites in Budapest (which we truly enjoyed) we were treated to many unique visits to Lake Balaton, Eger and Tokaj. Jozsef was knowledgeable, informative and entertaining throughout our tours. Would recommend him to anyone visiting Budapest and throughout Hungary. Totally enjoyed the trip.

Budapest is worth coming for sightseeing!. The city is great, many bridges, fountains, monuments and parks! The Parliament is amazing at night from the other side of Danube (e.g. you can come to subway station Battiany ter) with its lights it's really glorious. Amazing to climb to the top of St.Stephan's Bazilica - the view of the city is great. And the Formula 1 race in the suburbs is also an amazing experience.Food is not cheap in restaurants, service always included - from 30 to 120 Forints depending on the restaurant.Budapest is worth coming for sightseeing!

Professional, informative and passionate!. We love to go on walking tours as there is no better way to learn about (and then appreciate) the city we are visiting. The two most important requirements are understandable English and knowledge of the history and city. Bridgett (not sure of her spelling) was AWESOME! Well worth every Euro. She was a big reason we ended up loving Budapest. She spoke English perfectly and was not only knowledgeable, but conveyed a love and passion for her city and country.
