She could answer any question posed and often knew what someone was referring to without even turning around to see what they were pointing at! She did not give you fake dopey anecdotes (as some tour guides do thinking they need to entertain). The trip was 3.5 hours and included a subway ride (the price included all museum and transport fees) that is not to be missed. Built over a 120 years ago, it is quaint and really brings you back in time. Wear comfortable shoes, but this is an easy walkable city tour with few stairs.

Segway Tour- Fantastic. We chose to do the Segway Tour; combining a historical and informative guided tour with something new and exciting! I was a little nervous about trying out the Segway, but our tour guide, Adrienne, was reassuring, helpful and friendly. She soon made us feel comfortable with the Segways after a little practice. The tour covered a number of different locations in Budapest with Adrienne safely guiding us around the city and stopping to give us more of an insight into what we were seeing and to answer any questions. There were a number of occasions where we stopped in different pedestrian squares and she let us 'play' on the Segways! The tour lasted over 2 hours and there never felt like there was any rush to get back! We would highly recommend this to people who are looking for a bit of history and sight seeing with an exciting difference!

Best Fun All Week. The Segway tour was excellent. Obviously we were nervous at first but within a minute we were all racing around with confidence. This was a great way to see the sights, learn a bit about Budapest's History whilst having a whale of time buzzing around at speeds of up to 20km/hr. Our guide was excellent and apologies for not adding his name here.
must do tour. Budapest is a beautiful city, it is full of life and amazing heritage. the view from the river at night is breathtaking as the buildings are beautifully illuminated.

Summer weekend top 1. The beautiful city with beautiful bridges and profound history always catches my attention and interest. The summer trip to Budgest just make you feel like living in the heaven, food, river, bridge, sun, wine, princess.
Very scaring. Don't go if you are affraid of high places. There is rost all over and it feels like you are falling to the water.

"Big Bus" Tour. Buy a two day ticket on this bus and get off and on as often as you want to see all of the main attractions in the Buda and Pest sides of the river. We enjoyed walking through the Central Market which is huge and sells everything from fish, fruit, vegetables, and souvenirs.

Cruise on the danube. Budapest is a very amesing city. You find many history walking though the streets of Budapest. The bay is gorgious during the night. One of the most inviting cities I ever visit. There is a mix of culture here. The place is save and charming.
Buda and Pest tour. We visited the Buda hill Castle, Danube river cruise, Independence square, The famous chain bridge and the old city square. it was a memorable journey

Budapest is the best. On my trip in June 2015 I visited 4 main cities in Eastern Europe and Budapest was the friendliest, cleanest, and the most amazing in architecture. The weather was perfect my entire visit. All the English speaking tours I took were very good.

Great Tour Guide and Driver. My US travel agent contracted to Discover Budapest for our multi-day private tour of Budapest with trips to Lake Balaton, Eger and the Tokaj region. The trip was for 10 adult relatives researching our Hungarian roots. We were so fortunate to have been assigned Jozsef Zombori as our private tour guide. Jozsef absolutely made the trip amazing! He is very personable and extremely knowledgeable. His explanations of complex Hungarian history were lively and interesting and we had fun the entire time. He went way out of his way to make our trip memorable...finding a beach so we could swim in Lake Balaton (on a very hot day!)...calling the pastor of our grandfather's childhood church and arranging for us to view old records, etc. He was patient and flexible and made many suggestions which greatly enhanced our trip. He speaks several languages, including English, and he was invaluable as a translator when we ventured beyond Budapest. Ask for Jozsef - whether you need a guide for a few hours or for a longer tour. You will be delighted! Also, our driver Zsolt was a very safe and patient driver. If these two gentlemen are representative of Discover Budapest, then it is a first rate agency.
architectural marvel. architectural marvel,it is the life line bridge that connects buda and pest,it is amazing what they could achieve so many years ago

Great Tour of the Budapest Area - Learned the History of the Area. Signed up online the night before for the group tour, and to our surprise, we ended up having a private tour! Our guide was named Balint - he spoke great English and provided lots of history on the city, as well as took pictures of us. The tour was great since Budapest has very wide streets, and it was a great way to ground ourselves. The best part was after the tour when Balint provided us with a map and local recommendations on places to eat & stay based on the length of our stay. We did most of those recommendations, and don't regret a thing! Highly recommended activity!
Here, a look ... there a wonder. A city, a surprise around every corner. A monument, various locations as wonders. Welcoming, friendly, helpful, ... Budapest is a hostess par excellence.

Private tour of communism and memento park. I enjoyed the tour of communism with Joseph. The content of the tour gave me insight into the history of Hungary. The tour guide, Joseph, was personable, friendly and knowledgeable. All my questions were answered. Highly recommend.

Great Guides and Interesting Facts!. My husband and I had the opportunity to go on two tours in Budapest, both of which were enlightening and thoroughly enjoyable. Our first tour was an overview of Budapest as a city with Kati. We went to the Heroes' Park, several stops in the center of town, and ended the tour in the castle district. Kati was so kind, knowledgeable, and informative about the history of Budapest. Our second tour was the "Hidden Gems" tour with Tomas. We mostly focused our tour in the Jewish quarter and learned a TON about the history of Budapest. Though we had been in Budapest for 4-5 days already, Tomas still found sights and told us stories we had not known about. Tomas was again, like Kati, an excellent guide who was so enthusiastic and entertaining throughout the tour. I highly suggest any "Discover Budapest" tours for couples or families!

Amazing tour, My Speciall gratitude to the Brigitta the best tour guide ever ..... To be honest it was my first time in europe . honestly i didn't know anything about the budapest (actually about whole europe) when i landed to hungary. and i can tell you i was so lucky to choose the walking tour and seg way tour from the discover budapest. and specially the great thing was my tour guide the brigitta was great with guiding. as i didn,t know anything about hungary she explained everything for my well understand A to Z, and not about hungary ,she explained about the histroy of Austria and about the Roman emperers too. and i asked soooo many question about hungary and the second world war , my tour guide was so kind to answer my all of the questions...so i felt so good with the tour of walking and to be true, i learned about the europian histrory from the brigi than what i learned from the school)))))) and next day i went for the segway tour also and i was fortunate as my guide again was brigitta. first i was so scared to even step on the seg way as it was my first time but always my guide was so supporting to me and teached me how to manage the seg way. it was so wonderful tour and i felt like i am flying without wings in budapest city. Great feeling ,and the Budapest is so beautiful city and my holiday was wonderful as i choosed the tours in discover budapest and as i got the best tour guide ever in the world.......Thank you !

Great walking tour. My wife and I very much enjoyed our walking tour of Budapest with George. He did a great job answering our questions and showing us a lot of the highlights of the city.One thing to note: this is an exterior tour... You will not be going in the sites, just seeing them. For a city like Budapest, I highly recommend this tour...

Overall Budapest. Budapest has so many facets to it. There is the Danube and surrounds, the Pest side, the Buda side with the Castle district, the spa's and pools which are gorgeous. Churches and roman ruins and caves to explore. It really is just whatever interests you. Public transport is brilliant and day or week or month tickets are a really good buy. Discover for yourselves

Great,a lot to see especially on the hop on hop off busRiver cruise good. Great,a lot to see especially on the hop on hop off busRiver cruise goodConcert for organ in St Stephens Bascilica if liked a good mustWe didn't like some of the bus attendants from other bus companies they were rude and unhelpful
river cruise. I been on river cruise on Danube river and its wort every money you will pay for ticket. I learn a lot of the history and the sightseeing is magnificent.

BudapestCityTour. The varied city tours are available and all are good depending upon individual requirements. Very well co-ordinated during change-overs. Night walks on own can also be done and accomplished. Trams and buses are very convenient too. A day's ticket (24hrs) is worth it, over all modes.

Beautiful Budapest!. Visited the Pest and the Buda in August of 2013! The architecture was amazing, the Danube was just as I had always dreamt it would be! Cobble stone walkways, wonderful monuments, the windows and doors intriguing (have a thing about photographing their design and uniqueness ) but most poignant for me was the Holocaust Shoe Memorial commemorating the lost lives of so many innocents during WWII.
Super overview. Excellent guide, quick overview to start our 3-day stay in Budapest. We got the layout of the city and a strong orientation to spots to revisit.

Beautiful Budapest. We arrived in Budapest on 31st May 2015 for the start of our 5 week holiday and to celebrate my 50th birthday and got there early before our cruise started. What a gorgeous city Budapest is. We loved the vibe of the city. We were staying in Pest at a gorgeous hotel and I will write that up soon.The weather was sensational. Sunny & warm. As my husband & I walked around I kept saying to him this place looks like it's straight out of a Bond movie. The people are friendly. The shopping good as our hotel was in the area. We did a hop on hop off bus ride which was value for money. I think we will be returning to Budapest one day again. Love Budapest.

Great way to see the City. We loved the hop on hop off buses. We use them to get around the city because they get you to most of the place you would lke to see. Make sure to take advantage of the second day deal because it is well worth while
Amazing City. old historical buildings, Spas and food was also very good. It was nice and warm. Going round the city is easy using hop on and off buses.

Small Group Communism/WWII Walking Tour. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this tour, the company and our guide, Tamas. From the start everyone was welcoming and excited which started us off on the right foot. For this particular tour, you begin in the basement of the tour facility that they have all kitted out with Communist era furniture and decorations. You sit in this recreated apartment and learn about the parts of Hungarian and Budapest history that you're most interested in (Tamas gave us a full run down but asked our preferences of older or more modern history for focus). He showed us personal artifacts from his family's experiences with communism in Budapest. Then, he toured us around various sites, monuments and other parts of town with historical significance. Since we had a small group tour (and me and my husband were the only ones who booked that day) it was incredibly customizable and personal. Tamas was knowledgeable, professional, funny and engaging. He even gave us restaurant and other recommendations for the duration of our stay. I absolutely recommend this tour company, specific tour and tour guide!
Take time to look around Budapest. Just liked the overall ambiance of the center we just walked around and took time to take in the views.

Great overview walking tour. Laszlo was our tour guide and he did a good job explaining the history and culture of Hungary while pointing out major sights along the way in this 3 hour tour. It's more of an overview walking tour through both sides of the river. You don't go into really any of the buildings pointed out but you do get some explanation from the outside and nice stories. They do show you the metro station and cover the cost of taking the subway for a portion of the trip.The stop along the way for strudel and coffee is nice and didn't feel forced. I left feeling like I had a good idea of how Hungary as a nation evolved and how the city came to its present state.
Great place to visit. Budapest is a fantastic place great shops food restaurants and bars really good markets and plenty to see

Not a fascinating experience. Good organisation and a nice guide tour, but we did not learn much. We had already been to most of the sites, and though the stop for coffee and pastries and chatting with other tour guests was nice, we would have liked to know more about Hungary and to visit more unexpected sites.

Fantastic Budapest. Just loved it. Wow really worth seeing Budapest. Old buildings and so much history to see. So much character. Walking in such wonder you are amazed with it all. Saw the opera and ballet while there and still have the images in my mind.

Like a Private Tour. We booked this tour through our hotel and the company picked us up by Taxi to join the tour a few minutes away. Since there were only 4 English speaking visitors on the 3 hour tour it was like having "a personal and private tour". Our guide Francis (Frank) was excellent and had an exceptional knowledge of Hungarian history. We visited all the major attractions and spent an hour walking and taking wonderful photos of this beautiful city. Would strongly recommend, great value.

totally recommend.. My husband and I did the daytime cycling tour of Budapest recently. Our guide was Tamas (Thomas) and he was excellent, giving us a great history lesson and cultural insights with humour and in superb English. We saw far more by bike than we could have covered on foot in the same time. Afternoon tea strudels were also excellent. I highly recommend this as a way to get an overview of Budapest.

Fantastic way to see the city. I spent three very enjoyable hours in the Segway tour of Budapest. George was exceptionally knowledgeable and engaging and as I didn't have much time it was a great way to see a lot of the city in a short time. The Segway provided a real fun element to the tour.I would definitely recommend this as a way to see the main sights of Budapest and then decide where you want to spend more time,
It's all there. This is the area to see, all in one place, what you will see all over Europe.The weather is stable & warm.

Great tour guide. We enjoyed this walking tour. The tour guide was very knowledgable, friendly, and entertaining. It was nice to have the little break in the middle for a pastry and drink. It was hot so the little break was needed. I thought the price was a little steep compared to other great tours we took in other cities on our trip.

Jewish walking tour disappointing!. we missed the first half hour because we were sent an email that gave us the incorrect meeting place. Our guide Fatima, tried to make it interesting and gave us important information, but the group was not the most enthusiastic and we were disappointed in the tour itself.

Outstanding tour guides that made the city come alive. We took 2 walking tours and the two tour guides were outstanding. Laszlo and Andy were more than guides and their in-depth knowledge and enthusiasm for their city/country made everything come alive. They made our trip to Budapest the success it was.
Perfect!!. I Like the food and the view the garden and the building. Very chip food and shopping. the spa with hot water was wonderful

Magic City full of Grace and Beauty.. This is a wonderful city to be a visitor, you have museums, cultural sites, beautiful buildings, outstanding art, great food. Friendly people, easy to get around on the city transport system, underground and above ground. What I liked best was the different cultures that mix within this city. This city still has the discovery factor, not super crowded as in Paris or London or even Vienna, you can still walk around without large crowds of people in the way.Note** get the city week pass good for all transport and some attractions.
Discover Budapest. Fantastic tour by Discover Budapest. Great touristic and historic Experience. Must see city. We are going to do it again.

True Budapest. Budapest is a mix of East meets West! I Million live in Budapest and the city is easy to walk, the language is a challenge and many older folk don't have a word of English but understand what you mean. The food portions are huge, prices are slightly below Euro equivalents here but tipping is essential and prices are generally rounded up. Public transport is frequent, v cheap and safe. I would definitely recommend a visit before it becomes too Europeanised, at the moment they still retain an unapologetic uniqueness

Fabulous Walking Tour. We visited Budapest in May 2015 and went with Discover Budapest Absolute Walking Tours. Our tour guide, Anna, provided a great overview of the city and was very knowledgeable about the history and significance of all the buildings and monuments. Anna was very helpful and answered any questions we had. She gave us some good recommendations about places to visit and the best times to do this and recommended a local market as well which was very good. The only downside to this tour was that it didn't include entry into any of the attractions which I would have been willing to pay a bit extra for. Although as the tour is 3 1/2 hours long, it would maybe be too much to go inside the buildings as well. about 2 -2 1/2 hours into the tour you visit a coffee shop for a drink & 2 pastries which is very nice and also gives you a chance to visit the bathroom if necessary.
Budapest city. Convenient way to see wonderful buildings and monuments. The superb weather was a bonus as we were able to travel upstairs on the open top bus

Chain Bridge. Fascinating Bridge. Had a strange tale, they wanted to roll it up and store it in a tunnel which would have been somewhat difficult. Easy walk across from Pest to Buda with a good view of the Danube and sights such as the Castle and Parliament.
city break. Beautiful City with lots of interesting things to see and do, transport is good and cheap, food is varied in price and quality, vegetarian food can be difficult to find

Excellent!. My husband and I booked an hour and a half segway tour in Buda around the castle district. It was the perfect way to see the castle district, saving our feet and legs from a lot of walking, as well as saving on time. It was the first time we'd rode on a segway. Our guide/instructor was patient and showed us how to ride the segway, and he made sure we were comfortable before we took off for our tour. He was informative, kept a good pace, stopped and waited for us when we paused for pictures, and even offered to take pictures of the two of us. We thoroughly enjoyed our segway tour. It was well organized, easy to find, fun, and informative. We wouldn't hesitate to book with this company again.

Wine culture and all that jazz. Beautiful city, friendly, lively and proud of who they are. I really enjoyed it. the wine culture is just amazing.. the beers not bad either... the food is excellent & the cultural nature fo the city is just fab... Totally recommend it.. All ages... just give it a go. I will go back

Great tour packed in a lot of history. We visited Budapest and went with Discover Budapest Absolute Walking Tours. Our tour guide, Andy, provided a great overview of the city and was very knowledgeable about the history and significance of all the buildings and monuments. Andy gave us some good recommendations and helped us to enjoy our time in this beautiful city.

Budapest by Walking. We walk everywhere as we like to explore the city on foot and stop and have a snack and walk to the next spot. It is a very easy city to walk; however, the street signs will change on you so have a map.

A short resume' doesn't do our trip justice. We enjoyed a bus tour of the city, can't remember the name, it was very educational and worthwhile as we learned a lot about local places and culture. we also did a tour which took in the Danube Bend and Szentendre which was a very old town and had many interesting shops
Beautiful city.. The Hop on and hop off buses. You reach everything you like to see in a very efficient way. Fantastic hotel and many nice restaurants in the neighbourhood .
Budapest is GORGEOUS!. It is one of the most beautiful cities I have every seen. Especially when it is getting darker and everything is lightened. It is amazing. MUST SEE.

HISTORIC. Loved all parts of the city. The name "Paris of the East" is well deserved. The architecture was beautiful to see and record on camera. The views from the mountain on the Buda side is spectacular, especially at night. The food and wine was delightful and enjoyable. Listening to the Hungarian Gypsy music gives you the true feeling of Hungary. The visit to Castle Hill, with the Matyas Temple and Fisherman's Wharf are not to be missed.
Beautiful Budapest. The city is so beautiful clean and many wonderful sights to see lots of wonderful restaurants museums

Informative and fun. This was a brilliant way to start exploring Budapest. The guide was excellent and full of information plus had a great sense of humout. Highly recommend going on one of these well worth it.

Best way to see the city highlights is by Segway.. Last week we've been in Budapest for a city trip. The Segway tour was fun, the best way to move around from one point of interest to another, without the walking in between, so you see a lot in two hours and you don't get fatigued.The guide was super. First we had a basic training session to get reacquainted with the segway. It has been a few years we did a segway tour in Rome, but it all came back after a few minutes of practice.The tour itself was instructive, our guide knew exactly the right balance between facts and fun.Thank you very much Christy!
Hop On Hop Off Bus. Very useful to see the area and to find out where you want to visit in the short space of time that you are there

On a Viking River Cruise in 2011 NOT 2014!. A beautiful old city with LOTS of history, beautiful churches & parliament buildings- one of the UNESCO cities. We first saw the city at midnight as we round a bend in the river, went under a bridge & saw the WHOLE city lit up! Nothing we didn't like!

Terrific evening tour and boat tour on Danube. We booked thru Viator and got a lengthy evening tour of the Pest side which included a stop by many lovely buildings including the gorgeous Parliament building and many monuments. Peter was our guide and he was very, very knowledgable about the history and culture of Budapest. We did this tour our first night in Budapest and it was a great intro to the city. We enjoyed the boat tip on the Danube at the end but the accompanying video was distracting. Cannot express how lovely the Danube is at night!

The only way to start!!. Thanks Andi!! A great guide and very flexible with our group, which included experienced segwayers and novices. If you haven't tried this, it is the best way to save 4 hours + of tired feet and gives you a great experience and a great orientation to the city. We had booked 5 of us on this tour, and I had done their walking tour the day before but I didn't feel I was doubling up. Of course the fun is the mode of travel and looking.. But not going in. You must start off with a Segway tour first - seriously - make it the first thing you book well before you travel, so you can do it on your first morning and then get a feel for the city and then retrace your steps and go into some of those beautiful buildings you see from the outside.
Absolute Walking Tour. We booked a walking tour and although expensive, it was excellent. The office itself is worth visiting for a huge range of second hand books.

Beginning to understand Budapest with Gabor. We booked a bike tour online through Discover Budapest and made that our introduction to the city. We were not disappointed! Bikes were well maintained and easy to ride. We covered a lot of distance in 4 hours and loved the coffee and strudel break along the way. Gabor gave us history lessons and political commentary at each stop so that we have a real appreciation for the beautiful city of Budapest... and the beginning of an understanding.

Historic. I have visited Budapest 3 times now and each time it is an eye opener. It is quite sad that more people are not aware of how marvellous Eastern Europe can be, the weather can be very wet at times, even when raining it be can be 22-25 degrees. There are many attractions and buildings and the food and transport is very cheap. On average a taxi across the city costs about £6.00, the average meals around £10.00, you must try Goulash Soup it is best made in Hungary.

Fantastic tour with Anna. My boyfriend and I arranged a walking tour with Discover Budapest in February 2015. We had originally booked it for the Saturday - however, we got a bit lost finding our bearings and missed the tour! The staff were very helpful and helped us rearrange for the following day at the same time, which we really appreciated. We were very happy that we rescheduled as it was only the two of us on the Sunday morning, so Anna was our 'personal' guide!Anna's impressive knowledge made our tour fascinating, and her passion for the city was infectious. She showed us around at our own pace and my boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our day! Anna recommended other places for us to visit and see for the remainder of our time. The tour was our favourite part of the weekend, and would recommend it to anyone visiting Budapest. Thanks Anna!

Budapest by Segway. My partner and I had a fantastic afternoon been shown around the wonderful city of Budapest with Brigit from Yellow Zebra. Brigit was a fantastic guide and was happy to share her love of Budapest with us. The start point was easy to find and all the staff were friendly inside.

Great tour. Will do it again. I booked online and they sent me multiple reminders before my tour. On the tour day I went there and found that i was the only guest for that group tour--Guess November is really not the hot season. I thought they would cancel the tour but they did not. The tour guide (sorry I forgot your name) was super fun and very good at his job. Great to talk to him about Hungarian history, especially at the Hero's Square. Too bad I only had half day in Budapest but the tour helped me appreciate the beauty of the city and the history. Thank you!

Night tour with Lazlo. We really enjoyed having Lazlo show us around Budapest on our first night. The buildings are beautiful in the evening, and it is less crowded also. Lazlo did a great job explaining the history of Budapest and the different buildings. Very interesting and enjoyable. It was a small group which made it even better. Lazlo was very personable and highly recommend him as a tour guide. The boat tour at the end was nice however the walking tour was better.

Great walking tour. George did an amazing job explaining Budapest and its history. The tour was 3 1/2 hours and a great mixture. Stopped for a lovely pastry treat. George has a wonderful personality and represented his company and country well. Would definitely recommend this tour company and George.

Budapest the Queen of the Danube. Budapest was coined the "spa City" in 1937 because it is richly endowed by nature with its medicinal waters and unmatched natural sights. Budapest was named the "Queen of the Danube" because of its natural beauty, its many historical and artistic monuments and its rich and varied architecture and bustling cultural life.

Never got to experience the tour. I had booked a caving tour in Budapest for 6 people well in advance of the tour date. I even revived a confirmation from victor that my trip had been confirmed. However, several days later I received an email from the company saying that the date I had chosen had actually been full and there is now no room for my group. They did offer another day as available and able to accommodate my group. When I responded saying that I was still interested in taking the alternative date, it was also fully booked! No priority was given to my previous reservation. I will be booking with a company that properly knows how to use their websites and not this one.

Well organized and good guides. we did two Tours' the walking and the gastro , where we liked the walking Sligthly better. Bothom guides , brigite and Elza was helpul, god presenters and made entertaing Tours'.

The most amazing experience!. I arrived in Budapest after a 20 journey just two hours before starting the Hammer and Sickle Tour. It could have been exhausting but actually it was completely inspirational and an absolutely perfect way to start my first trip to Budapest.The tour managed to fit in an incredible amount in within the three hours. My guide was Anna, and she is obviously highly knowledgeable about Hungary.What really made this such an amazing experience, however, was Anna's ability to adjust the tour to my interests. At the start of the tour she asked particularly about my experience of and interests in Hungary. Even beyond this, however, even during the tour I believe that the information and sights that were included were in response to interests that I had expressed during the tour (Successionist architecture, for example). I believe that this was possible because of Anna's very wide range of knowledge, but there was also an extraordinary level of professionalism in ensuring that I saw many sights of interest and had an enjoyable tour.I highly, highly recommend this organisation. A huge thanks to Anna for a wonderful introduction to beautiful Budapest!
Amazing caving tour!. Must do when you're in Budapest. Entertaining guides and challenging activities! However, would not recommend if you're scared of tight spaces.

Lazlo did a great job. We enjoyed our 'Absolute Walking Tour' led by Lazlo. His pace was good (we're a 62 year old couple in decent shape), and his english was perfect and his voice projected well. This tour is a good way to start your visit to the city because you get familiar with it, and it uses two subway rides so you learn how to use the Budapest subway system. We also like to start our visits with walking tours because you can get information from the tour guide about how things work in the city - money, buses, taxis, restaurants, etc.The strudel stop at the end of the tour was very tasty, and we went back to that restaurant for dinner the next night.

Segway Tour - Enjoyable time had by all. I have done a city segway tour in Rome last year and suggested the idea for a trip to Budapest with 6 friends.Was a little worried if others would enjoy it as much as I did in Rome but everyone loved it, even the more nervous ones. They all now want a segway to get around at home!Tour guide was very knowledgeable and helped us out with a few different things. Only advice I would give is to dress very warmly if it's cold. By the end of the two hour tour, everyone was quite cold and that was wearing coats, scarfs, gloves etc. Would recommend to everyone!

Excellent tour, excellent value. Wonderful tour and excellent price. One thing to note is that the tours start behind the Opera house in a little shop that they own. Not on the street like a lot of other tour operators.
Segway tour with Thomas. My first go on a Segway. Great fun after the first 5 minutes. Tomas was a fun and knowing guide. We cruised the major sights over the two hour trip. I can recommend this !

Discover Budapest walking tour. The tour guide Brigitta spoke very good English and we found no issues understanding her, the tour itself was very informative and for my first time in Hungary found all the information very interesting, particularly the history of this country. The tour was a pleasant pace and the stop of at a traditional cafe for some refreshments was fabTracey & Steohen Forrest (Scotland)
Bridgit was great.. A wonderful introduction to Budapest.We went to many places and Bridget explained history and essential facts in excellent English and good humour. You should not miss this trip.

Tour to make you see the city in a new way. I would highly recommend this tour. It gives a fascinating insight into the history and culture of Budapest and Hungary without being overloaded with facts and figures. As we were a small group, Anna, our lovely guide, changed aspects of the tour to suit our interests, spending longer in places we were interested in. She was very knowledgeable and happy (and able) to answer any questions we had. There were lovely touches to the tour such as free subway tickets which Anna handed out, two strudels with tea/coffee in lovely traditional café and recommendations on where to go afterwards. This was one of the highlights of our trip!

Thank you, Szolt Jenei!. We booked this tour not knowing what to expect. It ended up being a highlight of our trip. Szolt was a SO informative, patient with questions as well as slower walkers, and made us feel very welcome. You start the tour in the basement, which is set up like an average home in Budapest in the 1970s, while they were still well under communist control. This was absolutely brilliant! It gives you a candid picture of life in that place and time. Szolt shared a synopsis of the history of Hungary (as a nation and a people). Then, he showed us actual school workbook from an elementary school child, dating back to the communist era. He even showed us some communist-era personal items belonging to his family. Next, we hit the streets. We learned all about uprisings and changes of govtt, explanations of several monuments, which are tied to the Hungarian political struggles, and various communist-era installations. This is the bulk of the tour, and is packed with information. We recommend starting your Budapest visit with this tour, as it gives you an excellent framework of this beautiful city.After a lengthy and eye-opening tour, Szolt gave us a recommendation for a restaurant, which was out of this world, too! Thank you, Szolt. You're the best!
Budapest walking tour. My tour guide Brigit was amazing!!!! She was very knowledgable and made the tour what it was!!! The city was beautiful and I would definitely visit again.

Great walking tour of Budapest. This was our second visit to Budapest, so we knew quite a lot abut the city, but this tour was absolutely great! We learned a lot and it was fun. The group was small (which makes it more personal) and the guide was excellent!

Highly recommended. Great walking tour of Budapest. Finished the tour with a highly valued understanding of its amazing history, layout and attractions. The passion our guide (Brigit) had for her city/country was made transparent and was very pleasing to see. Unlike some tour guides who swamp you with information that you couldn't possibly retain, Brigits method of delivery was excellent and left us wanting to explore the city even more.A well timed stop at a traditional Hungarian cafe/restaurant was included in the tour which was appreciated by all during a cold day.This tour is highly recommended for those who wish to get acquainted with this amazing city. the online booking process was easy and the company was organised and easy to locate.

Great way to discover the city!. We love walking tours (as opposed to bus tours) and we always try to find a company that specializes in small groups when visiting a new city for the first time. We were served well with Absolute Waking Tours! Our guide Brigit was knowledgeable, friendly and easy going. It was nice to get on the metro and on a bus (tickets included) to cover more ground. And we enjoyed the strudel and coffee (also included) to warm up on a cold day!

Excellent history of Hungary. Our walking tour of budapest and it's history actually started with a conversation in a relipa of a Hungarian home in the 70s. The talk with Toyr guide, Anna, was very informative and especially helpful as she reduced our walking time in the bitter cold weather in favor of a longer history lesson. Once on the walking tour, Anna continued and delightfully told us more about Hungary. The quick ride on the metro was a nice add-on.

Great experience on Segway, poor guide experience. This was our first experience on the segways, and we really enjoyed it! However, our guide unfortunately had very little information to offer, at times we even suspected what she told us to be inaccurate.

Great Tour Great Knowledge!. I came to Budapest with a good knowledge of Hungarian History, the Hapsburgs, the Communist regime and in particular the days of the end of WWII.The guide Tamas was excellent and our conversations were enlightening. He delivered more than the stats..he portrayed life as it was under all of Hungary's rulers For the past 500 years. A highlight was a visit to the office where the display of an apartment replicating life under the communist regime was.I would recommend this company and its services without hesitation and a must do in Budapest!Thank you Tamas!

Great tour of Budapest. I booked the tour through the company's website and had an excellent tour with a small group and our guide Andi. I was only in Budapest for one full day and this was my introduction to the city. We saw as much as one could hope to on a 4 hour walking tour and Andi was relaxed, very knowledgeable and humorous. Budapest proved to be a very walkable and very interesting city. Andi not only talked to us about the city and its history but gave a some good insights into Hungarian culture and attitudes. The tour included a stop for coffee and strudel and the small group made for a particularly enjoyable experience. At the end of the tour I got some great recommendations on restaurants and other sights to take in and was able to take advantage of some of those. Overall a memorable experience.

Walking with Zsolt. Even an overcast, wet, and dreary day couldn't slow Zsolt Jenei, our knowledgeable Discover Budapest tour guide from getting passionate about showing us his home town. About the only thing we didn't have time for were the Parliament Buildings and it's advisable to reserve your spot there over the Internet (easy to do). Cameras, even on a rainy day, are a must.Although a walking tour, we did use the street car and the cute and oldest electrified underground railway system on the European continent to make our way around where necessary. Zsolt supplied all the tickets required for transportation.The highlight was the wonderful visit to a local cafe where we enjoyed two exceptional Hungarian pasties (I had the strudel of which there were umteen sorts) and the hot drink of our choice to warm us up. A great day, Zsolt. Thanks.

Excellent walking tour!. We booked our walking tour with Viator as we had had an excellent tour in Kraków last year from the same company.There were only 3 on the tour and the guide, Andi, was terrific- very knowledgable, bright and real fun. The city itself is the star as it is beautiful and a joy to walk round, however, it was made all the more enjoyable by the company.I would recommend both the trip and the guide to anyone who wants to see the city

Wow!. Awesome trip into the Budapest caves! We had a small group of 9 with a very knowledgable, fun guide who made us feel safe, comfortable, and always entertained. A member of the team met us at the bus stop and helped us with public transportation, and when we arrived, we were suited up, given lockers, and headed underground! The tour was a little longer than expected (be prepared for 4.5 hours or so) but it was definitely worth it. Great people, great tour, we would definitely recommend this!
Can't fault it, excellent way to see this beautiful city.. There were 6 of us and we all agreed this was the highlight of the weekend.Patient guide who was very knowledgeable of the city.

Try the Segways. The Castle district, which is large and offers wide views over the Danube River, was REALLY fun to explore on a Segway. It's easier than a bicycle to ride, and our guide was a very knowledgeable local university student who spoke excellent English. She mentioned the places to see in town and especially the one to avoid (the 8th District). The staff allowed my wife and me to re-book for the next day even though we missed our initial appointment. My only difficulty was locating their offfice, which operates out of the tourist information booth. Be aware that the balls of your feet may ache after you Segway more than half-an-hour, because of the lean-forward stance needed for forward motion. My feet ached for a day, but I would go again, just not for a whole hour.

Amazing. My husband and I did the segway tour at the beinning of November. There were only 4 of us and our guide George was fantastic. I was really nervous about using the segway for the first time but George trained us well and his knowledge of the city was superb. This is a really good way to get to know Budapest. Thoroughly recommend it!

Don't miss it. Me and my friend were lucky enough to have a private Segway tour in November as no one else had booked that day, and it turned out to be one of the best parts of an already amazing trip to Budapest. Our lovely guide Brigitt was so friendly and knowledgeable, she trained us quickly and thoroughly on the Segway (so easy even if you are a big clumsy idiot like me) and off we went. She aked what we wanted from the tour which was great, in depth sightseeing or just a go on the Segway, we went for a mix of the two and it was unbelievably good fun. Can't recommend this enough - you just need to do it! By the end we were gutted it was over even though it was a good long tour and we saw a lot (I recommend going towards Heroes Square, Citi Park and Jáki kápolna if you haven't already) and our feet had cramped up a bit! The tickets were such good value even though they were probably the most expensive thing we bought (everything costs pennies there), and we were tempted to book another before the trip was over. Seriously, do it!

Fantastic & educational walk in Budapest!. My girlfriend & I booked a last minute walking tour of Budapest through Discover Budapest & it was the best decision we've made. I can't fault anything from start to finish - out guide Andi was a breath of fresh air, polite, informative and extremely knowledgable. We couldn't have asked for a better way to start our holiday or see the most notable sights if this beautiful city. I'd highly recommend them to anyone looking to Discover Budapest! A huge thanks to Andi as well who not only gave us an amazing insight into the history of this city but also pointed in the direction of some of her favourite spots. If you get the chance try the Gelato @ GelatoRosa next to St Stephens Basilica & next door to that is DiVino wine bar where you can get some of the best wines Hungary has to often (try the local favourite red known as BoarsBlood & the cheese plate - awesome)

Fantastic!. George and Christie were great! The Segway tour was exactly what wanted- saw a lot of the city with great historical knowledge and all in a fast paced Segway ride!!The Segway training was thorough and we were All very capable at there control quickly Big thanks to the team for being very accommodating!! Well come back again on our next trip to budapest... Great city
Don't miss this stour. This is a perfect way to start a visit to Budapest The tour is casual and a good way to get your bearings.Ask for Laslo for a great guide.

A relaxing walk through Budapest. We were guided by Anna through the town to the river. She told us stories instead of reciting figures and facts. At the Danube we were dropped off on a boat that cruised the river for an hour. The sights were explained with an audio guide. The text was nicely put together. Very good value for money and Anna was an excellent guide.

Great way to see a fabulous city. Took the longer 3+ hr Segway tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. Segway is a great way to move quite quickly through a city and this gave Robert our guide plenty of time to answer questions and describe many of the fabulous sights. By visiting with a local you quickly get to know a city, it's people, history, find interesting places to visit and maybe avoid some of the obvious tourist hotspots.Thoroughly recommended and good value for money.

Quite Fantastic!. We had a EXCEPTIONAL, wonderful guided tour with Laszlo.A veritable "goulash" of history, geography, politics, culture, poetry, humour, mythology, folklore religion, technology, music (the National anthem rendition was ambitious!) architecture of a wonderful city in a fantastic country.There were only four visitors on the tour - two couples, We rapidly became a cohesive engaged group all enjoying each other's company. Laszlo said that he enjoyed the job because he felt it was like showing friends round his home city - indeed it was, we were treated to the company of a real friend. We were also spoiled by fantastic weather - although I am not sure that I can credit that too to Laszlo!By the end of the tour we had firm plans of what to do and see and where to eat for the rest of our visit. Which worked well.I cannot recommend enough the tour and Laszlo as a guide.Quite fantastic!Matt

Great Walking Tour. Brigitte was great! She provided a wonderful tour and great information about Budapest. What a wonderful city, we can't wait to come back. She didn't walk to fast or slow and was considerate of everyone in the tour. The stop for coffee and strudel was a highlight and much appreciated. There is so much information about this city I can't put it all here because everything we did turned our great. We plan to use the same group in Prague and I hope they are as good.
Segway ride in Budapest. Tamaas our guide took perfect care of us and told us a lot or history and other fun thingd.Highly recommended!!

Must go on Hammer and Sickel Tour!. We did two tours through Discover Budapest and they were the best our entire vacation throughout Europe. We only had 3 days in Budapest and they really made the most of it. We did the Absolute Walking tour (awesome, great overview of Budapest) and the Hammer and Sickle tour which was the coolest tour I've ever been on. The Hammer and Sickle really got into the interesting history and the fact that as an American I was exposed to a whole other part of the world: the former Soviet regime. I definitely recommend doing both tours if you can. The guides were amazing, friendly and thorough and the experience was the best!

Excellent option of tours. We took a night dinner cruise which gave us an amazing view of Budapest. A must do even if you do not go for the dinner. The city is just so beautifully lit up at night.We took a Around the Danube Bend trip which was suppose to be a river tour but I did not realise after end Sept they only do it by car. A little disappointed, but the sights we saw were really worth the trip by boat or by car. Our guide was very informative! Well done!We took the Absolute walking tour and that was great fun as you get to use the metro and get to see some fantastic sights around the city. Must do! Our guide Tomas was Super!

Awesme. I found this website and booked these tours Night stroll and Boat ride and the other one Absolute Budapest.and I made the right decision .The best way to see Budapest are these tours,Our Guide Thomas was fantastic.his knowledge his way of communicating and his sense of Humor made these tours unforgettable experience. I will recommend these tours to everyone visiting Budapest.Its worth It.All the best Guys and keep up the good work.
Thoroughly enjoyable tour.. Thoroughly enjoyed our tour with Bella, who was very knowledgeable about all the sights and looked after us very well.
So much fun!. My friend and I had so much fun on our segway tour in Budapest!! Kinga was our tour guide and she was wonderful. We would definitely do it again!
Absalute Walking Tour Budapest. Great walking tour and our guide thomas was a wealth of knowledge. I would recommend this tour to anyone whou would like to learn more about the history of Budapest.

The only way to tour budapest. Thank you to Kristin our guide who was both kind and patient with our group. We saw all the key sites in and around budapest and our tour was perfectly timed for us to catch the changing of the guard at parlament and hear the church bells ringing at St Stephen's cathedral. I highly recommend this tour to anyone looking to have fun and get around quickly! Ask for Kristina if you can!

Best way to see Budapest. Segway tours are the best way to see a city - you cover more ground and sights than you would if you walked, and it's far better than looking out of a bus window! Our guide on the superior tour was George and he was super! Very knowledgable, friendly and always leading us safely around the city. This tour is a must for those who want to see Budapest at its best and have a great time doing it!

Awesome tours- Must see!. Booked a Segway tour and a walking tour with Discover Budapest. Guides were very knowledgeable and took us to some very nice landmarks. The Segway is a bit tricky at first but after a while it becomes so much fun would definitely recommend for anyone who likes taking pictures of cool sites or landmarks. All the best Budapest has to offer is available in the stores anyone coming to Budapest highly recommended they take the stores great day out and meet some fun people!

Eger wine tour with Anna. We spent the day with Anna touring the town of Eger and then doing wine tasting. Anna turned what could have been a typical day of tourism into a day of being welcomed into the Hungarian family. She is a true professional -- her breadth of knowledge and understanding is unsurpassed. But beyond her depth of knowledge, her people skills and her relationship skills make her truly exceptional. I would welcome her not only as a tour guide but as a friend. After touring the Eger castle/fortress, we had lunch at a local restaurant she recommended that was filled with locals and not tour busses it's where the food was amazing and each course was paired with a local wine. After, we went to the valley of the beautiful women and spent the afternoon at the Biro Biro cave. Beatriz, the owner, conducted our tastings and she was a true gem. We were welcomed as a part of her family and her wine tasting experience was one of a kind. She is a true Hungarian gem and we we're honored to share her phenomenal wine. Anna was a true joy and professional to spend the day with -- I would recommend her to anyone looking for an interesting, laid-back and knowledgable guide with whom you can learn more about the region. Five stars no question.

Segway tour of Budapest. Robert our guide must have wondered what he let himself in for when saw two elderly ladies waiting to be escorted around Budapest on Segways! We had done it before in Denver (USA) last year so were experienced but it was nice to get a refresher from him before setting off. His english was excellent and knowledge and history of Budapest was outstanding. He took great care of us as we zoomed down bike lanes in the equivalent of Piccadilly Circus during the rush hour. It was a bit hairy at times but he took good care of us. His passion for his city brought it to life for us. The 2 hours soon passed and I'm sure he was relieved that we had made it back without any mishaps. It was a great experience and I would recommend it to young and old.

Best way to discover the city!. We decided to book a Segway tour for our first morning in Budapest to try and get our bearings of the city and spend our first morning finding out a bit more about it. I cannot put in words how glad I am that we did! We booked the extended tour which meant there were only 4 of us on the tour, with our guide Robert. He was friendly and made sure we knew what we were doing before we left. Although a little intimidating to begin with on the busy roads, we soon got used to it and we had a great time. We saw a lot of the city and all the main sights, stopped for coffee and cake and then finished off the tour back to the office. Robert was an amazing guide, he was very informative and friendly and we had an absolutely amazing morning. Would definitely recommend this tour to anyone interested in exploring the city!

Perfectly balance; helped us understand the Cold War on a personal level. Zsolt was a wonderful guide, sharing music, family mementos and his own views (but only when asked). The tour was structured very well - it started off on the individual level, then moved to the socio-political. Many of my questions were, no doubt, strange, but Zsolt handled them very well. We lucked out, and were the only two on the tour. It will probably be different with a mixed group, but still pretty worthwhile, I'd bet.

Segways are the only way to travel. It's our custom to segway around the world so whilst it was more expensive than Berlin and Vilnius tours, we were super impressed with the fact that they add 30mins to the 2hr duration for training, as opposed to taking 30min training at the start and only 1.5hrs touring. No other company has been generous in that way so we felt better about paying the higher price.The office staff were kind and helpful, Kinga was our guide and she was excellent in making sure the 2 newbies were confident and capable of using the segway before we left. She was very informative, answering our questions and giving time to take photos and get a speed here and there.We had a great time and just wished we could hire the units for several days - it's the only way to get around!

Evening Segway Tour- must do!. A memorable occasion! Friendly, welcoming staff. Great tuition by Christy, who was knowledgable, helpful and very patient as we toured the city and learnt how to manage the segways! For those of a nervous disposition they are easy to handle and manoeuvre once you get used to them! Would recommend, and plan to use the online discount 'gift' given to us by Christy, which entitles is to 20% discount for segways,walks, and bike rides in several other cities. Next stop Prague! Thanks everyone.

Discover Budapest tours guides are excellent.. We experienced 2 tours Jewish Heritage and City Walking Tours. Both Ambrush and Bridget were very knowledgeable about the city and it's history. They spoke eloquently. They made it fun and participative...so be on your toes. The tour was a combination of underground railway and walking....which made it even more interesting. You can also see their passion and pride for their city. We will recommend this company to our friends. Thanks for a great introduction to Hungary!

Excellent Walking Tour. Thoroughly enjoyed our walking tour of Budapest. It was a comprehensive introduction and orientation to Budapest with a very knowledgeable and well informed guide who answered our questions with sophistication. I will definitely recommend the tour to all of our friends.

Excellent segways tour. I visited with my daughter in Budapest. As part of the trip booked tour segways. We were a small group with a great guide named Brigitte. We have received clear and detailed explanations of all the sites we saw. Strongly recommends
Jewish Quarter. We took a walking tour of the Jewish Quarter with Discover Budapest. We found our guide Fatima to be very knowledgeable and enthusiastic.

Great Walking Tour. We did the tour on our first full day and it was a great way to see the city. Bridgit was our guide. She took us to all the important spots in the city. We rode the underground subway to get around to some places. We stopped in a cafe for a strudel and drink. She told us all about the history of Budapest. It was very interesting and a great introduction to the city. We ended at the Matthias Church and spent the afternoon exploring on the Buda side of town. I would definitely recommend this tour.
Budapest Walking Tour. Fabulous, informative, walking tour on Sunday 7 Sept with Jan. 3.5 hour tour quickly became over 4 hours, with no issues....highly recommend it.

Well worth the time and cost. Great tour to start a visit to the city. My guide Robert was funny and knowledgeable. Some food and drink options included in cost as well as other discounts following the tour

Great Introduction to Budapest!. My husband and I did the Night Stroll and Boat Cruise and were really happy we did it our first night in the city. We spent two hours walking the city with Anita and four others (good group size) and it really set us up for the rest of our two days in Budapest. Anita was very personable and answered every question we threw at her about the city and growing up in a Communist country. The boat tour is a little cheesy (narrated by a guy pretending to be the Danube), but the views were beautiful, we got a free glass of beer/champagne and it really did provide a lot of history and detail through the headphones. The restaurant recommendations Anita gave were great too!

A very enjoyable and helpful introduction to Budapest!. I was the lone Brit on a half-day walking tour of Budapest led by Andi, with the rest of the group coming from the USA and Australia. Andi speaks excellent English and is very personable. We covered quite a lot of ground in a short space of time, assisted by a short trip on the metro and a sit-down in a local café/restaurant where we all enjoyed some freshly made Hungarian strudel and a coffee/drink. The trip proceeds at a moderate pace, is not strenuous and provides a fascinating introduction to both Budapest and the turbulent history of Hungary, which Andi was able to summarise succinctly. The trip takes in many but, of course, not all the main sights. Andi is clearly very knowledgeable; however, in my view she struck the right balance, by not overloading us with too much information. She was also very happy to answer any questions we had. Overall, it was a very enjoyable and useful orientation trip. Thank you Andi!

Great place to hire bikes. Looking to hire bicycles for the day, we found Discover Budapest on the internet, close to the opera metro station, and very easy to find, helpful staff who all speak english, good, and very yellow bikes, and a very easy hire system, just a deposit, no id required.pricing was very reasonable, Budapest has a pretty good cycle lane system, especially along the Danube, and on Margret island, so a great way to spend the dayThey also do segeway tours which we'd like to try next timerecommended

Personal tour for the price of a group tour, very lucky.. I was very lucky and was the only person on my afternoon bike tour, Laszlo was my guide. He was friendly, approachable and informative without sounding like he was reading from a book. Snack stop was good, nice restaurant. Budapest is beautiful and I thought the tour was great value for money.

Fantastic tour of the city by Segway. We booked a Segway tour of the city - it was really fantastic, taking in the sights of the city and stopping at various points to take photos and hear more about the area. Our guide was excellent and she helped everyone feel comfortable with how to use the Segways properly (30mins) and then took us out for a 2 hour guided tour. Groups are kept small (less than 10) so everyone can enjoy a more personal experience. I'd recommend this activity to anyone!

Discover Budapest. Our travel agent booked us a private tour and we could not have been more pleased. Our tour guide Lorant Laszlo was a pleasure. He was personable and provided a terrific balance of history and culture. Of the guides we have had in the cities we have traveled, he was the best. I highly recommend him.

Very informative and great fun too!. Five of us booked a Segway tour of the main sites of the town. Two had Segway'd before and the rest of us were both excited and apprehensive. However with a little tuition from Christy, our guide, to familiarise ourselves before setting off on the tour, we were already loving it. The tour itself was very good, catching a good number of key sites and having them put into context with some of the history from Christy. We dutifully followed in the tracks of Christy when told to do so in the busier areas, which was not a problem at all, and were let off the leash when time and space allowed - great fun! The tour gave us a good feel for the geography of the town and enabled us to work out to where we wanted to go back to on foot. Thank you Christy!

Good overview of the City. Anna was our guide who was very helpful and informative. The tour was very history oriented and gave a good overview of the city's main sights. You cover a lot of ground, but they make it easier by using the metro and giving you a break. It would have been nice to learn a bit more about life in Budapest today, but Anna provided some good context in that respect chatting between sights. Perhaps a bit too long in hero's square...

Terrific Walking Tour. Andi our guide was a wealth of information and delightful. With this tour we saw parts of Budapest I would never have seen. We hit the highlights, had some delicious strudel and we were able to an amazing amount of Budapest in a short time. Would highly recommend.

The Hammer and Sickle Tour. (* I am not sure if this walk is done by Discover Budapest or Absolute Budapest as they work out of the same location and seem to work together with respect to selling tours).We did the communist tour with Anna and a trainee Robbie. It was a little weird at first as we were taken into the basement of the tourist center where they have a room set up with decor of the era, the "time capsule" as they called it. Anna was anxious to provide a background education prior to the tour and her enthusiasm shone through. The tour doesn't take place in the basement so don't worry about it. Anna and Robbie enthusiastically showed us various parts of the city and discussed the country's political history. They also explained architecture and culture. We particularly enjoyed two metro rides, one on a communist-era metro line and the other (not sure if was a plan or a coincidence) on a more modern one. If you are interested in modern history this is a recommended tour. Tip: the tour does not end where it starts and is a bit out of the way so plan on getting back to the center via metro or taxi. If you like to walk we walked back to the center quite easily via Raday street where we stopped for a late afternoon snack.

Amazing tours through Budapest!!!. Me with my fiancée visited Budapest in August 2014 and decided to see as much as we could during those three days. On a good recommendation we were referred to Discover Budapest and it surpassed our expectations. We took three tours - Night Stroll with boat cruise, Buda Castle walking tour and downtown All in one tour...All tour guides - Anita, George and Anna were very professional and shared with us history of Hungarian nation and many interesting stories connected to Budapest. I highly recommend to take All in one tour if you're short of time, Castle tour for those who would like to know more about this district and lastly - the Night Stroll is very romantic tour you end up on a relaxing boat cruise with free champagne included:-) Our guides really convinced us that Budapest is a city worth of second visit!

Andi was our Tour Guide. She was very kind, helpfull and had a very good knowledge about the Hungarian History. Thanks. Andi was our Segway Tour Guide. She was very kind, helpfull and had a very good knowledge about the Hungarian History. Thanks again

Great Bike Tour of Budapest. A great bike tour, informative and fun, led by Barbie, a charming and knowledgeable guide. We learned a lot of Hungarian history, and saw a number of beautiful sights we would otherwise have missed.

Budapest Card is worth it. I was a little hesitant about spending $35 for a 72 hour card when people mention that this is an eminently walkable city. But on many occasions we were on one side of the city and had to go to see an attraction on the city and a direct bus was easily available. We also made use of the Number 2 tram. And had one guided walking tour. Overall I broke even using this card

Super Segway Tour. Had great fun on the 3 hour segway tour. Easy to use after a short training session. Our Guide Anna was superb and very knowledgable and interesting. Good value and saw all the main sites. Highlight of our holiday, and thoroughly recommended.
BEST TOUR YOU CAN DO IN BUDAPEST!. Amazing time on the Segways. So worth it. Our tour guide Bridget was a brilliant. Thanks so much from the English guys.

Fascinating tour. I spent Wednesday morning on the walking tour with Brigit, and as no-one else had booked I was lucky to have a private tour. Brigit was very experienced and clearly knew the city, showing me the main sights as well as an insight into living in Budapest. I learnt a great deal about the history ( just the right amount for me), as well as hearing about when Budapest was used as Moscow in one of the Die Hard movies!I would strongly recommend this tour, and whilst it is not included in many of the 'free' tourist packages, for me it was definitely worth paying the small charge. Whilst I'm sure it is unusual to get a personal tour, I saw huge groups around, no doubt struggling to hear and missing out on not being able to ask questions.An excellent insight into a fascinating tour.

Super Segway. Three hour tour (after training) became 3.5. We saw all of Pest and Szabi (hope that's right!) was a great guide. Brand new Segway i2s but don't kid yourself - if you damage it you will be liable to pay! Discount on rebooks. I've become a Segway addict and thoroughly recommend. My advice: build in a drinks break at a tame cafe. We won't care if it's your aunts place

Budapest Morning Segway Tour 2 hours + training. We booked the 2 hours Morning Segway Tour in the course of a stag party for 8 people. It was great fun, everybody enjoyed that way of discovering the "Pest" side of the city. Our guide was called "Andi" and she really did a great job. "2 hours" also really were 2 entire hours, the training is held before the 2 hours begin.

A good tour of a great city. We did the 3 hour walking tour with Tomas in mid-July. He did a great job showing off this amazing city. It was very hot but we still covered a lot of ground. I think you want to be in decent walking shape to do this tour as the walk up to the Buda district is a fair workout. We took the streets instead of the stairs as it was 33 that day. The stop for strudel was also tasty and fun. The hero’s park part was a little long but that could be just because of the heat, I might have enjoyed that more if it would have been cooler. I would recommend both our guide and this tour we certainly learned a lot about one of my new favourite cities.

Highly recommend the cycle tour!. We had a great time doing the cycling tour of Budapest. Though we used our own bikes there were no bike issues with the group and the tour itself was informative, well-organised and interesting with our guide Gabor. The last part cycling through traffic may have been a little stressful for less experienced cyclists but it wasn't for very long and everyone got through it without incident! Highly recommend the tour as a great way to see all of the main attractions in a short period of time.

Excellent tour!. We had an excellent tour around Budapest with our wonderful guide Laszlo. He knew so much about the city, but our tour was also great fun. A wonderful, relaxing way to discover the city. Laszlo gave us some great tips on other places to visit during our stay, and places to go for dinner etc. Would highly recommend this walking tour.

Walking Tour is Awesome!. My wife and I did the walking tour on our first full day in Budapest. I highly recommend it. You will get a good historical overview of the city's history and orientation to the major sites. Our guide was very knowledgeable and personable. Highly recommend it.

Great walking tour and guide. We took the daily 10:00am walking tour. Our guide was Andi. Both the tour and Andi were terrific! She really knew Budapest and the region's history. The tour included a stop at a great strudel shop. Highly recommended!7

segway tour around budapest. My girlfriend and I booked the segway tour before we had arrived and didn't know what to expect. We thought we would have gone around in a group but we had our own personal tour guide. Her name was Andi and she was excellent. The tour lasted about two hours which felt like just the right amount of time, any longer and your legs start to ache. It was oir first full day in Budapest and it was good to get our bearings around the city. The city is beautiful and the segways seemed like the perfect way to get around. I would definitely go again and couldn't recommend it enough!
Great Way to See Budapest. Did the afternoon segway tour. Central location behind Opera House. Fun time & great route. Easy to learn and staff very friendly.

Absolute walking tour!. I had the walking tour with Bridget. It was a small group, only about 10 of us all together. We learned so much from Bridget! I was very happy with this tour. We even took a peak at the Széchenyi thermal baths! And the park and castle around there. The castle her favorite, and I can see why! :) She has such a kind personality and really made the information she delivered fun to learn about and she questioned us in a unique way to get to her stories. I liked it. I can definitely recommend this tour to any traveller. It's not excessive walking. You even get to ride the underground! The oldest in continental Europe ;) Thanks Bridget!!

Good walking tour. We had booked the walking tour through Viator. Our guide Anna was very cheerful and told us the history of Budapest during the tour. The best part of the tour was a stop at a local cafe where we had two pastries. A good tour for someone who wants to get acquainted with the the city!

Segway city tour. We were 2 couples who took the segway tour last week with Andi who was very informative and showed us what an amazing city she resides!! Segway is an awesome way to see any city and I highly recommend!!

Great tour!. I highly recommend this tour because of at least 3 reason: 1) I don't know any person who doesn't enjoy Seagway. It's easier than anything on the wheels.2) Seagway in Budapest, in one of the most beautiful cities in Europe, becomes even more special event.3) to make it even more special you need to join the guide Joseph, the funniest guide I've ever met. And he speaks fluently at least 5 languages. We tried as we had multinational team.

Amazing Tour of the City!. I was in Budapest for work, and unexpectedly got the last day off. I booked the walking tour with Brigit and couldn't have been happier. The walk is beautiful, and Brigit answered every single question I could think of. My parents are both history professors, so I knew they would want to know details about everything from Roman times to Hungary's joining the EU, and Brigit knew detailed facts about all of it. She was very knowledgeable and welcoming to the city and the country - it was a really nice way to spend the days after four solid days working jet-lagged at the University. My favorite parts were her great stories about the monuments in hero's square, as well as the stop for strudel near St. Stephen's - try the cabbage and the sour cherry - both are incredibly good! The view up near Buda castle at the end is worth the walk up the hill (I didn't find it bad at all, but might be hard if you have mobility issues). Brigit also suggested we bring water and I recommend this too!
Great fun segway-ing through Budapest. We did a private Segway tour and had a great time. The Segways were awesome and so was our guide. Greatly recommended!

Great tour!. we did the budapest castle district walking tour with our guide, Lazlo, in late June 2014. it ended up just being us in the group! ( we were actually runing a little late, and he managed to find us!)he was very knowledgeable and passionate- clearly loves his job! he played us a number of songs on a flute/ whistle that he had - including the National Anthem, which was moving. would definately reccommend this walking tour- it gives you a good understanding of the Buda side of the City, and was not too rushed. thankyou Lazlo for a great afternoon!
Budapest Segway Tour. Awesome tour. Small group and the segways are super fun! Brigit was a fantastic guide - informative and entertaining. Highly recommended!

Yellow Zebra Bike Tour. Our bike tour of Budapest was splendid. Gabor, our guide, was friendly, knowledgeable, and full of interesting information. We saw all the important sights, with great commentary. A wonderful way to gain a first look at the city before setting out on your own, more extensive explorations.

Absolute Walking Tours with Laszlo. The way our guide Laszlo introduce the city of Budapest and character of Hungarians was absolute wonderful. The tour lasts for more than 3 hours ,but went very quick,thanks to Laszlo who was professional,gave us a lot of interesting information, was very friendly,witty, show us his musical skills ( played us Hungarian anthem himself).The tour was a highlight of our trip to BudapestLaszlo, thank you very much from Olga and Igor(Australia)

Budapest Segway Tour. As the best man for my friends wedding, we decided a Stag-do trip to picturesque Budapest would be a great choice, but wanted to have him enjoy something other than just all day drinking! And this experience was just the thing to do that.After a brief 20 minute training session with the staff of "Discover Budapest" me & my 5 friends embarked on a highly insightful cruise around Budapest on our Segways, while their Budapest-born your guide filled us in on monuments, history+events that we saw around us! There were about 20-25 people in the tour in total.At some stages of the tour we were also allowed to push the segways a little more and scoot off around open spaces - lots of fun!Give this tour a go, I don't think you'll regret it ;)

Their biketour is the best way to see the city. Its always fun to take a biketour in a foreign city, this was no exception. Knowledgeable guide, we saw all things that you need to see and heard a lot about it.

Walk Tour of Budapest. Our walking tour was an excellent introduction to the history of Budapest. Andi, our guide, took us around the city, describing everything from Hungary's past leaders to the once innovative metro system. I would recommend Andi and the Discover Budapest tour to anyone who is planning to visit Budapest in the future.

Great way to see Budapest!. Barbie was our tour guide for the 4 hr bike tour and she did an amazing job! We had a large group, about 20 ppl, and she made it feel like we were a small group! The little snack at the end of the trip is a nice bonus too :) Definitely recommend this to anyone who can ride a bike!
Walk Tour of Budapest. This tour was a great introduction to Budapest and its history. Our tour guide, Tamas, was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic.

Great Value - Great Time. If you can ride a bike we highly recommend Yellow Zebra Bike Tours! It is fun! Anita, our guide was extremely knowledgeable, very enthusiastic and a joy to have lead our group. We had interesting conversations as biked and learned about Budapest. Yellow Zebra with their professionalism make this a special experience, a wonderful way to get an over view of the city, learn its history and present culture. Joan and Peter

3hour Walking Tour of Budapest. A wonderful background and orientation of Budapest. Our guide Brigit was so informative and interesting. Highly recommended as way to get to know a bit of the background of this beautiful country. Pat and Lesley.

Good value - great experience. First time in Budapest. Excellent introduction and orientation to the city, culture, and history. Anita, our guide, was competent, friendly and helpful. Anita sat with us during our stop at the yummy strudel restaurant and gave us more details about Hungary and assisted us with planning the remainder of our trip. Length of the tour was perfect and the tour covered the main sites in and Pest and once we arrived in Buda, the views we're fantastic. Anita Also had good recommendations for things outside the tour.

Awesome Segway tour. Although I appreciate a good walking tour, I have recently discovered Segway tours. With only a few days in Budapest, I wanted a good overview of the city and the Segway tour fit the bill. You cover so much more than you could otherwise just walking and you don't miss out on any of the personal touch that a walking tour provides. I was part of a group that started with five and my friend and I opted for the extended tour and after 2 hours we had our guide, Tomas, all to ourselves for an additional hour+. He was very engaging, knowledgeable and he loved questions. In addition to the big must-see sites, he showed us some other interesting things which I otherwise would not have seen. Reading some of these other reviews, it sounds as if Discover Budapest has some great guides, Tomas included. Highly recommend.

Segway History Tour - AWESOME!. Being allergic to bus tours and touristy stuff, and needing a bit of adrenaline in my life, I went on a Segway Tour of Budapest with Discover Budapest / Yellow Zebra. Being the only participant on the day, I got a personalised tour with one of the friendliest and most knowledgeable tour guides - Tomas. Tomas firstly gave me a training session to ensure my safety and then we were off around the city. I am not the world's biggest history buff, but Tomas made it fun and fascinating - and expertly guided me through traffic and and up and down curbs. The trip was brilliant and I recommend it to anyone who fancies a bit of fun with their history, and at 58 Euros, very good value. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED and thank you Tomas.

Hungaro Gastro - Budapest Food & Wine Tour. Our tour guide, Barbara, was excellent! The four hour tour included: sipping Unicum, a tour of the Great Market Hall, food tastings (dried meats, cheeses, snacks, paprika, candy, chocolates), a short walk around the town with stops in a few local restaurants (for lunch, dessert, and chocolate), wine tasting, and a quick stop at a ruin bar. Barbara's English is excellent and she is very knowledgable of Budapest, Hungary, local traditions, and local history. We highly recommend this tour -- well worth the price.

Discover Budapest -the absolute walking tour. We did the 31/2 hour walking tour with Bridget on our second day in Budapest and it was fabulous.
