We walked and caught the metro so covered a large area and our guide introduced us to not only the wonderful sights of Budapest but also the fascinating history of Hungary. I can highly recommend the tour

Budapest 3 hour walking tour - the best possible start to our visit. From the start, our delightful and accomplished guide, Anita, made our tour interactive. She encouraged questions and none went unanswered. We were treated to a comprehensive overview of the city, covering its history, art and architecture with plenty of interesting and humorous snippets of information thrown in. We were captivated throughout the tour and when it finished, found it hard to believe that 3 hours had passed. It would be hard to imagine a better introduction to the city. Köszönöm Anita!

Segway Tour is a must. This would have to be one of the best tours my husband and I have ever been on! The segways were so much fun and our guide, Brigit was fantastic! Well worth the money and highly recommend this tour as it is a great way to explore the city.

Perfect overview of Budapest. We did the 3 hour general walking tour with Anita on our first day in Budapest and it was the perfect introduction to the city. Anita was a wonderful guide, sharing a great mix of insights, anecdotes and history - with an impressive command of English. I felt she went well beyond what she needed, making sure everyone in our group of 6 had customized advice for places to visit. I loved the coffee and strudel stop as well. I would highly recommend this tour, especially in the beginning of the trip as it gives the perfect overview to this beautiful city!

Discover Budapest. Our Absolute Walking Tour was great. Anita was very knowledgeable, informative and kept our group of 6 engaged and interested. She also shared some tips on what to do on our own. The tour was time well spent!

Unorganised - over 2 hour wait. I did a caving tour - the caves themselves were fantastic but the organisation of the company was terrible!!The tour started at 1:45 - it was 4:00 before we even suited up to go into the caves!! Really disappointing and unexecptable to wait around doing nothing was so long

Segway Tour. A fantastic way to view the city of Budapest in 2hrs. Bernadette took us around the major tourist points and gave us an insight into all the attractions along the way. Great fun & will definitely use this company if in Budapest again.

Walking tour with Laszlo In March 2014. Our half day walking tour in Pest with Lazlo was fantastic! He made it really personal experience with music, dancing and was extremely knowledgeable. Thank you

No better way to discover Budapest. This is the perfect concise way to see and understand Budapest. Our guide Anita was charming, considerate and sensitively aware of each person in her care. She was thoroughly informative and open to questioning, taking time to answer with an impressive command of English. We were so captivated that we feel that we must return to Budapest. Thanks :)

Exactly what I wanted! . So we started in the middle of the city with Anna, an excellent tour guide. She was very interesting and informative. A great tour with metro and buses included. Aslo a coffee and a strudle as part of the tour. Great job Anna, will defo reccomend you to others.

Segway Tour with Bridget. Because we liked our segway tour in Prague so we decided to have segway tour in Budapest. We enjoy our time with Bridget. She is quite pretty, speak very good english and very informative. Thanks :)

Excellent - I would highly recommend this tour!. If you are coming to Budapest with a limited idea on what there is to see this tour is an excellent overview of what Budapest has to offer. This tour highlighted the main sights, while providing a very interesting history lesson of the country from it's inception.Our guide, Brigit, was phenomenal. She presented the information with ease and in a way that made me want to know more about this fascinating country. The group consisted of roughly 10-15 people and Brigit did a great job engaging everyone and was able to answer every additional question posed to her. Overall, I would highly recommend taking this tour. You will not be sorry. It serves as a great place to start your journey through Budapest and can help to outline the rest of your visit. Brigit was able to recommend what sights to explore more thoroughly and other sights or activities not included on the tour that should not be missed. Enjoy your travel to Budapest!

Budapest Walking Tour. The walking tour of Budapest was very good value for money, especially if you book on-line in advance and save a further 10% (useful tip!!!!). The meeting point is easy to find. Our tour guide was Brigit (on the morning of Friday 2nd May 2014) whom was very polite, knowledgable and kept the small group of six of us (three parties of two) interested throughout the three and a half hours. The pace of the walk was excellent and we visited Heroes' square and city park which we would probably never have done or ventured to had we not done the tour.The walk up to to the Matthias Church & Fisherman's Bastion would not suit everyone, but then you would not be doing the walking tour if you didn't like 'a challenge'. The inclusive visit to the coffee shop for patisseries helped beforehand. A nice touch and a good idea.My advise to all who visit Budapest is ditch the 'hop on, hop off' bus tours and get your feet on the ground. You see far more of the city and having a good tour guide gives you a clear informed visit and the chance to ask questions the buses do not give you...and you'll feel fitter as well! A good basis and starting point, if like us, you need to know the way around before tackling in more depth on your own later in your visit to this lovely city.We did fancy a go on the Segways, but only having four days to see everything, we ran out of time.Thank you Brigit and Budapest Tours for a nice tour.

Fantastic walking tour. I cannot recommend this tour highly enough. Our guide, Anita, ensured that it was engaging, responsive and highly interesting and relevant. Probably the best tour of this kind that I have been on.

Segway tour rocks!. I have to say that the Segway tour turned out to be one of the highlights of my budapest city break.The tour guide Kinga was a very good Segway trainer and tour guide. This was despite the fact we were messing about quite a lot, Kinga kept her cool and kept the group together.The whole group got to know each other very quickly and it was a great mix of nationalities and characters.Thanks to the Segway and Kinga we got to see and learn a hell of a lot in a short space of time. The Segway tour is a must, really cool, fun. You have to do it, it's amazing.

Bike Tour Guide Should Receive More Training. Unfortunately the bike tour was not a good experience. The perk - biking around the city. The con - the tour guide. She had a quiet voice, didn't know how to keep the group together, didn't seem excited about the history, didn't provide much cultural information, and seemed extremely new (however, she has been there for a couple years). Perhaps different tour guide would have been helpful. I was counting down the minutes before the tour was done. I've heard the walking tours are good...

What a beautiful city. Highly recommended...although I came for business trip and only 1 day to explore this city, it is really beautiful and definitely it is not enough time for me. Will come again soon.

Bicycle tour through Budapest. We went on a 4 1/2 hour biking tour of Budapest with Bernadette, a wonderful, young, energetic, and knowledgeable Hungarian tour guide. My wife and I were the only two on the bike tour that day, so we have a private tour of the entire city. This also made it very easy to obtain lots of pictures from different angles without having to deal with large tourist crowds.Bernadette guided us though all the major sites on both the Buda and Pest sides of the city, proving lots of history and stories at each of the stopping points. We were treated a comprehensive history and cultural lesson at each of the sites, and Bernadette answered all of our questions with enthusiasm.Cycling is Budapest is safe and easy. Bernadette did a great job signaling and indicating our route. The bike lanes are protected from major traffic.The bicycles are very easy to ride. Because of the frequent stops and length of the stops, you are never out of breath or sweating. The bike ride has one hill climbing up to the castle district on the Buda side, and the Pest side is essentially flat. Total distance covered is between 6 and 7 miles which, over 4+ hours is essentially a very relaxed paced. If you know how to ride a bike, this is a fantastic way to see the city. We highly recommend Yellow Zebra if you have a day in Budapest.

Segway Tour. Highly recommended..Our lovely guide Brigit took us through the basics and quickly got us confidant to take off through the streets of Pest.Brigit gave us a great mix of Segway riding and stops at various sites, where she was extremely informative. We learned more in the couple of hours or so we spent with Brigit than in all the previous days we'd been in Budapest.The final blast around the large open area in front of the parliament building was more fun than you could shake a stick at ! ☺Thank you Brigit.

Segway Tour. We enjoyed the Segway tour around Pest on Wednesday afternoon, Laszlo was the guide, he was able to share lots of information whilst also having fun at the same time. The team in the office were very welcoming, plenty of Budapest information available, just wish we had found their office a day earlier. Would recommend the tour and if we are in Prague we will certainly make use of the Segway tour.

Brilliant Segway tour of Budapest.. Highly recommend the Segway tour of Budapest. Enjoyable and educational. What a beautiful, friendly city! Our tour guide Brigit was very helpful and made the group very welcome. It felt safe but exciting as well. The highlight was racing around the Parliament Square on the Segways.

Defiantly recommended!. We were lucky to have the 2 hour city tour to ourselves :) our guide Bernadette was really friendly, knowledgeable and fun. She also gives great restaurant suggestions :) thank you

Budapest Segway Tour. we use Segway tours whenever we can when visiting cites this is one of the best we have done.Great Segway tour around the Pest side of Budapest very knowledgable guide spoke great english and answered all questions. we had a very small group just myself my wife and 2 others which added to the experience and personal touch. i would recommend the superior tour it adds 1 hour onto the tour and takes you down to the park and heroes square which we would not have seen as we where only in Budapest for the weekend plus you get to enjoy lots of extra time on the fantastic and fun Segway's. overall a fantastic experience and tour i would highly recommend.

Wonderful Segway Tour of Pest. I was hesitant to ride a segway for 2 hours as I had never ridden one before. Our tour guide (Kinge) spent individual time with us until we were conifdent enough to venture out. It turned out to be very easy, even for a fat, 50+ year old american. Faster then walking and way less tiring we saw the famous sites of Pest with our knowledgable guide. It was so easy we signed up for the extra hour and our tour was close to 5 hours long...it was one of the best experiences I've had. I highly recommend the segway if you only have one day to see the city. Wonderful, absolutely wonderful.

Interesting information and locations. We went on the tour of the Pest side of the city which was free for us with 24h Budapest card. There was only the three of us and a guide Brigit who was friendly and she told us about Hungary's history in short and simple way, and answered all our questions about other attractions in the city. Very interesting and worth the time!

buda and pest visited. we were guided through Pest by Brigit and through Buda by Laslo and both gave us a good impression of the typical areas and laid a good basis for further exploration. Good knowledge of English. Recommendable.

Best tour of Budapest with the best guide, László!. It was a fantastic tour in a beautiful city! László made it wonderful and full of charm/character. Would love to do it again and I hope I can again soon!

Excellent Segway Tour. The Segway tour is a great way to get an overview of the Pest side of Budapest. Since only my wife and I had signed up for the tour that morning, we had what turned out to be a private tour with a knowledgable guide (Bernadette) who answered all our questions and spoke English very well. It's easy to learn how to ride a Segwsy and it is a blast. A great way to spend your first morning in Budapest and see many of the important sights.

Great introduction to Budapest. Had a great time on the Absolute overview tour of Budapest. My guide was enthusiastic and knowledgeable about Budapest's past and present. Interested to engage in conversation about living in Budapest and I found that I am retaining the information through the way the city and its history was introduced. Would recommend without hesitation.

Amazing guided Segway round trip!. We booked a 3 hour guided tour with driving a segway. The cost was 36000 HUF (80 USD) But it ws really worth the money. First we had a training session to get to know and ride the segway. In the beginning i felt difficult, but after 5 minutes we really got a hold of it, and it become very easy and very very fun. We had a guide named Thomas, he was fun, helpfull and a really great guide. So ask for him if you are going to take the tour. This was really worth the money. Top recommendation from me :) LUPS

Enjoyed every minute.. Anna our guide is interesting, interested and entertaining. She took us on a 3.5 hour walk showing us the most interesting buildings alongside fun facts. Highly recommend her and the company!

Segway tour Budapest. I booked a private segway tour for 5 ladies as part of a birthday weekend, amazing!From the first correspondence to the sad goodbyes we were treated wonderfully.Lauren the lady we dealt with on the telephone & email & Peter our guide could not have done more for us, he even showed us an amazing restaurant to go to that night. We laugh all weekend about 1896 & 7... facts I will never forget! Thank you.

Fantastic Buda and Pest Walkingtour. We bought the Budapest card - there were these two tours for buda and pest included - so we did them and we are very happy about it! :)Our guide was László. He is a very intelligent and funny person. He told us the History of this city like a nice story. He also gave us a free language course for some words in hungarian. Thank you very much for these two nice walks! We really enjoyed them!Greets from Vienna Kinga and Benjamin.

Comprehensive and entertaining. Would recommend this tour to all visitors to Budapest interested in learning more about the city, history of Hungary, and culture! Our guide was knowledgable and friendly, showed us the highlights of the city and gave a great review of the history. She had a great sense of humor as well and kept the mood light and enjoyable. The strudel break was delicious and well earned by a hike up to castle hill.

Walking tour of Budapest. The walking tour was very good lots to see and time to look and relax. Coffee and strudels in the Strudel House in Pest was great. Anita was our guide and she was great with a good sense of humour and lots of knowledge of Budapest and Hungary. Would use them again if we return.Lovely city.

Budapest Segway Tour. it was SOOO much fun!What a great way to go around a beautiful city. Kinga, our guide, was lovely and very professional. She gave us a 30 minutes training/practice on the segways before we started the actual tour. She was very knowledgeable and gave us loads of interesting facts about the buildings we saw.The only downside of this activity: having to return the segway at the end of it. I would have happily carried all day :)

You have to buy this card!. The best thing we did was buying a Budapest Card immediately after arriving in Budapest by train from Prague. The card entitles you to use any mode of public transit - metro, tram, or bus. The transit system is the best way to get around the city, it is quick, clean and timely. The card also gives you access to the National Museum and National Gallery and other sites at no extra charge. You can also get 10 to 20% discounts at many other attractions, so it is well worth the money.

Best way to start your time in Budapest. We did the walking tour with Bright, she is friendly and knows everything about everything. The route is well plqnned and her explanations gave us the best hinds of what we wanted to visit in detail later. The tour is highly recommended and if possible you should try to do it with Bright!
buda tour . we wend to Buda tour with Bridget and its was wonderful: the storys she told and the way she guided was very interested. im enjoyd the tour. thank Bridget!

Buda + Pest guided tour with László. We have been deciding for a while which guided tour to choose. At the end we´ve decided to choose a "free" guided tour (free with Budapest card). We did one guided tour in the morning - Buda and the second one afternoon - Pest, both with László and I have to say it was excellent. László is a first class guide. He is funny, entertaining, interesting to listen to and still informative. We can recommend this tour and especially if you go with László, to everyone. Great experience. Vitalij and Markéta from the Czech Republic.

Discover Budapest Walking Tour with Laszlo. I only had one full day in Budapest so I decided to join the walking tour to save me some time (the walking tour is free if you buy the Budapest card). I actually managed to join both the tour for both the Buda and Pest side, both with the same guide, Laszlo. I've never joined walking tours before so I can't really compare but I did enjoy it. Laszlo is a friendly tour guide who is obviously proud of his city and its heritage. He would answer any questions you have related to Budapest, from directions to how to pick up girls in Budapest (the question posed by another tourist in my group). I asked Laszlo if there are any vegetarian Hungarian food and found out he's actually vegan! He recommended me a vegetarian restaurant, and I did end up going there for dinner. It was a productive full day in Budapest thanks to Laszlo!

Budapest. I have just returned from a ten day visit to Budapest for dental treatment.What a beautiful city. There are so many attractions to visit such as The Parliament Buildings, The Royal Palace, St Mathias Church, St Stephen's Cathedral, Fishermans Bastion, and many more.No visit to Budapest could be complete without a visit to the Thermal Baths and Spa at Szechenyi. They are easily accessable on M1, the oldest underground in Europe.I spent a day there and loved every minute of it. They must have the best public transport system in the world. Anybody over the age of 65 can travel free on all public transport around the city. If you are thinking of going there for dental treatment I would highly recommend The Implant Centre on Margit Korut.The staff there, from the girls at reception to the dentists and dental surgeons and nurses are second to none.If you are lucky enough to get Dr Nameth ( dentist ) and Dr Klink( dental surgeon )you will be treated very professionally. It would be hard to find more kind and professional people. If you are looking for a basic comfortable hotel I would suggest you try Hotel Papilon which is only five minutes walk from the clinic.The staff on reception could not be more helpful and informative. If you have a few days to spare I suggest you take a train to Vienna.The journey takes about two and three quarter hours and costs 29 euro rreturn.You can purchase a 48 hour travel ticket for 12 euro and travel on trams, underground or on the buses all over the city. Hope this is helpful to somebody.

The quickest way to get to know Buda and Pest!. We only had a short stay in Budapest, so we wanted to get as much out of it as possible. We did a Pest tour with Thomas (+/- 3 hours) and a Buda tour with Laszlo (+/- 2 hours). They were both excellent, friendly, enthousiastic and fun guides, thanks to whom we had a really good time while learning about the history of Hungary and Budapest. This tour is for free if you buy the Budapest City Card at one of the many tourist information points!

Budapest card "free" walking tour - Locations - could be more, guide - could be more informative. Maybe I had too high expectations after reading all the great opinions. We saw a few of the must see sights of Pest on this walking tour, however I was disappointed as we could have gone much closer to the Parliament. I love architecture and hoped for more detailed information from a tour for our small group. (same problem concerning St. Stephen Cathedral) The guide was young and he tried his best with the jokes. The only advantage of Budapest Card was the free entrance of Lukac Thermal Bath. I enjoyed that a lot. As my hotel was centrally located, and Budapest is absolutely walkable I used the public tram once.

la'szco' s walking tour Buda. He was a very nice and funny boy. He explained us very clearly the attractions, their history and he enjoined us also with his music playing his flute!He knew very well the monuments of Buda.

Excellent walking tour. We took 2 walking tours with Discover Budapest in December 2013. The tours are included if you buy a Budapest card which also includes public transport and discounts/free entry to other attractions. We took the Pest tour with Anna and the Buda tour with Laszlo. Both were excellent, really informative and interesting, brought to life with lots of anecdotes. Laszlo in particular had to do a lot of improvisation as the fog was too thick to see the beautiful views from the Buda. Thoroughly recommended.

Budapest Walking Tour with Anita. My family went to Budapest in December 2013. We went on the walking tour with Anita as our tour guide for both the Buda and the Pest side of the city. Anita was amazing, enthralling us with her knowledge of the history of Beautiful Budapest. Highly recommended

Anna's Walking Tour. I typically don't do packaged tours. But Discover Budapest caught our eye and was a great choice! It is worth the time and a great history lesson! Anna answered all questions patiently and linked them to various historical sites. Walking, metro, bus all part of the experience! I particularly enjoyed the personal anecdotes about her family & communism. The strudel & coffee offered as part of the tour was delicious. Thanks so much Anna! See you in Austin!

Christmas market tour. We went to this excellent Christmas market tour and it is one of the highlights of our trip. Our guide Tamas is very friendly and informative. He's more than happy to answer all our questions. We learnt a lot with this tour about the wine, cuisine and history of Budapest. We had a great time. Thank you and we highly recommended this tour.

Walking Tours in Budapest (link to Budapest Card). We spent 4 days (3 nights) in Budapest and decided to take a 48 hour Budapest card from noon on Saturday to noon on Monday. The package was excellent value but the real highlight was access to the 2 walking tours in Pest and Buda. By chance we had the same guide on both walks (Anita) and that was our good fortune. Despite the cloudy overhead conditions and near freezing temperatures, Anita kept us richly entertained with both facts and folklore. The insights gained on these 2 walking tours enabled us to make the maximum use of our weekend away. Thank you Anita.

Walking tours of Pest and Buda. Having experienced a first tour of Pest with Laszlo, we enjoyed it so much that we joined his tour of Buda the very next day. We loved the way he connected with the group. He genuinely wanted to get to know us and he made it feel as though he was describing places for the first time, just for us.He spoke in a passionate and sensitive way about all that his country has been through, especially when it related to what he had experienced in his own lifetime. We learned a lot in a short time. I love the way he played on his pipe and got us dancing in the street in a way that even the least extrovert person would feel comfortable. We will never forget Laszlo, he is a wonderful representative for his country.
Anita. Anita was our guide in a walking tour in Buda .She did it very interesting . I liked the way she explained not only the historical point of view , also the actual live in Budapest.

Budapest Christmas Market Tour with wine tasting was Fabulous. The Christmas Market Tour was a lovely adventure and our tour guide Julien was wonderful. Her stories about Hungarian Christmas traditions, the cathedral and the wine regions was very informative. The wine tasting was a nice addition to the walking tour and made the group feel connected even before the walk began.

Take the walking tour. I was In town for the weekend from the Canadian West Coast and I used my Budapest Card to take advantage of the tours offered by Discover Budapest. Our guide for the morning and afternoon tours was Laszlo and he was fantastic. We saw a number of amazing sights and Laszlo's explanations, folk tales and insight into the Hungarian culture made for a truly amazing day.

Budapest card. We purchased the 72hour ticket online & picked it up at the airport. We went on the 2 free tours, buda tour with Anna on Sunday morning in the pouring rain & the pest tour with Anita on Monday afternoon in the snow. Both were extremely good, very informative, friendly, humourous & helpful. Both spoke English very well & gave us a great intro to Budapest, Hungary's history & places visit & even how to get to each place. Brilliant.

A great value...... We attended a walking tour with Discover Budapest and had a wonderful time. The tour was free with our Budapest Card and we did not know what to expect. We were surprised. The tour started at the castle in Buda where we met the group and guide. Our Guide was a young gentleman named Victor who took around to the sights. He knew well the sights and some core history. But if your looking for history that goes back to 700 AD, you would be best to take a Trafalgar tour. We were perfectly content with all the information that Victor dispensed. And it was great to spend the time with a younger generation Hungarian resident. As luck would have it, our guide also did the afternoon walking tour through Pest. So we had some lunch and met up again at the Discover Prague office. Another great tour and perfect afternoon. Try not to miss this tour. It's informative enough while still be entertaining.They're worth the tip too!

Budapest 72h Card. SO GLAD WE PURCHASED THIS CARD for our four day visit to Budapest. Ordered online and paid prior to our visit. http://www.budapestinfo.hu/home_en.html We arrived at the airport around 6.30pm Friday evening November 2013 and collected this card from Terminal 2 Information Point. We then went outside and caught the 200E bus to the Metro. Hopped onto the Metro and in no time were at our hotel. We used the card for the Metro and Tram - we also did a LOT of walking. We utilised the Free trip to the Thermal Spa Bath which was excellent. We did a free walking tour but unsure if it was the one the card recommended. It was extremely convenient as you did not have to keep validating this card or worrying about getting fined on the Metro. Most certainly do recommend this card.

Walking tours of Buda and Pest. I went along on the two free walking tours included in the Budapest card. Anita was the guide for both of the tours, and gave us a good interesting grounding in the basics of Hungarian and Budapest history, the great historical figures , and all the things that make Budapest so special. I would really recommend these tours to anyone visiting the city. They are a great way to get your head around the city.

Walking tours of Buda and Pest. My husband and I bought the Budapest Card at the airport on arrival from England. We also booked a shuttle to and from our hotel. Very reasonable prices.The card included a walking tour of Buda and Pest. We had the pleasure of having as our guide a gracious young woman named Anita. She led the AM Buda and PM Pest tours. She was very knowledgeable and was happy to answer any questions. She also gave out maps at the end of the tours and marked restaurtants etc.She grew up during the occupation so she shared insites into the past and present times. Her English was excellent so there were no communication problems. We stayed at the HIlton Hotel which is located on the Buda hills not far from many of the interesting sites. I highly recommend the Budapest Card as it also included unlimited use of underground and buses.

Walking tours - Buda and Pest. We did the walking tour of Buda on one day and Pest the next. Brigit was our guide for Pest. Both tours were absolutely excellent. The guides were extremely knowledgeable and their English was really good. I'm not a walker and was a bit worried about doing 2½-3 hours of walking but they were both quite gentle and suitable for all age groups - just wear comfortable shoes. We learned a lot about the history of Hungary as well as about the parts of the city we were taken to. Really worthwhile and highly recommended.

Buda & Pest Walking Tours. I went for the Pest tour with Brigit and the Pest tour with Laszlo.Both guides were very well versed in their English and are very knowledgeable. They were able to explain the history associated with the attractions. At the same time, they were able to make the tour interesting and meaningful. I strongly recommend anyone who is visiting Budapest to join in these walking tours.

Really nice experience in visiting Budapest. We bought the Budapest Card and got 2 free tours of Budapest. We had our two tours the same day (Nov 11th) with a great guide called Tamas. He was really nice, gave a lot of anecdotes about the city... in two word we had a perfect time in visiting the wonderful city with him. We don't know the other guides of this independent company but if all of them are good as Tamas we highly recommend you to have visit of Budapest with "Discover Budapest". Also, be attentive during the tour because Tamas will ask you several questions about the history of Budapest and try to challenge all the participants in a quite funny game... the winner will have the honor to get the "Mysterious price"... it is really funny and we found the idea interesting...

Buda and Pest walking tours. My friend and I purchased Budapest Cards and joined the included Buda and Pest walking tours. Our guide for both tours was Laszlo, and he made the experience excellent - very informative and highly enjoyable. Laszlo's English is flawless and he was a very friendly fountain of knowledge on the city and its many stories.

Walking Tour - Buda and Pest. I highly recommend this tour when you purchase the Budapest Card. Not only does it comes free with the card, but our tour guide Anita was very knowledgeable with the general history. She also injects humor which makes the history explanation more interesting.

Great segway tour of Budapest with a very nice guide. My segway tour of Budapest was great! A segway is a fun and efficient way to see the city. The tour begins with a 30-minute training session on how to use the segways (it's actually very easy once you get the hang of it). Our guide was very knowledgeable and friendly and explained things slow enough for everyone to understand. I would definitely do this tour again.

Best way to experience Budapest. Just back for a short break in Budapest and would highly recommend the walking tours ( free with the purchase of a Budapest card.)Our guide on the pest side was Viktor. He was very friendly helpful and funny . He has excellent English and was very happy to answer any questions . The guide for the Budapest side was Anita . She was also an excellent tour guide. She was very knowledgeable, entertaining and informative . I thought that both guides appeared to really enjoy their job and clearly love the city of Budapest which adds to the enjoyment of the tours .

Budapest card free PEST tour. I let myself convinced and bought Budapest card in the main local tourist information center. Unfortunately I missed Buda tour that morning due to the big traffic, but joined Pest tour in the afternoon. We visited the main attractions of Pest from the Heroes’ Square to the St. Stephen’s Basilica.The walk was average with Tomas.He gave us 1000 years of history from the nomad founding fathers to the present. Tomas knew his subject well however I felt the sites were only part of the main stream and he often went into too much detail instead of making the sites memorable.

Good pub crawl. We booked via expedia for a 'nightlife tour' in budapest. Firstly, very reasonable value. Guide 'sophie' was slightly late which meant we were slightly worried we had done something wrong (meeting point at deak square was correct though large area). However she did bring a sign so we werent confused when she turned up. Took us to 3 bars and a nightclub. Had good company with some americans and french. Had a free shot at each place plus a pizza slice after 3rd bar. Bars were different with different selections of beer and other drinks. Guide was friendly too. Be prepared that some in tour will use it as a chance to drink to drop. We decided to leave at 1pm after last free shot at club as we had train to vienna next morning. In context, we prefer night tours that include some history such as literacy tours and this wasnt that but still enjoyable.

Shame about the rain!!. We did the Hammer & Sickle Communist Tour which we had booked before we left home as part of a holiday package. When we left our hotel earlier in the day the weather was dry and reasonably mild, however by the time we met Zsolt at 2pm.it was pouring with rain and we had no coats and no umbrella! We very much enjoyed the tour, although we did decide to miss out going via the Parliament Building due to the heavy rain. On a dry day it would have been great! We had already been in Budapest for three days by the time we took the tour and possibly the tour would have been more advantageous earlier on in our stay, however we still learnt a lot. Zsolt was very knowledgeable about the city and it's history. He was very easy going and friendly. Normally the tour would have lasted for around 3 hours and we thought the tour was good value for money. We were slightly disappointed to not have the whole tour but that was our choice due to the weather. We would definitely recommend the tour and would happily do it again (but without the rain!) Thank you Zsolt!

Interesting and funny Buda and Pest tours. We did both the Buda and the Pest tour with Anita, the tour guide, and we enjoyed both very much. She knows a lot about every place and she always has very funny facts and annecdotes to tell. We learned a lot about Budapest and Hungary while listening to her stories. She never didn't rush the people and she always gives time enough to take pictures. At the end of the tours she offers herself to answers any questions we had and she gives good tips for the rest of the stay in the city. I would kindly recommend this service.

Excellent Segway Tour. Brilliant fun and a great way to see all the sights of the city. We did this tour on our first day in Budapest! We really covered alot of ground and were lucky to have the tour guide all to ourselves. The tour guide was extremely nice and friendly. She was accommadating to any preferences we had about routes and attractions. The guide, Brigit had an excellent knowledge of the city. I would highly recommend it and definately do it again!
Excellent walking tour of pest. Enjoyed an enjoyable afternoon walking tour with Anita. She was very knowledgable of all the sights and added plenty of facts and entertaining stories.

Free tour on the Budapest card. The folks who sold us the Budapest Card told us to take these tours, which are free for cardholders. We took the city tours - Buda in the morning and Pest in the afternoon - and were fortunate to have Tamas as our guide for both. Friendly, helpful, informative. Steeped in the history of Budapest from 896 to now. You won't go into the churches or museums or sites, but you'll know what you want to see the next day. You'll get the layout of the city. You'll learn a lot. And you'll have a great time. Wear your walking shoes. Highly recommended.

The perfect start to Budapest!. Today we joined the walking tours of both Buda and Pest: the ideal way to start our 4 day trip to Budapest. Our guide, Anita, not only new the major historical facts in detail but also took us on a cultural journey with lots of extra facts which we could never have gotten out of a paper travel guide. Anita was also keen to answer any individual questions, making anyone in the group feel like a preferrenced guest. Both the morning journey in Buda as the afternoon journey in Pest gave us the perfect overview to be able to plan the rest of our citytrip in a coherent way. Thx again Anita, we deeply appreciate the way in which you fired up our love for your fabulous city! Elke

Excellent Buda&Pest walking tour. Today we participated to the free (budapest card) walking tour covering both the Buda and Pest area.. The tour was highly exceeding our expectations! Our guide (Anita) was not only explaining all areas of the tour on a very comprehensive and enthousiastic way.. But was also very helpfull in answering all kind of individual questions and giving us very useful hints for our further stay in this lovely city.. Thank you Anita, you really made a perfect day for us!!! I can only recommend all visitors to take this opportunity! Rgds, Bart (from Belgium)

walking tour buda-walking tour pest. Excellent walking tours, which covered the majority of the important and basic sights. The tour in Pest lasted 3 full hours in the Pest side and the walking tour Buda lasted aprox 2 hours. The guide (Tamas) was very helpful, funny, understanding. He explained the sights based on history facts, and myths. He gave us very useful information, tips, suggestions on what to do next etc. |We also played a trivial quiz during the tour and the winner won a mystery prize :P Thank to Tamas we saw most of the basic sights of the city. The tours were free with the Budapest Card.PS Excellent english speaker Nikol-John

Free Budapest Walking Tour with Budapest Card. A staff talked me into buying a Budapest card at Keleti Station 3 weeks ago during my visit. In that afternoon, I was able to catch the Free Walking Pest Tour covered by the Budapest. The tour led by a tour guide named Laszlo (I hope I'm spelling your name right :) exceeded my expectation. He actually took out a flute to play a song at the freedom plaza. He is also very knowledgeable and passionate. Because of that, the next day I decided to catch the other Free Walking Tour on the Buda side. Overall, I think Budapest card is quite worthy and convenience!

Budapest Walking Tour. We chose this tour as a good way to see the highlights of the city and also it included a visit to a traditional. Hungarian strudel house! The tour was excellent and our guide Anita did a great job of re telling the important points in the Hungarian history. There was no question she could not answer and she was very keen to make sure we has the best time in the city. Can thoroughly recommend the tour !

Làszlò is the best tour guide!. I had a lot of fun with my family going on the free walking tours of both Buda and Pest and luckilly enough we had Làszlò as our tour guide on both days. He is very relaxed, funny and informative, we had the feeling the tour lasted much less than it actually did. For me an absolutely recommendable tour!Làszlò you are the best.

Tour of Buda and Pest. Laszlo was our guide on both days showing us around Buda and Pest. He was really knowledgeable and I would highly recommend anyone to do this during their stay in Budapest. He was very informative and very passionate! He even played the Hungarian national anthem on his flute. He showed us all around the city and showed us all the best spots to take pics. Made our trip more memorable. Jay and Hetal x

Budapest walking tour. Chose walking tour on my first day. Received great explanation of the history of Budapest. The sights were amazing with plenty of photo opportunities. Our guide was Victor and I highly recommend him.

Interesting walking tour. Lászlo was the perfect tour guide. Very friendly, interesting, relaxing. On that day was my Birthday day and it was an awesome day with the tour group and the tour guide. I will never forget this day, I learned a lot of the history from Budapest and it was wonderful. He does a great job :).

Great walking tour!. My friend and I joined 1.5 hours long walking tour in Buda lead by Laszlo on Oct 23 happened to be a national holiday in Hungary. Laszlo was a great guide giving us things to know Hungarian histories. He even played a national anthem on flute and I regret not recording his beautiful playing. I wish I took more walking tours with Laszlo during my staying as it was a great opportunity to learn about Budapest and its history. Laszlo was incredible!

Free Buda+Pest walking tours. Làszlò is the perfect tour guide, informative, friendly, relaxed and amazingly entertaining. I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants to learn anything about Budapest. We took the tour with our two young daughters, and even they were charmed by him and didn't get tired! :)) Don't hesitate to ask him for local tips and recommendations!Làszlò thanks a lot for the nice days we had!

Interesting walking tour. My sister and I had a "private" walking tour (we were the only ones showing up on that day!) of Pest with Gabor. On top of all the sites we walked by and/or visited, Gabor explained to us a lot about the history of Budapest and the current life of Hungarian people nowadays. He was very passionate about it and we also learnt a lot about the roots of the Hungarian language.The tour lasted approx. 3h but it went really fast.We really enjoyed our time, thanks a lot!

Free Budapest Card Walking Tour. You will love this relaxed & informative walking Tour... Laszlo is passionate & proud of his heritage and country! Only about 90mins in length, he talks and walks around the "castle" district of Buda. Plenty of photo opportunities and great view points! Meet him at the Monument in the square.

Laszlo - Perfect Guide for BUDA and PEST walking tour. I strongly recommend the walking tours of Pest and Buda of your Budapest Card. The guide Laszlo was absolutely wonderful and is a really nice guy. He knows a lot of recent and old story of Buda and Pest. He was always with a beautiful smile in the face witch matches perfectly with the shiny days of Budapest in the summer. I can tell you that I made a really good friend and not just passed some of my time with a guide. Thank you Laszlo!! Your friend Giordano from Brazil.

Two thumbs up. Laszlo was an excellent tour guide - entertaining and informative; He even played for us the hungarian national anthum in a runined church and when stumped by my question about a event that night, asked some locals to find the answer for me. The tour only last for 2 hours, but that is because everything is so close, there is still plenty of information presented and lots to see - just with less walking. Its an excellent introduction to Buda. Get the budapest card and its included, the number 16 bus gets you to the top of the hill from Pest. Some information/suggestions about the local food would be a good addition to the tour.

Excellent way to get to know Budapest. I enjoyed a lovely walking tour through Budapest. The tour really allowed me get to know the city and its history. I did the tour first thing when arriving to Budapest and it was a great way to get find my way around afterwards. The stop for the strudels was yum-yum...definitely recommend this walking tour. (Tip: I kept a map handy to see which areas we were walking by so I could return easily and also know what I still needed to see).

Good walking tour. We did a walking tour with Brigit in October and really enjoyed it. We saw a lot of Budapest that we might have otherwise not noticed or bothered visiting ourselves (eg the baths in City Park since neither of us were particularly interested in this but it was interesting to see). Brigit was really knowledgeable and could answer all of our questions. She also took us to a strudel cafe which was really nice. The tour was meant to last 3 hours but ended up being about 3.5.I would recommend.
Walking Tour. Our guide Laszlo was a very knowledgable and friendly guide. Thank you Laszlo for a lovely walk and a good start to our visit.

Wonderful walking your. Our guide was Laszlo he was funny informative and a very attentive guide. We went on the Buda tour in the morning and thoroughly enjoyed all the information and stories of that part of the city he had to tell us. The tour was so good we decided to take the second walking your that afternoon of Pest again with Laszlo. The afternoon was as good as the morning and we felt like we really learnt a lot about the city!! With the tours you really get your money's worth from the Budapest card. We highly recommend getting the card and the walking tour.

The Budapest Card and the included free walking tours are not to be missed. My husband and I spent 3 days in Budapest during the first week of September and absolutely loved the included walking tours of Buda and Pest. We did them on separate days so that we could learn about the area and then explore it more on our own. ANDI and TAMAS were our guides and they were FANTASTIC. Two different, but equally fasinating tour- Andi took us around BUDA and the castle area the first day. She gave a very complete tour and also added in her personal feelings on the historic events -which was special. Then Tamas, who is incredibly enthusiatic, marched us around PEST the second day, for at least 3 -4 hours and really gave us a fun, educational tour with quizzes (!) as there is so much history to absorb in a short time. The beauty and the history of Budapest is so incredible that you can easily spend a week exploring the city. The Budapest card allows you free public transport and entrance to museums for 3 days, as well as these well organized walking tours, so it should be your first purchase when you arrive to the city.

Walking Tours. One of the features of the Budapest Card were walking tours of Pest and Buda and I can heartily recommend these to everyone. Our guide Laszlo was a friendly and delightful host and provided a witty, informative and engaging tour of Pest on a sunny afternoon which we enjoyed so much we went again the following day to enjoy the tour of Buda by the same guide. Heartily recommended

Very Good Walking Tour and Excellent Value. My husband and I have just completed this excellent walking tour of Budapest. Our tour guide was Brigit. She was extremely pleasant, knowledgable and happy to answer any questions we had. We booked the tour online and as we are staying in The Hilton Hotel which is on the Budapest area of the city, also booked a taxi via the Discover Budapest website. This arrived on time and delivered us to the departure point. We walked to many main attractions, the history given and the option following this would be to return at a later point and go inside the ones which we felt were of particular interest to us. Brigit took us to a lovely Hungarian restaurant where we had two lovely pastries and a drink of our choice. This was included in the tour cost as well as two short trips on the underground.

Buda Walking Tour. We went on a free walking tour of Buda, that is part of Budapest Card. Peter was our guide on the day and he was very informative and entertaining. His style of involving the participants in his talk created a sense of fun and connection amongst those on the walk. Highly recommended.

Very enjoyable tour - recommended!. I took the Budapest Gastro tour in October. It was an excellent way to spend an afternoon. The tour was very informative and covered a lot of the city. The tour guide was great - very knowledgeable and engaging. The food and wine served on the tour was very tasty and authentic. I would recommend Discover Budapest as a small, independent tour company that gives you an authentic experience.

Budapest card-Plan before you buy it. Budapest card will give you discounted access to many attractions and restaurants as well as some free admission to some (very few) attractions but also free usage of the Budapest transport system for 24/48/73 hours.A price for any transport ticket is 450 HUF.Here is where you should start your calculations.How much ill you use the transport system and WILL YOU REALLY use the free attractions.Look at what attractions are included,Remember that you can really see a city by walking through it's streets and quarters. Maybe to get from one end to the other you will use the transport service .Plan the rest of the attractions and then decide.Buy it online and collect in the city or at the airport.This will save you 5% at the Budapest card official site.

Free walking tour of Buda and Pest:. Beautiful cities of Buda & Pest, free walking tours offered with Budapest city card and Peter, the best tour guide. What more could one ask for? It was one of the best experiences of our trip. Peter was a real delight. He was informative, engaging, energetic and very friendly. And to think that this is his day job, wherein he manages to maintain his enthusiasm and wit is commendable. It was essentially because of Peter that I could do the two tours back to back, each of which lasted for about 3 hours. I’d highly recommend this walking tour to everyone.

Great!. After pondering a variety of options included a two day private guided tour, we opted to take the Absolute Walk of Budapest on our first day. Our experience this trip has been that as it is shoulder season, the tour groups are quite small anyway and the guides all darned good, we were going to be in Budapesst for 8 days, so why not just get an overview from a company recommended in Rick Steves' guide book? We are very happy with our decision. Anita did a fine job telling us about her city and showing us the highlights. We had a perfect base for further exploration. Thank you, Anita! I also wanted to take a cooking course and in the end took one given by chefparade arranged for me at very short notice by the Discover Budapest staff. This went perfectly. I had a great instructor, Cecilia, whom I met at 9 am outside the Market. We cooked up a virtual storm including a Gerbeaud cake which takes a lot of layering, let me tell you!Thank you to the team at Discover Budapest! Great job.

Fun way to see all the outdoor sights on a sunny day. I booked a bike trip based on the description in Rick Steves Budapest book. This trip met exactly what I wanted: getting to see lots of the sights (such that I could choose to follow up on my favorites with more time later), getting moving on a bike, and being out in the sunshine. Our guide wasn't initially very talkative, but when we asked questions, we learned more about what Budapest citizens like most about their city now, and also what life was like under Soviet occupation, which was particularly interesting. The group was small (around 10 people) and we saw sights on both sides of the river. This trip included quite a bit of urban cycling, but there is enough of a bike culture in the city that there weren't any problems in the traffic of other vehicles. Would definitely recommend to others!

Fantastic Buda walking tour. Peter was the best guide ever on our free Buda walking tour on Oct 1. He was informative, talked very clearly. His presence was tangible. The tour was very interesting and so much fun. All members of our multinational group participated in a quiz while walking along the beautiful, historical Buda streets. Thank you, Peter, for making our day!

Walking Tours of Buda and Pest. With the Budapest card, we took both the Buda the Pest walking tours. Our guides were Laszlo and Tamas. Both of the guides had excellent knowledge of their city. They showed all the main attractions, giving us time to take photographs, the tours were never rushed and the guides were excellent, particularly discussing the history of their country. They both were able to engage with their audience including telling jokes and making this a thoroughly pleasurable experience,

Hammer & Sickle Walking Tour. I really enjoyed this tour and learned a lot about the recent history of Hungary (post-WWII). In addition, our guide Victor was very enthusiastic and gave us a history of ancient Hungary all the way up to the current political environment. Bring comfortable walking shoes and give yourself enough time to get to the meeting point.

Loved it!. Today we enjoyed a terrific 3 hour Segway tour with a great guide named Victor. He was a helpful, fun and very informative. Both my wife and I have ridden Segways several times before, so didn't much training, so focused on practicing how to navigate some of the curbs we would encounter. I'd recommend the 3 hour tour as you get to places where you don't see other Segways. Safety was also clearly of greater importance to this company as we were kitted out with nice crash helmets. We saw several other Segway groups and none had crash helmets. So we'd recommend this company, the 3 hour tour, and Victor as your guide for can't miss fun!
A great overview of the city. Fun to ride. The tour was great. Segway was a blast. My first time in one. The history and sights were fantastic. The guide was cool.

Pest Walking tour. Our guide Garbor did an amazing job introducing us to Budapest. He took very good care of his guests, introduced himself to each of us individually and showed us around more in the style of how a friend would do it if you visited him in Budapest than a payed tour. Wonderful work!

A must do with the budapest card!. We did the Buda walking tour. Our guide was La'slo, he was awesome! So passionate about Hungary and Budapest! It was great to hear some history and stories of budapest and hungary from a born and bred local. It was cold and windy but he made it worthwhile. He even played the national anthem on his wooden flute. So good. Definitely do it!

Amazing Absolute Walk!. We just returned from Budapest, where we had an absolutely incredibly walking tour of the city with Andi. She is one of the best tour guides I've ever had and it was really the highlight of our trip.Her knowledge and enthusiasm made the city come alive!

Pest Walking Tour. I went to Budapest with some friends and we did the Pest Walking Tour that was offered by Budapest Card. It was a great experience. Its buildings, monuments and squares testify the hungarian culture and history. Our guide was Laszlo. He was very friendly and charming, and his explanations and answers made the tour a real fun. Very nice guy ! On your next visit to this incredible city, you must consider doing these walkings.

Walking in Pest. Last Summer I went to Budapest and I wanted to see both sides of the city. To discover Pest, I choose for the Pest walking tour.It was a great experience. We saw a lot of great buildings, lovely architecture. We tasted the Hungarian culture! We saw also lovely monuments! Our guide was Gabor.He was very friendly and answered all our questions very spontaneously and with a smile. Very nice!If you go to Budapest, it's surely something you HAVE to do!

Highly recommended!. I totally recommend going on a walking tour in Budapest. We bought the Budapest card and we had two tours included.The tour in Pest was very interesting thanks to Peter, our guide who explained us in a funny and catchy way facts about the important buildings like history, leaders etc. As Goethe said, we see what we know, and thanks to Peter we could see more of the city. Lovely experience!

Good walk and interesting talk. With the Budapest card, we took the Pest walking tour. Our guide was Laszlo. He made a very good and interesting review of all main Pest sites, with good observations and cheery anecdotes. Had the opportunity to talked with him and made some questions, and really he is a very smart guy. Total satisfaction. Tomorrow, Buda walking tour!

Biking and Walking Tours. We booked a bike tour, an evening walking tour with a boat ride and the alternative walking tour. They were all EXCELLENT with awesome TOUR GUIDES! They did a great job for a reasonable price. They knew a lot of information and history about their city and their city is wonderful! The biking tour was fun and Budapest is a bike-friendly city. Robin was our tour guide and she was great. The evening stroll and boat ride was lovely too. We walked from their location (which is behind the opera house and easy to get to) to the downtown area and then to the river. The boat cruise was relaxing and informative. The alternative walking tour was fascinating and a different take of Pest than all the other information. Much more current and interesting. Our tour guide was Val and she is awesome!

Beautiful city. As a retired EU-member you can go freely on almost every public transportation in Hungary, We enjoyed visiting Budapest and to look at all the splendid buildings, eat very well and make spa visits. Only too short time, two days.

Tours include in Budapest card - great idea. My friends and me had 2 days in Budapest and decided to buy 28eur worth Budapest card. Main reason - included Buda- and Pest tour. And that was a bingo. Great tours for only 28 eur.

Great Tour. The tour was simply amazing. Gabor, our tour guide, was capable of giving a good review of the history and culture of the Hungarians and answered questions without hesitation. Even for a person like me who's almost never been on a bike before, this tour was fun and the sights we visited on the day were fantastic. Will recommend this to all my friends and family! Well done!

Free Pest tour included in Budapest card :). The tour was very interesting and informative. Our guide Peter showed us and told us everything important about Pest and answered on every our question. Highly recommended :)

discover budapest. Got on it by Budapest Card. Had an absolutely fantastic walking guided tour, by Peter. In the morning Buda, afternoon Pest. He knew definitely everything about the city/country: history, small details, funny and serious topics. And he just had an aswer for every question. Got a very nice feeling of making contact with the city/contry after that 2 tours. Good small group, not even 15. Just DO it !

Get informed!. A sweet, informative tour for anyone looking to get oriented in their surroundings.We had Tomas for a morning tour of Buda after having strolled around it for two days admiring the views without a single idea of what and why and when. Tom gave a very interesting, concise lowdown on the historical, cultural and even political happening in Budapest and made everyone feel super comfortable in our little group. Questions were very welcome and answered in depth, making the whole experience very interactive and lively leaving you feeling confident in the new city.Great big THANK YOU to Tom!
Walking Tour. We did the morning (BUDA) & afternoon (Pest) On the same day. The walks were well planned and entertaining thanks to our wonderful guide, Laszlo. What a beautiful city !!

The best way to discover Budapest. We booked this tour after having a good look from a distance to the "free budapest walking tour" group that meets by the lion fountaine in Vörösmarty square. We saw the 2.30pm group and it was a small multitude of quite young people (60-80 pax) that was being divided into 3 smaller groups. Nothing wrong with that but that was not what we were looking for. We found the Absolute Walking Tour on tripadvisor and managed to book it online for the next day. We even got a taxi to pick us up at our hotel for a fixed price (a mere 7€).As for the tour itself, I would recommend to do it as soon as possible upon arrival to Budapest. They cover most of the highlights of the city in about 4h, but that means that there is almost no time for actually visiting the landmarks / attractions themselves. Once you finish the tour it's much easier to know where to spend your time based on what you liked the most.Our guide Tomasz is truly passionate about Hungarian history and knows a lot of interesting trivia and details about all the places we visited. He also managed to engage the entire group into the tour as we all made lots of questions that he was more than happy to answer.

Very nice tour! Get more information about this interesting city in a fun way!. We took a tour and we enjoyed it very much! Laszlo takes you to all the points of interest and tells a lot of interesting facts about this beautiful city! We would definately recommend this tour!

Get a Budapest card and do the walking tours!. We recently visited Budapest and took a chance on getting a Budapest card at the airport. It is safe to say that we were not disappointed! As well as sorting out any difficulties with what tickets to buy for the various (and great) transport options around the city, it offered free entry to 7 museums around the city (including the Museum of fine art, the National Gallery and the Budapest History Museum. In addition, you were able to go on two walking tours for free. We went first on the Buda tour, which encompassed the outside of the main sites of the Castle district including the Mattyas Church, Fisherman's bastion and Castle itself. Our guide was Laszlo and he was excellent bringing the various phases of history in Budapest alive with his descriptions of how modern Buda looks like it does and how the culture of Budapest has evolved.On the second day we went on a tour of Pest with Laszlo again our guide. This tour takes in Heroes Square, St Stephens Cathedral, Parliament, Freedom Square and the Opera house amongst others. The tour is 2 and a half ours long but Laszlo managed to keep it interesting the whole time and the time just flew by.After both tours Laszlo stayed around and answered everyone's questions on where they wanted to go, how to get there and also recommended a few other things to do.All in all the Budapest card was good value for money and the tours were excellent.Iain and Emma

Budapest is the Best!. Andi did a super job in conducting our tour of the city and it's sights. Supposed to be 3hrs. Tour but it was over 4hrs.; Andi loves her city and it shows; very passionate, knowledgeable and informative. Great orientation to Budapest and highly recommended.

Nice way to discover the city. We did the tour of Buda and Pest for free with the Budapest card and were not disapointed ! Our guide, Laszlo, was very friendly and interesting so both tour give you a nice overview of the city and of Hungarian culture/history.

Very good. We took the tour with Laszlo, and its was a very interesting, you can buy the Budapest card and take the tour of Buda and Pest for free.... It last 3 hours and see the most important places that later you can visit if you are interest in enter to a museum or the parliament for example. Very good!!!

Peter. The tour in Buda started very well. I appreciated that the guide asked all people for their nationality so that we all knew what kind of group we are. Peter is very natural and charming guide. His knowledge about the city is very good and was very good in contact with all visitors. He also has acting talent. We prefered the tour in Buda - it was a bit shorter and more interesting. Pest was also very nice but the end of the tour was litle bit boring. In summary for me the visit in Budapest was very very good and we enjoyed it very much thanx your tour. w´We will recommend it to our frined from the Czech Repiublic. Good luck in your job!

Excellent guides! Great city walking tour!. I joined the walking tour (free walking tour if you have purchased Budapest Card) on both Buda side and Pest side and both were perfect. Great way to know how to get around the city.My guides were Gabor and Thomas both very knowledgable and great people. Gabor not only knew every answer to every question on Hungary, he knew so much about other counties and itshistory/culture as well, so some of the comparisons he made were very interesting.Thomas not only is also a walking dictionary of Hungary, he is a true entertainer! humorous and such a fun person to hang out with and he made sure all of us were entertained!I've only joined these free tours by Budapest Card, but it definately showed how high the quality of the guides are. If I everccome back to Budapest, i will not hesitate to sign up for one of their tours!It truly made our trip to Budapest a very special one!

Budapest Card Free Tour. I did both the Buda (am) and Pest (pm) tours today with Peter the tour guide. He was very informed, enthusiastic and entertaining--what more can you ask for? The pace for both tours was good and the sights very interesting, a good overview of the city. Good recommendations for further visits to museums, restaurants and spas. Also helped get an understanding of the public transit system. A day well spent!

Fantastic Budapest absolute all in one walking tour. Thanks to Peter! He is one the best tour guide we have had. Amazing in good stories, knowledge about the city, history and engagement. We enjoyed every minute of it. We will advise to our friends who plan to come Budapest to take this tour. Øyvind & Gry

Excellent tour of Buda - especially since free with Budapest Card. I bought a 48 hour Budapest Card (NOTE - buy these at a hotel or somewhere where you only pay the face value...at moment 7500Ft for 48 hours....and do NOT buy at the train station for example where they mark up the price. Also note - get florint at an ATM and avoid the horrible exchange rates..you need cash to buy the card.). Once you have the card you get to ride all the public transport for free and also get two museums free and the TOUR! Took the 1030 tour Buda tour that leaves from in front of St. Mathis church...hang around the statue in front and you will find the guide. Luckily, I had Laszlo and it was great. He gives more than just the standard history and fills in with stories and folklore so you will remember the tour. He also played the national anthem on his flute at one spot on the tour...very moving and gets you into the spirit. I would rate this 1.5 hour tour as very good if I had to pay...and Excellent considering it was free. He answered all the questions and gave just enough information and discussion (not too rushed to cover everything) that I felt good and learned and appreciated the history of Buda (pest) (not confused over what was where later). Highly recommended.

Worthwhile Tour with an Excellent Guide. If only we could have a tour guide like Lazlo in every city we visit! I cannot say enough wonderful things about the Budapest tour with Lazlo and Discover Budapest. Lazlo was so incredibly knowledgable about the city's history and revealed a very touching and interesting past we would not have otherwise known. The information was very honest and parts of it moving but throughout were sprinkled moments of humor and beautiful music (Lazlo shared a couple songs on the clairinet).My husband and I are not usually up for group tours but this was truly a wonderful experience. So much so that we took two tours in the same day with Lazlo (the morning tour in Buda and the afternoon tour in Pest).There are so many great sites and history to take in and our tours allowed us to make the most of our short time here. Highly recommended!
Just Great!. I really enjoyed walkink tours with Tamis and Peter. Good, enthusiastic guides. If you are lookin for a guide, Tamis is the best choice.

Little bit disappointed. We have booked Night Cruise with dinner for 2 and that was about 68euro. I had to admit that I had higher expectations about it but it was just average. First of all TAXI transfer from hotel to checkpoint (Duna Palota) was to expensive - you can fine TAXI cheaper - thank god we did not take it. After meeting on check whole group went together on the ship where twas welcome drink and dinner waiting for us. Main reason for poor rating of this attraction is that there was not a single word about attractions, buildings and POI during the cruise. In fact it is just cruise with average dinner and that`s it. Since this was our 3rd visit to Budapest we pretty much know all the buildings but I`m sure rest of group did not know anything. Food is just average just, classic catering/take away - nothing special with bad glass of free wine. Maybe it was our age - we are in our late twenty and there was a lot of older people there. In my opinion the segway tour or bike tour during the night with a guide can be way more fun and educational.

Excellent Pest tour. We took Pest walking tour with Peter and enjoyed it very much. It was very extensive, time efficient and satisfactory. Also we would like to thank to Peter. He is the best tour guide we have ever seen. I will advise to my friends who plan to come Budapest to take this tour.

Pest Walking Tour. Last weekend I was at 2-days visit to Budapest. It was my first stay in this beautiful city. I decided to take a part in Pest Walking Tour with our guide Thomas. It was a great time for me. Thomas was briliant in his job. He was truly walking knowledge base about Budapest and not only. He made our tour very exciting and humorous. We visited major places on Pest side and learned a lot of interesting facts about each of them. Our guide was really happy to answer our questions, and asked us for more. His english was also brilliant. I supose that all participants would share my opinion. Highly recommended!Thomas...thanks ones more. You made my day! :)
excellent tour and guide. I took the buda tour of the palace and matthias church. Viktor was amazing and gave us interesting info onnthe sights.

Walking tours Buda and Pest with Viktor. We discorvered the Buda hills on saterday and took the Pest tour on Sunday. Both tours were two hours long and our guide was Victor. We saw the best spots of Budapest while having a marvelous time. Our guide was funny, interesting and liked a lot of quistions. If you want to discover this beautifull city and enjoy the hospitality and openness of hungarians, we certainly recommend this tour.

Discover Budapest - Walking Tour and Gastronomy Tour. Highly recommend Discover Budapest for booking your tours. They are conveniently located right behind the Opera downtown. My wife and I took 2 tours: the half-day Budapest walking tour and the gastronomy tour. We had the same guide for both, Brigitta, who was terrific. Very knowledgeable about her City and very entertaining as well. The gastronomy tour was particularly enjoyable. We met at the Great Market and proceeded to learn about and taste a variety of local foods. A three-course lunch at local restaurant followed which was also excellent. The tour ended in a charming wine cellar in basement of the Discover Budapest office for a tasting of some local wines.

Absolute Walking Tour - Budapest. I recently visited Budapest and along with some friends paid for this tour. Thomas was our guide - he was very informative, friendly and made this tour very enjoyable - he showed interest in our understanding and ensured we saw the most interesting parts of this beautiful city. He is an excellent guide.

Matyas cave, Budapest. We had a wonderful tour for this fairly challenging route through part of the Budapest cave system from a very informed guide, Emöse. This part of the caves is not as beautiful as the stalactite cave area under Buda, but the journey is more authentically spelunking, as the route has not been adapted for tourists. Be prepared for chutes, narrow passages, and climbs!The website we booked from, absolutetours.com, had several pieces of information wrong, including the meeting place, but we found the group in the end and all else went smoothly.

Buda tour with László. A wonderful tour with László, who guided us through the nicest places in Buda and allowed us to share his passion for the Magyar people, culture and (un)official history. He even played the Hungarian national Anthem on his flute! Unfortunately, we could not follow him for the second part (walking tour in Pest that we did one day later with Gábor), because of the birth of his baby.These two guided walking tours were really worth the expense!Thanks and best wishes to László's baby and family.Pierre and Danielle, from Belgium.

Very informative and fun!. It was the 10am Buda-walking tour that made me fall in love with Budapest and be interested even more in the history of Hungary. Budapest is a beautiful city, with most astonishing architecture and fascinating history, but it was our tour guide Laszlo that made the city and its buildings speak to us and open up. We listened to him play the flute, we laughed, we even danced in the park and we just all became friends. He created a beautiful atmosphere within the group and made touring around a city a whole new experience. Thanks to the organizers and thank you Laszlo! - Nigora from Dubai.

Tour with Laszlo. We spent a whole morning on aguided tour with our charming guide Laszlo.he shared his passion for Hungarian language, history and peiople. His enthousiasm was fantastic and gave us a pleasant stay in Budapest.It was a pitty we could not attend his tour at the Pest side due to the oncoming birth of his child.Thank you very much laszlo.frank and Juliette Belgium

Great experience in Buda [with LASZLO]. I stayed with my family in Budapest for 5 days. We bought Budapest card and we had a " Buda - walking tour " with a great guide named "LASZLO". The tour was amazing and Laszlo was friendly and very polite.-Thanks Laszlo - {the family from Greece!}

Walking tour castle area. I was in Budapest with my wife for 3 days, we bought the Budapest Card, that includes 2 free walking tours. In Buda Castle area our tourist guide was Laszlo, and we enjoied it very well!

Lazlo's AWESOME walking tour. Lazlo was an amazing and gracious host in Budapest. Our tour went through all the main areas of Budapest and learning the history and difficulties of the Hungarian peoples was truly interesting. I have looked at other recommendations on what to see when in Budapest and we covered all of that in entirety and more!!! I HIGHLY recommend this walking tour, and also recommend doing a little bit of research BEFORE you arrive in Budapest. This city and people are truly amazing.

Friendly, interesting and fun guidance. We were guided around both the pest side and the buda side in around 3.5 hours. The tour was excellent and it was obvious that our guide, Tamas, takes personal pride in providing a fun, exiting and educational guidance. VERY good!

Budapest card. I recomend you to buy the Budapest card so you can use all of the public transportation in the city for free. With the card you also get free tours of Buda and Pest, free entrances in some of the museums and a lot of discounts on other things that the city offers. A friend and I took 2 walking tours in Budapest. Anita was our guide in Buda and she made our tour a very plesent and nice experience. Tour lasted about 1,5 h and in that time we learned a lot of Budas history. On the Pest side our guide was Barby. Tour lasted about 3,5 h and in that time we saw a lot of important historical and cultural places in Pest. It was the best way to see the city and in the same time learn about its history. Anita and Barby were very good guides who answered on all of ours questions.

Walking tours with Anita and Barbie - really nice. I was in Budapest with my friend for only 3 days and we bought the Budapest Card that includes among many things also 2 free walking tours. In Castle District our tourist guide was Anita and she really told us very interesting and important things. She didnt just filled us with numbers and facts about history like many guides do but she explained the manifestation of history in nowdays buildings and events. I think that the tour was very refreshing and not boring at all. At the end she gave us maps and she marked what we wanted to see and told us how to get there, what bus to take, so that was very helpful. In Pest our guide was Barbie and I really liked her energy, enthusiasm and her sense of humour. The tour was about 2 hours and a half, I think, so it is good if you have a big bottle of water with you, especially if the day is so hot like ours was.I am very happy that we went on these two walking tours because we didnt have a lot time in Budapest and we have seen almost all the things that we wanted to see and really get the informations that we needed and felt the heartbeat of Budapest which is the most important :-)

Dinner and pubcrawl. Travelling alone, the best way to socialize is to do a pubcrawl etc. Booked mine true Time Out, Discover Budapest was delivering the "goods".Kata and Viktor (the apprentice) took us dining at Strudelhouse; food was great and the pàlinka strong ;-) What impressed me most was the ruin bars, Instant and Szimpla. Just loved the atmosphere and detailes.Top notch deleivery and a sucsessfull night!! Thanks

The best way to discover Budapest. My boyfriend and I were participated in two walking tours of Budapest. Our tour guides were Gabor and Tomas, they both were extra helpful and fun guides. They have made these tours very interesting. Thank you guys!Tour of Buda last about 1,5 hours and Pest about 3 hours. I highly recommend the tour as the best way to see the city.If you buy the Budapest card you will get free transport all around the city, free entrance to some museums and these tours also.

Interesting walking tour. I took the walking tours of Buda and Pest with very knowledgable and helpful guides, Gàbor and Tomas. I would recommend to anyone wishing to learn some of the history of Hungary and Budapest.

Great Help. thanks. A group of us have just returned from a bike ride from Passau in Germany to Budapest. I tried everywhere to hire bike from the German end with no luck. So I had to do it the other way aroundand was given details of Ben at Discover Budapest. Everything I asked for, yes was the answer. Nothing was to big a problem. what I asked for, was what was delivered. The bike, panniers, tools maps etc, delivered as requested. The bike were great, not a problem, not even a puncture, which considering 8 of us travelled 450 miles shows how good they were. Also like to say thanks to Arthur, who travelled through the night to get the bike to us. highly recommended. Thanks guys.

Bike Tour with Peter.... ...was great, especiallybecuas I was the only participant. ;o) Peter coud answer nearly all of my questions and is very vigilant, which is, as cyclist, pretty important in Budapest.However I booked a secons Bike Tour and am looking Forward to it.
great tour in Budapest. We really enjoyed walking tour of Buda. Our guide Thomas was great. He talked very interestingly. We highly recommend him.

Great way to see the city!. This was fabulous, I highly recommend the tour as the best way to see the city. Be aware that sunscreen is a must!
