Put it on places you might not normally think about, like on the back of your calves and the tops of your feet if wearing sandals. The Castle hill is an effort, but there's a water fountain at the top. Our guide Kinga was great and gave us lots of interesting information. I'm now addicted to doing a cycle tour every time I go to a new city!

best tour in Budapest. Our guide was Anita . She was brilliant . We really enjoyed it . My 11 years old daughter still talk about the tour and the strudel house . will recommend to every one going to Budapest !

I am glad I tour this walking tour. The three hour walking tour with Anita was excellent. She did not rush the small group and gave great descriptions of the history and sights of Budapest. I enjoy taking walking tours and Anita was among the best guides I have had. She is not overwhelming, but if you are interested in a particular topic, she takes the time to give more background. The tour actually finished in just over 4 hours with all the questions folks had. With all the interesting information given, the tour did not feel long at. The strudel and coffee stop, which is included in your ticket, was a wonderful way to break up the walk. We didn't go in any of the sights, but I was able to go back to the sights I wanted to visit inside later in the afternoon. Budapest is a very walkable city. If I was in Budapest for a longer period of time, I definately would of taken another tour by Discover Budapest.

Gastro and Wine Tour. I had the privilege of being the only participant of this tour on Saturday the last weekend. My guide Gábor told me that this tour was new for him, but he still did an excellent job. Since I was the only participant the tour became personal, like going around with a good friend. The food was great and Gábor did a good job showing me all the specialities at the market. Unfortunately there was a parade in Budapest that Saturday and much of the centre of Pest was closed of by the police. We had to go around the city for over an hour to get to the wine tasting, but Gábor did a great job turning the inconvenience into just an extra guided tour of the streets of Pest.

Pest Walking tour. My cousin and I did the Pest walking tour. It was amazing. It was almost 5 hours long, but we weren't tired, we loved every moment of it. Our guide Thomas was very knowledgeable as well as enthusiastic. We covered all the key sites in Budapest which were on the Pest side. To test whether we were paying attention, he even asked us questions to see if we were paying attention. It was a great way to explore Budapest and made our experience worthwhile. Walking tour in Budapest shouldn't be missed.

Great way to see the highlights in half a day!. We only had a couple of days to spend in Budapest and took the half day walking tour to get the feel of the city and catch the main sites. Our guide (Anita) was knowledgeable, professional and fun. The cost also includes a tasty surprise. Great tour and a great day!

Educational & Entertaining Hammer & Sickle tour. For a great tour of the Castle District, with lots of interesting and personal facts thrown in, go for the full tour with Anita. She is delightful and knowledgeable, and I really appreciated the personal stories she included. It made Budapest's recent history come alive in a really unique way.

great guide, worth the time. My friend and I went on the Gastro food and wine tour of Budapest with Thomas yesterday, and we really enjoyed ourselves. There were only the two of us, and Thomas was very friendly, educative and fun. He had brilliant English so there were no issues with language barriers. The food and wine were really great, not things we'd have known to choose if we hadn't been guided. Thomas included interesting facts and history related to our interests, was encouraging with regards to questions and was a great guide. And we found out at the end it was only his second tour of this kind. Highly recommended

Walking Tour. The half-day small group walking tour was perfect. We saw the key sites of Budapest - the Castle, St. Stephans, Chain Bridge, Heroes Square, as well as Fisherman's Bastion. Our guide Orsi was great. She shared her knowledge and paced the walk appropriately for us. The strudel stop was an excellent break to recharge.

Bike tour with Laszlo Lorant was a highlight!!!!. We spent seven nights in Budapest and had many experiences while there but one of the most fun and informative was our 3 1/2 hour bike tour with DiscoverBudapest. Our guide was Laszlo who was very helpful, funny, patient, and so knowledgeable. In particular he was supportive of my children (ages 9 and 12) who had a few challenges going up to the castle district. We learned a lot on this tour and simply riding through town we saw much of the city. can't wait to get back to Budapest and will most definitely take another tour with Laszlo!!!!

Best way to see and learn! Great guides!. I was in a 3 day trip to Budapest, made the Buda walk with Anita and the Pest walk with Orsi. Great guides, they made a quick Hungarian history briefing during the tour and in the end lost lot of time helping with all the cool places to eat, visit and drink. Really great girls!! Wish them the best... Buy the Budapest card, will give you free transport all around the city and this tour too :)

Segway in Budapest. We reserved segways with Discover Budapest in May. The weather was great, but there was 15 of us to begin with. the four of us had experience with segways, but the others, quite a bit younger, did not. it was Penecost and most of the stores were closed, but the streets were teeming; the cafes were doing a brisk business and tourists were enjoying the sights. On this trip we learned how to go off curbs and up on to curbs, which was a new experience. On other trips there were handicap ramps. It was a bit challenging, but not really difficult. It was a bit more challenging to dodge all the people on foot. the younger riders were a bit competitive and horsed around quite a bit; we just let them get ahead of us so we would be out of harm's way. Many of the sights we visited we had seen before, but we did get a new perspective on some. Our guide removed the governors off our segways in the central park and we were able to really zip around with plenty of room. This was a great tour, but I had really rather be with a smaller group. You stop frequently to take in the info the guide gives you and to rest and regroup. This is not a cheap tour, but lasts about 1.5 hours and is well worth it. there are snacks and souvenirs as well as a bathroom at the office.

Excellent guide; great itinerary. I really enjoyed all of the places that my guide Kinga took me on my 1/2 day city tour. Early on in the tour she acknowledged my fascination with architecture and began to point out some very beautiful structures that I may have missed. Kinga was very patient with my insistence on taking a lot of photos. I never felt hurried and even pointed out a few unique things for me to photograph. Because I love to bake, I was delighted to be shown one of Budapest's finest strudel makers as part of my tour. Unlike other tour companies that pushed me to see Buda and Pest in two separate tours, this itinerary combined the finest points of both areas in an enjoyable way. Kinga's advice on how to use public transit was very valuable as I explored the city on my own the next few days. I really recommend her as a guide and this company as a tour provider.

Budapest Segway tour. The tour starts at 9:30 am, they ask to get there early to sign release form. The tour was suppose to be 3 hours, so it was from 9:30-12:30, but was very unorganized and started late. So at 12:00 the guide decided to head back to the office and continue the remainder of the tour in 2 parts. Problem is that we had another tour at 2:00pm. So we had no choice but to end the tour after the first part. So we didn't get what we paid for. A lot of people plan multiple excursions in one day and tour companies should be aware of times posted for the tours they run. It was fun for my college kids who never tried a Segway before, but poorly organized. It was more of a history tour than a Segway tour and if you are combining them, give people an accurate idea of time.m

A Great Way to Experience Budapest :). We took the Walking Tour with Anita on a sunny day of June. It was the first time when we were in Budapest and this tour was very nice and entertaining. We got to know lots of new places, funny stories and monuments in approximately 3 hours. We really appreciated our open-minded and the enthusiastic guide. We had a great time ! Thanks ! Hugs from Moldova ! :)

Budapest afternoon segway tour. Went on the afternoon (3pm) segway tour to avoid the extreme sunshine and heat of the morning/early afternoon (30-31- degrees!). Anita was the guide and I was the only one on this afternoon tour. Anita showed me how to manoeuvre the segway and was a fantastic teacher and guide. The segway is definitely a fun way to explore the 'pest' side of Budapest. On top of that, Anita is an excellent guide who was very willing to answer questions about the local area, cuisine etc. highly recommended if you want a fairly cooling tour around budapest in the hot summer time.

Excellent!. We recently spent a wonderful morning with Orsi, our wonderful young, enthusiastic guide. We covered a lot of ground in just a few hours We did the All-in-one Walking Tour It was a great intro to a city we quickly fell in love with.

Budapest Walking Tour with Anita. My wife and I were lucky enough to be the only two on the walking tour with Anita in April of this year. The city and sites were wonderful and Anita's enthusiasm in telling us a bit about the history of this tremendous city was second to none. I would certainly recommend the tour and if you are lucky enough to have Anita as your guide you won't be dissapointed.

Amazing walking tour!. My sister and I took a wonderful 4 hour walking tour with Laszlo and another couple in May. Laszlo was absolutely fantastic; he was full of knowledge and ready to answer all our questions. I highly recommend this tour (and Laszlo in particular) as it includes all the major sites and truly shows you the beauty of Budapest. Unforgettable!

Grand Budapest Segway Tour. We had a great tour with Tomas this morning 10 June, 2013. He was very enthusiastic and knew a lot about the history of Budapest. There was only the two of us and a couple of girls on the tour. After about a 20 minute training session we were on our way and I was surprised at how quickly we got the hang of it as we were first timers!!! We segwayed to a lot of main attractions on Pest side of Budapest with lots of stops to learn the history and for photo opportunities. It is very tiring on your legs standing in one spot for so long so be prepared.Gary & Alison, Townsville, Australia
walking tour. I really recommend this tour.It was very interesting to get a first overview of Budapest City.Anita did an excellent job with the group and the strudel was very good.

Fabulous time with great guide. The nearly 4 hours with Anita on the walking tour of Budapest was interesting, informative and fun. The tour was really an overview of Budapest and for a short stay would have taken you to the main sights. For me, it was in introduction to the city and Anita gave us each a map over our coffee and strudel (included) with other places which she recommended and which suited the interests of the group. It is often the case with this type of tour that you feel 'hurried along' but that wasn't the case with this particular tour and Anita seemed interested in the sights and venues too, which is a rare quality when she has probably been there a million times. I was very impressed with this day and would highly recommend it - especially if you are lucky enough to get a guide as informed and friendly as Anita.

Segway Tour Budapest. Peter was our tour guide and instructor for the 2 hour evening tour. After a period of instructions and getting over the unusual operating manner of the Segway, we were off. Since our family of three were the only evening riders, it was like a private tour. Enjoying the tour from two wheels (easier than a bicycle) was fast paced, educational and the most important for our 13 year old son... FunWe highly recommend taking the time to book a tour and hopefully you will get our guide Peter. He appeared to be very knowledgeable of the facts and history of the city, making it easy to enjoy and understand. He also took the time to answer questions about how the average citizens work and live.Price keeps it from being a 5 rating.

Great 3 hr walking Tour - not rushed at all. Andi was our tour guide for the 3 hr walking tour, she is extremely knowledgeable and leaves plenty of time for you to take pictures ask questions. She actually makes the history of Heroes’ Square and the Millennium Memorial interesting, as she walked through each statue we enjoyed her comments and information. The Vajdahunyad Castle was one of my favourite things to see. If you are a person that is not in shape get ready for a hefty lung work-out as you trudge up the stairs to the Fisherman's Bastion on the Buda side of the river...I thought my lungs were going to explode...Andi was patient and waited as my old bones made it up the hill. This tour guide never rushed at any points and although I know we put her behind in her schedule, she never once made us feel rushed. She is an EXCELLANT tour guide with a wonderful use of the English language.Our morning 10:00 a.m. walking tour was wonderful, as we visited 80% of the sites before it became to hot. The stop for freshly made strudel and coffee, was a welcome break and to see the strudel being made before our eyes was a treat as wel. If I ever go back to Budapest, which I plan to I will definatly keep this tour company in mind. Wishing Andi the very best from Canada..on her future studies~!

Mixed experience. I did two different tours with this company, and I had a mixed experience. On the first day, I did the basic walking tour of the city with Anita as the guide, and I thought she was great. We got to see a tremendous amount of the city, and she did everything at exactly the right pace. She's extremely knowledgeable, and also has a nice subtle sense of humor. We stopped at a café for some wonderful strudel, and while we were eating, she did a personalized map for everyone in the group to give recommendations for other things to see and do in Budapest. This was one of the best group tours I've done anywhere. Later in the week, I also did their Night Stroll and Boat Cruise tour. the guide for that tour was less enthusiastic, and much of the information for the first part of the tour was the same as I had received on the other one. That wasn't the fault of the guide, but if the two tours are that similar, then the company should say that in their publicity. For the final hour of the tour we took a night cruise up and down the Danube River, which was wonderful. However, the cruise part was run by the Legenda group, and the tour guide did not even go with us. This is something that I could've booked on my own. I loved the cruise, but the earlier part of the tour was not necessary.
Amazing Fun. Signed up to the 2 hour Segway trip after a friend recommended it. The trip was so good we added an extra hour at the end. Everyone should do this!

Excellent, with free personalized tourist info!. Great walking tour touching all the main sights and with plenty of interesting information. Anita was very knowledgeable and still showed great passion and interest for the city. We loved the stop for strudel and coffee. A very nice touch was that Anita took the time to give everyone on the tour personalized tips based on what kinds of things were of interest and where your hotel was, and marked these on a free map. We felt like locals showing up at the restaurants. Do this walking tour on your first day! Price also great - tour took a total of almost 4 hours and we paid 32 EUR for 2 adults (pre-book online for this price) and our two teenage sons were free. Amazing considering this included 2 metro rides plus the aforementioned strudel and latte in a nice restaurant.

Ok Walking Tour. We take walking tours in most cities we visit. We have taken about 10 tours. The 2.5-3 hour Budapest walking tour with tour guide Anita was interesting but I wanted more enthusiasm and history/information. Anita was feeling a little sick that day so I cannot tell if her sickness influenced tour quality. I wish the company provided a tour guide that was feeling well. She did take us to a cafe to try local desserts which was an excellent idea.

Walking tour of Budapest. Great day with Anita and group discovering the city of Budapest. Started at the Opera, rode the yellow Metro line to Hero's Square, City Park and Szechenyi furdo. Back to city center and the Basilica and a break for strudel. The tour continued across the Dunaj up to Castel Hill. Great views of the Parliament from Fishermen's Bastion.

great walking tour, small group. I dont generally care for tours when I am traveling but I liked the idea of a small group with a local guide. Our guide Bridgette was great, she was friendly and knowledgeable, I could tell how much she loved her city, county and history. There was a fantastic break for strudel (i highly recommend the sour cherry) and coffee which is included in the price of the tour. I appreciated that the tour was kept small. We only had 6 people and I was told the tours are always kept less than 15 people, which I appreciate. Very much recommend Bridgette and the Discover Budapest group.
Very interesting. We were happy to have Tamas as our guide. He told us interesting things about Buda. Very energetinc, exciting and entertaining. And bundled with touristic card ;)

Guided halfday walking tours Buda and Pest. We took the Buda half day walking tour with Laslo in the morning and were so enthousiastic about the guide that we also booked the afternoon tour in Pest. The tour brings you to the most interesting places of Budapest and introduces you to the history of the town. The guide underdstands the balance between serious historical background information and humour and fun.We had an fantastic expirience, that you can taste on http://youtu.be/MCcQ-1-Rv5U

Excellent value walking tour & informative. Excellent 3-hour walking tour of the city, taking in all of the main sites of Budapest. Great to do on the first day to get your bearings of the city and find out what places you may like to return to at your own leisure. Anita our guide was very knowledgeable & answered everyone's questions - she has an excellent grasp of English, is very personable and has a good sense to humour too.My highlight was the stop in the strudel house, a great touch. Whilst breaking here for strudel & a drink (included in the price), Anita provided everyone with maps and provided individual advice to all about other recommendations & advice tailored to any requests.The tour is mainly on foot, but we also went on the metro and the transport tickets were included in the price of the tour. There is one part of the tour which involves walking up around 100 steps to Buda. For anyone less able, Anita was more than happy to provide a bus ticket so that they didn't have to walk.Excellent value tour- recommended. You can get an extra discount if you book online in advance.

Great value tour. We took the absolute walking tour today with barbara and it was excellent! She was very knowledgeable and made many recommendations for after our tour. The tour includes a free strudel and drink halfway through which was great. If you book online ahead of time its much cheaper and makes it an even better value!

Food Tour of Budapest. The food tour was extremely interesting and and informative, we enjoyed it very much especially the tour around the market and the wine tasting. It was made more enjoyable by the fact of the friendliness of the tour guide. We would do it again. :)

Very cool tour. This tour was great! Three hour guided walking tour in Budapest in a small group. I don't like big tour groups so this was perfect for me. The tour guide, Brigit, was phenomenal- very knowledgable, helpful, and very pleasant in general. Great opportunity to see the city and also learn a lot in a fun way.

discover budapest by Segway. There were 4 of us; all over the age of 60. Also included in the group were about 8 ranging from 18-35. We had a great time; fun seeing the sights and zipping around tourists, crossing streets, and even managing the curbs. This is fantastic fun and we all highly recommend this outfit. reasonable price, great guide Bridgett and fantastic Budapest.

walking-tour Buda/walking-tour Pest. We had the very good luck to have Laszlo as guide on both the guided trips on Tuesday 14 May in the morning and in the afternoon. The guided tours were very very interesting,, not at all too bombastic and full of knowledge and facts about the 2 parts of the town. The experienced guide even made lovely music and let us do a dance and a game to make the tour very pleasant.and lively. I like to recommend such guided tours to everyone who will visit Budapest.

2 hour Budapest Walking Tour. Had a 2 hour walking tour with Andi from the organisation. This was an excellent tour and Andi kept the tour light and amusing in terms of the information provided....she spoke passionately about Hungarian history and some of the traumas Hungary have faced in history, in a very amusing and entertaining way. I would go as far as to say this is probably one of the best walking tours I have ever done. Fully recommended.

Walking Tour of Budapest. In 3 hours we covered more territory, saw more and learned more than I thought possible. Anita, a native of Budapest, shared her knowledge of her city and her experience growing up during the '80s while the Communists were still in power. She gracefully guided us on foot and by metro up hills, over bridges and through squares giving us detailed information the whole time. A highlight was stop mid-way at a coffee house where we had choose 2! pieces of fresh strudel from many varieties. I'm signing up for Discover Prague walking tour organized by the same company.
Fun and easier than we expected. Brigit did a great job of instructing and guiding. A good.pace and enjoyable introduction to Budapest
Very, very good!. Very nice intro to Budapest! Great tour guide and small group to begin our exploration of this excellent city. Thank you!

Great overview. As part of the Budapest card, we took the Budapest tour with Peter and the Pest tour with Louis. Both tours guides were locals with good English skills and excellent knowledge of the area. They answered lots of questions and pointed us in the direction of further exploration.

An excellent way to get introduced to Budapest. We took both walking tours as part of the Budapest Card, which is a excellent deal if you are going there for the first time. Our guide was La'szlo', who proved to be very knowledgeable and a very kind and polite companion. He even played a couple of folk Hungarian songs with his flute and encouraged people to make questions on the attractions and on the history, which he answered promptly and convincingly. The Buda tour takes about 2 hours and the Pest tour another 3 hours. I suggest taking both tours if possible in 2 days. If you don't have time it is possible to take both in one day but could be somewhat exhausting, but I guess you would feel this is time well spent as La'szlo' will make it fun and enjoyable. Good Luck.

gastro tour and city tour. Discover Budapest has something for everyone with lots of different tours for all tastes. I have used several of the guides, and they have all been easy to understand, young and in tune with what we want to hear. The gastro tour takes you through the market hall and explains all the different foods eaten by the locals, followed by a tasting of Langos (deep fried bread with different toppings). This is followed by a stroll to the Catholic church with the chance to go inside. It finishes with a fantastic wine tasting in the wine cellar of the Discover Budapest building. You get big measures of five of the countries most famous wines. You can finish off with a lunch in a nearby ruin restaurant. Very good value and great service all around.

Walking tour. I took the 3 hr walking tour and my guide was Peter. I booked the trip online prior to arriving to Budapest. The tour was a great way to get familiar with Budapest, so I would suggest doing this early in your trip. Peter was very easy going and informative. He was able to answer all my questions and provide interesting insight. I live in Sweden but am a native English speaker and Peter was very easy to understand and had perfect English. If you walk to the office on lázár utca 16 from the busy street called bajcsy-zsilinszky you have to walk to the very end of lázár utca to find the office.

Buda & Pest Walking Tours. We were in Budapest for a short time and we wanted to see as much as we could in that period. With our Budapest cards, we had the options of taking the walking tours for Buda & Pest. We decided to go ahead with both and we were not disappointed. László, who was our guide, ensured we visited most of the places of importance - sharing with us pieces of local culture, history, myths, facts, figures and stories of the beautiful city. He even played the flute introducing us to Hungarian folk songs and taught the group a step of a 'happy' song!! Our five hours on the tour were thoroughly enjoyable and well spent!

Biking Budapest. Biking the city is a great way to orient yourself to the major sights. The ride was fantastic and Andy the lead was extremely knowledgeable and provided a number of insights into the history of Budapest. Highly recommend.

Wonderful Budapest Segway Tour. The tour was booked online. The location behind the Opera House is very central and the organisation of the tour was excellent. We were fortunate to have a very good, knowledgeable guide who ensured that this was an amazing introduction to the beautiful city of Budapest. Our guide (Balazs) is to be highly commended for his professionalism and personal attention. This is the absolutely best way to get a great overview of a large amount of this city. Your safety and personal questions are at all times paramount.

Walking Tour. We booked the tour online. The meeting place was easy to find and all the staff were very helpful. Our guide, Barbara, was friendly and very informative. You do have to be quite fit to walk up all the steps to the castle!

Buda and Pest Walking Tours. My girlfriend and I purchased Budapest cards at the airport while organising transfers, amongst other things, the card included 2 walking tours. Having a keen interest in history and not knowing much about the city or culture, it was a no brainer to go on both tours. I am very glad this was the case since both tours were very worth while, informative, interesting and fun! A great way to see the city and find out about its history/culture, from inception to current day. Our guide for both tours, Peter, was excellent! Very knowledgeable, great anecdotes, genuinely interested and enthusiastic about the city and its history/culture and always delivered with good humour and a personalised style which only added to the experience.I would recommend these tours to anyone and everyone!

Budapest bike tour. Just a quick review of this great tour by far the best way to see his lovely city it's parks and castles Easy to find location to pick up bikes at the shop right behind the opera house .Lots of interesting commentary from our guide Peter so much we didn't know about this interesting city, tour is very flat biking and takes in most of the important locations you need to see in Pest side of the river before traveling over the chain bridge and up to Budapest castle ( the only incline on the tour) great views for your camera and the time goes by so quick So don't miss this tour the best way to see all you need to and gives you an understanding of Budapest it's people and history oh yes and it's great fun as well

Segway Tour. My husband & I took a Segway tour in Budapest a couple of weeks ago , it was the best way to get around the city & see so much in a short space of time. Balazs, our guide, was a wealth of knowledge, he was friendly & guided us with care & safety in mind. It was so much fun we plan on doing it again before we leave Budapest. Sandra, Australia. April 2013

Great fun!. Everything went smooth. The booking process, the reception, the segway tour. Our guide, Barbie, told us the story behind all the sights with a perfect mix of facts and humour. Both she and her assistent were very friendly and made our tour a highlight. Thanks!

Nite time walking tour & Danube cruise. We decided to book an evening walking tour, which finished with a cruise down the Danube, and we are so glad we did. We booked with discoverbudapest.com, and Peter, our guide, was excellent. Although originally from Holland, Peter was extremely knowledgeable and genuinely enthusiastic about Budapest and Hungarian history and culture, and his extremely friendly and easy-going attitude added to the experience. Initially I wasn't so keen on a walking tour, as I thought we would be herded around the sights, but in reality it wasn't like that at all and to see the city at night with all the sights illuminated was amazing. Great value for money. I would suggest that you book well in advance so you don't miss out on this experience.

Segway Tour. We went to Budapest just for fun. A Segway tour guided by Peter completed that fun. He trained us in handling a Segway safely in a very friendly and professional way. He guided us through the dense traffic and kept us safe. Now and then we stopped and Peter told us some interessting facts about Budapest and it's historical buildings. I highly recommend Peter as your guide for having fun in Budapest.

Segway Tour. I was the only one on my tour so I had the my tour guide Andi to myself. She was excellent, both extremely knowledgable and passionate. Very professional outfit and great way to see the city.

Segway Tours. Our guide, Peter from Holland, was very friendly and professional. He learned us how to ride a Segway and brought us to nice spot of the city. There was no moment we felt unsafe with his supervision, although there was a lot of traffic on the road. If you visiting Budapest you definitely have to jump on a Segway and ask especially for Peter to guide you through the city.

Fun. One of the most fun way to see central Budapest is by segway. If it was less expensive, the fun was better. you can get 10% off with this minicard that you can get in most hotels. Better to make bookind in advance. the price is Huf 14000 to 19500 depend on tour type. Tel: 36-1-2693843www.BudapestSegwayTours.com.

Segway Tour of Budapest - Excellent !. First visit to Budapest, we arrived Tuesday afternoon and had a 2 hour Segway tour that evening. It was incredibly good fun and an excellent way to get an introduction to this attractive city. Our tour guide was very knowledgable and friendly - we would recommend this company to everyone!

Why didn't we do this sooner?. You see so much more of the city when segwaying than walking. At the end of our tour we then revisited some of the places (markets for example) that we'd not been aware of.We were on pavements throughout (except when crossing roads, of course). We felt safe, had fun, learned a bit about Budapest, and we were as flat as pancakes when our time was up and our guide made us give the segways back.
Walking tour. The best tour you can take. Anita our guide was excellent. Totally recommend. She took us on the subway which I would never have done , it was brilliant.Barbara and Bobby Scotland .

Well paced, informative 3.5 hour walking tour of Buda and Pest!. I feel very fortunate to have had Anita guide my group for our city tour this morning. Her solid background knowledge was invaluable. She was able to answer all our questions and added many interesting facts about all the sites we visited with her. The tour included a stop at the "first Strudel House of Pest Cafe and Restaurant" snack included in price of tour. Delicious freshly baked strudel and coffee. This tour is a great way to see the most important sites and meet nice people. A great way to be introduced to a beautiful city!

Three-hour walking tour of Budapest. Anita, our guide was excellent! Her knowledge of the history, architecture, art and culture of the city was fantastic. No guidebook could have surpassed what we learned on the tour and even though it was unseasonably snowy, it did not put a dampner on the walk. My favourite parts were the journey on the subway, even though the station announcements reminded me of a bad 90s electronic game, Heroes Square, the People's Park, Szechenyi Baths, Fishermens' Bastion and not forgetting the halfway stop at the strudel shop. I so want to go back to Budapest as four days were just not enough!

Segway Great thing to do!!!. I had a great time with our awesome guide Andi! She was very informative and she also humorous too. She was helpful before during and after the tour. Andi knew the history of a lot of places and she told us all the great places to go while we were passing them on the segway. At the end of the tour she was really making sure that everyone was ok and she also made sure that everyone knew where they were going next. Thanks Andi

Magnificent tour on Wheels!!. My wife and I came to Budapest on our Honeymoon, I have to say it was the best choice despite the freezing weather of march. We took the Segway 2 hour tour with our guide Balazs who took us all over the main attractions of the city and was knowledgable about each and every part of it. I highly recommend this tour and ask about Balazs Berenui as he is very friendly and knowledgable.

Walking Tour of Budapest - excellent way to experience the city. My husband and I booked the 3 hour walking tour and had a fantastic time. We ended up being the only people on the tour. It was cold but we still had a great time. Our guide (Brigit) was fantastic - extremely knowledgable, funny and easy to understand. The tour started at the Discover Budapest tour centre with the first stop the magnificent Opera House. From there we took the metro (tickets included in the tour price) to Heroes Square, the baths and other sights. From there the metro to St Stephens Basilica, stopping off at a local cafe for coffee and strudel (also included in tour price) before heading to the Chain Bridge. the tour ending after walking to Fishermans Bastion. This was a great tour to become familiar with Budapest. We were able to work out which places we wanted to go back to and spend more time. Brigit also helped us with other sights that would be of interest. This is a great tour - value for money, informative and a great guide.

3h absolute walking tour highly recommended. just completed the 3h walking tour of budapest and would highly recommend. Very informative guide (we had Anita) who went at a good pace and knew everything you wanted to know. The stop for a coffee and strudel (included in the price) was great, and overall the tour was a great way to get to know about the history of the city and the country. Anita was also full of recommendations for whatever else you wanted to do/see/eat.

Friendly. We booked the City segway tour. We were lucky that there was no other party booked and got a guide to ourselves. This was our first time using the segways but we were given a training session before we set off. Our guide Ivett was AMAZING!! She was very patient whilst we got the hang of the segways and once we set off, she was great as a tour guide. She made the tour interesting and knew everything there was to know about Budapest. I would definitely recommend this company when booking any tours, but most recommend to try and have Ivett as your tour guide as she was brilliant.

Very informative!. We took the city evening Tour and boat cruise. Ivett, our guide, was very nice, knowledgeable and helpful. She gave us advice on where to go and eat in Budapest and her suggestions were very good. The Tour helped discovering the city and getting to know how to get around. The cruise was excellent! The view was amazing and the audio-guide was interesting. It was worth every Forint! Would definitely recommend at the beginning of your trip...

Excellent Absolute Walking Tour. Last weekend we were in Budapest and decided to do a walking tour with a guide. We used Discover Budapest - the absolute walking tour, our guide was Peter. It was an excellent tour ! It was very imformative, we saw and learnt such a lot about Budapest. I would definitely recommend it and would recommend Peter as a guide. He was friendly, patient, helpful, very informative, and knowledgeable about the country and its history. My husband and I had a great time. I would absolutely recommend these tours. They did segway tours which did look fun.

Walking Tour of Budapest. The first morning of our holiday we decided on a walking tour of three and a half hours to formiliarise ourselves with the tourist attractions budapest has to office,this was of real benefit in finding our way round when on our own. Our hotel recommened Discover Budapest Tour Centre and we were not disappointed, our guide Anita was excellent not only did she speak fluent english her knowledge and humour made the tour most enjoyable, if we were giving out marks Anita would get ten out of ten.This company doe's other tours including cycle and sedway.

Segway tour, fun in Budapest.. I recently did the seqway tour in Budapest. It was a new experience for me but so much fun and so easy to learn. The guide was a very nice and knowledgeable young lady who had a lot of knowledge about the city, the county and its history. I had a great time.

Excellent!. We took the Absolute Budapest walking tour and the Hammer and Sickle tour. Both tours were excellent. Our tour guide Anita spoke excellent English, was very patient and knowledgeable. We had a great day seeing the sights of the city and learning more about less known facts and places.I absolutely recommend these tours to anyone visiting this city and would definitely use the same company if I visit again.

Walking Tour of Budapest. The goal of a city walking tour is to introduce you to the history, physical layout, and give you a chance to hear a local's perspective of what its like to live there. This tour did exactly that. Anita was our guide. She was wonderful to talk to, her English was very good, she had a good sense of humor and was genuinely interested in hearing about our life experiences. She also pointed me towards local jazz clubs and music stores. Included in this tour: coffee break and strudel. Book it, you won't regret it!

City Walking tour. An excellent 3hr tour of the city which became a private tour as I was the only one booked. Amazing value and extremely interesting, included underground tickets and a coffee & strudel stop.
My thank you to Peter for being a very informative and interesting guide.

Budapest Absolute All In One Walking Tour with coffee and dessert stop!. An excellent introduction to the city of Budapest, its history and culture. Myself and my wife were the only people on the tour and Audrea, our guide, was really excellent- very knowledgeable, informative, friendly and clearly very proud of the city of Budapest. The tour itself lasted three hours and was well paced making a great start to our stay in the city. It helped us in planning our next few days so that we made the most of our short break. We would highly recommend this tour and hope your guide is as good as ours was!

Highly recommended. We always take walking tours whenever we go to cities and we'd rate this one highly. Peter was very knowledgeable and rightly proud of Budapest's history and heritage. He was very friendly and made sure all those on the tour were included as we went round. We've been to this city several times for the spas and the culture - but we still learnt a great deal. Our guide knew the answers to everyone's questions - often adding in an anecdote or historical story. The stop-off for the local strudel delicacy (savoury as well as sweet) included as part of the tour's cost wasn't a bad idea either!

Great tour !!!. I was fortunate enough to be the only person on this tour, Sunday January 6th. All at the shop/meeting point were warm and friendly including my guide, Peter, who was a native, lived in the city and was obviously a very proud resident.The three hour tour went very quickly and there was never a dull/quiet moment. Peter is incredibly knowledgeable about Budapest and histroy in general and was great company.The sights visited (Opera House, Metro, Heroes' Square, City Park, Liberty Square, Chain Bridge & Castle Hill) were by no means an exhaustive "to do list" but flowed well and gave a very good general experience of one of my now favourite cities.Would recommend this tour to everyone. Just be mindful that there's a fair bit of walking involved so maybe not for everyone, but that was the only downside I could see.Brilliant tour, Brilliant guide, Brilliant city !!!!!

Fantastic Segway tour!. We had a great time on a segway tour with our friendly, fun and knowledgable guide Brigit. There were just the two of us on a bright morning tour, we had a training session on the segway (a bit scary to start with but very easily learned and felt confident after about 10mins). We then set off exploring the sights of Pest. Brigit told us all about the sights we went to and it was very informative.Being on the segway obviously meant that we didn't go into any of the places we visited which was perfect for us but it would be best to do this tour at the beginning of your stay and then you can go back to the places you want to spend more time in. The shop itself was excellent, all the staff v v friendly and they helped us with buying tickets for the Szechenyi thermal baths to avoid having to queue.Thank you!!

Great Pest tour. My girlfriend and I have been backpacking europe for 2 weeks and have found that walking tours of cities are very useful in understanding cities histories. Budapest is not the exception, so when you go to Budapest you must get a walking tour to understand all the Buda and Pest cities history and why now they have merged into one. We had Peter as our tour guide. We had the Pest tour which is the one in city center around the opera, the parlament and St. Stephen's Chatedral and some other places. These 3 buildings are Peter's "must visit" in budapest. You can be part of this tour using the budapest card, however for the Buda side the citycard won't work with this company (there is another one). It was a 2 1/2 walk with plenty of information about the Pest side and all its history. At the end of the tour Peter gave us a small taste of an hungarian cinnamon swirl bread which was very delicious.

Great tour , excellent guide and value for money .. My boyfriend and I did the 2 hour Winter Segway tour on the 2nd January. It was absolutely freezing ! But the tour was great , the first 30 minutes were spent training 1 at a time to get used to the Segway and gain confidence going up kerbs etc. After this we went to theOpera House ,synagogue ,VarosmartySquare , the Danube , Four Seasons hotel , the parliament and St Stephens Basicala. Our guide ,Julie , was excellent and made us all feel at ease . She gave us a lot of information about the buildings and also gave a valuable insight into the history of Budapest . After the tour she kindly showed us the location of certain sights on the map and provided us with lots of local tips . We loved doing this tour and don't be nervous of trying a Segway , it is very easy to pick up and the guides are very patient and understanding . Try it out !

A Personalized Experience. My wife and I decided to begin a weekend in Budapest with a walking tour to get our bearings. We had Anita as our guide and it happened that we were the only visitors on a cold bright morning. The three and a half hours were an excellent introduction to the city and its people's ways. Our guide was very well informed about the history and development of Hungary and its capital city and we greatly appreciated her friendly introduction. While on the walk we were able to book tickets to a magic performance of Mozart's Requiem Mass at St Stephen's Cathedral which was one of the other highlights of our time in Budapesst. Thank you Anita, keep up the good work, you are so good at what you do. Pat and Deirdre.

Great Tour Co. and People. Anita was our guide for both the evening boat tour and the general sites tour the next day. She was extremely knowledgeable, personable and friendly. She gave us great insight into the history, architecture and people of Hungary. I highly recommend Discover Budapest tours.

Fantastic evening segway tour. What an amazing experience, we love d every moment despite the cold temperatures! Brigit was an amazing guide and kept us entertained through the tour with her knowledge and energy. She is an excellent teacher and my friends and I managed the whole tour without any injuries. We learnt a lot about the culture and history of Budapest. Some of the highlights included: opera house, liberty square, parliament, chain bridge and looking over to Buda castle and St. Matthius church, st stephens basilica and vorosmarty square. We enjoyed the evening tour and was a great ending to a wonderful trip to Budapest. I recommend this tour and company 100 percent.

You have to do this!. We had a brilliant afternoon segway-ing around Budapest. We had a private tour with a great chap (sorry, can't remember his name). Very informative and we learned a lot about the attractions that we would have otherwise missed. My 11 year old son said it was the best thing he had ever done in his life!! The fun of riding the segway is good on its own, the historic information and views are the icing on the cake. TAKE GLOVES!

Anita was wonderful. We thoroughly enjoyed learning about Budapest from Anita a few weeks ago. She was personable and knowledgeable. There was plenty of time to ask every question we could think of and we felt familiar with the city and its history by the end of the tour. I highly recommend this tour -- and especially Anita.

AWESOME FUN, FUN,FUN!. Absolute great way to tour. After 5 - 10 minutes were ready to go. I was nervous but our guide put us all at immediate ease by his proffessionaism. There were 4 of us in tour, all adults from 24 to 74. Weather was perfect at 72*. We all would recommend this mode of transportation for touring anywhere in the world and we are going to book Segway everywhere we travel to in the future. Try it, you'll like it. If you can walk, you can Segway Away!

Budapest at night... My wife and I took the evening walking tour and river cruise. We were in a small group of 6 which was ideal for this kind of tour. Our guide was very knowledgeable and we covered several interesting landmarks in Pest. The pace was leisurely and relaxing. There was plenty of time for picture taking and questions. If I had one complaint, it would be about the cruise potion of the evening. I would have liked if the boat had an open deck on top. It would have been more conducive to picture taking. There was a lot of glare coming from the windows. All in all a great evening.

Segway... The best way to city tour!. I always hated city tours. I usually think they are boring and you can only see great places from behind an glass wall like an aquarium!For my surprise I LOVED THIS SEGWAY CITY TOUR! I don't know if it's because it seems you're walking or if it's because the speed you're riding or the fun you have with the device but after this one I also did segway tours in Vienna and Prague.The segway is easy to ride and our guide, Marti, was a nice teacher. She took her time and made sure we're ready for a tour without accidents.About Marti, she was great. She knows a lot about Budapest and respected our wishes to focus both in the tour as in the ride (of course, we don't ride segways everyday). By the end of the tour we wanted to start all over again.I strongly recommend this tour. The two tour we've made with Discover (Budapest and Prague, this one with Cristian) were the best city tour we ever made.

Best way to learn about Budapest. We went on the three-hour walking tour and thought it was great! There were only six in our group so our excellent tour leader Ivett was able to answer all our questions as well as explain everything of the sights as we walked around. Yes, it was quite a long tour but going on foot is the bestcway to learn about a new city. We also had a pleasant break halfway for coffee and strudels - a nice touch!We have now booked a similar Discover walking tour in Prague, so that's proof of our satisfaction with this tour service.

A (if not 'the') highlight of our amazing trip.. My partner and I booked ourselves on a segway tour- My first time on a segway. I can honestly say it was a delightfully amusing/thrilling way to see this fantastic city. Worth every penny. We were the only couple booked on the tour that particular morning, which meant we got the personable guide, Marti, all to ourselves. Marti gave us a quick lesson on the wheels then off we went, confident in our new driving skills. The pavements are wide so there was plenty of room to manoeuvre and we used the cycle paths whenever it was possible.We covered so much of Pest in the 90 minute Grand tour - it never felt boring as we wheeled around in the heat. Marti was very friendly and informative. She gave us plenty of opportunity to ask questions and take photo's. Definitely my favourite method of touring to date!
3hour walking tour. Excellent. I did this tour this morning. The guide Julie was first class and the experience great.The best way to see and learn more about Budapest.
segway grand tour. We had the best time on this tour would highly recommend one of these it's also a great way to set your city compass and orientate yourself.

Fantastic!!!!. Following a recommendation from a friend, I booked myself, my mother, grandmother and aunt to do a segway tour on our visit to Budapest. When we arrived we were trained and my grandmother and aunt decided they could not do it. So instead of losing their money, Brigit ordered a rickshaw for them to follow us around on the tour.The segways were such fun, and a great way to see the city. Brigit was lovely, very helpful and informative. I highly recommend it to anyone.

Do the Segway tour wherever you go!!. We first encountered Segway tours when doing research for our Washington DC trip last summer. After that fun experience we vowed to do at least one Segway tour every holiday we take. When preparing for our Eurpoean holiday this year we found that there was a Segway tour in Budapest, so we booked it. Today's tour was excellent! It was even more fun than the DC tour. Our Segway instructors were very helpful and friendly and the main guide, Andrea (Andy) was very knowledgable of Hungarian culture, architecture and history. So the tour was not only excellent fun but very informative as well.Highly recommended!!Doug Brewer and Marianne ConroyLake Oswego OR USA

free tour budapest. We didn't plan to do this tour and Barbie (our guide) just came by and asked if we wanted to do a tour with her. We were just 2 people and the tour was more than we expected. Barbie explained all about the city, monuments, history or common life in the city. Also she recommended good places to have dinner or just a beer. Really good, it's a tour i'd recommend

Excellent Extended Segway Tour. Brigit led our family on a very informative jaunt around Budapest. Fantastic insight into the city and culture, and great knowledge of the architectures used. We've found the best way for us to get to know a city is Segway first, and then go see the things that require a more in-depth visit. We cover more ground in less time, and we like the personal touch Segways allow over bus tours. Highly recommend this option since Budapest is an expansive sight-seeing city.

A bit of different fun in the city.. I went with my sister after a friend recommended it. After our 30 minutes of practice at riding segways, we were ready to hit the city, but unfortunately there was a parade. Me and my sister were the only ones who could come the next day. I would think people who run tours in cities should know when the city is going to be completely blocked off, but oh well. They all spoke nice english, but I could never hear what the guide was saying because of traffic. She didn't exactly speak loud in my opinion either. The actual segway ride was fun, I'd liked a little more practice on how to go down and get up curbs, especially since I nearly fell off my segway at a curb. My segway also kept rearing up, which was very scary. The guide said I was probably going too fast then, but I was at the same speed with everyone... I also found it a bit offputting that my sister asked if people fell off a lot (we signed a form where they took no responsibility and we had to pay if we crashed etc) and the guide said yeah, especially the old people.I'm not sure if I would come back to do this, it was a bit expensive too, for just riding segways and not really having much guiding. But it was a different experience, and for that it was fun. My sister liked it more than I did.

Free walking tour with Brigit among the best I've ever had. I try to begin exploring new cities with a free walking tour, to get myself oriented, learn a bit about the city, and to identify places to return and spend more time. This was truly among the best I've ever had. Brigit really knows the city and its history, the pacing of the trip was perfect, and moreover she's very funny and entertaining. If the other guides from Discover Budapest are half as good, you'll really enjoy your tour.

From Budapest to Vienna. We had the most fantastic individual trip from Budapest along the Donau river to Vienna. The friendly and helpful staff at Budapest Tour Center provided us with new bikes and a croozer for our luggage and tent. Thank you for making it possible to drop the bikes in Vienna!

An excellent night walk around Europe. We received this free walking tour as part of our honeymoon package and weren't entirely sure what to expect as we tend to go to the sights ourselves.We found the little office with no problems and were lucky enough to be the only people participating in this particular tour.Anita the guide was friendly and informative throughout the walk giving us plenty of time to get some nice night shots of the sights and lots of useful information about each place we saw. She was able to answer lots of questions and her enthusiasm about the city certainly made it all the more interesting, especially the changes since the Communist era.A highly recommended experience rounded off with a great night cruise down the Danube which showed us all the major sights close to the river.

Very nice guided tour. I tried the Segway tour during my stay in Budapest and it was very nice. I had the 1,5 hour tour and I was lucky enough to be alone along with the guide. I think her name was Mesi and she was very kind and well informed about Budapest sites. She gave me some pretty nice tips about the city and also guided me around. I would suggest you get a bigger tour if you can afford , mine was over pretty soon, time passed fast but the evening tour was full so i had to compromise. Have in mind that if you have a Budapest card (as I did) you can have a 30% discount on your tour.

Walking Tour and Night Cruise Disappointment. I went on the Walking Tour and Night Cruise with my wife and sister-in-law and we were universally disappointed. Te tour route was fairly poorly chosen as it went from the Opera House to St. Steven's Basillica to the Chain Bridge before being dropped off at a mass preordered river cruise. The walking tour added no real value to the evening and the route should be rethought to include more ground and while the guide, Kinga, was pleasant, much of the information which she provided was either provided at the rehearsed level and not from the knowledge level, and then was contradicted by the evening river cruise video. My wife and I have used Viator to book over a dozen different activities in at least a half dozen different countries and this was clearly one of the most disappointing activities we have been part of. I hope that Discover Budapest rethinks the route for the walking tour, though it is difficult to cover Budapest in a walking tour.

Great Fun. Had a private 2.5 hour tour today and it was Excellent.I can thoroughly recommend it for any age.Our Tour Guide Barbara, spoke excellent English and was very knowledgeable about the History of Budapest and Hungary in general.Very good value for money. Thank you

Unconventional tour offering family fun activity!. My twins and I had a fabulous experience with this tour! Our friendly and very pleasant guide, Brigitte, expressed concern in accommodating our needs from the start. We underwent training in a safe area and discussed desirable touring approaches to meet our expectations prior to setting off on our excursion. During our excursion we were able to cover a lot of ground, with greater speed and efficiency than a walking tour! The boys stayed actively engaged and enjoyed the additional challenge this unconventional touring approach had to offer. With Brigitte's expertise and guidance we navigated our way through pest quite smoothly. Thanks, Brigitte- you were the best!! Great family fun and adventure that I would highly recommend. Get Segway discount coupons/Budapest Card from tourist info center to pair with this tour in prder to maximize your Budapest visit.

Great tour!!. Really brilliant tour, the best free one I've ever done! A bit of walking but not too much in the end, learnt so much about Budapest in only a few hours. Especially good was the story about the firstMcDonalds :)Our guide, Brigit was brilliant and really friendly, definitely recommended!!

Segway tour. Not a possitive experience. The on line booking was lost, we were left waiting at the hotel and had to chase the company up. The tour ended half an hour too early. The dissclaimer form was very one sided, any costs incurred whilst being on a segway could cost you alot of money, not sure if the company is insurred!

Sweet segways. My husband and I had never done a Segway tour before. We usually just stick with the bus tours. This was a completely new experience. Our wonderful tour guide, Fanni, gave us lessons on how to use the segs. It was way easier than I thought. When everyone was comfortable we set out on the town. We went to so many different sites - such a quick way to get around the city. Fanni gave us lots of information about the buildings and the history of Budapest. She was very personable and fun. The tours were either 2.5 or 3.5 hrs. We went on the longer one and were so glad that we did. Amazing experience. I would do it again in a heartbeat.

Budapest with Marta. On a recent trip to Budapest, Hungary we wondered how best to explore this incredible city. We discovered Budapest Segway Tours. With Marta my Guide, we did a one hour tour of the City … just Marta and me … incredible experience - the first time ever for me on a Segway. A real highlight of our trip to Europe. Thank you Marta :)See my short video here https://vimeo.com/44686561enjoy

Fun & informative segway tour. This Segway tour was great fun and covered all the major sites on the Pest side of Budapest. Our guide Orsi was knowledgable and had very good English. We were also pleased to receive a discount card for the same tour in Prague. We have completed many Segway tours in various countries and this tour was comparable. You can cover a large part of the city in a short time.

Grand Segway tour. This is a very entertaining way to discover the city and I really recommend it! You can move over a fairly large area quicker than if you walk but without getting tired. Still you access all the walking areas so you get really close to the sights. And the Segway is so much fun to ride! Plus, since you have a guide with you, you get a very personal touch to the tour. We had chosen the 2,5 hour Grand tour, which started with a quick training session outside the office and then Mesi gave our family (2 parents, 2 teens) an excellent tour, thank you Mesi!It was so much fun, we felt we could have done this every day :) You don't need any special clothes or equipment to do this, my only tip is to put on sun tan lotion and bring a bottle of water (the Segway has a little bag in the front where you can keep it handy) if you do the tour on a hot day like we did. Young or old, on your own or with friends or family - this is the perfect way to do the Budapest tour - book it!/Annica

Absolute waste of time - AVOID - run bybackpackers. Absolute shambles! Arrived at the office to rudely greeted by a fleet of incompetent backpackers. They have no professionalism or even basic understanding of how to run a business. We were treated like idiots and spoken to horribly. Finally, our male guide showed us how to ride the Segway - and to his credit he was absolutely fantastic. Sad a bad review when he was so great. We then had to wait another hour for late comers because one of the tour guides made it clear she didn't want to take 3 people by herself. Too bad if we had something else on afterwards!! I asked to use their 'free internet' to email our friends to let them know we'd be late. Only for an extremely rude 'backpacker' with a half shaved head to roll her eyes at me, shake her hands in my face and told me to 'hurry up'... Finally we got on our way to find we COULD NOT GO ON OUR TOUR.. There was a parade and the city was blocked off.. Something a business should know!! No apology.. Just abuse from the shaved head girl. No discount for rebooking.. They were all SO RUDE.. Except our actual lovely male guide... He was so nice: the rest were rude backpackers who have no idea how to run a business and I'd be appalled if I owned the business. One backpacker was actually eating his dinner while we were all trying to sort out out refunds. Don't waste your time - go with Budapest Segway Tours.. They are amazing!!

The very best way to see BudaPest!. Loved our Segway tour. Our guide was precious and most attentive to our training on the Segway. She made sure we stayed right with her the entire tour. Our tour was during the 6-8 pm time frame which was perfect for getting photos and seeing the old city with minimum traffic and no heat. Although I wrecked on my Segway (completely my fault and was well attended by the staff and fellow travelers on our little tour), I would highly recommend this as a great way to see the 'Pest' side.

Superb, great fun. What a start to our 3 days in Budapest. we booked the segway orientation tour on line and got a discount which was a good start.A little apprehensive to start with but with expert tuition from a brilliant guide of we went.If you really want to have a great tour or the Pest side of the river go by segway and use this professional company you will not be disappointed !!!!!

Pretty Good Tour. I've done Segway tours in every major European city, as I think they are fun and a great way to see a city. Booked with City Segway Tours since I had a fun time on the last Segway tour I did with them some 6 years ago. Our tour guide Mashi was cute and knowledgeable, but it took an hour from the time we arrived to get going as everyone had to be briefed on Segway use individually and even though I prepayed at their request with Paypal and confirmed payment, they insisted on refunding me and making me pay by credit card instead. Most disappointing though was the fact that they had speed limited their Segways. I agree that this is a good idea for inexperienced riders, but not nearly as fun for those that know how to ride.

AWESOME. This was my second time to go on a Segway tour and no doubt it was my best. The young lady who was our tour guide was wonderful and very knowledge. It was a great way to see the city along with hearing about the history. Segway is very easy to learn and will worth the cost to see all of the city.

City Tour was excellent!. Kinga gave an excellent tour for our medium sized group on Friday June 1, 2012. The stop for coffee is a nice break.\We didn't take the Segway Tour but we noticed a celebrtiy (see the attached photo).

Amazing experience!. What an amazing way to tour the city! The Segways are very easy to learn, and you feel super confident to ride through the city in just 5 minutes. Our guide was a wonderful girl, who shared with us info about all important spots of Budapest. It was super-fun and definitely worth it!

Best Two Hours of Standing I Ever Had. Though I went on a bike tour the day before, I decided to tour a second day on a Segway. In a word, it was awesome. This was my first time on a Segway so I was a little reluctant. The reluctance subsided quickly as the guide gave me a quick 5 minute lesson, which was enough to get me going. If you are a little adventurous and not timid (and can learn to trust the machine), after 20 minutes the Segway practically responds to your thoughts. The territory we covered included very crowded squares, uneven terrain, dirt paths, grassy fields, areas of high traffic, steep hills, and I felt very comfortable during the journey.As for the tour, I have nothing but great things to say about it. I was lucky to have been the only one so it was just myself and the tour guide. As a result, the guide pretty much customized the tour for me. It was supposed to be the Citadel Tour, but we were able to cover much territory in the 2 hours I signed on for (Budapest Castle, Parliament, residential neighborhoods, etc...). The Citadel portion was particularly fun because the tour guide took me off the path and to places that you could not cover any other way. We went to places busses could not get to, hills that only very physically fit bike riders could manipulate, and covered more territory in two hours than you could walk in 2 days. To my liking, the tour guide took me through residential neighborhoods and places where you would never see tourists and only find the locals.My guide, Balazs was really good. Not only did he customize the tour for me, but was very knowledgable and provided a good narrative along the way.I can't say enough about this experience. True, it is a bit more costly - but the experience is well worth it. My only regret is that I was traveling on business so I did not have my wife and 3 kids to share the adventure with.

Segway Tour. If visiting Budapest, and you like a little adventure, and something out of the ordinary, then this is an absolute must. I cannot recommend it enough. We took the Segway Tour from the the offices of Discover Budapest in Lazar Utca and after a short training seesion (it is easier than it looks) we set off for a two hour tour. Our guide (sorry I forgot his name) was a fountain of information about Budapest and did his very best to accomodate us in every way. He was attentive, considerate, amusing, and an all round nice guy. However the Segway really steals the show. It was fantastic fun. My only regret is that the roads of England are not realistically equipped to allow me to buy one and use it here! However Budapest is just perfect for it. Take my advice book it now.

The best way to discover Budapest history is on Danube boat trip. We discover Budapest by night on Danube boat trip in feb 2012; it was a great experience and I love it ! We also ate on boat the traditional Hungarian food... Goulash ... Sarmale ... Apple Cake ... And Tokay Wine...For 30 euro or 7800 Huf you will not regret...

Get the segway tour from them!!. We want on the segway tour, which is the same price as the other segway tours on offer but is private rather than a group tour. Our guide (Martine) was lovely and showed us the sights we wanted to see. She gave us the choice of whether to stop and learn the history as some people don't want to know (we did). I learned a lot about Hungarian culture from her and she took some videos of my husband and I on the segways. They also offer coffee etc in their office free of charge. Apparently they are a bit quiet for bookings at the moment, so I urge you to choose them if you are considering a segway tour.

Good way to see the city. We have done segway tours all over european cities and this unfortunatly was not one of the best. We were told to arrive 15mins early before the tour started which we did but unfortuantly the owner didn't show up until 15mins after the start time, standing around for 30mins in the street not fun. But he did apologise and all was forgiven. We had a good sized group and half had already used a segway before, but for safety its reasonable that everyone tries it out and feels comfortable, but because there was 8 or so of us this took 45mins! Oh my gosh this was frustrating, I think segway tours should say beginners should come 20mins earlier than tour start time, do their training, so we can all get going on time and start seeing the city. Our superior tour just ended up being the basic tour and once back at base, back on the segway and up to Hereos square and back. For the tour itself it was a tour of Budapest's big buildings and squares. No real insights or special places and didn't really take advantage of the segway, I imagine those sights are the same as you would do on the big red bus. We didn't go to the castle side, I would have liked to see if our segway could save a climb up the hill (in Athens we segwayed the steep hill up to the Acropolis with everyone else walking in the sun it was a fantastic use of the vehicle!). With the superior tour do have a hearty breakfast before hand, it was coolish and there was no pee or snack stops. Actually a quick way to add something would have been a stop in one of the famed coffee houses, maybe try a unique product like a Cserpes Trudi, slice of langos at a street stall, lace being made, the Tisza story outside the store. I'm only going by other tours we had in other cities who all added something different, not just a bus tour on a segway. I love Segway tours and I would still recomend this to segway beginners, basic tourists and people who love big building facades and squares. But if you've done segway before or want tours with a bit of extra insight I think you would be dissapointed.

Segway in Budapest was GREAT!. This was the first time on a Segway and we had a blast. It was very cold and since you are not walking in the cold you need to dress warm (temp = 1C). Easy to learn for us 54 year olds so anyone can do it. What a great way to to see an old city in a new technology. Our guide was great she was very experienced and spoke excellent English. Don't miss this one opportunity to see a lot of Budapest in a short amount of time and have lots of FUN!
Great Orientation to Budapest. Our guide, Marnie, was terrific - very knowledgeable and friendly. Very nice tour of the major sights.

The future of city slickin'. It won't be long before these machines are the norm around town. Therefore you should get on one now before the novelty wears off and its no longer a talking point. Couldn't think of a better way to get round the city in a short time and be able to see so much, so easily. The guys at City Segway Tours are very relaxed and very cool to deal with. Our tour guide was fantastic as well and didn't at all patronise the inability of all of us in getting the hang of it at the start. Really informative tour but not too much deep-rooted history to tie us up which was kind especially after a night on the Hungarian liquor. Considering Budapest is delightfully cheap for us Brits, it is well worth splashing out a little extra cash on doing one of these Segway tours. Think about it......it you don't enjoy it, well at least you've been on a Segway and got a story to tell about how you terrorised the Budapestian old ladies doing their morning shopping!!

Relaxing way to see mutch in Budapest in short time. If you have just some days in Budapest, it is worth the money to buy tickets on a city tour.See mutch, learn some an drink a lot of beer. We had 41 degrees during our stay, so beer was a must.

Tour of Buda and Pest by segway. The segway tours of the city are to be thoroughly recommended as a way of seeing Budapest. The 3 hour tour goes around both the Pest and Buda sides of the city. A perfect way to see the city in good weather, for the fairly fit. The guide was really friendly and helpful which together with the excitement of riding the segway makes it a really enjoyable way of seeing the sights.

Budapest Tour and lunch the right way.. I was really impressed with how Segway Budapest handled our group. We are a party of 5 ranging in age from 14 to 80 so clearly all of us bombing around on Segway’s would not be a good thing and we were not going to abandon “ Grandmother” What they suggested was Segway’s for the 4 from 14 to 55 and a bicycle/ rickshaw for “ Grandmother” Worked out great everyone was happy and everyone got a great tour of Budapest in a novel fashion and a great lunch at a local restaurant with great food. Of particular note was our tour guide and our rickshaw peddler both were young Hungarians who were proud of their country but were not going to overlook it’s faults. I could see in the future saying that I was toured around Budapest by somebody famous. These kids are going places!!! It was great to get a real insight into what young Hungarians thought and have them communicate this in an effective way to my family.

Well organized and reminds me of a living GOOGLE. I arrived there at the main business center feeling a bit overwhelmed and I was a bit afraid they wouldn't know what I was talking about. The center had plenty of modern English books and plenty of tourist aide equipment in the place such as bikes, and other rental equipment. The location was easy to find and just off the path like it stated in their guide and books. I would recommend this for anyone that just wants to soak it all in and figure out what they want to see and do while in Hungary from wine tours, to hiking and biking, they can set it up. Deal with them with no pressures and no issues. THEY WERE EXTREMELY HELPFUL and very patient listening to my concerns and needs. It was an interesting experience and I am grateful for passing by. I really recommend just sitting back and soaking it in all in while you are there. Use this place like a military command center and plan on how you want to conquer this beautiful country. Keep an open mind about everything and welcome new opportunities when they come.

first river cruise. my wife and i have been on several ocean cruises but my wife can get sea sick so we elected to try a river cruise. Avalon Waterways has a five day Taste of the Danube which takes in Budapest, Linz, Melk, Vienna, Durnstein and a road trip to Salzburg. The difference between ocean cruises and a river cruise can be sum up in one word personal. Because your cruisemates will number anywhere from 100 to 185 people who become individuals very quickly. If you like meeting people this is a vacation for you. In addition the food quality and selection beats most oceanliners and you are going nonstop from a wonderful buffet breakfast and lunch to a seatdown dinner with wine included. No need to worry about coffee be it expresso or capacino as it is available free 24 hours. We sailed on Avalon's older ship the Tapestry, 2006, and one would never notice any aging with staterooms larger then again most oceanliners. Can't say enough very enjoyable, great new friends.

Plesantly surprised... River Beatrice with Uniworld was everything and more than expected and hoped for. The wonderful crew, the beautiful accomadations, the many interesting ports we visited. All that added to making our cruise everything we could have wanted. The food was excellent as well. We would recommend the Beatrice to anyone that wants to be pampered and really treated well. It happened we had a suite, and we were amazed at the amount of room we had in that size of boat. I will say their internet service was really poor. Very disappointing...It's our hope that one day we may have the pleasure of traveling with Uniworld . Top Notch!!

Fabulous concert in beautiful surroundings ~ far superior to the Duna String Orchestra in St. Stephen's Basilica. A thoroughly enjoyable evening with a varied repertoire from an obviously accomplished group of musicians. The accoustics in the Duna Palace are superb, the atmosphere fun and lively and the inside of the palace exquisite. We booked this concert online prior to our visit but it's easy to buy tickets from the numerous sellers on the Budapest streets. At just over 30 euros per ticket, we felt this we very good value for money, especially compared to the 50 plus that we paid for a very disappointing hour-long shambles of a performance from the Duna String Orchestra in the Basilica two days earlier. For those who enjoy a typical "tourist concert", the Danube Symphony Orchestra with cimbalom show in the Duna Palace is a must ~ unlike the Duna String Orchestra's shocking performance at St. Stephen's where they rely on the beauty of the venue alone ~ don't waste your money on this one!

Too short - Could have been better. We were the only 2 on the tour so perhaps that was why our guide decided to make it so short. Our 2 hour tour lasted little over an hour so we didnt feel that we had value for money. We have done segways in lots of cities and this was the poorest.

Great family fun. We went (family of four including children aged 11 and 13) during February when when it was still cold. Kids really enjoyed the experience and the tour was very informative as well as fun. Given the climate, would definately advise wearing thermals and good pair of gloves (ski ones would do the trick as standard gloves aren't as effective).Ben, the owner is very friendly and helpful. He is an expat so his English is very good.The tour covers most of the key attractions on the "pest" side. We went on the tour as soon as we arrived which helped us get our bearings in terms on where we were and what we wanted to see in detail. Do give this a go.By the way, they do bike tours as well.

Great and different sightseeing. We were four guys doing sightseeing on Segways. Both fun for your body and interesting for your head. Drinving around the city gives you a lot of attention and tourists are taking photo of you. The guide is interresting as well. He tells you what you want to here and if you want to know something more he tells you about is. We were racing each other and had great fun. If you are into sightseeing - try this!
An excellent way to spend two hours! The.... An excellent way to spend two hours! The guides are very friendly and informative, and the Segways are fun and easy to ride.

The best fun ever - and become a tourist attraction!. Just back from Budapest - what a fabulous city. On our first morning we went on a City Segway tour and cannot recommend it highly enough! Office is conveniently located behind the opera house and you get a 30 minute tutorial and practice before heading off on the tour. Agnes was our guide and she was lovely - fun and informative.
