For 2 1/2 hours we glided around the city seeing key places - it really helped us orientate ourselves. The Segways are brilliant - a bit wobbly at first and then before many minutes and before you realise it, "Segwaying" is as natural as walking - but oh so much more fun! You become a tourist attraction as you glide around, which is a first for me! We loved it and all 4 of us on the tour want one! Do this tour - you will love it!

The Most Fun You Can Have Standing Still. Our guide was charming, educated, patient and fun. Getting started wasn't as easy as I expected, but it was still easy. You do cross some fairly busy roads and have to navigate around numerous pedestrians, so it might not be suitable for those that are either very timid or completely Gung-ho. It might seem quite expensive, but it's worth every penny. I loved every minute of it and I'd definitely recommend it.

Fantastic Fun. Segwaying is easy and a lot of fun. My wife was kind of worried when we met at the shop to start the Segway tour. The worrying did not last long. After a short instruction, a short test drive and the a few 100 meters of the tour all in our party were very confident driving this strange vehicle.And it was great fun and a very cool way to experience the city. And a very nice and knowledgeable guide was leading the way. This is a must try for all.Also the service we got from the office was world class.

Try their DISCOVER BUDAPEST TOUR - of the Danube Bend area. Discover Budapestwww.DiscoverBudapest.comTry this site for this company's other tours that take you out into the country and to visit three towns on the Danube. We had a tour guide Edina and she was fabulous. Definitely ask for her. She was informative, fun, and provided a very personal tour and experience for us. It was an all day tour on a small bus making many stops - and then a boat ride down the Danube back to Budapest. My teenage son enjoyed this too. Edina took us to a perfect Hungarian restaurant and helped us order true authentic dishes. It was our best meal. WONDERFUL TOUR. THey also provide walking tours in Budapest through Absolute Walking Tours. We did this too and also enjoyed very much.

Best part of our trip!. We were visiting from Canada, and an internet search resulted in finding the Segway Tour. The reservation over the internet worked without a hitch, and we actually got a refund without asking since the Forint dropped quite a bit lately. Customer service like that is not a common thing in Hungary.The weather was very cold and somewhat wet. Just make sure you dress for it as you will be basically standing for two hours.Our tourguide Andrew taught us the basics and within 15-20 minutes we were scooting around like pros.The tour took us through some cool sites and travelling was straightforward on the segways. The guide was excellent and we learned a lot of interesting history. He was also very personable and his English together with his communication skills were excellent (another rarity in this corner of the world).I would highly recommend the segway tour no matter your age. We covered a lot ground safely and speedily giving us more time to actually see the sites.

Super Segway!! I want one now. I thought a Segway tour would be something a little fun and also give us some sense of the city layout on our first day.Couldn't have been more right!We arrived at the shop behind the Opera 10 minutes early - only to find the shop closed. Cue panic from me "But it says get here early!" I guess in cold February they aren't that busy and didn't need the extra time. The shop opened at 10 and in we went for a 20 minute lesson with our guide Bea. I was worried at first that I would not manage it - it being standing on a platform and leaning backwards and forwards. After a bit I got it but still felt nervous – Bea assured us we would soon feel it was natural and be trying to go faster. Still, after practicing going over a bump to ready us for pavements we were off outside.Luckily we had thought about the weather and had thick gloves and coats as it was pretty cold standing on the Segway. The thrill of it soon warmed us up though! We zoomed all round with Bea giving us a really good tour and information – and despite the cold kept going for the full two hours!! And she was right – we did get the hang of it and did want to go faster!This isn’t an in-depth city tour but for getting your bearings and having fun it was excellent.We will definitely do a City Segway tour again (unless I can persuade my husband to let me buy one!)Luckily we had thought about the

Segwaying is fun :). I live in Budapest since I was born and never thought that I'll take part on a guided tour in my city. But I wanted to give my husband a special birthday gift and payed him (and me) for segwaying in the city. After a 20min orientation (we learned how to use the segway) we started to see the city center: along Andrassy street thorough Erzsébet and Deák squares to the Danube. We've seen than the Chain Bridge, Parliament and Basilica too. The tour took us 2 hours but the most fun was to be on the segway. Lot of tourists and local people asked us how did we get this vehicle and what is it called, how is it work. A guide came with us who answered to all these questions. And she told us stories about the different buildings too - that we didn't know before, though we both live in Budapest :)I think it's fun to see the city on a segway and I would recommend it to everybody. It is easy to learn and easy to use - you only have to stand and sometimes make a curve :)

Fun on the Segway. We took this tour on our fourth day in Budapest. It was very appealing, but we didn't know exactly what to expect -- would it be dangerous or difficult or just fun. It turned out to be a fun time. We took the 2 hour tour on the Pest side near the Opera and Parliament. They took between 20 minutes and a half hour to orient us to the Segways and then off we went. I would definitely recommend this tour. It is fun to do and more personal than a bus tour. We are both in our 60's and had no difficulty managing the Segways. Be careful of the posts on the eges of the sidewalk where you cross the streets. I fell off, but with no injury (except to my pride). A really different and fun activity!

Something Very Different and Fun!. Want to have a tour of the sites of a City but something different from a coach or walk? Then try a Segway tour. My girlfriend and I did just that on our trip to Budapest recently and what an experience! A Segway looks like a two wheel lawn mower. A battery powered two wheeled scooter that goes about 9mph max. The segway tour office is on Lazar Utca immediately behind theOpera House. You start with a 15 minute induction of the machine. A really nice guide we had in Anna. Once we got the hang of the machine off we went speeding along towards the Danube, getting so much attention from passsers by as we went. The trip lasts two hours and you get to see a part of the City you would not normally experience. People smile as you glide past and boy do people watch you.The tour takes you through the streets of Pest from The Opera House through to the river, the chain bridge and then on to the Parliament building.Absolutely recommended!!
Such an amazing tour!. The guides were so knowledgeable and kind. Very clear and answered every question, i would recommend to anyone!
Best tour ever. We did the free tour with Beatriz and we enjoyed so much that we decided to do the Buda Castle and the Pest tour as well. Beatriz is enthusiastic and an amazing story teller! 5*

Amazing. Amazing...You will never find any other guide with so much passion as Beatriz.We had an amazing time and learned more than in any other tour we have done in the past.There was always an amazing story behind every place we stopped and Bea is not only a guide that tells a story or speaks about a place, person or monument, she lives every bit of it and guides you through time as close as possible for you to live what happened in the past.So...Thanks White Umbrella tours.And a very special thanks to you Bea. Don't loose your pation.P.S. - Hope to see you in Portugal at some point...

WHITE UMBRELLA FREE TOUR BUDAPEST IN SPANISH !. Aitana was a perfect guide. kindly with people, very clear, and attractive description of history, people and evolution of facts.A very solid person in knowledge who made us understand the history.I highly recommend this tour, and Aitana, THANK YOU !!!Aitana fue una guia perfecta. Muy atenta con las personas, muy clara, una atractiva descripcion de los hechos de la historia y la gente que la marco.Su solido conocimiento nos hizo comprender tan compleja historia.Recomendamos altamante este tour y GRACIAS AITANA !

Excellent!. We took the free tour, the Pest tour and the Buda tour (all in Spanish). They were all great and helped us discover so much more about the city! The tour guides, particularly Elena and Eduardo were excellent!! They make it fun and keep you engaged all the time. Would totally recommend it!

Amazing tour, I learnt so much!!. Beatriz was a wonderful tour guide. I learnt so much about! This is exactly the way I like to get to know a city. We did the tour in Spanish and it was extremely informative and fun! I would recommend it to everyone :) Thank you Beatriz and Kerman for such a great experience.

I've never had such a great tour!. We did the Spanish free tour in Pest and also the one in Buda, both in the same day. We did both with Beatriz. All of us agreed that the tour was really really good. Very well documented, she was passionate doing the tour and trying to make us understand the history of Budapest. Congratulations Beatriz, your tour was excellent. It is awesome and grateful when you find someone doing her job like you. Thank you very much.

Buda castle tour. Elena is an excellent guide, very knowledgeable of the city history. Tour well organized, affordable price. We took a tour with them in Prague and had the same experience. Highly recommended

Bueníssimo! . We had the best introduction to the city with Elena. The tour was dynamic, complete and fun. She gave interesting historical information and a lot of practical facts. Showed us beautiful places, gave us useful tips and answered all questions. Recommended!!!!!!
Super professional and documented. We did the tour in Spanish, with Elena and she was perfect. I discovered 3000% more than what I knew from free tours on Budapest.100% Recommended.

BEST Free Walking Tour Company!!. White Umbrella tours have the BEST tour guides (not only here in budapest but also in Praga) that make the walking tour experience absolutly AMAZING!!
Especially we whant to congrats to Flor who's been one of the best tour guides we've had during our eurotrip! :)
